text: Lines were long, staff was not friendly whatsoever. The manager was not professional and I would suggest to not only use a different location but a different bank altogether.

Great for simple transactions - quick, efficient, and friendly service. For more complicated requests, they seem a bit disorganized and slow. Eventually it all gets done correctly though. 
Beware of turning left out of the parking lot - it might be easier to circle around to go out of the light at Apache Wells.
BTW the previous review seems to be about the company in general, not this branch in particular.

Have to stop here for clients now and then. Today drive thru is closed more than 30 minutes early. Huge line inside, one teller open at 4:20 PM. Long line and several employees sitting around in cubicals not with customers, not working. When I finally got my transaction completed there was no thank you, no sorry for the wait, no courtesy whatsoever.

I just filed out taxes with Sundin & Fish and unfortunately, I don't have good news to share.  The gal I worked with was basically an order taker, equivilant to working at McDonalds.  She wanted me to tell her what I wanted to do.  Offered ZERO advice or guidance on tax credits, deductions, the process of paying the IRS or receiving a refund.  Dug?  Why am I paying you then?  I know little about taxes, so it felt like the blind leading the blind.  Dont pay this company hundreds of dollars to file your taxes if you expect any guidance.  If you want to pay someone for data entry into Turbo Tax, then by all means, go with them.  Something you could probably do yourself at home for free.  They expect you to know their job.

Unfortunately, I don't have a good thing to share regarding the practice of Sundin & Fish.  As a new business owner with little to no tax knowledge, I trusted the practice to guide me.  Let's face it, from the outside, this firm is very regal and appears to be the end all be all for accounting firms.  The first year the firm did our taxes, it was easy and painless.  The moment I started asking for help or asking questions I would receive, that will cost you $120+ per hour, we don't give info over the phone and I'd get referred to some website to search for an answer.  After paying hundreds of dollars for completed returns, an SCorp filing and a DBA filing and not knowing how to move forward, I called.  Once again, I was told it was a fee to talk to them.  The receptionist Jeanie, along with both Fish brothers, speak down to their customers-they have little to no respect and are completely unwilling to help-even after spending HUNDREDS of dollars for their services.  It's as if they expect you to know how to do their job and get annoyed and frustrated when you don't know tax.  I've NEVER received such horrific service from what appeared to be a reputable company.  I'm at year end, didn't pull a salary, never was explained what needed to happen and I'm needing to have a salary shown NOW.  Well, isn't that great...there goes my income for the rest of the year because the estimates they provided were far from accurate.  I've sought out someone new for my taxes and have since learned that the little I was guided to do was very shady and unethical.

The people here are great to work with. Very detail oriented and willing to take the time to listen and explain. I had several years of taxes redone and got $1000s back.  They offer everything all in house. Bookkeeping, payroll, tax prep and planning, financial planning, insurance retirement etc!

As I moved to Cleveland I opened an account at Huntington at this branch without much knowledge or advice from locals living here.
This is the best bank I have had to deal with. From the security person at the door, to the tellers, everyone is super nice and respectful. I've always had very pleasant conversations. Employees know how to do their job well, they are very well informed about the banking business in America. Customer service on the phone is very helpful, too. I've always been able to do what I needed online. Definitely 5 stars!!!

Worst bank ever!   Do not bank with Huntington.  They wouldn't deposit my small dollar amount check because it was signed over to me.  I have never been so humiliated and angry at the same time.  Their obsession with policy causes low customer service.

Scott Green has helped me and my husband with our mortgage needs for the past 20+ years. There are many characteristics about Scott that make him an exceptional professional.  Those that rank at the top are his integrity, honesty, and superb customer service.  He has saved us thousands of dollars over the years on our mortgage and has gone above and beyond to be sure we are doing what's right for us at the expense of making a sale.  His staff is exceptional. I highly recommend signature home loans for all of your mortgage needs.

My wife and I bought a home using an FHA loan recently and used Home Signature Loans.  Eddie Knoell and his team did an A+ job from start to finish.  They get our highest recommendation.  When we go to refinance we will of course use Signature Home Loans again.

John Rader has been my husband's accountant for over 15 years, and now I am glad to have him handling my business and personal filings as well.  He is very thorough, quick to respond and knowledgeable on what is best for us and our financial health.  Also, he is really pleasant to chat with during what could be a stressful time!  I highly recommend Mr. Rader!

Great credit union here. Employees and staff are all very friendly and provide excellent customer service and info. Opening a checking/savings was quick and easy and best of all it's at a convenient location close to my home.

One Nevada Federal Credit Union formally known as Nevada Federal Sucks Ass!!! 
Customer Service was horrible and they charge $5 fee!!! 
Had bad experiences in this bank! I started telling my friends to close their accounts and they will...Not to mention,the  female manager was totally unprofessional and a Jerk! My Family closed all our accounts and decided to open a new one somewhere else.

This is the branch where my account was opened, but it's close to my job. I have been a member over 30 yrs,  back when it was Nellis Federal CU. Today I went to the DI branch and had the unfortunate pleasure of being serviced by Linda Sue Murphy. My name was the next name on the sign-up list, with her back to me, she turned to the other customer seated who happened to be Caucasian, I am African-American, and said. " I can help you"'. I spoke up and said "I'm next". She said "are you sure"  and even the security guard told her "yes". 
The whole time I was seated at her desk, she never looked up at me when speaking to me, and she appeared unhappy that she had to assist me.
I am TOTALLY insulted, I am an educated (Master's Degree) Woman, not that it should matter and I have never experienced this kind of service at any branch of this Credit Union, EVER!!!!!
My father served on the board of directors in the1980's and I have been loyal since I opened my account many years ago.
Because of the service I received today, I will have to find another branch to transact 
 business at as I will never return to this location again as I may have to encounter this individual again. She, in my opinion, needs a a lesson in customer service. 
This is discrimination at its best, and today, I am embarrassed to be associated with One Nevada Credit Union and plan to share this experience with those whom I know have accounts at this institution.
Thank you for your time,
Robyn McGough

So, true story: I always think for some reason this location is on S. Kings. This results in me driving around and actually thinking, did they move the bank? Fail. 

This branch is convenient if you're in the Metropolitan/Target area just outside of uptown. It's also close to the Farmer's Market, so if you are over there and forgot you need cash here's your savior. 

I rarely go inside this location, but the few times I've been in here the workers are all really nice. Granted, I go during off-peak hours, but it's never really busy or a long wait. The ATM is not a drive-thru, so you do have to get out of your car to use it. I'm always super paranoid about this and try to only visit this ATM during business hours. I watch a lot of SVU and I'm pretty sure it's convinced me that I'll be kidnapped one day. 

Whoever runs their social media is pretty on point. I checked in here on Yelp during my visit this afternoon and someone Tweeted me back from the Twitter account pretty quickly to thank me for coming in today. Brands, this is how you do it.
They charge high fees and keep you waiting forever.

Excellent service I received at this location the many times I've been here. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The manager went out of her way to talk to all guest and ask if the service was good or how could it be better. I already know how to activate my bank card but it was nice of the lady helping me to go out to the ATM and make sure it worked properly.

Dear Santander,

I appreciate that your new ATMs are all shiny and fancy, but they're also bloody annoying. I know that by feeding in notes the money is in my account straight away, but:

1. I don't really care about having access to the money on the same day

2. Feeding unenveloped notes in is only okay if I can get into the branch (I'm really not fine with doing that on the street, here take all my money passers by!)

3. After standing there having to do several transactions (because you'll only accept 50 notes at a time) your machines ALWAYS end up rejecting a handful of notes, meaning I have to end up queuing at the counter anyway (which as a business customer I'm not supposed to do).

Honestly, just sticking all my notes in one envelope and putting it in the deposit slot was so much quicker and easier.

Yours frustratedly,

Rachel

Santander is one of the most aggravating banks I've ever tried to open an account with. I moved from the US to UK and as such proof of address can be tough to come by early on. I was allowed to apply via phone, told with certainty that the proof of address I had available would be accepted, then made to wait for weeks before actually receiving the necessary information, sending all the things in that I was told would be fine, only to find out that they wouldn't accept the information I provided. This was so inefficient and infuriating, I will never attempt to bank with Santander again. NatWest offers the same interest rates available at Santander, but didn't waste weeks of my life on inaccurate information. Highly recommend avoiding Santander if possible - there are many other banks to choose from which might hopefully be less incompetent!

I went in to meet with Liz about my taxes, both personally and professionally and I came out with so much more! 
Liz and her team are fantastic! They treat you like they have known you for years and are extremely welcoming. My taxes seemed easy to understand by someone who is an expert and professional in every sense of the word. EK tax goes above and beyond to make sure you are satisfied and more importantly, that you understand everything.
What I didn't expect is how she truly wants everyone to succeed as much as they can. Within our meeting she had expanded my network by leaps and bounds. Offering new ideas and areas to get new business and join networking groups. No other CPA I have ever met has ever done anything like that. 
Liz and her team are truly the best that are out there!

I would never recommend this company to anyone in Arizona. I have dealt with Liz K., Mike F. and Maria O. Every one of them did not address my issue or concerns. They were outsourced from a company I have worked for as a full time employee and a eventually a freelance contractor. I never received my 1099 misc forms from this company since 2011. As a freelancer I need these documents to file my taxes. I have emailed and tried numerous times to address my concerns to get what I needed. Nothing in return but an estimate of how much I have made! I am not looking for an estimate for I keep records of income myself and know exactly how much I have made and each project I have completed for each company. I am requesting my 1099 misc form that I have always received every year before (before the company I worked for hired them) Having a 1099 misc form sent to me to file taxes is a way to document every single piece of income and makes it easier to report to the IRS.I may not be an expert with taxes or accounting but I know what to expect when this time of year comes. When the company I worked for outsourced to EK Tax & Accounting, I never received my checks on time AND never received my 1099 misc forms for the last 2 years. This has been the first time having to deal with this and I have been a freelancer for the last 8 years. it has become utterly frustrating to deal with this. Taxes are enough of a pain to file and for them to make it more difficult on us contractors is just a disadvantage. 
I would not recommend them personally for your business or professionally. So this is why I am giving them one star. Bad communication, service and experience.

Liz's knowledge and professionalism is everything you look for in a CPA.  However, her genuiness and friendliness are above and beyond anything I have every experienced in an accounting relationship.  Liz has a unique knack at making extreming complicated tax situations very simple to understand.  She also has helped me save more money than any accountant before.  I have been a client of Liz's for years and will never change!

Excellent service and beautiful selection.  Amir (The owner) is honest and makes you feel comfortable in his store.  We have been purchasing our jewelry from Finest Gold since our engagement and continue to travel here from the States to this store for all of our jewelry purchases and maintenance.  Highly recommend this gallery.

Great customer service and awesome owner. I bought my engagement ring here with my husband a while ago and we had a good experience. Their ring selection is good, lots to choose from. I actually just came back here yesterday and sold my gold jewelry. Highly recommended!

I also recently registered with Scottrade.  Unlike Michael, I could not get through the entire process online, so I aborted.  No matter, the next day, a Scottrade representative called me to ask if I needed assistance.  It was one of those situations where I felt I needed to talk with someone personally...that was no problem either.  They invited me in to the local office, were more than helpful, more than thorough in the registration process, and I left feeling really pleased with the entire experience.  Now, if I could only find some money to invest...

Too many gimmick promotions. I've had nothing but bad experience with this bank. First they ran some daily deal with RedFlagDeals for $185 bonus if payroll deposit was changed before August 31. I missed this deal by ONE day because their customer support got back to me AFTER the promotion was over. Then I signed up for the next promotion of $100 bonus if payroll deposit was switched to them by Aug 31. It took them FOREVER to process my application and by the time my account was activated and I went to change the payroll info from my company's system, it tells me that it can only process the new deposit info for payday of Sept 2!! When I called their customer support to explain the situation, they basically said 'too bad nothing they can do.'
So much for appreciation of my hard earned dollars.

In summary: Gimmick promotions. Don't care attitude from client 'care' team. Long wait time for creating an account. 
You get what you pay for. Or in this case, do NOT pay for. 

I'm out of there.

Customer service has gone downhill since Scotia took over.... wait times during non-peak hours during the day have increased from a couple of minutes to 20 minutes!

ING Direct clients were right to worry that Scotia would destroy it with the takeover... new name Tangerine, not so sweet service!

I signed up on Yelp purposely to be able to give a 5 star review for this First Credit Union branch. I have had nothing but excellent experiences with them from account opening, to notary service to shared branching, etc. Everyone is nice- everyone is helpful. I would highly recommend them over any traditional bank.

This is the main branch of First Credit Union.  It's a bit bigger than most of the others.  But it's still the credit union.  Check my reviews of the others, this one is the same.  Banks suck, credit unions rock.  I use banks as little as possible, preferring instead the no-hassle credit union environment.

As I've said before, they have no shareholders.  They are responsible to their members.  Banks only care about the quarterly report to their shareholders, and they make all those profits off of YOU!

I have been a member of this bank for a very long time.  I have been coming to this particular branch for a few years now.  The staff here are always very friendly and willing to help.  A few of them even recognize me and know me by name.

I have never had an issue with First Credit Union, even when I was a victim of identity theft a few years ago.  If you are looking for a bank to join, this one is definitely one that you should consider.

Drove 20 minutes on a Saturday to find out the Tempe, and apparently all locations, are now closed on Saturdays. I've been a member for over 10 years and didn't receive any prior notification that they had begun keeping these extreme "bankers hours". Actually, closing at 5pm Monday-Thursday is worse than most banks. If you work, when exactly are you supposed to be able to use this credit union? I guess I'm supposed to take time off from work? Ridiculous and beyond inconvenient. Shame on you First Credit Union.

Steve and his agency have had all of my wife's policies for nearly 10 years and all of mine for the last 5 years since I moved to the area.  What a great group to work with.  They go out of their way to be helpful.

I'm been insured here for over 2 years. And I suggestion is "AVOID THIS GUY". 
I had issue with this agent twice!

First time, I was out of the country for 2 months, and I changed the car insurance to "comprehensive only" which should be only $10 per month. But they charged me over $30 for a policy change fee. I know that it's state farm not this single agent makes the price, but this fee is never mentioned when I talk to this guy.

Second time, I've had my drive license for 3 years and should eligible for a price cut. But they never notified me about this discount. And the result is: I payed over $40 extra money for an insurance with less coverage than my new quote half year.

Heather seems to really care about her clients, and from my experience she does what she always gives that extra effort.  If you are looking for a broker that is going to put your needs first, you should definitely use Heather.

Bank of America in Belmont, NC is the big bank with the small town atmosphere and customer service to follow suit. I've been familiar with this location for many years and even thought they don't know me by my first name, they're accommodating, helpful for the most part and sometimes willing to go the extra mile.

I'm not one to have a love/hate relationship with BOFA, so I tend to accept them at face value, however there is a competitor bank that is across the street that seems more customer centric and knows clients on a first name basis. When it came to a recent mortgage application, I found BOFA to be average or below average but their competitor who I won't name right now has been superb and dedicated to the customer. 

So, currently I am with the competitor for my mortgage and other loan needs even though I still bank at BOFA. A word to BOFA, name recognition is great but if you don't have the customer service and willingness to be the best at all times you will not keep many clients.

Many of the people here are very friendly/helpful.  Unfortunately, all of my interactions with Holly have been extremely negative.  Not only has she processed several of my banking transactions wrong (which I've had to have her correct) but her overall customer service is less than desirable and I would not recommend her to anyone.

There is a larger and shinier BoA down the street a bit from this one. Is BoA going for the Starbucks business model? Anyways usually I like them big and shiny, but in this case I prefer this BoA.

Why you ask? Well this one has a much easier exit and entrance, is less crowded, and the walk up ATM doesn't leave me standing outside. Instead you're in a nice comfy air conditioned little glass cube. If you've never stood outside waiting on someone at the ATM in the hot humid summers or cold wind chills then you probably wouldn't appreciate this. If you're claustrophobic I can see how you'd prefer the other one though, or if you're a huge fan of pink glass and need to check out your reflection for a quick freshen up. Don't lie you know you've done it before!

Comforts like this make this my BoA of choice for when I need to do something that I can't do on my phone.

Great service provided by our Broker with Nevada West, Vigen. They go above and beyond the call of duty to provide the absolute best service and rates . Very happy with Nevada west and plan on renewing with them every year. We have our liability and all our auto insurances with them and couldn't be happier.

Being new to Arizona, we didn't want to prepare our first years' taxes ourselves as each state has differences. We were able to schedule our appointment online, and received a confirmation call the next day.  Being in a certain mile radius of his business, he came to our home for no extra charge.  This ended up being more helpful than we thought, as more than one question required us to search for paperwork.

Mark arrived at the scheduled time, and had great attention to detail.  He caught some things we would have missed, and made suggestions to benefit us for next year.  His rates were very reasonable based on the time he spent with us preparing everything.  We would highly recommend Mark Smith for tax preparation.

I made a good choice in selecting Mark to do my taxes this year. He answered questions, clarified issues, and gave me helpful advice. I'd been using Turbo Tax for years but never fully understood what made the little counter in the corner of the screen roll up and down. I gained a lot of knowledge from Mark, and he was very personable and efficient. The cost was reasonable and well worth it. Highly recommended.

john rader did my business and personal stuff. he knows what hes doing and is very knowledgeable. 

we always talk about life and family while during the appointments. 

i like him.
i trust him.

good guy

This is a very nice Wells Fargo.  It is nice and big when you walk in and there are plenty of friendly tellers helping customers without hesitation.  This location is near several popular places and also in the same parking lot as a Bank of America.

This branch of Wells Fargo consistently provides me with the best banking experience I've had. Kelvin and his staff are friendly and courteous and understand customer service. Reminds me of how things used to be. Good job Kelvin, keep it up!

Slow as molasses. Not even close to community banking or the understanding of going above & behind for a 25 yr customer. It's all about them and what is best in a loan for them. Never the customer. There are other banks out their I suggest you talk to.

My CPA is retiring soon, so I thought I'd better get out there and meet a few so that I can pick the best one when that dreaded day comes that my current CPA retires. I was really worried about finding the right person. It's an industry where you expect to meet really smart people with not so great personal skills. So I was prepared for lackluster. 

I was actually, kind of dreading the process. Anyhow, I met with the first of three candidates: Wanda E. O'Malley. Here's how that went: she absolutely knocked my socks off. I'm actually looking forward to my current CPA's retirement now. Wanda is super approachable. she is an excellent listener who knows how to really be present with the person she is talking to. That alone scores HUGE points in my book. It seems that when most people are in conversation they are thinking about what they want to say next instead of actually engaging and truly listening. SO that tells me that Wanda will be all over the details when it's time to take over our taxes. 

As a local real estate agent, I get plenty of requests for referrals for various professionals, and it will be a pleasure to refer Wanda E. O'Malley at every opportunity. One last thing to note: I did a little digging, and discovered that not only  has Wanda graduated with an accounting degree, she actually graduated as Magna Cum Laude of her class. Pretty impressive. Give it a go with Wanda E. O'Malley CPA when you have accounting needs; I'm sure you will be glad you did.

Even though I have done my own taxes and taxes for others for many years, we had a special situation come up this year that required a deeper knowledge than I possess. I met with Wanda and really felt comfortable with her assessment of our situation and recommendations. I didn't feel rushed and we sat in her office and discussed the matter until I felt comfortable with our plan. I cannot recommend Wanda highly enough!

I come to this bank almost everyday to make the deposit for my work. The staff here is extremely pleasant! They are attentive and very kind. Even though I'm not currently a Wells Fargo customer, I plan to be. These people really know how to treat their customers.

Don't come to this location if you have large amounts of cash you are depositing. This is the only location I've ever had issues with. Last time I came here the employee said there was 15 less then what I figured (keep in mind I check over and over there is literally no way I am wrong) told the guy to recheck at which point he said I was right and it was all there.  I just came here again today and the guy said I was 10 off of what I figured, told him to recount it at which point he said he ran it through the machine "three times".  I know for a fact it was all there, I keep track of every single dollar that comes and goes from my pocket. I should have just asked for my money back and leave but I had somewhere to be, but being that this is a repeated issue with this location I'll choose not to come here anymore. Either the machine is wrong or the employees are stealing.

I went to the bank to create a notarized document to fax to another bank regarding the disbursement of funds.   After waiting about 2 minutes I was helped by Edward G., a personal banker who greeted me with a smile and proceeded to help me create the document, notarized it and faxed it over to the other bank within about 10 minutes.  

Edward was awesome!  It was the best customer service experience I've had in long time.

Hopefully Wells Fargo monitors Yelp and gives Edward an attaboy or two so he hangs around awhile.  He is definitely an asset  to the business.

To summarize the amazing service at Laskey Costello:
Superbly professional team combined with a wonderful personalized experience. 
Highly recommended.

This is the only accounting firm I have used and can't say I'll have any desire to switch. Tim did a great job on our tax stuff last year, taking care of both our personal and business obligations and making things very easy. His staff was extremely available if I had questions, emailing me back very quickly. The receptionist is very poised, knowledgeable and friendly. Appointments are easy to make, rates very reasonable, what else could you want in an accountant?

I just moved to Ohio from California and thought my taxes would be pretty complicated. The past few years I did not have a good experience getting my taxes done in CA. Will Costello took care of my taxes within a few days and assured me he would straighten things out. I couldn't be happier with my service. I had my refund checks sooner than expected. The rates were extremely reasonable. I am very happy with Laskey Costello!
Seems to be very slow at anything you need done.  I feel that perhaps my first review was a little emotional so I wanted to update the star rating.  I still stand by what I had written before though.
They are great! Found my dream car at one of their credit union sales. When they have their car sale it's the best way to buy a car.
I stop here frequently on the way down to the 'Rents house. What else can you say about a bank? It serves my needs.

I have banked with Bank of America for some 20 years but they have committed the ultimate faux-pas with their legal department. They illegally seized ALL of my and my children's' accounts - some of which contained my children's death benefits and my retirement fund deposits in them, which is against federal law. The Texas judge who fired off the order immediately reversed the order and apologized for the mistake AND also said that what Bank of America did was against federal law. So, Bank of America returned our money after about a week but Bank of America has decided to keep $100 dollars for "legal fees" and $10 from an overdraft protection fee that cleaned out a savings account when the order was issued. Even the SS agents say this act of seizing death benefits done by Bank of America was illegal in the first place "but this happens all the time with Bank of America" they said. 

Oh, I talked to every manager I could at the Bank of America legal department in California until I reached AJ, who said he was at the top of the legal department. He bluntly said, "we are keeping your money".

Well Bank of America, you won your $110 for now but you lost 7 accounts already by us closing our accounts to keep you from doing further illegal things to us. I will continue to recommend that people make other banking arrangements to protect themselves from the predatory ways of the Bank of America legal department.

Sincerely, Craig Stellpflug - former Bank of America customer

The tellers at this bank, although friendly, are not very competent. They do not pay attention to anything you write on the check, like the account number on the back. I wish I could find a bank that actually cares about my business.

Worst bank service EVER!!! First of all there will be 4 employees there ready to help. But only 1 open teller, regardless of how long the line is. Today was the worst customer service experience. Tried to deposit my check in to my account and its post dated, I go here every week never has it been an issue until today. They deposit my check ,then realize its post dated so she cancels the deposit and rips up both deposit slips in my face as if I'm doing something against the law. I ask for a manager and she comes over with nothing but attitude! So I walk over to the atm, deposit my check,no problem! I will never go here again.

My husband and I called VN Accounting one weekend morning as we needed help with our personal and business taxes. We were able to make an appointment on the same day despite short notice. It was the best decision that we had called VN for our taxes. Mr. Sanjeev Kamra was very thorough with his service and will take his time to discuss your current situation and the solution. He is honest and goes above and beyond his service. Highly recommend!!!

This bank is amazing! The staff work so hard to get things done and quickly. They are so nice and welcoming when I walk in. I've been to many bigger banks and this bank is much better and seem to always be there when I need help. I Would Highly Recommend Them!

5 stars for the service and 5 stars for Mike! If you are like me, just the word "insurance" hurts your ears. I don't want to talk about it or think about it, I just want it to magically be there to take care of me and not cost an arm and a leg...and that is why I am so happy I found Mike.  Mike will take care of you. He helped me understand all the really boring details, he explained exactly what types of coverage worked best for me for both my home and my vehicle. It was really painless, very personalized and amazingly affordable. Plus, Mike is a really awesome guy, still a little confused on why he would work in insurance, but I am really glad he does.

I have been a policy holder with Mike Bengson for over 8 years and have found Mike and his staff to be friendly, reliable and focus on customer service.  Not only are the rates competitive, the service they provide is why I am a happy, stable customer.  I would highly recommend Mike Bengson and his agency!

My oldest son just went in to open a student account.  My wife and I have been with B of A for over 15 years and this will be my second child to open a student account in the last six months.  Girl pushes a regular account but doesn't tell him fee is waived if under 23 and a student. Tells him fee is 12 dollars without direct deposit or $1500 continuous in account.  Wants to know who his employer is.  He just said, he was a student. I question her as to why, after he tells her he wants to open a student account, she continues to push the fee and not ask him for his student ID and explain the student fee waiver.  Her response, "I wasn't pushing the fee without the waiver." I ask if she was going to help him open a student account? Needless to say I got loud and he doesn't have a b of a account.  I am very close to pulling all my money also and moving somewhere else...

6 bucks to cash my check. Sorry if that was a little shocking but nothing says scumbag like going into a bank of America if you ask me. I very politely told the lady that I was now less inclined to open up the checking account that she was trying to push on me after learning that I have to pay $6 to cash my check, but as I was giving this opinion she argued with me vehemently that I should just open the account because everyone else does the same thing. Do they? I guess I'm old school whatever.

I am a victim of identity theft and can't get them to return my calls to clear my account despite having sent them proof that the debt is not mine.  I've called and emailed for two weeks without results and my credit rating has dropped more than 80 points because of this.

After getting behind on medical bill payments, this company was super friendly and worked with my payment schedule I could afford!  No threats, no "I can't work with you unless you pay THIS amount" - None of that.  They take what I can afford every month with no questions.

Great customer service to boot!  Thanks :)
I fell behind on my medical bills and this collection agency was kind enough to set me up on a payment plan. The truly are the nicest collections agency I've ever dealt with.

Got my wages garnished for an apartment through cccs after amount was paid they still show I owe almost $200. Been battling them to take Balance of my credit for the past 4 years. They even sent me a receipt showing paid in full. Just when I thought they finally corrected the problem last month I get a notification on my credit that it has reappeared. Their staff says they'll correct it but never does. Tired of this week do our part but these collection services never do theirs!

i wish i can give them no stars. i have paid on time for the 4 years and come down to my last payment, they seem to not leave me alone and just go away!!!  i have been paid in full for many months now and thank god i asked for the piece of paper that stated i was done, and you should do the same because you will talk to one person who will tell you important information you need to know, and then you'll end up speaking to someone else who will tell you something very very different. none of them know whats going on, theyre definitely not on the same page with anything, and there's just no structure or communication with eachother. its crucial that they need to be, because they are messing with people's credit, finances, and lifes. they sent the constable to my job (months after paying off and asking for that letter) which was very embarassing and frustrating, i drove down there to only hear a bunch of confused associates. again, if i did not have this piece of paper labeling "paid in full", i would have had to create an even crazier mess there. they kept telling me i owed a significant amount still from what their computer showed, and unfortunately thats the only thing they go off of, which is wrong, because they dont communicate on it or understand it half the time. i showed them the letter and they said "oh" and from there reassured me they will fix it. its been about 8 months now since ive paid in full and to only find they put their name on my credit, stating i am behind in payments affecting my credit score. they just wont go away. now, im off to going down there, because calling is the worst thing you could do, and im off to calling my credit consumer bureau to dispute them and the better business bureau, and more... because as long as they wont leave me alone, i wont leave them alone.

I am reviewing this specific location because the website lists it as the main office/corporate.  I am so pleased with this bank.  I mainly use the Bullhead City and Fort Mohave locations, but need to talk about the bank's online staff (hence the review for the corporate location).  I just had a 3-day long conversation back and forth with Misty (online rep).  There was a misunderstanding with a bill pay item, so I asked for a refund on the overdraft fees I was charged.  Even though she explained clearly how they were assessed, she still submitted my request for refund to the higher powers.  I just checked today and the fees were refunded!  I'm so happy I closed my B of A account and switched to these guys.  Its been almost a year since opening my NBAZ account and life is good.  These guys provide real personal service.  My emails are always answered promptly and clearly.  Although Misty explained that in my situation I would probably not get refunded, she still submitted my request.
Ok, so the situation was that I sent an e-check somewhere.  Normally, when I send an e-check, the funds are taken from my account when the check is "mailed out" (which may or may not be an electronic mailing).  For whatever reason, this particular vendor has a different process, so when I send the e-check to them, the funds are not debited until they "cash the check" on their end.  (I suppose that means confirm receipt).  So, I had bought something the afternoon before of my automatic deposit because I saw a positive balance and failed to check the actual register.  I had assumed the check cleared already, then went ahead and swiped my card at the store.  Sure enough, the next day I had overdraft fees.  Apparently the check cleared at some point the day before, but after I had looked at my balance.  
My fault for assuming the check cleared.  I just assumed it had processed the same way all my previous online payments had.  It varies vendor to vendor, and not 100% under the bank's control.  I understand now, thanks to Misty's time.  I would definitely recommend this bank to anyone who asked.  
One of the appealing things that originally brought me here was their low direct deposit requirement to waive bank fees.  Only $100 monthly as opposed to $250 that B of A asked.  And if I remember correctly, the $250 B of A was asking for was all in one deposit.  It was not a cumulative number that NBAZ uses.  When you work in retail, and hours can get cut in the blink of an eye, this matters.  If it isn't obvious that I believe their online service is phenomenal (although I see opposing opinions), I need to state that I also appreciate their google play app and never had any bugs or glitches with it.

Worst customer service. I opened an account online and went to the branch to make the initial deposit. They don't know what their online banking system is doing and they had to send it to another location in Tucson, this is after I had called yesterday to verify that I could make the initial deposit in my local branch. Get it together! If you are going to have an online system, make sure the branch operations coincide with that! I'm going to cancel my account and do my business elsewhere. Thanks for the headache!

If you are looking for tax services in Surprise, look no further! I needed my personal and business taxes completed. Trudy was really flexible and I was able to drop my documents off at her office at Greenway and Reems the next day. The following morning I received an email... she was already done! Tax "pros" that did my returns in the past would take weeks and charge outrageous fees. The experience I had with Trudy was quite the opposite. She provided a free consult where she spent a good amount of time answering my small business tax questions (there were a lot!) and sharing her knowledge. If you live in the West Valley and need a good tax person, try Trudy's Taxes!

I stopped in for the first time ever to make a Shared Branching transaction back on Dec. 31th.  It was approximately 2:15 p.m. and there were three tellers present.  I literally stood there for at least a minute without any of them acknowledging my presence.  They seemed more concerned about closing out for the day, with it being New Year's Eve and all, instead of servicing their sole customer.  Yes, I was the ONLY  one in the lobby and all of their heads were down, concentrating on whatever task they were each doing.

When one finally greeted me after a minute of silence and asked if they could help me, they couldn't.  She didn't know how to process a Shared Branching transaction or couldn't for some reason.  I was helped by another teller.

Not the best first impression your credit union gave me and based on it, Alhambra Credit Union doesn't deserve to have that heart on its signage.  Disappointing.  I will NOT be coming back and will use another credit union for my Shared Branching transactions.

Have been using Alahambra now for 2 months to make my van payment. I am always greeted with the friendliest people. They get me right in and out, even come out to open the door for me since I'm a wheelchair user. I will use them for a long time. Thank you Alahambra for having awesome staff!

Helped me save money and also file on time.
I organized everything for Trenton and provided all of the facts he needed. He helped me get my taxes done in a timely manner. I did my taxes for 4 years and for the first time needed help.
He was very professional and didn't charge me to just speak with him regarding questions over the phone and in person.

I have only lived here in Vegas for a year, but when I moved I had to relocate my company, too. The Nevada amount of paperwork was relentless for the corporation, and I couldn't keep up. So I had to hire a CPA to guide and assist me.  

I had a so-so experience with the first COA firm, but I was very lucky to find, near my office, Arlint.

I felt like family the first time I walked in the door and met Amanda.  She is incredibly friendly, smart, astute and detail oriented.  And she loves to laugh!

I'm in very good hands and the service is excellent and the fees are not budget busters.  

Highly recommended!!!!!

Every once in a great while you have to rave about a business or service.  I saw Cort yesterday for my FREE consult.  The IRS can be very stressful, I must say he put me at ease.  There wasn't a single question he wasn't able to answer (believe me I wrote a list there were so many).  The gal at the reception desk made a great initial representation with her personality as well.  Thank you again.  There are only 5 stars...I give this business a 10!!!

Cort is awesome. Much cheaper than my previous CPA, got my taxes done in less than an hour last time despite it being the first time he looked at any of my documents, and I will definitely be returning next tax season.

Cort is fabulous! Their tax process is seamless and made filing this year the easiest I have ever experienced. 

He met with me in person last week to collect the necessary documents (there is a list provided on their website) and he let me know a couple other items I needed later that day. I provided them and a few days later we met. I signed my tax return, paid the reasonable fee ($125/hr) and I am done! What a great feeling to not have to sit white knuckled through Turbo Tax this year. 

I highly recommend Cort for his CPA services.

Cort handled our Nevada/California tax return involving the sale of income property that we had owned more than 30 years involving several million dollars. He was friendly, fast and knowledgeable. His expertise and speed resulted in a very reasonable bill. We will use Cort from now on.
This one is convenient if you're traveling on the I-17.  Located just south of Glendale Ave and the I-17, it offers lobby and drive-thru services. Tellers are courteous.

The good: no fees, shared banking, not a big bank screwing over everybody. The bad: not the best service, not the best phone/online systems etc. Once my banker didn't return my calls for over a week, when I really needed to know something, and I was out of town so I couldn't go to the branch. How can you do business like this, I don't understand. I never had these issues when I was with a big bank. Well you get what you pay for!

This Chicago Title is the best Title company I have worked with in my real estate career. Bill, Theresa and the gang are professional and go out of their way to help the clients and real estate agents. I could not recommend them stronger

Recently sold my house and I've never seen paperwork get done so fast than it was done here. Personnel here was courteous and totally willing to walk us green-behind-the-ears peeps through the process.

Go Clean Credit did what they said they would and THEN SOME!! They also got collections deleted I thought would never go away and saved me more than 10 X's what they charge alone.  I highly recommend them!  

580 to 680 fico (low 700's when I pay my CC's down)

Because of go clean credit I was able to purchase my home!! Even had many IRS liens on my report. And several were removed!! I highly recommend them! And will continue working with keep raising my score!!

The most experienced, honest, and friendly staff. Justin took a look at my credit report and addressed my concerns, as well as some others I was not aware of. In my case, there wasn't much they could do to improve my score, but I really appreciated the honesty up front, versus other credit repair companies that would have no problem making embellished promises and taking my money. If they can help you they will. I would recommend Go Clean Credit to everybody. Thanks Justin.

After a recent review of my credit score from a site called Score Sense, I found out my credit score was not quite what I would have liked for it to be and contacted Go Clean Credit. They took the time to carefully review the items on my credit report I provided them via Score Sense and were very helpful and communicated well throughout the process. The first thing they had me do was request another credit report from a more reliable site that they exclusively use called Privacy Guard. The credit reports were similar but the scores themselves were vastly different! They offered to still try and remove a few items from my credit report but actually suggested that NOT using their services might be a better decision due to the fact that A) my score was actually quite good after attaining it from a more credible site and B) often times when items are attempted to be removed from your report, it could possibly reopen an outstanding item and hurt your score again. 

I greatly appreciated this type of honesty and would not hesitate in recommending them for your credit repair needs. One final note - do NOT use the site Score Sense to obtain a credit report and score. It's better to go straight to Go Clean Credit where they not only set you up with a more accurate site, but they can also provide you with a secured credit card to try and improve your score even more.

After my wife and I lost our business in 2010, we found ourselves drowning in personal and business debt and due to some unique circumstances, we were unable to file bankruptcy. Dawn and her team have done an exceptional job of removing derogatory information and getting us on track to restoring our previous credit status. The team at Go Clean credit was always available to answer questions and provide useful insight through an extremely challenging time in our lives.

Ladies, if you need a car, go here. I recently traded in my 2004 Ford Ranger in for a 2006 Mercury Mountaineer and couldn't be more pleased at the level of service I received. From the time I called and spoke to Andrew to signing the papers for the new-to-us car, we were treated with respect. (As a woman, that is rarely the case when I've bought a car.) Through each step of the process with Nick and Brady at Mesa Motors treated me as a valued customer, asking questions to find me the vehicle to fit my needs. It was a refreshing experience . I recommend Mesa Motors to everyone I know.
What a great place to buy a car. I got what car I wanted and they were able to help reestablish my credt. I hate buying cars, but now thanks to Mesa Motors I have a dealership that I can trust.

Be careful about this place they screw with the cars and try to charge you for it. They messed with my check engine light so that the codes can't be read so you can't fix it yourself... They have now said that they will do no work on my van that I purchased from them all because I wrote a bad review. Here's a thought want a good review do good work don't just pass the buck... So be sure you call Andrew the owner and ask how he will discriminate against you for having a bad experience. Talk about unprofessional..... If I wanted a temper tantrum I would have gone to a preschool... Although now I know and am warning you stay away from Mesa motors and brown and brown you will regret it if you buy a car from them.

Look, Adam Greenfield was real nice, and it was a nice place and the car was a great deal, it's not a bad place to buy a car. NO HASSLE!  Before the car had it's problem i was very happy with Mesa Motors, I even posted a great review on Facebook, and i never do that and trust me it's way BETTER THAN CRAIGSLIST, that's a true junk yard what junk cars people are selling. Adam did go out of his way to put the deal together, what's sad is i really love this car. it's what happened after the sale is what is going on, if they refund me my money or do more then just hang up i would not be changing my first review, The car fax report shows a car that was destroyed and i can't sell it being a good Christian. It runs, but over heats with in a few miles and the wiring harness is fried and i spent $107.87 for a new battery along with the new floor mats, seat covers oil change. The car books for $5500.00 if in good shape, i got the car for $2500.00 out the door, it was day 14 that the car was no longer driveable and the car won't pass state smog so, this is what put's this deal upside down. i would run a car fax report on ANY used car before you buy from ANYONE. 

Come on, return my money or get me into another car. I have sent friend from my church to buy from them so, this tells you their nice, even for used car dealers selling on Car Fax.com are selling worse it's what it is, excuse the pun, USED CAR SALESMEN!  LOL

Steve St Clair
Get more Tellers. I do not want to spend my entire lunch hour waiting in line. Busy afternoon 2 tellers.
I am forced to bank here once a month because my car loan gave me no other choice. Worst bank ever, always lines out the door. Slow service. Takes over an hour every time I go to any Bank of America.

This is one of my local Scotiabanks.  It's with in walking distance from my office and house, the location is clean and the staff are friendly.  They are very efficient, and very helpful.

If you go at lunch - there will be a line....but they buzz through the line and they are always very sweet about it.

I can't remember her name, but there is this wonderful black lady that makes me smile every time I'm in there.

I'll agree with Chris P - the hours are not great, but no bank has good hours these days.  Since the invention of online banking, there is no real need to have someone there later in the day....that's why they call them bankers hours.  I will admit, I HATE that they are not open on Saturdays and Sundays.

All in all a great bank....

Probably the worst hours of any bank I've ever been to.  What bank closes at 3:00 in the afternoon?

I specifically left work early to ensure I was here before 5 only to find out that this branch caters to...wait...who do they cater to? THEY CLOSE EARLY EVERYDAY TO GO HOME AND HAVE A NAP!

Remember when you were a kid and you'd go to the bank with your parents and the teller would give you candy because you didn't scream like a banshee while waiting in line for 15 minutes? Well, if you take your kid to this particular bank, the kid won't have time to scream; there's literally no lines. Ever.

That's what I like about this bank - they have their stuff together and whip people in and out in a quick minute. I doubt I've ever been in there longer than 15 minutes, except the time I opened the account. It helps that it's relatively close to my house.

The tellers are friendly and actually remember what I do for my paychecks. It's a bit weird when there's actual customer service (aka, they remember who you are) because, well, there's not a lot of that these days.

This isn't an ING account so you're going to get basically nothing in interest, but the account works fine for checking. I love that I had the option to NOT have over drafting (it will just automatically decline the transaction) which I don't think I was ever asked when I used to bank with Washington Mutual/Chase. I've never spent so low that I'm in fear of over drafting, but I think it's a really great feature that they offer and I like that I opted to have my transaction automatically decline should that happen. 

I'm happy with the bank, the only thing I really dislike is that I signed up to not get statements in the mail to save on paper, and I still get loan, credit card and air line mile ads from them - defeating the point of saving paper. 

Overall, I like US Bank and will stay with them for checking, and put savings into silver (aka, not into a bank account.)

I HATE US Bank!!!!  They try to squeeze me for every single fee they can.  I have auto deposit on 2 accounts plua a savings and a car loan for over 4 years and still they want to charge me $10.25 a month for a maint. fee!!  Makes me crazy!!!  A small amount but are you kidding me?  And then when you call they have excuses adn packges to discuss and want to upsel you on this and that and never resolves my problem.  This is why I have a savings and checking at Wells Fargo as well - and they are no better - fees fees fees - no incentive for moving to another bank.  And I have learned it's to no advatage to have all your banking at one bank.  I think I will check out a credit union.
The teller was inefficient and unprofessional. The store manager just stood back and watch. I will never return to this branch.

I use this branch often.  Since it's on the way to the gym for me I like to stop here to conduct my financial transactions often.  Today I had to go inside and use a live teller.

The line was short and she was very friendly and pleasant.  I was 3rd in line when I arrived and was in/out in 5 minutes.  Awesome!

Not much more to say about this branch other than it's pretty laid back and the employees are fast and efficient.

Will I return?  For my financial sake....I hope so!

Bad business with this place! Once they get your policy you are trash to them!  They will not be professionals nor call you back when needed! I have been with state farm for 10 years and no longer want to do business with them! Every month we have big issues! I dont have time to sit here 3 hours a month to wait for you not to call me back and deal with a problem!

I have had insurance with Xavien Hood State Farm since 2011. Not only have they given me the best car insurance and rental insurance rates, I can honestly say it is THE BEST customer service I have ever had. EVERYONE is always so positive, nobody is ever grumpy, nobody ever makes you feel like you are wasting their time with questions. I work with a lot of different companies in my profession and can honestly say this is a one of a kind staff. LOVE, LOVE, LOVE this company and everything about them.
Awesome, awesome customer service! Yes, the place is huge but the bankers and tellers make you feel like they have your best interests in mind.

A very friendly bank, the customer service is 100% always. The employees go above and beyond to make you feel welcome and help you . I recently went in to apply for a second mortgage after meeting with Lassaine I know I won't ever need another bank. He is phenomenal in knowledge. His expertise is amazing . Charlie is my favorite teller he is my go to person at the bank . He was the one who chose Lassaine to help me with all of my banking needs
The person Charlie or Charles as he goes by both has been promoted to banker. He is great at it even though he looks young he holds a tremendous amount of knowledge
I used them to purchase some money orders, very quick,polite and did the job right the first time (unlike other mass retailers)
There are so many better choices... Why not drive a couple of miles down Craig and do business with Navy Federal Credit Union.

I love Ron Harris, he is so helpful, is very professional and not to mention very friendly staff. When it comes to handling my multiple W-2, and big deductions like my car and house. He gets me the most on my tax returns. Because of him I enjoy tax season, and he makes it stress free.

I've had Ascend CPAs do my taxes for 4 years now, and the quality of service and professionalism is second to none in my experience with CPAs over the years.

Ron Harris, CPA is top notch and a great guy to work with.  Regardless of how complex my deductions are, he always makes filing an easy and painless experience.

The office staff are fantastic and accommodating.  

My electronic filing is processed quickly and Ascend provides clients with a very organized and professional packet for records.

I highly recommend Ascend for any CPA needs!

BB&T Indian Trail along with all the other Union County Branches offered Free shredding of important business papers this morning.  When I was in the branch earlier this week the manager, John Killman told me about it, and when I informed him I probably had a truck load he told me to come on, so I did this morning and was welcomed with open arms quite literally since he and several other bank employees were on hand to assist.  This is not the first time BB&T has reached out to my business, they did about 18 months ago when Janet Graham, their commercial loan offiicer called upon us offering unbelievable mortgage rates for refinancing our two notes.  Yes, it's true what they say, you can tell they want your business!  Way to go BB&T.

It's so sad that I can't reach an actual person when I call customer service. It's almost impossible. There are somethings that I know I need to speak to someone about. Things that the automated system can't help me with. It's so frustrating that I get hung up on when I press 0 a few times. Terrible service. How can you call yourself a bank if you don't even take your customer's calls???

They are thieves! I used to have an account there but they would always put a hold on my expense check. It didn't matter that the check was drafted on a BB&T account. So I closed my accounts and switched to Wells Fargo which has been great. The past couple of months I cashed my expense check at other BB&T locations with no issues or the mention of fees. Today the Indian Trail location wanted to steal $8 from me to cash the check. I asked the clerk if I wanted to cash an $8.50 check they would charge $8.00?  The clerk said yes with a smile. Rude service as usual.

After relocating to Henderson from out of state, it was time to find a new State Farm Insurance Agent. I have always had a great relationship with State Farm, the Agents and staff. After asking several people who they recommend, Mark Citsay"s name came up a couple of times and the comments were very postive. Transfering my Auto Coverage and my other policy's was a breeze. I was fortunate enough to have Mark personally assist me and go over my policy's and coverage with me.  I have found that Mark's office staff is more than helpful, knowledgable and friendly. I highly recomend if you are new to the Las Vegas community you should contact Mark, Sheila, Rene or Jodi. This office more than measures up to the great service I am used to recieving from State Farm Agents!

Such a precious store! Each time I've walked in they have greeted me with a smile. The last time I stopped in the young lady had a candle burning which completely sold me on an almost $30 candle. The associate was so busy with a very picky lady who seemed to be spending a lot of money during her visit. However, the clerk took the time to explain the "story" behind the wine scented charleston candles.  

This store offers Tory Burch items, from shoes to accessories. And they always seem to have sales going on!

Be sure to check this little shop out ladies!!

The designs provided in the store are nice. However, there is a big "catch" for the gift return policy. The posted policy allows full refund within 5 days. I returned my gift within five days to find no full refund or store credit would be provided, but that I had find new items in the store right away. Normally, I would not mind this but this new holiday gift return policy was neither posted in the store nor conveyed to my mother upon purchase. Actually, my mother was told she would be given a full refund in five days. Moreover, when I was searching for new items I was not helped and had a rather uncomfortable experience. I wish I could like this store, but I just seem to always have a bad experience here.

I've worked with a number of accountants for my personal returns and my small business returns, and Wil of Stunkel Tax & Accounting is my absolute favorite.

This is my first year doing business with him and he made the process as painless as could be. He was able to fit me into his busy schedule two weeks before taxes were due when my other accountant dropped out at the last minute. He thoughtfully explained every detail to me and answered all of my picky questions.

I will be coming back to Wil for a long time, and I'll be recommending him to all of my friends in business. Thank you, Wil!

I never used an accountant before, but had a very pleasant experience with Wil. He is very quick, professional, and is willing to give advice throughout the year with regards to what deductions would be and the short vs. long term ramifications of making claims (e.g., when renting your house), how to structure your deductions to avoid unpleasant surprises in April, etc.

I was looking for someone to help with taxes and was glad to find William's business on the internet.  He personally called back the same day to schedule an appointment within a few days.  My tax situation was complicated but William easily handled it and gave great advice while doing it.

William was very easy to collaborate with and I look forward to working with him again in the future.  I recommend anyone who wants top notch accounting services to contact William Stunkel now!
I tried to get a home loan here and they never got back to me.  Anchor bank down the road was happy to help.  Disappointed that my home town bank didn't take me seriously.

From good to bad to worse.

This will not be your choice for financial services if you are a business.  The lack of communication from head office and the frustration dealing with their poor leadership at head office is enough to make a person go mad.  They only know how to mail out letters and do not understand how email works or even how to make a simple phone call.

The branches are fine for personal transactions and the basics but they cannot compete with the big banks.  They do not have near the vast amount of knowledge when compared.

Ten years ago it was a good choice.  Five years ago it was fine.  One year ago it was ok.  Today - it is only a little credit union masquerading  around, pretending to be great when it is not.

Do yourself a favour and shop at one of the banks that has good reviews for business before you get sucked in, like we have, for far to long.
Absolutely fantastic! I has a consultation here with Debbie and she gave me a plan on accomplishing my personal goals. I enjoyed my time with get. Very informative and personable. Worth every penny.

My wife and I just recently made the switch to Craig from another CPA. We were having challenges with the other CPA, primarily as it related to timely communication. Craig has been a breath of fresh air and has been a huge help for both our business and personal tax needs. He has a depth of knowledge that exceeds our expectations and he is very friendly. Craig is a very effective communicator and his turn around time was incredibly fast. I won't hesitate to recommend him to all of my friends and family!

Craig has been doing our corporate accounting and taxes for 20 years.  We have been audited 3 times during that time and always came out on top.  The last time there was no change at all to our return, which is very rare.  I credit that to Craig's confidence in his work, his easy rapport with the auditors and his knowledge of us as clients.  We feel blessed to have such a conscientious and competent CPA on our side.

Kelley Kregle
Efficiency Mechanical, Inc.

Time warp banking. Very low tech. Like banking in the early '70s. Ditched their checking account, but kept the Visa Credi Card. 
The free checking was nice because it would refund the fees that other banks charge for using their ATMs. But the customer has to do all the work by saving the receipts and mailing to Birmingham, AL. Other banks offer this but the computer system keeps track and automatically rebates the fees at the end if the cycle. If you complain about it the just say "This is the way we do it"

My Compass Visa acct is such a nightmare to me.  I'm supposed to get 5.44% APR  balance transfer FOR LIFE when I first open my acct, but when I received my 1st statement, I was charged 13.44% APR (regular) balance transfer.  Also, instead of FOR LIFE, now it says the duration is only for 99 months. I called and the phone rep admitted the error but it would require TWO(2) MONTHS to rectify the error. 

Then I made my payment 2 days after I received the statement but  online still shows that I need to make a min payment of  $XXXX by 5/11/2013 even though they acknowledged receipt of the payment I made.  IWO, the company never bothered to update the online info.  So now, I don't know if I should make another payment.  

This bank must have hired  the absolute lowest efficient workers..............it is amazing!

Wow! I just got strung along, lied to, and then finally let down after 6 weeks of patient waiting by a banker at this branch named Manuel Amaya.  Manuel and his manager Eric we're both rude, discourteous, and totally unprofessional. They returned almost none of my phone calls, told me they would refinance my car, and then totally reneged. I would never recommend this bank to any one.  beware of these people, they don't care one bit about you as a customer.

When you're buyiing something you hope you never need, how in the world can you be sure what to get?  Answer:  Ask Tony!  He's straight, honest, and has such a perfect wife and family that he doesn't need to sell you anything.  I've tried to stump him, but he knows everything.  Don't waste your time shopping around, Tony doesn't play games.  Call him, get what you need, and worry about other things in your life.  You can trust Prutting Insurance Group.  Enough said.

Saved me $2,000 on y business insurance!!!! Tony is just awesome and takes great care of me! Jessica and the office staff are on top of it! Looking forward to the quote for my homeowners policy. If you want to save money and have a great agent, this is the only call to make.

If you shut your eyes and ears to how Cash Converters obtained most of their stock then you'll be able to shop without compunction. If however, you take a second to think about where all the 'liberated' TVs, games consoles and films come from then you may have a twinge of doubt. Especially when you see some of the people flogging their wares then promptly crossing the street with the winnings to spend it in The Grapes, the embodiment of vice.

Apart from this, Cash Converters has an alright stock. They've got loads of TVs, DVD players and Hi-Fis as well as loads of CDs and DVDs. This selection is a little more random, as they come and go every day, so you have no guarantee of finding a good one. A good time to go is the morning when they have a better selection, in the afternoon most of the good ones have gone. It's also ridiculously cheap, with films costing about £1.50 or £2 and a 2 for 1 offer on, so you can get films for about a quid, which isn't bad in my book.

Just look on ebay. Go to ebay, find what you want and don't buy it from here because you know they had to get rid of it in a hurry and the whole idea makes me sad. There's so many "unwanted" presents and hobbies that it makes you think, why have they brought it to this miserable place with a really terrible buying price.

There's some good bargains available in this very small Cash Convertors, especially in the games and movie dvd sections. Due to it's small size they've not got a lot of selection when it comes to the electronics that the larger namesake store on Leith Walk excels in, but you can find a few gems and because it's not very big, you can go through their wares pretty quickly. I found a lot of great xbox1 games there, and the 360 games are also very reasonably priced for the most part, compared to more expensive stores such as CEX.
The staff are also very helpful compared to CEX, and even resurfaced a scratched game disk that I'd only paid about 99p for in the first place!
they have a good selection of stock in this store. good for electronic goods.
Rachel made the title loan process a simple thing! Great rates and an inviting atmosphere. Highly recommend Auto equity loans for your next title loan!
These people are great! They helped me out with everything really quick. Process was super simple

Might just be the worst bank branch on earth. If this is your home branch, I would change it. They keep up as best they can with the volume, but it's just way too small a branch for the small business owners that are demanding complex transactions from it. It's an absolute mess.

This is my regular neighbourhood TD Bank - pros:  easily accessible, decent hours
cons:  that there are security guards often.  Weird.  But the people who work there are nice, in case you want to need to talk to them.  The lines are sometimes long, but that's how it is at a bank.

Overall, this location does the job.

Michael was a great help navigating the many options with my health care. I appreciate the time he took to explain the various choices I had. I highly recommend him if you have any questions about health care insurance.

Michael Alexander is such an awesome health insurance broker! He's very professional, friendly and thorough! He explains everything to you in detail so that you leave his office feeling confident that you signed up for the best healthcare plan for you and/or your family! I definitely recommend him to everyone looking for a great plan!

HORRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE 

Was told I couldn't cash a check because the bank doesn't hold enough money... then asked if I wanted to open an account there. 
Nope.

Supervisor Celeste was extremely rude and no help whatsoever. 

If your bills can wait and your life can be put on hold until US Bank has money, join them!
Always pleasant tellers. Been bankning with this bank for over 5 years and this location is very friendly and I kind of will go out of my way to come it.

This was hands down the worst treatment I have ever got from a collection agency.  A woman named Susanne called me a few weeks ago in regards to a collection of about $45 dollars.  I let her know to call me back in a week or so and I could try to pay it.  When she called back, my paycheck wasn't as big as I expected so I had no money to offer her.  I didn't answer that day, then the next day she would call 2-3 times a day until finally today (9 days later) I finally answered to tell her I don't have anything to offer.  She said "Well why did you tell me you could pay it then!?!?"  I said "Because at the time I thought I could"  She said "This is $45 dollars, you tellin me you don't have $45 dollars?!?!"  I said "Yes that is what I am telling you, I don't appreciate the way you are talking to me may I speak to your manager?"  She said "My manager??  I'm not putting the manager on the phone for $45 dollars!!!"  I said "I don't want to talk to him about the money, I want to talk to him about the way you are treating me".  She said "If you can't pay it now, when do you get paid next???"  I said "I would rather not share that information incase I am put in a position where I can not pay it again"   She said "That is a bunch of BS!!!"  I said "Well i'm sorry, things come up"  She said "Things come up????  THATS REAL ORIGINAL!!!"  - Then hung up on me.  Who hired this moron?  Sorry I have $10 dollars in my bank account for food and gas until my next paycheck.

This Awful company was ordered to pay $8,000 in penalties and over $1000 in fees for harassment and business misconduct!
http://www.azdfi.gov/Consumers/PublicRecords/Forms/Consent/Thunderbird_Collection_Specialists_Inc_Consent.pdf

The bank is very clean and pleasant to visit (though it's eerily quiet with no music playing at all- even a tiny, tinny pocket or clock radio on someone's desk...) Everyone there is cordial enough and they are immediately at their respective stations ready to help you as you walk in the doors. Well, it's a bank :)
What would I do to enhance the experience? Notice my choice of adjectives used... let's make "cordial" into "friendly" (read: Less Stepford Wives, More Flo from Progressive) and "eerily quiet" into "for Pete's sake some elevator music at least" LOL!

While I have had some bad experiences with this bank (being in between jobs and not in control of finances, until very recently)- one thing I have particularly liked is how they have been willing to wait for me to repay a loan (as well as overdraft fees on a checking account, long story), for a little bit longer just so my account does not get sent to collections. The customer service people are extremely friendly and will work with you in order to ensure that your financial needs are met. Overall, i would highly reccomend 1stBank to anyone i know in AZ, California or Colorado (they only do business in these three states).

I have had my Insurance with this company for over 5 years now.
They have always been very helpful to me in all situations and saved me money. 
I have my car and home.  Also my family and friends have called them for insurance as well.   You can do everything over the phone, by email, or even go there in person.
All requests are taken care of immediately and I always receive great customer service

I've been a client of Brian's for about 8 years. He has helped me through home buying, car buying, a growing family and now buying a business and has been absolutely wonderful. He finds me the best rates and is extremely reliable. I just call him with a need and he delivers quickly! Brian is extremely trust worthy and knowledgeable about what he does! I would definitely recommend him to anyone-You will be so glad he is only a phone call away!

This tiny currency cabin built into the Princes Mall is clearly very strategically, and cleverly placed, for people getting off airport buses and the like, and for reeling in wandering tourists in general. That bit of the street is always packed and it takes a hundred years to get anywhere or cross the road (whinge, grumble, complain).

Anyway, obviously, No.1 Currency isn't just for tourists needing a quick and convenient Sterling hand out, it's for locals getting away on their holidays too. I'm always completely disorganised and massively last minute about everything, so for me this place is great for a speedy Euros pick up, not that you get many of them to the pound these days. Wow, I hadn't realised I was in such a grumbling mood before I started writing this.

I'm not great at researching and going round places checking lots of different exchange rates, but apparently word on the street is that No.1 Currency, Marks & Spencer, and American Express have the most competitive exchange rates in the city centre, so if you're actually organised about your holidays, unlike me, it's probably worth going round these three and seeing what rates they're offering.

Having needed money for a brief jaunt to Europland for my birthday, I stopped in this tiny place in the hope that they would have better rates than some of the other places i had looked at.

To my dissapointment, they didnt - the exchange rate was somewhat of a rip off - but I assume that is for the benifit of our tourist friends, so I can understand why. Never the less, the staff were very friendly and efficient.

I treat this as my home TD branch and have opened several accounts here.  In general, I have found all of the staff very friendly and personable, though one teller needs a bit more practice in English.  The lines seem to move very quickly yet they manage to be friendly and accommodating to the regular customers.  

I like TD because of its numerous ABM machines and convenient hours.  I've also invested in their mutual funds, which have a good rating.

I have an account with TD, which I mostly keep because my ING account takes money out of it. I've never had a bad experience with TD staff (in any branch or city where I've used them), but the rates and corporate nonsense that they keep insisting on is a big turn-off. Their new "high" interest account is an insult; I mean, even a venerable financial institution like Canadian Tire gives a better rate.

Coming back from a trip abroad, for instance, I took about ten pounds and fifteen euros to this branch to get exchanged. Apparently, they wanted to charge me an extra ten bucks for EACH currency; after I balked at that, the teller lady waived it... but come on, TD! It seems like they try to get away with whatever they can if you don't call 'em on it.

This is the worst HSBC branch that I have ever dealt with and I just closed my account  and cancelled my credit card due to the horrible treatment that I received here. 

Days after my wedding I came in here to deposit a large amount of cash received from wedding gifts (slightly under 10k). The teller immediately and rudely demanded that I present proof of my marriage (I had just gotten married and this documentation was not available).
