She presented a handout on FINTRAC rules against money laundering, which said that for large cash transactions a report had to be filed to the government to report a large deposit. I quickly skimmed this, not noticing that it did not say anything about providing back-up documentation, and suggested that I could deposit a lesser amount but she refused to do this because she "already knew how much I came in with". I also suggested that perhaps the cash amount was under 10k and could she please count this? She refused. This left me no choice but to leave the bank and go about my day carrying around 10k cash on me, which was extremely unsafe.

Later that day, I went to another HSBC branch to deposit a smaller amount after keeping the bulk of the cash safely at my home, due to what had happened earlier. The teller there told me that all the first teller had to do was to file a report with the government reporting that a large cash deposit had been made into my account (FINTRAC rules: http://www.fintrac-canafe.gc.ca/msb-esm/reports-declarations/types-eng.asp). Why did the first teller not do this?? There were NO RULES that said that I had to provide proof of my marriage as part of the report. Even if I had some sort of paperwork that proved that I just got married, would this had proved where the money came from? No - this request was completely irrelevant because the cash were gifts from my guests and not traceable.

Not only did the teller at this Yorkville branch not know the rules but she treated me like a money launderer and forced me to continue with my day carrying a huge amount of cash. 

To make things worse, I called in and complained to HSBC about this incident. They apologized and felt that this should not have happened, that the teller should have just filled in the unusual transactions form and filed a report, and said that they would forward my complaint to the HSBC branch manager who would call me to apologize. A month has passed and I have heard nothing. I called in again on another matter and asked about it - they said that the manager would call me, and still, I have heard nothing.

I closed my account yesterday and I want this branch to know that it was their doing. Shame on this horrible teller, and worse, irresponsible management that will not acknowledge the mistakes that their staff are making.

I honestly am glad I don't bank with HSBC based solely on the lack of customer service at their branches. 

Don't expect tellers at their desks 

Don't expect acknowledgement when waiting in line  

Don't expect any extension of service beyond what is absolutely required of them 

And 

Don't expect service with a smile 

If HSBC employees are that miserable, I can't imagine what their clients endure.

If you must bank with HSBC, rule out this yorkville branch and the yeglinton locations. Smh.

Before I create euro and gbp a/c, I call few times to make sure what ID doc. I need to open a/c,.

During my visit to open a/c, i need to visit another 3 times to get it done, because they forgot to tell me something to bring with me.

Before i transfer euro and gbp money in, i double check 3 time, no extra service ( except withdraw fee, less than 1 dollar) then i transfer.

but where i try to withdraw, they charge me another $15 for each fund transferred.
Ask them why?
They SAID : we consider local transfer as wired money as well.
I:but when I asked you three times, you said no extra charge, just like what I did in TD bank.
They : because we are not just like the regular bank n Toronto...

Well, when I got cheated through hidden fee like this, there's only one time business, because not worthy any more.

No wonder I saw so many angry customers in this branch whenever my visit to willowdale HSBC. The worst bank I've ever visit.

416-756-2333
3640 Victoria Park Ave, Toronto, ON M2H 3B2

Our family has had the pleasure to do business with Duane Hansen and Modern Woodman.  We appreciate the fact that Duane always has the clients best interest in mind.  He does his best to meet each individuals needs.
Modern Woodman is always giving back to the community. I am a club leader with them and I love the fact that they give you the tools to be a blessing to the community.
Get together with Duane  and learn more about his company!

Walked in this morning to find one of my old Banker, managing. Mr. Mike H.  Got to see him in action. How expedient, and efficient Mike is. I have friends that have known him all his life. What a great asset Mike H.,  is to Bank of America. Daniel is no chop liver. The kid is good too.

I really do not get it..... This is a decent size bank location in a very populated location in town right off the highway. Why is it that I am always having to wait an eternity to get and service at this location. There seems to be one person helping out with accounts and another person running the teller position. I also see a total of 4 employees here and it is after 4pm, the time when everyone gets off of work and handle their personal/business banking stuff. Why not hire some more people and make this an more efficient location. I just do not get it....

Horrible experience! After being a State Farm customer for 25 yrs this office cancelled my auto policy after I changed bank accounts because they didn't have a "authorization signature" even though I filled out the new bank account information and gave them all the new information. Now, because of this I will lose all my years as a loyal SF customer. I will lose deductions for good driving/no accidents 10+ yrs, etc all because this office did nothing to help me! After receiving a letter from the DMV stating I owe them a huge fee for not having auto insurance I called the office only to be hung up on by the owner of this particular State Farm office (Mary). I spoke to another SF office in the LV area who gave me information on how to handle the situation and rectify it the best way possible. They found the actions of this office unbelievable as well. I believe State Farm is a great Insurance carrier although, as in every profession you run into people who care about their costumers those who just want the pay check.

Mary's office is AMAZING.  I've been with State Farm for almost 12 years and after a horrible experience with another agent I moved my policies to her office. Mary, Vance, Maria, and everyone else is extremely responsive and prompt anytime I need something. 

I got a quote through Geico that was a whopping $7/mo cheaper for my 3 cars but they can't write my house insurance and it would cause it to go up by almost 20%, effectively negating any savings. I would happily pay 5x that to keep my policies with an agent I know and trust over some random person at an 800 number that will never know me, my family, or our . 

Thank you all for everything you do, you have made me a customer for life!

I've been with US Bank for two years and I'm really surprised that this is the first review of the Hilldale location. I only have a student checking account here so I guess my review should be limited. 

I've been a member of several credit unions in Madison spanning a 16 year period and the customer service here has been by far the best. 

The US bank iPhone app has been a life saver! Well, maybe not literally but it has been that good. I've always been treated with respect and genuine care. I once swore that I would never give a bank my business ever again, but I must say I'm very glad I did. 

Any who, as Nacho Libre would say..."Ees fahnTASTick"

This is banking old school style. Everybody who works there knows my name, greets me by name, and gives me very personal service whenever I'm there. Just this week I was too sick to come in and sign something so one of the bankers came to my house to drop off paperwork and came back again later to pick it up again. I don't know many businesses that make house calls anymore! And this was after he unilaterally proposed a new product to me that he thought I could benefit from. I've also been pleased how U.S. Bank has kept up with technology. They have decent online tools, a good mobile version of their site, and just started offering cool tools for remote check deposits. This has already saved me countless trips to the bank since I typically handle a lot of checks in my business. I don't use cash so I'm not sure about their ATM fees, if any, but I love that they're conveniently located near my house across from Hilldale & on the Square.

If only I was willing to do more business with BofA.

The teller was very friendly and not pushy at all when he learned that I was not a member.  Just a girl trying to cash a check.  

Very clean, friendly and personable staff and I got out of there pretty quickly.  Considering this is one of only a few BofA's in the area, I was surprised I didn't have to wait too long.
3pm. 10 customers in line and only 2 tellers. I was #6 in line and took me 20 minutes to get to my transaction. No management or anyone around. Just sad experience for customers.

Definitely the worse banking experience available. I've never been a TD bank fan but this is not a TD issue, this is a management issue. As a long time resident in the area I can see what has gone wrong here. The Neighborhood has changed a lot in the past 10 years and the mentality at this branch hasn't changed at all. Leslieville being one of the most progressive neighborhoods in the city should have a better banking experience than what is being offered here.

I would also like to take a second to remind you that TD Bank register all there mortgages as a collateral charge.  If you think this is good for you than you have not done your homework. They don't tell you they do this or what it means. When your mortgage comes up for renewal, get as far away as you can from TD.

Conveniently located, I stopped in this weekend to get some cash from the ATM.  In the middle of the day the vestibule, as Danielle P points out, smells like it is used as a hangout for drunks and others with possible incontinence issues. Sad ATM, but well-placed for all the "cash-only" restos on the block. Does visa really charge that much to use their services?

My mom went in to get a quote and after the staff going above and beyond to get her exactly what she needed I decided to check it out for myself. I appreciated their assistance and helping me in such a timely manner as my policy was about to expire from a previous company.

I came in to get a problem with my insurance fixed.  I was totally freaking out all day.  When I came in, Tiffany helped me.  She was very friendly and extremely knowledgable.  I thought I would be in the office for at least an hour, but she had me in and out within 30 minutes.  The best part is she saved me ALOT of money.
Tiffany kath helped me get the lowest rate possible for my car insurance and also lowered my apr! Helped me refinance as well ! She's the best! Highly recommend this place!

I can't give this insurance company enough stars. Everyone that works there is amazing, Tiffany though is a doll. She was my rep and has taken care of me from A to Z even when I didn't have insurance with them, she was always there to answer my questions. Such a beautiful office and amazing people working there.

We have used Pro Tax Financial Services for the past 3 years and they are great.  They make filing a easy and offer sound tax advice that is straight forward.  It is a family run business so there is a direct relation to the customer service and the clients who continue to return to their business.
If you need any 1on 1 help Khaseem j. Everett  is the representative to ask for! Very professional, very attentive, definitely will wait on line to see this guy for any of my banking needs!
My wife and I love Wells Fargo bank. Very polite, knowledgable people, great hours, the kind of bank everyone hopes for. My wife loves it so much, she got a job there!

This branch is allegedly part of the CU$ alliance which allows credit union members nationwide to withdrawal from an alliance ATM, surcharge free. I'm a member of a sister credit union and the ATM said it would impose a $2.50 fee. I cancelled my transaction and left. If you don't bank with SunWest FCU directly, stay away from their ATM's!!!

I cannot say enough great things about this organization and the people who work there. Sandy is particularly awesome and went above and beyond to help us get our auto refinance completed, even while their computers were down. Her excellent customer service is top notch and all the other girls are wonderful too. 

They really care about their members and when it comes to things like loans, they don't just judge you by a credit score, but look at the whole picture. Most banking and financial institutions are not like that, they look at your score and if it is not exactly where it should be, they instantly deny you. I am thankful for this credit union and the people behind it, who care and treat each individual as just that, an individual, not a number. 

I highly recommend this credit union to everyone!
Love these girls, Jennifer is awesome! Everyone is super friendly & helpful! I have never had a problem with anything and I wouldn't bank anywhere else!

We shopped around for a loan for our first home and took recommendations for Steve Schauer's office from a friend and our realtor.  

Steve was my very first stop for shopping my loan and he initially spoke with me over the phone.  He suggested that we set up an appointment to meet and go over our loan options.  My husband and I had so many questions as first time home buyers and Steve was so professional and patient with us.  He is an excellent educator, telling us what we needed to know about home mortgages, not overwhelming us with those big scary mortgage terms and explaining everything in as much detail as we needed without going overboard.  He spent so much time with us in his office and we felt totally comfortable asking all of our questions.  

We initially opted to purchase a new home and had to go with the builder's lender to receive closing costs.  That lender was awful to work with as a first time buyer (totally different review) and we even called Steve a couple of times throughout that process to have him clarify some things for us.  He graciously helped us despite not being our lender at the time. 

Fast forward a couple of months and we decided the new home wasn't for us.  We found a resale and quickly went back to Steve's office to help us with our mortgage needs.  He and his team worked at LIGHTNING speed to help get a mortgage in place and we closed within 3 weeks.  They kept us updated during every part of the process, were always available to assist us with questions/concerns, and never left us guessing at any point.  

First time home buying was such a fun/exhausting/confusing/emotional/stressful experience but I can honestly say dealing with our lender was the EASIEST part of the process thanks to WJB and the Schauer lending team.  I want to thank them for hustling and working so quickly.  We so appreciate all of their hard work and will recommend them a million times over.

***Edited because the Steve I worked with for my mortgage was Steve Schauer and not Steve Lee. Steve Schauer is now at New American Funding on Paseo Verde & Stephanie in Henderson.***

Steve Lee is everything I could ask for in a loan agent and more. I had a bad experience with another loan agent and went searching for someone who could help me. I got in touch with Steve and from our first conversation over the phone I felt comfortable with him and decided I would give him a shot. He did not disappoint. He is excellent at communication. He told me what he could do and what he could not do and even clued me in on some facts with the loan process that I was not aware of. 

I told him I was in a bit of a crunch to get the loan process worked out as soon as possible and he and his team went to work fast. If he had any questions at all he did not hesitate to call or email me. And likewise when I had any questions (and I had a lot) he was very quick at responding back and making me feel at ease with the entire process. 

When I closed on my home and went to sign my final loan documents Steve was just arriving at the airport from being out of town. He made it a point to rush from the airport to the loan document signing even though it wasn't necessary for him to be there. He just wanted to make sure he would be there to support his client (me) if I had any questions. 

I could not recommend Steve and his team more. He was efficient, honest and very quick to respond. All things I appreciate much. I will use Steve again if I ever buy another home and will certainly refer my friends and family to him as well.

I have worked with Steve Lee of WJ Bradley and must say he is very professional and knows his business well.  I have referred him to several relatives who were also pleased with him and his company.  Great job Steve Lee!
HORRIBLE WORK they overcharge and don't even know how to process docs properly.  TAKES INFORMATION and then CHARGES TOO MUCH for the work I could have done better myself.  horrible. people
Totally overcharged and the owner is a perve. Next year it's Turbo Tax for me baby!

I will admit they seem to have gotten rid of the snooty tellers and it's okay. 

The drive-thru opens at 7:30a and closes at 6pm. 
The lobby includes a kids play area, fireplace and computers like every other location except the Capitol Branch (no kids area) and State St. (no kids area). 

I do prefer the State St. & Monroe locations as they maintain the same staff versus other locations that seem to rotate staff more frequently.  In the end, I'm in and I'm out. Some things could improve with regards to loans and underwriting but I'm loyal, overall.

I have been a UWCU member for 3 years now. Let me say, becoming a member here has been a revelation to me in banking. Not only do I feel fairly treated, but this institution straight up inspires feelings of LOVE and GRATITUDE for the quality of services they provide. 

If you are used to larger banking institutions, then you are probably familiar with the many fees associated with your accounts as well as the impersonal service you receive. Prepare to be wowed at UWCU. You will actually feel like your opinions and finances matter. All of their policies and procedures are fair and even helpful. Say goodbye to feeling like you are getting screwed over. Say hello to feeling heard and appreciated. Great services, great customer service. That's what UWCU offers!

The icing on the cake is their amazing mobile app, which has so many interesting bells and whistles that you can spend hours learning about how you spend your money and how you can make your money go further. Really above and beyond what even OTHER credit unions in town offer. This place is awesome!
i don't know   how the tellers put up with me !!  everytime i'm in vegas, i'm at this branch and i always need something beyond the deposit/withdrawal stuff - they get it done...everytime

Not nearly as bad as the Citibank at 8701 W Sahara but now that the Jones/Flamingo location is gone, I'm sure they won't mind 1 star. +Shitibank just plain sucks anyway. But especially the tellers at the W Sahara location!

This branch's closed. 
How come no one did report this bank has been closed.
New branch is open at sahara ave their post says.

If I could give this a 0 I would love too. I recently switched over to Steves agency with a new truck I had purchased. I had first been talking to Mary-Ann who quoted me $140 a month. As soon as I signed up, I paid the initiation fee. However, the first bill I received was $50 more than I was told without any explanation. So I gave them a call. This time I spoke to Steve and was told that it was a one time fee for an accident I had 2 and a half years ago. Okay, fine I'll pay that and expect my monthly bill to return to the $140 a month. A couple weeks later a friend told me about  a bundle discount if I were to switch my other car over from Allstate. So again, I called Steve and we added the car but I never received a discount.. 

After about a month goes by I get my next statement which was normal. Yet, I had received a letter in the mail from my loan providers saying that my insurance had been cancelled. Where did this come from? Assuming this was a misunderstanding, I again called Steve and asked about the letter. At first he brushed me off like it was an invalid letter because it was "old" (2 weeks) and that everything was fine. Me, assuming that he didn't even pull my file up, continued to ask more detail specific questions. As soon as I did, he was forced to open my file and sure enough, found something and immediately put me on hold. He ended up having to call me back saying that my insurance, in fact, WAS getting cancelled because of my accident 2 and a half years ago with my CAR. First of all, where was this communication??? What would have happened had I not called him. Aren't you my Insurance provider? Isn't it YOUR JOB to be aware of these things and keep me up to date on what is going on? Second, I initially signed up my truck first and paid the "1 time fee of $50 to cover my accident". But the funny thing is, they want to cancel my Truck insurance (which has never been in an accident EVER) and keep my car insurance (which I had just switched over AND got in the accident with). How does this even make sense? 

To top it all off, the customer service I had received by Steve was incredibly dissatisfying. He does not give a crap about you or your policy. All he wants is your money; and fast. In addition, the lack of communication between him and his customers is non existent and he will not remember changes made on your policies. Finally, I never ONCE received an apology nor letter informing me of the changes about to be made. 

If you want my honest opinion, AVOID THIS AGENCY AT ALL COSTS!!  There are far better, more caring insurance agencies out there.

Steve Sears is absolutely the best !  He is friendly, knowledgeable, honest and professional.  His right arm, Mary Jean, is always there with an answer to my question and, on the rare occasion she has to get clarification, she never fails to call back!  I have never felt pressure to buy insurance I didn't need/want and feel they have always given me options.  When I called to insure a new car I had just purchased, Steve asked me if I had financed the vehicle (I had) and he let me know about State Farm Bank. There was no pressure. He told me to give them a call to see if they could save me any money on the interest rate. A five minute phone call saved me 1 1/2%. I was grateful!!!  I highly, highly, highly recommend Steve Sears State Farm.  I feel like I am always treated like family!  Thanks Steve and Mary Jean!!!

This BofA has weird, sloping parking so watch who you park next to & hold onto your doors when you get out.  There is always a security guard at this branch.  The branch itself has a strange configuration of teller windows.  The manager is usually there to greet you when you come in, but if you need to sit down to talk with someone, that can be a wait as it seems the manager isn't allowed to sit down.  The tellers are quick & mostly friendly.

This is the B of A I frequent the most. I mainly use the ATM for deposits and withdrawels. They do multiple check deposits which speeds up the deposits process. There have been a few instances when the ATM was down but that has been maybe 3 times in 7 years. Occasionally, I have had to go in and the customer service has been great. theres never been a line and the employees have always been very helpful.

Speedy Cash is as good as it gets !

The location on 51st Ave & Olive in Glendale is clean, the staff super friendly and the loan process a breeze.  They offer registration loans and title loans with an array of other services.  Most registration loans are $500 if you choose and super easy to pay back.  Just remember do not borrow more than you can borrow and pay back.  

Payments are generally about $45 every pay day for a $500 loan but most of it goes to interest so make sure you pay back your loan as quickly as possible to avoid paying almost double the amount you borrowed.

I was referred to Dan by a friend and have been extremely happy with the service and pricing he has provided. He was able to increase our general liability coverage for our business and save us a substantial amount of money too! I'll be switching my car insurance  over and referring friends/family to him too.

This is one of the busiest bank location I have ever seen. They always have a line up even after have multiple tellers working. 

The service level is average. We went there when out account was hacked and the person we dealt with was not much help. He gave us the wrong business card and it was so hard to track him. When we called the person on the card she was so negative and started arguing on where we got her card...we are freaking their customers and it doesn't matter where we got the card from!

Schaut nur mal am Wochenende beim Trölsch in der Myliusstraße vorbei, um zu Sehen wieviele Menschen dort Ihre Frühstücksbrötchen kaufen. Aus gutem Grund, denn alles ist immer frisch und ausgesprochen köstlich. Mein Tip: das Paderborner Brot ;-)

Worst customer service ever! My card got stuck at the atm and when I went inside to talk to someone about having them get my card they told me I had to wait for the manager.. Waited for the manager and the manager had us wait for someone else to let us know that they had no access to it!! Every employee acted like they didn't care.. Never coming to this bank ever and I'm letting all my friends and family know!!

I stopped by my local branch because of a problem with my account. I had to wait over a half hour to speak to someone. Other people were waiting, and one of them just got up and left because he was tired of waiting.

I'm not a fan of this bank in general and closed my account, so I won't have to deal with them again.
B of A sticks! They nickel and dime you for everything. Their customer service stinks too. I will never go there again!

My dog peed on their carpet...

And they were completely calm and professional about it.  I came in to refinance my house and had great friendly service even for a huge banking institution.  They even had doggy treats as well.  

Ultimately there is nothing they had to offer for homes for refinancing, but they were very friendly.  

The building has a very interesting modern look which is not typical of a banking institution.

This branch sits at a very busy intersections on the SWC of Tatum Blvd. & Shea Blvd. in Paradise Valley.  The lobby is very big and very bright, floor is very shiny.  And yet, on a busy Friday afternoon during lunch, there were a lot of personal bankers and yet there were only 2 tellers helping you at the lobby and at the drive-thru.  The branch has 3 drive-thru lanes, 2 for ATM's and 1 with window teller.  There are 2 separate teller ATM's for after-hour business from a separate entrance where you have to use your Bank of America Debit card for entry.  Overall service was okay, but I waited for about 10 minutes before I was helped.  Not coming here again if I don't need to.

I have been using The Book Balancer for the last 2 years now to do my corporate taxes for my business Tru Cab. They have been excellent to work with and made the process so simple I really don't even remember much about my experience with them last year! 

I can say this since we filed an extension and just had them wrap up our taxes before the Sept. 15th deadline. They have a great location in a nice building. I'm always greeted by a friendly smile every time I'm there. I was able to email them all of our quickbooks data so my only trip in was to sign the paperwork and pick up my copies. 

They also give you a nicely bound copy to keep for your records and everything is nicely organized with copies of necessary paperwork for each of my 2 other business partners. 

I primarily worked with Jennifer over there the last 2 years and I will say she went above and beyond to handle a confusion that occurred this year. 

I don't have much experience working with anyone else since this is the only company I've used to file taxes but their prices seem more than reasonable and I haven't heard anything from the IRS saying we owe a lot or there were errors so their work must be good! 

I'm working on starting up another LLC so maybe next year I'll have them file for 3 businesses. Thanks for everything Book Balancer!

"Honesty & Integrity First & Foremost" is NOT what I have experienced with Jen at The Book Balancer. I experienced unethical billing practices from The Book Balancer. JMC had her filing TPT's and other small clerical work.  At the time I did not know how to file our company's TPT's.  She charged JMC several and multiple times for one hour of work when many of the TPT filings required zero tax liability.  I learned after the fact that the form required at most 10-15 minutes of work but she billed for a full hour several times over totaling several hundreds of dollars in unethical billing practices. Moral of the story, know how to do your paperwork before sourcing it out. Jen you had an opportunity to answer my certified letter and documents and the BBB complaint. Shame on you...Jen at The Book Balancer!  Ramona G.

My better half and I just shut down our accounts today after being with Wells Fargo for decades. Wells Fargo is unfair with their fees. We got hit with a fee this month that wasn't our fault. The employee we dealt with wouldn't waive it or even cared.
This is enough already. It seems Wells may be more greedy than they used to be. We are done with them.

Since when will a bank not accept a deposit of $175 into a Boy Scout account?  I am not a signatory on the account, but why would that matter?  It has never mattered in the past, at any other bank I've ever been to.  It didn't even matter to the other Wells Fargo branch I took the deposit to.  But evidently it matters to this Wells Fargo branch.  Let them have their rules, and I will move all of our accounts elsewhere.

Horrible customer service. Wouldn't let my partner (who is a Wells Fargo customer) use the restroom. I personally have had bad service there as well. They need to properly train the staff on customer service badly.
Service was real professional. People there were real knowledgeable and curious. Referred  some friends and family and they hooked me up. I never will go back to any other tax company.

Maria has a great office. She does what a good agent does, stay in touch to make sure your have the right coverage. Nobody likes spending money on insurance, but since you have to don't you want to make sure your fully covered?
Maria is very knowledgeable about insurance and a fantastic person.

Rob S

I have been a Wells Fargo customer for over 20 years and I used to work at Wells Fargo as a teller  for almost 3 years when I was an undergrad student. This bank location lost my cash credit card payment. I went inside the branch and tried to straighten out the situation. Some young male worker was completely disrespectful to me and treated me like I was a criminal or a scam artist. This teller jumped down my throat and pretty much called me a liar. He didn't even attempt to investigate my complaint. He asked me what the teller looked like who took my payment and I described her. He said no teller looked like that. I walked away because I didn't have a receipt.

1) I used to work as a teller and deposits were lost while I worked at Wells Fargo. It is not unheard of for money to be credited to the wrong account or just lost in general. It didn't happen every day at the bank, but it happened frequently. Again, I worked there for almost 3 years and I saw it happen often enough. 

2) I actually used to work at this same branch and was able to identify an employee, a lady named Pat, who was still working there 15 years later.I could not believe that I was treated so disrespectfully and this guy who was supposed to be a supervisor pretty much yelled in my face. He should have investigated it. I didn't have a receipt, so I walked away. I will never make a cash payment again. I knew the date of the transaction and the lazy employee should have been able to investigate it from there.

I am still a Wells Fargo customer only because of a business rep that I deal with in a paradise valley branch. But I will never return to this crappy location. 

If a transaction is lost or not credited to your account, I would call the main 1800# and have them contact the branch to correct mistake or research problem. That way they are forced to investigate the transaction.

Outstanding customer service, knowledge, and management. From the simple to the complex, Wells Fargo has the expertise. Don't waste your time with other banks. Even though large, Wells Fargo feels like a community bank.

Needed a signature guaranteed and my normal WF  branch didn't have an authorized employee. Went here on Christmas Eve; promptly greeted by a couple of super friendly employees. Waited just a minute or two and Dallas York hooked it up; in and out and no fuss. I would definitely revisit if ever in the area!

Schließe mich JoBe an: unschlagbar für den mitnehm-imbiss für den zug, wenn morgens das frühstück ausgefallen ist: ich empfehle besonders die Laugen-Bagel mit Kürbiskernen, gefüllt mit Frischkäse, Tomaten, Alfalfa-Sprossen.

Für mich der beste Filialbäcker in Ludwigsburg. Die Backwaren sind frisch und schmecken sehr gut. Nur mit dem Diätbrot war ich nich so zufrieden, aber mal ehrlich, das kann man(n) auch nicht essen ;)


 In der Myliusstrasse kann man herlich frühstücken mit frischen Rühreiern und leckeren Brötchen.

Best mortgage experience ever. Greg and State Farm Bank made it very simple and painless.  Loan was funded quickly and with ease. great experience!

My family always had state farm insurance at Hawaii. They've always pushed me to get state farm too. But it would always look for those cheap insurance out there. But last, I decided to give it a try. 
Right away, they helped me out made sure I get the right rates and explained why my pass rates would be hire and what to look forward in the future. They also have life insurance. 
Anyways I love that they have a 24hr assistance that you may call. I've had to call them twice with no hassle. They're always there in my time of need. Oh and is a live person you talk too. 
So ya....I love my experience with them.

it's a bit hard to write a review about a bank.  i mean it's a bank, my pay check is put into my account every month, my rent comes out, and i use the rest to pay my way for the month.  i generally have few interactions with my bank except recieving my monthly account status and twice a year going to get US dollars.

based on those two things i would have given this bank an excellent rating, but there is one very poor customer service event that stands out for me.  see in september of this year i went to deposit a fairly large cheque into my account.  the cheque was from my grandfather in the states and when i asked if i could deposit it directly into my ISA even though it was a foreign cheque i was assured that i could.  four weeks later i still hadn't seen the money go into my account nor had the cheque cleared in the states.  so i got on the phone to the bank.  the guy assured me he would check up on it and be back in touch.  he did get back in touch to say that unfortunately since it was a foreign cheque i couldn't deposit it directly into my ISA as it was subject to tax.  ok then, i asked if they could deposit the cheque into my current account instead and then i would transfer the money over.  he said that wouldn't be a problem and that the cheque was being sent back to their branch.

when a week or two went by and the money still wasn't in my account i phoned the bank to check what was going on.  i spoke to a girl who said she would phone the international department and check where the cheque was.  a few more days went by and hearing nothing i phoned back to speak to the guy i had spoken to originally.  he apologised for not being in touch but said he wasn't sure if there had been an update.  then the girl i had spoken to a few days ago said to him that they had lost the cheque.  LOST THE CHEQUE!!!!!  if i had ever wanted to punch someone through the phone this was the moment.

trying to keep the sheer rage and annoyance out of my voice i asked what my options were.  he said they had a copy of the cheque which they could pay out on but this would take another 6-8 weeks.  it had already been 6 weeks since i originally deposited the cheque.  my other option was to get a new cheque and deposit this into my current account. and after speaking with my parents they decided the best option was to get a new cheque and cancel the other one.

so eventually with the new cheque in hand i went to the bank and deposited it.  i was helped by the original guy who had been dealing with the situation.  he assured me that the cheque would show up in my account in 14 days after going through the international holdings to decide the exchange rate.  true to his word, the money did appear and i was finally able to transfer it over to my ISA.

however, besides that one helpful guy, the rest of the customer service experience was appalling.  the girl had clearly known that they had lost my cheque but not phoned me to tell me.  and they LOST MY CHEQUE!!!  i can't even begin to describe how unprofessional that is.  i was absolutely shocked that a bank who deals with billions of pounds a day could lost my cheque.  so for that one instance this place gets three stars.

I have maintained an account with Wachovia (now Wells Fargo) for many years. 

A few times I have had serious issues with unknowns accessing my checking account and once with a cash deposit "disappearing".

This review will cover the times unknowns accessed my checking account because those are the times no branch activity was involved/my interaction was solely with customer service.

Once a few years ago my checking account was accessed and several payments were made to a business or businesses unknown by me for I-have-no-idea-what.

To their credit, the bank called me. I didn't answer but returned their call when I got the message the next day. The customer service rep who helped me was extremely courteous and went out of her way to assure me that all funds would be returned to me, etc.

I did have to fill out a little paperwork but my funds were returned right away.

This instance resulted in a few overdraft items a few days later but the second customer service rep I spoke with returned those fees to my account during our conversation.



***


The second incidence of unknowns accessing my checking account was early 2011. I once again received a call from the bank. Several payments were said to have been made to a company that teaches ESL and one to a company that sold audio books. The total was almost $300.

I was livid.

The customer service rep who assisted me was an angel. I know she could hear how I was barely restraining my anger and she assured me that all would be well. Curious, I asked her how someone had gotten into my account. 

She said it looked like someone had most likely accessed my debit card and not my actual bank account. So no need to close my account because the bank would unlink the offending card and issue me a new one which should resolve the issue.

(Which didn't really make me feel any safer because I've had friends who have had similar happen to them again and again and AGAIN, even after being issued new debit cards numerous times.)

Any whooo, I got my new debit card and life continued as usual.

After this incident,  I set up banking alerts. Now I get notifications when all sorts of activities occur with my accounts.

You do realize that the company can edit contact information to reflect anything they want, RIGHT? And maybe don't give them a 5-star review for the sole purpose of manipulating the rating... what are you, an employee?

This is a company selling health insurance that makes unsolicited calls to your business and will hang up on you when you politely ask to be removed from their list, leaving you wondering if their next sales training class will stutter and fumble with the script in the next week or month. 

They called from 480-612-0200

Went in to pay off a loan via shared branching. Needed to have them fax confirmation of cash payment to my credit union to expedite a title release.

I've now called five times and still not had the confirmation sent to the proper receiving party. 

When I called the fifth time, I reached a central hub and spoke with an extremely rude female who hung up on me when I requested to be transferred to someone at the specific branch I'd gone to earlier in the day.

Long story short: I will NEVER do business with this institution again. I know financial institutions are notorious for bad customer service, and I've dealt with my fair share of banks and credit unions in the past; this one takes the cake for absolute worst customer service.

CUSTOMER SERVICE LINE WAS THE WORST PEOPLE IVE EVER TALKED TO IN MY LIFE.... Worst bank I've ever had to deal with... I called to get business account number, simple task, after numerous attempts of having to hang up and call back, they finally gave me a number, the WRONG number on purpose after we exchanged words.... That's got to be illegal and she needs to be fired. Then she even has the nerve to freeze my account while I'm out of town and can't go into a branch when they're clearly in the wrong.. Grow up and get better employees. I'm making sure everyone knows how I feel about this credit union. I definitely would not ever bank here for anyone in the future.

Everyone I've encountered at this location has been great. The problem is Desert School's online banking! I started with desert schools about 3 plus years ago, I had trouble with the online banking at that time and was told they were making changes and working to make it better. Fast forward to almost 2016 and for some reason they still cannot figure it out! It's so frustrating that I might actually switch banks. Every single time I've NEEDED to sign on and make a transfer etc. it says online banking is temporarily unavailable... Every. Single.Time! It works about 40 percent of the time if that! Figure it out already Desert Schools, you're losing customers because you can't do what every other bank is doing successfully!

This Desert Schools location is great! Whenever I need to deposit a check, I can get in and out quickly. The staff members are very friendly and helpful. Most recently, I took my dog with me through their drive-thru, and the teller put a dog treat into the canister thing that holds the money. I thought that was a nice touch! ;)

We insured with Traci at Sed Poche's State Farm office and for the first term it was okay. Then, in the renewal, my son dropped off the insurance. He had been in their system for the first term, but inexplicably disappeared - the renewal cards and papers included only me, my husband and daughter. I called the office, but, of course, it was closed, so I got the call center who said, "That's strange" more times than you ever want to hear. For some unknown reason, my son wasn't on the renewal policy. But, they said, he's listed as in the household, so he's covered. I got nothing in the mail to confirm any of that. A couple of weeks later, my son bought a car, so I called Sed's office and told them that same day. They worked on that for me and came back with an increase of $20 a month for my son's car. I asked them, so he's insured right now? "Yes," they said. "He's good to go." My son goes to the DMV on a Saturday to register the car and they say we need evidence of your insurance, have them fax it over. I called, and of course, got the call center (because nobody has insurance issues on a Saturday and never needs anyone to be in the local office who are making money on your policy...) anyway, the call center said..... not only was my son NOT on the policy, neither was his car, and there was NO record of either phone call that I'd made, one to find out why he was left off, and two, to add the new car. So my son is at the DMV, in the line, getting closer to the front and I'm having to go all over my son's details and the car details AGAIN so this guy in the call center can add him. AND, he's been driving this car for two weeks and he wasn't insured!! This is a staggering lack of decent process and customer care that left us vulnerable and with no cover for my son or anyone he might have hit. So guess who's looking for a new insurance company now? ............................... Update!!! So the initial agent we spoke to this morning, who categorically told me he had faxed the form to the DMV, did not! So yet another long call to another State Farm agent and then a three way call with the DMV to get my son on his way. He was at the DMV at 7:30 and he's just got done at noon. Just the most appalling customer service of any company I've ever dealt with - ever. On this one, I'd give minus five stars if I could........................... Final Update - they sent my renewal and my monthly bill DOUBLED. From $355 to $669. Needless to say, we're back with Geico.

I recently moved from CA to Las Vegas, NV. I came across Sed Poche State Farm and I am very happy I did. Sed, and his staff, provided a seamless transition from start to finish and were able to answer any questions I had quickly and efficiently. I will definitely be recommending Sed Poche to my colleagues and friends!

Still one star, as I found most of his systems weren't very profitable, as least in while I practiced/tested.  He did have a fine grasp on the theory of craps and seemed to enjoy the game.

Was in contact with fellow Yelper Jerry via PMs and I learned that Leonard Benson passed away on August 5, 2013.  Since it's really not polite to speak ill of the deceased, I'm removing his company from my Sh*t Listed list, as it folded and he cashed out at the great big cage in the sky (or somewhere else, who knows, right?).

Received another unsolicited telemarketing call from this company today.  They have been making their unprofessional sales calls for many years now, and the reverse lookup of their phone number is indicative of their ongoing attempts to badger the good people of Phoenix.  Their newest addition of "mortgage protection" is another B-grade product with little benefit to homeowners according to my review.

The folks at Design Benefits seem to not be getting the message about the Do Not Call list, and I, for one, find it frustrating they continue to be a black mark on the insurance industry here in Arizona because of their tactics.  I have to wonder if they are still part of Southwest Resources (Bob Harden's group) that also used to pull the exact same diabolical tricks, as these two companies were once aligned.

Typical behavior in a call from them is to not reply once you've answered (like a robodialer would do), breathe heavily or mumble, pitch health insurance if you're the business owner, or ask for the names of people in the company in an attempt to solicit again by phone or mail.  Reporting them to the Arizona Department of Insurance seems to have no effect.

If you happen to receive an unsolicited call from them (480-612-0250), I recommend you follow these steps:

1.  Ensure your employer or company doesn't use them for their benefits management.  If they do, then Design Benefits can call you UNTIL you ask them to stop.

2.  If you are certain you're not utilizing their services in any way when they call, demand that you be removed from their list and that they confirm it has been done.  Register your telephone number under the DoNotCall.gov website if you haven't already done so.

3.  If they call again, remind them you're on the DNC list (if you're on it) and/or have requested they stop calling.  Further calls subject them to fines or other disciplinary action.

You are allowed to file a legal claim against them if they continue from that point. Search the web on how to do so.

If you're seeking insurance of any kind, I recommend going somewhere else.

This company continues to make unsolicited calls to companies.  They never leave a message, just hang up.  Regardless of how many times you ask them to stop calling, the calls continue.   Absolutely horrible company!

I always check backgrounds/associations with companies/individuals I do business with.  In the case with ATAS and Leo Yoffe, I would definitely stay away from doing business with him.  His association with Global Pharmedica and other information discovered makes me look elsewhere.  Move on to someone else.

Great bail bond service! The only way I was able to get out of jail was because Bad Girl Bail Bonds took me on as a client.
