at citibank. had a cd there for 5 years. earned about $6- $7 a year. bad investment choice on my part. pretty cheezy on their part. the day i matured i decided to pull it and invest elsewhere. they said they could not give me my money but the could give me a cashiers check and i could come back in a few days to cash it o.O . yea...it sounds retarded. it gets better though. 3 days later. here at the bank again trying to cash the check....their check...my money..real cash they have had for 5 years. waiting now for 45 min for them to verify THEIR check lol.  Am i missing something or does this sound like incompetent bs? hmm maybe they dont know what they are doing..or maybe they dont have the money...hope they are not running out of money...that would suck for people...or maybe they just want to create such a hassle that they think i will juat go away and they can keep my money?

Best return i have ever gotten!  Honest and straight forward. Highly recomended! They take the time to explain why certain things have be done a certain way and i didnt feel like i was just another number. Great!

Mecham and Dicus has done my taxes for about 4 years now.  Super professional and always done in a timely manner.  I've always got a quick return. I can't say enough good things about them.  You won't be disappointed!

Went in today to meet an individual who banks with them to get an auto loan for my vehicle. Staff seemed to be pretty nice and courteous and got it done in a reasonable amount of time. I walked out of there with the payoff amount of my vehicle and my buddy left with my keys in his hand. Quick. Simple. Painless.

Went there to get an add on to an existing loan- Harry took care of me right away with the preliminary information and then sent me to the lobby to wait. I did not have to wait long before Brian came out and called me into his office- VERY EFFICIENT- VERY FRIENDLY-VERY PERSONABLE.  Normally I call and do loans and business over the phone but these 2 guys make me WANT to drive the 30 min to this location.  Hard to find friendly help these days and these guys excited PERFECTLY- well done !

I have been banking with Federal for over 20 years. The previous location (off Westinghouse) closed and I was excited for this new location which is closer to work. I went in to set up online banking and the lady in the office was SUPER helpful. Unfortunately, on my most recent visit, I was disappointed to see that some of the DMV-like surly attitude that I used to experience at the old location still exists. Some of the tellers (this time was the drive-through) just don't seem friendly or even happy to see customers. A smile, a "Hello, how are you today?" or even a "Thank you. Have a nice day." seem to be too much effort. During my last visit, they weren't even busy. I understand their jobs might be stressful, but this is a customer service business. 

Services/rates offered are good. People skills are hit or miss. The more "experienced" ladies especially could use a refresher course in customer service with a smile.

Brittny became my agent in 2013. I had my car insurance, home owners insurance and bike insurance through her. Over the years, my policies kept going up. I reached out to her each time and she told me I had all the qualifying discounts. In December 2015, I purchased a new car. Brittny initially quoted me for a $15 increase each month, but after providing VIN number, etc. my policy went up almost $30! I emailed her several times and she basically told me there's nothing she could do to lower my monthly cost unless I signed up for life insurance. I got insurance quotes from 5 other companies.....FIVE! And guess what? All 5 agents told me she was over insuring me and "ripping me off." So now that my car insurance is only $90 a month (you do the math! $40 in savings each month X 12 is $480 plus the home owners savings) and my home owners insurance went down $350 a year, I realized that Brittny at Allstate really got me these last couple years and that really irks my nerves. I give her 3 stars because she was always very nice...up until I emailed her to give her the chance to review my policy before switching companies...then she just stopped replying to my emails and they were very short over the phone when I called in. I will not be coming back to Allstate that's for sure.
Brittny has been our agent since 2007. She is the best agent we've ever had. She's always there to answer questions and take care of your needs. I recommend her to everyone I know.

Being a teenage girl with an accident on record can make it hard to find good rates. I shopped around for weeks to find the best insurance rates I could for my car. when I went to allstate, the rep, jordan was able to beat all the prices I had and I hadn't even told him that I had been shopping around! Truly the best rates and the most personable customer service. I recommend them to everyone!

I can't speak to the quality of this location in general; but I was compelled to write this review after an interaction with one staff member two weekends ago.

Let me preface this story with a few facts: Boyfriend and I are money idiots.  But we love each other and we want to have enough money one day to buy some land and love each other far, far away from other people.  So, after a few months of balking at the idea of going to a bank, where they do bad things like ask me for money every damn month and charge me for the privilege of keeping my meager amount of cash in their greedy, clutching hands, I gave up.  We put on our least-ratty pairs of Chucks and wandered over to Wells Fargo to talk with someone about what a mortgage actually is and if we'll ever qualify for one.

Thank the sweet baby jesus we got Shondra.  Wonderful, knowledgeable, kind, incredibly helpful and patient and funny and did I mention kind already Shondra.  She took a full two hours walking us through extremely basic concepts and showing us how we could track our savings progress through the WF website... and then, just when she thought she was done with us, Boyfriend remembered he'd been having weird transactions for, um, the past fifteen months on his monthly statements (like I said, we're money idiots).  So Shondra, without batting an eye, took care of them.  All six of them.  She got a cool $200 back into his account immediately, then gave him an internal WF number so that he could track his statements even further back in time and get that cash back, too.  

I should also mention that through all of these shenanigans, Shondra maintained the perfect blend of professionalism and understanding.  When she wasn't helping us deal with money issues, she animated recounted stories of Flagstaff, the Four Corners, and living off the land- issues very near and dear to my hippie-dippie little heart.  Boyfriend and I left Wells Fargo calm, happy and with the knowledge and understanding to start saving up for our dream cabin.  Which, incidentally, is in the Four Corners.  Thank you Shondra, I actually can't wait to go back!

The customer service at Wells Fargo continues to amaze me. This is the first time that I visited this branch. I usually go to the WF down the road, but ended up here today to have a cashiers check made. 

Immediately upon entering, I received a "welcome to Wells Fargo" greeting by a smiling, friendly employee. I was asked if I need help from a banker.  

Went to the window where I was greeted by another smiling face. The teller was friendly, helpful and efficient. 

I've completely converted from the credit union to WF for my banking needs. 

The customer service can't be beat!

All I can say is WOW!!! Great service. This guy is a veteran when it comes to the lending industry and he knows how to navigate the complexities of mortgage lending guidelines. He has a fantastic team that ensures no mistakes are made and therefore, no surprises at the closing table. Our loan was a bit tricky for a number of reasons but Phil suggested a perfect fit for our budget & needs and then followed through with the underwriting staff to make sure that what he promised- he delivered. In our case, our Realtor was on vacation so he made it a point to be there with us at signing to ensure all documentation was accurate. If you are looking for the best, look no further.

I hate having to go into the bank to stand in line to do my banking. I am one of those always on the go, busy, busy, busy single moms with very little time to spare. And I don't like spending what little time I do have waiting at the bank. 

Thankfully there is this lovely branch right across the street from my building. No need to park. No need to come in during busy times. I come in mid morning and am helped right away. I mean five minutes in and out. Normally I would be disappointed but it's okay when we're talking about banks. ;) 

The staff is always super friendly and always complimentary. It's not like I am going to close my account if they didn't like my hair or earrings but its always nice to have a bit of conversation with the staff while my transactions are processing. 

Anyways, banking here has always been a joy. Thanks BofA. XOXO

B of A...what can I say? Let's start with parking. Teeny, tiny, postage stamp sized lot. Sometimes there's a dude there helping folks get in and out. Sometimes not. I think I see him hanging in his Dodge K car with the A/C cranked listening to The Moody Blues. Who can blame him in this horrific heat. Actual bank is on first floor of high rise on Central. They just remodeled the lobby and frankly I don't see  much of a difference. Money would have been better spent on giving raises to underpaid employees or by putting some in my meager savings account. But four stars for the staff. Shout out to Daniel especially. He always takes care of me in the merchant line. I love when I get the stink eye from some unhappy office cubicle clone who's waiting in the peon, er um, I mean regular banking line, and I get immediate help in the merchant line. I know, it's a meaningless and shallow point in my day...what can I say? B of A? Bank of Agony? Bank of A Long Ass Wait? I say B of A...Bank of America! Hand on heart, standing tall....over and out yelpers!

Martie Troisi is a personal friend, client and Insurance Agent. She's a wonderful person to know as a friend and professionally strives to inform her clients with the best information possible. Marie's extremely knowledgeable and her ability to convey information to her clients is always clear and easily understood. A true professional!
It was/is wonderful working with Martie.  She is very helpful and quick to respond to any of our questions.  Would highly recommend her to friends and family.

Very bad customer service. I came in at 4:30 and waited and waited for anyone to address me. Finally at 5:01 they asked what I needed. I told them what I needed and they told me, "That is really fast and will take no time at all, but we're closed now, so you need to come back tomorrow." I wish someone would have told me that they didn't have time today before I waited a half hour....

Went into this particular branch for the first time, mostly because of the convenience, being located near the on/off ramps to the Loop 101. Initially found the atmosphere pleasant due to overall cleanliness and presentation but, then I decided to interact with the employees there. The teller that helped me came off as rude, abrasive and ignorant of the idea that their job is to relay a good customer service experience while helping me with my request.  Needless to say I won't be coming back here anytime soon and was happy when my business had concluded, left more annoyed than anything else.

I really enjoy this location because the lobby is always clean, ready for business, and full of smiling employees, which is a combination rarely found anymore. Also, they do currency exchanges without any hassle or runaround, which again, is something that is rare in modern banking.
Has been our bank branch for 20 years. Hard to get to see a personal banker so we use the B of A up the street in Raintree and 101.

If i could give negative 5 stars, I would.

Here's what I experienced in a year and a half with this "bank":

- They dinged my credit score when I opened my account, not once, but twice. How, you ask? The initial "credit union" check, and then I declined to apply for their credit card, yet a week later got a "pre-approval" in the mail, which I ignored, and when I checked my credit there was an inquiry for "applying for the card". What?!

- On attempting to cash in some savings bonds, the teller took 20 minutes (!!!) and nearly deposited it in the wrong account. It was lucky she tried to address me as "Stephanie" or else somebody else would have gotten my money. How exactly do you screw that up when you have both my debit card and drivers license there?

Stone-age technology:
- Their website is ALWAYS down. My God. At least 3x a week.
- Their email does not work. I tried to close my accounts (and I refuse to do it in person or online, because I don't want to listen to their spiel to get me to keep it open) and the email bounced back. Professional, eh?
- You can't do ANYTHING over the phone, so when the website is down, either drive to a branch or you're screwed. I was in Vegas, away from a computer, and had to call and give my login info to a friend to transfer money to my checking account. This is ridiculous.

And the piece de resistance, the re-arranging of transactions. I log in one day, expecting to have one NSF fee from an emergency purchase, and see my account is negative nearly $300. WHAT?  
These bastards had 1) hit me with an NSF fee when I was $61 positive, then 2) re-arranged several days worth of transactions so the largest hit first, causing another NSF fee (which only happened because of the missing $35 from their first false NSF fee!), and then the whole thing just cascaded into oblivion. 

I am so beyond pissed at Desert Schools. I refuse to deal with them anymore. These s***heads can keep calling/mailing every day, turn me into collections, whatever, but I just walked away and am not paying for any of their bullshit charges.

I switched over to Wells Fargo (who does NOT rearrange transactions, and all pending transactions show up immediately online) and am much happier.

Nice enough staff but I went out of my way to buy some coins but they refused as I don't have an account.  If I was trying use a card or turning in coins is understand. Cash for coin though?  I find that last part foolish and aggravating.

Good and bad. 

Bad for standard business practice of closing books at 4:00 pm even Fridays when other banks are normally 5:00pm and even later on Fridays. 

Good because I just missed the cutoff by 5 mins and they were nice enough to post same day anyway.  But only can rate 2 stars because I had to get a little firm in asking them to do it and I did have to point out that I had been waiting for over 10 mins while I was also the only one in line at the drive through.   

I was depositing a check for someone else. I'm glad I bank elsewhere.

Awesome.  Came here to get some money out and the machine wouldn't take my card.  Well, it went partway in.  I've heard on the news about scams where people put a machine in there and steal your card number.  Hope I don't lose all my money.  Gee, thanks US Bank.  So I had to go to the grocery store to get cash.  Time to switch banks.... AGAIN.

I love love love this bank. They are super friendly to me and my family. We come in once a week as regulars and it's always an in and out along with great costumer service. I've had bad experience at other banks and always felt they were setting me up for failure always felt cheated. fees every time for everything.I've been with us bank for 4 years now and I seriously can't say enough.

I've banked here for a long time and am not changing.  But I do find it very annoying when there are 5 of us waiting and only one teller open while 3-4 others are doing whatever they do in back. Very annoying
George goes out of his way to make insurance simple and the process easy.  Best agent I've had!
These guys are AMAZING!!! I usually work with Rebecca and she is just awesome! We have about 10 commercial roadside plans with them and Rebecca is always wonderful when assisting us!

I have known Mark for quite a few years and I can promise he is a wonderful person to do business with! He's all about the relationships, which is why I think we are still working together - we always stay in touch. I have never had any other insurance other than State Farm, and they have always come through for me - even in a situation where one of my employees had accidentally transferred a policy to a new home instead of adding it, since I had both houses - still covered! They have always been there for me. Give Mark a call - great guy!

I called this agent to try and switch over to his office from my current agent over a week ago.  I spoke to someone in his office who said they would be calling me back the same day to help me make the switch.  I feel thankful that they haven't called me back since it shows that they really aren't about taking care of the client.  I would think that new business would be a top priority of an insurance agent, but he must being soooo well that he doesn't have the time to take on new ones.  Thanks you for showing your true colors right from the beginning.  It's shameful that I will probably have to change to a new company since State Farm agents don't take care of the clients that they currently have.

I have been working with Mark, Eric, and Esmeralda for about two years now. 
They have always been so generous and friendly everytime I call to make a payment, have a question, or to change my policy! 
I've never had such a great experience with an insurance company before. 
I recommend them to anybody looking for a new agent or branch.

The manager is rude and seems to stereotype or look down on people. I worked in a bank before with women managers who had big power trips/egos so they are naturally snotty. I know her type and would hate to be her employee. The customer service and care is lacking. Also, the way they posts items is not consistent. It lacks as well because I am checking my account now and I have a print screen of how truly inaccurate it is especially because it says I have way more than what I know is there. However, they will look at you crazy and treat you badly because of their horrible system. I now print screen for my protection of what my account looks like at real time to prove its inaccuracies because it will look normal later as if it never happened. So if you don't have proof of their inaccuracies they treat you like you're insane lol. Ditching US Bank especially this branch within the next couple of months and I am searching for a better bank or credit union. Good luck with them!

US Bank is a conservative bank who tries to compete against the "too big to fail" banks, and has won my business. After speaking with Jennifer Craft and her Manager named Ayesha at this branch, I decided to move my accounts to US Bank. There are two reasons why I am abandoning my current banking relationship of 14 years: 

1) "Too Big To Fail" means "Too Big To Compete"
     My old bank is a huge bureaucracy of left hands not talking to right hands, intentional and willful slowness to benefit no one, and an employee culture of elitism. 
2) The three rules of banking never applied: Convenience, Cost, and Care.
    My old bank, although with tons of branches spread out everywhere, was never convenient. The costs associated with the accounts were exorbitant and they raised my credit card interest rate to 38% "just because". And nobody new my name after years of banking at the same branch. WTH? Could you "pretend" to care?

At US Bank (particularly this branch), Jennifer Craft took the time to get to know me and what products and services could be beneficial to me. Jennifer Craft went the extra "mile and a half" (while Ayesha fielded all the other customers waiting in line) to make sure I had everything I needed. If patience is a virtue and knowledge is power, Jennifer Craft is both virtuous and powerful.

Big plus for US Bank: Current and former United States military service members receive "Platinum Checking" at no charge.

Big pluses for this branch: Care with a capital "C". Open seven days a week. Get it? A bank open on Sunday! Convenient location.

Big negative for (Gank of America): A mortgage department not motivated to do real work means the last straw on an overly burdened camel. In the words of Big Dan Teague (John Goodman) "See you in the funny papers, boys!"

Alexie or Alexis im not sure how to spell her name or im just bad at spelling and the women with the big beautiful eyes was very helpful and friendly. Enjoyed getting to know them and talk to them while im doing my banking business. Recommend this location if your close by the neighborhood !

We joined Heartland Credit Union two years ago after dealing with banks for too many years. The associates at Heartland are always friendly and very helpful. Their online banking is super easy to use. They do great things for the local community too. I highly recommend banking here. We moved recently and we were really sad to leave Heartland CU.

I've been a member of Heartland Credit Union for about 34 years.  Service with a smile has always been the case, and I'm never just a customer.  I've used three different locations of the credit union, this one, the one at West Washington and the one on Williamson Street.  I will say that I've only had one experience in those many years that wasn't up to snuff, and that's a teller who doesn't speak good enough English.  If your money is in a bank, you're really missing out on the credit union MEMBERSHIP experience.

Some cretin at a store swiped my credit card information while ringing me up and then charged 3,000 bucks worth of stuff on my Keybank debit card.  I was in Florida at the time on a long term assignment, hundreds of miles from a Keybank.  I discovered the fraudulent charges when I checked my balance just before leaving on a road trip.  I called the customer service number and within a few hours all my money was back in my account.  They canceled my number and sent me an all new card by FedEx which arrived the next day at my destination. They made the whole recovery process so easy.  Miss this bank, big time.

Once upon a time Keybank was great, but over the past two years or so I've been pretty disappointed with Keybank.  I would suggest finding another bank.

Some disappointments about my experience with Keybank: (1) Their customer service phone number is only open 8 hrs/day, 5 days/week.  (2) They play silly games with their savings accounts, where after half a year or so they significantly lower the interest rate with no warning, while creating some other brand of savings account with a significantly better interest rate for new customers.  (So they care more about attracting new customers than about treating loyal customers well.)  (3) They make money off of fees, so be pretty careful about that.  (4) Keybank doesn't support ACH transfers unless you have online banking.  (5) Keybank handle renewals of CDs in an annoying way.  If you want to renew your CD, you have to call up in this narrow window right when or shortly after it expires and ask them to do so.  If you call up several weeks in advance -- say, because you're going to be travelling -- to try to set up how the CD will be handled when it reaches its maturation date, they will ignore you and tell you to call back.  If you can't conveniently call back in that short time window, sorry, sucks to be you; they don't care.

I pay for Medicare part D and they are making me wait until I have only one pill left before they will allow me to get a prescription refill on my heart medication.  An hour on the phone to their customer service got me nothing but an experience in total lack of empathy.

TD's media team wants us to believe they're the best out there for Canada.  They say that banking can be comfortable (have you gone through the mortgage process?!?) and that they're voted #1 customer service for years. Is that true?  Actually, to some degree it is.  There's 3 TD banks conveniently close to my work and with how they're run, you'd think they actually did their homework to figure out clientele volume!

This bank in particular is well staffed at the teller counter.  I usually see at least 3 working constantly during lunch and I've even seen them pull another person in for 4 active stations when it gets a bit busy.  The line ups are never longer than 2 people.  The ATMs are my choice ... it's fast and I'm on there to get cash on the odd occasion.  I've never had to line up as there is more than one here and most people these days know how to use an ATM thankfully.

The Financial Service Reps are all helpful and they're willing to answer questions.  It's really to book an appointment here if you want to discuss something.  There are varying degrees of expertise so make sure you specifiy what you want done ahead of time!  Not all of them can do stocks, mutual funds, or big mortgage applications.  

I've never had an issue with this particular bank and everyone is always pleasant.  So maybe banking can be this comfortable?

I would like to thank Ms. Marika Jacyla for excellent service. She is caring, helpful, efficient and I have no words to describe her positive attitudes towards clients. I am a new client and I want to express my gratitude for her  efficient help, knowledge and encouragement . Thank You from a bottom of my heart. You represent your organization with pride and great experience.
 It is a great pleasure to join Buduchnist Credit Union.

You don't have to be Ukrainian to use Buduchnist, but it helps. (Especially since, as far as I can tell, the tellers consist entirely of Ukrainian women, and some can be a bit surly.) They support local Ukrainian organizations and schools, incidentally.

While the credit union does most of the stuff you can get at a bank, you'll have to pay a service fee to use their ATM card elsewhere, since there aren't multiple branches around town.

They seem to get bigger and bigger, too: now Buduchnist's financial services are swallowing up the old West Arka next door. Unlike the big banks, their growth comes back to the members, even if the folksy, grassroots feeling is lost in the process.

After getting transferred all around the county offices, city offices, recorder's office, and other title companies, I finally gave First American a call for a title search and they promptly gave me the information that I needed! Thank you especially to Kariann who was the person I worked with. Her friendliness and efficiency was a needed respite after hours of trying to get what I needed!
I have worked with Tammy Stalker at this office and she did a fantastic job. Also love Matt Canady.  First rate office!

Overall, Wells Fargo is a solid bank. This review is meant to illustrate this specific bank location's accountability, which I found to be excellent. 

 Today (10 Dec), I came in ready to give some aggressive feedback to this bank after being $5 negative in my bank account earlier this week. The banker (through bank-teller Nadia) told me that if I make a $10 deposit to cover the  -$5 I would not be charged overdraft. 

 I didn't believe it. Far too many experiences have shown me I would have to cover the $12.5 overdraft protection fee so it doesn't turn into an additional $35 overdraft fee. I asked for it in writing and he said to just come back if I'm charged and he will reverse it. The next day when I was charged the overdraft fee, a banker closer to my area of town told me there was 0% possibility management would reverse the fee. At this point I'm thinking the man who gave me his word had cost me $35. 

 Today, I stopped by the branch and talked to Nadia again and the manager learned the situation. She immediately reversed the fee because the banker had given me his word. This is great news, and I'm happier to be with this bank because this branch honored their word.

Upgrade on a recent post Wells Fargo holding my money hostage because I lost my card very next day went to the bank I usually use on West Lake Mead walked in what did they do one second came back handing me in cash all my money turn around has to tell her why I had such a trouble at this bank have no idea you have three accounts with us and again one star that branch does not deserve again they need 0

I have been using Mike Law for over 10 years for my corporate and personal taxes.  Before I found Law & Reed, I had another CPA that made many mistakes that Mike Law fixed.  He explains everything to me and makes everything very clear as far as what I need to do and what he is going to do.  I am always impressed with this knowledge of corporate and personal taxes.  I highly recommend Law & Reed.

Law & Reed have been doing our accounting for our small business , an personal income taxes for 6 years.  We are very satisfied with the service they provide.  Michael Law is very helpful with all the new laws, an very knowledgeable. I would recommend their services to anyone.

I been with State Farm since 1998. I move a lot so I dealt with many agents throughout my experience with State Farm. One agent that stood out inparticular is Ivan over at Eric James's office. He has always been very knowledgeable at all occasions and answered all my questions, let me say he is a tremendous help! The reason I stick with the company is because of agents like him. State Farm let me tell you Ivan is a great asset to your company.

When I signed up for insurance with Ivan, he seemed very young and unprofessional, that was uncomfortable for me especially when it comes to important things like insurances. He tried to make the car/home payments on the same day but I said so I am paying extra days for nothing? he said yeah we can do that and kind of smirked about it. So of course I made it different days money ain't easy and that was very weird. Other than that he also made some similar odd comments that I don't recall since it's been awhile.

After year 1 I didn't get the new insurance card in the mail, I actually found out 2,3 months later so I was carrying expired policy. And they didn't mail me the new card for 2,3 months(until I saw my expired card in my wallet). I went online and requested the new card, after 5 business days I still didn't get it and also got a voice mail from a lady asking if I got the card. So I ask for the card again and got it like 7 business days later. 7.

Tried to email and ask question on the statefarm site but they didn't' know who I am, I logged on I would think it will have my info when emailing (not secure message) but I guess not and it's the website's crappy design.(but they can look me up using the email) 

Emailed Eric James to see how do I cancel the policies, he said just tell him over the email. 5 Days later I still got charged, called and Eric wasn't there, Vanessa answered and said if I want to cancel I HAVE to do it by phone, and they need a date. In the email with Eric I said cancel it until end of this billing cycle since I already paid, just don't renew it he said fine. But on the phone it's a total different story I have to cancel by phone and they need an exact date. You see how much difficulties and headache that I had with them? and I never filed a claim, can't believe how difficult it would be to file a claim so I switched insurance of course.

Tried to look up a complaint line on statefarm site but can't find it, did a comment/suggestion thing for all of above. wonder if they even read it anyways if I can rate 0 star I would, definitely won't recommend them.

update: Nov 9th I emailed Eric to cancel and not renew my policies and he acknowledged in email. Nov 17th I still got charged for a new month, next day I called Vanessa for a refund and still didn't get it as of today Dec 3rd. Also another policy was charged for a new month on Dec 1st. It's just problems after problems.

Needed some insurance for the purchase of a second home..  Anthony in this office did a great job getting me a quote and putting the package together when we closed.  Timely response and good service.  Only 4 stars because I don't want them to get too cocky. :)  Highly recommended!

First off, I've been with this agency for a few years and every time i've need help they have always done right by me. I'm currently looking to add an additional vehicle to my policy so I contacted the agency and was help out by Luz Tolentino. Every question i had for her she had a response almost instantly, her extensive knowledge and great personality will definitely have me referring people to her and keep me around for a while.

I have been with Eric James for many years.  The office personnel is the main reason why I have and will be loyal to him and State Farm Insurance Company.  They take care of all of my personal and business insurance needs with urgency, even when I make last minutes changes to policies.  Luz has been my go to person.  She is on top of it and I truly appreciate all the work she does for me.  You could not ask for a better group of people and company to work with.

I have been with Eric James With State Farm
Since I moved to Las Vegas as well as my mom. We have two cars Insured with him and our home. Since about 1997. We were with State Farm in our previous state as well. We have never had a car accident, speeding ticket or home problem and we always pay our bills. But as of a week ago my shower tiles started bulging out of the wall, never seen that before so I called a bathroom remodel place and figured it's time to remodel bathroom. Home was built in 1997. They came and inspected and said a pipe was broken behind the wall causing this to happen which may mean mold as well and it's draining under the tub as well. Very costly. So they said call your home insurance and this is something they should fix. We called and State Farm sent out a man who told us no they won't help us only if there was water spraying everywhere! And this may have been going on for awhile and they only handle things right when it happens. Please tell me how I was supposed to know a pipe was broken behind a wall? Do I have my ear against the wall when I shower? Why would I even think that? When I saw tiles bulging (which as of today have fallen out of the wall see photo) i called immediately for fear of getting water in the cracks. This is unacceptable and I am just shocked. Years of paying and no help from State Farm or Eric James. He even refused to take our call or even call us back. It's is just me and my old mom and we now have to live in this moldy smell thanks to no help from State Farm. Never use this company or Eric James. They have disappointed us and now we will cancel our policies and go elsewhere to people who care.

I rarely write reviews on Yelp, but since they asked me 3 times while I was there to write one, I guess I will.
First of all I have been a State Farm customer for 15 years and across 4 different states. The service, claim system, and reps have always been stellar, until now.
I moved from New York to Las Vegas and needed to update my insurance. This location was chosen at random as it was closest to my house. I called and told them what I needed and that I would be down in half an hour. When I got there, they had no idea who I was even though they had written up my estimate.
The price for my insurance went up from $220 per  month to $450 per month for less coverage than I had in New York. They gave me a long list of reasons for the increase;
Nevada is 2nd most expensive in country
People sue a lot
24 hour liquor access
etc.
The change in cost was significant enough, and the personal level of service at the epr bad enough, that I called Geico. My insurance changed from $220 per month in New York to $240 per month in Nevada with lower deductibles than I was going to get from State Farm.
Another important note;
Geico is available 24 hours a day 7 days a week. I can not do business with State Farm on Weekends or after banker's hours because everything must go through the rep and they are not available.
And now I just found out they are still charging my credit card 2 weeks after cancellation. It's Saturday so I have to wait til monday to try to straighten it out.
45 minutes with geico cut my insurance from $5400 per year to $2880. I can do business any time. Hopefully I won't get charged for service I have cancelled. You do the math.
If I could give it no stars I would. No service, not friendly. I would recomend to stay far far away.
It's a credit union. What more can I say? Open an account for the benefits and diversify your funds. Convenient and quiet location in downtown PHX.

Hey CIBC! Here's a tip! 

Instead of making people wait in line for a teller, have your "greeter" serve people instead of standing around guarding the stale coffee. :S
I'm moving my mortgage away from CIBC. Their customer service is awful. They don't even answer their phone at 10:30 on a Friday morning.

Wir hatten vor gut einem Jahr ein Sofa sowie einen Sessel bei BoConcept in Stuttgart gekauft. Nach nicht einmal 7 Monaten mussten wir feststellen, daß der Stoff an diversen Stellen extrem ausgeblichen ist.
Daraufhin haben wir beide Produkte im Stuttgarter BoConcept Laden reklamiert. Es ging hin und her, jedoch immer wieder mit der selben Aussage, der Hersteller lehnt die Reklamation ab. Obwohl dem Hersteller das Problem mit diesem Stoff bekannt ist. 
Für Rückmeldungen musste man immer mehrfach nachfragen, bis endlich eine Antwort zubekommen war.


 Fazit:
Im Verkauf sehr freundlich und zuvorkommend. Nach Kaufabschluss wird jedoch die Kundenzufriedenheit bei dieser Marke mit den Füßen getreten. Wenn ich mangelhafte Produkte auf den Markt bringe, dann muss ich auch für die Konsequenzen gerade stehen. Das ist hier eindeutig nicht der Fall.
Von daher, nie wieder BoConcept, denn schlechte Qualität bekomme ich auch bei anderen Möbelhäusern zu wesentlich besseren Preisen.
Schöne möbel viel auswahl es lohnt sich hın Und wieder reinzuschauen

By far the best Insurance Co I have had. Especially with my driving record. My old insurance company USAA dropped me after getting one too many speeding tickets and sent me packing to Progressive. At first I was offended and a little hurt but that was the best thing that has happened. They are GREAT... The customer service the claims reps everything. They care and act like they mean it when they ask how you are doing. I would recommend this Insurance Co to anyone that drives. A+ Service... It doesn't get any better than that :)

My daughter has Progressive Insurance. Someone called her recently to offer her roadside assistance. She already had AAA but the offer made it sound like she would have increased benefits and advantages over  AAA. Today she had an opportunity to test that claim. Her key wouldn't turn in her ignition. She called Progressive and it became clear the weekend customer service people were not exactly the A team. 
     Her car was stuck in a parking garage of a shopping mall. It was a frigid 28 degrees that day. She made her first call and after repeating her policy number, name and other requested information several times, the representative disconnected her. The second call was with a representative that claimed she couldn't even find my daughters account or policy so my daughter was unable to even get road assistance. That phone call lasted 48 minutes with no success. The 3rd phone call was almost as frustrating but eventually, after repeating every detail once again over and over, a tow truck was scheduled to come tow her. 
    I should add at this time she mentioned each time to each representative her car was parked in a parking garage. We waited 90 minutes only to find out the tow truck height was taller than the garage entrance clearance. Therefor the truck could not get in to tow her vehicle. When she made the fourth call to request another tow truck she was told progressives policy was that you could not make more than one service request in a 24 hour period. Thus, she was out of luck, cold, stranded, exhausted and frustrated. But then she remembered she had AAA, made a call to them, and an hour later they were towing her car. Moral of the story is to not purchase Progressive Insurance roadside assistance because you will not get serviced by a competent individual, you will be treated poorly and disconnected, the representative will not listen to your situation  and ultimately you will not get the service you paid for. You will get a lot of corporate policy babble from uncaring representatives and left stranded and emotionally distraught. Stick with AAA.

Like what am I paying you for???? Apparently I'm stuck searching for a doctor who is "contracted" by Humana, not a doctor who "accepts" Humana!!!! So while I continue to find a doctor in my spare time, like when I'm not working to pay you, or laying in bed in pain cause I can't find a doctor.... These customer service reps will repeat themselves 100 times & resend me the magic "doctor list" that dissapears after 72 hrs in my inbox because of "updating" by Humana !!!!!  I really just want someone to tell me that the insurance I pay for every month is always accessible to me, no stipulations, no guide lines, no limitations. I mean come on, I'm young, I just want a damn MRI without paying $2300.00 because I went outside the network !!!!! By the way.... Smooth how your coverage price went up this new year from last year YET I STILL DONT HAVE A PRIMARY CARE PHYSICIAN!!!!

What a wonderful experience with Health Insurance AZ! Helped save me a great deal of money by explaining my options in detail and finding me the best policy for my needs and tailored to my situation. Best rates, service, and care in town!  If you want to save money and receive personalized attention give Steven and the gang a call! Its very reassuring to know my agents have my back.  Rebecca and Steven stood by me throughout the entire claims process and truly went above and beyond any agent I have ever previously had.  Highly recommended!

SIA handles my home, auto and health insurance. 

After years of being a happy customer, I had managed to convince the owner of the company I work for to switch all the business insurance over to SIA. The cashier completely ignored me while carrying out a conversation with another customer who had already paid. I waited patiently for a few minutes, looking around at the other non busy cashiers as they spoke to one another. I was hoping someone would offer to help me, or at least look at me and say something. No one did.. so I ended up walking away and checking myself out. So that's fine, he was just trying to do his job. I only wanted to buy ziplock baggies and dog food! I decided to call for they cook speak with their cashiers on being more friendly. It took me 10 minutes of waiting and the girl hung up on me, unable to find a manager. 
I called back and spoke to one in a few minutes, the store manager. He rushed me and interrupted me and basically hung up without me being able to let him know what happened. I've been a cashier before, even worked at a call center, so Im always extra friendly because I know how many rude people they must deal with. If only I could receive the same kindness from these employees.. I certainly won't be coming back.

Love shopping at this location! If you like customer service, this location will blow your expectations out of the water, by far the best customer service in town!! She had a great sense of humor, always has a smile on her face, happy go lucky and just made my whole experience. My man David helped me get a lower rate on my insurance. Not only that but every time I call they always greet me in a polite manner. Check them out!

Not only is the insurance fantastic, but everyone in the office is as well. I've been with State Farm for a number of years, but Leon and his staff make me feel like more than a customer. They know who I am when I call, take time out of their day to talk to me when I go in, and even if it's just a silly question, they treat it like it's important. If you need insurance, don't go to one of those fly by night joints. You get what you pay for. This place will treat you like family, without costing you an arm and a leg.

This branch is perfect for me. It's close to my place and the staff is always very professional and courteous every time I go in. Never had a problem with this branch yet. Plus it's close to I-15 so you can get around to other parts of the city fairly quickly. I recommend this branch.

This particular branch closes at 4.  Which is annoying.  Also the drive up wait time is 10-20 minutes no matter when you go.  It is in a more industrial part of town.  Also half the time the drive up is closed because of someone driving off with the canister!  You might ask why I don't take my lazy butt inside well it's in a dangerous part of town lots of questionable characters around the parking lot and or waiting for a bus..  I recommend this branch in emergency banking purposes only
Nice friendly and fast. Is not your usual bank behind big thick glass. You actually sit at a desk with the banker. Kind of a nice change.

I received a solicitation in the mail promising to insure my home for just $429. That's more than $200 less than what I currently pay. it sounded too good to be true and from a company I've never heard of before called Arizona Home Insurance Company (further investigation reveals the company is actually Western Mutual Insurance Group. Again, another company I've never heard of before. I was skeptical. I filled out the required information online on Friday night and a salesman called twice on Saturday, left one voicemail and then called again on Monday and left another voicemail. It said I could complete the application online, that I did not need to talk to anyone, but clicking the link resulted in taking me back to the original form I already filled out. When I called them, they said they needed to know the breed of my dog. I explained that I already put this information in the online form - a golden retriever mix. They said mixed with what? How should I know? What difference does it make? They said they WILL NOT insure any home that has a dog with Dalmatian, Chow, Pit Bull, and a couple of others I can't remember at the moment. Since I have no way of knowing what my dog is mixed with (and my dogs not telling me) they said I would be REQUIRED to send them a picture of my dog and an employee (not a canine biologist, or even a specially trained employee) but ANY employee (potentially) will examine the picture to determine if my dog is mixed with a 'dangerous' breed. Theoretically, I could send a picture of my dog under four different applications, and depending on the employee who evaluates the picture, I could be both approved and denied, depending subjective view of the employee.  I could also trim my dogs hair, or even Google 'Golden Retriever mix breed' and submit any photo that shows up. They have no way of knowing, but they are DISCRIMINATING against me because I refuse to send a picture of my assets to them prior to allowing them to bill me $429 (for the first year - it goes up after that, and it goes up again the year after that). Despite the fact I am more likely to bite someone in my home, I am more likely to set my house on fire (by mistake - my dog doesn't bite people or play with matches) and I own several guns, so if an intruder were to break into my home, the dog should be the least of their concerns. I am the dangerous one. I am the one seeking insurance. Not my dog. I have never filed an insurance claim (car or home) in my 25+ years of home ownership. I don't mind if they want DNA from my dog and want a canine biologist to determine his breed characteristics. I take issue with the inconsistent and non-scientific manner upon which they determine my eligibility. They don't ask if I smoke, they don't ask if I light candles, they don't ask if I work from home, they don't ask the age of the dog (an old arthritic dog that can't even get up without assistance is irrelevant to them.) This is judgmental discrimination placed solely in the hands of random, unqualified employees.

Furthermore, numerous scientific studies have attempted to identify the number of annual dog bites, the dogs most likely to bite, the people most likely to be bitten, and the circumstances under which bites are most likely to occur. Such studies have not reached a uniform consensus and have left us with more questions than answers. Even the studies that have attempted to report on breeds' proclivity to bite have cautioned that their research is incomplete and should not be used to justify breed discrimination by legislatures or insurers.
To date, no scientific study has been able to resolve what I term to be the problem of "numerators and denominators." A person wishing to determine whether certain breeds are more likely to bite than others must first determine the number of bites per breed (the numerator) and then compare that number to the total number of dogs of that breed in the general population (the denominator).

I've been shopping for new insurance on my rental property, a friend of my mine recommended Arizona Home Insurance so I gave them a try. Sure glad I did...I saved a total of $1,171 and that was with the old insurance company's $282 discount! Arizona Home Insurance even provided more coverage! Super simple and very efficient. This is the company you need to use ONLY if you want GREAT customer service, help on any and all tax issues/concerns, accuracy and most of all dependability. Damiana was wonderful, extremely knowledgeable, and we cannot recommend her enough.  We definitely will be a returning customer, and encourage everyone to become a new customer.

The owner Damiana crimi is a very rude person. She failed to keep an appointment with me and then had the nerve to keep texting me nasty messages. Her behavior is very unprofessional as she will harass you with threats to sue you for no reason. When I asked her to stop contacting me, she continued to harass me with emails and phone calls stating that she can do what she wants. Ive never had someone be so vengeful for no reason! It was her fault that she did not show up for our appointment, not mine. Do not deal with her or you willl end up getting harrassed! She even started slandering my company just to try to get her way. Very unprofessional, unpleasant and in my opinion she is crazy! BEWARE!!
I've been waiting half an hour to see the ONE personal banker working. There's a line of five people for the ONE teller working. Closing my account today.

I believe that this branch sits on the former Blockbuster Videos that closed down due to the company closing.  The branch is also next to a grocery store, so there's a lot of traffic.  It doesn't have a drive-thru window, and it has one ATM with card access after hours.  Lobby is pretty big and the last time I went there, there was a security guard standing on guard.  Overall service was okay.

It's easy to get a person on the phone at Midfirst, but it turns out that speaking to a human being doesn't mean you'll be treated like one.  I've had three significant experiences at this bank in which the customer service was so low, it wasn't even there.  

First, I spoke to someone about an auto refi who simply would not contact me back.  She would always tell me she was going to call, and then she wouldn't.  I ended up handling it with another bank.  She never followed up to find out.  I guess they're doing so well that they don't need any more ~extra business~!

Secondly, I ordered a new debit card because they were running some kind of promo for the design cards.  You know, picture of a flower, your dog, etc.  Card never came.  I called them a month later, they cancelled it and sent another.  Card never came.  I called them a month later, they had no idea what was going on, and I told them to forget it.  NO FANCY CARD FOR ME.

Third, there was a snafu between Midfirst and another bank that I use.  Midfirst was obviously completely to blame for the incident, but instead, the people I spoke with on the phone petulantly insisted that it was either my fault or the other bank's, but not theirs.  This went on for weeks, and ultimately, they did nothing to fix the problem or to retain my business.  Again, Midfirst must be doing REALLY WELL to just fling off customers like this.  It was such a minor issue that I could not believe not only the thinly veiled hostility from the people I spoke with, but that they would be so petty and ridiculous instead of just fixing the issue.  I'm not kidding when I say it could have been an easy fix.  I'm flexible!  But not when they are so openly unwilling to do the least thing to retain a customer.

Instead, they fought with me like a middle school frienemy, and I am closing my account in disgust.  Almost every interaction that I have had with this bank has been annoying, and unusually devoid of customer service.  They don't even pretend over at the old Camelback location.  

In closing, worthless quality of service, time wasted, total mistake, closing account, do not recommend.

Went to this bank and had excellent service. Lindsay helped us open an account and was very honest about everything. We also got $125 for opening one. The card for the account was ready that day. I felt very fortunate to go to a bank that was helpful and knew all their clients who walked in.

Not Good for business... First it took Kathleen a long time to open the account, Almost an hour and a half. When she finished, she asked me about my green card and she told me that i have to bring it to get a copy of it.. After three days she sent me a rude email saying ''bring the copy of your green card or come over and close your account if you don't want to comply'' !! Very Rude!!
The second bad experience was with Barbara, she is in charge of loans. After i submitted my application and emailed it to her, I asked her to let me know if she received it but i haven't heard from her, so i went to the bank and she was not there, so i gave it to one of the employees and asked hem to tell her to just email me  to make sure she received it.  I haven't heard from anyone for 12 days, then i went to the bank online  customer service to tell them about the issue.

Finally! She got back to me already 2 weeks,,,I answered the phone,,,No apology or explanation about why she did not get back to me,,, she said that my personal credit is not that great, and they cannot give me any business loan!!

So, it might be good for a personal account but NOT RECOMMENDED for business.  Go to a reliable bank that can help you with your business.
Samuel gave me excellent customer service!! He greeted me with a smile and asked how my day was going! I wouldn't go elsewhere!! Thank you Samuel for your wonderful customer service!!!!
Perfect coverage and the perfect price no where near the 1000 to 1500 wveryone else was getting me, plus they accept huskys!!
Great service and good people who care about the community. You won't get that from a big bank!

Wow. Just spent 20 minutes trying to activate a new BMO Harris business debit that arrived in the mail. The reason I chose M&I was because they weren't like the big bad banks (Bank of America, Chase, Wells Fargo). BMO Harris pretty much is the same as them, so I think not. I went to a credit union and I'm thrilled. 6% interest, online check deposit, no fees.

The workers here at this location are very knowledgeable very friendly and are always willing to help. I want to thank Linda M. for contacting me on this matter and for being so helpful.  She was very understanding and made everything a lot easier experience with this OneNevada branch. **I don't even know where to begin.  I normally don't name names, BUT I do believe this is a time to do so. Horrible! They can get to your money but you cant. The second chance account sucks! The customer service sucks, the employees seem angry all the time. I went to take money out of the atm and the atm ate my card for no reason ans would not give it back. Because it was Saturday all branches were closed so I had to wait untill monday. Without going into all my banking details. Alex S. Provides great customer service and as a man of his word. Help me through a process when the ATM ate my funds.

The ATM here is a true CU$ credit union alliance ATM. Surcharge free for all credit unions who are part of the alliance nationwide. I'm from PA and didn't pay a surcharge. Thank you, First Credit Union for honest and ethical business practices!

I had a great experience at Fast Credit Solutions working with Victoria in repairing my credit and being able to qualify for my house loan  . I appreciate all the hard work and the individualized attention I got . They were true professionals . Thank you for everything Fast Credit Solutions!

f you're looking for an agent, I would highly recommend Mark Brandon State Farm.

I am astonished at all the negative reviews for Busey Bank.  I do not "have tons of money" and I am not involved in the "exciting world of investiment banking" but have always been treated well at Busey.  All my banking is done there. I have been steered right in all my business -- refinancing, IRA, loans, whatever.  Was just in for retirement financial advice at the main branch and met with two very helpful, courteous, and personable young people (Daly and Adam) who set my mind at ease and followed up on our meeting.  For years I have worked with a delightful woman (Marsha) at The Pines who has been helpful, efficient, pleasant, and friendly.  It is always a pleasure to do business with her and she manages to remember my name no matter how long between contacts.  In the decades of business with Busey, I have never been treated with anything but professionalism and courtesy.  Online banking intimidated me but Busey's online banking has been easy to use. I would not hesitate to recommend Busey to any newcomer to C-U or to anyone looking to change their bank home.

Banks like Busey are exactly the ones the Obama administration wants to target for exorbitant fees. They called it the "Opt-in" program (without even defining what it was for customers!), as if it were a good thing, something new they had thought of for their precious clients. They did not inform anyone that this was required of them by the federal gov't. for their exorbitant check return fees. With this loophole (and duped customers) they managed to hang on to these scams, but the Obama admin. is on to them-they are following the 'law' but not the intent. Oh-we should thank them for their community work and being so nice to the few while ripping us off. Even their own employees cannot explain how it is that 'money' goes in an account, and yet NSF funds keep popping up! I am going elsewhere asap!!! I would give them -10 stars if I could!! Oh! and if your Busey card doesn't work, know that you won't get an answer until you ask! Several times their data center in Chicago has been broken into-which is why Michigan ave. shops refuse it-if you do get cash out of an ATM because of this-YOU have to call THEM to get the charges reversed.
really quiet and slow compared to other branches. People are helpful and resolve my card problem the same day and got me refunded

Brad Bengston at Busey Bank (the alliteration has been amusing) has been so helpful, informative, attentive, kind and he also took our present circumstance, future earnings and financial goals into mind and presented us with thorough financial breakdowns. 

In the end, we learned not to place too much value on your current bank (*cough* National City *cough*) as well.

So as an owner, I felt she was more than disconnected with her customers, but at least she has a friendly staff.  I've since changes coverage due to State Farm numerous rate increases, which I know she has no control of
I have been insured by this office for a few years now, and my agent is Christina. She is AWESOME! I am very happy with her and my rates!! I highly recommend going there and checking them out!

I truly enjoy going to Raja's agency to talk about my policies, I have rarely seen anyone so passionate about what they do. It's contagious and I absolutely recommend him to anyone looking for insurance. He truly cares about his clients and makes them feel important. Outstanding staff as well!

As the 48th State to join the Union, the landscape of this great land is varied and beautiful. I'm not sure if this location is the center of Arizona but I can say its capitol Phoenix, and its surrounding metropolitan area is spread out and each city has its own identity. 

The scenery is awe inspiring and at times almost surreal, from the out of the world scenes of monument valley in northeastern Arizona, the snowcapped San Francisco peaks of Flagstaff, the greatness of the Grand Canyon, the bright color hues of the red rocks of Sedona, the pines of the Mogollon Rim to the majesty of the vast Sonoran Desert, this state is a true artistic representation of how beautiful our land can be. 

Its capitol Phoenix is not too shabby either with its great freeway system, it's grid like planning, and picturesque views with the landmark Camelback Mountain in its center, the red lights of South Mountain and the largest public park to the iconic "A" Mountain of Arizona State University, the metro Phoenix is truly a Queen of the desert. 

Overall I'm proud to be a resident of this great state, and despite its current trials, and tribulations, the celebrations we do enjoy and love, I affectionately call myself a Zonie, and love my home. =)

I've been to Phoenix a half dozen times, though only twice since I've been Yelping. And last year, my road trip from Denver to Las Vegas brought me through Arizona with stops in Flagstaff and the Grand Canyon.

Yes, the Grand Canyon is absolutely incredible. A World Wonder in fact and you should not miss it. Please understand that it's not exactly close to Phoenix. It's at least a 7 hour round trip and understand that the Highway Patrol will pull you over for going faster than the posted 80 miles an hour speed limit.

But there's more to the state than the Canyon. The Lowell Observatory in Flagstaff was where Pluto was discovered. The Pima Boneyard is where old aircraft go when they're not needed any more. Monument Valley, on the Arizona/Utah border. The Hoover Dam, on the Arizona/Nevada border. Sedona, Havasu Falls, Petrified Forest. Antelope Canyon. And I've only been to *some* of those places. Writing this list has me thinking that I need to be back in Arizona. Soon.

Not a fan of this place. 

1. No freeways

2. Don't accept vertical id's

Won't be returning

I've been here my whole life, and I've never had an experience as great as this. From the one forest to the low hot desert Arizona is the place to be. I live in the Phoenix/Scottsdale area and love it, what I like to say is you get 3 months of hell and 6 months of heaven. But the shopping, food, culture, and beautiful desert landscaping really draw you in and make you feel relaxed, and special in your own way :-)

You Know You're In Arizona When ....



You think Taco Bell is the local phone company. 

You notice your car overheating before you drive it. 

You no longer associate bridges or rivers with water. 

You can hear the weather forecast of 115 degrees without flinching. 

You can be in the snow, then drive for an hour...and it will be over 100 degrees. 

You discover, in July it only takes two fingers to drive your car, because your steering wheel is so hot. 

The best parking is determined by shade.....not distance. 
 
You run your air conditioner in the middle of winter so you can use your fireplace. 

You realize that "Valley Fever" isn't a disco dance. 

You can make sun tea instantly. 

Hotter water comes from the cold water tap than the hot one. 

It's noon in July, kids are on summer vacation and yet all the streets are totally empty of both cars and people. 

You actually burn your hand opening the car door. 

Sunscreen is sold year round and kept right at the checkout counter. 

You put on fresh sunscreen just to go check the mail box. 

Some fools will market mini-misters for joggers and some other fools will actually buy them. Worse.....some fools actually try to jog. 

You can pronounce Saguaro, Tempe, San Xavier, Canyon de Chelly, Mogollon Rim, and Cholla. 

You can understand the reason for a town named "Why" 

You can fry an egg on the hood of a car in the morning. 

You know hot air balloons can't rise because the air temperature is hotter than the air inside the balloon. 

No one would dream of putting vinyl inside a car. 

You see two trees fighting over a dog. 

You can say "Hohokam" and people don't think you're laughing funny.

You see more irrigation water on the street than there is in the Salt River 

You have to go to a fake beach for some fake waves

You hear people say "but it's a dry heat!" 

You buy salsa by the gallon. 

Your Christmas decorations include sand and 100 paper bags. 

You think a red light is merely a suggestion. 

All of your out-of-state friends start to visit after October but clear out come the end of April. 

You think someone driving wearing oven mitts is clever. 

Most of the restaurants in town have the first name "El" or "Los." 

You think 60 tons of crushed red rock makes a beautiful yard. 

Your house is made of stucco and has a red clay tile roof. 

Vehicles with open windows have the right-of-way in the summer. 

Most homes have more firearms than people. 

Kids ask, "What's a mosquito?" 

People who have black cars or black upholstery in their car are automatically assumed to be from out of-state or nuts. 

You know better than to get into a car with leather seats if you're wearing shorts. 

If you haven't worked for Motorola at some time, you must be a newcomer. 

You can finish a Big Gulp in 10 minutes and go back for seconds. 

You know a swamp cooler is not a happy hour drink.

You actually get these jokes and pass them on to other friends from Arizona.

You take rain dances seriously. 

You've signed so many petitions to recall governors you can't remember the name of the incumbent.

When a rainy day puts you in a good mood. 

When you drive two miles around a parking lot looking for a shady place - even in the dead of winter. 

You feed your chickens ice cubes to keep them from laying hard-boiled eggs. 

You "hug" a cactus only once in your lifetime.  

When you have to look up "mass transit" in the dictionary.

A hundred ten in the shade is sorta hot, but you don't have to shovel it off your driveway. 

You wear a bola tie.

You take a stroll on Ho Hum Way.

The beer is chilled and filled with chili.

A haboob happens.

Petrified doesn't mean scared.

Standin' on the corner sounds good.

The temperature drops below 95 and you feel a bit chilly. 

You've experienced condensation on your butt from the hot water in the toilet bowl. 

You would give anything to be able to splash cold water on your face. 

You can attend any function wearing shorts and a tank top. 

You realize that asphalt has a liquid state.


Compiled and edited by Kathy Weiser
Legends of America

Some of the Chase branches on the West Side really need to better train some of their tellers.  I truly am sick and tired of some of the unprofessional, snide, and insulting comments that some tellers make when I deposit a sizeable amount of cash!  My family works VERY long and hard for our money at our family business, and besides, depositing a couple hundred dollars at once is not out of the ordinary.

The Kabb Law Firm does amazing work for the Elderly and their families. Working in healthcare, I know the barrage of paperwork and legal issues that families face in order to protect their loved ones health, assets, and wishes.

Best bank.

I have been a member for 15 years, and kept our accounts as we moved around.  We have been a member at two other Big10 school credit unions, and are now members at a large federal employee credit union, the biggest in the country.  

Service at UWCU is always amazing.  They are always a year or more ahead of others in terms of technology and convenience.  They had chip cards and mobile deposits before our other institutions, and we have yet to find anyone with Moneylink--in fact, in another state we were MAILING a check to our landlord even though we both held accounts at the same institution.  Surely this can't be this hard???  Oh yeah, and our cash back card is not the absolute best, but if you want one from your brick and mortar institution we haven't found anything better.  I've had my CC number stolen overseas, and they called me within an HOUR before I knew anything was awry.  They took care of everything for me, and I never had to call some anonymous call center for help.  As an added bonus, their online layout is clear and sorting and tagging transactions is helpful, if you're in to that.  I didn't always value this, but I've used some BAD online banking.

I always tell my friends and family in WI to never leave the UWCU, and I wish it was possible for them to be our only bank, but alas we are out of the state.

Let me start by saying as a credit union, I have never had an issue with customer service. Very friendly tellers, speedy service, great all around.

My low score is because taking out a mortgage/construction loan with UW has possibly been the most infuriating experience ever. 

My husband and I are a young couple, buying our first home so we know very little about the whole process. Both of us bank with UW though so it made complete sense to take out our loan here. The problem currently is no one can tell me what is going on with this loan. I can't see it online on my UW Dashboard, I was told, because its a construction loan. Um. Okay. So I can't track my loan or make payments online. So they tell me I have to mail in my first mortgage check, do on June 15th. Okay, no problem. Except its been 2.5 weeks since I mailed it and it hasn't been cashed. Me, trying to be the responsible party, calls UW to see if they've received it. Hmm. Well it looks your mortgage maybe with our mortgage servicer. Um. Well, okay. 

So I'm transferred to the mortgage servicer. Only to be told they don't have my mortgage either. WHO AM I MAKING PAYMENTS TO AND WHERE IS MY CHECK?!

As a 29 year old with no prior experience in this area, I feel like I am being jerked around and not getting all the facts. Not only that, we had initial issues when first taking out the loan like getting timely responses. Oh, and when we signed our title they forgot to mention our contractor needed to be there as well. On a Friday morning. In rush hour. You know when we found that out? When the title company told us as we were signing the papers. No one from UW told us because we were having a construction loan that our contractor needed to be there.

Hopefully they get this worked out, because buying a house is already stressful enough without having all of this on my plate too.


*UPDATE* We were given mortgage coupons with incorrect information so my first mortgage payment is out there floating around in space.

I have been with UW credit union for a very long time.  I started my account in Milwaukee, moved to Madison because of a job, then moved across the country and back because of a job.  I have had some minor trouble with them in the past, but they have always been very helpful.  Their staff are willing to go above and beyond for their members.

The entire staff is amazing. Great group of women, all are very professional and courteous who take their time to explain the different loan options. I moved across town and still drive to this location because of the staff.
Great with customer service. The staff is very friendly. Information for loans was clear and all options for loans are explained clearly. Interest rate is pretty high but still affordable.
Very clean and friendly staff to help you. Wasn't busy at the time I was there. Staff was efficient and completed my request very quickly and even offered me an alternative way to send money.

This Mexican lady/wannabe manager treated us so badly, I will never go back there! We just wanted to cash a check, she couldn't even do simple math without pulling up her calculator, then she says she couldn't give us any cash, got into an argument after I told my husband in Spanish that she is dumb, and we left. She cussed me out and I cussed back. Really lady?? Is this how you treat customers?? I'm gonna complain to the GM and she better be hoping she'll keep her job

Don't go here ...I was in a bad situation and went to pay off an  un paid loan I found out I still had from 8 for 200 ..I paid it trying to get a new loan used the last if my $to pay it off because they said they were  going to loan me again but only after I paid....guess what I paid and they denied me because of my loan from 8 years ago! That was all the $ I had and they just took to get their payment. .. if u go here be careful make sure ur getting approval before putting all ur $ down....never again going here!

First time going here. I had to deal with 3 different employees so I will name them #1, #2, #3.. 
I stood in line and when I finally got to employee #1, I told her I was picking up money through western union. She proceeded to ask me, "is this your first time withdrawing money from us?" Clearly didn't hear a word I said. She then directed me to the counter with the paperwork that needed to be filled out. I filled out the only thing that was in English (other papers were in Spanish). I went back in line for the second time. When I reached #1, she told me to fill out the other paper that was only in Spanish. I then stood in line for the third time. A male walked into the store and instead of taking me when I was next in line, #2 helped him out first. #3 opened up her window and said, "next person," which would have been me, but she took someone else also. When #2 was done with the guy, she finally called on me. She could not pull up the transaction since "the number was wrong." I attempted to show her my phone which had the picture of the receipt texted to me, and she didn't bother to look at it. Her response was, "maybe you got the number wrong." I told her, "how could I get the number wrong when I have a picture of the receipt right here?!" She didn't bother using my name to look it up or anything. She basically refused to help me since the number didn't work. I walked out and went to the location on fort apache where they helped me with no issues and I was in and out in 3 minutes!
Becca was my teller and she was awesome not only friendly service but very knowledgeable. On payday loans. Fast in and out with no problems and answered all my questions. Thank you check city

Great people there with a great attitude.  Extremely helpful and willing to give me any information on ways to help me.  I have been to different representatives in this location and they all have the best customer service. 
Can't say enough about how nice and engaging the whole staff is!
The employees are always so nice to me. They always take care of me. Thanks Ofelia and Courtney! Best customer service!

Short review because I only ended up here by default! Somebody owed me money and I needed it asap! My bank was no where in the city that the sender was in! First thing that comes to mind would be western union! I never come to these check cashing and payday loan places hence the horrific prices and fees I heard they charge! Then to I manage my money to well to ever have to result to this establishment however that's no shade to anybody who does have to use this place! The staff was very courteous and professional! I forgot the young lady's name but she made the transaction of picking my money up from western union fast and easy! Thanks!
Great customer service easy to deal and very knowledgeable good prices I'm happy I met this guy

I was in need of auto insurance. I tried getting it through other companies and no one could get me insurance with an Sr-22. Found Adam gave him a call and within 10 minutes he got me what I needed and at a  better price than any of my quotes I had received  from other companies. Adam took great care of me and plan on keeping him as my insurance agent moving forward.

Adam is the best! I not only needed a good quote on insurance but I was in the middle of buying a car and was having trouble getting approved for financing. So I called Adam and he picked me up, brought me to a dealership and made sure I got into a new car with an awesome rate on insurance for it too! I can't believe how well I was taken care of. Most agents are just interested in getting a quick policy signed and then forget about you. With Adam, he really takes the time to help you, and make sure you're happy. He even called me a week later to ask how the car was doing and if I needed anything else. Very impressed, thank you!!
Great 5 Stars after sales customer service. Very competitive rates. preferred customer since 2007.
Been with Adam 2+years. Great service, great rates and  awesome guy! Wouldn't go anywhere else

I would definitely recommend anybody to use Adam for their car insurance needs. I went to his office ready to get insurance for my car, but when he put the VIN number in the system, the quote went up. He actually called another insurance agent and found a better price for me ! Even though he lost my business, I will definitely recommend him to all my friends.

I went into the bank today to resolve some charges on my account.  Kristen and Carolyn went above and beyond to figure out how to fix the problem, then made sure it wouldn't happen again.  Thank you ladies, i will definitely be back and will refer my friends and family.
This is probably one of the best Wells Fargo banks in Arizona! The guy that took care of us, Marcus, was very nice and friendly! I would recommend banking with these guys!

Wow went in to ask if they have temporary checks, nope. Asked to order checks, have to order with customer service. Asked to change my address, have to go online to change the address. This is the only Bank of America that doesn't do there job. Go here if you want a headache and for people to tell u they don't do shit. They have all that space and yet can't do anything. Staff is a joke. They should have a sign on the door that says, use the atm.

No tellers. Really. Hire hire hire. Today 2 tellers. Yesterday At 4pm 1 teller. This bank really sucks. They have a greeter and plenty of personnel to open accounts and do loans. But no tellers. Really!

This review is for the Home Loans department located at this address. The mortgage loan officer that we were assigned at this location didn't act very welcoming at all and she didn't explain anything to us about the mortgage loan process. Thank the Lord I had a really good realtor that explained everything to me. The loan officer at this location would take forever to return emails or phone calls and always acted bothered when we asked her questions. It was such a relief when our loan was moved to another loan officer who was in Texas and communicated very well as well as answered all of our questions in a timely manner. If you want a good loan officer do not go to this location.
