Ricky Montanez the mortgage loan officer at this location is a horrible loan officer. He did not give me the time of day when I tried to get a home loan. I guess it's because it didn't benefit him, or so he thought! I'm a single mother and was 30 at the time. Great job, money saved, perfect credit score and just because he thought he could judge me before even taking the time to get my information to know everything I worked for to be able to afford a home! He didn't give me the time of day. Ihave owned my home for 3 years now! Brand new home in a new community! Now bank of America wants me to refinance w them! NO THANK YOU! I will stay w Wells Fargo! Your loss!

I've been using this branch for several years.  What can you really expect from a bank? Aren't they typically impersonal, aloof and indifferent?

This bank does have one teller, Ms. Kitchens, who smashes the stereotype. She's very sweet, helpful, and knowledgeable. There is no future for her in banking.

I would have switched to Washington Mutual a long time ago except that it's a pain to switch banks.  I applied for a car loan online and it was denied the instant I clicked the mouse. Click-DENIED. How is that possible? I've never had the slightest problem getting credit. Suspecting a glitch, I tried calling my branch. You can't get through. It takes hours.

I spoke to a jerk. I explained the situation. I have more money in the bank than the amount of the loan. Any suggestions? 

He talked to me like he was dealing with a welfare cheat. He said I could apply again but it would hurt my credit rating. Too many inquiries. I don't want to apply again.  Can someone review my application?  We can't do that blah blah blah--a smokescreen of anti-customer jargon. "You must have something wrong with your credit history," he advised. You're probably a deadbeat, in other words.

What kind of scenario would have made me happy?  "I see Mr. Q . that you've been banking with us for 12 years and you have more money in your account than the loan you applied for. We certainly appreciate your business. Let me check on this and I'll get back to you." I'm dreaming, right?

The bank sends you a form letter with an 800 number to find out why you didn't get the loan. I didn't bother. I ended up getting a loan elsewhere with better--that's right, BETTER--terms. 

After 12 years of banking with B of A they let me down the first time I asked anything of them. Apparently they have an algorithm that evaluates your record and renders a decision in milliseconds. That's all I was entitled to. It wasn't anything personal.

I didn't close my account on principle because it doesn't make any difference to them. They don't have an algorithm for angry customers. It would just mean more inconvenience for me.

Any bank will give you the same treatment. Their strength isn't serving you; it's dreaming up outrageous new fees for granting you the privilege of depositing your money with them.

UPDATE: I finally closed my account. Never again. I went with Wells Fargo. Not that they're any better. They're all thieves. Wells Fargo says their free checking will never change. We'll see.

I feel good about breaking with B of A because of their shameful conduct in the mortgage meltdown. They're all about throwing people out of their homes just to secure fraudulent profits. Shame on them. I urge all yelpers to boycott B of A, an institution that should have failed. Thank you.

This is the worst branch ever . There is always a long line and not enough tellers to help you .
I'm using different branch all over vegas and all of them have enough tellers,  and usually I'm in and out in 5 minutes but this branch is at least 25 minutes wait.

Auto Title Loans USA is a great company to work with if you need a title loan. I was hesitant after one bad experience and wasn't sure if I should try again. My experience with these guys was shockingly painless. Very professional, courteous, knowledgeable and the customer service before and after the transaction was top notch! I was treated like the only customer they had from beginning to end. I highly recommend Auto Title Loans, USA to anyone in need of a title loan. They will be the first ones I call!

Many reviews suggested this firm is the tops and I needed professional advice with my tax return for a specific item of business. They delivered hands down at a reasonable rate of return for both parties.  

However the skeptic in me with something that I am not familiar with leaves me wondering and I suppose time will tell if the IRS comes knocking on my mailbox; hope not! The firm seemed very confident!!

We were living in Phoenix temporarily, and our 2010 taxes were a bit complicated.  I read the other Yelp reviews and decided to give it a shot, otherwise I would have randomly chosen an accountant based on location.   

I was very happy with Mr. Gallacher.  He was very nice and personable.  He was not rushed, and made me feel very comfortable.  I'm a young woman, and sometimes people can make you feel intimidated.  But not Mr. Gallacher!  

We've since moved from Arizona, but I think I will have him do our 2011 taxes as well!  Its not easy finding an accountant that you really like!
I went into this State Farm office today to ask a couple questions and WOW, what great people. Bill, Patti and Deanne were so nice and helpful with all of my questions. Thanks again guys!!!

I'm updating this review solely as a response to AZFCU's response to my initial review.  It is their response that downgrades them to 1 star, and has now put changing credit unions on the table.  I think whoever delegated the task of responding to Yelp reviews ought to reconsider their choice.

Firstly, they addressed their closing of the Desert Ridge with a backhanded apology in the form of :

"We understand it can be concerning when the location nearest to you closes - especially so soon after you became a member here - and apologize if the letters and emails we sent did not reach you"

A proper apology doesn't include an opportunity to save face by mentioning that you sent me letters about the closing branch and thereby insinuating something like  "it's not like we didn't tell you about it".  Apology not accepted.  I never got any notice in any form.  I challenge you to provide me with proof of mailing of those letters.

Secondly, notice how the responder glosses over the issue of the initial 60-day blackout on remote deposits, WHICH IS LIKELY TO BE INCONVENIENT FOR MANY NEW CUSTOMERS. AZFCU, if you're going to respond, then bring a proper response that addresses ALL of the noted concerns.

FInally, I'll supplement my original post by offering Yelp readers and potential AZFCU customers another word of warning:(in case AZFCU's haphazard attempt at a response isn't repellent enough):  If you're a couple who wants to maintain separate accounts, have a joint account, and link them all together, then prepare to waste an hour of your Saturday signing you name umpteen times and listening to endless disclosures.  IT LITERALLY TOOK AN HOUR.  I'm not kidding.  It was the most convoluted banking procedure we ever witnessed. 

My thanks to whomever wrote that reply.  In trying to defend AZFCU, you ended up giving credibility to my original advice: LOOK ELSEWHERE TO HANDLE YOUR BANKING NEEDS.

Mobile deposits take multiple days to go through, staff is unfriendly and rude, and overall this is not a place to trust with your banking needs.  We are closing our accounts and taking our business elsewhere.  On top of that, when I ordered checks through their web site (it connects automatically from your account page), the checks were wrong.  But not the info you would think - routing number and acct were ok, some other number they put on there was not.  Took hours on the phone to sort it out.  Sick of the fees, sick of the $3 they take out every month for NO reason (yes, they charge you for your account).  Right now we have multiple accounts with them between my husband, children and other family members and guess what - you've lost them all AZFCU.

I wish I could give negative stars.

I've been with this bank for 20 years, and this means nothing to them. In the 20 years I've been with them they have done endless crap to me like auto-enrolling me in programs I don't want the latest of which caused over $300 in fees on my account. After calling them, they put me on hold for a while to "review my account" (which obviously means to see if I am important enough to them to refund the fees). Apparently I am not. After holding I was told they won't refund them (again these are fees from a program I never signed up for). Insulting. This is what they continue to do to me after being with them for 20 years.

I'm out. I can't take it anymore.

Clark Howard recommends credit unions over banks. However I would not recommend this credit union over most banks. My problems with them:

1) They charge you $3/month to each and every member, no matter what. With my current bank, all monthly fees are waived since I have direct deposit. Not so with AZFCU. $3/month, regardless.
2) After seven ATM withdrawals in a month, you're charged a hefty fee for each additional ATM transaction. I found this out the hard way when I visited Europe and would withdraw relatively small amounts each time, so that I wasn't carrying too much cash on me. I get home and what do I find? Fees out the wazoo. My current bank has no such limit.
3) Their loan rates are noncompetitive. Even as a member I was always able to get better loan rates at other banks. And I'm talking a couple of house refis, a home equity line of credit, and a car loan. I always did better going outside the credit union.

Maybe Clark Howard has other credit unions in mind when he recommends them over the "big monster mega-banks." This isn't one of them.
This place uses to be about us members but now they are no better then the big banks out there. They will hit you up with fees and even charge a monthly membership fee!  Barf!

I am a new "member" and let me tell you, I am not very amused. I have a VISA secured credit card with them and because of it, a savings account. I want to make a payment to my VISA secured credit card and I cannot do it online using a checking account from a different bank. The only option is to "move money" from their savings account onto the secured credit card. It's 2013 people!!! How many of you cannot pay your VISA with your checking account?
Called their customer service, after being on hold for 31 MINUTES, I was hung up on. Called again and after on hold for another 32 MINUTES, I was hung up on again. Called the lady that opened my account, voicemail. An hour wait for a simple freaking question from a new member!!
After some research online, I found out I can pay my VISA secured credit card with a debit card from a different bank, by paying a $18 "surcharge" fee. How the hell am I supposed to pay them?? Go to the freaking branch in person to pay a simple credit card??
No answers. Left a voicemail to the lady who opened my account and hopefully she will get back to me.

UPDATE:
After an hour wait on the phone, I finally got to talk to someone and they did tell me I cannot make an online payment using the checking account from a different bank. I can only pay it online using the debit card from a different bank and paying the $18 fee. Or I can pay using the checking account from a different bank over the phone, pay a $5 fee and it takes up to 4 days to process. Or I can go in person, give them my debit card from a different bank and be charged a non-bank atm fee by my bank. What a mess. I'm closing my account and going someplace else.

After seriously giving up on the Rancho location (which is only a mile away from work), thought I would try this location (2 miles away). 

Ok, I don't know what's with Wells Fargo, but they don't seem to get customer service. No matter what branch I go to, they are ALWAYS short in tellers. There always seems to be an issue when I come here. The systems are down, not enough tellers, the really slow teller I seem to always end up with, the business line takes just as long, they don't have change. Never ending list. There are however, 2 tellers that I have become acquainted with who are fast and friendly, Pariese and Carlos. Thank you guys for making my trips bearable. Kudos to you guys, but seriously Wells Fargo, when will you step up?

I've always had to wait in super long gone lines at this place and the customer service isn't the best. Every now and again you'll get one employee that will be nice, but that's few and far between. If you have plans after the bank make sure you at least have 45 minutes to spare.
Don and his staff are so helpful. Im so glad I swtched over from American Family. They saved me money and a peace of mind. Thanks guys. I love State Farm and the Newsom office.

I've been a client for 3/4 years. Ive always paid my policy In full and on time. It all was great when I fist came in, And young lady named Vanessa made coming here a delight. Great customer service and caring. 
Now. The receptionist is a young girl and has an attitude that she doesn't care. An agent that is the stepdaughter of the owner. The wife also works there. And the boss. 
Which I think is wrong. That's not right in any other work environment. 
The stepdaughter quoted me wrong. And when I came back, because I got a bill of $200 extra, she said that she never had quoted that. And of course. The boss/stepdad said she would never say that either.
This should be right. But oh well. 
That's why today I cancelled all of my policies. And moved to a different insurance. 
I use to tell everyone about this place. Now I'm thinking of the opposite :/

We have our mortgage thru this um company and I use this term loosely, any way we started to so a re-finance in August 2012 we were told it would take only 60-90 days to complete will 6mos later we are still doing the re-finance which now we have to make yet another house payment and in the process we were getting a rate and we were told that , that rate is no longer ava, really? Bad service all the way around.

We have had nothing but trouble with Flagstar Bank-mortgages.  We chose an impound account in order to not worry about saving and paying our taxes and hazard insurance.  For an entire year, I have to monitor to make sure they make our payments.  The latest snafu is they did not pay our home insurance.  I called them a week before it was due and the rep said she would take care of it.  Nope!  Two days before I called again and another rep said she would handle it.  We went an entire week without insurance.  Why am I doing their job?  Therefore, you can guess why I would highly NOT recommend them.

I made an appointment to replace a wheel bearing on my car. The staff were all very helpful. Jason checked me in and provided excellent customer service from start to finish. Will definitely come back whenever I need service done again.

Thanks to Randy and Nathan for such excellent service at AAA WT Harris Blvd in Charlotte. You and your team quickly diagnosed our problem and our car was fixed in no time. I especially appreciate how you helped to explain the issue with our clutch and made it a great experience all around. Thanks again!

This was my first trip to this location as a new AAA member. I made an appointment the day before and dropped my car off that morning.  They had my vehicle ready by lunch.  The staff were extremely attentive and knowledgeable and even offered a courtesy shuttle service. The facility was clean and offered vehicle service, travel agent, Hertz counter, insurance, and travel products (suitcases, bags, etc.). I used a email coupon which brought the price down to a reasonable amount but without it the prices seemed high.  I would recommend this location with the only knock being the higher prices.

Never going here again for car service, and I'm probably going to be cancelling my membership, too. I had a low coolant light come on a couple weeks ago, they charged over $500 to fix a hose and to buy the kit they claimed had to come with it. The light came back on this week. Took it back today, they said the water pump was broken and would cost almost $400. Had my car taken to another garage, they said the pump wasn't broken, and the first fix probably didn't need to be made as well; it was just a broken censor. I believe AAA was going to keep overcharging me for "broken" parts that they "missed" during inspection the previous time. They were dishonest and crooked, and I will never deal with them again.

I loved my experience here at this location when planning my Honeymoon.  Cherrese was EXTREMELY helpful and even checked in on us after the honeymoon to make sure our trip was great.  Moyra also was very helpful in planning our meals and we would have been lost without both of them!

This new location provides car care (no body work), insurance, travel, and other AAA member services.  I visited for member services and the staff were quick and attentive and service was prompt.  The on-site insurance services are new - that's home, life, auto, etc.  You can drop off your car if necessary and get your hair done at Indulgence or grab a quick bite at Salsarita's both just across the parking lot.

Auto:  The location is great as previous reviewers have mentioned; barbershop, bakery, restaurants  within walking distance so you can multi task.

They were friendly and polite. If I didn't have a coupon & a membership the oil change would have cost $45. 109$ an hour for labor is a little high in my humble opinion. I made an appointment easily the next day from the previous day phone call.
However; they left my car unlocked in the parking lot....I'm not okay with that. How about I just hand over my keys and valuables to a thief?

Travel : I did have a good experience with the travel people. I ran into a challenge with an online booking and the employee gave me the contact info for a manager and she fixed the problem right away.

They also sell Baggalini bags for those of you who are as obessed as I am with the brand.

This is my usual lunch spot when I am out shopping with my family. It is very popular and the line is usually quite long. I don't know what was up, but it was very slow going. Given that the food is already prepared, doesn't make much sense. I ordered a two entree orange chicken (my fave) with white rice. I really wanted vegetables, but they were out and I didn't want to wait. I was going to get a soda with my order, but they were out of Diet Pepsi. She asked if I wanted to wait or get something else. Being that I only drink diet soda, it meant must go without. I got water instead. The portion size was fine, but the orange chicken was a bit off on this visit. It was kinda vinegary.

:) return customer! i have been in UC area for 2 yrs and i think this is one of the best panda express. the servers that i encountered were all nice and friendly! I don't remember their names but i remember the lasted one: Syena~~and don't forget to flask the survey to win a free entree :)
like any other panda express,advice: don't let the old women put for you the food:she is very stingy!! let the young employees do so! anyway,they are nicer

I decided to try Panda Express at the mall this time over the other fast food Chinese places.  What struck me was they slice the chicken breast in front of you so you know you are not getting chopped up pieces of whatever which has always disturbed me about the other places.  They also cooked the vegetables up fresh for you.  The flavor was really good for the price and I thought the portion was just right.  I was able to have a fulfilling meal and take some home for later.  I liked the Teriyaki sauce on the side too so you can regulate how much you want on your food.

This review is about the nice treatment that we had when me and my cousin were stuck in a broken car in the parking lot next to their office. We were trying to give a jump to my cousin's car, and it took us a long time. It was a hot humid day. While we were trying to start the car, a young beautiful nice lady came with two cold bottle of water. We were very thankful. 
That was very nice and very thoughtful.  Thank you!

Alright, so I am reposting this review with a total 180 from the original I wrote.
Another employee at AZFCU has really gone out of their way to follow-up on a problem I had with them, that I thought was their fault and it actually wasn't.
After the employee followed up with me and we calmly talked through the details of the issues I was having, I was told specific transaction dates as well as dates of information reported to the three credit bureaus. Not only did I realize that it was my mistake but the employee then referred me to some free resources of government sponsored programs that would help me resolve other issues.
So yet again the people of Arizona Federal Credit Union have come through and really helped me.
Thank you all.

I took money out of the ATM in front of their credit union, went in and asked if i could trade 5 20s for a 100 dollar bill. I was informed that because i don't have an account there they were unable to do this for me. You are a bank, you have money right??? I went across the street to 1st Bank and they did it no questions asked. Just because im not a current customer doesn't mean i wouldn't be a future customer. I loved going back out in 110 degree heat to drive across the street to a bank that did what any bank can and should do. I just moved to this area but you are making my options of which bank to move to much shorter...so thank you.
Super friendly, efficient, helpful people. Great customer service. Highly recommend. Went in to open an account today and I am completely pleased with the service.
This company is a scam. If you use us bank watch out the have a scam between the to companies.  Your statement will say pmt nuf hp insr888.

When Lot Solutions used to manage the NUFIC program it was much easier to deal with claims. Now that AIG is managing it, there is a lot of red tape you have to go through to getting your claim paid. When they deny the claim, they send you an Explanation of Benefits state that has no explanation on it, and no phone number to call. It is up to you to figure out how to write an appeal letter. I was very happy when Lot Solutions managed this program....they were a 5 start company. With the new management, I'm debating dropping this insurance.

I purchased travel insurance through Costco for a European vacation. The underwriter for the insurance was National Union Fire Insurance Company. My trip was delayed by 24-hours due to weather and when I returned home I completed a claim. I supplied all of the required documentation (which was extensive) and less than four weeks later I received a check for the entire amount requested. The service providers were professional, easy to work with, and the process was straight forward. I am now a firm believer in travel insurance!

Wells Fargo had a charge on my credit cart with the name Wells Fargo on it that I thought was the monthly fee for holding the credit card of $24.90 / mo. When I recently paid off and attempted to cancel my credit card, I was told this monthly charge was actually an insurance plan from "Wells Fargo National Union Fire Insurance Company" which was never authorized, needed or even used.

There were no monthly statements and no indication of the insurance services that I ever received. I have had full home owners insurance through All State and full health coverage through my employer, so there is no reason I would have ever authorized this charge for an insurance services that seems to be a scam.

I am amazed that Wells Fargo is associated with this company as I have always appreciated working with them, but the fact that they allow their name to be used in conjunction with a fraudulent service makes me want to switch financial institutions entirely.

Super. Nach einem fürchterlichen Besuch in der Königstraße/Bolzstraße, quasi eigentlich der Prestige-Filiale, ging ich nun zu meiner Stadt-teil-Post in der Nähe.


 Und siehe da: Mittags ALLE schalter besetzt, alle Mitarbeiter engagiert, und ich habs ogar noch 2,- EUR bei dem Paket gespart.


 Super, ich geh jetzt nur noch hierher.


 Und kleiner Tip: wenn jemand ne Paketbox hat, kann er auch bei Paketversand was sparen. echt praktisch!!

Völlig überforderte Mitarbeiter , grad heute z.b stand ich vor verschlossener Tür wegen einer Betriebsbesprechung, und in der Schlange wartet Mann wirklich immer eine Ehwigkeit . Ich muss da natürlich oft mal hin da die nächste Post in der Stadt in der königsbau Passage liegt ,aber ich bin jedes mal angebervt über die langsamen mitarbeiter.

Heute wie jedes mal 30  40 min angestanden. Die Schlange bis auf die Straße und die Krönung als ich drankam: Ihr Päckchen mit den Maßen 15  30  50 und 1 kg kann nicht als Päckchen für 4,10 Euro verschickt werden, da Sperrgut. Das macht dann 26,90 Euro  Wie bitte??  Ja, Ihr Päckchen hat zu wenig Ecken.
Es ist wie immer eine absolute Katastrophe in dem Laden. Nachvollziehbar, dass sich in der Filiale grundsätzlich 80% der Kunden aufregen und beschweren.

In March, I opened a "Kasasa" Checking account.  It refunds All ATM fees and pays 2% interest  Unheard of at most banks.  The key is when you use your check-card, you have to press credit and NOT use your PIN.  You have to do that 15 times a month or you don't get the refund.  The problem I had, their security is set so hi, my spending habits shut the card down.  I was never sure which transaction did it, but they never called to see if it was actually my transaction before blocking the card.  

I coud still do transactions with a PIN number, but that practice goes against the way the account is supposed to function.  I called after about a week of getting declines.  I was out of town and the woman in card services asked if I had left AZ, when I said yes a travel for my job she said that was the reason.  All transactions out of AZ will apparently lock the card.  Most institutions only do this if you leave the country.  She offered to permanently lift the restriction but I declined and said I would just come in and close the account.  I did not want to take the risk of them telling me I waived my fraud rights if I actually had an identity theft with the account.
Been here 17yrs.  Great.  Tried others and this one tops the cake.

I am impressed! I was contacted just
Minutes after leaving my negative review here on Yelp! The manager was beyond kind and said that she even went back and listened to the phone call to verify the information. I'm happy to know that those " recorded calls"
Are actually
Listened to and to know that they are putting quality first. Great job management of Altier CU!

I'd given zero stars if I could.... Tempe location is the worst! Their atm wasn't working yesterday when I tried to deposit cash to make sure things didn't bounce. Went it today and they say sorry nothing we can do would've put it in the night drop. Why am I going to put cash in the night drop?! So whatd they do? Hit me with 3 overdraft fees and won't reverse them! This isn't the first problem I've had with them either. And when I was talking to the assistant bank manager he was laughing about it! What great customer service. I have been in customer service for 15yrs and that is the worst thing to do! Account closed! I will make sure to let everyone know not to bank here!

I have purchased several cars and financed them through AZSTCU, and have been a member for over 20 years.  The service is excellent, the people are friendly, and they offer great loan rates to their customers.  I am also a member of the other credit union in the Desert, and AZSTCU has offered me rates that were 4-5% LOWER than my other credit union (which I have been a member of for over 30 years).  Yes, there are fewer branches than I would like, but the personal, inexpensive service is well worth the travel!

Pros: Really nice branch people, rates as good as anywhere else, you don't feel like they're actively screwing you, you can feel good about supporting a local financial co-op.

Cons: Shitty branch and call center hours (though awesome if you work there), they have some sort of security breach at least once a year which forces you to change your card numbers and change all your autopay stuff, call centers are moderately useless so there's a 50-50 chance you'll have to trek down to a branch anyway by 5pm M-F.

Great service!

My experience with Bonding Solutions has been amazing. The agent I worked with was knowledgeable and courteous. The response was expedient.  I wouldn't hesitate to recommend Bonding Solutions.
Great Company! Very kind and helpful staff and leadership. Would definitely recommend anytime

You will not find a better customer service experience anywhere else.
Both Taylor and the Office Manager Cindy were always quick to respond to any questions or needs that I had. 
They will be used again and I recommend them to any business in need of surety bonds!
Quick, clean and reliable!    So glad I found a local company to handle a surety bond on my vehicle.    Pricing are the same as everyone online.

We have been customers of the Bovaird's for years.  We started 10 years ago with life insurance then added auto and home a few years later.  They have saved us money and always treated us with integrity!  I trust their office to always be honest and treat me fairly.  When we added a new car and teenage driver they took the time to explain to us how we could get the best rate possible by taking the Teen Smart driving class online.  After our child was done she actually said that the class helped her and she was glad we forced her to take it.  By taking the class and her good grades we saved $800 a year on her insurance.  Thank YOU Bovaird Insurance for always be there for us weather its Auto, Home, or Life Insurance.

After being with State Farm for over 25 years, I asked Kevin and Suzanne Bovaird to shop insurance agencies for my family.  They found Pekin Insurance from Illinois had the best rates for us and we saved a substantial amount of money.  The Bovaird Agency has the ability to shop different carriers and compare prices and benefits.  The Bovaird Agency has a great staff and provide many services.  This is a winning team for exceptional customer service.  Give them a call.
Little disappointed that there are no outside ATMs at all. Service from the drive threw tellers was ok. Still would prefer a drive through atm

Two ATM's inside the lobby where you need your Chase Debit Card to gain entry after hours and on the weekends.  No drive-thru ATM, however there are 2 drive-thru teller windows.  Didn't get to go into the branch so can't review what's in there.  Enough parking spaces outside and bright lights, so it's a safe place to go.  It's on a busy intersection right by the light-rail station.
They're making me happier than B of A as of late. We'll have to see how it goes. Not too long of lines so that's awesome.

There is always only 1 banker at all times
Waited 25  Minutes to open an account i finally just left!!!
This location simply sucks
The tellers are great that's why I gave it 3 stars

I had Jay review my auto insurance when I was with another company. He showed me the breakdown of my current coverage, and how I can save if I switched my coverage to his company. I was very happy with how much information he gave me as well as the time he took with me. Those were the main reasons why I switched.

The easy thing to do was add my home insurance as well, which helped since it's combined with auto.

I'm so happy I went with Jay. I've since moved my health insurance over to him as well as purchased life insurance.

Jay is no pressure and gives his honest opinion about all of the policies he sells. He always gives you the time you need to fully understand your purchase.

do not go here. whatsoever. they do not care about their customers and can give less of a care for high priority issues. they want money. they do not care if your starving. they don't care if you will pay it all by next check. do not go. i recommend you go to check city or rapid cash.
Jackie is amazing!!!!! I had a great experience!!!! Love love love!!! I was worried about getting a loan but Jackie reassured me and took care of everything.

I was a member of the credit union for over 20 years. Over that time I've had auto and personal loans, savings and checking accounts with direct deposits and a credit card with a great rate.
About 6 or so years ago Riverset took over and this place went downhill fast. Their goal now is not customer service but to maximize profit.
In June 2015 I received a letter telling me my credit card rate would be increasing but not by how much. I was assured that they would let me know the increase amount in the coming months and that it would be SOMETHING plus prime. I was further assured that until such time they figure out what that SOMETHING is they were going to raise the rate over 30%! Since I'd never missed a payment despite their lengthy crediting period, I assume it was a mistake. So I called and was politely told that the reason they were raising rates was because they "weren't making enough money with the lower rate"!!!
I spoke to a manager, pointed out to her that interest rates across the boards are at the lowest levels in decades and that I'd been a loyal customer for over 20 years, she just confirmed the fact that the sole reason to increase rates was "we are not making enough profit at the lower rate". Also when asked she could not tell me what the ultimate rate would be.

GO ELSEWHERE

I've had a riverset/pittsburgh teacher's credit savings account since I was a child.  I like the personal feel that a credit union offers over a bigger banking institution.  Every time I have visited the south side branch the employees have been personable and quick to service my banking needs.  I also like the competitive auto and home equity rates they offer to members.  At Christmas time they offer a skip a payment which is great around the holidays.

This is my go to ATM when I'm in the area.  Being a member of a credit union myself, it is best to stop at a credit union.  No fees!

Asides from that, there's nothing special about this place.  There is not enough room in the parking lot that is for sure.  If you want to park here, it's best to find a spot on the street instead of fighting with other customers for one of the spots.

Here I am again within the same year! I obviously can't close out my year without writing another beautiful review for Riverset credit union. Please be aware of the sarcasm in my writing. 

Like most people, I worked hard for the money I entrusted Riverset with. I'm very upset with the direction of this financial establishment handles it customers. I would say they are rude, but they're rarely available to solve problems. When problem's do arise, they treat your situation as if it is not important or give you grief for calling and asking questions about your account. Again, I was hit with an over draft fee, but this time three in a row. The kicker is that I did, do, and still have the amount that was needed to pay the bills. From the notice I received about the overdraft fees, it even states I have a balance that can take care of the bills I had needed to pay. What drives it home is when they don't want to correct this. This was the best financial institution to have, but as soon as they went from PTCU to Riverset things started to slip. They have so many back door policies that forces you to agree or you can't check your accounts. I've just reported them to BBB.org, and people who are choosing banks need to understand that Credit Unions are good, but this one is on "the evil list" for sure. Just another small financial institution who likes to overcharge. My advice is to try PSECU if your in PA. They are open on Saturdays and open late on Weekdays. Riverset is failing and they know it! Which is why every other day you login to your account your always agreeing to a back door policy or you can't have access to your money. I hope my two comments can steer newcomers away and hopefully current members can speak up about their bad experiences. I just read some more policies and found either way if I would have put a stop payment on each bill I've paid, they would have charged me $30 for each one. Either way I had to pay an overdraft fee or the cancellation fee. They both are $30 dollars for each transaction. I can't wait for their reason and explanation on this.
Don't bank here they loose money . I payed a bill early on line and chase lost the money . Now they won't credit my account the money they lost. ....

Went to this bank to get a cashiers check to pay off my house. The teller said he couldn't give me one unless I had an account there. I said I don't have an account so just cash the check since it was on a local business with a chase account. He said there would be a 6 dollar fee to cash the check.  I said ok. The the manager came over and said we won't cash the check, I said its on your bank. To bad he said, take it to your own bank. I said, you have to be kidding me. I yelled out before I left for all too hear, if you want to cash a check drawn on this bank don't come here.
Worst customer service Iin the world, go online and Google chase bank and you will hear from thousands of customers and employees that hate chase bank... They said it was the worst place they ever worked. 
The Internet speaks for iitself. Find a local credit union who cares about the customer, CHASE WILL TELL YOU TO GET THE HE.. OUT AND GO TO YOUR OWN BANK...............idiots
Tom was amazing he explain everything, took care of me right away gave me a offer. Great job tom

Amateur hour. Walked in to get info about opening a checking account. The woman didn't even look up to make eye contact. She said I should look at the big sign in their lobby for details or go online. I asked for any information I could take with me since I wasn't getting answers I needed. Clearly annoyed, she called for a guy to come over to hand me a brochure. Since I had him cornered, I got in a few questions but it was obvious they both just wanted me to leave. 

Read the rest of their reviews. It seems I dodged a bullet and will continue my search for my savings and checking needs.

I started going to the tempe location in 03.the employees are amazing to work with.no long waits.I,be developed good relationships with more than a few of the bankers,always nice and friendly,the ac helps.Haha.I can't think of any other place I would go.im over dealing with Bofa.sch/luck.and I have accounts with chase,but I never go in there stores,weird I know,ok,im done,stay classy yelpers

Lost 1467.56 dollars in Debit fraud transactions. After 60 days your screwed. They also because of the fraud charged 300.00 in over draft fees and killed my account don't bank here not safe any more there security systems are flawed. Never got ripped off by a thief and a bank at the same time. Don't let this happen to you. I am at a loss for more words and have lost trust with this credit union.

Horrible business practices.  I had accounts for a couple of rental properties.  All I did was deposit checks and send an electronic mortgage payment each month.  I tried every which way to stop getting a paper statement yet they kept sending them and charging me for them even though I didn't want them.  Plus I was also getting charged $5 a month for each account.  When I asked the condescending (male) teller about the fee, he said all banks charge this.  I immediately closed all 4 accounts and found another credit union that actually seemed to appreciate my business and not want to nickel and dime me.  If you open an account, make sure you know all the fees.

I have been with this credit union for years. They have always been personable and will get to know you if you go there regularly. They have a point system that gives xtras and forgiveness for overdrafts when needed and a great staff to work with. Some of the employees have been there for years and are just the nicest people. Recently I had a disaster in one of my accounts and Vickie in the Solution Center helped me with no hesitation which was a wonderful calm after my storm.
The Customer Service is horrible they never greet me with Hello's or Thank you's. Every visit I dread it!

I had to open a business account and I went to this bank. Well, I have to say I was pleasantly surprised. I informed the receptionist, guy that I was here for a business account and he asked me to wait while he went somewhere. Looking around there was about 4 people waiting too.

When the receptionist guy returned he asked me to follow him and he took me into an office in front of all the people waiting. I met Ruppi who begin to help me with the business account. There were the usual questions and waiting while papers were filled out and crosschecked. Ruppi was very helpful and went beyond the norm a few times during the application process. 

After about 20 minutes I was sent on my way with everything signed and ready to go. I had the online banking and a nice new debit card in the mail. Not bad at all.

I was in the Chinatown area and needed to do some banking.  I stopped here at the drive through ATM.  The only problem is the area is like a maze.  You have to drive to the back, make a U, and then come up to the ATM.

Getting out on Spring Mountain is iffy at best.  Then I found out I could exit via Arville.  Another time if I stop here again.
Personal bankers work extremely slow. It took us about 1 1/2 hrs just to be added to my husband's existing account and it wasn't even busy.
Lines move quickly, they serve coffee & snacks, and they are always friendly. Drive thru ATM's also.-Really why is there braille on the drive-thru ATM?

In June I attempted to inquire by phone if I had paid a bill which wasn't showing on my account as being paid.  Of course I just got voicemail and 2 days later no one called back.  I called my credit card company and they responded immediately and took care of it for me!  In October we got hit with their new "low balance fee" for anyone who doesn't have credit cards or loans with Riverset - no letter of warning or email 30 days before like banks always do.  We have over $2000 a month in direct deposit, and we get punished with a $7 a month fee for "low balance"???  This is outrageous for a credit union.  This is something to be expected from a bank - and we have accounts with other major banks and they always forewarn.  That's supposed to be the selling point with a credit union - free checking.  
And last week I attempted to renew my AVG antivirus and once again Riverset blocked it because it came from the Netherlands, the 3rd year in a row, despite emailing them last year to unblock it.  This time I got the usual robocall from their security and called their automated line, no human of course.  I clicked "1" to indicate yes, I did authorize it.  And a few days ago AVG informed me it was denied!! There was more than enough money to pay it.  What part of "yes I authorized this transaction" is difficult to comprehend?  I got on live chat with AVG and had to use my Citizens debit card, and it was paid within seconds!  I shouldn't have to get permission to authorize automatic debits with my own money as long as the money's there in my account.
As for their e-statements?  They're a jumbled mess, with no beginning and ending balance, all thrown together.  My 14-year-old could do a better job.
With the punitive "low balance" fee, we are in process of getting out.  And the "convenient" locations?  They're convenient only if you work or live in Shadyside or Southside and can get there before 4:30, and definitely not by bus.  I went to Southside for the first and only time last summer to deposit into my husband;s account.  The teller expected me to say my husband;s Social Security number out loud.  I of course refused.  I got married in 2011 and they're still using my former name in online transfers, despite numerous emails and refused to give me free checks in my new name - but Citizens had no problem doing that.
Very friendly, knowledgeable staff !!!

Came here to get Domestic Partnership papers long, long ago. Recently I've been back for other papers. They have a lot to choose from and help to find the one you need.
 I've also used their notary service several times. Once she was over an hour late, but another who was off the clock stopped and got us handled. Ruby was very nice to do that!

Called three times trying to find out if I could get 1099s.  They said they had them and I could get them, but when I drove across town to pick them up they wouldn't give me blank ones.  Wanted to charge me to prepare them.  Horrible place.  Obnoxious as hell.  Never ever coming back.

Purchasing any document is super easy and they are helpful in regards to which type of document you need. However, once I had a question about what a line item meant in their Deed, they completely changed their tune. Before I could even finish the question, the woman responded "that is legal information, we cannot give you legal advice." When I attempted to explain that I am not asking for legal advice, I am simply asking what they meant by writing their own document. Again, "you have to call the Clark County Recorder." Really? I have to call the Clark County Recorder to ask them what Nevada Legal Forms meant when they created their own form? AWFUL customer service!!!
20 minutes and counting at the drive through window. I'll be looking forward to finding a new bank after my loan is paid off.
This is the main US Bank location for Phoenix. They are very nice and helpful. I have not had any issues with them. I'm going to continue to bank there, they do a great job.

I have been a client for over 15 years.
The wait in line is rediculous. The atm eats checks, this bank has gone down hill
After having had completely awful service up the road at Thompson Peak, I decided to take my deposits to this location. Greeted by two friendly and pleasant employees... Great expeeience

Earlier this year (2016), my wife and I decided to buy a second house.  Chase Bank holds the mortgage of our primary residence, and Chase Bank held the mortgage of the house in Massachusetts we sold last year.  Since we had had good experiences with Chase Bank mortgages, we decided to "keep it in the family," so to speak.   The wonderful financial professionals on the Customer Service team at our local Chase Bank branch, which does not have a mortgage banker on staff there, referred us to Ryan Jones at the Frank Lloyd Wright-100th St branch in Scottsdale.  It turned out to be a very fortuitous referral for us, and we simply have to tell everyone about it.

The succinct description is that our recent mortgage banking experience was legendary!  This dramatic description is really not much of an exaggeration.  Not only did we close on our purchase mortgage nearly two full weeks sooner than first planned, we closed on the primary residence's refinancing mortgage the same day!   Ryan Jones, as the mover and shaker in both processes, was doggedly determined to burnish Chase Bank's mortgage reputation to its shiniest ever.  He did so through 1) constant contact with us his customers - almost daily contact at times!, 2) very clear explanations of technical financial terms as well as very clear explanations of what could be considered tedious mortgage application processes and 3) offering us a Chase Bank refinancing options that we were previously unaware of to move us into a considerably more advantageous financial position than we were in before.  Ryan always made himself available to us by cell phone, and he was always patient with his answers to our many, many questions.  He was refreshingly the complete opposite of some of those banking reps, who don't care, whether they come off as condescending to us homebuyers.  The plain fact is, not only are we extremely happy with our purchase mortgage, we are ecstatic with the refinanced mortgage. 

It never hurts to talk!  Decide for yourself after you talk with Ryan Jones of mortgage banking at the Frank Lloyd Wright-100th St Chase Bank branch in Scottsdale.

I have been to this Chase location multiple times in the past few months due to purchasing a home. While I am not doing my mortgage through Chase, I do bank here and needed bank statements and documents notarized. Every time I've gone, the employees were quick to greet me and ask what I needed. If they couldn't help me, they would direct me to the correct person. Every time the employees were friendly and courteous. I was able to get in and out relatively quickly and always with exactly what I needed. This was a great experience. I have also used this bank as a quick ATM (which is inside) or as a quick deposit through the drive thru. My wait has never been long and I like that. The employees know what they are doing and are able to help customers efficiently.

Worst policy ever, my friend is out of town and needs cash now, I go to the branch to deposit $350 cash green American money not euros but authentic Ben Franklin's. They will not accept my deposit because I am not a signer on the account. Really worried about money laundering at $300 at a time? This is the worst customer service and left their client in a lurch

I've worked with this location for over 7 years. I've pawned, put stuff on layaway, bought and sold items. As with all pawn shops, there are many things that come in to play with the merchandise available. And the merchandise varies widely from location to location. Since it's not a traditional big box retail shop, what they carry changes literally from day to day and they cannot maintain any products at all. The very idea of a pawn shop is it's fluidity. That's why I love them and flea markets or swap meets. It's all about the hunt for the bargain or the unusual.

Every once in a while, I'll find something nice at this location....but more often than not I end up leaving empty handed.

Return Factor - 43%

worst experience trying to cancel my case. Jason Flory at X 399 the biggest unprofessional Jerk in the world with complete lack of any people skills. Doesn't even check his own voice mail and when his assistant is out of the office they don't get checked. Had to drive all the way down there to talk to him face to face, dressed like a slob, wrinkled suit. I do not recommend this firm to anyone for anything.  we have been trying for over a month to get our $ back

You want to be treated less than human while injured from an automobile accident?... well then you've found the place. They literally add insult to injury.

Sarcasm aside, I echo the other reviewers' assessments of this business and caution those reading this review to stay away. My husband and I were involved in an accident approximately 3 years ago. This was our first MVA, and we were both injured and naïve as to what to do. Under the advisement of our physician we decided to seek out a professional law firm to represent us through this scary process. At the time, this firm did not have a Yelp rating; otherwise I would have steered clear. 

We have spent over 2  1/2 years dealing with the inadequate, unprofessional service and the disrespect that this firm chooses to dole out to their clients. The paralegal assigned to our case failed to send important documents through the mail as required, and it is typical for emails and voicemails to go unreturned. More than once I felt that I was putting the attorney out by requesting information; and more than once the attorney would not deign to speak with me but rather instructed me to follow through with the paralegal that refused to return my calls. 

During the actual depositions and arbitration, I felt that the Phillips attorneys were ill-informed and fumbling. This is by no fault of mine or my husband's as we were highly prepared and provided detailed updates to each of the half dozen attorneys that our case changed hands through. From one month to the next, our case was turned over to a new attorney and we had to explain who we were all over again. Even at the time that I arrived to pick up my settlement check, the paralegal still had no idea who I was or who was involved in my case. I understand this firm has many clients, but in this type of matter diligent note taking and bookkeeping should be the standard. Just to provide the reader with an idea of how this firm drags their feet - our settlement checks arrived May 14th, meaning the firm can deposit checks with our POA documents and then pay out clinicians, take their 40% add in any medpay from the insurance company and then cut us a check. I only received my portion last week and my husband still hasn't received an update on his. Today is July 2nd. Over the past 7 weeks his 5 emails have gone completely unreturned. If we do not hear back by next week we will contact the AZ Attorney Consumer Assistance Program. 

My advice to anybody facing litigation due to a personal injury case is to fully research the firm you choose. I am now kicking myself for not putting more time into my search. My only explanation for choosing this joke business is that I was injured, scared and desperately wanted somebody to tell me that they were going to help me. In an automobile accident a person already feels that they need to be guarded against the other drivers and insurance companies and defense attorneys. They shouldn't feel like they require protection from their own attorney as well. In the case of Phillips Law Group, what you see in your initial consultation is NOT what you get. The expensive advertising, the high rise office space and office girls in 5 inch stiletto's is all a smoke and mirror facade in the end.

Keep as far away from this law group. All they are is a bunch of hacks. Paid them 25k to defend my son, and the lawyer we got was more conserned about his getting Judge pro tempore than the case he was being paid for. I could have done a better job.  Everything was done at the last minute,  Half of the time he did not show.  Did not ask questions of the witnesses like he should have.  Would not answer any of my questions.  If I had know at that point that I could have gotten another lawyer, I would have ran as fast as I could.  When we first went in, they were more conserned about getting paid, then my sons case.  I guess I was so scared, that I did't use my head. Keep as far away from these crooks as you can. And then they had the nerve to ask my son if he wanted to be in one of there comercials praising their company.  Especially after they lost the case.  Keep as far away from these hacks as you can get.

Public beware DO NOT use this dealership's service department under any circumstance. This has to be the  MOST NEGLIGENT, INCOMPETENT and DISHONEST service department on the planet.

Please allow me to get you up to date on my situation. My Jeep Wrangler has had a recall issued for defective side view mirrors with defrost due to the potential of an electrical fire. This in my opinion is a VERY serious recall. This has gone on for over a year.  I continue to receive notices by mail, constant emails and voice messages (at least 3 times a week) from Jeep corporate as to how urgent this situation is and that I need to have the issue fixed immediately.  I have tried NUMEROUS times to have this dealership fix the recalled items and I have been told repeatedly that they don't have the parts. Six months ago, I took my Jeep in for an oil change and again inquired as to when the parts may be available. I was told by my service adviser, Crystal Melton, that they could "remove the fuse to disable the defrost mechanism on the mirrors to prevent a potential fire until the parts come in". On my very next visit for another oil change, I again asked if the parts were available yet again. Once more I was told NO by Jay Rappaport (service adviser). Upon further discussion with Jay Rappaport I mentioned that I was glad that they had removed the fuse to prevent an electrical fire and he asked me who had told me that and I replied Crystal Melton (service adviser). He then informed me that removing the fuse was not possible. She (Crystal Melton the service adviser at the next desk over) then looked at me and said that she had never told me any such thing. I then asked Jay to pull up my history of visits at the dealership and it was clearly stated on my paperwork that, YES indeed, Crystal Melton (service adviser) had typed on my invoice dated 12-1-14 that "the fuse for the side view mirrors had been removed to prevent a potential electrical fire until parts are available". Needles to say she was pretty embarrassed when she realized that I had caught her in a bold face lie. 

Now fast forward to Wednesday 05-11-16.
I called the dealership to set up an appointment for another oil change and asked the service adviser if they had the parts in yet for my recall. He then told me that he would have to have the parts department call me back to let me know if my parts were in and they would set the appointment up for me if so. I then patiently waited for several hours and finally a female from the parts department returned my call and informed me that the parts were indeed in and that I could bring my Jeep in on Saturday 05-14-16 at 10:00am and that the service would take 3 hours to perform. I was also told when I inquired about getting a loaner vehicle during this time that they were short on loaners and that I would have to schedule my appointment 10 days out if I wanted a loaner. Seeing that this is a serious recall, I decided to forgo the loaner and get it taken care of as soon as they could get me in and I told her that I would be there at 10:00am on Saturday.

Saturday 05-14-16
I arrived at Gastonia Chrysler Jeep Dodge Ram at 10:00am to drop my Jeep off for an oil change and a much anticipated sigh of relief to get the recall issue taken care of once and for all (I thought). I worked with Jay Rappaport  (service adviser). He checked my car in, took my key and told me it would be ready in about 6 hours. Contrary to what the lady in parts had told me earlier in the week when she said it would only be 3 hours. Again, I didn't mind too much because I thought this nightmare with the recall would be over once and for all.

I waited 5 and a half hours and then called the dealership to see if my Jeep was ready for pickup. The lady on the phone told me that she would have Jay Rappaport (my service adviser) call me back. Thirty minutes later I get a call from Jay Rappaport (service adviser) notifying me that my Jeep was ready for pick up that ALL work had been completed.

I arrived at the dealership shortly after 4:00pm and checked in with Jay Rappaport (Service adviser). He printed out my paperwork and then, to my DISMAY, casually mentioned that they didn't get to my recall issue because they didn't have the parts. At first, I thought he was joking, but then I realized that he was serious. I then let him know my frustrations with him and the dealership he works for. I asked how this could happen and he said that they had somehow "put the parts that were on reserve for my Jeep onto SOMEONE ELSE'S VEHICLE". He had absolutely NO concern or remorse about this HUGE mistake. All he would say to me was..."Sir please don't yell" as I began to raise my voice as I tried to convey my thoughts to him. 

I must say...I have never seen a company employee so many INCOMPETENT employees and I have no idea how they stay in business. 

PUBLIC BEWARE!!!!!!!!!!!! 
If you want your vehicle repaired properly, this is not the place to go.
Best customer service, Honest and helpful.... Would recommend to my family and friends. Will shop here again.

Where do I start ... we were traveling back to Texas and had truck problems and came to Dodge . This crew is amazing. Travis got our part from another dealership and made sure that we could get back on the road quickly. I have just enough medicine to last me a few days so it was very important this was done asap. Dodge gave us a loaner as we have 3 dogs and luggage and we would be staying one night . Tabatha was so helpful,  even calling hotels and offering to house our animals in case we couldn't get them in a hotel with us . The service dept worked hard on our truck and although we didn't get their names we want to say a BIG THANK YOU . We met very kind sales people stopping to talk to us ,petting our animals, giving the animals doggie treats and asking if we needed anything. Ron the GM is very gracious and is a great leader to his team. Obviously they are hired not only because of their skills but because they are the real deal . This dealership took care of us - a Veteran and Texas residents with urgency and compassion for our cause.  We can't Thank you enough. Travis you are blessing to us . Thank you Gastonia Dodge Chrysler and jeep and Ron  ( Franklin Dodge)

OK, nobody likes paying taxes, but it's one of our duties as responsible Americans to pay our fair share (I'm looking at you, Republicans and 1%ers). So you may as well do what it takes to make it as minimally painful as possible.

This H & R Block location is not in a great part of town, on the corner of Twain and Maryland Parkway. There are many other places in Vegas I'd rather be... like, pretty much anywhere. And some of the clientele here make rednecks from the Ozarks look like Hollywood socialites.

So why do I give this place 4 stars? Her name is Susan Ettinger. Best lady in that office. This is my second year working with her, and her pleasant, helpful attitude helps you forget the fact that you're being squeezed dry by politicians yearly. Well, maybe not forget. But it makes it more bearable.

Also, H&R Block locations usually do a "Free 1040EZ filing" promotion for the first few months of tax season, so you can have professional eyes looking at your taxes, and not bumble around on some internet program and hope you get it right.

I've been an excellent client of this particular State Farm agency for 3 years. I'm giving them two stars because the staff is very friendly and does their best to accommodate accordingly. 
If I were reviewing Brendon Walker himself, it would be 1 star. 

Reason being; my requested roadside assistance didn't reflect in their system for years! For all three vehicles I've had covered through them... 
So, the most recent vehicle I insured through them, I had a note put in the system documenting my roadside. 
As luck would have it, I got a screw driver in my tire outside of Area 51. And when I called the third party agency who handles State Farm's roadside assistance I was informed that it did not reflect in my account. 
8 hours and $700 dollars later, I was back on my road trip. 
Upon contacting Brendon the following day to express my disappointment and see if a reimbursement claim could be submitted. He proceeded to inform me that it takes 30 days for roadside to be available (although it would have transferred had it been correctly applied to my previous vehicles), and that there was nothing he could do to correct his agencies mistake. Ultimately he raised his voice at me and was extremely unprofessional. 
I've requested a transfer to another agent and have made a formal complaint to the corporate office. 

 I will not support a business representative of corporate company as reputable as State Farm is, who has the audacity to yell at woman who was stranded with a child on a highway because of an internal mistake. Buyer beware.

Don't waste your time and money. This agency will tell you one thing and do the complete opposite the next. Staff is nice but not trained properly. Staff can't answer most questions one will have. 

My policy was raised by almost $100 dollars one month and I called the office to tell them I wanted to cancel my policy because I would be paying to much with my policy being raised. Staff convinced me to keep my policy by telling me it went back down to my old policy and that I would only be charged the lesser amount. Having to find out that month that I was charged the high policy and that changes in your policy take 30 days to change. Thanks a lot! So I switched my policy to geico (WAY CHEAPER, MORE COVERAGE)

Unfortunately, I did the mistake of refinancing my car with them. It's been two months since I set up my auto payments and I've been getting a call from the office for the last two months that I need to call State Farm bank and make a payment through the phone because my auto payment hasn't been processed yet. 

Thankfully they're refunding me for the $15 fee they charge to make a one time payment over the phone but I have to pick it up because it can't be mailed to me. Come on its 2016. I work two jobs that's a huge inconvenience for me. 

Save your time and money, you've been warned.

I want to thank Bobby for all the help he gave while he was there as he is no longer there my girl Brandi stepped up and has filled some pretty big shoes and expectations that I have and she has by far exceeded everything I have asked for I would recommend her and the office for any insurance needs thank you Brandi for all that you do.

Very nice location, customer service is very good. I mainly come in to deal with the business department, the wait is kind of annoying but hey I didn't schedule an appointment. 
Daisy the Rep is very nice and knowledgeable.

Service is usually slow but very friendly. Lines can be long. I had to stand in line to get checked in and then wait again for service. Seems redundant. Also seems like they need more help. 

But when it was my turn finally the actual transaction took three times longer than it should due to too much chit chat. Maybe they don't need more staff but just to expedite the processes their using. Friendly is good until it's so friendly it makes me late back to work.

I recently went to this Bank of America branch to address the concern that I have with Bank of America in general and the way that they are continuously charging fees

I walked in and the person at the front who greets the customers stayed on the phone the entire time while I was waiting to be seen by either a teller or a personal banker which ever one could solve my problem.  I waited for him to finish up his phone call, during that period of time he was joking and laughing with the person on the phone and not talking business,  so right away I could tell that this is going to be a waste of time. I should've walked out right there but I was stupid and stayed around.

Next I was seated with a personal banker who had a dual appointment with Bank of America and Merrill Lynch.

I gave him my ATM card and asked that he look up my accounts. I have three checking accounts with Bank of America and one savings.  I wanted to see if there was a way I could still keep one of my smaller checking account even though I wasn't going to have a minimum $1500 in that account at all times.  I was experiencing an $18 per month fee which would basically make the account pointless because I was going to be paying more in fees than I was getting out of it.  I keep that checkbook in my bag to pay simple league fees for shooting.  Even though it's been years since I was in college, Bank of America made simple modifications in the past and changed this small account over to campus edge checking.  I find out it has done away with that now because they just want more fees.  Don't make enough money and they want to squeeze their customers more?

The only thing that this guy wanted to do was help me move my brokerage accounts and my profit-sharing and 401(k) over from Wells Fargo. I told him that I just wanted to avoid the $18 per month checking account fee on this 16 year old account THEN he had to get up and go talk to a branch manager. He came back he said that he and the branch manager talked about it because I don't have direct deposit or the minimum amount that they wanted that there was no way that they can help me.  It was basically ridiculous and Bank of America sucks for charging continuous fees for a customer that they have had since the 1990s.  If it wasn't so much trouble for me to change banks I would do it then I'd have to figure out a way to notify all of the companies that I have making automatic debits from my other checking accounts.  I'm half tempted to do it if this keeps up I think I will.

This location despite being very busy has some good directorial firces that makes it run like a well oiled machine. In particular, Sahar Arghavan , one of the managers, is a sweetheart and does a phenomenal job of making sure the tellers are doing their job well, people do not wait too long, and explain things in very detailed manner. I had a very easy job opening an acct with no minimum  fees and got alotta advice on why to open a savings acct and what interest rate. Ill be banking here for a longtime when I visit Vegas.

susan r. must have been there on a bad day.

I find this to be one of the best locations to NOT have to get out of the car. 2 drive thru ATMs that move very fast and no crazy traffic around. A very convenient Chinatown bank

I recently moved to Las Vegas to buy a home. The management and staff at this branch were exceptionally friendly and helpful. After only a few visits they greet me by name. I needed to prove to a mortgage company that I had made a deposit in the Bank of America. The manager went out of his way to see that my funds had cleared and provided me with a statement to give to the mortgage agent. It saved our deal. I will probably drive all the way to this branch from Summerlin if I need to go to a bank in person.

Sunwest has been my bank of choice for the last 15 years! I was so happy for this new location to open and I'm even more pleased with the new renovations made to the building.

The staff here is by far one of the most genuine, kind groups of people I have ever come across in a business. I have yet to visit this location and have a bad experience. The tellers are always smiling and greet me with a friendly hello (which we all know on certain days can be the highlight of our day) The Branch manager here Loree is an all-star! She used to be at the main location (Black Canyon Freeway and Cactus) but is now working at this new location on Bell. Loree is always willing to go above and beyond to help out customers (even staying a few minutes past closing hours when I annoyingly stroll in five minuets before they close... Sorry Loree :] ) She is extremely knowledgeable and trustworthy (obviously this is extremely important when it comes to people who are dealing with my money). I've followed her to this location because I know I can always count on her to answer all my questions. Ed the older gentleman that works here is a hoot! I absolutely love his personality! He always brightens up my day by cracking a funny joke or just simply putting a warm smile on his face! The other tellers here are just as wonderful and always are in good moods which always makes for an enjoyable environment.

This credit union has low rates for personal loans around  7.90% which in comparison to other personal loans is extremely low so for this I do thank you! Sunwest is also insured by the National Credit Union Association which helps once again ease my mind. They have 7 locations around the state and also do shared branching which makes it easier for me and I'm sure other customers to deposit money regardless of what area of town you are in . I also like that you have several different options when it comes to managing your accounts. You can choose to have money transfers automatically take place monthly without having to set yourself a reminder, they have direct deposit available which for me is extremely helpful. This credit union also has overdraft protection fees which we all know is important. Another great selling point about this company is that they also have notary public services available at all of the seven branches, and ding-ding-ding these services are at no charge to members. 

So if you are sick of people you don't trust messing around with your money, if you're sick of outrageous interest rates and rude bank tellers make the switch to Sunwest and I'm sure you will be the happiest you have ever been with a Bank/Credit union!! Oh and I did forget to mention that if you suggest Sunwest to a friend or family member and they do go open an account I believe that Sunwest gives you 10  ( I'm not positive on the amount, but who cares its free money).

Thanks for making my life easy and hassle free if I could give this location ten stars I would!
Great customer service... And even better rates on our truck payment....

We went to apply for a car loan five days ago. It was a Monday and it was very busy -- they were extremely short staffed due to two employees not showing up. The teller encouraged us to apply online or by telephone. So we went home and did just that. What a fantastic service!  We were approved within minutes. They said they would hold our loan approval for sixty days and to go in to the branch when we could and they would do the paperwork. So we went in this morning (Saturday) and Sheila took very good care of us. Thank  you for the fantastic service!

If only I could give this location zero stars! I am so sick of coming here and seeing "out of service" screens on their ATMs. No other Chase branch has a problem like this one, I've been to at least 10 other branches the past few years and this location has had more issues I can remember than all the other ones combined. Last night both the drive-thru ATM and walk-up ATM were out of service. Seems like the management doesn't care about keeping their equipment functional.

I am not sure whether making this about Chase or this branch is more important.  I am Republican, but am almost rethinking the over capitalization of these big banks.  As with most I have checking and credit cards with Chase, which when working properly, is an ease to transfer to pay.

Now this branch.  My girlfriend and I went in to open a joint account with both of us already having Chase.  The PB was not very knowledgeable and might have had a long night.  I was ordered the incorrect debit card and it took over two weeks to straighten out.  Also the account for some reason was not accessible for 2-3 business days.

Given Chase being Chase as the standard, worst branch I have been to for technical service, sadly the effort was there.

It was a gigantic waste of time going to this office. They will only talk to you if you have an appointment. They did offer us a drink but that was about it. Disappointed with this offices professionalism. If you work during the day their business hours are very inconvenient. Why don't they have a person who just helps walk-in customers?
They have cookies, coffee and twizzlers.
Great company, they saved me hundreds on insurance premiums per year.  One on one customer service.

In considering my experience, (without exaggeration) this law firm doesn't deserve any stars. The lawyer assigned to me from this office was too busy for my case. He had so many other cases that he couldn't focus on the details of mine.  It was up to me to ensure that the court received the correct information in time for the projected court date. This place was terrible about returning phone calls, and/ or getting paperwork out on time.  Also, my case required that I appear in court. The lawyer assigned to me from this office reassured me that they would appear in my place. This was far from the truth. I was called a day prior to the court appearance to show up to court by 9am. I was fortunate enough to be available and appear on time. I could've handle this entire case myself but I decided to be on the safe side and hire an attorney. Even though I won my case, I would never use these people again. Winning the case is the only reason why I didn't take further action in reporting these individuals. They were very unprofessional and seemed incompetent at times. I am a very reasonable person, most people would not of put up with this level of unprofessionalism. So, this review is merely to help others and hopefully persuade them to spend their hard earned money at another law firm.

Note: My first contact with this Law Office was located on North 83rd near Peoria, AZ close to the Arrowhead Mall.

The service was great they are very thorough and helpful with everything concerning the legalities of my car accident.  But more importantly they care! So thank you for working my case Chad, and a very very special thank you to Amy Wagner for working my case as well you are amazing thank you for all your help and added compassion.

Absolutely Horrible!  It is Friday afternoon at 3:00 PM, I go to court Monday morning at 8:30 AM, I still can not get a hold of my so called Attorney.  I called the office numerous times, all I do is leave messages, no one ever calls back.  I never even spoke at all with my so called attorney, EVER!.  This is the first time I am dealing with this, and I'm left high and dry.  I have been waiting to go to court for 2 years, now what?  Thanks for nothing Phillips Law.  You are exactly why most people hate Lawyers.

Phillips law group SUCK.TOO bad ZERO STARS is not available. They took my case to court. The Lawyer who I met 5 MINUTES befor court clearly did not review my case,  and when the hired medical Dr said on transcripts that he was "on vacation and had only read 18"  of the 250 PLUS PAGES of documents my "lawyer" made one  remark ( that there were over 250 pages submitted) he did not argue or push my case because he doesn't care!! Iv worked and been forced to deal with 4 people in this firm they do NOT CARE about the disabled people!!!  they do not argue cases!!!!, they shuffle you around and once the case was denied they said " it's in MY BEST interest to get another lawyer " AND REFUSED TO RE SUBMITT. If u want to win a case DO NOT TRUST THEM you will tell your story for no reason. I gave them a perfect case and THEY BLEW IT. LOSER FIRM   Also THEY DISTROY ALL YOUR DOCUMENTS AND YOU CAN NEVER GET ALL YOUR DOCUMENTATIONS BACK.
Perfect banking location right off the freeway. There is plenty of parking and a walk up ATM. There is a business deposit box outside for business drop offs for quick or nightly deposits.

There's always just one teller working here along with a long line of pissed off people waiting.  Not sure why this location even exists if you're only going to have one location.  This is a good location and close to work.  But unfortunately, I was regret coming here because I have to wait 10-15 minutes.  They should this place into a Starbucks!

For the longest time we went with the impersonal style of insurance carrier where you don't have an agent--you just call in to an 800 number and hope for the best. The problem with that is that the person on the other end of the line doesn't know you from Adam and therefore has no real vested interest in you as a customer much less as a person. 

The best thing we ever did was switch from the impersonal online stuff to Chance Mikos. Chance treats every customer like a friend. He comes right to my home at times that are convenient for me about our insurance needs. He is never pushy or tries to sell me things I don't need. He doesn't try to oversell. As a family man himself he understands the dynamic of choosing the right products for the individual rather than trying to fit the individual into a box.
