He even takes the time to review my account and make suggestions or even to say hey, reviewed your account and we are right on target. 

Whenever I have a question, Chance is a phone call or email away. I can always count on him or a person from the office to get back to me promptly. While Farmers might not always have the cheapest price, I'm actually willing to pay a little more because I have a guy like Chance on my side looking out for me and for my family. 

Chance can count on us to be a customer for life.
The worst branch on the planet after waiting 25 minutes I finally walked out. They only have one person I can ever help you. Whatever you do do not go to this branch.

This bank is on the corner of 16th street and Osborn. There are two drive thru tellers and one walk up teller. The location seems to always be busy and has bilingual tellers to assist Spanish speakers. 

This is an older location which is not as modern as most BofA's but it is always clean. The tellers are friendly though plan on standing in life for a while as I mentioned it stays busy.

If I had a choice I would not rate it with a star at all. To start off the teller Saida Olivas asked me for an ID for a deposit when I have  never been asked before. The guy next to me did a large deposit and he was not asked for an  ID . She also kept speaking to me in Spanish as I kept responding in English I understand I look brown but that does not mean I speak Spanish. I felt she was doing it on purpose I will never go back to this location I felt discriminated. I hope somebody can talk to her and let her know you don't do that

My American Express cards all got cancelled - all FIVE !!  All of my cards were in good standing - never ever late - NOT ONE PROBLEM!!  So what the heck happened?  I added an additional user to one of my corporate cards as they ASK you if you want to do this all of the time...this additional card was set up to be used 95 % of the time - it's just how this card was set up.  I didn't use my card... Nobody ever said that this would cause a problem... I was never told this could be a problem and why would it be?  My accounts came up for financial review - now what the heck is that?  After weeks of calls and weeks of questions - LOTS AND LOTS OF QUESTIONS.  I finally got someone to tell me that my cards came up for review because I wasn't using my card on the corporate account and they wanted to be sure that I could support any and all charges that the additional card holder was spending.  Okay that is fair but I was exhausted now, the process to find out why I was being treated as though I did something wrong was exhausting.  Not to mention I am super busy running businesses and using Amex!  I supplied AMEX with everything they asked for - phone call after phone call.  Finally I got to what I was told to the end of the process and everything looked good but there was a form that they didn't like the size of the font...YES that is what they said!!  Are you serioius!!  If filling out this form incorrectly could cause an account to be closed shouldn't they have a standard form that you just sign??  Are they setting you up to fail?? I had submitted this form to them several times and they accepted it but now they wanted the font bigger.  I made it bigger but I guess this time I forgot to check a box and the font was too big on one area.  Did I get a phone call NO - was my financial documentation in order - YES - Could I support ALL Charges - YES!!  I was away on business the last couple of days and as I was paying for a taxi and my card didn't work.  I looked at my emails thinking - Oh Amex thinks this may be fraud and they are looking out for me...I got an email from AMEX telling me that my ACCOUNTS HAVE BEEN CANCELLED!!!  My twenty plus year relationship with them was DONE over a box not being checked and a font size!!!  ALL FIVE CARDS - a few I have Businesses that I RUN MY BUSINESS WITH AMEX.  Are you kidding me!!!  I didn't do anything wrong - no late pays - nothing nothing nothing WRONG!!!  American Express shame shame shame on you!!!   I am moving to the CHASE card never to return to AMEX - please join me - Stay away from AMERICAN EXPRESS !!

I moved to AZ recently and had a number of difficult insurance issues to address.  Chris helped me solve them all, even the ones he was making no money on.  His staff is helpful and all my question were answered promptly.

Professional, friendly Scottsdale, Arizona insurance agency with a very knowledgeable team.  The Roden agency is highly recommended for Auto Insurance, Homeowner Insurance, Business Insurance and Life Insurance.

I truly don't think I can say enough great things about Chris. He is the definition of customer service. A co-worker referred him to me as an excellent agent and I'm thankful she did.
Chris helped me find the best rate possible initially and has even continued to find me savings as years went on, all while making me feel comfortable and cared for as if I was family. If you are reading this review, stop now and call him for not only a great deal with exceptional coverage but also a great experience.
I have worked with Chris Roden for 24 years. He has been a trusted insurance partner in my life since college, marriage, babies and insurance policies. I highly recommend him.

Our loan was transferred to RoundPoint from NCUA and ever since then we have been consistently harassed and threatened via telephone and mail. As of January 2013 our loan with NCUA was transferred to RoundPoint Mortgage Corp. Since that time both myself and my husband have been harassed with phone calls and letters with threats to report negatively on our good credit if we didn't pay an extra payment because their system shows a payment is missing. I have provided copies of our bank accounts showing every payment was not only made, but, that they are set up and paid automatically via online bill pay with our banking institute. The payments are electronic payments so the funds are immediately in their account. I have faxed and mailed copies of our statements. I've filed formal complaints with RoundPoint the FTC and Charlotte BBB. I have spoken to countless representatives of RoundPoint inquiring as to which payment specifically they claim is missing. I have been told a different answer by each representative. Initially, it was the Nov 2012 payment that was paid to NCUA, then the Dec 2012 payment. Thereafter, I have been told it was the February 2013 payment and the April 2013 payment. We have received countless phone calls and each representative claims to not have any knowledge of all the information I have provided and will not let me speak to a supervisor. If I persist they will then relent and say they can see in the notes in the system where I have provided copies of my bank statements. I have contacted our banking institute and opened inquiries on each individual payment. I filled out a Third Party Authorization form with RoundPoint allowing them to discuss our account with a representative of our banking institute. I have provided copies of the Oct & Nov checks paid to NCUA as those were the payments needed per the conversation between RoiundPoint & our Bank representative. In addition to speaking to representative on a near daily basis since January 2013, I have asked to speak to a supervisor and am always told "they're in meeting." When I asked how it was possible that they were always in meetings January through April every time I am speaking to a representative the girl told me, "well, they're meetings are back to back." THey are threatening foreclosure, threatening to report us delinquent to the credit agencies and the only solution we've ever been given is "pay an extra payment." The issue is within their company, they can't tell me specifically which payment is missing, as I stated each representative says it's a different one. During one phone call I was told their system shows all the payments were made but the April payment shows "blank." When I asked what that even meant, she said, it looks like someone entered the payment but not the amount paid! How am I supposed to rectify problems within their system? I have done everything I know to do to provide proof of our payments. We are being treated as though we are bad debtors. We are being harassed with threats of ruining our excellent credit if we don't comply to their "solution" of paying an extra payment." Their representatives are not helpful but refuse to let me speak to a supervisor. Most recently when I complained about the consistent phone calls and the fact that I had provided all proof of payments the representative said, "I can see where we call you a lot & I will remove your number from our system so we won't be able to call you." While I appreciate the idea, it does not solve the problem that they're not fixing their system to accurately show our payments have all been received. I have sent faxes to various representatives and departments...Rodney, The Cashier's Dept., Jeffrey Engstrom & The Payoff Req Dept. in the hopes that someone in any of these departments will follow through on this and make sure it is properly resolved. I have spoken to Amanda, Julie, Jonathan, Jason, Rodney & Yosef in addition to others I wasn't able to write down. Even after all this they still continue to threaten us with foreclosure and a negative credit report!

Every single review is on point, these people are galactically stupid. I have been calling daily for a month to get an update on my account and refund which they OWE ME with 0 success.  They also keep telling me on the phone I will receive a call from them. Really? Has anyone ever gotten a call from the DMV telling them, surprise, we owe you money!? I think not.  I have spoken with pseudo supervisors, requested expedited service, sometimes I called 3 times a day, and each time I received different response.  It is utterly exhausting and ridiculous.

when my loan got transferred to Roundpoint, I read all the negative reviews, and flipped out. lol I called my lender, and she said they were a reputable company, and most of the people complaining were people who didn't pay their bills on time. 

I can't speak for the rest of them, but Roundpoint has been fantastic with me. I have had ZERO issues with them. Set up automatic withdrawals and forget about it.

This is an unbelievably bad mortgage company. 
They misapply payments, they bill you multiple times A MONTH but the worst is they leave you on hold for HOURS when you call to ask how they possibly could have misapplied your DOUBLE MORTGAGE PAYMENT so it shows that THAT YOU DIDN'T PAY IT AT ALL. Totally, utterly incompetent mortgage company. RUN AWAY.

This has been a very hairy and distasteful ordeal for us with RMP. They seemed to be working their best NOT to send us our funds due after our water loss. 

Thanks to my lengthy initial Yelp review discussing our RMP nightmare, we received an immediate message response offering assistance from the Social Media Manager, Omar P.. We wish we'd have had such diligent and consistent follow up from the beginning but alas, such wasn't the case. 

We filed a complaint with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau today as recommended by a few fellow helpful Yelpers, just in case this was another "pretending to get things finalized" by RMP loss draft department.

This all should not have gotten to this point and would not have had RMP done right by their clients. Thank you Omar! He actually deserves a 5* rating for his diligence and respectful handling of our case. He helped move our reimbursement process along in one week while we'd been dealing with RMP shenanigans for over 2 months. Today's midnight update at RMP reflects payment status FINALLY pending.

Hopefully Omar can continue working to change the course of things for the better for clients who deal with problems with RMP loss draft tom foolery and imbecility.
Worst ever Mortgage company..  Every year RoundPoint using threatening letters to request insurance information even do they know its for large condo complex. Run away and don't looks back.

I wish Yelp had the option to give zero stars, because I'm so passionate about this review, it pains me to even give them 1 star.

My former mortgage company (Cobalt) has been fabulous since I purchased my home in Oct 2011 (first-time homebuyer). I was bummed when I rec'd notice they were  transferring to Roundpoint in early Dec 2013. But, I know this happens and is normal.

First and foremost, I could not even get a human rep on the phone with the # provided on the letter. I had to dig and Google alternate numbers to get a human. I was then told I had a 60-day "grace period" by this rep to get everything set up and not worry about mortgage payments, late fees until 2/3/14. Okay, great! I documented this, of course.

Last Friday, I find a "Confidential" door hanger on my front door. WTF? I open and find myself "delinquent" w/Roundpoint? What??? I call them today and speak w/Crystal. She was pretty blasé and tells me I owe almost $3k in back mortgage and basically that I must have misunderstood or gotten bad info last Dec. I calmly read back my documentation to her. She again apologizes.

Long story made short - I still need to cough up the back $, but can do it over 3-mo period to soften the huge blow.

Guess I wouldn't be so passionate if I was working right now, but I'm on Short Term disability due to ACL surgery and only getting 60% of paycheck. GREAT fucking timing!!!!!

I'm not impressed and very upset w/this entire situation. I'm not a person who would just blow something like this off. I want my Cobalt Mortgage back. :(

Horrible customer service!
Over a month since I paid off  the loan and still no check for the escrow funds. This is fraud.

Can we put a -10 review.  They may be fine in the beginning, but watch out.  We were promised our escrow check when we re-financed to another company.  On the computer it says it was mailed on 08/19.  I called last week and the lady said call Monday as that would be 10 days.  No check Monday, so called and was told it really was not mailed as it had to go with a document which was not sent until 08/24.  Of course no documentation on-line about that.  Also I was dealing with people in the Philippines.  They would not do a stop payment and would not do an electronic transfer to checking account.  They are however collecting interest on our money.  We were never late with a payment, but they are criminal.

RoundPoint acquired my mortgage after I refinanced with another company. I made my payments on time, and everything was good - until I had a need for customer service. They contacted me regarding a payment made to my home insurer and wanted me to pay them back. I don't escrow, so I called my insurer. They confirmed that RoundPoint had paid them for a year of insurance as part of my refinance. Sounded good to me, so I paid them back. A month later I happened to come across the paperwork for the refinance, and a quick review showed that I had paid for that year of insurance as part of the closing (which I now know is common). I thought this was a simple mix-up, and I paid twice. They should be able to check that and remedy it, or show me that I'm wrong. I've contacted them by phone several times, and eventually I was told to email them. I did that and only got an automated response - that was January 13th; never heard from anyone looking into it. I called back and asked for a real person's email address. Qadirah Ellison has managed to ignore my emails from January 20 and 29. I ended up sending a letter with the HUD statement by certified mail which they received on February 17th. I called today to check on the status of that and was told they don't have any updates and to email them (that was rich). Today I submitted a complaint with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau, but it's sad that it has come this far. I hope to update this soon, but for now 1 star!

Awful. Stay away. Our mortgage was sold to them back in January.  I believe everything would be fine if you never need to speak to them. If you do need to contact them, be prepared to be on hold for days. I initially tried to call them back in April, on hold for average of 45 mins each call. When you finally get someone on the phone, good luck understanding them. They have an office in Manilla which I unfortunately always seem to get. I asked my question, which should be simple, and didn't get an answer. I was transferred, while on hold again call for an additional 15 minutes, all of a sudden the call was dropped. This happened around 4 more times. Finally reach someone that I could understand and she informed me you can request to speak to the US office but somehow I feel like an awful person making this request. Either way, I was told to send an email. I received email confirmation that my email had been received. However, I didn't hear from them again. I called them again....same issues. Finally on March 27, over a month later I received a letter in the mail with instructions for my request. I still needed to speak with someone though. I began the impossible process to get someone on the phone that I could understand and that actually had answers to my questions.  It is now nearing July....still no answer and a seemingly impossible company to have a conversation with. Stay away at all cost.

I know I'm the only person in this crowd that isn't angry with RoundPoint for one customer service issue or another, but maybe that's related to people only reviewing mortgage companies when they are angry.  Check my other reviews and you can see I too have had a bad mortgage experience with another provider.  Regardless, Round Point acquired my loan about a year ago.  Truthfully, I have had to call twice about a discrepancy in my payment amount or the escrow balance being incorrect.  Not sure I love that it got screwed up somehow on two occasions, but I can say that the customer service people I worked with on both occasions were helpful, gave me a clear resolution time and delivered on it.  To that end, I have been happy with my service there.  I also like the online bill payment system. It's clear and flexible with how I apply my payment. They are a step up from my previous provider.

They are getting one star only because zero stars is not an option.  In September they asked me to provide proof of my insurance.  I promptly did this and I was told everything was fine.  Then they took $500 out of my checking account to pay for "missing insurance"  I have spent over two hours on the phone trying to get my money back.  Each time they say, "a check is on its way"  It has been almost a month and I still don't have my money back.
Truly dishonest and awful company.

I was asked to write the review here instead of under Roundpoint Mortgage Company  because even though they have the EXACT same physical address, website, and email domains...they are in fact not the same company...really?!?!?!  But ok i'll just leave this review up under BOTH sites.

My loan was transferred from a GREAT mortgage company to Roundpoint late last year.  Since then a NUMBER of problems have happened with my account.

1) When my loan was first acquired i began to receive calls that i had not paid my last payment to my PREVIOUS mortgage company.  I told them I paid the last lender and that whatever is wrong needs to be worked out between my previous lender and roundpoint.  I received a call EVERYDAY for 3 weeks regarding this issue. Every person i spoke to would say they would make a note of my payments and check with my past loan provider.  No one ever called them.  I provided check numbers of the payment and transaction numbers, they still called.  Finally i called my previous lender myself, they told me ROUNDPOINT NEVER PAID FOR MY LOAN.  I was getting calls about a loan that they hadn't even funded completely.  How does something like this happen?

2) Roundpoint begins telling me i don't have hazard insurance, which i most certainly did otherwise i wouldn't be able to have my house.  A week of phone battles between my insurance company and roundpoint and myself finally proved that i do in fact have hazard insurance and no one knows why i got the letter and calls.

3) A month after that i needed roundpoint to pay my TX windstorm insurance as it is a REQUIREMENT for home ownership where i live.  My insurance company called several times and was told they were not able to escrow it. I called several times and was never able to talk to anyone in the escrow dept.  Every time i called i was sent to a new agent who would then put me back in the queue for the SAME dept.  Finally i called and was angry enough to actually get someone to put me directly in touch with the escrow department.  The lady i spoke to said that adding the insurance to the escrow account would be no problem and that they would pay my insurance company immediately.   Why did i have to go through a week of people telling me they can't do it when it only took 1 person in the correct dept. to say it could be easily done?

4) This is the big one.  A new year has started and i wanted to check and see if roundpoint had updated my tax and insurance information for the new year.  They had not.  My insurance had dropped in premium price in October, they still had the old balance up.  I then asked the agent ot check and see if my taxes had been updated for 2014.  She said, they were using the SAME TAX INFORMATION FROM THE PREVIOUS YEAR (is that legal to just reuse outdated data).  That's just lazy, no one had called my county tax collector to get updated information on my property, so they felt it would be OK to just use what i had last year regardless of if it went up or down.  God forbid it has gone up and i didn't check and i find out i have to come out of pocket at the end of the year to settle what my underfunded escrow account couldn't.

I'm not sure if it's incompetence or just plain lazy but these mistakes seem to happen ALL the time.  You don't make it easy to speak to a representative, and when you do find one they have a tendency to say "let me look into this and we'll call you back" which NEVER happens.  When you call back, and tell them you called the day before they tell you they don't have a record of that or the person you spoke to.  It's frustrating to work with this company and if they could just sell my mortgage to b of a or somewhere i would be so happy.

They put me on hold for 35 minutes to speak to a supervisor and no supervisor had the decency to pick up the phone. Customer service refuse to give supervisor's name because of "privacy" issues. Really? You asking for my name, SSN, address, phone, but cannot give a supervisor's name??? Something or EVERYTHING is really wrong with people like that. They cannot take any accountability for what they do, and obviously they don't know how to do it. Go back to where you came from and get some education and training. Because of people like you who try to be somebody, the financial system is where is now.
Thank you Omar for your delightful customer service, kindness and understanding. I am glad to have Roundpoint Mortgage service my loan.

Pretty poor excuse for a financial institution. On Friday at about 1pm, I went to this branch in to have money wire transferred to an account at a different bank.  

When I was at the bank, the rep I was working with in one of the front cubicles had to go to the "back office" several times to check on things.  When I asked why it was taking so long (over 45 minutes) he advised that they want to make sure it had not gone through twice.  Friday evening I checked my account online and could see that my account had not been charged for the amount of the transfer and thus I knew it had not been successfully processed.

Saturday morning I talked with the branch manager and she didn't have a clue.  Said there was some kind of a "computer glitch", that the transfer department was closed till Monday morning and that she'd follow up then.  A "computer glitch" at a bank?????  Wow, what a confidence builder that is.  Also, no call to me on Friday to let me know that there was a problem with processing the transfer so I could let the intended recipient know.  They knew they were having some issues while I was at the branch ("making sure it didn't go through twice") but yet no management initiative to ensure that was supposed to happen did actually happen.  Wow...another confidence builder!!!!

Two of the reps I have done transactions with at this location, Alex and Jose, have been excellent.  The third, who shall go unnamed, like his manager this morning on my call about the wire transfer, didn't have a clue.  The transaction that day was getting a Medallion stamp for a financial transaction.  For over an hour I sat in his cube while he was on the phone with someone who seemed to know less about the process than he did.  One of the two of them said they needed to see an account statement to "prove ownership".  It of course doesn't and the manager acknowledged that they needed to know the value of the account in order to issue the correct type of Medallion.  Who fabricated the BS about a simple account statement proving ownership is unknown and it doesn't matter nor should they be in a position of providing information to customers. 

So, so far, 4 visits; two handled efficiently and two (wire transfer and Medallion stamp) were failures in the initial visits on each.  Even in the worst scenarios of grading on a curve, 50% is usually a failure grade.  And, that is what Chase has done: failed to perform.  With that abysmal performance, other than cashing a personal check, which is pretty hard for even Chase to screw up, it looks like I need to select a new financial institution for handling anything else.

If I can choose 0 star I would, because this location is one of the worst locations I have ever been into, people are rude management are idiots and nobody gives a fuck about you. You could be waiting in line for a good 30 minute and nobody even apologize for the wait.

Chase is the best Bank in Las Vegas.
I love people that works for Chase .
So friendly and helpful.
Thanks Chase for making my life easier :)
Horrible time management at this location! Lack of professionalism for guests waiting in the lobby.

This is by far the SLOWEST bank eithvthe longest wsit time I have ever encountered. They are completely under staffed. They were taking so long to get to customers who were there before me that some people walked out because they were waiting too long.I am completely dissatisfied with the lack of staff on board to help at this branch.

Worst bank. On a Monday there is 2 bankers to help and one teller open. Unbelievable. They have someone in the lobby to help get people in line and direct them on how to use the ATM and that system is a complete fail. Over 30 minute wait to speak to someone at all times. Unbelievable.

Painfully slow service. Waited in line for 30 minutes. Maybe they are just short staffed. Looks like the manager is just walking around instead of helping people. Next time I'm in town I'm going to a different branch.

I had a great experience with Round Point when filing my insurance claim.  If it weren't for the professional help of Omar, I would have been lost!  Thank you Round Point and Omar for making a customer very happy!

Regards,
Lauren

Long story short. When I had received my supplemental tax bill I contacted roundpoint and they told me not to worry about them. Then a few weeks later I get another bill with late penalties. After almost a month and several frustrating phone calls I was told a manager (Shamika) would listen to the recording of my original conversation and if the employee did in fact tell me not to worry about the supplemental tax bill that they would refund me the penalty. I was going to be called back in no more than 72 hours. This was over 2 weeks ago . I've tried calling multiple times  and she's always in a meeting, apparently with all of the other managers because they won't respond to me either. During this time they did my escrow analysis and sent me a check with my surplus and told me my supplemental tax bill had to be paid with that amount. After telling me that they STILL paid my first supplemental tax bill leaving my escrow in the negative, which increased my monthly payment. When I called about this, nobody could help me. I'm really really really disappointed in this company and I'm so frustrated that my head is going to explode. I'm helpless and don't know what to do at this point.

If I could leave zero stars, or better yet, a negative star rating I would! This company is run by unprofessional hacks. They claimed to be our mortgagee after an assignment yet could not produce one shred of evidence to show they serviced our mortgage. To call themselves "servicing" is truly a joke. They have no original note on the property and had their service hire an insurance assessment company break into our home and steal from us. After hiring an attorney to iron out the details, they said they were closing our file. We are still waiting for them to prove that they do, in fact, hold our mortgage. We have asked them to produce the original note to prove they own our mortgage. They do not return calls. They do not contact their customers directly..they will ignore all pleas for paperwork or proof. They were not licensed in the state in which our home exists..yet they claim to be the servicing agent? Our attorney has been calling them repeatedly but to no avail. The frustration with Round Point is beyond exhausting. RUN RUN RUN! Do not work with this company. There are plenty of other companys out there with a good track record and decent rates.

The customer service is the absolute worst...rude, curt, nasty and even some childish, spiteful reps. Unfortunately, my mortgage was sold soon after the closing so RP was not my choice. My plan is to refinance with my reputable bank JUST to get away from RP....they suck. I absolutely despise calling for any reason and I do so very reluctantly. I have no issues other than the customer service is much less than subpar and hold times are longer than necessary. If you do have a choice, don't choose RP.

Had to provide documents multiple times during escrow when timelines were tight. 

RP was not disbursing my PMI to their provider, which lead to a mistake on my tax forms. 

RP did not get back to me with a PMI question.  Rep was unable to answer on the phone, said they would get back to me, never did. 

RP actually included my wife's CAR INSURANCE in our escrow after I added her to my car insurance policy.  Yes, they actually did that. I caught it.  Surprising that no one from RP thought it was weird that our hazard insurance when from $600 to $1200.  

RP underestimated our monthly payment (taxes and homeowner's insurance) by over 5%.  So much for that good-faith estimate.  

Wouldn't lend from them again.
Horrid Service, inconsistent, no communication, loss mitigation is non existent and this is a foreclosure mill along with Queens Park Oval Assets

After listening to the latest conversation my wife had with this company I've decided that I'm going to refinance and get away as fast as possible. I don't care if it costs me money, I don't want to give them another dime.

A few months ago we got our statement and it was almost $100 more than it should be. We called, got one story, called again, got another story, this happened about five times.

Even after we figured out why this happened, and made the appropriate adjustments it seems to not matter.

My wife finally did reach someone helpful in their insurance office, she went above and beyond to try and help get our issue settled. She conference called my wife to the customer service dept. this broad was rude from the get go, literally went off on the insurance person that was trying to help, she demanded that she hang up and let her deal with my wife. The lady couldn't because it disconnect my wife's call. Rude ass kept saying that she can just call back. Needed up demanding to speak with another supervisor named "Marco". So he gets on, she goes off, he's like "really, you're doing this with a customer on the phone?"

Bottom line is the people in that viper pit of a customer service office must get off on jerking people around and providing minimum service possible.

I refuse to feed the beast that is roundpoint any longer. I am going to refi with someone like USAA etc... At one point I was determined to call their corporate office and set shit straight if my next payment was incorrect. But after our latest experience I'm convinced that their unethical business practices is systemic throughout the entire organization and escalation of my issue will probably be an exercise in futility and lead to only more confusion and inept service.

This is a 30 year pain in the ass I don't want to deal with. I bet they have a real shitty CEO too.

My loan got sold to Roundpoint last year. Have had issue after issue after issue. They didn't pay my homeowners and it took me and State Farm 6 months to get them to do it. They said they mailed a check...no check...this happened for months. Now they have screwed up and doubled my homeowners insurance amount in the escrow and I am currently on my 5th call to them in 4 weeks trying to get it resolved. Keep getting told it will be fixed, I will get a call back, etc...of course it never happens. They are absolute morons. I'm going to do my best to post a bad review everywhere I can and to report them to the BBB. Oh, and btw, I pay my mortgage on time.

Mary and her team handle all of my insurance needs from the car, home and professional.  Mary takes a personalized approach to fit my needs.  When my son was in a minor fender bender, I felt like I was calling family.  Mary made sure I was taken care, and her team followed up to make sure all of my needs were met.  I recommend Mary to all of my friends and family, and the icing on the cake with Mary is that she is an active member giving back to our community.  Thank you, Mary and team!  You all ROCK!!!!

I originally placed a comment on yelp in regards to the lack of service from this agents office. The fact is this agent has a complete lack of understanding of listening and acknowledging issues that arise.
Such as incorrect information, my policy information being sent to someone that I had requested not be sent certain information. as well as incorrect information stated and the lack of taking responsibility. 
I recently received a call from the agent Mary advising me she had received my request to switch agents, which I sent much earlier on. The agent had taken a lengthy amount of time to transfer my policy, which I confirmed does not take much time to take place. Even after my policies where transferred to the new agent she or her office still failed to send everything over which caused a delay in obtaining a life insurance policy. Mary personally requested I remove my yelp page comment. I advised I would not. She explained that she feels its incorrect. I explained she can comment on my review as I have done for my own personal business. I advised her I felt it was very unethically for her to ask me to remove it. 
At that point the conversation came to end.
Today 10/13 I received an email from Yelp reference case 5065974 advising me they had removed my review of yelp because it had been brought to their attention by the yelp community that it fell outside of their content guidelines because it did not provide enough detail. It a little funny that someone had said that to yelp, after receiving a verbal request from Mary herself to remove it. I will pursue this unethical action further.

Mary is a great professional and a dedicated supporter of the community. She is knowledgeable and always available to provide insight and advice.  Definitely someone who you should look to for advice and guidance.

All the 5 star reviews for Mary are probably true, but those folks have never needed her service. I want to start by saying I have been a long term customer of Mary's. Over 10 years. I was recently in a car accident on a hot 115 degree day. I called mary's office and spoke with Heidi. I asked her to walk me through the process. She took general info from me and transferred me to some guy who said he couldn't help me and that my agent should have gone over the details of what I needed to do next. So I hang up and call Mary's office again. No answer. I call again. No answer. I call again ( please know it was 115 degrees outside and I had 2 small children with me). Heidi answered again but could not give me any information. She said she could not help me that I could talk to claims about the process. I asked what my deductible was, I asked if I had rental coverage, I asked if my car would be towed.... She said she could not help me and transferred me to the clowns department again who told me that since it was after 1pm on Saturday that would not get a rental car for me until Monday. Even though I have coverage for it. They also told me because of the time I would need to have my car towed at my expense and submit for reimbursement. Even though I have coverage for it. I had to call them back 4 more times that day asking additional questions and their response was we can help you on Monday during business hours. Very disappointed. 10 years of paying premiums and he first time I need to use them .... I was on my own.
Mary is such a passionate person. She takes the time to understand the your unique situation and needs. She works hard to find the best plan for the buck.

If I could I would use less than a star. I think it's rediculous that they wouldn't accept change "coins" and gave me sleeves and had me do it myself. Isn't it there job to count money? So I had to sit down and do there job whilst they checked there Facebook status...

Unacceptable in my opinion. Coins are legal tender... I could maybe understand if I wasn't a part of this bank or if I had $200 in coins...

When I made the girl accept the remainder of my change that wasnt enough for the paper sleeves she was angry and lengthened the time that it took her to receive my deposit... as if there was anyone actually there or they were actually busy.

I will be switching banks/using a different branch that's out of my way..

I personally do not bank with Chase, but the business I run does. Also I pay my rent through Chase because that's the bank the realty company uses. 

My first time using this location, I showed up at 5:15 PM on a Tuesday night to deposit some cash for the business, and even though the branch didn't close until 6PM, all tellers were already shut down and I was told I would have to come back. A bit annoyed I said okay and planned on coming in the next day.

We recently had a change in the business and had a new account set up. The next time I came in I was trying to find the new account number and asked the teller if she could fill out the deposit slip for me while I look for the account number as I was in a rush. She rolled her eyes and said okay. The entire time she was helping me she kept saying " We won't do this for you every time. You need to fill out your own deposit slip next time" and basically treated me like I was some huge burden, even though there wasn't a single person in line. 

Now I understand that there are procedures and that need to be followed and I should have been more prepared, but the attitude and just all around poor costumer service I have had at this branch was frustrating. It definitely makes me grateful for the bank that I use for my personal account.

First US Bank that I have been to that doesn't have a change counter. I was insulted when the young attendant told me he'd give me coin rolls so I could roll them myself. My God what has happened to customer service.

Can I just say " OUTSTANDING SERVICE" I will never ever change banks as long is this location is here, they are the most caring and fantastic people I have ever encountered, they really mean it when they say, "We'll take care of you" I'm so delighted to come in each time and each time they have delivered to make a better experience. Great example to what Customer Service should be all about. In my opinion should be the continues core to retain happy  customers.
Randy is the one to see. Sanctuary Bail bonds is the best place to go to when you need action now. 5 star 100%

I'm a criminal defense attorney and have been referring clients and their families to Sanctuary for a number of years now.  I was one of the lucky ones that got to work with Jill before she moved on.  I was happy to introduce Jill to dozens of my criminal defense attorney friends because Sanctuary does a top notch job at what they do.  I've never received negative feedback from anyone I gave their number to; in fact, it almost always results in a sincere thank you.  When I need to get bonded out, I'm going to call Sanctuary!

I have practiced as a criminal defense attorney for over a decade.  When I know I have clients who will need bail services and a clear explanation of the process, I always refer them to Sanctuary Bail Bonds.  They work tirelessly to ensure that my client and my client's family understand the process and I know that they would treat my client with the respect and care that I do.
Very professional and excellent customer service. My clients always seem happy with their services.

I have been with this credit union for many many years through many name changes. They are always very helpful and courteous. I like the upgrades to the ATM machines..no envelopes or deposit slips adding the cash deposit is awesome.  I missed that when I closed down my other checking account with a major bank 7 years ago. However, having to deposit checks one deposit at a time is cumbersome and annoyed me and the people behind me.

We were recommended by a family friend customer services was great the only down fall is we had applied for a consolidation they told us they would get back to us in one day yet it has been over a week we call and to check the status of our loan and they tell us they will return the call back and we never get a call back from them. Never again doing business with this branch!!

I have been with America First Credit Union since 1993 I believe they were Network Credit Union back then. I now use the Las Vegas Shadow Creek Smith's Branch They are the  Best and always helpful with all my banking needs. A-1 Operation.I wish I could give them 10 no 1000 stars.

I had to take the Life, health, and accident producer licensing exam for a new job. 

This, by its very nature, is a shitty thing. 

Ford Schools made it slightly less so. They say the pass rate is around 50% for the exam. I passed. Ergo, 4 stars. 

The course was  2 1/2 days of brain dump and the material was by no means stimulating. That being said, they were very thorough and the instructor had an abundance of experience. 

My only gripe was he had a tendency to over-politicize the material. Seriously, if he said Obamanation one more time, I was going to lose my shit. But, we are in Arizona after all, so I guess that comes with the territory. 

Overall, if you have to learn this, I would recommend doing so here.

I recently was referred to Ford Schools for fingerprinting as a process requirement for the state nursing application. I am very delighted for their services. I must have went at a great time, since there was only one other person being processed before me. My visit was very short, literally in and out. The processor was pleasant and we struck up a very nice conversation. I highly recommend Ford Schools for your fingerprint background check and it was affordable.  :)

I needed to transfer a title on a Saturday morning. The process was fairly painless, though the line was looooong. There were 4 people working and we still had to wait about 30 minutes.

This is a great one stop shop. You can transfer a title, get a license plate on the spot, and sign up for insurance too.

Overall, I'm very happy with Jack Maggs.

2 months ago I came there to register my car. They refused to register because it was gifted and it was out-of-state. They said that I have to show papers that previous owner paid the tax. A tax amount was written on the title. But lady said it Will not work. She said that I have to get another paper and refused to serve me. She gave me Bull crap story about department of revenue that gonna call me that's why she can't do that. 

I went to AAA and that worked out just fine because tax amount was written on the title. They said it's sufficient.

I've never been inside this place - I never go inside banks really anymore. There is one cash machine here and three lanes to talk to a teller from your car. Even though there is only one ATM and this bank is on busy Mayfield road I have never had a long wait in line. This branch is located on a corner so it makes getting out of the parking lot back onto the street a bit easier.
This is the best bank I've ever had. The employees are always so nice. There is plenty of parking and you never have to wait long in line, if there is a line.

I HIGHLY recommend Dollar Store Services to anyone that is looking to open up their own business and is committed to putting in the time and effort to build their business. I opened up my dollar store a little over a year ago and I am very pleased with how the business is performing and continuing to grow. 

I have over 30 years of retail experience and was ready to go out on my own. I did a tremendous amount of research, looking into franchises, buying an existing business and other opportunities before I decided to go with Dollar Store Services. I absolutely made the right choice! 

Every person I encountered at DRSS was professional, knowledgeable, enthusiastic and eager to help. From the Real Estate Department to the Finance Department to the Merchandising Team, everyone did a great job of doing their part and ensuring I was satisfied and looking out for my best interests. Each phase was seamless. 

After they get your store set up and opened, they call you weeky to see how things are going and if there is anything they can help with. They also continue to be a resource for any concerns or questions you may have. This is not a give them their money company and never hear from them again. They continue to be involved and are available as needed in any aspect of the business. 

The bottom line is, you are paying for a service, but you are in control of all decisions. You choose the location. DRSS negotiates the lease, but you have final approval or disapproval. You choose the layout of your store and the merchandise you receive. You create the business name and most importantly the business strategy/plan. You must own it and be involved to make your business successful.

I am looking to open up more stores and will definitely be using Dollar Store Services as I grow and expand.

I recommend Dollar Store Services to anyone who is looking to open a discount store.  They are very helpful in giving you the information you need to get yourself started.  They do a great job with the store buildout, both in the planning stage and the implementation.  They told me the store would be ready within 5 days...and they had it done!  Russell Hecht has a vast knowledge of information, and calls me weekly to check on the store and answer any questions that I have.  Dollar Store Services doesn't just cut you loose after the store opens...they keep tabs on you to help you be successful.

I've been open since Nov 2013 and DRSS really helped me through the process of finding a location, financing, my leasing contract, merchandising, ordering and building/setting up my store and many other things.  Unlike owning a franchise, I felt I had a say in every step of the process and at any point IF I wanted to I could've stopped and said No to anything I didn't like/agree with.  Some owners might not like having a merchandise package pre-set for their 1st order/opening but it's truly the best way.  No one knows based on your location what is gonna be hot or not.  Just because it's hot in many other locations it might not be the hot item for your store.  So after the initial opening, you have 100% freedom to re order an item or choose something different based on customer feedback.  This isn't a franchise, do what you want. There is no sure thing in anything you do.  I've learned for my particular store to have a small amount of an item but have lots of variety and it has been great for me.  Some vendors might not be so flexible with having smaller case sizes for what you want and we've learned that there are SO many choices/other vendors to order from out there that we typically end up much happier than getting stuck with lots of something that didn't end up selling.  DRSS is very helpful anytime I need to call and ask for advice with a product or vendor or a display or anything at all.  Remember it's advice, it's not a franchise, do what you want. Some things work out great, others don't. You really just have to keep talking to your customers and find out what is popular for your location.  I also HIGHLY recommend attending trade shows like toyfest and ASD here in Las Vegas (they are here twice a year).  This gives you a chance to meet with current and new vendors, touch and play with new merchandise that might interest you and you can do this on your own or a representative of DRSS can spend time with you to help you as well, it's totally your choice.  All I can end with is what you get out of your business depends on the effort you put into it. It doesn't run itself.  Thank you DRSS for what you've helped me with and the flexibility to do what I want with my own business.

No more drive thru "live" service.  The first two lanes are closed, and the outboard lane (#3) is an ATM.  So you have to go inside if the ATM wont do the transaction.  This is so Bank of America.  Chase stood out for still having full service drive through lanes.
I was making a car payment with a credit union check so I needed to do it live.  It seems that the people who still do their banking without ATM's need to be hand held and walked through transactions. First of all this bank is very close to my home. Which makes it most good!!   2ndly they are always very friendly. Ran into this branch to talk to a business banker Madeline. Stopped in because hotel charged us twice and Chase issued us a temporary business credit and then reversed it. When into find out why they reversed it when we were do the credit. Got tired of arguing with this lady because she tried to tell me she couldn't find the charge. I told her she didn't know what she was talking about and I was going to go elsewhere. She remarked back to me but I didn't know what I was talking about. Very rude and unprofessional will never go back to this bank. We will be pulling our business from Chase because we are tired of having these little mishaps all the time. Clearly Chase employees only people that are completely clueless and can't even add. So if you're looking for a bank with people that can't even add and are basically useless when it comes to customer service this is the branch for you.

Good location in South Tempe by ASU off US-60, busy intersection.  I usually just use the ATM by the entrance, never really have to go into the lobby.  Good bank to put your monies in.  Definitely recommending it to everyone!

I wish negative stars was an option. This is BY FAR! The worst branch I've ever been to. The staff is rude, act entitled and unprofessional. Even the new people quickly change into negative jerks. I don't think I can stomach Chase because of this location:
Marilyn is a rude banker there that doesn't speak with professionals or respect let alone make proper eye contact. To me it feels like people are intimidated by her.

I plan on speaking to a regional manager about this location.

I wouldn't even give them one star but it's required in order to post. It's a shame that there is no service whatsoever. Person who came from the back room and stood behind the teller station responds to customer "oh, I'm not fully up yet." Not even a Hello! I don't even know how they operate in this manner! During the lunch hour, there is no one available to notorized for customers. The customer service is going downhill.

Big bank not  so great customer service- for a city where they call this  Big Bank home - it's lacking in love for the little guys. Most branches are doing away with drive thru so either you go in and wait forever or find another bank.

It's really nice working with Greg... it feels more like spending time with a friend then it does work.  He's more like a concerned and caring older brother....the guy you go to  when you go to a guy...kind of thing.  you  know he IS the guy.
 Well for me Greg IS that guy. I feel comfortable having my affairs of finance and future in his hands.  I know his guidance ,advice, has all of my best interests and needs in heart and mind.
I have dealt with other planners before.  Then I stopped. I was not impressed with what they did NOT do for me. I was not cared for or concerned about  and no progress was the progress. Since meeting and getting a feel for Greg's personality driven with his passion and genuine concern for me as a person...friend
I feel confident I am in the right place with Greg. No pressure . Easy to converse with. Greg has a  very good ear and insight to my needs as they change just through our talks and chats .
Good GUY ...thanks Greg.

I'm completely frustrated and disappointed. Their client completely ruined the right side of my car, and it is unquestionably his fault, which he admitted to. However, this insurance agency will not provide me with any wholesome answers. The accident occurred almost three weeks ago and they still have not given me an estimate of what they'll pay for in repairs. Changes in their customer service department - Scott is FANTASTIC!!!  So happy now!

Well, here we are on October 4 and still no acceptable offer of settlement. A word of advice here, in several states, if your vehicle is totaled, the insurance carrier is liable for the taxes you pay on your replacement purchase. Thank you Colorado legislature!
I guess they just don't like paying claims, how unusual! :-)
Very professional team. Answered all of my business financial questions. Would definitely refer this company to friends and family. Keep up the good work and thank you for your time.

I went in to open a new Chase Slate account for balance transfers and the agent first off entered the completely wrong name to the card, second, lied to me and told me that I was approved for a much lower APR than I actually was, third, he submitted a balance transfer without my permission! Completely illegal! I've now been with Chase for 2 weeks and I regret ever walking into this branch. I will go tomorrow and speak to a supervisor to try to fix the mess this employee did.

Of all the Chase Bank locations I've been to (which includes several states), this location is by far my favorite. The staff here is friendly, professional and efficient. I've never had to wait more than a minute, and the staff always processes my transaction quickly.

At other locations I get frequently annoyed at how the staff forces small talk. They notice my out of state ID, etc. and start chatting me up. Look, I didn't come to the bank to make friends, I came here to cash a check, make a deposit, etc. I don't have that problem at this location however. The staff is kind and makes me feel welcome but they don't waste my time and I really appreciate that.

They have a drive thru, a drive thru ATM and an additional ATM inside. If you like Chase (which I do), this location is one worth visiting.

Worst experience ever in every way!!! I walk into an empty chase bank and I'm thinking that wow this is my lucky day, I'm walking into the bank and it is not busy, I should definitely be able to get in and out rather quickly. I walked up to a teller and let her know I needed to do a name change ...would that be through her or  or where did I go she informed me it would be with a personal banker and that I should have a seat and someone would be right with me as soon as they were done helping the guests they were assisting. 

On a sidenote I had called customer service the day before to see if I can do the name change on the phone and they wanted me to come in person and were even kind enough to look up the closest location for me, which was the warm Springs and Durango location. The customer service rep on the phone let me know I should be able to walk in and get assistance no problem. 

After I sat there for 20 minutes on my lunch break one of the personal bankers freed up and walked right by me and welcomed someone else who had just sat down. I politely noted that I think I was next as I've been waiting, before they arrived. She rudely snapped her neck and looked at me and said wry rudely 
 Um did you make an appointment? With her eyebrows raised and face scowled. I said no, no one informed me I needed to make an appointment and she said they were strictly by appointment only and I needed to come back when I had one. She then took her appointment to her cube. 

At no time did anyone inform me that they were by appointment only and no one ever stepped out to say the wait is going to be awhile, or ask if I had an appointment, before letting me sit there twenty minutes. The teller told me to have a seat but never informed me of the policy either. 

I left upset and the started to become very upset and frustrated because I was just rudely talked down to and asked to leave after waiting a long time. I walked right back in walked and interrupted her with her clients and said you need to get a manager, I'm not gonna be refuse service and treated poorly and she told me her manager was busy and there was no one here to help me. I started yelling that I wanted her manager now. She went behind close doors and said it's going to be at least 15 minutes if I wanted to wait because she's busy.

So I waited and while I waited I called customer care and filed a complaint, they offered to call the branch and get someone to help me. I accepted, just shortly after they rang a person in a black suit came and called me by name and let me know she was taking me to someone who could help. She walked me to the business transaction line where the clerk had ultimate "bitch face" and asked what can I help you with rudely, I stared a simple name change while on the verge of tears. She said no I can't do that, you need an appointment, you will have to come back. I said really? Does the left hand not know what the right hand is doing I was just told I would be assisted and you are telling me no, come back when I have an appointment? Seriously? She said I can't help you, next in line please!!!! 

I walked out yelling that they cannot expect to keep customers being so rude and denying service and that they just lost all my business. You don't get to treat people with disrespect and yank them around for an hour it ended up being without providing any service or utility and basically ignoring me entirely even while I'm frustrated and upset. No one felt the urge to pull me aside or calm me down just to keep fueling the fire and treating me poorly. I am never going back to this location and I'll be damned if I need to bank with them there are too many places who actually enjoy their job and want to treat people kindly and not waste their time.

Visited this branch last week. Ask for someone to call and set up an appointment  to set up our accounts, no one called. We just stopped in again, no one available to set up our accounts. 10+ cubicles for bankers to work but only 2 working. Banking elsewhere now.

Getting refinance on my car. Great service ask for Shue  He is the best for your banking needs I got my higher interest cc transferred to a lower no annual fee and no transfer fee up to 2 months so I am saving 400 dollars each month.  I am a happy camper.

***Yelp Challenge 2016 9/100***

I left the branch on Rainbow and 215 because of the customer service and came to this branch. They welcomed me with open arms and the customer service is great! Always make sure to make an appointment!

It is 9:30 and the bank is closed. However they're hours read they open up at 9am. ??? I had opened three accounts with them and had to go in three times to fix errors they made on the account. They cost me money! I didn't wait long for each visit and the reps were very nice but they really messed up my accounts!!! Since they're not open I went to Wells Fargo which is across the street to do what I needed to do. Funny thing is the two other people in the parking lot waiting on Chase is also at Wells Fargo. Also their drive thru ATMs are always out of service. Very frustrating dealing with this branch. But Chase is over all a good bank which is why we keep them for our personal and business accounts.

5 star rating for my man,

Jared Lindsey!

I always come back because I 
appreciate his high calibre of service and is always on point!

Thanks you for always being incredible. 

Kind regards,

-Jordan
I worked with Chelsea for my insurance, Her team was amazing and didn't skip a beat during the process. Best part is that Chelsea is always there when ever we have questions.

Chelsea is great!  She is very knowledgeable and helpful in making sure I had the right coverage to protect my business and equipment. She's always available to help with   questions to make sure I understoof my policy. I wiuld highly recommend her!!

I can't say enough good things about Chelsea's agency.  She is fantastic!  She is always happy to help and goes out of her way for her clients.  I am so impressed by her hard work, and even more so by the personal attention. The best part about getting insurance with Chelsea is that she educates you about what your insurance options are and what the best way is to get a better rate.  Not many businesses today care enough to do that.  You can overpay or underpay and not be insured correctly when buying insurance- Chelsea really pays attention and knows her stuff!  I highly recommend Chelsea for all of your insurance needs!

Best experience I've had with an insurance agent!  Just moved to Az and got my renters and car insurance.  Whole experience was great and any questions I had via email were answered immediately. I would definitely recommend Chelsea for anyone needing insurance!!

Don't even deserve 1 star. Most rudest UN knowledgeable staff I have ever felt with. I had 4 pounds of sterling silver. You guy's advertise you pay the most and can prove it? I can prove you wrong. They magnetic tested on item and there was a slight resistance, so he refused and said everything I had was fake except for a silver bowl which they offered 20 cents a gram. Which was only 45 dollars. You are taking More than half of the profit. 
Which now because of your dickish staff, you lost out big time.

This place only gets 3 starts because Laura was really helpful and fast !!! While everyone else got done with 1 customer she would be done with 2-3 I was getting really frustrated with the slow service until she helped me in less than 5 minutes

Fantastic work...we just love Irene.  With her assistance I was able to take my first real vacation in 5 years and feel confident that my books would be kept up while I was gone.

We will definitely use Kufner Bookkeeping Services again..hopefully soon!  Vacation was really nice!!!

Julie Sharpe, VP
Nations Auto Transport LLC

Awesome, professional and nice. Perfect combo for a bookkeeper. I like the options that make it affordable for my small business. As I grow I look forward to working with them and adjusting my seeds. Very informative and helpful.

I was in a minor rear end in Oct 2015 ($1,800K on him) but I never thought in a million years a few lights down from that stoplight...and a few months later...I would be rear ended again involving a hit and run asshole.

I got rear ended Jan 2016 very bad, the person took off. Sitting first at the stoplight I was lucky this situation was not worse. Whiplash, back issues and almost $15K in damage...this situation was bad enough. 

My nice new car was completely smashed. Back hatch, back hatch shell, back bumper, all sensors and components under bumper, right taillight, right back quarter, right back door, bent roof shell, and labor and paint...a total nightmare. 

Called the claim in to Progressive (we both have had them over ten+ years) a few hours later and we drove the bumper flying off smashed end car to the center the next day. Let's get this done.

Pre Drop Off: As a diamond customer they offered to come pick up the car and take it to the shop we wanted to use but I just wanted hubby to get the rental for me and get this deal over with. Hurt and in a wrist splint I wanted this process over (again) ASAP. 

Drop off: We arrived to a beautiful smiling face (can't remember her name) Hubby gave them the keys. Signed some papers. She explained accident forgiveness. She said she felt sooo bad for me and I must have been in pain, yes I was in major pain, empathy nice. Done. She/they would call when it was ready. 
We were offered water, snacks, blah blah, everything but a massage. The transaction was soo fast we didn't even have a minute to check it out, which is awesome. 

Rental: They actually put my car in the body shop I wanted it in and the rental was a brand new 1400 mile spotless one. Hundyai GT something. Cute, black, brand new and clean (thank goodness no smells) but I drove it three times maybe? over the week and a half. 

Pickup: We drove the rental back put the $4 in gas in it across the street, pulled in and was greeted with a smiling face again. The guy took hubbys card for the deductible then the rep he took us outside to my baby.
It looks like it just drove off the showroom floor...again.

Needless to say it was a very smooth transaction. Hey that's what insurance is for right? It blows my car baby was rear ended again. The person who did this can eat a big one (karma is a bitch)...but with this insurance and excellent customer service...hey it could have been way freaking worse!

Great insurance company. My husband and I had our boat trailer stolen from Lake Mead Harbor. The insurance was very understanding and helped us replace our trailer quick. They even made sure the replacement was comparable to what we have and in all actuality we feel the new trailer works better. So easy to work with and to make our claim. They always take care of us and the price is perfect. Thank you for getting us back on the water.

Easy, painless and perfect!  I lost a battle with a parking garage support post  and my front fender was crushed.  From submitting my claim online to picking up my finished car, the entire process took less then a week.

I am so pleased with their customer service and ease of the process, I would recommend them to anyone!

I was in a minor accident with someone who was insured through Progressive. They were ultimately found 100% at fault so I proceeded with my repairs through the service center.

The staff completed my claim flawlessly! From the friendly staff, too the quick turn around time, too my excellent repairs.. I'm blown away! My rental car was also fantastic, I did not want to give it back!

Thank you for making this process pain free!

After speaking with my claims representative and then her supervisor, the claim has been reversed, Progressive has decided to side with me after further investigation into this matter. I am elated and would rate my overall experience better if they had backed me up in the first place. I feel that when I pay for a service, on time, for many years, and never need to use it, the one time I need them to support me, they should jump at the opportunity. My advise to anyone in an accident or like my situation, accused of causing an incident, wait for the police! Be persistent that they come to the scene and fill out a report even if nothing really happened. A lot of time and energy could have been saved by waiting for the police. Don't let your insurance company roll-over on you, make them back you up. You pay for this service, use it, they work for you.

Had to bring my car to get evaluated for repairs due to an accident that occurred a week ago.  The place was very easy to find. The staff members were very helpful. Maria Veronica immediately greeted us as soon as we got there and she directed us inside the building. She then proceeded to evaluate my car.  While inside, the three young ladies were very friendly. They were all dress like "Flo". They offered us coffee and hot chocolate along with other treats.  It took about 20-30 minutes until they were done. Gave me an estimate of the damages and said that we were all finished and that the insurance adjuster will be in contact. Great service.

Although the facility at the claim center was clean and the staff was very nice especially Crystal  The adjuster .  her boss  Nathan got involved and although  three estimates stating a damage aluminum top can be repaired per the dealer and three shops  Progressive adjuster Nathan lied and said he knew the repair person at the shop I was going to and said it was no problem to fix. When the repair shop was  told this the person this Nathan guy mention was called  in and  punished  for giving an estimate over the phone. Turns out progressive employee Nathan is a liar he had never spoken to this poor employee.  Sad that progressive hires such incompetent people and liars .

Getting in an accident is a horrible experience, especially when it is not your fault! I was dreading the experience of getting everything repaired but so far Progressive has tried to make is as easy as possible.

Teresa Alvarado is my adjuster. She was quick to call me back after I reported the claim. She is easy to get a hold of via phone or email. (As stated on her voicemail,If you call before 4pm, she will call you back by the end of the day). She set up my estimate meeting according to my availability and convenience. 

Going in for the estimate was simple, easy and painless. As indicated it took approximately 45 minutes. I waited in the lobby that had very comfortable couches and chairs. There is also a snack area that had a variety of snacks: Oreos, goldfish, cookies and chips. There are refrigerators that contain water and sodas and a tea and coffee maker. The snack area was a nice touch. While waiting for my estimate was able to do a little bit of work and answer emails. Leaving I was able to set up my appointment to drop off my vehicle for repairs.

Hopefully the repair process is just as easy. (I will definitely update the review after my vehicle is out of the shop)

I hired Paragon Credit services and was blown away by not only the results but also the customer service. I felt as though They truly cared about me and went above and beyond.  My average credit score went up by over 80 points and I was able to get approved for a home loan after previously being denied. I highly recommend Paragon Credit Services

Paragon was referred to us by a lender that my husband and I trusted so little research was done on their services prior to working with them. Bari Clapick was the original person we spoke to there and she was very nice and very persistent in getting us signed up, but as soon as they took our money there was rarely any follow up. We gave about $2k with no positive results. After a lot of self research I managed to get my credit to where we needed it to be to get our house, about a week away from closing Mark Hagenbart the supposed CEO and owner calls me and says he is going to send us to collections and file a judgement (this is after we were done paying him) His exact words to me were "I don't care if you get into a house, you're the most egregious person I've ever done business with and I don't care about your family." Scared out of my mind that we wouldn't get into our house, I paid him about $800 over the phone for services I never received because we didn't want to lose the house. Never got a receipt and never heard anything from him again. Needless to say it was definitely our fault for not doing the research and trusting a lender who we ended up not using. There are sooooo many ways to improve your credit by just self educating yourself and working with a lender who's company has an in house credit specialist. These credit "repair" companies are a scam, they just send out disputes on everything and in turn just prolong the home buying process.

After all of the frustration, I called them to cancel. I was told that I didn't need to cancel and that the policy would be cancelled automatically if I didn't pay. Fast forward to the end of the year when I receive a $1400 bill. I call them to see why and they said that that the policy does not get cancelled automatically. To add insult to injury, they said that they didn't have any notes on file that I have called previously; I have called and spoken to them no fewer than 6 times.

Edit: I spoke to Jose who was the first helpful - not defensive and argumentative - person I've encountered. Am filing an appeal.

Is there a way to give zero stars?? This company deserves absolutely no positive feedback because, as those who have reviewed before me have stated, they suck. They do more than just suck. They are the worst. 

I had a doctors visit at which I had some
"routine" and "preventive" tests done after expressing to my doctor that I had no concerns. She informed me that these tests were preventive and therefore covered by my Health Net plan. A few months later- surprise! I get a bill from the lab for the tests.  I called health net to ask why I was being charged, and they blamed the doctors office for incorrect codes. After finding out that this wasn't the case I called back, and was given more inaccurate and useless information. After calling AGAIN I was told by a higher-up that I shouldn't have been charged and they would reprocess my claim. Over the next month I called to check in on the status of the claim multiple times, and was told it was "being processed." Then after the supposed 30 business days required for reprocessing I called and was told that NO ONE HAD EVER SENT THE CLAIM BACK!!

I have talked to at least 10 people from health net, NONE of which were competent enough to resolve my problem, and now I am paying for services I never even needed that should have been covered by the insurance to avoid collections.  Health Net does not give a RAT'S @$$ about anyone.

Health Net just dropped to 1 star. Last month Health Net changed all subscriber ID numbers and issued new cards with the new the ID number and the name of your PCP. I had to call because I had never heard of the doctor listed as my PCP, I got the information corrected and they mailed me new cards.
Now for the Health Net BLUNDER: They also issued member ID cards to former subscribers giving them new ID numbers as well and indicating they were all active members as of 1/1/13. You can imagine how shocked we were to get a Health Net member card for my husband who has not had Health Net insurance for nearly 3 years. We called Health Net and they confirmed that this was an error that impacted thousands of AZ residents who were former subscribers and that in fact my husband does not have Health Net insurance and the card was issued by mistake. 
Fine, issue resolved? Nooooooo--they had already filed all of these former subscribers as covered by Health Net in a national database and now his Humana insurance refuses to pay any of his medical bills claiming that Health Net has to pay first! Of course we are going through the hassle of appealing these rejections, but this was all preventable if Health Net had not made this egregious error.

AVOID HEALTH NET OF AZ! IT IS NOT WORTH ALL THE DRAMA.

My Doctor who has been a Health Net provider for many years. When he opened his new private practice it took Health Net 4 months to approve him as a provider. My wife saw him a month after he was accepted by Health Net and her claim was denied because Health Net could not figure out he was an approved Doctor for nearly 3 months after they approved him. Hours spent on the phone eventually lead to payment months later. On the last day of February 2015 Health Net cancelled in error my company group health policy but did not notify anyone until April 7th.  Health Net claims they reinstated the policy back to March 1st but I am waiting to see if this is true. Today my wife called to make an appointment with our eye doctor who has been a Health Net MD for many years. My wife was told Health Net without explanation dropped his practice from their provider list. Health Net seems to have high employee turnover and a reputation for poor service. Stay Away.

If I could give it lower than 1 star, I would.  As others have stated, their website doesn't work.  You can't find providers under your plan.  When you try to contact tech support via email they send you an email back telling you to click on a link for secure messages, but the link doesn't work!  (just one example of the cr*p that goes on with them).  They do not pay claims and deny all sorts of things that you're supposed to get.  For example, I am supposed to pay $50 for a visit to Urgent Care.  So far, for one visit I have paid $70, and am now being billed another $50.  The Urgent Care people tell me it's because HealthNet refuses to pay.  I have been trying to call HealthNet for over a week.  When, after holding on for over 30 minutes I actually get through to a person, they tell me they have to transfer me to claims.  I ask for a direct number to claims, and they tell me there is none.  So then you are holding for another 30 minutes and you wind up reaching claims in another STATE!!!!  So they have to transfer you back to Arizona!!!  So far I have been holding on waiting to get back to where I started from for over an HOUR!!!!!  This same scenario happened yesterday, and after holding for over an hour I was CUT OFF!!!  If this were not so important to me, I would say this company is a JOKE, but they are not a joke, they are a despicable corporation that will do anything to avoid paying your claims and then will not allow you to reach anyone about the claims to even find out why.  THEY ARE HORRIBLE!!!!

It only got worse. In the end we paid for months that we apparently were not covered and for services directly to doctors that should have been covered. 

We have since moved to Blue Cross of AZ and it has been smooth as silk. I was starting to think it was me...

In my original review, I mentioned that their number one priority is your payment.  Well, low and behold, I was wrong about that.  They have updated their online bill paying system and now it won't accept any form of payment.  This means I now have to call in, and wait on hold, each month just to pay my premium.  

After multiple phone calls with multiple departments, I actually got an honest employee who told me that there isn't anyone who can help me to solve this problem.  I give her full credit for being honest.  That being said, it doesn't change the fact that their online bill paying system is useless.  I now have to wait on hold once per month to pay a premium that doesn't really cover anything.
