As previously mentioned, we will be changing insurance companies at year end. I recommend that anyone consider using Health net as your provider that you should consider poking your eyeballs out with dull, rusty needles first as it will be much less painful than actually dealing with this company.

The culture of 'customer last, payments first' pretty much says it all.  Do yourself a favor and go elsewhere! Shame on Jay Gellert for creating this miserable culture!

This company is terrible . Legalized crime . I paid $400 + a month for insurance for my 3 children and was denied benefits for them . They have no pre existing conditions and are very healthy. the first time i tried to take them to the dr. while paying heath net for coverage , i was informed they had not been added to my plan. I had to wait until open enrollment to add them to my plan. o.k. i thought my healthy kids can wait. open enrollment time came , i filled out all the required forms sent it in on time only to find out 4 months later they were not added . I called Health net they said oh it's just a mistake have your employer just resubmit your forms . so my employer and i both resubmit the forms that i had originally submitted with all the dates cause i kept them . and they still denied my children coverage. so thank you health net for collecting $8500 of my dollars and providing NO  coverage. you are criminals. I'm not understanding why you can take money and promise a service and then not have to provide any services and not go to jail. You steel from people. I asked others I know about who there providers are and anyone that I have met thats had health net has the same awful story to tell that I do. Your employees must all have nice cars at the rate of witch you are taking advantage of people.

I could not be more frustrated with Healthnet if I was trying to plead my case to a Chimpanzee!  We picked Healthnet as our Healthcare.gov "Gold" plan, have been paying premiums since January, have had our coverage cancelled now twice for billing issues, really difficult with claims, and several other billing related problems.  Please keep in mind we have paid all of our premiums and still have had all of these billing issues.  The latest...keep in mind it is August 11th...we received a notice today that our coverage was terminated July 1st...they have the money, we have no coverage...almost 6 weeks later to get any kind of indication of this matter, no e mail, no calls!  Although they are Johnny on the Spot with e mailing the bills and taking the money from my account via ACH...STILL...even after it says on their website I have been terminated!  Just ridiculous!
Healthnet is the worst health plan ever- i wish there was a zero stars choice- it was  a year of hassles and not getting the medical care I needed.

On hold two different times for 33minutes and 48 minutes. Writing this as I'm still on hold with claims. They pay but they sure do make it hard on everyone. They constantly send notice to doctors and hospitals to resubmit more info. By that time doctor sends it to collections. I'm on hold to see why they don't pay it cause I checked EBO and it's covered. Frustrating! Your just on hold forever!! My husbands small business is due for renewing medical insurance next month and I'm lobbying him and his brother, the owners, to switch!  Healthnet picked up and now I'm on hold while they see why it wasn't paid. 1hr 43 seconds later I'm still holding ugg. Unless you have a lot of free time get another insurance.

Navigating through health insurance is difficult enough without the extra added frustration of dealing with billing. They accepted my doctor in the network only to reject their charges for services 5 months later. Their billing services is awesome if you like pain and punishment. I pay for 2 months, get a notice of cancellation after I am told I don't owe for paying twice...the second star is for the one great experience with member services who helped me navigate through my billing mess. I do not recommend this insurance plan to anyone.

LOLOLOZ Healthnet of Arizona is the biggest joke of a company.  Thankfully i am somewhat healthy because if i was not, i would not be counting on healthnet to help me get there.  NO.... and i repeat NO! Dr. wants to do business with them.  I am getting rejected by Dr.s that are listed online as "In Network" on my plan.  There name should be Health NOT!

Always used Turbo Tax, but when I received a letter from the IRS recently I contacted HR Block to help because I wanted to deal with someone face to face. Linda Reader not only met, but exceeded all of my expectations. Long story short I went in owing $4k and left HR Block getting a refund from a 2014 return. She was genuinely concerned about my situation and took the time to get to know me personally during the visit.  I will do business with this branch going forward.

I wanted to try something other than turbo tax, and I'm no tax expert, so I was hoping to find one here who would have patience with me. Fortunately, I met with Peggy who I would recommend to everyone! Not only did she take me through the process with care and understanding, but, once she realized that what I would be charged for the appointment was half of my tax return, she was compassionate enough to immediately stop the appointment and advise I make an online account and do the same things she showed me on my own for free. She even had me schedule a free "second look" appointment just so I would feel confident in my tax filing. Due to illness, I wasn't able to make it to the appointment. Weeks later, she emailed me to ask how I was doing and if I could come in for that free second look. I was astounded she even remembered me! The establishment was not receiving a dime from me yet she truly wanted to help. I received true service from Peggy, and I highly recommend her and the rest of the nice staff at this particular H&R Block.

For Gilbert Wells Fargo Banks... This is my 1st Choice because of the Customer Service & No pressure banking. Other banks are pushy about signing up for Credit Cards, Savings Accounts and who knows what else... But not this bank. 

Fast, Efficient, Friendly, Free bottle of Water (YEAH BABY!), Smiles from the Employees... You won't dread walking in to this bank unless your Broke & the bank won't give you a loan... But thats not their fault!

I've been with Wells Fargo for as long as I can remember and some locations are better than others. This one thou is may favorite by far. The staff is friendly, knows what they are doing, quick and always have a smile.
Maria Fuentes has the best customer service skills I have ever seen with a banker. Kind, fast, yet still socialable. She's great & I highly recommend you request her! Very helpful and very sweet

With all the bad news on Wells Fargo, I decided to check our bank accounts (checking and savings). I discovered we were being charged $15/ monthly fee for banking with them since June 2016 because our mortgage was no longer active. (we sold our home). Today, I called 3 times with no good advice or wrong advice from various CSR. When I was transferred to a fourth person - ONLINE banking CSR ( Michael Puckett) who saved the day by transferring our account to an account with no fees as long as we kept a specific combined balance which was not a problem. Top it off, he got an approval from his manager to return the fees they have been charging us because they failed to notify us of the account change after we sold our house. I have always liked and trusted Wells Fargo and I am glad they made it right after being so persistance to speak with someone who knew what he was doing. Thanks Michael Puckett! I was ready to close all our accounts but your good training saved the day.

Had to file a claim for my motorcycle. Geico office responded very quickly. Mario (adjuster) showed up at the dealership the day I brought the bike in and cut a check for the repairs instantly. Best service ever! Thanks.

I had to get new auto insurance b/c when I moved last year, I changed States. I have a perfect driving / claim (no claims) record of 15 years (knock on wood) and I am 41. I also drive a super safe vehicle that's not a drag racer car. It was also not financed. So I should most definitely get all the discount benefits being so low risk. However, I couldn't believe how ridiculously high all the quotes I got were. And I am in Nevada now? I'm talking about, ALL the quotes I got were double the cost of what I was paying in Cali and at that, these policies were bare minimum coverage. Before I had full coverage and low deductibles (I had Mercury / Progressive). And even a new quote from them was exactly the same, double the cost, less than half the coverage. 

Then I found Geico. I'll just leave it at that. I have had them this whole year. And then this month I sold my car and bought a Scooter (for the interim). It's kind of tricky, b/c these kinds of Scooters don't have VIN #s, aren't registered etc. So after I signed up for this new policy online, I called the Geico office just to clarify these things. The service there was immediate. I had a specialist on the line with me within minutes. And I was covered immediately. Huh, $25 bucks a month on this new policy!! Really friendly, helpful staff. And I feel totally confident in their service. 

Last but not least, I have seen that Geico's offerings as far as discounts (for certain things that make you lower risk) was the best fit for me! Other companies had some of the discounts for me, Geico had all the discounts that I wanted / deserved to benefit from (in the overall cost of the policy). 

When I go buy my next car, (assuming nothing changes w/Geigo and I don't expect it will), I will definitely stay with Geico then too.

I guess that lizard with an English accent isn't full of it after all!
I switched my car/home insurance to Geico, and 
15 mins literally saved me MORE than 15% with better coverage. 
Jay was very professional and responded quickly to my emails. 
He made the entire process of switching so easy and smooth.
I never thought changing my insurance would be this easy, ha!
Thank you Jay!

So happy with the service my husband and I received.  John (the manager) was super helpful in answering all our questions and providing us with a quote for homeowners insurance within an hour of contacting him. When we bought our new car, John helped us again in combining out home and auto insurance. We got a great rate and amazing service!

Worst customer service ever. She kept getting an attitude with me when I didn't know answers about my history 10 years ago. Get real, who can remember that far back? Gave me a quote for $158.00 a month and I said "WHOA!!!! No thank you and hung up." I'm only one person who has a prestine driving history. Insane waste of my time, kept trying to sell me stuff I didn't need and wouldn't let me say anything. Would NOT recommend to anyone.
Excellent service, friendly knowledgeable staff. They really make you feel like part of the family. When I had a claim it was processed quickly. I wouldn't go anywhere else.

I was having issues with the DMV in regards to a suspended registration and my insurance lapsing, so I finally went into this location to see if anyone could help me resolve it. Dean Collotta and Alexus not only understood the bizarre situation i was in, but went above and beyond to find a solution. Because of their knowledge and expertise, I was able to get the fine dropped and the registration reinstated without a charge. All agents were extremely helpful and friendly throughout the entire process. Thank you GEICO for your excellent customer service!

updates 2/28/2016
I'm still happy with the company but I do noticed they raised my rates every 6 months though I still have a good record with no accidents . They're excuse is that there has been more accidents in my area and I live in a very good area.  This seems to be a trend, a switch and bait. They get you in with a low rates and then raise your rates no matter what. I'm going to switch again once it gets too high.

Old post:
I switched over Geico from State Farm because State Farm raised my car insurance every year and I'm a good driver with no accidents.  Geico had the lowest quote.  So far I'm very impressed how fast I can reach an agent.  I had a rat that nested ib my car causing $3,000 damage to my electrics in my car and Geico covered which was a surprised.
Earlier today, the teller gave me money  so I left the bank swiftly, like  Spiderman eating a peanut butter sandwich living happily ever after, the rest of my day.

I've been a Chase customer for 10 years. A lot of that has to do with the fact that it's such a pain in the butt to change everything over to another bank and some of it has to do with the fact that there's really no huge significant difference between one bank and another. For the most part I'm satisfied with the services Chase offers.

This review is branch specific and "customer service" specific. Ironically, banks seem to be getting rid of employees, (those responsible for "customer service"), and making everything automated and self-service. But there are a few employees left to man the shop, mostly managers and someone to point customers to the proper self-service machine; the banking industry equivalent to a Walmart Greeter. The few employees left to hold down the fort at this particular branch are always rude. Now in all fairness, I don't go to this branch that often and when I do, 9 times out of 10 I use the drive-thru ATM. I rarely go inside, but on the few occasions I have gone inside my impression was "rude." I don't believe I've ever dealt with the same employee twice there, so maybe "rude" is part of the hiring criteria for this branch. 

Yesterday I called the branch after my wife told me about the "rude" treatment she received from someone there when trying to resolve an issue. When I called I immediately asked to speak to a manager and got the obligatory, "Okay, tell me what the problem is and maybe I can help." The first problem is that I called in as a customer and asked to speak to a manager and you immediately took the [customer is always wrong] approach and ignored my request. You might as well have said, "Okay, you're obviously an idiot and there's no way you could possibly know if you need to speak to a manager or not - you need ME to make that determination for you." 

After I explained why I was calling she put me on hold for a substantial time. Finally another women picked up and her English was so bad it was annoyingly difficult to understand her. I asked, "Are you a manager?" and she replied something like, "No, there no are any managers who can available." (That's not an exact quote - but it's close). 

Since there's really nothing but managers working there now I'm guessing I got handed off to the cleaning lady or someone of equal authority. At any rate, she couldn't do anything for me except to continually say, "I'm sorry, unfortunately... I'm sorry, unfortunately... I'm sorry, unfortunately..." The ole "condescending, I'm not going to do anything for you, why are you trying to make me work" approach to customer service - gotta love it.

If it wasn't such a pain in the butt to switch banks I probably would, but then I'd probably just have to put up with this kind of incompetence by some lazy employee who used to work for Chase.

Being a resident of this city, I've gone to the branch several times trying to give it a chance.  A few of those times the tellers are so non-attentive.  At one point, she told me why don't I go to the ATM to take care of the transaction.  I said, if you say that to every customer, you'll be out of a job.  Which wouldn't be a bad thing.  I will drive the extra 15 min. to the B of A in Henderson on Heather Ridge where they go out of their way to help you.  Boulder City employees should go there for training.
Every other banking institution in this city has multiple windows open, BOA get off your butt and hire more tellers, it's inconvenient. 1 teller always long lines.
This bank is terrible and the manager thinks she is all that and a bag of chips. Service is slow the employees act like they are better than you and the policies of the bank are archaic.

Staff was very helpful and very professional. Like most Chase branches here in Arizona customer service is superb. I've banked with Chase for a while now and I love my experience every time I go into a branch.

Absolute worst bank in THE WORLD, close to my work out of the 15 times ive been there only once did the outside atm work, and half those times the inside didn't work either, HORRIBLE customer service, today i went there in a hurry, Atm was down, went through the drive through line and skinny hispanic guy w glasses pops on and tells me its closed, so then i have to drive around wait 20 minutes and when i get up the r e he wouldn't let me put money into my fiance account because i wasnt on the account?? I WAS PUTTING MONEY IN !! NEVER EVER HAD THAT ISDUE, so i left beyond mad went to a different Chase and deposited it NO ISSUES, honestly this bank is horrible, it alwatlys starts w management, if u have to go to Chase go to a different one.

the worst! keeping calm and using a quiet voice and not doing your job correctly  is unacceptable. they have caused me more grief than I can  say! Shame on them!!!! no wonder their bank branch at walmart near stapley i now a village in, and nobody is ever in line at most branches i have been to.  shame shame shame on them

We were looking to re-finance our truck loan and Canyon State delivered.  Rate is awesome, service was excellent and we couldn't be happier. 
Thank you Canyon State!

Issues:
Card cash redeemable only in November.  Unless you happen to close your account after the November payout, everything past that point is lost.  I asked about my 30$ in card cash and was told I'd have to keep the account open with either the minimum to avoid fees or they'd bill me 3$ per month until I collected my 30.  

Few locations and limited online ability.  This doesn't bother everyone, but I travel a lot.

They once tried to charge me 5$ for a printout of my statement.  Apparently it was a miscommunication, and they thought I wanted some official document rather than a standard printout.  It still took 10 minutes out of my day and some arguing.

Nothing special if you're just using checking/savings.  With a bigger bank, I get more locations, quicker service, better online functionality, and am overall much happier with my experience.

They are a small bank without the small bank feeling.  This is entirely subjective, but part of the reason I joined was a positive experience with a small bank elsewhere.  People there knew me and were friendly.  The representatives were hit or miss at Canyon State, some very pleasant and others perfunctory.

It's not so much that they don't work, but rather, that they are mediocre in all of the areas that I value as a checking account holder.  There are plenty of better options.
Horrible customer service. Been on hold for 30 minutes trying to reach someone.....

DON'T DO BUSINESS WITH PITNEY BOWES!!!!  One of the worse businesses I've ever dealt with!  My husband used Pitney Bowes for 12 years even though the prices weren't the best.  When he sold his business we called to close his accounts.  He had a credit line and a postage meter.  The credit line was supposedly closed on my first call in May 2013.  I was referred to another person to handle the meter.  I missed the 1st call by the cust. ser. rep. and it just went down hill from there.  I have called, emailed, and written numerous letter but can't get either account closed and I still keep getting bills.  I can't get anyone to respond and say where to return there postage meter.  I try every month to close the account and send them their equipment!  Its almost the end of November 2013 and I don't think this mess will ever be over.  THEY ARE THE WORSE!!! BEWARE!!!!

The hours posted are only if you are doing day to day transactions like withdrawals or deposits. Anything outside of that requires their "back office" which observe different hours. This is not posted anywhere. Management is also not helpful in finding a solution if you have a problem and doesn't bother to tell you your screwed the next day too because they are closed for the holiday. Worst customer service!

CUSTOMER SERVICE LINE WAS THE WORST PEOPLE IVE EVER TALKED TO IN MY LIFE.... Worst bank I've ever had to deal with... I called to get business account number, simple task, after numerous attempts of having to hang up and call back, they finally gave me a number, the WRONG number on purpose after we exchanged words.... That's got to be illegal and she needs to be fired. Then she even has the nerve to freeze my account while I'm out of town and can't go into a branch when they're clearly in the wrong.. Grow up and get better employees. I'm making sure everyone knows how I feel about this credit union. I definitely would not ever bank here for anyone in the future.

Would have a 5, because 99% of the employees here are PHENOMENAL!  One person either has a bad day, stereotypes, doesn't like their job, etc and boy oh boy can you tell. 

I don't know name names, "those" kind of people usually weed themselves out. 

Good vibes people. Relax,  it could be worse.
I always get great service here! The staff is friendly and attentive! They really make you feel at home!!
Great customer service everytime I come into this location as well. I do a lot of my shared branching here and they are always polite and very helpful whenever I am here.

In three years of living within walking distance of this BOA location I had my first truly negative experience here. This location is always understaffed, if two tellers are there its a full house. The tellers are always positive and helpful ( Alberto and Gabriella come to mind), however, today I meet the new branch manager Kay Handy ( or Hardy). She was extremely passive aggressive and borderline rude. I had visited the branch earlier today and waited for about 20 minutes in line before I left. I came back 2.5 hours later and facing another long line ( another 25 minutes) stayed. Once I got up to the only teller ( in training) working and Kay, I asked to make a cash deposit. It took some time to verify the cash and some other bank patrons decided to spend their time elsewhere and get out of line, just like I did earlier. 

Here is my point. I am not responsible for your staffing levels. I am not responsible for what other patrons do in line. Everyone has to wait at the bank. I understand you were under stress training a new to the state employee but if you have a problem with your Locations Time To Provide Service then call in another employee or shut the doors and don't do business until you can meet your own standards. Don't project thinly veiled passive-aggressive comments towards me.

I have never met such incompetent people before. I would never bank here or at any other Bank of America. I had an auto loan with BOA and they sent me a reimbursement check. I went to deposit it at my bank and my bank stated that BOA issued the check to me and Bank of America. So I had to go to BOA for them to sign it and then I could deposit it. 

I went to this bank and they made me wait 45 minutes. He first had to verify that I had a loan and then made some excuse as to why it took so long. After 45 minutes, the banker told me that next time I should have them issue the check to my bank. He didn't apologize for how long it took and then blamed me. Nice customer service.
Terrible customer service. The branch manager Abigail does not seem to be able to offer solutions  I'm moving my banking to Bank of Nevada

I've been banking with Chase since 2006 and have yet to have a negative experience, until a very disappointing experience I had today with this branch. The bankers and tellers I have interacted with at other Chase Bank branches across the US from Denver, NYC to Lexington, Ky have been incredibly helpful and expeditious when assisting me. And the drive thru tellers are usually kind at this branch. 

However, today, I sat for 30 minutes, with a grumpy toddler, waiting to be helped. And there I sat, with only one person acknowledging me. She offered my child a lollipop and kindly informed me she had an appointment with a client or she would have been happy to help me, until I decided to leave. 

Not one person, after the friendly banker, popped over to say that they were going to take a while with their current client or gave me an approximate wait time. I even approached a teller who had no customers in line, to inform them that a fellow customer and I both needed help and that we had been waiting for some time. After a quick apology from the teller and my returning to the waiting area, still no one assisted us. There was no sense of urgency from the employees.

In short, it was a very disappointing customer service experience. After a meltdown from my toddler and 30 minutes of total waiting, I needed to leave and so I did. Without an acknowledgment of my presence or of my leaving. 

I bank with this branch only because it's conveniently close to my home. But, from now on, unless absolutely necessary, will I go into the lobby to be assisted.
Worse experience at a bank. Sad that Bank of America has better service then this bank.. Definitely not worth having a Chase account.. Do yourself a favor and go Credit Union..

Holy crap they take a long time !!! 
30 min in the drive thru and I was the only person in line

As a former employee of J P Morgan Chase Bank I am extremely disappointed in the general customer service at this branch.  I always get the feeling they think they are doing me a big favor when I come in.  Recently I was in the market for a home mortgage and was treated like a total loser. Mr Bill B, mortgage banker acted like he was always pissed off at the world.  Even tried and talk to this guys boss and still was totally treated like trash. I finally told them to just forget about it and took my business across the street to Wells Fargo where I was actually treated like a human being.  Next step will be to close all accounts at Chase. Take your business elsewhere.

Should be 0 stars. Don't ever go to the Chase Bank on Alma School & Queen Creek. I was going over there to look at moving all of my business and personal accounts to them. 35 minutes later no help from anybody. Not even one person said we will be right with you. When I over heard a couple saying we have a 10am appointment and they were sitting there 10 min past time then walked up to front counter and no one came over to help them I decided to leave, talk about crappy customer service. I guess the yelp reviews don't lie LOL.
I had to do very big amount wire transferred. And I am not local I am from California. Still they did it in no time. Very professional and smooth!

I love Wells Fargo. The people at this location always take good care of you. I currently lost my debit card and Gina was super helpful in setting me up with a new card. There is an actual bank at this location

I came in a few weeks ago to cash a check but didn't have an account with them. They signed me up for a free account that didn't take long at all. The best thing about this place is the workers. They were slammed busy, with people coming in from the rain. It was closer to closing time & honestly I felt like I had walk into a party. The worker were all in a great mood. They were joking around with customers and because the atmosphere was so awesome I felt chipper as well. by the time I was done setting up my account I felt like I had made 5 new friends that I would love to hang out with.

Best time I've ever had walking into a bank. THIS PLACE ROCKS!!!
Have been going to this location for about a year now and never had a bad experience. Great service with a smile. Good job Hazeer and his team!!

The employees do not understand how a line works. I was "dealt with" after people who walked in after me. As far as I can tell only 1 employee has manners. Most unprofessional branch I have ever visited.

I went this Wells Fargo to update my married name on my bank card and complete a couple other things.  This is a typical Wells Fargo, as far as setting and appearance.  I just happened to be welcomed by one of their staff members Alex.  

After I told him why I was there, he told me he had just gotten engaged a week prior.  We had a really nice chat about getting engaged, married, how we met our significant others, etc.  He was a very personable banker.
  
As far as actually helping me with what I needed, he was thorough and called when he had a question on something I needed handled.  This bank isn't the closest to my house but I would go back here for my banking needs.  Everyone at the bank seemed to know what they were doing and seemed just as helpful as Alex.

Been here quite a few times and I've had nothing but excellent service. Bankers are always pleasant, ask how your day is going and try to help you with everything you need. Had a question about how to get currency for different countries and the guy helping me told me exactly how to go about ordering it. 

It is a little hidden though, it is just a little door in between Einstein's and the Mr. Sandwich

Nothing special, but a bank. 
They have a convinient, safe on-location drive thru and walk up service. Of course, personal safety is always an issue so just be 'aware' of your surroundings. 
There is a Smith, Nail place and other business in this corner. Definitely a convinient location.
Top notch customer service. Came in on a saturday and they made me feel important as a long time Chase customer. Thank you

I admit banks scare me, which is why I banked with Washington Mutual. Their set up made going to the bank less intimidating. The glass shield, elevated counters and tight-lipped ladies who generally oversee the banking process have frightened me ever since I was a wee little girl. So, when Chase came in and removed the open teller system of WM and installed the old school teller set up, I was sad. However, time has passed, and as we have become frequent users of this Chase location, my fear has subsided. The tellers are always smiling, and they know us by name. They even take the time to get to know a bit more about us. Yes, ultimately, it is the arm of a big, bad banking megacorporation, but they manage to make the experience feel a bit more personal. I have never had a problem here.

Whatever you do , do not use the roadside assistance, they contract with a company called Agero and my husband was on the side of the road for 7 hours in 105degree heat waiting for a tow truck .Every time we called they said the trucks on the way. We have been members for over 25 years and have at least eight different products through USAA. I guess you get what you pay for, since its free, that's what you get very bad service. The day after that happened we went to AAA and got membership, I know it would only take 30 minutes or less for tow with them!!!! Hope no one else goes thru what we did.

When I was younger, I had such a hard time with banks! When I finally signed up for USAA, they actually took the time to educate me about my finances. 

Funnily enough, what turned me onto USAA was a car accident. At the time, I was with another company, and the person who hit me had USAA. They treated me better, educated me, defended me... which was way more then my company had done for me. 

Thanks USAA for being there for me through all of the bumps in the road!

Veteran from 1989 and finally switched ALL my banking over to USAA.. I should have done this when I first learned about USAA... 

Member now for about 4 years, great customer service, and all their apps work great, !!!

Great bank to do business with normally.  However, once you get your account hacked, good luck getting your online access back. I've spent a week now trying to get someone to believe me when I say I am me, but apparently no amount of information I can provide will let them verify that I'm me and unlock my account.  The best part is, I can't even get myself verified in person.  The nearest "financial center" is an hour away and they apparently don't deal with stuff like this, just stuff that gets them new business with the cadets it seems.  I mean, what's so novel about verifying who you are by showing up in person with some identification?

I don't know about all the other reviews, but I have had no issues in my dealings with USAA bank and Insurance.  Had an accident and they handled it promptly, paying it all out within a few days.  Worked with the body shop of my choice, without a hitch.  Banking has been excellent customer service as well, even with dealing with complex fraud issues.

USAA is the standard of customer service... Aside from having great, competitive rates and great products, their customer service will sell you every time.  I have spent hours of phone time talking to their employees who actually care more than enough to give every once of information they can so that you can make an informed decision about your life choices, even if that means not using a USAA product..... which makes you want to spend a little more to use USAA... cause they actually care.  I actually enjoy doing business with USAA.... EVERY TIME.

I love the idea of USAA.  The insurance side is good.  In April or May of this year I charged my USAA mastercard at a bar.  The tip over drew my account by 3.80 which I cant explain.  I couldn't deposit money in the account manually because they cut off the relationship with UPS where I deposited up till then.  They charged me an over draft of 25 bucks.  There was a total due of 28 bucks and change.  I would have been happy to pay it but they cant take Visa and I cant deposit via UPS.  The only option was electronic deposit via internet. They have every legal right to have charged my account off for 3 bucks but do veterans really want to deal with it,  It dropped my credit score over 100 points.  

My suggestion to you is don't use them.  Its a pain in the back side to deposit and there is no relationship.  it all about the money.  They screwed me over 3 bucks.  Imagine what they will do to you.  Insurance yes....  Banking no.  I will be transferring my insurance to Geico just to rid myself of them.  Its your choice.

Sorry.  They charged my account off on my credit in case you didn't understand.  Don't walk away from them....  Run

Went in for my interview today and was just amazed at how huge this campus is. They have security posted at the entrance to the compound and security inside the building, it's almost like a military post. You have to swipe a card to get through the door. They have a Starbucks and a sandwich shop, a cafeteria and a little shop with clothing and other things. The manager told me you can swipe your card at the register at any of the shops and it will directly take it out of your check. They also have a gym, a quiet room, a game room, physical therapist, nurse... It was amazing, really hope I get this job (fingers crossed).

This is the worst insurance company I have ever dealt with. Excessive wait times and terrible customer service.
Overall, this appears to be a very poorly run company.

I do banking and insurance through USAA and I love their customer service. I am always able to easily get in touch with an agent who is willing and able to answer any questions I have regarding my account. If I could give more stars, I would!

Sadly, this company has gotten so large, that it's lost it's focus - which should be helping the customer and taking care of their needs.   They do have some good people, but they have far too many bad apples especially in this office.   One huge issue we have with this office is that they do not keep their word - as they say one thing and do another.   We've been with USAA for over 25 years and have seen a drastic decrease in the quality of people they are hiring.   Very sad ... because they use to care about their customers.   Now, it's all about the money.   They have no compassion or heart.

Lacking Customer Service Skills
Total Waste of My Time
Do NOT recommend
Total Disappointment on ALL LEVELS

Wish I could give a NEGATIVE 10 rating on this review.....

I have had this bank for over 4 years and plan on getting rid of them. Some of the representatives are very unprofessional.

Customer service is slow and I usually have to call twice for one issue. Either somebody didn't follow through with something, gave me wrong information or my phone call drops after waiting on hold.

There is no bank in my town. If I loose my debit card I am screwed.

Their dispute department is a joke. I had a payment made via bill pay and it went to someone else's' account. They still didn't get my money back. I don't have enough hours in the day to fight it.

They just bank on the loyalty to our Vets. This company isn't that great. Go somewhere else and you will also get a better interest rate.

USAA has the WORST phone system I have Ever.  I've been with them since 1970.  Their service has deteriorated significantly and their phone system drives me crazy.... on the other hand they have reasonable rates so I put up with it all.
Employer of choice!!! USAA is consistently rated a top employer in Phx, as well as the nation. Fortune 20 company!

Amazing company to do business with in every regard. They stand behind their values.  They CARE about their members and they demonstrate that daily! I just because an employee for USAA and may I just say...WOW!!!! Happies person in the world!!!!

I will never get a title loan from any other location in town! I needed some emergency cash for some home repairs. I don't have much established credit at all so getting financed for any loan from a bank is such a chore. I went into Presto, they were so nice, helpful, and it didn't take much more than 30 mins to complete the whole process. I got exactly what i needed with no issues!

As someone who is on SSi disability This company Not only gave me a loan but are reporting the on time payments to the credit bureau's helping me and others build our credit. This place ttreats you with respect and courtesy when your in a bind.
I have had no issues with Presto. They helped me out when I needed and the payment has been reasonable. I hope I don't need there services again and it is nothing personal about them.

Would have given it 5 stars but one of the women tellers is a bit of a hassle and doesn't follow through.  But everyone else is really great.  You get personalized service like you're some big wig with tons of money even if you aren't.  The can do everything a big bank can, except they have more limited hours/locations.  They close at 4 which stinks, but I've shown up at 4:05 and they actually let me in and helped me.  I can guarantee you no big bank would do that!  So, the limitations are far outweighed by the great customer service I get from almost everyone there.

Same situation as other ladies...over $16000 worth of jewelry stolen and he said pay pawn ticket off and he would turn into insurance. Did that...then he said ok we finally settled with insurance company and that he would pay me. Went to collect and its under different ownership!!!! No cameras in the shop and there still isn't. The guys behind the counter are very shady. I will be going to court and 3 on your side and every other avenue I can. This was insurance fraud  for sure!!!

Mark and Kyle will give you great service! I have purchased several high end watches here - always for a great price. I am never dissapointed. If you are looking for quality - this is the place to check.. I drive by every 2 weeks to see if there is some new inventory and usually there is.

I had over $4,000.00 worth of jewelry here. I went to pick it up and they told me my jewelry was gone because they were robbed. They told me to go ahead and pay off my pawn ticket and they would make it right. I did and now it is over 4 months later... Every time I call I hear excuses. So, I am out for my jewelry and my money. They told me I should file with my homeowners insurance!!! These guys are the worst ever! My advice would be to stay away. Far, far away!!! I am going to have to sue them to see any kind of action taken.

We also echo other customer's feedback regarding Mark and Kyle! Great merchandise and friendly people make the shopping here a great experience! Stop by and check out the electronics, jewelry, and firearms! :)
Thanks for all your help,  Going through a nasty divorce and what not been able to make ends meet without your help.  Also you got great rates.  Would recommend and also use again!

Had a great experience with Executive Pawn after finding the pawn shop on Yelp and reading some of the recent reviews.

I called Mark about some artwork that I was looking to sell and he gave me clear direction on how to proceed.  He was very thorough and diligent throughout the whole process and gave me a fair offer.  Very easy to do business with.

Would definitely recommend and will hopefully do business with again in the future!

There area many insurance companies to choose from. Dan works hard to find the right one for you. Because he is a broker he can shop for the best quote and options for your needs. I've used Dan for my family and my clients for years!

She was SO RUDE on the phone. Which is a bummer considering I was referred to her by a close friend that highly praised her to me. She answered the phone and sounded immediately irritated. When I told her I was referred to her she cut me off to abruptly let me know she's not taking new clients. I don't mind being told no, but at least be polite or give another referral! I'm glad it worked out the way it did after reading the other bad review on here. I wouldn't want some bitter, impatient old woman leaving out deductions or losing my personal information. INCREDIBLY UNPROFESSIONAL.

SHORT STORY: Julie is impolite, unprofessional, and a LIAR. AVOID HER AT ALL COSTS.

LONG STORY: For the 2014 tax returns, my mother (who filed me as her dependant) went through Julie. Since I am no longer her dependant and have a family of my own, I decided to file my 2015 taxes with TurboTax. I encountered a problem when I tried e-filing, as I couldn't do so without the address that was used. I was unsure if my mother used my address or hers to file my taxes. I thought, no problem, I'll just call Julie and ask for the address. Apparently that was a problem. I called her, left a message, and over a week went by without a return phone call. 

I tried recalling her and I immediately felt as if she saw my phone call as a burden. She was not polite in any way, and as soon as she gave me the address she said "okay, bye" and hung up. I had another question, as the IRS website was not processing the address to give me an e-filing PIN, and had she waited half a second I would have asked for my AGI, However, she did not. She hung up on me. I waited a few minutes to call her back, and she ignored my call. I thought, "okay, maybe she's on the other line." so I waited another hour and a half to recall her. Again, to voicemail I went. I left her another message this time, politely asking if I might be able to get my AGI. I then sent my mother a message to ask if she had that on file, and explained to her what had just happened. After a few minutes, my mother returned my phone call. 

THIS IS WHERE IT GETS INTERESTING. She told me she just called Julie, who told her that she was tired of giving me the information, had spoken to me on several occasions, is very annoyed at this point and will send my tax information if I pay $25 for it. While I understand wanting to get paid for your time, there was ABSOLUTELY no reason to lie. None whatsoever. It would have been completely fine if she has said "I've been a bit busy, so I hadn't had the chance to pick up her call. I apologize for that. However, I do not want to work for free, so I can send her all the documents via email for $25" That would have been very professional, BUT NO. She thought it would be best to make it out like we have spoken on numerous occasions and isn't answering because I am practically harassing her when we had only spoken once after me waiting over a week for a return call, just so she didn't look rude to my mother, her client. Biggest load of crap.
Fantastic customer service at the windows. (see Victoria). Tellers are pleasant polite and most importantly efficient. Went in twice and was remembered by name. Good bank. Good people.

Probably fine for direct deposit and withdrawing if you're a student nearby. But I've had a number of screw-ups originating here that would make me never trust this bank for anything beyond that. 

(1) After another PNC branch screwed up a transfer by failing to submit it, I re-did it here (taking an hour of my time). I was told the fee would be waived because PNC had wasted my time; it wasn't and nobody bothered to inform me about the outcome or why it the fee-waiver was denied. (2) When clearing out my account via wire-transfer, the person failed to include the wire-transfer fee either via cash or by taking out the proper amount (balance - the fee). This left me in the red and forced me to take my own time to go in (while attempting to move out of the city) and fix the issue. 

In each case, a torrent of apologies ensue from everyone involved. But at some point, I don't care about apologies -- I just want a bank that works, and when a bank screws up, for it to not charge me for botched work.

When I walked in, a PNC rep told me to sit in a chair and wait in line. Then more people came in after me. After 35 minutes of waiting, I asked the rep how much longer I needed to wait. He points to two other customers (who came after me), and said they are going first. I corrected him that I came much earlier than they did, and the other customers agreed. But he still said I need to wait until they're done, because their task takes shorter amount of time. I left after that, feeling frustrated, because I had other appointments.

Is that how queues work at PNC?

Mal wieder ein aus der Packstation Hauptbahnhof umgeleitetes Packet hier abgeholt. Fast nichts los in der Filiale, zwei Kunden vor mir in der Warteschlange und 5 bedienende Mitarbeiter. Das ging heute echt flott und die wirklich nette Mitarbeiterin ist auch zu kleinen Späßen aufgelegt ist...

Ich bin entsetzt. Weniger von dieser Filiale  dort muss man meiner Meinung nach genauso lange warten wie in jeder anderen, das liegt natürlich daran, dass die sooooo viele Postfilialen geschlossen haben. Ich bin eher entsetzt, dass dies jetzt in der Stadt wirklich die einzige, letzte Filiale zu sein scheint. Wollte gestern am Olgaeck schnell in die Post hüpfen. Ein Stück die Straße runter war ja immer eine. Und jetzt? Gibt's da nur noch Postfächer. Gut, dachte ich mir, gehste zum Bahnhof ARGL! Da gibt's AUCH keine Filiale mehr! Nur noch diese hier am Schloßplatz. Und die ist eben genauso chronisch unterbesetzt wie überall, und freundliche Mitarbeiter sind ein seltener Anblick. Die Post schafft sich selbst ab.

Einen Stern, weil man null Sterne nicht geben kann.
Hier steht man  egal zu welcher Tageszeit  endlos in der Schlange. 3/4 aller Schalter sind regelmäßig unbesetzt  an den restlichen wird im Schneckentempo gearbeitet, gequatscht oder zu Stoßzeiten Pause gemacht. Wenn man endlich dran ist, wird man langsam, unfreundlich und oftmals inkompetent (Brief in die USA? Woher soll ich wissen, was der kostet?) bedient. Zur Krönung versucht das Personal dann auch noch, einem jedes Mal ein Postbank-Konto, eine Versicherung oder was weiß ich anzudrehen. 
Wäre es nicht so traurig  und man selbst nicht regelmäßig in Eile  müsste man drüber Lachen und/oder einen Film drehen
Die Öffnungszeiten (von 10 (!!) Uhr bis 20 Uhr) sind außerdem für die einzige Innenstadtfiliale eine Frechheit. Da schafft man es weder vor noch nach der Arbeit, etwas zu erledigen.

Schlangenzucht in Stuttgart-City...


 Dafür, dass dies die einzige Filiale im ganzen zentralen Innenstadtbereich ist (am Bahnhof gibt es zwar noch eine aber aus der ist die Postbank abgezogen und es sind nur 4 Schalter, davon sind dann 1-2 besetzt) ist das eine ziemliche Zumutung.


 Die Hauptpost ist schön und groß und hat 12 Schalter. Leider sind meist nur einige (maximal 5) davon besetzt. Die zentrale Warteschlange, die sich davor vor sich hin windet, wird meist durchaus nicht als stichhaltiger Grund angesehen, einen weiteren Schalter zu öffnen.


 Alle Kollegen/innen aus den vielen, vielen Büros in der City, die mit Post nach Feierabend unterwegs sind, stehen sich ja gerne mit schweren Paketen, prallgefüllten Freistemplertüten und Päckchen die Beine in den Bauch. Nach 16.30 Uhr mehr Leute einsetzen? Unmööglich, da haben die doch auch Feierabend.....


 (das gleiche Argument wie bei Emil's Nachtwache: "Sie haben einen Einbrechcher? ....Nein wir chönnen jetzt nicht chommen, hat auch cheinen Zweck, wenn es dunckel ist sehen wir ja nichchts".....)


 Bei der Postbank im ersten Stock geht ohne Vorameldung gar nichts und meist muss man dann trotzdem noch lange warten.


 Aktualisierung: Kaum zu glauben aber der Service ist tatsächlich noch schlechter geworden.


 Noch weniger Schalter besetzt.


 Am Infostand stand ein Schild "vorübergehend geschlossen" und obwohl die "Bewohnerin" des Standes anwesend war, machte sie sich nicht die Mühe, auf meine Frage zu antworten weil es stand ja das Schild da und es ist doch eine Frechheit, einen geschlossenen Schalter einfach anzusprechen....


 Meine sämtlichen Postbank-Sparkonten samt Giro sind inzwischen umgezogen. Irgendwann reicht's.


 Und wenn ich mal Post mitnehmen muss, fahr ich extra nach Degerloch hinauf. Dort ist die Post-Servicewelt noch einigermaßen in Ordnung.
Went to Maximum and met with Christine, she was wonderful, friendly and professional.

I chose to go here based on the great reviews, went there this morning to get a loan and was there for almost an hour with my 2 year old grand daughter and after all that time they couldn't do my loan because they couldn't verify my employer(which I told them when I first arrive that if they needed to contact my employer that it is closed for a week due to holiday break) so after I signed every document they had for me to sign is when they told me they couldn't do the loan. It was a complete waste of time. They should have said something when I told them my work is closed for a week, the girl should've know. Right then that they weren't gonna be able to do the loan instead of making me wait almost an hour and signed all papers. I'll keep my business at title max which would've given me $3000 instead of $700

A really great, large, branch. A half dozen inside tellers, four outside drive-up tellers, a couple ATM's, one drive up, one walk-up, etc. They are unfailingly friendly and polite, always seem eager to help during each of my dozens of visits there. The ONLY reason they don't get that fifth star is because they wouldn't help me retrieve my ATM from the outside ATM.

They could have asked the Brinks folks to bring it in next time they emptied the machine, but just resisted and resisted. Caused me a huge financial hassle because I had a Wachovia account that hadn't been converted and it took me two weeks to get a new card, and I had to change lots of auto-payments.

Sun American is a great company to work with. Derek and his team were there every step of the way during the process and we closed just like we were supposed to. They kept me in the loop and were very responsive. I would highly recommend them to anyone that is looking to purchase or refinance.

Rex Duffin and his whole team made buying my new home easy! They took care of all the details and I was able to close a week early. Everyone responded quickly to my emails & texts whenever I had questions and were always willing to help me.

We had a really bad experience in 1993 and even filed a complaint with the Arizona Banking Commission.  While legally, they did nothing wrong, it cost us money and in our view was very unethical and immoral. Terry Turk and Todd Rogers both refused to make it right.  

It really boiled down to their rejecting our suggestion to make the loan go through.  Then when they couldn't get it done, (as Todd Rogers said "we have nothing to lose now so why not") they took our suggestion and the extra charges were born by us not them.  Using our suggestion, the loan did go through.  WE DID THEIR JOB FOR THEM!!!!  It cost us extra money that wouldn't have been the case if they had just taken our suggestion in the first place.  Really unfair!  They didn't step up and admit they were wrong and offer to pay the extra charges.

We gave the next 30 loans to another lender Ferrell Beazer of at the time Express One Mortgage. We were real estate investors at the time that knew what was required.  The supposed professionals did not and it cost us money.

Suggestion:  Try someone else and save some money.  We thought by now for sure they would be out of business.  It's surprising they are still in business?

Absolutely, without a doubt the WORST bank I've visited in AZ. The people at this branch are incredibly rude as well as just not caring at all. I was attempting a deposit of all things. Don't waste your time with this branch and after this experience, US Bank will get NONE of my money.

Even their company website customer reviews for this branch are 2.5 out of 5!
They are crooks bunch of idiots here they are unprofessional and don't know how to handle money properly

I don't know where to start about these guys except to say Chase Bank = worst bank ever. I had no choice become a customer of these crooks because they bought my home loan from another company. I had no say in the matter. If I had a choice, Chase bank would be my very last choice. I feel much more like a victim of this horrible company than a customer. Their app is terrible and doesn't work right, so they reward themselves for it handsomely with a healthy late fee for themselves. Now, they make me pay my mortgage with a cashier check or cash only, because when they went to "reward" themselves with some of my hard earned money for their gross incompetence, my bank USAA, best bank in the world, denied them. I can't express how much I hate dealing with these guys, and they stand by their lack of empathy and poor customer service. They truly don't care, they make their money off of late fees and tricky practices. If you're thinking of banking with Chase, just don't, they truly suck. You'll wish you didn't. There's a Desert Schools credit union across the street, and they are a much better choice, I have them also, and they are great.

I had a very bad experience at this chase...I waited very patiently in line and the person who helped me,Jesse, was very rude. I just had some very simple questions and he was very short with me and tossed my cards at me twice which I thought was very strange because I was being very polite. Jesse just looked like he didn't wanna be there or help anyone.

For a smaller bank, you would expect greater customer service and more personal treatment from its management. Unfortunately, their customer policies and banking solutions don't compare to their larger competitors. Their treatment of good customers, when there is a discrepancy involved, is plain awful.  The only reason why I am still banking there is because I received a great promotional rate on a HELOC awhile back. Once the HELOC expires, there is absolutely no reason to bank there again.

Thumbs up to MidFirst bank. We have our business account with them and there was some fraudulent activity. They caught it before I did and acted immediately saving me what could have been a lot of money. It just reaffirms our decision to move our business to this great bank. Antonetta and Nelson have been great to work with.

We first went to MidFirst when looking to refinance our business loan. Tom (at 64th & Greenway) went above and beyond to pull off a complicated deal. Now after this I am even more impressed with the bank and the staff. 

Thank you MidFirst

If I could give this bank a zero I would.  Constant issues with them holding title company checks in larger amounts.  They actually held a large cash deposit today.  Cash!  The management is always changing.  Drive thru can take 20 minutes for a small transaction.It's just a shame that this particular branch brings down the reputation of the entire bank.  You should be able to access your money.  We had a $2500 spending limit that we never knew about until denied a booking for a vacation.  More time out my day to have them correct this. Choose another banking establishment.
Love Midfirst in general.  Drove by and needed the cash after hours.  Only one ATM, no problem, fast in and out, definitely will recommend to friends.

After being a frustrated Citibank customer for over 10 years, our move to Charlotte a while back happily forced me to switch banks. Hooray for Credit Unions!

Compared to other Credit Unions I've done business with, CMCU holds up pretty well. They absolutely excel in customer service - they hire smart, happy people who put out positive vibes and treat you like you're special. Honestly, most CUs have this nailed - it's an essential part of the experience, obviously - so ya.

They're growing - there are now 6 locations in Charlotte. 

Anyone that lives, works, or goes to school in Charlotte can join - which means anyone in our fair city who wants to opt out of the big bank BS can jump on the CU bandwagon. Although this is a growing trend among CUs, many still serve specific populations (ie, state workers, telecommunications employees, etc) and their families, so it's rad that CLT has a Credit Union that will work with anyone in the area.

But - c'mon, you knew it was coming - CMCU's not perfect. Dings include:

Broken or empty ATM's at peak hours (broken) and Sundays (empty). Only worth mentioning because of the frequency at which these things occur.

Outdated technology at the ATMs (if you need to check balances, make transfers, and withdrawal money, you'll be sticking your card in and keying your code three times). Website's a tad slow and anti-intuitive. But, they do electronic statements, so that's helpful.

ATM withdrawals are limited to 4 per month before they start assigning fees. Yeah, that's pretty lame. Getting cash back from a store purchase won't cost you or count.

Conservative lending practices and membership approval goes with the territory at CUs, so expect a pretty thorough financial check-up before becoming part of the Union.

All in all, I'm pretty comfy with CMCU and plan on continuing to be a customer. However, if I had access to other more "exclusive" CUs, I'd probably do some exploring.

I don't usually take the time to write a post (especially about something like a financial institution), but I really can't say enough good things about this credit union! I joined today after my friend recommended I check them out, as I was feeling uneasy about the interest rate I secured for a car. Ashley and Martha at the Ashley Road location were wonderfully helpful, customer-oriented, and were able to cut the other rate in a bit more than half. The level of service, competitiveness of rates and ease of communication is genuinely outstanding. I now intend on making Charlotte Metro my primary financial institution for not only major lending activities, but daily banking as well because of this excellent experience. As  a side note to the review discussing "shady" practices in reference to overdraft fees, the CU gives you the option when you open the account to not permit any payments to clear your account (i.e., decline attempted charges) if it will cause an overdraft to ensure no fee can occur. Just an FYI :)

Things started off pretty good at this credit union, until I realized they're so much like a bank they should just call themselves one! I initially opened an account with CMCU because they had better auto loan rates than other comparable financial institutions. To get that rate, I was forced to open- and keep open- a savings account with a minimum $25.00/balance. After dealing with over a year of medical illness and hospitalizations, I fell behind on that loan. I made prior arrangements to pay my auto loan (which I had never been late with before) on such a date and in the amount of xyz, and without so much as a notification from CMCU, when I got a sum of money deposited into my checking account from a relative trying to help out (but had plans on using it for groceries and other necessities), Charlotte Metro went ahead and helped themselves to MY MONEY to get me caught back up on the loan, when I had already made plans to pay the auto loan with an advisor from their loan department. Without that immediate cash, I was unable to buy groceries for my daughter and pet food for my two small dogs, let alone gas to get to work or food for myself. I'm sorry, but putting food into my 3-year-old's mouth is, and will always be, more important than a less-than-30-day delinquent auto payment. I've never heard of any financial institution going into an account (even if they see the money is there) and simply helping themselves to it! Not only did Charlotte Metro do this once, but TWICE! You would think I would have learned my lesson during that first struggle/hardship that they caused me, but unfortunately it took me twice to learn. Never again! Readers, beware!

I have been a member for several years and was pleased until recently. Two weeks ago there was a mixup with the credit card I obtained through them and I suspected fraud.  I had the card shut down and a new card number was issued.  Their credit card is  with a bank in 
Nebraska, and I found out today that their bill pay system is outsourced to Virginia.  They are starting their own credit card next month but I was told that if I want to switch to that one I will have to go through the entire new customer application process.  This will really hurt my credit score if I close down the first account and do this.  Every penny I own is in this credit union, and I am upset that they could not just transfer me from the card THEY set me up with to their new local card service (there is 0 balance and were never any late payments.).  I am also having an issue with this Omaha bank because I paid the balance with my online CMCU bill pay and they say they didn't receive it.  The money was deducted from my account and hopefully this is just a small glitch that will be straightened out.  But I thought the main point of a credit union as opposed to a bank was that everything is handled locally. That would have avoided some of my problem.   With all this outsourcing I am questioning if I'd do better to switch back to a local bank.

CMCU This credit Union is engaging in the same shady business as banks. They process the large amounts first, even if they are more recent than your small charges; all in the hopes of over-drafting your account then charging you $33 fee for each overdraft. Shameful!!

Great for a local close to home credit union - which is perfect for me. I use this for my small business. I would like to see an update with the ATMs though... it would be nice to be able to deposit cash at the ATM.  That is the only time I need to go into the bank b/c I use the App to deposit checks.  Everyone is friendly - great customer service - and that outweighs the ATM.
The drive through is a complete joke. You are guaranteed to be waiting a minimum of 10 minutes. They need to hire an employee to strictly work the drive up window.

I used to be with farmers and they kept raising my rate for no reason. I went with Inspirion and have been very happy. Great service. This company has saved me and my family a lot of money on our car insurance. Jeff is very professional and gets back to me right away. I highly recommend this company.

Highly recommend this company to anyone I was with progressive for several years and it seemed like the rates were always going up I was hesitant about switching cause I didn't want to deal with the Hassel's of it not be reported to the DMV I didn't have to worry about it at all Jeff blitchfelt and his team took care of everything for me all I had to do was go in he took care of the rest!!!

Very highly recommend! Jeff provided a very personalized & professional service. He not only got me a lower rate on my auto insurance then the lowest price insurance company but with a much higher coverage. I was so impressed that I even switched my home insurance to Inspirion   Insurance and saved some more $$$. Thanks Jeff!

4 years ago this branch was terrific. However, the staff changed almost overnight and so did the Management. Susan the new Branch Manager is friendly until you question her about something or challenge her on a bank policy. She and her staff's favorite answer is always "No". With the new Branch Manager came a security guard stationed at the front door who stares people down. There is no reason for a guard in this neighborhood. Chase has good online banking services, however the personal service is especially poor. This branch with the new Management is a new level of poor service. They offer poor service with a big huge friendly smile. If you like smiles and free candy this branch is for you, but if you rely on personal and business bank services....stay away.
Super friendly & they always have candy!

This agency has been very helpful over the years with my home, auto and motorcycle insurance. A friendly and helpful staff. Elena is great! She even knows my cell and work number and greets me by my name when I call, I'm not sure if that's a good or bad thing though, lol.

I work graveyard so I never have an opportunity to go to the bank during business hours and the ATM seems to be "Temporarily unavailable" to deposit cash or checks. This has happened to me too many times to count and this time it happened to me and now I'm late to pay a bill because of it... If this can be looked into... I would greatly appreciate it

Holy cow!!! Terrible experience!

This branch is terrible. The line was out the door and there was only 2 tellers working and the wait was over 30 minutes. It seems like they know this is a problem but apparently the branch manager refused to do anything about it!! 

It's one thing to make mistakes it's another thing to keep making the same mistakes over and over again and not care about customer service!

AVOID!

I have been with West Star for five years now. I use the Valley View branch. The first four years they were great.  The tellers and the management always very friendly and helpful.  I loved it there.  No longer.  In past year or so they renovated and had a change in management and now it is the WORST bank to deal with.  The new management is unfriendly and unhelpful and actually act like they resent having to deal with their customers.  Twice now they have cheated me out of money by charging false NSF FEES.  They reorganize the dates of payments to suit themselves just so they can charge you fees.  I feel like this bank is stealing from me.  They withheld large payments submitted on the 30th, paid out smaller payments that were made on the first.  Then charged NSF fees on the big payments even after I transferred money.  My statement clearly shows the right balance to cover payments on the 30th but they claim NSF for items pending on the 1st then bang me $38.50 which reduced the balance to NOT cover the payments made on the 30th.  This is fraudulent.  Twice I have called the bank and the girl was rude.  I have been in to see the bank manager but is conveniently never there and never calls back.  Disputes go unrecognized and no one follows up or communicates.  STAY AWAY FROM THIS BANK IF YOU VALUE YOUR HARD EARNED MONEY.  I'll be closing ALL my accounts and credit cards first thing in the morning.  Disgusted!!!

Conveniently located off the 95 freeway, and close to the Meadows Mall, I used the Drive-Thru window (saturday hours too) a lot and it was busy! On numerous occasions, Jerry helped me (we were in training together- yes, I worked for the credit union, for a brief time.) and was very nice (I don't know if he recognized me the last few times though but maybe it was a  busy time).

The two times that I went into the branch: it was clean, and there were only a few other members, so I didn't wait too long to get to the window. I was treated courteously. The members seemed to be the more mature set, which was good, because I used to see some strange members at the other branches (if you used to work with me, you know what I am talking about!). There was a coin machine but I think that they did away with that.
Great place to get an auto loan. I don't have the best credit, but got 2.7%. Everywhere else was over 8%.

F@ck you Weststar!  After being with you for over a decade, you refuse to accept a check from a well known investment company.  Did I hear that right? You don't want my money?  I just tried to deposit a check from Edward Jones but because there was a third party on the check(who was present with me with her ID), you won't accept it?  I was going to pay off my loan and my credit card from your bank.   I can understand putting a hold on it until it clears, but to flat out refuse to take my money to pay you off is downright ridiculous! As soon as my account is set up with B of A, I am closing all my accounts with you and will never do any future business with your bank ever again!

Only 3 reviews?!?! Geez! 

Been with these guys for over 10 years AND have also had Wells & BOFA-WestStar tops them all! Interest rates are low, great customer service and they don't cut off a limb if you ever have an incident! I had a couple overdrafts back when when I first opened my account and it was a smooth process to resolve. The branches are always clean, you're in and out on all banking errands, no craziness. 

CONS: (A) They only have two locations in town :-( (B) Be prepared to pay fee's at every ATM if you ever  need to pull cash. 

PROS: Sign up for direct deposit to limit your runs to the bank & if you need to pull cash, go to any convenience store for cash back. :-) Problem solved!
Great office.  Always there. Eric and Jennifer are on the ball.  Highly recommend them!!!
Eric is hands down the best you can get.  I have never met anyone more loyal and dedicated that Mr Pfister. I'm very fortunate to be under his watch!

Eric is very hard working and honest. I have not had any problems in the 5 years I have been with his agency. The staff is knowledgeable and friendly. They are understanding and accommodating with my monthly payments based on my pay dates. I would highly recommend Eric to anyone looking for quality service.

Mr. Pfister is an excellent agent who deeply cares for his clients. Scheduling an appointment was super easy and reviewing our polices left us with the sound knowledge that we were covered correctly and at a competitive price.

I filed my taxes the first chance I got for 2014. I was happy that this H&R block was able to get me in quickly and didnt overcharge for their services. I plan on going back next year. My provider was new with the computer system but it didnt take her more than 30 minutes to complete my return.

Forget PLS...Forget TIO RICO....Forget Cash Time....CASH 1 is where it's at!!!!!! Their loan process and payment options are phenomenal!!! I had the pleasure of working with Brittany at the Thomas location and I was completely blown away at how friendly she was, how helpful and knowledgeable she was and the speed of service!!! I'm still in awe!!!! From here on out, if I ever need to refer someone to a loan center, Cash 1 is what I am HIGHLY RECOMMENDING!!!!!

I have to say I love this cash 1. They are always so nice and helpful. All the workers are very friendly.  I been going here probably 2 years and definitely the best title loan place. All the men and women are awesome. Keep up the good work. There rates aren't bad either they do title and registration loans. I mean all title loan rates are bad its the beast that it is but when your broke it helps out or you need quick rent money. Your payments go toward the principal to pay it off faster. Give them a try this holiday season if you need money. Very easy process.
Only used the ATM so I didn't interact with anyone.  The machine gave me the money I needed so I was more the pleased!  Always a good experience at Chase!

First off Danielle  that place you parked is only for Chase employees and you do not get charged you have to have a badge to even park in the garage. Also, that Chase is a place that is a call center and there is a Chase bank right by CVS , ( you cant miss it ). And  your BF should not have had to climb any walls becuse there are several pedestrian walkway right into the employee garage. So maybe don't blame Chase for you not reading the signs posted EMPLOYEE PARKING GARAGE. Also one more thing,  you cannot get past  the security in the lobby. I have been a member when it was Washington Mutual, which I loved. FYI, Chase puts their employees through weeks of training and are very careful in safeguarding your accounts. Actually people get all uptight because they are so good about account security and idiots like a BF or a GF that have lived together or has children together or a son helping his elderly mom pay bills cannot coax  an Chase employee to give them access to anyones account if the cannot answer security ?'s and have access . So being a customer of some shady banks thrughout Phoenix, California, and Utah,  that will give information out randomly or half the time their shared branching system is down. and many other annoyances. I give Chase 3 stars only because I know employees that work over in that Tempe call center off of Mill, and they are micro managed to the point that the employees are miserable and stressed out  . Then when an employee wants to take vacations they must stay employed the full year even though they have plenty of time to use, or if they quit lets say before Dec 31 then stupid Chase sends them a bill. So lets just say they dont treat their employees well. So Chase in Tempe with the big sign (call center)  stop being douche bags to your employees that get yelled at by all the customers all day    . Maybe have those big managers and leads take classes on how to treat people and work as a team with better insentives than a stupid chase buck now and then. Because Wells Fargo pays more and advances their employees quicker without the bully method. Also Wells is on the Top with higher scores as of today.  No I am not a customer with Wells and at Chase I only have a savings. But the inside people that share their thoughts, do not like how you treat them. Other than poor power trip managers and Vacation hours being manipulated so you can never quit without being screwed then they are a good bank.

I have been a long time Chase customer. This review is about customer service at this location. 

One star only because that's the lowest. I went thru ATM to get cash. ATM gave $300 of $20s. Went inside to exchange $20s for $100s and was told by the guy at the window they could not do this without running it thru my account. 

I asked, you can't exchange cash for cash without running thru my account? He said no, it was a Chase policy. Then he seemed to try to make up some illogical policy on the spot. 

I went to a second Chase location and they did this cheerfully and quickly without questions. 

What an arrogant ass the guy was at the Mill location. Another customer walked outside behind me and said "your guy must be pretty stupid, the guy at the next window gave me my cash without running thru my account."

Manager of this branch need to pay more attention to training and listening to their customer service training.

Owning a business on Mill Ave it's been an absolute pleasure dealing with the staff at this location. Every single employee remembers you by first name basis and makes you feel like an important client. The staff is always overly friendly despite dealing with college student all day long which I can only imagine is frustrating. A very busy branch but never wait too long. 5 star service

I needed to deposit a third party check into my account and cash it right away. I don't do this often, but my boyfriend uses Compass and there is not one Compass bank  in Vegas. So, I went in with his check and asked for them to cash it. Without any problems, they took it and gave me the entire amount in cash (based on my relationship with BOA). I don't use this location since I live in Texas so I thought there would be some sort of hold/fee/issue, but none of the above applied. 

Great service. Also, there was no lines so it was a very fast transaction.

I don't know if this bank is under staffed but only one personal banker in this huge facility is ridiculous? I had come in to close and open different bank account that b of a had set up on accident.... The bank is empty and there's only one person taking care of everything with a cue of about 6 people! Pretty ridiculous.... And thank you for the ridiculous wait time of 40 minutes to see the ONLY personal banker.
I like B of A, they do have a lot of ATMs everywhere I seem to be! I just wish the one at fashion square took check deposits- grrrr...its only a withdrawl type Atm...I dislike those...grrrrr

It's Bank of America.... what can I really say other then in terms of service, they fall far behind Chase but in term's of sheer numbers, they seem to be everywhere. Which is the reason I have been banking with them for over 10 years. 

Other then being close to school, one great thing about this branch is the # of drive up ATM's they have.

I really liked this branch.  The personnel I dealt with, from the teller, banker, to the manager are all so nice, helpful, and best of all knowledgeable.  This is the nicest banking center I have encountered by far.  

The only thing I don't like is the busy location.  Traffic-wise...geez how I hate driving on Maryland PKWY.  Nonetheless, this banking center is big, many PBs on duty, excellent customer service (for me at least).  

I will go back as it is convenient and of course, having knowledgeable PBs and management personnel is the best when it comes to one's finance.

Wow, I'm very disappointed in BofA and how they handle emergency issues and customersI 

I needed to make an emergency transfer of funds on my way to airport and had limited time. Something so basic and the manager says and I quote "wait for 45 minutes or go to another branch" and I say Are you kidding.

Time for a lesson of customer service. This loser should wise up and learn to serve the people who pay him.... I'm closing out my accounts and moving to bank that understands customer services.

So I've been a customer of Bank of America for over 10 years now.  My account is in Virginia, but I can access it here.  This branch has a bunch of ATMs, so there is never a wait unlike some other BoA branches.  

This last trip to Vegas, I actually had to go into the branch.  My dad locked himself out of his account back home since he messed up his pin.  I went into the bank expecting a problem but it is very easy.  Showed my ID, swiped my bank card in the little machine at the teller, teller runs the check through the check machine, and she hands me the money.  He was very professional and it was smooth sailing.

I wish all bank branches worked this well.
