I was having trouble with my bank Wachovia, now Wells Fargo sending my information and debit card to the wrong address, twice... long story, so I literally walked into this branch of Bank of America looking for a temporary solution and within 45minutes I had an account and debit card. The people were extremely kind and helpful and as a result I am currently in the process of switching over to Bank of America permanently.

This is the worst bank I've ever banked with in my entire life!!!!! They say TCF Stands for customer comes first... It's could not be more off!!!! Should've known from the start of signing up with them they were a huge mistake to go with! Nothing but problems in getting my debit card,
The customer service I have experienced is absolutely horrible, and now they hit me with three overdraft fees in a row!!! Seriously just want to cancel this bank account now I can't because I'm hostage to paying them over $100 in overdraft fees!!!!! I am very careful about my spending money so to have three overdraft fees seems absolutely ridiculous!!!! Out of people signed up at my work with this bank, models every single one of them have already closed their account because of issues they've had with this bank. Everyone should do themselves a favor and skip this bank when considering their banking options!!!!

Well read the other reviews of this bank. They are not good. However, i have always had a very good experiance here. True they are spread out,not too close to where i live or work. However, you can do a lot on line.  I have been in here several times and always had good customer service. Maybe i am lucky i never had to deal with Mrs. Torres.....They at this time will give you a $100.00 if you open an acct. very much like Chase.   I have referred 2 people and they have been happy with there change. Look into them and give them a try, maybe you too will like it.

I used to love my bank but they are going down hill fast. My husband brought in a hundred and fifty singles and the teller acted so put out by having to count them. I would have let it slide but a few days ago i brought in a couple hundred in fives and the girl told me she didn't want to have to count them she wanted to step into the back. Why? Is counting no longer part of their job description? Long story short we are looking for a new bank.

This has been one of my banks for about 5 years.

The hours and days open has been cut back, but it doesn't affect me.

The lobby is great, and rarely is there a line. When there is a wait the tellers are quick to thank you for waiting.

Coffee, Cold Water, Popcorn, Restrooms, & a Piece of Candy can often be found PLUS, the Tellers here have always been Professional, Kind and Efficient.
Ed Walden is amazing! He found the best plan for our needs. I know we don't have a lot of choices out there but he found a plan that works  for us!!

Ed and his team are great! They have helped me throughout the years with insurance issues and IRA rollovers. Walden associates are not only knowledgeable but friendly and efficient as well. Ed and his team have even helped me navigate through my benefits provided through my employer. I definitely recommend their services!

As a Coldwell Banker real estate professional I amvery cautious about the services I refer my clients to.

JoEllen James & State Farm are one team that I feel great about  endorsing. 
One thing we want from an insurance agent is EVERYTHING, right? Well, JoEllen James just might be the closest thing there is to the perfect insurance agent: smart, organized, compassionate, educated, understanding, and competitive as all get-out!

Terrible inside setup.  You're practically elbow to elbow with the next customer that's being helped at the same table. So forget about privacy. No real line to wait in.  No deposit/withdrawal slips. Trying to withdrawal a decent amount of cash does not go unnoticed by other customers, because you're cash is being counted for all to see. And the "lobby" entrance is right next to Van Buren.  I think I'll stick to my Scottdale branch.

Love this location right down the street from my apartment. Tellers and associates are extremely helpful except for one time where the manager was rushing me through out my visit there. Yes I will come back and sleazy do. This credit union have helped me build my credit, given me what I need and always been there for me. I am very proud to be one is Us

TCF Bank will close your account because you didn't respond back within 30 days to their questionnaire submitting your residential address and answering other nonsense and invasive questions.  

The only reason I decided to open up an account with them was because they were close and offered "FREE" Checking Account. Catch is, you have to pay $19 for some checks that nobody really uses in this time in age. I wasn't even going to continuing GIVING THEM MY BUSINESS considering they are a small BRANCH but I went along anyway & opened an account I now regret. 

First of, I was told since I opt for online statements I wouldn't get charged a fee. I did, twice. I called TCF Bank about 4 times within 2 months of being a new customer and each time got lied to with them saying they were going to stop charging me the fee & reimburse me, never did. 

Then, I receive so much JUNK Advertisement mail that, WHO REALLY sits & read their mail from a corporation from a BANK? Well, I don't & I didn't so because of that TCF closed my account. 

I called again, 5X, was told that because of the Terrorist Act of the PATRIOT ACT that because I didn''t respond back to their mandatory questionnaire, they were acting illegally because they could not verify my residence & because of that closed the account. I said I want my checking acct & fees reimbursed & the teller for TCF told me that I would have to reopen the account by SUBMITTING the questionnaire or sending in a electric or other utility bill of my resident. 

The Patriot Act is REAL but why in the US like I'm a dammmmm Terrorist?! Shit so backwards in the US. UK is a Kingdom for a reason! Much better common sense. ;0)

I've had an account for about 5 or 6  months. Today I plan to close it.  The idea of extended business hours pulled me in.  However what they don't tell you is the operate on midwestern hours so when you bank after 3pm local time things are posted as being done the next business day.  
The issue I have is I saw my account was in overdraft and raced to cover it before the close of the local business day. However I was informed I would still be charged the $37 OD fee on a couple of dollars mishap.   I thought at a previous occassion that the amount was $5 or under I would not be hit with an OD fee for any bank but learned that was not the case with this bank.
Today I discovered my mgmt company hacked my account to collect a $25 fee I refused to pay.  I have never paid them with bill pay. I have only hand writtenb a check or paid with a money order. TCF refuses to accept these facts and wants me to pay $32 stop payment or to allow the bill pay check to go through and then dispute it.  As I told them I am not working and $25 can create a nightmare of OD fees for me in the meantime.  
My only resort is to close the account.  Cancel the legitmate bill pays I have in que and to pay my bills via a different bank account, MO or cash.  And to eat the cost of the checks I ordered when opening the account barely 6 months ago.  Along with the 3 unfair OD fees for accounting errors I tried to correct in the 1st 24 hours of noticing them.
The staff is not friendly at this location andeveryone claims their hands are tied buy bank policy or the time difference when I have an issue.
Also please note I can seldom get the online statements to open!  As is the case today.

This  branch is stupid.  I live in NY and someone in this branch in ohio processed a withdrawal from my checking account by typing in the wrong numbers, what a bunch of idiots.  I guess they don't have any verification processes or the people working there are too dumb or lazy to use them.  What's even worse is having to deal with  Chase's idiotic customer service department, this transaction was pending for 2 days before anything could be done and I got transferred to multiple departments who didn't know what the f was going on.  Chase is a big bank and has been around forever, but can't get their shit together when it comes to customer service.

Beware of this insurance company!!!
 
We have been a customer of this insurance agent for a year, paying our premiums on time every month without incident. We recently moved our facilities in September and in doing so we needed to update our new location, loss payee info, and our new credit card information.  I contacted their company in mid-September.   I gave all of my updated information including my new credit card information and was assured by the office manager Roxana that the new certificate with the updated endorsements would be sent to me via email within 1 to 2 days.  They also took my updated credit card information over the phone.  She assured me that if there were any problems they would call.  I did not hear from them so I assumed that everything was ok.  They have called me in the past if there were any problems when we first started the policy and since there was no calls or emails, which were the primary forms of communication that we were engaged in during the updates as well when I first started the policy, I assumed that everything was in order.  We had a water main break at our office building a few units down from ours at the start of December.  It did some damage to some of our equipment and office furnishings.  I called them to file a claim.  They gave me the number to the claims department.  Almost a week has gone by and I finally received a call from the claims agent stating that they canceled my policy for non-payment back in October.  I called this agent and they said that after trying to run my business debit card, which had well enough to cover the premium, that they sent out a letter of cancelation instead of picking up the phone and calling or emailing me as they have done with all of our communication in the past!  If you take credit card information over the phone and you are not running the charge immediately, any normal person would consider, if the card is not going through ,that they may have made a mistake in writing down the information in the first place. Especially if it is a customer that has always paid on time for an entire previous year.  Why would you send a cancelation notice when you could simply pick up the phone and verify that the numbers that were written down were correct?  Why would your resort to this informal way to reach out to a good customer?  I question whether this insurance agent cares about truly helping protect YOUR BUSINESS.  When I called to get an explanation, Agent Fred was very cold and rude unlike how he was when trying to sell me the policy.  My suggestion would be to go elsewhere for your insurance needs.  This guy really doesn't seem to care about the health, welfare, or protection of any business but his own!

They have always taken care of every problem that comes along. Even when Allstate gave me the run-around, Fred Ledford and his agents made it much easier to navigate and find a solution. I always feel like I'm their most important customer.

Why would chase assign a personal banker for location I've never been too?? They asked me to come in to meet my personal banker. I get to the bank at 5 like I was asked. For my personal banker to tell me I have the right accounts. I'm not sure what I was expecting but thanks Chase for wasting my time.
I only go to this bank when it's daylight time, I would not feel safe to go after night time even thought there's plenty of lights around the entrance and the ATM.

Went to open an account for my 16 yr old daughter. She is so excited to deposit her very first paycheck. The bank attendant who helped us was so clear and understanding. It was a great experience for everyone. She received her bank card today and screamed with excitement. Not really sure why, because she is saving for college. ;) thanks NSbank.

I called to see if they had a safety deposit box and what sizes. I talked with Dalton who was very helpful. They had all sizes available except the largest one called a body box. Also very reasonable annual fee.  This bank is huge with plenty of tellers to help you.

I needed a notary for some legs documents.  My first notion was to stop at UPS, but there was a sign in the window that said notary was not in.  I walked across the street and found three at this bank.  They were very friendly and didn't charge me anything.

Wanted to deposit money from another bank and was advised to walk to drive threw ATM on foot and look out for cars because they cant pull money from a Visa card inside the actual building LOL!!!! No longer banking here.

I have been doing business with Edward Vasquez for more than two years. He and Hector were some of the first people I met and dealt with even before I moved here from California. Not only have they helped me with personal plans (property, auto, renters) they have also secured my business liability policy, life and a specialized industry-policy that I needed to carry. Even if they don't have the product I needed, Edward went and found another carrier to write me the policy and arranged all the details!

They have been so responsive, efficient, helpful and pleasant to work with -- I cannot imagine going to any other agency. 
When my windshield was cracked, I called Edward while still in my car moments after a pebble did the damage. By the time I reached my destination, Edward had already arranged and texted me the details for a replacement appointment, at my work the next day. Amazing service. 
Just a total pleasure to work with.

I VERY HIGHLY recommend Edward and Hector at Allstate.

As an Allstate customer for over 20 years, I can say Edward is the best Allstate agent I have ever had.  He provided expert advice for insuring my car and home.  Edward and his staff Hector, Eric, and Lucas consistently provide outstanding service, particularly when I had a claim.  If you are looking for insurance this is an agency you can trust.
Edward is amazing, I cannot imagine getting my insurance from anyone else. He really took the time to answer all of our insurance questions. Thanks Edward!!

Terrible. This place unfortunately American west uses as a supposed "preferred lender"; but BE VERY CAUTIOUS. They will add on fees towards the end and hold your home hostage basically to get those fees. Basically tell you one thing to get you on board, lie and then hit you in the end with an additional 10k to lock in your rate. We walked away from them and paid our home in full instead because it was a TOTAL SCAM! They also kept all of our paper work, then refused to return calls. This place is full of complete MORONS who don't no anything about law, real estate or customer service. Others in our community lost their homes due to this companies scam. Unfortunate I wish they would be shut down by the state. One day it'll happen. Don't trust them

My boys were approved with US BANK definitely  the loan officer was very unorganized did not answer questions that was needed had to find out the answers but days went by before getting answers.I said see ya left them ( he never called  back to follow up) went with another company who did a great job said my Boys had no business being in a FHA loan so they went Conventional they ended up finding a foreclosure the bank wanted money held in escrow for repairs but what we needed the finance could not help us with and was told no one out there did what we needed ...well after me the mom called 8 different companies including chase and boa I was told by a few places Let me find out I will call you back...I knew no one was calling back even on Monday no one had called back  by this time I didn't care because I found a Diamond....so I will continue.. Friday by now its 2... I found Anne with iMortgage I explained everything in detail what was needed.  She told me let me ask some questions and I will get back with you. I thought yeah right its a Friday afternoon...but I was WRONG! She called me back around 4 said they could do the escrow hold out this was amazing...They close at 5 her team  stayed late got the information needed and my boys had there pre qual letter by 7:30 I know what you are thinking they are getting paid well, yes but so was the other 8 places I called and no one wanted to be bothered.
Everyone here was great to work with, they were organized and was always available for questions.
I am a future Real Estate agent and this company will be one that I will recommend.....

My boys bought the home that they wanted they did not have to settle for something else!
Thanks 
iMortgage

I would never recommend Freedom mortgage to anyone I cared about.   They get two stars only because they did get me the Nevada Home Is Possible grant and they closed in a reasonable time.   However, the loan officer I worked with was very demeaning, i couldn't get any type of interest rate quote or lock in until I was actually under contract (which in the past I always was locked in), etc. Plus their rate was 4.25 while others were 3.50/3.75.   At one point I almost went thru Quicken Loans but, again, the Home is Possible Grant kept me tied to Freedom Mortgage.  If I heard it once, I heard it at least 20 times how great of a loan officer he was.   I had to bite my tongue and listen to his condescending voice.   I made my realtor deal with him most of the time.   So I closed and thought, it's done.   

A month later I refinanced (I had to take a 5% rate for the grant) to get at 3.63 rate which lowered by payments by $200.   Two weeks before I was closing I was notified that Freedom had sold my mortgage.  They gave us a payoff good thru July 31.  We wired the money 7/29.  That should have been the end of it.  NOPE.  They transferred the loan to US Bank on 8/1.   It's been a nightmare to try and get fixed.  So now I have two mortgages on my credit report.   After two weeks of this Freedom FINALLY returned the money to the title company who is working with US bank to get this paid off.  

as I said above, I would never recommend Freedom Mortgage to anyone I cared about.

8/26 Update:  The nightmare continues with Freedom Mortgage who has admitted they shouldn't have transferred the loan on 8/1.   US Bank won't backdate the payoff and are requiring an additional $848 in interest.   I'm now getting past due notices from US Bank.   I'm to the point I'll have to pay the interest to protect my credit and then file a small claims with Freedom Mortgage.   NEVER will I recommend this company.  Next step is file a claim with BBB.

If I could give 0 stars, I would. This is specifically for the broker Samira Lopez who's part of Freedom Mortgage.

At first, I explained my situation and my plans for buying a house. She was on board and supported me fully. She also bragged about how she always kept up with clients and would get things done in a timely fashion. Boy, was that off.

At our first meeting, she and her assistant took my information, informed me of the next steps, etc. I left confident feeling as though she had my back. One week went by, two weeks went by, 3 weeks went by, nothing. Not knowing much about how all this works, I tried to call to see what I could find out. You know? Get an update, a further explanation of what was to happen. No answer. I called again and still no answer. I expected she was busy, so waited a little longer. I called again and she told me that she was busy with a client and that she would contact me later. She never did. Another week went by, every call went without answer. Until finally, she answered saying that her assistant could help me and I should email her for specifics. I didn't have her assistant's contact info and asked for it, which she said she'd give me later but she never did. I got tired of my calls not getting answered and sent her a text. She informed me that her assistant gave birth and she was handling everyone by herself. I understand that it's a lot of work, but you saw this coming for 9 months? Why didn't you plan for this. Besides, a month and a half later and you have no clue of me or my stuff?

After that and all her excuses, I gave up. Samira ran my credit for the loan and led me on to believe she was doing something when she wasn't doing anything. I don't appreciate how she stringed me along saying all these good things when none of them happened. Thanks for the points on my credit. Thanks for wasting my time. Hopefully Freedom Mortgage has better brokers than Samira for the sake of clients that want things done.

I love this branch a lot. So professional, responsive and friendly. I have been with them for many years (8 total) and 4 cars and not even thinking about going somewhere else. Also, they still keep me happy for what I pay and amazing coverage. Give them a chance to quote you. I bet they will be the winners.

Love Accupro! Their staff is so friendly and they are skilled in finding the best and most affordable rates out there. I don't know about you but I love being able to call a business and get someone on the phone without having to go through a million prompts while yelling, "REPRESENTATIVE!" Give Glenn, Eddie or Sara a call. They won't disappoint.

The staff of Accupro insurance are knowledgeable and friendly. They take great care of their customers and are going to provide superior service along with the best rate possible. This agency has been in business for many years and knows the Las Vegas market inside and out. If you want to get great service you should bye your insurance from this fantastic agency.

I have been a client of A-Accupro for over 15 years and they have always been extremely helpful and attentive to my insurance needs.  They continually try to get me the best deal out there and I would never look elsewhere for my insurance needs. Personal service and great rates! It is a winning combination!!! Give them a call and you will be very pleasantly surprised at how much you can save!!!

I am a small business owner and I have 2 vehicles one commercial and the other personal. Every time i seem to be in need of anything paper work, forgot to make payments, etc. Ed and Sarah always seem to come through and save the day. Service is everything.

This branch has excellent customer service.  Jesse opened a new account for me and was very helpful and friendly.  Went back later that day to open an account for my daughter and Jesse was busy so branch manager Lisa helped us.  She took the time to explain everything to my daughter since this was her first account and made sure everything was set up just the way we needed it.  After we left, my 14 year old daughter turned to me and said "I really liked that lady, she was so cool!".  

I highly recommend this branch if you're going to open a Chase account in Scottsdale.
Convenient location, great hours, and a notary always on site.

this bank is always under staffed with long lines.  One teller policy? what?!
the teller stated that the new policy is to have only one teller.  if that is true, boy that is bad business.

I don't have an account with Chase but I've made some deposits here for other accounts and everyone that works here is always so helpful and kind. 

I would consider opening a Chase account based on my experience at this location. 

Plus they have free cookies =)

I wish I were able to give zero stars. This bank is an absolute JOKE! The main teller is SUCH an unpleasant, rude person as well as one of the personal bankers. I will definitely be closing my account with chase due to poor customer service not only at this branch, but at many others. Never have I ever been treated so shitty at a financial institution! I worked at a credit union for 4 years and now know why I should have an account with a credit union and not a bank. You should be ashamed of your staff at this location! (Hayden Rd. Scottsdale)

One of the most common concerns of the newly arrived traveller to Edinburgh, or indeed any foreign city, is finding an address, getting proof of that address, finding a job, and sorting out a bank account. Now HSBC are onto that, and have a 'passport' account that uses your native country bank account as proof of who you are and where you come from. All well and good, but now comes the good bit. Don't get sucked into setting up your account at the HSBC branch on Princes Street. Hidden away down Hanover street is the Business branch, who also deal with regular customers like you and me. This branch actually has real people, who meet you at the door, take your details, and send you off to an office where you are seated and treated like a real person. Perchance there is a short wait involved, help yourself to a complimentary cup of brewed coffee, take a seat in a leather lounge, brows the foreign papers or catch up on the latest sports news on the wide screen TV. Not bad at all for a trip to the bank!
who am i talking to please and how did you kwon about this founds?
Have to agree with super-Rebecca. There is a great vibe to the bank and the blonde polish girl on cash desk is always very helpful and friendly. The bank is nice and clean and welcoming too.

I've been coming to NSB for years now. Very nice people work as tellers, at this location. Nevada State Bank itself, I'm starting not to care for. Unnesicary charges and fee's started in early 2012, without warning. Other than that small ordeal, my overall experience w/NSB has been pretty nice. Hense me banking w/them now for 4+ years and counting...

I run all the deposits for my boss at Nevada State Bank, I have to say this branch is by far the best of them all.

The girls always express a genuine interest in me and although I don't personally bank there, I'm going to open my accounts with them very soon because of the exceptional service.

The worst customer service I have ever received at a bank. I was asking questions n the lady just turned and put her sign n walked away . I went in there to cash a check I got for my birthday is was only 100 dollars. I just moved out here and I only have a valid I'd card and about to forms or banks cards. Which any other bank takes to cash one of there own checks. They didn't try n even help. Even a guy who banks there had trouble getting his money like me n him we lost are driver's lic. I just honestly never had someone say no n not try n help . I took the bus there with the last bit of my money n since I couldn't cash it . Thank fully I had someone deposit money into my bank card and I walked to use another banks atm. That asain lady was terrible I wish I got her name but I was so upset.

In this age of hurry up and go banking, I still really like the interaction with a person that's handling my business. I enjoy my experience when I go inside.. The tellers are always friendly and remember my name.. Not a big thing but its nice..

Please don't be suckered into believing this agent's grandfatherly trustworthy sense of looking after your interests. First meeting, he gives you all kinds of time and attention. When you call in to talk to him, his "trained staff" will listen but refer decision over to Norm. Make sure you scrutinize the policy and question the glass coverage. He signed us over from Acuity with comp coverage and later find no coverage when needed. All I can say is review your docs before signing.

"Norm" is the nicest guy his staff so helpful and always available for service.
Great place to get insurance.
Sandra Morals was an outstanding employee for this establishment. Its always good to have an employee who shows pride and enthusiasm for their job.
Great agency.  Whenever I've called with a concern, change, etc. they have been on top of it.  Great pricing too!  They saved me some serious cash monthly.  Ask for Sandra Morales - she's the best!

I had a GREAT experience working with Sonia for my insurance needs. I switched from Progressive, got better coverage and saved money on top of it!!! Sonia and her team are very professional and eager to help with all my needs. I have already recommended her to a few friends and plan to continue on with her and her agency for a very very long time.

I literally just tweeted a few months ago on how nice it would be to have my bank closer to home and I received notice weeks ahead that they are opening a new branch location near Chinatown. I'll take it! Beats driving down to N. Las Vegas or Henderson. A much greater branch location that lives in the southwest region of Las Vegas. Thanks Navy Fed for thinking of us!

I was also glad that they opened a more central location. Having to trek North or South for a 45 minute drive was such an obstacle for me. But no more. Everybody was wonderful and helpful, no problems.  In fact the only problem is, this location is so popular that my son had to leave because it was going to take too long to wait for help to set up a direct deposit.
This new branch is nice and accessible, the customer service and the staffs are Awesome especially Jordan.

Our family has used this location for many years, each and every time we received customer service above and beyond what we expect. The past several years our personal tax advisor has been Vicki, and her knowledge and patience is such an amazing quality and rarely found in a corporate company.

We will continue to utilize this location as well as recommend this establishment to others!

In 25 years of having my taxes prepared, Brian Wojtowicz has been the best tax professional I've come across. He's a down-to-earth guy who makes understanding your taxes easy. Compared to my last year's taxes, I received almost $3K more and he helped me find another $2500 from last year's tax documents which I will be sending in as an amendment.  He made getting me money his #1 priority and it genuinely shows that he cares. Thanks Brian. I'm going to this branch and Brian in particular from now on.

PS. I never leave messages unless the service is amazing or horrific.

Ricardo

I needed to get some Euros for a recent trip to France. I looked online for a currency convertor and Kantor had a detailed website listing their current rates. I always appreciate when businesses put details on their website! It makes me feel informed and more comfortable trying them out.

Kantor is located on Runnymede and Bloor, just west of High Park. Its very easy to get to from the Bloor station, just exit, cross the street and you will see a sign. The stairs lead you down to a small but efficient office. Tip: don't come here from Queen St and try to take the Runnymede bus up...it takes FOREVER (i.e over an hour for me). Just circle around the subway....

They were polite and friendly exchanging my $. The rate was as posted on their website, and comparable to the day rate. They have debit, so very easy to withdraw foreign cash. The bills they gave me were crisp and new! 

Its good service and I would go back again for a fair rate.

Nice, very efficient staff, no messing around here. I was in and out within minutes. 

Excellent location 2 min walk South from the Runnymede subway exit and down some steps. 

Good, pretty reasonable rates, available and updated frequently on their website. Better rates than any bank and the downtown core competition, but of course you have will always pay a premium for exchanging hard cash. (I usually avoid by taking money out of ATMs abroad using Tangerine bank card, and trying to spend all the cash, but this time I had multiple currencies leftover)

For convenience, I do like that there are no added fees, it's built into the rate. 

I fully recommend, and will use again.

I read the reviews here and since there were only two and had been sort of dated, I figured I'd just take a chance and see.  Well, I met her and right off the bat I knew I'd stick with her.  Terry was very professional and quite attentive to my need.  She was very friendly and caring, which is a hard character to find in a CPA.  After a week, as promised, my taxes were done and filed and got it deposited in my bank in a week!  wow.  I'll be coming back to her next year again!  Thank you, Terry!

I have used Terry two years in a row and she has provided an excellent service each time. She provides a very detailed, and helpful, account of your taxes. Unlike H&R Block or other tax service companies which you essentially pay to run TurboTax for you; she has an excellent understanding of the tax code. I strongly recommend her.

We love Cornerstone Home Lending!  We have had the pleasure of working with Pierre and the crew to secure our first home.  They have made the first-time homebuying process super easy for us.  They go above and beyond for their customers, and the whole staff is excellent at providing exceptional customer service!  They respond quickly and professionally to phone calls and emails.  Customers are not just another "number" to them, they strive to get to know you as an individual.  Thank you Cornerstone Home Lending!

If I could give 100 stars, I would.  Thank you to Vicky, Pierre and the entire Cornerstone Home Lending team!  We just purchased our first home and the process couldn't have gone more smooth.  All questions were answered quickly and the entire process was absolutely pain free.  Thank you thank you thank you!!!

I recently used Vicky and her team at Cornerstone to purchase my first home.  The process was so simple  Vicky is responsive broke everything down into dummy terms for first time home buyers.  I highly recommend the team at Cornerstone to anyone who is in the process of purchasing a home.

My wife and I had the pleasure of working with Vicki and Pierre and their wonderful team at Cornerstone. They are the only reason we were able to buy our dream home. 
We had a short sale in the past and despite that being more than 3 years ago and both of us making very respectable incomes...and rebuilding our credit.....not a single mortgage officer or banker would give is the time of day. 
Vicki and Pierre reviewed our situation in detail and agreed to take us on. Their team always kept us informed and were able to overcome some last second hiccups from the PMI company.
We got a great rate on our loan and closed on time without any issues. At the end of the journey we felt like they were all close friends.....yet we have not met any of them in person.
We only the highest possible recommendation for Vicki and Pierre at Cornerstone......you will not be disappointed!

Have worked with Vicky on a couple occasions.  Very thoughtful, knowledgable, honest.  Highly recommended.  I call for advise and she consistently treats me like a valued customer.  A true professional.  Very grateful.

We worked with Jill Fortner and Pierre, as well as many other team members at Cornerstone (Terri, Kathy, Courtney) on the recommendation of our terrific Realtor, Joe Scott. We were very pleased with the tailored mortgage loan they found that fit our needs perfectly. Service was professional and efficient  throughout the loan process, and we closed on time. We recommend them highly -- and many thanks to the Cornerstone team!

Vicky, Pierre, and the staff at Cornerstone are THE BEST!!! We seriously could not have secured a home loan without them. They took a personal interest in us and making sure that we were able to get our home when the big lending companies did not. We can't thank or recommend them enough!

I cannot recommend Cornerstone Home Lending highly enough. They helped me through a refinance under sensitive and difficult personal circumstances. The entire team was incredibly professional, respectful, and understanding. I experienced quick and efficient communication from every individual I dealt with, and the process was completed unbelievably fast. Every single step was totally seamless from beginning to end. Everyone I had the pleasure of working with went above and beyond for me. The whole experience was so personalized and I felt they all knew me and cared about me as an individual and a homebuyer. I am so grateful I turned to them for this journey! Thank you so much to Pierre, Terry, Cortney, Kathy, and the entire team at Cornerstone!

I went with cornerstone based on Yelp reviews and was very pleased. They put the whole team in action for you. It helps make their job easier when you have all your ducks in a row ahead of time and then the process is very easy. Jill was my loan officer and she was fantastic. The whole team is fantastic. Thank you all.

Cassidy and her staff are so amazingly professional! It was incredible working with them. 

We first came in for car insurance but decided to go for all of our insurance needs with them. 

They are super patient and explains everything thoroughly. They are available for questions later which is super important, not everyone are! 
I loved working with them and would definitely recommend this office.

Why is there only 5 stars in this freaking app?!?!
Let me tell you guys, I have always had 4 different insurance agents for my properties, vehicles, businesses, toys and all. It was such a headache and impossible to follow!
Until I met Cassidy and her awesome team!!! WOW, these guys are in top of it, always pricing out better options for me, on top of my payments and making sure I'm always current.
I would say the best thing is the personal care you get, it's as if they actually care about saving you every dime (even when you don't care for it) while maintaining a booklet proof insurance coverage for you and your loved ones.

I highly recommend Cassidy and her crew to anyone who owns anything ;)

Do NOT go to Cash Time Auto Loans unless you just want to give your car away. 
I was in a financial bind and needed a quick loan so after calling around Cash Time seemed like the best option. 
I went in with my car and title and was out the door with a check in my hand within 30 minutes. How wonderful!  It was fast easy and very few questions asked. 
But the good things stopped there. I was put on a weekly payment plan of $125 every Monday for 23 weeks for a total of about $2800. I was loaned $800 on a car with a blue book value of $2300 and agreed to pay $2800 total. Maybe I'm the moron here but when in a bind I had no other options. So anyhow I pay my weekly payments for 8 weeks in person at the office cuz that was part of the agreement.  The ninth week I went down to pay it and the office was closed due to it being a holiday. No big deal I thought, Ill just come back Tuesday morning. WRONG! I got up Tuesday late morning and my fricken car was gone!! Thinking it was stolen I called police and insurance company, etc. Come to find out the jerks at Cash Time took it. Apparently I had a 0 day grace period and as they said when I called "it's not their problem I defaulted the agreement."  They wanted me to pay  $1600 to get it back which was $600 more then I owed on the loan. UGH! 
The only reason I gave them 1 star is because I can't enter the review with no stars!

I've been coming here for a long time now, and it's always a good experience. Everyone is super helpful, and today, even when it was super busy as well as understaffed, Stephanie made it painless. Once we got to the back we were done in no time! Thanks for a great experience Stephanie!

Going to see Barbara was truly an amazing experience.  She made me feel completely at ease, like I was talking to an old friend.  I was blown away by how many things she knew about me and was able to guide me expertly through some tough choices.  If your looking for a reading with someone who is caring and doesn't waste your time and money stating the obvious, Barbara is exactly who you should  go see!!!!

I have been Barbara's customer for over 2 years now and I am in awe on how on point she has been with everything
 that has come and gone in my life!! She knows what she is doing! And I had been to my share of psychics who just took my money and said all the things I wanted to hear. She helps you find your way with her accuracy and wise words. She really dedicates her time to you and makes you feel like you're family and not just "some customer"... I am forever grateful for having run across this amazing person and experience and will continue checking in :) Thanks Barbara!! Come check her out! You won't be disappointed!

It was my first time experiencing anything like this and she made it a great experience. My friends and I went at the same time and we were all satisfied and amazed at the advice and the things she said about each of us. I would recommend anyone to go see her!

I am not sure if she was not able to connect to me, but she gave be a "cold" reading. Not telling me anything specific about my question. Rather she said many general things that could be applied to anyone such as "your a good person but when you need help no one is there for you". She then tried to push me to purchase a meditation to fix my situation for $300.

I went in there today for a money order. Tell me why the clerk told me there's a $5 charge for the freaking money order?! FIVE DOLLARS?! Whet? Like who does that!? Especially when other places such as supermarkets or even the post office charge UNDER A DOLLAR! I had even checked the website before hand just to see how much the charge was for a money order and the site didn't give one. That's probably because they know $5 is too dang high! Unfortunately, I was in a rush so I had to pay the 5 bucks but dang. Lesson learned.  Do you know what I could've done w/ $5? Well let me tell you: Costco's gas is currently $2.50/gallon. I could've gotten TWO MORE GALLONS of gas. A $5 foot long from subway before the tax. An Old Navy t-shirt for the low. A pack of hamburger meat. Underwear, b/c you can't have enough underwear. Basically you can buy a lot of things w/ $5 instead of spending it on a dang money order.  I have a checking AND savings account there but charging that hot mess price smh. Also had to wait a good 5-7 minutes inside before getting help.

I go there often and have had nothing but excellent service. They are one of if not the only bank that does not charge for a simple thing like counting your change. They are also open on Sundays which is awesome.
Great "small town" feel of the bank. Have always had good service with a smile.
I have made 5 calls - left three messages. No response and no one was able to help me until i demanded a manager.

Unbelievable customer service and know how from Heather White, one of the bankers there. She is extremely knowledgeable, professional and down to earth.
The rest of the staff was also very respectful, they made me feel comfortable and showed they care for the customer. The place is very nice inside, super clean, nicely decorated, very inviting. Brand new computers and printers, clean bathroom nice sitting area, well lit.
I never heard about this place before. I will be closing all my accounts at my 2 other credit unions and just deal with Vantage West. I will also be recommending it every chance I get!

Always the worst customer service.  I've been waiting 10 minutes for a notary while only 1 of 4 people working in the branch is busy helping customers.  They are too busy looking at their computer screens to pay attention to the people standing in here waiting!  I can't wait to change banks!!!  I HATE this branch!!!!!

I have been with this agency for a year and a half now and I've always received excellent customer service. I feel very comfortable with the fact that Sheri is taking over for Sheryl and I look forward to staying with Allstate for years to come!!

I regularly go to this bank due to its close proximity to my house, but that's only why. It is located within an Albertson's store and is very small. I normally do not give anything one star, but this branch has basically done everything to alienate me. There have been numerous times in which I have tried to deposit my student loan checks and income checks here, only to be treated like I am a scam artist, trying to con them out of money. Once, we went in to change my wife's name, since she had legally changed her last name to match mine, and they treated us like we were total crooks. I've been a customer of Wells Fargo since 2001, and they are pretty consistent across the western states, but this is the only horrible branch I have been to. It makes me want to cancel my account. They need to work on their customer skills and learn how to treat customers with respect and trust. It is understandable that in this day and age, that banks need to protect themselves from hordes of dishonest people, but treating every customer like they are there to cheat the bank and uncomfortably checking all of their information without as much as a smile is disappointing. I would not recommend this branch to anyone. Just use their ATMS. The automated/non-human part is just fine.

On my worker's compensation check it says payable at WF. Because I have an account,  they want to hold it overnight.  If I had no account,  it would just be cashed.  This is poor practice and customer service is of no use. I wish I had kept my accounts with Bank of America. Will switch back as soon as possible.

I switched all of my policies to this office after moving AZ in August of 2013. And had issues getting accurate information from day one. We purchased my wife a new car in January of 2015 and called to add the car to our policy we were told the car was covered my wife then had a crash in early February. At which time we were told that the car had not been added to the policy. Then as of February 20, 2015. We were told by the claim department handling our claim on the car that Nicole Schaffer informed them that we had pulled our policy from her office. (Which we had not done at the time I am writing this) So this office just dropped our policy rather than admit there mistake.

And forget speaking to Nicole yourself as others have stated here she seems to be like the Wizard of OZ hiding behind the curtain. And no one in her office seems to have any knowledge of insurance business or customer service for that matter.

Best advice avoid this agent or any State Farm office associated with her

Hey Nichole,

I hope you are having a wonderful day. 

I just wanted to reach out to you regarding remarkable customer service that Mr. Jerome Hammack provided to me on numerous occasions. He addresses the questions/issues head on and makes me feel important as a State Farm customer. His work ethic is spot on and gets the job done in an efficient manner. I am proud to be a State Farm policyholder because of him. He is the definition of REMARKABLE and he's a keeper.

Thank you for your time.
- James

I usually don't write reviews but I just had a major conviction to alert the public about this ah-mazing insurance office.  Nichole is one of the most genuine people I know.  When you walk into a Nichole Schaffer insurance office it radiates with positive energy.  You would think it was a unicorn in the back office but out comes Nichole shooting rainbows from her ass!  If you believe in the end of the rainbow then you will definitely find a pot of gold at Nichole's office.

Love this agency. The staff are efficient and personable, and my questions were answered quickly and thoroughly. I appreciate that Nichole is a strong member of the community and treats every customer with respect and courtesy.

I received a quick response to my initial inquiry and quick turnaround on my case. The principal attorney got it done quickly and efficiently...he also had the "heart of a teacher" in that he walked me through the whole process so I would know what to expect, and when extra costs may come up. I had a great experience...would definitely work with IBC Law firm again.

This lawery is terrific he help me by telling me what the law said about a financial situation and what he would and wouldn't do. I want to do things in the eyes of the law and do everything legal. I am so thankful for his advice I agree that he is very honest. Well if you need someone who is  honest and smart call him.

I recently had some questions concerning real estate and needed a real estate lawyer- one of the many aspects of this law firm. I was able to make contact with Matthew personally on my first call to the firm, and he spent a great deal of time with me. Matthew took the time to listen to my story without interrupting me, and then was able to walk me through several options before we agreed upon one option that was the best for my situation. I would highly recommend this law firm for your legal needs. They offer a lot of services, so definitely look at their website!!

Love this branch! Every time I have had an issue with  my account or needed some questions answered I have always gotten assistance quickly. Last time I was in I even had the branch manager help me. Super nice!

If you need a bank in the area this one for sure knows what customer service is!

Love this branch.  Since I live right down the street, I come to this branch as often as I can be.  This location used to be a 2-story restaurant / night club when the neighborhood was in development.  But since this is a family community, the business didn't do all that good so it was closing and then later I learned that it's going to be a Chase Bank and I was so happy that there's finally going to be a Chase Bank in my neighborhood.  I used to have to drive all the way to Tatum Blvd. & Bell Rd.  The only bad thing about this branch is that there aren't any safe deposit boxes so I will have to go to another branch for that service.  Overall services was great.  Definitely recommend you to visit this branch if you are in this area.

I am so happy I found Matt. I met him through a business contact . Moving from Arizona and a prior state farm customer I thought it would be impossible to find a comparable agent since I was extremely happy with my agent in Arizona . Started to get quotes from state farm agent here locally . Agent was combative and did not know how to figure what coverages I needed for my business . He is very knowledgable about the business aspects of the ins end which most agents tend to only know the residential side . Highly recommend!

Matthew Heifner - Farmers Insurance is one of the best companies in this field.  Matt knows how to get the best bang for the Buck.  He is quick and is always available for questions.   If more people could have the same work ethic our society will be a better place.  Keep up the good work.

This branch sits on a very busy intersections on Scottsdale Rd. & Shea Blvd.  The driveway goes into the bank and coming out is both one-way street, if you missed the entrance, you will need to turn into the shopping center and then turn into the bank parking lot.

There's only 1 ATM on-site and no drive-thru ATM at all which I think they really need improvement on.  But overall service was excellent.  If you need anything, go see Joe, he'll gladly help you out.

Daniel was great! His quote was significantly better than our previous car insurance company and the service he provided helped us feel safe, secure,and like he really cared. We'be recommended him to all our friends and family.

Daniel has been my "insurance guy" for the past couple of years and has been an absolute pleasure to deal with. Daniel has quoted me on auto insurance for both my family's cars, and on our home insurance. In all cases, Daniel's quotes beat every other received. 

The thing I appreciate most about Daniel is that he is always honest and even willing to sacrifice larger policies/premiums if he genuinely believes it is in his client's best interest (Daniel didn't believe my liability insurance on my car needed to be as high as it was in the past with my old insurance broker - and talked me down to a lower threshold, which in turn decreased my premiums)! 

I would strongly recommend giving Daniel a call to see the packages and pricing he can offer - I am confident you will find that his combination of pricing and service cannot be beat.
Nichole is great! Very informative, helpful, & friendly! :-)

State Farm is a great neighbor until you need their help, then you are on your own with half-truths, and misdirection. Will make this short and to the point, as to not drag on about an awful experience. Late 2013 we had a bad storm come through the valley that caused damage to our roof, which then caused damage to the interior drywall. All was well when I called state farm who burst into action and sent over people to begin drying everything out and an adjuster to look over the damage.. Funny enough (Now I know is part of their SOP) State farm found no damage from the storm to the roof (how did water get in) but did say the storm was bad enough to cause rain to blow up underneath the Tiles and cause the leak. Sounds Fishy, but fine, they are the "experts". Here is where Cheuvront Construction comes into the action, their "trusted" contractor; State farm sends them to do the work, which was fine by me, as I haven't the time to track down contractors, and I felt good knowing they were a "trusted" contractor of State Farm. While there they check the roof and say they find one spot that they think may have been a part of the leak, which was weird since state farm said they saw no damage, so we pay OUT OF OUR POCKET to Cheuvront Construction to fix what they see may be a cause of the damage. State farm is made aware of this and we move on.. Come 8-3-14.. Another bad storm and the leak appears again, so I call state farm who says to call Cheuvront Construction and that they'll send out an adjuster.. Adjuster finds no damage this time, and cannot explain the leak (awesome) while Cheuvront Construction now says that we need a new roof (without coming to look at it), so we need a new roof per state farms "trusted' contractor, but according to state farm there is no damage.. No loss paid out.. This goes on twice more with the same result. State farm won't hold their "trusted" contractor responsible, and they claim no damage, which is strange since before that bad storm the roof was fine when it rained. Fast forward to present day, state farm just cancelled our policy, and the only answer I have received is that our insurance isn't good enough anymore, or something to that effect. 
After being informed of this I call the office, then attempt to contact them via email through state farms own website, which In the past I used when adding coverage (funny they responded immediately then) All in all this was a horrific experience stemming from Cheuvront Construction, state farms trusted/guaranteed contractor, being involved in our repairs, and claims adjusters who see no storm damage from storms powerful enough to drive rain up a slope and under the tiles... 

Bravo, guys! You have shown me what horrific customer service truly is. So now I have to get new home owners Insurance, and they won't even help provide the docs I need to get new coverage.. So not only did they "miss" the damage that their own contractor fixed, but they also would not hold their contractor or selves accountable to correct the mistake. mind you, this isn't some upset guy on a rampage, I have Life insurance, auto, and personal article policies with state farm to this day, but that will change now that I have been told kick rocks and sorry but we cannot even supply one document necessary for you to get coverage.. A document every other insurer has said they would supply in the same scenario. I even spoke with an underwriter from State Farm who let me know to file a grievance with the executive claims department, but that there was nothing rake she could do. 
There was a nice young lady at this office by the name of Tiana, who absolutely did try to help in getting me some docs, but State Farm as a whole failed me in the most horrific manner. Although I know it won't make a bit of difference, I've file with the BBB on the agency, the contractor, and State Farm corporate withy hope it's helps even one person avoid this abortion. 

If anyone is looking for insurance, I had a local Allstate & Geico agent bend over backwards to get me insured, even with all this mess going on. I even saved $4 a month on my premium with the company I chose.

Nichole is the good neighbor that State Farm promises is there for me. Her and each of her friendly, personable staff, are the reason why I will continue to choose State Farm as my home and auto insurance provider. And she's a proud member and supporter of the Phoenix LGBT community through her business!

Working with these two has been a fantastic experience.  No other way to put it.  I'm trying to get all my scores up for an upcoming real estate purchase, and went to see Derick and Becky.  Total pro's, right off the bat, quick to respond to emails, and their "coaching" (which is how they put it) has been spot on!  Scores went up 87 points across the board in 2 months, and they have been quick to answer questions, clarify points of confusion, and let me know status on letters, new accounts, etc.  

Their pricing is also very, very reasonable.  When I was looking into this, I ran the math on the higher interest on a large loan, versus paying a well-run small business to boost my scores (I got hurt a lot by actually not using credit - was always a cash guy), and it was a no-brainer!  Keep up the good work you two, and I'll be sending more people your way for sure!

Derek Vogel and his team are one of the few, if only, credit repair teams that I trust my clients with. After bankruptcy and debt settlement, my clients want to do everything they can to improve their credit. They need to know that they have s trusted party helping them get back on their feet as quickly as possible. With Credit Absolute, I know that my clients will feel secure with whom they have entrusted with this task.

I'm a loan officer that does a lot of volume. I've had 50 credit repair companies pitch me their product/services. Derick Vogel of credit absolute is the best in the business, hands down. Look no further if you need credit repair services. You'll be happy you connected with him.

Thank you very much Credit Absolute!  Derick, Becky, and company help me raise my credit score.  It is allowing me to lower my car and home insurance.  They really know what they are doing.  The company is professional and very patience with you.  I highly recommend Credit Absolute if you are looking to improve your credit score.  Thank you again.  I really appreciate it.

Hello My Name Is Alex Berry, At the start of this year I set out looking for some help with building credit for my new business and to fix my own personal credit. I found Credit Absolute, and what a blessing its has been. I spoke with Derick Vogel, He made me feel so comfortable with what his company could do to help me with building my company and my personal credit. I'm so pleased to say that in a few mouths of working with Credit Absolute that My business credit is coming right along, But my personal credit has made the biggest improvements 

Trans Union went from 525 poor to 723 good, up 198 points
 Equifax went from 563 poor to 581 poor, up 18 points
 Experian went from a 567 poor in march to 623, fair up 56 points 

This was better than I thought it would be in such a short period of time. So if you need help with any credit issues, The answer is Credit Absolute. 

Thank you for what you have done up to this point and I'm looking forward to the future.

When I lost coverage after being laid off from my job of TEN YEARS...I was upset and confused about what options i had for insurance. I called Cornerstone and they were extremely helpful, patient, and understanding. They even met with me at my house! INsurance can sound like a completely different language, but they definitely have mastered breaking it down to the average person! lol

Lauren referred me to another broker, Susan, who helped me figure out which plan that was the least costly for my school's insurance requirement. And we got it all done in about an hour. She sent me everything I needed the same day, summary of benefits and my new insurance card. So fast and stress-free. Best people to go to to figure out your insurance and not get stressed about it! :)
Best insurance agent in the business!  He has gone above and beyond to make the insurance experience a pleasure.  We are grateful for all his commitment to excellent service!  We couldn't be happier!
Poor customer service. Does not inspire confidence things will get taken care of. Life insurance is serious business, I will be moving my business away from this guy's office.

Great help getting my issues taken care of with my account!!! Thank you :))
Their bankers are extremely friendly and know their stuff.
Sigh of relief when my problem was solved within a matter of hours.

Horrible customer service!!! Manager Ahmed Wabli is extremely rude. I've been a customer for years and lost my job. I no longer get direct deposit and Chase is refusing to waive my 12$ monthly service fee!!! I deposit a check every 2 weeks loyally but that's not good enough for Chase!!! Don't bank here!!!

Looking for a mortgage lender? Don't come here! unless you want to be lied to!

I used Chase as my mortgage lender, and it was one of the most frustrating experiences I've ever endured. Robert Page, my mortgage lender, said that we would close on October 16th. Then he pushed it back until October 18th. Then he pushed it back until October 21st citing some ridiculous reason. Of course, we couldn't close on the 21 because of another ridiculous reason, so Robert pushed it back until October 25th. You see the trend? Then, we were supposed to close on October 28th....which didn't happen either. 

If you can't close on a certain date, then don't make a promise. It's that easy! I would have been much happier if you told me from the beginning that we wouldn't be able to close until October 29th...in which case I could have chosen a different lender.
The situation got so bad that I had to reach out to Robert's boss, David Campbell. He said he would "take care of us" which is also another broken promise.
]In an effort to rectify the situation, Chase promised to reimburse us for the rent we had to pay when we couldn't move in on October 16th. Of course, they reneged on that as well.

Perhaps a federal credit union will be a better choice.

As a small business owner I love these guys!  There is always a friendly voice on the other side of the phone offering superb customer service.

Travis Jack is the best accountant I have ever worked with and I will be relying on his services for years to come :)

I have been bringing both my personal and business tax needs to John Metz for 2 years now.

The staff here is very friendly, helpful and knowledgeable.

 I wouldn't consider going anywhere else.

If you're looking for a reputable firm to do your taxes then look no further. Having worked with several firms across the valley I hold no reservations when referring clients and friends to Metz & Associates. Not only will they impress you with their honesty and integrity, but they'll also keep you informed throughout the process and answer any questions you may have.
First time with Jack's Tax for our 2015 return. Mary was so friendly and professional. The only regret we have that we did not use her for our previous returns. We'll be back again. Thanks again!!

I would leave zero stars if I could.  

I would recommend avoiding this credit union if you are looking to get a loan.  My wife and I contacted them regarding a home equity loan.  The department that processes the applications is completely inept.  After much time and several failed attempts to clarify information we gave up on them.

I would avoid them at all costs!

The drive thru, if there is a line, is the slowest one ever. I've been sitting behind one car for 10 mins and he has sent the canister 4 times and he is still not done. I mean go inside if your transaction is that long.

I would avoid this bank and this branch, so long as people with no tact for Customer Service continue their poor service. I have had so much trouble with this bank and trying to get good service and then yesterday was the last straw. I haven't been able to access my account for many months. Other things made the account unusable like the limited banking hours and the lack of transportation to get to the bank, since you are forced to go into the branch if you can't get into your bank account online, which happened way too often. So I just decided to close it and when I did, the female teller was very nice and efficient but evidently so new that some guy had to stand behind her, take over all her transactions and be so unhelpful that I couldn't close my account fast enough.

After 11 yrs a customer and their level change I'm getting charged 7$ a month to have my accounts there. They will only waive the fee if I go into debt with them.....Time to switch banks... 
Not a wise move at all DSFCU
Zero stars!

Had to stay with them long enough to switch my direct deposit to my other bank, unfortunately, which gave them enough time to snag another month of fees from my account, but whatever, now I'm free! When I went to payroll to let them know I was switching, they said they'd heard a lot of complaints about Desert Schools and their new program. When I went to the bank, the teller asked me why I was closing my accounts. I told him "Relationship Rewards" and he said "We're hearing that a lot". I guess they're getting what they wanted, though, higher fees, more debt, and more defaulted loans, as the guy behind me in line wanted information about getting an auto loan so he could "move up a level". Sigh.
The guy at reception had the personality of a doorknob. I get no public restrooms but made it sound like I was a total hassle to him

I am a huge fan of Desert Schools. They are really nice and great to bank with. I worked for them years ago and I can attest the employees go through great training and really do a great job at helping their customers. I recommended everyone switch to a credit union especially this one! The lines are never super long, even on Friday afternoon. I have never had a major problem like I experienced at other banks. The other major bonus is they have branches inside Wallmarts open all day Saturdays.

I just opened an account here and already regret it. 

I deposited a paycheck several days ago and the funds are not available yet. When I called to inquire, I was asked to verify the following information...
1. Account number 
2. First & Last name 
3. Address
4. Last 4 of SSN
5. A recent transaction to my account
6. Business or personal account

ANNOYING. That's too many questions in my opinion. 

Next I was told when the funds would be available. I understand business days are taken into consideration, but I will not have access to my funds for 7 days after the initial deposit date. They have a "hold period" of up to 10 days!

Side note, I deposited a check issued by the same account just a few days prior. That one cleared much faster for some reason...

If you actually want to be able to spend your money, I'd avoid this place.

When I get a document notarized at the credit union for free, then take it to my office, stupidly fax it to the wrong number by not adding a "9" at the start only to get a call an hour later from the bank employee who notarized it telling me that the person who received it in error had called her to let her know some numbskull was faxing important-looking legal documents to him by mistake, and does it all with a maximum of cheerfulness and forbearance. . . that's service.

CUSTOMER SERVICE LINE WAS THE WORST PEOPLE IVE EVER TALKED TO IN MY LIFE.... Worst bank I've ever had to deal with... I called to get business account number, simple task, after numerous attempts of having to hang up and call back, they finally gave me a number, the WRONG number on purpose after we exchanged words.... That's got to be illegal and she needs to be fired. Then she even has the nerve to freeze my account while I'm out of town and can't go into a branch when they're clearly in the wrong.. Grow up and get better employees. I'm making sure everyone knows how I feel about this credit union. I definitely would not ever bank here for anyone in the future.

Terrible customer service. Very slow. 

I absolutely hate dealing with this bank, especially this branch, but my auto loan is through them. Unless you're stuck with them for an auto loan go to Wells Fargo, they have exponentially better customer service. 

The Desert Schools online banking is primitive and the customer support over the phone is a joke. You're out of luck if you need something outside regular business hours. Go elsewhere if you can!  They will make you wait 45+ minutes to do something simple like provide insurance for your auto loan.

I have been with Desert School CU for almost 10 years now and never realized what horrible customer service they provided. I live in CO now and still continued to conduct my banking with them because I'd never had a serious problem before. The minute I have a pressing issue involving $100.00 that was debited from my account without my authorization, the Credit Union refused to help me. When I requested to escalate the situation to a supervisor, the telephone banker hung up on me. I'm finished with the unprofessionalism and lack of customer service I've been experiencing with them. There are better Credit Unions that actually respect and value their members and understand that a happy customer equals a happy credit union. For the record, I never did receive my $100.00 after the debacle.

Coming to this branch is worse than going to the dentist. Customer service is awful. Wait time for the simplest thing is rediculous. The obviously enjoy each other more than helping customers as I honestly waited 5 minutes for a conversation between two employees to end before they would even acknowledge me. I miss the branch they used to have in Walmart off Elliot. Ruins my whole day when I have to come here.

I came to Nevada State Bank after the customer service at my former back went south. I have had nothing but great experiences with this bank. Their loan department is great and very easy to work with. I have had no issues with my accounts with this bank.

After having some really horrible experiences with Bank of America in California, we decided to change banks when we moved to Las Vegas. After about 6 months with Nevada State Bank, we couldn't be happier. Who knew a bank could be this good?  Everyone is knowledgeable, competent, friendly and very helpful.  In particular, Kim has been very helpful, especially expertly helping us with an important and complicated wire transaction.  Thanks, Kim!

I came here today because of the reviews on Yelp. And oh how the reviews were accurate.  Best experience ever doing my tax filing. So professional and courteous,  wish I had found them sooner. If your looking for Professionals and to be treated with respect I Highly recommend Jack's Tax Service. Thank you Deborah and Jeannette .

Chose to come here today to get my taxes done (last minute) because after years of doing taxes myself this year was a bit more complicated for me to do on my own. So I chose here because of all the great yelp reviews. I expected to be waiting around a while since it was late in the afternoon, and taxes are due Monday, but I was seen within 2 minutes of signing in to start my taxes. Deborah was very helpful, and had us out of there in no time. Great customer service and reasonably priced. Will definitely recommend their business and come back again next year.
I have been coming here for my income taxes for 2 years. This place is great. Very accommodating with appointments. Judi is amazing. Thank you!

Just got back from doing my 2015 taxes with EA Mary.   First of all, if you're looking for somewhere inexpensive/affordable to prepare your taxes, this may be your best option. From what I was told, preparation starts at $60 (I was charged $88) depending on which/how many forms you have.. which for me is affordable after calling 10+ places and being quoted $100-$250. Mary is a doll and something as stressful as taxes on a typical person.. Mary made it painless and easy. She is so sweet and nice to talk to.  I was there for maybe 30 minutes tops. I will be back next year for my 2016 taxes! Thanks Jack's Taxes and thanks Mary

The oldest locally owned tax business in Las Vegas, it is the only place I trust with my taxes. 

They just opened in a new location with tons of parking and it's the same great people. 

2535 W Craig Rd in North Las Vegas
702.642.6131

Everyone is so nice and knowledgable. I was so happy with the women that helped my boyfriend and I (Judi and Leah) and how fast our taxes were done. I'm going to recommend this place to all my family friends. Please come here to do your taxes and save $!
I called these people BEFORE 10 am and have now been on hold w them for over 30 minutes!!!! This is EVERY time - I get the sense their plan is for ppl to give up and hang up

I would go zero as well if that was an option.  What a joke.  I was a customer for over 5+ years in a house that had no issues except for last year.  Guess what? Not only did they not contact me to renew but when I ontacted them they had decided that "management did not want to renew my policy"  I was allegedly informed via email which is BS because I religously check spam for instances like this.  I thought I had been auto renewed as I had been in the past.  Instead no call no write just dropped us.  When I call to file a claim I am told no policy.  Let me tell you the work wasn't that great and is all a scam set up through their Sonoran services company which does the repairs and shotty at best.  I have since switched my other home to Choice home warranty which is a national company that costs less and actually answers their calls.  I have had nothing but a great experience with them so far.  My recomendation is to check them out instead.  Choicehomewarranty.com

I like that there are WF banks just about everywhere, which means, you can take money out of the ATM and avoid stupid fee's. There is usually a wait no matter what branch you go to if you need to see a personal banker. The line for tellers usually moves quickly (unless you are in a hurry, lol). They have a cool program where, you pay $1 and you get your credit report with all 3 scores. You have to cancel the program before 30 days, because you will then have a monthly payment, but a buck for your credit scores is cool.

The poor drive thru window teller was getting yelled at by the tube customer and still managed to keep her cool and help me with my deposit. Susan was incredibly composed, and did her very best to be patient and polite, despite obviously being flustered. Be kind to these people!

I've lived in Las Vegas for 3 years and just recently moved back to California. This was the nearest Wells Fargo to me and my banker was Javier Lopez. He assisted me in many ways with my banking needs and questions. I felt comfortable with him for the reason we had the same last name, but also he did an outstanding job. I've never had any experience as the other individual making a review about him. He's always treated me with respect. I suppose some people get sensitive when they don't get exactly what they want like children.
I waited in line for 15 minutes because I need to get change for 100, these idiots told me I needed an account to break change, unbelievable

Horrible customer service,just a sham company,my problem still not resolved after 2 1/2 mo.Owe me for garage door opener,every time I call,get someone different,was told a month ago my claim under review,not holding my breath DO NOT USE THIS COMPANY,THEY WILL NOT HONOR CONTRACT

I've been using ahg for a couple years on 3 properties that I own. For the first year, I had no issues. I had a couple repair requests, and they were handled with no issues. When it came time to renew one of my policies they called to ask if I wanted to renew. When I said yes, they took it upon themselves to renew me with the 5 star upgrade and renewed the wrong property. When I brought this to their attention, instead of changing the policy address and refunding the 5 star upgrade, they just recharged me for a whole new policy less the 5 star upgrade. So now I've been charged nearly $800 for the one policy I was renewing. When I called about this their response was "well we didn't refund the policy that we accidentally renewed since its also due to be renewed in a month anyway". When I told them this was credit card fraud since they never got my permission to do this, they refunded me the initial charge after a 5 day wait. 

I gave them the benefit of the doubt and kept my policies with them. But the latest issue I've had is with a plumbing service call I just had done. I called it in, paid the $55 service fee and the plumber showed up. They promptly told me that the blockage I called about isn't covered by ahg. Ok, no problem. I proceeded to pay the plumber out of pocket for the repairs. The total came to $229. When
I asked the plumber if that was less the $55 I already paid, I was told no, that money goes to ahg and they keep it regardless if it's a covered repair or not. When I called ahg, they confirmed this and said that the $55 is their fee to dispatch the call regardless if it's a covered repair or not. They said their contract clearly calls it a fee, not a deductable. So I basically threw that $55 away on the gamble that the repair would be covered. 

I give them 2 stars since they started off as a very good company that did promptly cover the repairs in their contract. But they are quickly approaching 1 star level with their approach of ripping their customers off and hiding behind their vague contract language to justify it. 

I think when my other policies expire, I will be looking to switch to another warranty company.

1 star is being FAR too generous. After 10 years in real estate I have worked with my fair share of warranty companies,  I tried AHG in an effort to support a local business. AHG is by far the WORST company I've worked with yet.

I have been on hold for 28 minutes (as I type) waiting for a simple email confirming that they canceled my policy without any written confirmation or refund of my pro-rate balance. 

Nothing is covered, they nickel and dime you with fees and BS charges, and their customer service is the WORST I've ever experienced. Total SCAM, don't buy. There are plenty of other warranty companies so do your research, go with a firm who cares about their reputation and has the wherewithal to cover their policies.

Incompetent, Deceptive, Disorganized

DO YOUR HOMEWORK FIRST AND SELECT A WARRANTY CO WITH GOOD REVIEWS OR YOU'LL BE SORRY.

What a nightmare!  They never sent us our contract despite requests by phone and writing.  Then, months later they denied a claim saying the appliance was a brand not covered even though the service item was listed as "covered" on our confirmation email (which they said was not the actual contract, but just a confirmation email...hmmm.)  They had to come out MULTIPLE times to make a repair of the same appliance and the repairman was so incompetent that he had to look up online how to repair it...scary!   Sometimes it takes multiple calls to get them out.
