When you call to schedule work, they actually just take your info and then tell you to wait for another department to call you and this may or may not actually happen.

Before I wrote this I wondered, do only irritated customers review home warranty companies...are there any with good reviews?  I googled Arizona home warranty companies and found one called OneGuard and it had much better yelp reviews.  I plan to give them a shot when my contract expires with these goofballs.

My Real Estate Agent suggested this company when I bought another home in Las Vegas.  I had used another company for many years with excellent results.  AHG is at the bottom of the pit and if there was a ZERO rating I would use it.  Very poor customer service and although I was told that taking the "Elite Coverage" all items would be covered except my pool.  Not true.  I first had an issue with a toilet leak from the Master bath which caused a lot of damage to the downstairs dining room ceiling and wall by the time it was detected.  Since the damage was noticed within 30 days of close of escrow there was no coverage.  My upstairs AC was not cooling and apparently needed Freon.  Again the gas was not covered although my Agent had been told that everything with the AC units was covered.  I have wasted my money on the lousy company and would recommend anyone looking for a home warranty stay far away from this piece of garbage.

My water heater burst while I was away on vacation - i called them and they handled it immediately - The day I arrived back - they sent a contractor that was INCREDIBLE - Milburn Plumbing in San Antonio. I thought I would get the runaround because usually once they determine you need a replacement you have to order the unit....yadda yadda yadda - but the guy ran right out - got the unit - brought it back and installed it all between the time he arrived at 2pm and had the whole thing done and working by 5pm. So, 5 stars for AHG and 5 stars for Milburn Plumbing in San Antonio.

Absolutely Pathetic. Avoid at all costs. They send you forms to fill instead of sending a technician. No technician called even after a week for the HVAC problem that was reported and they started lying that a technician called and got disconnected phone message. My phone was working and receiving multiple calls daily during the time. All bunch of lies.
Avoid this company. Informing state AG to investigate this fraudulent company

It seemed they would great until the first guy came out and did not finish his work. The second time we called it was for a ceiling fan. It took them a month to get someone out and then when he needed additional instructions from the company they took two weeks to get back to him. During this time I called numerous times to get someone to talk with me why it was taking so long. I asked to speak with a manager on a Monday and was informed that there was no manager that came on That day...ON A MONDAY!!! I had to leave a message and of course I received no call back. I will be going with someone else once my year is up.

Read your contract, and don't believe in a word they tell you otherwise.
I switched to them from AHS the second year I bought my house - AHS was too expensive. I guess all the warranty companies are pretty much the same, though I had no issues with AHS. 
I researched for about two weeks before deciding on AHG based on their competitive pricing, and what they told me over email, assuring me that even in the case of my 20 year old home's HVAC breaking down, they would pay up to (yeah, watch that "up to") $5000 instead of only a fraction of what's required to repair or replace it. They bragged about how "no one else goes that high." So long as I purchase the platinum protection plan.
Well, unlike what they had told me, when my heat broke down 3 months after contracting with them, they would only pay $900 instead of $2000 because they had decided to cut me a check instead of replacing or repairing it. However, since they decide to cut me a check, they could just give me a depreciated amount. Wow, what a way to weasel out of things.
I sent a complaint to Better Business Bureau and they ignored me for the whole 30 days of it. I waited for them to reply patiently since BBB allows the 30 days for companies to respond. When I wrote to AHG asking why they had ignored my complaint, they completely denied it and called me a liar, forcing BBB to give up on the case. Lucky for them, this did not put a dent on their rating.
I ended up filing a small claims court suit, but I couldn't afford a lawyer so I had to fight for myself. Unfortunately, all the email communication with them were not considered legal documents, so despite all their lying and rudeness (the company president, Chad, was quite unprofessional, despite my keeping myself under control, but that's an issue no law suit can fix) I could not make the right happen. On the bright side, even though they tried making me pay or their lawyer, the judge did not think my suit was frivolous, and allowed me to ask for that $900 check to be reissued since it had expired by the time the lawsuit was done (took over a year).
Bottom line, they may be worth it if you don' t expect quality or greatness, but don't expect them to cover your loss if it's something you're not willing to pay yourself.

I was very disappointed with the way AHG handled my air conditioning system problem. Sonoran Home Services came out for repair and spent 2.5 hours doing nothing but adding 2 pounds of coolant (cost me $100 for the service fee and coolant). That did nothing to cool down my unit. I had very little confidence in the service man as he did not seem to know what to do and mostly sat for those 2.5 hours. There was no improvement in cooling. Several days later, a different service man (I requested someone else) came out and said I had a bad reversing valve. Not sure why the first guy did not see that. AHG picked up the charge for the valve and labor and I had to pay $370 for another service fee and a complete recharge. Still not cooling any better. I decided to buy a completely new unit as the A/C is 17 years old. I talked with AHG and they put me on hold to talk to the manager about me getting some compensation for a new unit (I knew they would not pay right out for a new unit and did not want to go through Sonoran Home Services for a purchase). The manager was conveniently on another line. I was told there would be a call-back right away after the manager was appraised of the situation. That was 3 days ago. I would never trust this company with an A/C unit again. Their practices are also shady. AHG owns Sonoran Home Services, which to me, is also odd. I am sure it saves them a lot of money to also own the service company (A/C, plumbing, and small appliiance repair) but beware the level of expertise the employees have.

Paid a whopping $500 for their annual home warranty on a property we own in Dallas. When we needed assistance with a minor repair, they did nothing. Repeated phone calls and emails to them and all we got was the run around on an item their contract guarantees they cover. If you feel like losing $500 you can give it to these guys or you could burn it in the backyard - same result. Wish I had seen all these complaints before signing on the dotted line: http://www.consumeraffairs.com/insurance/am_home.html

In a recent divorce decree, I was awarded the joint account my ex and I have with this company.  From October 2012 to February 2013, I tried to get this joint account switched into my name, but hurdle after hurdle was placed in front of me by the brokerage.  Finally, they told me that they would comply with the court decree when my ex-husband signed a release form.  As this was an unpleasant divorce, I have concerns the ex will not comply until I spend more money with my attorney and take him to court to get him to comply with the decree which states he shall cooperate with the transfer.  In addition, the brokerage told me that upon reading the decree, they could not find where the decree gives me the account.  The decree was marked with a large arrow on the paragraph pertaining to this award.

I fear that TradeKing is near insolvency to practice business in this manner.  In any case, it appears I will be out more attorney fees because of their business practices just to retrieve the money that I put into this account initially from my own funds.  

I have filed a complaint with Federal Trade Commission and with the Attorney General of the state of Washington.  I sincerely hope that this line of loud public internet complaint will at least result in me retrieving my money without further delay.

TradeKing, you will never ever receive my business again or receive a positive review or referral from me.  I hope others will speak up as well.  I'm sure their behavior is consistent.

Thank you Yelp, for providing a place to air my grievance.

Do not use this SCAM of a service. I was with a different brokerage that they "bought out". Upon transferring to their site I was immediately hit with inactivity charges and they almost NEVER execute OTB trades like the last brokerage.

AVOID LIKE THE PLAGUE! These are the kinds of companies that the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau are meant to protect consumers from!

After you get through the rather lengthy process of verifying your identity(I think they have to do this), dealing with this company was rather easy a fluid. Additionally, their rates are low and their customer service is responsive. Nice experience.

*note make sure to make at least 1 trade a year or you get hit with a pretty substantial fee.

I've been a client of TradeKing for over a year now. While looking for a new online broker my criteria was very simple: lowest trading fees. In my research I found that TradeKing had the lowest fees around. Unlike others, the low fees don't end after a promotional period. Each time I have contacted their customer support team, any issues I have had have been promptly resolved.

Been with this location for the past seven years and can say nothing but good things about this place.

It used to be located inside vons, but they recently move in 2013 to a open spot next to it. Their customer service is always on point and I'm always greeted with smiles. And if I ever need to deposit or ask questions about my account I never really wait long to get to the teller or representative.

I'm giving this review a one star instead of zero only because the employee, Adam, was one of the nicest and most helpful workers I've met in 12 years living in Las Vegas.  However, as far as this business goes, Wells Fargo is, hands down, THEE worst lending institution in the valley to do business with and they proved it, yet again, today with a $30 fee to wire funds.  $30, are you kidding me?!  When I asked to waive the fee, the branch does not allow it (They do in Wisconsin). This on top of their 'normal' account fees and hoops, ATM surcharge for 'non-Wells Fargo' ATMs, paper check and statement copy fees, and their terrible credit card, vehicle, and home loan options officially cost them all future business of mine today. I highly recommend Aloha Pacific Credit Union, Silver State Credit Union, and US Banks as good alternatives.

Extremely helpful and fast staff. They try their best to fix any problems and actually know what they are doing. My only gripe is that the Wells Fargo internal system does  not give them the autonomy to fix everything. Some situations are strange and require a human w/ common knowledge and not a computer program.

So we had to come in to reorder checks. The issue was that my father past away in June of 2015 and my mother had already reprinted checked without his name on it. But on the reorder this time around the bank had an issue for no reason and locked the account. We had to come in. 25 minutes later they figured that we need to bring in the Death Certificate to confirm his passing. Remind you she has already been issued checks in her name only once before. I ran home and came back with the death certificate and now Wells Fargo needs the WILL ABD TRUST.  45 minutes later. It's going to take 2 weeks to receive the checks. Best part I'm going to start using BillPay. Good bye Wells. I'm out this Bank. Again all this time was just to REORDER CHECKS. THATS IT.
Last time I will bank at this branch. It is incredibly frustrating every time I come in to do a merchant deposit. They are oblivious!!!

Every single time I come in here the managers ask me is it for business or checking, when I'm clearly standing in the business line. It's annoying they think because I'm young I don't have a business or something. It's kind of offensive. The tellers are pretty nice though. Except for one time I had a pregnant teller who would not stop talking to the other bank teller about stuff that did not have to do with work and it took forever for her to help me. The good thing is that it is near my house but they need to work on some things.

I personally have never had any extreme problems with Wells Fargo until today, especially in customer service. I had the bank teller name Liat and she was ok. She did her job and when she was giving me change I asked her if she can give me a bag because it to much for me to carry. She said we don't have bags and I looked at her flabbergasted. A lady name Jessica who I soon found out was the service manager came and I explained to her I needed a bag to carry the change out to my car. She said I can't give you a bag because it has out company logo on it that we ordered from Staples. I was once again was shocked how a simple problem could be resolved. So I asked her can I borrow that box you have on the counter and I will return it back to you after I finish putting everything in my car. Jessica said, "We can't do that because it has the company's logo on it." Then I asked her, I can't carry all of these out how do you suggest me to bring it to my car and Jessica said rudely, "if you know your were going to get change you should have bought your own bag." At the point, I was shocked and upset how I was treated because I never gotten this treatment before from any other bank locations. So Jessica walked away, I asked the Liat to direct me so that I can speak to a manager and Liat told me she was the service manager.  I look at the wall and there was a quote that mention courtesy and I wonder how she can be a service manager when she couldn't provided me the standard/basic service of customer service. Jessica came back and I asked her what this location's branch number is she gave me an answer and walked away. After I asked Liat, who is the general manager of this location and she told me that Daniel E. was the branch manager. During that time, some other teller found an empty $300 quarter box and gave it to me to use. Meanwhile, I asked to speak with him and she told me that he was in a meeting. I told that is ok. I will give him a call later. Liat then told me that he just got out and directed me towards him. I inform him about Jessica's rudeness and service. All in all, I would not go back. I would rather go somewhere else where I was treated better. I would honestly give them a zero star but since the branch manager attempted to talk to me I gave them a 1 star.
Never enough tellers.  No drive thru and atm only dispenses $600.  Forcing customers to stand in long lines inside

I'm struggling to see the purpose of these huge baking centers with just a handful of employees. One personal banker, two tellers, one preoccupied greater, and a mystical voice from behind a door. Came in earlier today and was told I needed an appointment, which I made. Returned at my designated time and sat for 25 minutes waiting to be seen. Once I finally was helped, the person that helped me was polite and friendly, without being overly personal. In general I would give this two and a half stars, but as the other reviewer stated take a book because you're going to have to wait.

This is where I do all of my banking. Its never really busy except for Fridays because of payday. 
They now have a rent a cop on duty probably because a few other banks in the area have been robbed.
I have been considering switching banks only because B of A is planning on charging a fee for every debit transaction beginning next year.

This location makes me want to change banks. The ATM's are a down about 50% of the time and if you need to go inside plan on waiting in line for a half hour or more. They NEVER have enough tellers! And the lazy manager there does nothing but stand around and watch people work. I hate this bank! I really really need to go somewhere else!

The lines are unbelievably long and there are only two tellers working. The manager is walking around with a clipboard and doing absolutely nothing useful and other workers are in the back. It's definitely time to switch banks.

Rusty was absolutely top notch! We closed escrow in less than 30 days - during the holidays! Thanks to Rusty's professionalism, knowledge and experience we will be in our new home for Christmas. Can't thank him enough. He is very easy to work with. Initial contact was via phone where he laid out all the expectations and followed up with an email reminding me of everything I needed. He didn't go back and forth like other lenders asking for a page a day. Very organized manner of running business which made the whole process run very smoothly. We've been through 3 purchases now, and about 4 refis and none ever ran this smoothly. Will definitely come back to Rusty if I purchase or refi again.

Came here and met with Rusty. A friend of mine is looking for a mortgage and since I was in the biz for years, I came along to ask some questions too.
Rusty was friendly and on point. We discussed the needs and he was able to find a program for my friend. I thought he was very professional and his company fee's were extrememly reasonable! If and when the time comes and I want to buy a home again, I will come here. There are a lot of shady brokers out there and Rusty isn't one of them.
I'll post an update as to how it went but for now, I'm definitely a fan!

WOW. Actually I have no words to express how Rusty helped me for the home loan process! I am an self-employed performer that been in this situation for last 10 years!  Just recently moved to Vegas and plan to purchase a place that I can call HOME.  Since as an self-employed performer that mostly goes by contracts to contracts even I had huge down-payment and great numbers of  tax return from the last three years. I called so many different Banks and Mortgage broker for loan. On the phone they actually simply said that to me over the phone "don't waste both our time". I almost give up keep finding for loan until I found Rusty on Yelp. I thought just give another shot to hear the same answer over again......! And I called and told Rusty my situation and he got me the answer is YES. I can do it for you! Then went to meet him at his office and showed everything he need simply he got me pre-approval letter right away....! Until then I still not 100% sure that he can really got it done for me until I owned a house one week ago. He helped me closed a house with in just TWO WEEKS from I placed an offer. Even my realtor she couldn't believed it went so fast and smooth. She said she never closed a house that quick since she is been working in the real estate for 10 YEARS. Not even cash offer could closed that fast.....! What can I say about that. I am so happy and LUCKY that I found him that he helped got my first home with this situation! I WOULD STRONGLY STRONGLY recommend Rusty to all my performer friends or whoever have hard time to get home loan before giving up just give he a call and he might have solution for you......! Thank you so much Rusty!

Jennifer is a top notch Insurance agent, deserving of her clients trust.  Dealing with Jennifer, it is obvious her clients well being and security is her top concern.  I have never felt Jennifer was trying to sell me something I did not need.

My wife and I first met with Jennifer in 2008.  She helped us choose the appropriate coverages for our Auto and Renters policies which were appropriate for our needs, exceptional, and affordable.  We appreciate the one-on-one personal service that we receive whether we walk in or call.  Also, Jennifer is supportive of local small businesses, and has helped our own business to grow.  Thank you, Jen, for all that you do!

Moved to Las Vegas from Chicago got excellent service on the transfer of my policy. State Farm agent Miguel and Ryan were so helpful in the details of the transfer. State Farm is what I have used in the past 10 years and with Ryan Janet it will continue.  Thank you for all your time and informative opinion of the proper coverage for this area. I will surely refer all my friends and family to you.

I cannot believe I'm back here again. I can only describe this man as desperate and 3 cans short of a 2 pack!!! After reporting him to the Nevada Insurace Divison and speaking directly to State Farm offices my wife and I decided to change agents. Imagine that? We actually want a new agent. It gets better folks. WE took awhile to find one since this isn't my lifes priority. We select a new one and phone them. The woman on staff emails this clown to ask for our release papers etc..Basically all our info. Incidentally we do not (belong) to him nor anybody for that matter. He's just an agent! She phones me back leaving a message that this guy claims he's working out our issues with us. I think he dumps acid, I really do. At no point have we spoken to him directly. I didn't want to for fear of my own temper. Suddenly he thinks he's gonna fight for our renewals.This is the point where they make money off of you for doing nothing.Which is what he does.Nothing. He has forced me to act again. I will call Sate Farm tomorrow with another complaint.Then the Insurance Division. His record will reflect this. It's how own fault. Vegas is full of idiots. Just full of them.They move here and think their are no rules to anything. WRONG!!!

I been with state farm for over 12 years. Ryan is definitely really knowledgeable in all he can offer. I highly recommend him. If you can't make it to him, give him a call, he can always meet you at your convenience.

I personally like Ryan; he seems like a pretty friendly guy and all his office staff have been friendly every time I've gone in. However, they let my insurance policy lapse while I was out of town for a couple weeks - and I never received a single phone call or e-mail from his office about the insurance lapsing. This left me in a tough spot as I got back in town and only learned about the insurance lapsing from a snail mail letter, and it was a weekend so Ryan's office was closed. So I had to have State Farm's central customer service people run me around in circles while trying to figure out how to get me back on my policy.

I take responsibility for not being in town to get my mail, but I definitely deserved a courtesy call or e-mail. Bottom line is when I'm already a customer and want to keep being a customer and the company allows the service to lapse without a single call or e-mail, I can only assume they don't really want my business.

I love going into Ryan Janets office to take care of my insurance needs. The entire staff Ivonne, Miguel, Aaron, Martha and even Ryan Janet himself make you feel like family. The office is always super clean and neat and no matter what they always always greet you with a smile and friendly warm welcome when you walk in. You guys are the best and thank you soooo much for all you do.

I've had many home loans over the years with a variety different companies, but few that worked as well as this one.  From the day we were quoted a great rate to the day we closed the process was efficient, simple and best of all exactly what we expected.  No surprises, no hidden fees, just a great company to deal with.

I'm a first time home buyer and having Rusty help me secure financing was probably the best decision I made throughout the whole process. From our initial conversation, he explained the home buying process to me and what necessary documents I would need to start. He was able to get me pre-approved for $25,000 more than what I was looking for, which helped when I found a house because I was involved in a small bidding war and the extra funds definitely helped. Once I found a home and my offer was accepted, Rusty went right to work. I was able to go in his office to sign my loan application within a week of my offer being accepted, he had my appraisal scheduled right away and because we did most of my underwriting during the pre-approval process I was ready to close 2 and half weeks after my offer was accepted, I ended up only closing a day early because the seller wasn't ready to move so fast. 

Before buying my home, I did a lot of research on what to expect and I was planning on running into some issues but with Rusty he made it as easy and stress free as possible. I will definitely be using Rusty in all of my future home buying and I will be recommending him to all my family and friends.

Rusty was GREAT! This is our second home purchase and we had been through a long and crazy short sale process with the last home. This was just the opposite! Rusty was quick to answer questions and respond to requests. He was helpful and honest about the loan process. My husband and I both work on contracts and don't have regular jobs. Rusty made sure that we had everything that we needed (even when we made mistakes) so that the underwriting process was smooth. Our escrow closed early and we were in our house sooner than expected. Even our realtor raves about Rusty! I would recommend him to my best friend and if we decide to buy another home one day I will definitely go to Rusty!

Jason was a very good salesperson. We paid for a trust to be established. He said he would get our house placed into the trust along with our banking accounts. Since he collected the money it has next to impossible to get a hold him. It's been almost a year and our house is still not in the trust. Nothing has been done to get our bank accounts in either. After complaining and calling so many times we just received another blank special warranty deed. We are to get it signed and take it to the county. We already signed several for him, which he did nothing with. We will end up doing the bank accounts ourselves because obviously he isn't going to do what he promised. 

Be very careful using Jason and Family Tree Estate Planning.

I'm writing this review based on my parents experience. My parents have been searching for a company to do their living trust for quite some time now, but with some difficult circumstances going on with our family through the past couple years it was rough finding it in the budget. One thing that caught my parents eye was the free consultation. Sean was the rep who met with them, and helped explain the whole probate process how they could assist with my parents wants and needs. He was also very helpful by offering a payment plan for them since they're on a fixed income at the moment. My mom had no problems rescheduling the delivery because they wanted me to sit in on the delivery of the trust. I was impressed on how professional Sean was and just how much he cared about my parents being happy with outcome of their trust. 10/10 would recommend this company!

Te coastal credit union doesn't exist anymore, i had lost my credit card from the michigan state fcu and needed to cash a check, the new bank at this location is NOT part of the credit union consortium, and i ran out of gas in my car because they wouldn't cash my check.

There is only one reason why this is not five stars, lack of locations.  The WT Harris location closed but their ATM is still fully functional and that is all I need.

I've been with Coastal for 2 years now and have never had a problem.  I went into the branch for a car loan and left with savings and checking account.  At the time the checking accounts gave 5.25% APY on your checking account balance, far better than any savings account.  Over the past two years that rate has dropped to 2.25%, which is still higher than most every savings account.

Not only do you get an APY, but recently they changed their overdraft fees.  If you go over by any amount you will be charges $0.01 if you deposit money correcting the negative balance by 11:00PM that day or if its less than $10 overdraft.

Their customer service is great.  They have a 24 hour calling center located in Raleigh NC and anytime I've had a problem they've fixed it immediately.  

Again locations is the problem, there are NO Coastal Federal CU's in Charlotte or anywhere near.   You can do whatever you need to do at credit unions in their network such as Truliant, Premier, Piedmont.

Too bad ya don't have more around Coastal!

My wife and I relocated from another state and wanted to establish a relationship with a new CPA as we have fairly complex personal (selling our old home and purchasing a home here in the East Valley)  and business taxes, not to mention, multi-state returns.  Due to the complexity of our tax situation, we value face to face meetings with our CPA.   

It was tough leaving our 10+ year relationship with our former CPA who did an outstanding job, but meeting personally with him would've been difficult and inconvenient (not wanting video conferencing, etc.) because of our relocation to Arizona.

My wife and I carried out some research and found outstanding customer reviews of Steven Vogt, CPA which led us to become first time clients.  In the end, we were pleasantly surprised and relieved that we owed far less than we had anticipated.   

Having met both the co-owners Steve and Leslie (not to mention some of their senior staff and tax preparers),  I can tell you first hand that they do their absolute best (and did) to have us pay the least amount of taxes possible. We also found the cost of having them prepare our taxes to be competitive and in line with what we paid with our previous CPA.  

One last thing I would like to mention is that even though they were very busy (a steady stream of fellow clients coming in to start the tax process or picking up their completed taxes) during our two meetings with them, we never felt rushed and their staff was very friendly as well which is important to us.

We're looking forward to our continued relationship with Steve and Leslie's CPA firm as they've earned our trust.

I was a new client.  I had the same experience another person reports.  I brought all my tax documents thinking I had an appointment to go over everything.  I wasn't provided with any documents to fill out before the appointment.  I spent 5 minutes with a very unpleasant older man and that was it.  I asked when I would have a full appointment when I checked out (pretty ticked off).  I was told that was my appointment.  Of course I received my tax documents with a whole lot of problems.  Which I was charged way more than anyone else I have worked with because they had to go back and redo so much. I never received one phone call asking for clarifying information.  They just filled it out at the quoted price with a five minute meeting and then charged a whole lot more to redo.   There is no way I could recommend this tax preparer to anyone.
I have had my tax returns prepared here for 3 years. I am completely satisfied with the services and documentation provided. I expect the same this year too.

I have been using Steven Vogt for the past 4 years.  They used to be down the street from my house, but have since moved.  I continued to use them as they did supply good service, and I felt I got value for my money.  This year, my experience was drastically different! I completed their tax organizer as requested.  The Tax Preparer sat with me for 5 MINUTES! He asked 1 question and I explicitly told him about a big change with my business.  5 minutes after my appointment, I got a survey request, where I expressed my concerns, but did not hear from anyone.  1 week later I go to get my taxes, and sure enough, there were mistakes (A tax preparer who used ASSUMPTIONS!). They were good, but have grown and they lost the personal touch.  I fail to see how they are any different than Turbo Tax (other than price).  I fill out my organizer, they fill out some paperwork and electronically file it.  Last year using them.

I have accounts at both Chase and Wells Fargo.  Chase is BY FAR the superior of the two.  The employees at this location are extremely friendly.  Many know us by name, and several have said hi when running into us in the grocery store, church, etc.  I appreciate their friendliness and great customer service and will bank here for a long time to come.

Eaton-Provident Group has been handling my insurance lines for many years, both commercial and residential.  They have been super!  Professional, prompt, personable and competent finding me the best coverage for the best price, saving me thousands over the years!  Diana Phipps has been the best agent one could ask for.  One of the best moves I've made.

Diana Phipps has been taking care of me for over 15 years and she's been nothing but amazing. I brightly recommend contacting her and letting her find and save you lots of money. :) She's super sweet, easy to get ahold of, and very competent in what she does. Don't even hesitate.

I've been a long-time client with Eaton-Provident, first working with Greg and now with Sarah. We are a small manufacturing company, but always receive "Big company" service from Eaton. Response time is usually with-in 30 minutes and always take care of my requests for additional insured for new contractors so I can do what I do best.
Thank you Sarah!

I had an issue with a money order that required a stop pay and reissue.  Although the issue was my fault Aida, Wendy and Andrai were very helpful and resolved the issue quickly, professionally and with a smile on their face.  Good folks, highly recommended.

First off I like Wells Fargo, I do my business there with very little problems.  This branch is close to my house so I went there.  When it first opened a few years ago this was a very nice branch, with nice and helpful people.  

Now they have had 2 managers in a row, with the current one, Orlando Gutierrez being particularly horrible.  He is rude, egotistic and like to break the rules of his own company.  He, and his people have been reported to mess with peoples accounts without permission, open accounts to meet quotas without permission and closing his branch early on many occasions.  

Top this off him and the personal bankers at this branch are rude, and unhelpful.  The last two times I went there customers were yelling in the branch because they are so upset at these people.  

I went to another branch today to do my business, I told them that I had a bad experience at Wells Fargo and they guessed it was this branch and Orlando that were so bad.  The worker at the other branch said that most people who work there either quit or leave, and that he personally processed 14 complaints about that branch in the last month.  

Whatever you do, help yourself out and don't visit this branch, there are too many nice people at other branches in the area to make yourself deal with this.

No just straight out no I will never go to this branch again. 
Not only did the guy I worked with seem like he had no Idea what he was doing most of the employees were rude with the exception of one banker who helped me deposit my check. 
I was told I needed to switch over accounts because I'm no longer with my former employer and I was getting fined from not having direct deposit with them. Cool that's fine save me money right? Well the guy started setting up my information. Not only did we not do this at a desk we stood at the teller booth and he wanted me to say my ssn out loud with other people around and my current bank account # and address/full name. In this day and age. No thanks. He than had to come out and go to one of their Web Access computers in the lobby and get me to log in, than run back to the teller booth. Now I'm still dealing with the mess this man made of my account!  He set me up with an instant card. Doesn't work but get this the old card from my old account does...wth? Did my money get transfered out of my old account to the new one? NOPE. I had to call wells Fargo and they said the money was "locked in" and the account isn't fully closed it could take up to 3 weeks...uhh No way! So I had to call the branch and they figured it out but seriously it was SUCH a huge hassle. And not to mention the company I'm with now banks with Wells Fargo, this branch is convenient and close. Needless to say we drive to the arrowhead branch on 75th and bell SO worth it!!!
I've given this branch a couple tries and now I'm running for arrowhead everytime.

I was referred to this place to get a loan for a house. We met with Paula and was told our entire loan modification and new loan would not take longer than 1 month to process and have completed. We finished all the paperwork within one week, had everything turned it right away as she asked. From the date everything was turned in we were told everything would be done in a month. It has now been 3 months and Paula has yet to even start our loan. Every time we call she says she's working on it, and what not but I do not believe her anymore. Supposedly she offered to have the girl next door work on our loan, but why would you have someone else work on our loan if you're supposedly working on it very diligently??? She also told us it was a very easy process and wouldn't take her longer than a couple hours, but here we are 3 months later still waiting, what a joke and waste of time. USE SOMEONE ELSE before they waste your time as well! She also told us 4 times she would call us back to follow up AND NOT ONE CALL WAS RETURNED OR MADE TO KEEP US POSTED!! STAY FAR FAR AWAY FROM THESE PEOPLE!

My realtor recommended Connie to me.  Seems like Connie Bowman does not like to do hard work.  My loan is a complex one due to all the income properties I already have and write-off in taxes, but it is definitely doable as others have done them for me.  Connie gave me the run around, put me on the back burner, and eventually stopped replying and requesting items.  Gave my realtor the run around too.  Come to find out my realtor hasn't worked with her before, but with Cindy.  Not sure how Cindy works, but don't work with Connie unless you got time to spare, and not in a rush to buy a property!  Just not responding doesn't work for me!

I have been a Wells Fargo customer for almost 4 years and am just about done with the whole bank, not just this one branch. However, the situation that happened today might have been the last straw. I had a problem with my deposit, so the teller called her supervisor or another teller I'm not sure. The other teller didn't smile at me once while explaining the problem with my deposit and didn't try to find any alternate solutions to the problem. When she was explaining what I need to do to fix the issue she stated it in a very matter-of-fact tone of voice, no sympathy expressed whatsoever. 

I don't have a problem with the actual deposit issue, I had a problem with the teller who seemed like she hated what she was doing and was bothered by me and my problem. For a company that prides itself in excellent customer service, this kind of service is completely inexcusable.

Customer service is great. The tellers are always very friendly and have a great attitude. There Is one teller that seems to always be in a grumpy mood, but needless to say the other tellers make that bad apple fade away. Has plenty of parking, great location and I've never had to stand in line more than 3-4 min.

I've been with State Farm for 30 years now, and with Scott's agency for the last decade or so. Always exceptional service, on the rare occasion I've needed it. State Farm has always been there for me, and Scott and his staff have always been great to work with. Don't fall for some lizard or caveman on TV trying to tell you "you could save 15% or more on car insurance!", fact is you probably won't, if you go with the lizard. Their rates are actually quite high, and State Farm will generally be lower. Who pays for all those commercials anyways? Hint: it's not the lizard.

From 2008 to... almost 2013.

I still give Scott 5 stars.  He, and his staff, are excellent.  I have referred several people to this office, and they all receive the same service.

Scott takes care of not only my car and renters at a great rate, he also takes care of several members of my family as well.  4 years, and not a single drop in the level of customer service.

You really don't think about your insurance, let alone your insurance agent, until you need assistance.  This is exactly what happened when my son and I were hit head on in SE Chandler by a driver in a pick up truck going well over 60 MPH in a 45 MPH zone.  The police and fire personnel were first on the scene, then my State Farm agent, Scott Thomas arrived to make sure we were ok and to assist us with what we needed to do next.  I'm thankful that there were no injuries and was very grateful for having Scott there to walk us through the insurance claim process.  In a time when good customer service is hard to come by, it is great that Chandler has an individual that goes above and beyond to provide great service.  Thank you Scott!

Swanky day-time lounge? Your living room? Bank? Yes, all three descriptions would be accurate ways of describing TD Canada Trust's newest concept branch - the TD Help and Advice Centre. A place where they've figured out a way to actually live their "banking can be this comfortable" slogan.

Innovation abound, buckle up because this is not your grandfathers, fathers... heck it's not even your older brothers bank, so you might be surprised at how they're upping their game to service a new younger generation of clientele.

The biggest difference you might notice, there are ZERO tellers. That's right, no lining up to deposit your cheques, take out small bills, international currency exchange. But not to worry, where there once was a teller, there is a new innovative ATM that allows you to do many of these transactions, including taking out small bills from your account. Want $20 in $5 bill increments? You can here!

How about when you use the regular ATM? Well that is a standard experience, except when the front desk welcome staff walks over and offers you a coffee, tea or glass of water while you're taking your money out!

They are also home to one of the only vaults with absolutely no cash money in. So why have it? So you can rent a safety deposit box, the whole thing is filled with them. The brand manager (Andrew) explained that SDB's are hard to come by and these boxes are selling like hot cakes - so if you're looking for one act fast.

Now for the most impressive feature in my opinion, their layout. Couches and lounge chairs everywhere, free wifi and mobile phone charging stations. The reason for this? While they currently have 3 offices for your more intimate and lengthy transactions (loans, mortgages, bank account set up, etc), before long you'll have the option of taking these meetings on a couch with an adviser and the only piece of technology between the two of you will be an ipad. So you can choose to have your meeting on a couch in their lounge, on bar stools side by side on a counter, OR even in their heavily beaded curtain enclosed area known as 'the cloud'. If you still like privacy for your big money talk, not to worry, the offices are still there to meet in!

Overall a very comfortable and innovative banking experience and Mississauga is very lucky to have the first of its kind. Don't be too jealous if you live in Toronto, TD looks to open the second branch of this kind shortly right near Liberty Village!

Banking is now more comfortable than ever!

The employee who works the front door area, promised me I would see a credit refund in my account. He lied. I never got any credit as promised. Now I had to call the toll free number to get my refund. The service at this new location is terrible. The staff are poorly trained.
Mint payroll makes my life so much easier!  They are very personable and reliable,  I highly recommend their services.

My company switched over to mint payroll a few years ago after being with a competitor that kept making mistakes. We could not be happier with mint payroll, anytime we have a question they are available to promptly answer our questions. Fast and easy service.

Holy cow, I would give them no stars if possible.  Sure, their funds are fine, but god help you if something goes wrong.  You will likely spend hours waiting to speak with someone.  What's worse, once you get to someone and identify the problem, if you need to call back, they put you in the same long wait time, and then you have to explain all over again what the issue is.  You cannot simply be connected to the person you spoke with before (oh, and the person you spoke with originally will not give you a direct number anyway).  If this is the regard they show for their customers, they apparently don't need my business.

If you have estate changes, good luck.  Their forms are ridiculously long and take a lot of time to figure out.   Customer service is only available by calling 800 number, so good luck with the long wait times and multiple call backs required to finish paperwork.   Ughhh!

It's kinda silly to review a bank but like the other Yelper who reviewed this location, I just wanted to give props to their friendly staff.  Britney helped me the other day and she was friendly and efficient!  Also, I didn't really have to wait at all, but then I went on slightly off hours.

The location is a lil tucked off the main road so don't miss it!

See ya there!

It doesn't matter which branch you pick they all follow Wells Fargo policies, which are legalized larceny in my opinion. From where I sit the fees they charge are abusive for everything from overdrafts to "processing" fees. 

I had my business account there so I would stop by with my daughter. They used my bringing her by with me as a chance to sell her on a credit card. I asked them not take advantage of her being there with me to sell her a credit card she would get into trouble with. She was a full time student at the time. Sure enough she got herself in trouble with it and I ended up helping her out.

I had an account for which there was not supposed to be any fees. It seems like every month I had to get the branch manager to correct the charges they would make anyway.

I moved very significant funds over to another much smaller bank and I am much happier. Bank where ever you like, but I have had all I want from Wells.

This bank is wonderful! Sean signed me and my boyfriend up for a few accounts and he was just great. Very helpful and answered all our questions i details. He even did a follow up call a few days later to make sure our accounts were going okay. 
I have been in this bank 3 times since I got an account and everytime was a fantastic experience. Everyone was friendly and treated me like a loyal customer!!

I continue to have outstanding service at this bank.  In fact, it's been so great that both of my kids have opened up savings accounts at this branch and my husband and I are considering switching from the Credit Union.  

Last time I was in the bank, I was horrified to hear how a customer was treating one of the bank employees.  What did surprise me was how calmly she handled herself.  I don't know that I could keep my cool as well as she did!

Sabrina no longer works here.  However, we have had wonderful service from Eric as well as the branch manager.  

If you want to be taken care of, go to this branch!  They're great.

I moved to the area over the summer and came to K&M on a recommendation....big mistake.  I figured how bad could they be?  Their servicing was horrible and they lied about their billing and for as simple as tax services should be, they failed to deliver as I would have expected.

Before moving forward I explained my situation and how I intended to file and asked for a quote.  They told me $320, which was on par with what I had paid in the past.  I sent them my tax information two weeks before the filing deadline and figured all was well.  After not hearing anything for about 10 days, I called to see where everything stood.  I had not included one of my state W-2 and they could not finish my taxes.  They failed to reach out to me to ask for this additional information which I found surprising.  When were they going to find me...April 16.  I asked them to assess my filing method (Married join or married single) to figure out which would be more beneficial and they never addressed that question.  Let's move on.

They are not very accessible which odd during tax season.  Their office hours are from 9PM - 4PM.  If you need to speak to them outside those times, better use email or leave a message and wait them to get back to you.  Once they finally completed my returns, they e-filed them but never bothered to ask how I wanted to get my refunds?  They filed and I received my refunds via check but did not ask if I wanted electronic payment.  A very surprising practice since electronic payments are quicker and more secure than checks.  Clearly they did not have their customer's best interest in mind. 

Lastly, the bill.  After they completed their service and explained the status of my returns, I informed them of the $50 off online coupon I would be using.  When their invoice came, I was expecting to see their original quote of $320.00 less the $50.00 discount.  Instead, the adjusted the base fee up to $370.00 and then took off $50.00.  I was stunned to see such deceitful behavior.  If they were willing to lie about their billing, I am now wondering if they even did my taxes correctly.  I am considering trying to find a new tax services firm to have them review their work.

So...if you want limited access to your tax preparer, want to get your refund the slowest means possible and want to be incorrectly billed, use K&M Accounting and Tax Services.

I have been using K&M tax services for several years and been completely satisfied. Their service is fast and professional and they will help to answer any and all questions you may have. I would highly recommend.

We just had our taxes prepared by K&M for the 2nd straight year, and we're very happy with the service that we've received.  It was a quicker than expected process, and their team is very organized!!  

When we did our taxes last year, we had to take 2 appointments to get things done, but this year we managed to do it easily in one sitting (which was very helpful since we have a 3 month old baby).  I feel they were able to explain all the deductions and credits we qualified for as well as explaining why we didn't meet the guidelines for others.  I think we'll definitely be back for a 3rd time next tax year!

Selman Co offers a supplement health insurance for military families. It costs about $30/month(!) and it's  a joke. They claim they don't cover "preexisting conditions" in the first 6 month of coverage. The problem starts when they consider a throat infection be a preexisting condition. Wow. Basically, they cover nothing in the first 6 months. And I'm not sure if they will cover anything after. Don't want to waste my life on the endless phone conversions with them. Cancelling as soon as possible. Scam.

I have been calling for the last 3 days attempting to speak to a customer rep. Endless hours on hold or a loop which reinitiates my call and puts me back to hold. I've left phone messages, sent notes...all to no avail. This company is not customer focused to say the least. I can't imagine trying to collect on a policy - this was the systems response to my note sent from their homepage - Your Message Has Been Sent. Thank you for your email to Selman & Company. We will review your message and you will receive a response if a response is required.

Selman & Company auto debited my account for the first time last February 2015 for my premium. Two months after my payment cleared, I received a notice stating my policy was terminated effective two months prior for non-payment. I tried to call to discuss this and was on hold for twenty minutes before being dropped into a voicemail. I am going to dispute the charges with my credit card company and look elsewhere for coverage.

We were not impressed at all. We took the time to sit down with one of their accountants and explained exactly what we needed them to do for our businesses. Spent at least an hour and a half going thru everything and provided them with all the information they needed. They told us they understood and sold us on their services - but clearly they either didn't understand or were incapable of doing anything that didn't fit into their rigid structure. A quarter later we called to follow up and we got a "I'm too busy for you right now" reply. Not cool. Three months after that we realized they weren't doing anything we asked and we tried to find out what happened. Instead of owning up to their mistake - they tossed insults at us and acted like our earlier conversation never happened! When we took our complaint to the owner we got a very robotic apology with no attempt to make things better. Clearly this company doesn't work well with others.

This place is absolutely horrible. They hired the most ignorant and inexperienced  people to work there.
We had the misfortune of working with a leah quarzenski, and my experience with her was aweful. Very rude, very incompetent. I took my business elsewhere,  I w I ll never again want to deal with such horrible people.

Let me start out by saying I usually hate pawn shops, but when I walked into this Pawn 1st location I was surprisingly happy with how clean it was. 

The employees were super helpful and friendly. They were even upbeat and humorous! It didn't stink like the other pawn shops tend to either.

Pawn 1st buys pretty much anything you want to sell and it is a very organized place. If I ever wanted to pawn anything again, I would definitely go here again.

Well I was a loyal customer until today 5.9.14. After paying off my pawn tickets $425.00 after they had been renewed several times over the past year I inquired about my layaway that I did back in November of 2013. 

The assistant manager Art told me that the lawaway was cancelled back in January. I advised Art that I was given no time limit in which to pay the layaway and get this he said he knows and that's why they had to write staff up because they were telling customers there was no time limit.

I then said well can I at least use the money I already paid ($45.00) and use that towards the lawaway and just pay it off today?

He said NO because there is a 90 day layaway time limit. I advised him there was no time limit given to me. He said he couldn't prove that. I said you just mentioned that you had to write staff up because of them telling customers there was no time limit.

He then starting talking about policy this and that.

Keep in mind, they cancelled my layaway in January of this year and put the two items back on the floor. 

We are now in May (5 Months Later) and the two items are now on the floor for sale. 

Still!!!!

So instead of making the sale, clearing inventory and keeping a 3 year customer happy and coming back Art wants to hide behind "policy", keep my $45 and lose a customer.

Who promoted Art? My God why are people in authority so afraid to make decisions that promotes your business and keeps your customers happy.

Its not like I got mad and said I want my money back.

I asked to use it towards the purchase and I pay it off today!

I will take my business elsewhere Art and I hope your boss Edwin is very proud of you.

I don't have a lot to compare it to as I don't frequent many pawn shops, but Pawn 1st is #1 to me. I was here on business (to meet with the owner), and was greeted by the friendliest staff. These guys are seriously more outgoing than many staffers at Nordstrom! 

The store is neat, clean, and as one reviewer noted "doesn't stink like other pawn shops." No bars on the windows, guns or swords in the cases, and the staff is not armed like many other shops.  And from what I can tell, they have all of their teeth.  No really, they are all really nice guys! 

Every time I visit Pawn 1st they are somewhat busy. In these tough economic times, people need a safe and friendly place to get a loan or pawn some of their valuables. Or get some great deals on movies, games, or jewelry.  I even bought a few DVDs, for $3.00 each!  Keep up the good work, guys!

This place is absolutely awful and unethical! My house was robbed months ago and the serial number from one of my items ended up getting pinged at a Pawn 1st store. I went to go collect my item and they tried to sell it to me. I told them I would pay what they paid for it so they didn't lose any money and they said, "No we're going to need double that to make a profit. It's our item now and there is nothing unethical about that!" So my item is confirmed stolen via the police report and the serial number. I was reasonable and did not want them to take a loss so I offered them their paid price but they would not budge. The worst part was to look me in the eyes and tell me that it is their item now and there is nothing unethical about it! WOW, just wow! 

I would never use Pawn 1st ever again! They traffic in stolen goods and do not understand what ethics are! There are thousands of other pawn shops, go there! Do not support criminals under banking laws!

This place is a joke.
The service is very hot and cold.  You evnter the store and all the employees scream hello , hey, hi then do nothing.  I was with my friend who was getting a title loan so I just started to look around see what there was.  I walked around the store for 15 minutes before someone came over to me to ask if i needed help.
I went over to my friend who was waiting for something to happen or something.  

Rico Arellano - Title Loan General Manager is one rude asshole.  As my friend was sitting in her chair not sure what was going on because papers were thrown at her to fill out then quickly taken away from her, given back for corrections then taken again. We then waited for Rico to finish his 10 minute conversation with a customer who was sitting in the booth next to us.  Did not look at his current customer once, Kept talking in spainish to the gentleman next to us.  throws papers back at my friend, saying she needs to sign somewhere that she forgot.  Rico replies I already told you to sign here, my friend replied when? Rico then just stared at her and went back to his cinversation with the gentleman next to me./  After another 5 minutes of waiting for him to finish and him leaving the room to go to the back.  He comes out to tell me friend that shes been approved etc, all while not making eye contact at all, just staring at the ground.  After our business was done I saw him business card and reached to grab one, as I was doing so Rico then tries to sell to me I guess because his demeanor completely changed, trying to get me as a customer.  
I told Rico myself, "oh I just grabbed this so that I know how to spell your name in my Yelp review of this shitty service we just recieved.  Thank you." And walked out

If you need a loan, just try to be better with your money dont go to these poor service
I quit banking with them yrs ago because they charged for every thing even talking to a teller and I had thousands in the bank so a balance didn't matter

What a terrible experience. This place is worst out of all the locations in Phoenix. Long waits, only one teller working with 10 people in line, the list goes on. Needs to be updated in the worst way. The area is very crummy with all kinds of shady characters hanging around. Lots of high pressure when it comes to opening up new charge accounts. The only positive is the nice security guard by the door. I only go in the branch if I really have to. Otherwise I'll go somewhere else.

I am re-posting a positive review. I emailed Liberty Tax Corp office with my below complaint. They promptly responded to my email and within 1 day the Area, District or office Manager "Bruce" called my son. Bruce immediately resolved the issue and refunded my son what he felt he was over charged. I was very impressed with the follow up to my complaint and how quickly and well handled it was. Thanks to Bruce!


This is the worst service and rip off company I have ever experienced! My son went to file his taxes. last year he used Liberty and they charged $126 and he filed his taxes for both AZ and Calif.. This year he only filed for Az and they said $226? He complained so the girl went to the manager Anthony Ferroni. He said I will give you a $80 discount, By the time my son signed the paper work and left he received an email that had fees of $126, + $40 handling fee, plus a $20 misc fee and another $9 fee ++++++. Bottom line his $600 refund turned into a $380 refund as Liberty tacked on all these fees.
So as the father I called Liberty and spoke to Anthony the manager. He basically said "sorry we already filed his taxes" (this was 1 hour after my son left). He then said Mr Kelly do you know what the Arizona fees are?? I responded- What does that have do do with you over charging my son? He then responds "we do not want your sons business,  Please go somewhere else next year". Wow what a bad experience. Anthony is a jerk and should not be representing a company like Liberty Tax.  Bottom line, Anthony is an idiot and a jerk. No help, no sympathy, just there to RIP OFF young and unsuspecting people.

This is now the third time we've been here to file our taxes. The first visit was fine although we did feel like we were being rushed even though we had an appointment and they didn't see us on time. The second time was terrible. We gave them a week to finish our taxes, was told it was ready to be signed and filed. We showed up to our appointment ON TIME and we sat there for ONE HOUR waiting for them to figure out how to work the printer. We didn't get to sign or file our taxes that day. BUT they did collect our money for their services. Today is the third visit and two minutes before our scheduled appointment, we get a call from our tax preparer saying that he'll be 20 minutes late. He actually showed up 30 minutes late. I had to give one star because even though they dropped the ball from the second visit, the first visit was good.

If I could give less stars I would. Horrible customer service, even slower banker, and the intelligence level of the branch is bordering preschool. If you have the option go to another location. I've banked with Bank of America for a decade and this branch had me thinking of moving to a new bank. 
Honestly hands down would of had an easier time with the McDonalds staff then this banks staff.
Does anyone work here? This branch is totally content on making customers wait... and wait and wait...
I come in every 2 weeks. I swear it's a 30 minute wait every... single... time. Always a long line here.

Kudos to notary Chris who assisted me w/ all smiles and w/o making me feel like I was inconveniencing her (unlike the two notaries AND host at the Laveen branch).  

I appreciate the roomy space that emitted positive vibrant energy, yet also made me feel quite at home.

Don't go here if you need to do something quickly or have business other than simple banking.

Stood in line for 30 minutes needing to do a wire tranfer only to find I needed to make an appointment. Only one teller with at least 10 people in line and building mid morning.

 No customer service.

Finally I understand why the rating of this bank is so low. I have been the customer of boa for 4 years since I have been the US in 2013. This branch is alway with the lowest working efficiency. They alway let customers wait at least 15mins to see the bankers even if I have an appointment in advance. I came to this location on Monday 3pm to make wire transfer(they close at 5pm). Only one banker was on duty that day, and the manager told me all the appointments were scheduled on that day so I have to come back tomorrow to see a banker. So I made an appointment for Tuesday 11am. On Tuesday when I arrived the branch at 11:05am (cause I spent 7mins to find a parking space on mill avenue), no banker nor manager was in the lobby except one cashies who was taking care of one customer. I waited until 11:12 the manager came out to told me since I was late they let another walkin customer to go to see the banker first cause she arrived early. I was really confused with the stupid policy. If they can do walk in prior to appointment, why they refused to service me on Monday? Now I really want to cancel my account and move to any other bank on mill avenue like Chase or Wells Fargo.

This is the absolute worst bank location I've ever been to. There's always one teller, two if you're really lucky, but the line is almost always 4 people long. The one time I asked to speak to someone about closing an account I was told it would be a 20 minute wait, even though there was no line and I watched multiple employees sitting around fiddling on their phones. I even saw someone on Facebook. If this wasn't the only location close to me, I would NEVER EVER come here. It's despicable how poorly this location is run.

This bank is very convenient and has a cool, industrial feel to it. The staff has been very friendly every visit but my biggest complaint is the typical wait time. This branch is severely understaffed. The wait just to see a teller is always a minimum of 30 minutes. If you want to see an actual banker you are looking at around an hour wait usually. Like I said, the staff is always super helpful and friendly but the wait times are unacceptable and something that needs to be addressed.

The service is so bad , I think i want to contact corporate until I get a response to complain ,
One teller , one banker ,  2 people hanging out all the time !! 2 people there for no reason , why are they on payroll ,

I am confused why so often I will go into a Bank Of America and there are a dozen or so customers waiting, while there is only one teller and two or three bank employees seated at their desk or just standing.  Today I wanted to get something notarized, got tired of waiting and ended up going to a UPS store.

Derek Taylor at One Nevada Mortgage Center is an excellent asset to your Financial Institution. I have received prompt replies to all of my emails regarding my home loan refinance process from the start to the end. I thank Derek and his team for their superb service! I highly recommend Derek as your mortgage loan officer and other financial services you may inquire. 5 STARS!!!

Thank you Linda Woodford at One Nevada Credit Union Blue Diamond location for referring me to Derek Taylor! 5 STARS!!!

I am right on board with Wenchi on this one. Although this is the first time I have purchased, I could not see the process going any worse for us. I have a long list of emails from both our agent and myself that weren't answered in anything near a timely manner. 

If you call the mortgage center line, it goes straight to voicemail. If you call Roger's number, same thing. Elizabeth never provided us her number, instead saying everything would be handled via email. Again, slow to respond to those emails would be an understatement. I did call the branch, asking them to transfer me to Roger's extension. That was the only way I could get him to answer. I assume his caller ID was showing a One Nevada Credit Union number calling, and he thought it might be "someone important". Nope, just me. 

We were told that final underwriting has a 24 hour turn around. We had our requirements filed on a Thursday, and didn't hear back from Roger until Monday, after business hours, that it was kicked back as incomplete. That's 3 business days later, plus two weekend days. The only part incomplete was that they had taken so long from the initial documentation, that my pay stubs were now too old. And because of the program we used, we needed another year's tax return. Shouldn't the loan officer know that would be needed?!? According to Roger when he did finally get back to me, he had known about it, and Elizabeth had been bugging him to call us. So why didn't he? We sent everything in that Tuesday, since he had called after business hours Monday, and it wasn't until Friday when I sent my "threatening to go elsewhere" email (see next paragraph) that we heard anything back. That's 8 days after we initially sent the documentation. 

Just like Wenchi said, we got the excuse that it was because they had so many loans to deal with. I can understand that. So I sent an email to Roger wondering what was going on, and asking if I should look for a different lender. I asked for him to please let me know if One Nevada was too busy to service my loan. Lo and behold, 9 minutes later, he had read, typed and sent an email back to me. This was record breaking speed for them. Funny how that is when you're threatened with losing your commission. Unfortunately, Roger started said email with "Matt, calm down". WOW!! Not how I like to do business. 

Like I said, that was on a Friday. Another weekend passed, many more emails from my agent asking when to extend escrow until, both to Roger and Elizabeth, again without answer. Roger then called saying we needed to show more money for our 20% down payment. We had made cash deposits that aren't able to be tracked. Understandable. However, when I went over the numbers with him, and cross-referenced with the title company, it wasn't adding up. That caused another week to pass. Yesterday, Tuesday, the 11th of October, we finally got the closing disclosures. Sure enough, my numbers were right, and the extra $2000 gift we had to solicit wasn't even needed, we had enough traceable funds all along. September 29th we could have been at closing documents, but no. 

Again, I emailed Roger. This time, "I know that you might not understand what the complete process entails for a home loan" is the way he starts things. It was simple math. I get that numbers can change, but you're the ones that give us the numbers. Don't give me an estimate that is $6,000 off, take the time to get the number right. 

We have now had to file an addendum twice to extend escrow due to lack of communication from One Nevada. Initially, any refinance was going to be through them, but now, not only will that not be happening, but my checking and savings, as well as my son's account that I just opened for his first birthday, will be going elsewhere. 

Please don't take this review to show any negativity towards the branches. They were amazing to work with. Very helpful and polite. Each time I walked in, they made sure to greet me, and apologize if there was ever a wait, which there rarely was.

Since I have posted, another review (2 stars) was removed. That is the person "Wenchi" that I refer to.

Beware!  We thought we were hiring a tax professional with IRS experience  We were shocked to discover not only did they "interpret" the IRS regs, Anne never worked for the IRS.  They were no where to help when we were audited; as they assured they would be.  Their response... "don't let the IRS intimate you, they are bullies and cant do anything".  That's not helpful with a real life issue!  These people have made a mess of our taxes. Same with our colleagues & friends; all carbon copy mistakes. The IRS is watching..... Spend the money and see a tax attorney!  In the end, it's all on the tax payers, not the preparer ... and A&M knows that.  It's shameful!

I had the worst customer service experience here. I wanted to open a credit card with them, but the banker didn't care about my account or my time. At one point, he actually said to me that he'd "rather be at home" because "he's tired". I had to go to the branch two extra times because he didn't know what we needed to open the account!!!! He assured me twice that I'd get my credit card within two business days. Two weeks later I still hadn't even gotten approved. I'm taking my business to UW Credit Union where you can get a credit card on the same day you apply, where they don't waste your time, and where they don't treat you like crap.

I've always had great experiences with chase, as they have always been friendly, professional, and most importantly, accurate.  In over 5 years i've had nothing but great experiences with them.  But last weekend they went above and beyond.

It was Saturday, and i needed a document urgently from my safe deposit box.  I called to ask for their Saturday hours, right at 2:00, but it turned out that was when they closed.  But Chase Bank's Adam offered to stay and wait for me to get there so i could retrieve my document!  On his Saturday!  I was blown away.  They are always friendly at the two Madison Chase locations i frequent, this    experience took place at the one downtown across from the capial, but they are also always extremely kind and helpful at the branch on the westside off of High Point Rd as well.  Thank you, Adam!  

I value Chase greatly and will always bank with them exclusively for all my checking, savings, credit & investments.
Just went in and paid my payment at cash one today and Jessica the teller  was amazing always helpful very friendly.

worst company ever to use!  they fight you tooth and nail to repair your flooded home. they pay contractors they hired and don't make sure that contractor hasn't broken items, if they do they say its out of there hands.. good luck suing us.. there horrible  and then they  r a i s e your premiums for the next 3 years and your stuck even though this flood wasnt your fault....i cant wait to sell this house cause then u get nothing from me.

i called the company 16 total times to pay off, close account, get a refund of my 600.00 security and was hung up on 100% of the time. on 10/21/2016 i called the company from my phone 14 times, my boyfriends phone twice. each time i was hung up on. the first 5 or so times i thought it was a problem with the connection. after, when i spoke with a man, explained i wanted to close the account, he pretended to transfer me to 3-4 so called managers even though it was the same man each time. he finally tranferred me to a woman named michelle who said she closed my account after asking me if it was ok to charge my bank the 52.20 remaining on my account. then when i asked for a refund of my 600.00 security, she told me she could not hear me, the connection was bad and for me to call back, then hung up again. i spent two hours and 16 calls trying with these people. i am livid that a company is allowed to function and scam people in this country. not only would they refuse to talk to me about the refund but the account still remains open. so they can continue to charge me interest i am sure. i have contacted the bbb to intervene. horrific company

I had an offer in the mail to use their product and decided to make use of their services as I was building my credit. I used them for the past 6 months, paying my bills on time and not focusing on the transactions on my account, assuming all transactions to be correct. I had an illegal charge go through my card on 5.13.2016 and called them to dispute the issue. I was told that they could not do anything to help and I wondered what kind of protection is offered to the consumers. I talked with an account supervisor (Jenny / id 0313024888) and an account manager (Desiree / id 0313065028). I regularly bank with Chase and Capital One and had never heard of anything so ludicrous. They could not help but asked me to send a letter to their Las Vegas office to start the proceedings.

Before putting my thoughts on paper, I spent time reviewing my statement for any discrepancies and this morning noted that I have been charged $4.22 monthly for credit protection which I did not authorize. I called Capital One again and was told that the charge had been levied by a sister company and they could not cancel it. My acceptance of the credit card came with a rider, the additional charge of credit protection which I did not authorize. I was transferred to another number but could not get a human to initiate the cancellation. How is it that the company that swore to protect me and help me build my credit is imposing unauthorized charges?

I asked them the reps at Credit One who regulated their bank and to whom could I escalate my issue. Anticipating that I would be told FDIC, I was referred to the BBB. When does BBB regulate banks? They are completely clueless, unethical and corrupt. This has to change. The journey starts with you, please do not suffer in silence. Leave me your story and let others learn from you.

The consumer affairs website gave them a 1 star rating with 908 complaints - https://www.consumeraffairs.com/credit_cards/credit_one.html

Do not use them if you have a choice. My balance is small; I will pay it down and close the account after I have brought light to their unethical behavior.

I am also posting the names of the sister banks here, beware!!
* Bank One Credit Helper
* Capital One Financial Corporation
* Comenity Bank
* HSBC Mortgage Corp USA
* HSBC Finance Corp.
* Affinion Group, Inc.
