I was issued a credit limit of $500 in 2006.  I never used the full amount, and I made my monthly payments. A year later my balance was $400. Though I was being charged $9.00 to  pay by phone I wanted to stop the annoying phone calls. A year later the balance was still $375..I stopped the gravy train. Last week they put a restrain on my account for $1,865.00.  I am scheduled to go to Court on November 19th. I didn't have any cancelled checks because I had giving them the authorization to deduct the monthly payments straight from my account but the Manager of Chase provided me with copies of my payment history. When I showed them to the court, their Attorney was so embarrassed he asked the judge dismiss the case with prejudice. That card is designed for people who are trying to rebuilt their credit I made a terrible mistake accepting it:(

Worst credit card company ever!!!! Hands down. I wish I could do negative stars. A couple months back, I got an email saying I was late on a credit card payment. I'm never late. Anyway, I found hundreds of dollars had been charged to a credit card that I had not used since 2015. I called the company and they did an investigation and found I had fraudulent charges on my card. I had been told not to do anything until investigation was over, so, I hadn't. They cancelled that card and sent me a new one. When I got my new card, the balance had been transferred and $50 had been credited back to my account. Keep in mind, I had accumulated $300+ in fraudulent charges. I called them and asked "WTF??" in so many words.  They said it's still under investigation.  Then, I started receiving calls telling me to pay my balance. Every time I explain that this isn't my balance and every time there are issues. They've put me on hold for hours, hung up on me, called 5 times in a row, whatever. It's getting ridiculous. They called again today and when I asked why my balance was still so high, they told me they can't see my balance on my previous card which is where the issue started. I asked to speak with someone who can see the balance, i.e. a supervisor, and was then transferred to customer service. She told me it was STILL under investigation and to bear with them. Also, in the same breath, asked for a payment....AHHHHH!! I asked if this payment they would be receiving from me would be credited back to me once the investigation was over. She said she can guarantee it but when I asked for an email or letter stating that guarantee, she could not comply.  Also, I have already received a letter from the company stating the charges were fraudulent and that the charges were credited to my account. Which is false since only one charge was credited at that time.

I had this card for about two years, just paid it off.  Not recommended as this card is designed to make money off persons who have bad credit, so they can hit you with fees.  I don't like the outsourcing customer service outside of US, when there is adequate talent pool in Las Vegas looking for work.  I asked the US customer rep to talk to CEO about this, she said write him, I asked for his email, she said no, I need to write a letter, who the heck writes letters anymore??

Credit One bank will not give credit to anybody with average or above average credit. Its bad credit people only. Yes - you will get a written denial that your credit is too good if you are average credit.

Credit one bank only deals with risky people. For that reason they charge a lot of fees. 

Once you understand this it's easier to accept them for what they are.

In my case I am very happy with them. Back when I could not get any kind of a store card they gave me a chance. With a 300 credit limit (mind u I think I spent like $75 in fees) but off I was to helping my credit.

because of credit one now i have better cards and for that i'm very thankful! 

Right before the 1 year mark i asked them for a limit increase and to waive the fee's - they denied both of my requests. I closed the card immediately.

My advice is for anybody with bad credit is to do what i did, use it, build credit, accept the fee's like a man and stop crying - then cancel them right before your first (or second year) right before the new annual fee kicks in.

If you thought that Credit One Bank is rude and doesn't care about you then you need to understand who they provide credit  too. I wanted to reestablish my credit score and this card was perfect. I knew exactly what I was doing. I am very satisfied with this Bank.

I don't think anyone understands the point of this card. Nor do they read about it before they get it. It is for rebuilding credit, it is not American Express. They tell you right off the bat you are getting charged $75.... yet every person on here claims the fees are hidden. THEY ARE NOT HIDDEN FEES. If you don't like it then don't sign up for it. The card is fine, I gave 4 stars instead of 5 because the customer service is a little slow, but it's probably because they deal with jag offs all day who didn't read about the card and want to know why they are being charged. So don't listen to all these people who chose to get a credit card without knowing anything about it.

Advertised as a US based bank however whenever you call them your speaking to India or some other third world country.  They charge you to apply, charge you to maintain your account, charge you for credit line increases and even charge you to make a same day payment.  You can not email customer service, nor do they have a live chat option.  I would never recommend these crooks to anyone!

Their credit card is more for people with no credit, but they approve just about anyone with bad credit too. I had their credit card back in 2001 when they were still FNBM (First National Bank of Marin). I used the card for many years, it was expensive but I had no complaints until I missed a payment one month. I figured I would just double up the next month being young and not grasping the importance of credit. Well, Day 45 the card charged off! That was pretty harsh. I would not do business with them. I was recently offered their card again and was like really?! My credit is way out of their league now.

I just got off of the phone with one of Credit One Bank's customer service reps. (I would've emailed them but that is not an option on their antiquated site.) I've had my card for nearly two years, have never missed a payment or been late. Not once, not ever. Despite my credit score of 722, I still am charged an annual fee, have a high interest rate (24%), and a very low credit limit ($950). I've been a loyal customer and have other cards with much lower rates, no annual fee and high credit limits. This card offers no perks / rewards to boot. The customer service rep I spoke to today informed me that their bank refuses to remove my annual fee or lower my credit score. I wouldn't recommend this card to anyone. Ever.

In short...
Activation Fee: $75
Annual Fee: $6.24/mo
Introductory Credit Limit: $500
Credit Increases: Infrequent and minimal

I have had this credit car since 2012 I have had minimal issues with them. It's a credit card that will help you rebuild credit so I expected high fees and such. Well back in Aug 2014 I accidently made two payments to my Capital one credit card thinking I had made one of those payments to creditone. The mistake was easy to make their symbols are nearing copywrite infringement. Well when my account with them became past due 35 days I received a call from the folks in the Phillipines informing me I was late. I gave them a o hell no! Well checking my records the gentleman on three phone was right. Well I then asked him as I was concerned they would report me as 30 days late on my credit report I asked him if I were to clear this up now would it not hit my credit report negatively. He told me if he cleared it up on the phone now the payment would go thru before it was reported as late to the credit card companies. This was the one and only time I was late and it was an honest mistake. Well a month later i reviewed my credit report and sure enough they reported me as late it dropped my credit score 65 points! I have spoken to their customer service, supervisors. All of which is a terrible experience. They lie to you, and are very scripted. They constantly hang up the phone on you and when u ask to speak to someone in America they flat out tell you no. I have sent three dispute letters to them with a copy of my report and the dispute in question. I have disputed this with all three credit  bureaus with no success on getting this removed. I HAVE HAD ENOUGH OF THIS RUN AROUND BS WITH THIS COMPANY. It is hands now the worst experience I have had with any company. I don't have any intentions on stopping my pursuit to clear this up.

scam!!!! scam!!! scam!!!!  do notttt get this card! i have had many credit cards in my life including gold amex business and personal.. we developed credit issues because of medical bills. we ended up in bankruptcy. after a time we were working on rebuilding credit. i received a capital 1 account.... i worked on good payment history. soon, i received another offer. credit 1.....  horrific experience!!!  when i activated card is when a fee was assessed... then on top of high interest there is a large fee if you lose card and if you call to make phone payment it is a $9.95 fee to do this by phone - the problem is it's all scams to cause more fees, fees and more fees. so,
i called to make payment to pay off account. i paid and asked over and over if all fees and everything were paid off.  i was then shipped over to a guy trying to keep me. i explained my position and said i wanted  to pay and close account... he says ok.. he processed my payment and said all was paid.... 
   i was getting a weird gut feeling that things were not right.
i decided to call about a month later... the guy says i have a balance of $10.  -----  and there was a $9.95 charge to pay my balance... they  seem to be in control of your credit and extort people and drag them into web of deciept and supper feeeeeeeeeeees!!! i am now forced to file complaint with gov. please take extreme caution!!!!

CreditOne was one of the first companies to give me a card after I lost my job and my credit was ruined, but considering I was the kind of person this company PREYS on, I do not extend them accolades for this. I had their card for over three years and every interaction I had with them was painful. Their customer service people are extremely rude and have accents so thick you can't hardly understand them, then they get pissy when you have to continuously ask them to repeat themselves. And get this: the reason I no longer have an account with them is because they closed it out from under me BECAUSE I TRIED TO MAKE A PAYMENT. Yes, that's right. I had two accounts listed on my online account to make payments from; one I rarely used. Well, one day I had to use it. Huh, strange, it's been a week and that money hasn't been taken from my account yet, so I try again. THEN I get a LETTER in the mail (instead of emailing me like they did for other things) telling me that the account I tried to use to make a payment was invalid (what?!) and if I tried to use it again they'd suspend my account. So I call, and they want me to get some kind of form filled out from a brick and mortar location proving they exist (again, WHAT?!) BUT, it's an online bank, so they don't have a branch I can visit! I went round and round because apparently, if their screen doesn't tell them what to say off a script, they can't speak or think for themselves. I tell him forget it, just remove that bank from my payment list and I'll add another, and he says he'll unsuspend my account. Two weeks later, my account is still showing suspended so I call again. This time the lady tells me that my account was closed and nope, sorry, can't do anything about it. I was livid, and decided that the best and only way I can get back at them is to pay my account in full so they can't get anymore interest payments out of me. If they're going to treat me like garbage, they're not getting another dime out of me. 

DO NOT ACCEPT CREDIT FROM THIS COMPANY UNLESS YOU'RE READY TO BE TREATED LIKE GARBAGE AND ARE ABSOLUTELY, 100% DESPERATE FOR CREDIT FROM ANYONE, ANYWHERE. You've been warned.

If you are rebuilding your credit use Capital One. Stay away from this card:

1. High annual fee.
2. You pay for each credit line increase ($9.95 for each $200, and they are given stingily. )
3. Interest accrued from the MOMENT YOU MAKE A PURCHASE. This is unacceptable. 
4. The foreign-based customer service is a nightmare. 
5. When I closed my account, they charged me $9.95. My payment (which was necessary to close the account) was considered an "express" payment. What a scam!

You're welcome!

Well, another year later and my credit limit is now up to $2200! I'm still holding onto it because my score is going up regularly and I got another card with double that limit. I still use this for one charge a month and pay it off. I don't know how people claim they have trouble making payments...I do mine online, usually from my phone, with not a single glitch in over 3 years. I get a credit line increase every 3-6 months, and they haven't even charged me for the last 2...which sounds bad, but again, I'm paying a small price to rebuild my histoy. That's the reality of it.

Progressive insurance does not pay their claims.  I was rear ended by a Progressive insured driver.  I was told by a Progressive agent to get an estimate - which they OK'd - took the car in for the repair when they told me to and then refused to pay.  They are no better than the other company that advertises "We keep you legal for less."  What that means is that you pay the low premiums and they refuse to pay claims!  They are not even within the Insurance Consortium.  Beware!

I have been with Progressive for almost 5 years.  I recently canceled a policy due to the selling of a vehicle, and they sent me a bill for $31 for canceling the policy.  They told me that it was a law by Arizona.  I also see several people complaining about them in regards to them not being responsive to claims that are filled.  Fortunately I haven't had to file a claim with them yet, but I may think about switching.  Although, I would get charged $60 to cancel my other two policies.  I asked the lady if that was their way of kicking a customer in the butt on the way out and she said "well, no".

What a joke!

I am so thankful that I found All Your Insurance! I cannot believe the money they saved us on our insurance! As a stay at home mom of two and a nanny of three, I hardly have time to search for the best insurance rates. It was great to just call them up, tell them what I needed and have them do all the work! Every person I have spoken to has been kind and patient with me. I never feel as though I am a nuisance when I call with a quick question. They are so efficient and get things done so quickly. I will stay with AYI for as long as I need insurance! GREAT company to do business with!

I was referred to AYI by my sister who has been very happy with them. I took her referral and have been equally pleased. All of the employees I've spoken with have catered to my needs and have made me feel like my needs were important and better yet have made sure to meet them. Thanks so much Ann Debbie and Guy! You're all great and look forward to our continued service together.

UPDATE: Since I first wrote this review two weeks ago I have been informed the agent I was working with has been fired...
This company is the WORST. We used them to get home owner's insurance for a new home purchase and they were so incompetent. They could not get anything right, did not process anything in a timely fashion, and because of their idiocy our settlement kept getting pushed back. Unfortunately, though, we were already in the process so we continued on. If it's this difficult to obtain a policy with them I'd hate to know what it'd be like if we actually have a claim. I have never dealt with a more incompetent company in all my life. Yes, their rates are affordable, but it's not worth the pain and suffering.

First let me start by saying this office has a great team of professionals specially Maira she is very helpful and always finds a way to make it happen ive had my last three vehicles financed by them and  absolutely love how easy their loan process is. They do all the work for me and i just go and sign the paperwork...

Great customer service and great services and deals. By far the best team i have came across. Very satisfying and professional. I  recommend jason's team to everyone, especially amabilia and guadalupe...very nice people, they always find ways to help you save. rate 10

Beware!! Very rude on the phone when you talk to them. I checked my credit and they don't even report!! When you call, you can't understand what they are saying. They charge very high interest and high fees.

Don't open an account with this company. You will regret it I promise. I spent many calls and wrote letters to customer service and to two execs with the company and received no responses. Their Facebook page won't allow any posts which I am sure is to prevent customers from commenting on the extremely poor service. I made multiple calls over the last two months and continue to get transferred from caller to caller including those that speak very little English. On the last call, they disconnected my call after being on about 40 minutes with various customer service representatives. 

The problem resulted from Credit One processing a payment much later than it should have been processed resulting in a late fee rolling into my March statement. I made a payment over the phone in February with one of their representatives that should have brought my account to a -0- balance. My bank, CapitalOne, also verified that this was an electronic payment and not a check mailed. However, for some reason, Credit One did not process this payment until March 6th, almost two weeks after I made the payment over the phone. This resulted in a late payment of 29.07 being assessed on my account in my March statement on 3/5. I made calls in March and in April trying to get this resolved, but experienced horrendous customer service. As a result of their representatives not being able to resolve this, I had another late payment of 33.41 assessed on 4/5. 

You can't reach anyone at their corporate offices as well and NO REPONSE FROM CUSTOMER SERVICE. I am moving forward with a complaint with the BBB.

Their credit card is more for people with no credit, but they approve just about anyone with bad credit too. I had their credit card back in 200.. something I used the card for many years, it was expensive but I had no complaints until I missed a payment one month.I paid the card off in full and then I went traveling abroad. I forgot that they were charging me month to month yearly. Well, I didn't pay the 1st month and I didn't realize it until I looked at my credit report.... I check it nearly daily and it was 32 days late from the only charge was the monthly balance I called them up immediately and rectified my oversight. So now on the 45th day they refuse to remove the late charge from my credit reports,

Pathetic business practices.

I am on hold with customer service again and this is my first payment. I only got this card for my sons use. I simply opened a letter with a Credit Card offer and logged in and the card was sent. I am not complaining about the fee because that was my mistake but after the first month of usage I started receiving phone calls from East Indians who you can hardly understand asking me for payments over the phone which I NEVER do. So I came home attempted to log into my account but couldn't so I called on a Saturday "closed". Called Monday and asked about my problems with logging on and was told that my account was locked because my account was temporarily closed because I didn't make my payment.

Ok, first I was never sent a statement. I was not at 30 days since first use of card. I couldn't access to make a payment. I couldn't reach anyone on a weekend to discuss payment options.

Now this brings me to this current time as I am typing this... I am still on hold after making a payment over the phone and being transferred to the (couldn't understand what they said department) but I was hoping to speak to someone that could help with login issues. Anyways another East Indian tells me that I can't access my account until I provide verification from my bank? I asked for what and he replied to open my account again. I said I don't understand I need to access my account to make payments, watch activity, etc. Again, you need to send verification from your bank that you made a payment. Again, I said "huh", I just made an over the phone payment when that payment clears will my account unlock so I can access my account online? He said not until you mail in your verification from the bank. 

So here is the good part, OK I want to close my account! He says it's already closed! I asked so do you mean to tell me I have no further action to close my account permanently? No, it's closed. I am waiting to speak to a supervisor 33 mins and still holding.  All in all this is one of those cards that will fee you to death and at any point that you use it they will not send statements, lock you out of your account and charge you a $9.95 fee for overt the phone payment. RUN, RUN, RUN as people say.

 Close your account and stop the bleeding. Ok, 36 mins in and the call was disconnected. 

I am going to talk to a supervisor and ensure the account is closed at my request and follow through in a couple of weeks. The rough part is I can't go online to ensure the account was closed, you can't trust the people you talk with...... I guess I will have to purchase some type of credit monitoring to ensure they didn't add some type of fee to close my account for which they will send you no statement, no email for this fee that could potentially damage your credit for nonpayment of something you knew nothing about..

The worst credit card company in the world. They charges you to raise credit limit. They they try to change yearly fee days after sending new cards. I called into customer support, don't press anything to actually get someone on line, and they were originally adamant about not doing anything. Then they were willing to drop fee for 3 months. They then tell me they can do nothing else. When I inform them I'm cancelling the card they offered to drop interest by 1.2 percent. I decided to just drop this scumbag of a company.
I'm not your customer and you are robo calling every single day. Scam.

DO NOT USE OR APPLY TO THIS COMPANY!!! Do your homework people, read these reviews, all the negative is true!!  Nothing in your life could be so bad that you need to resort to using these a@@holes!  You are better off dealing with the mob, worst company ever in the 24 years I have had credit, Stay away!! Far Away!!  I used the card as agreed for a year and a half, building my credit and paying it off monthly.  Then out of the blue fraudulent charges of $850 in Florida appeared on my statement, this happened in March.  I called like everyone on here, reported it, they sent new cards, but the charges stayed, conveniently they took away my April statement off the website account sign in, now I can't see the charges, and its almost the end of June with still no resolve and they keep hitting me with interest payments!  Time to lawyer up!  Maybe if there is enough lawsuits they will have to pay back all the millions they have robbed from all of us!!

Worst company and customer service I every had to deal with called about mysterious charges the company was adding no one could explain even hung up on me and transferred me around. After being on the phone for an hour dealing with Thai issues I canceled my card because I didn't want to deal with a company I couldn't trust especially a credit card. Fucken joke. Run away. Not only are there tons of fees and hidden charges. I've been paying my bill in full for months. The lady who got on the phone to take my payment said that there is interest acquired. I said no there is not. I'll just lay my balance plus the 9.95 they charge you for paying near your due date. Asked her to transfer me to customer service to cancel my card. She can't transfer. Call back to cancel the lady who answers is baffled, she says there is no interest. WOW. Cheats and Fraud. You're not safe, in fact don't even feel safe with them having my info. Will be contacting all three credit bureaus to make them aware and make sure they are doing everything right. What an embarrassment. Life Lock here I come

Second Month in a row showing a Payment Late. Interstate Bank Fraud On A Massive Scale-Maybe GLOBAL Bank Fraud, as the majority of their CSR's seem to be from OFF-SHORE!

Closed account with zero balance, recieved letter dated 11/22/16 saying so. On 12/4 I logged into acct. to check it out and to my surprise it showed a balance of $162.18. I called and was told THEY made 2 mistakes with my balance back in October and I owe them the money. If I wouldn't have checked this would've hit my report as a bad credit debt. Can't understand customer service rep. Poorly run operation.

DONT GET THIS CARD!!  I have Capital one credit cards (which are great) and I got pre-approved through the mail for this card from "credit" one with the same logo.  Granted, I'm the idiot that didn't notice it was different than "capital" but it happens.  I've used the card for a couple of months and hate it.  First off, their website is awful.  If u can figure out how to pay your bill online then you defeated their adult proof site.  So I called to pay it and he said my account needs to update before I can pay it.  WTF!  I don't know how to work with a company that forces you into late fees.  So I waited a couple days until I got back from vacation.  They called me 14 times the day it went passed due!  Seriously!  I finally cancelled after the second time it happened (in two months, 2 for 2) but I had to talk to 4 different people from India  for about 45 minutes.  The last guy tried to waive a bunch of fees and explained to me how important it is to build my credit like I was a 12 yr old Indian child.  He talked for 10 minutes without a breath before I finally had to interrupt him and say "Please cancel my card!"  I felt like I was pleading with a gunman.  STAY AWAY!!!

Ive actually had this card for a few yrs and never really had a problem til now! Someone somehow was shopping away in Miami and transferring $$ with my money putting me over $900 my limit! I call 'customer service' as they call it-- 1st guy i talk to cant speak english, hes telling me dont worry, were sending another card once i get the card to call them back- i hang up on him and call back.. Get someone else and hes telling me the same thing, im like dont i have to give you the transaction information so you know what was fraudulently charged?! No, just call back when u get the card.. Ughhh im so pissed and hate talking to the idiots and dreading calling them back cause geeee its been about 3 wks and havent received it yet... I should just contact a lawyer, so sick of people, makes me sick

Deceptive Practices,
On sept 8th 2016 i received an email asking me to check out my new offer that i was pre approved for. I filled out the online form and received an
instant decision of a limit of 400 dollars as well as 19.99% apr and 45.00 application fee. Upon receiving the card, the offer had changed to a higher APR and a 75.00 fee as well as a monthly membership fee going forward the second year. This is not what i agreed to and refused to activate card. I called the outsourced customer service and spoke at first to a rep. unfortunately i did not write his name or rep number down. He told me it was my fault and i accepted the wrong offer. i immediately requested the card not be activated unless agreed terms were met. He then transferred me to supervisor Eddie rep # 76958 who proceeded to read a script and apologize again and again. When he could not resolve my simple request based on an offer the bank extended me and baited and switched to a newer less desirable offer. I was then transferred to steve 51243 whom all he did was apologize and say he can transfer me to corporate in the usa. I was transferred to Rep Wendy 2567 who explained again that it was my fault and i should have been more careful. Wendy said she could give me the agreed upon fee but it would be difficult to adjust the APR.I informed Wendy of my agreement of the terms with the proviso of no 99.00 membership fee she was unable to do so Whilst she was pleasant she was not very helpful. In closing i would like the offer originally extended to me, if not i demand confirmation of closed account wit no charges and a removal of hard credit inquiry from my Credit report. I think this was a bait and switch and i will continue availing myself of all consumer remedies available to me.

First off, I don't think a lot of people know the definition of scam that are writing reviews here. Also, if this is the only card you are qualifying for, you have gone wayward in the past with your credit. It's not surprising (and mostly likely not the banks fault) you're having trouble with this card too. I've had this card for 7 years and no troubles. Started with a $500 limit, crappy credit and now I'm at $2k and several other regular bank cards. I only keep it open because it would severely drop the age of my accounts if I closed it. Yes, the fees are crazy and the apr is high but look in the mirror people, YOU ARE A HIGH RISK for credit. I'm sure half their accounts are in some collection status. If you're really paying with a debit card, just use your bank info and enroll in online payments (free). It takes like 3-4 days to post. You shouldn't be in that much of a hurry to burn up that credit again and if you are, you need to learn how to manage your finances. I'm great full for credit one. I only knocked a star off because automatic payments should be a must.

Call 1- I try to speak to the person but he was just simply not understanding and too stuck in his script to help .. so I ask to reopen the account online so I can try to fix whatever needs fixing. he says he cant ..so I ask for a supervisor..he says the supervisor would say the same.. OK - I'm not a huge fan (the $8.25/month annual fee is annoying) - but it's no better or worse than any other card I've had.  Yes, it's a sub-prime card.  I started my credit line with them at $500 (as did my wife) and we've increased that to about $1500 each over the course of a couple of years.  We haven't really used the cards much, other than for a couple of subscriptions - so we haven't bothered increasing our credit lines any further.

However, what it HAS done is allowed us to get standard cards with other companies.

The annual fee is annoying - but there are few no-fee cards any longer, and at the premium credit card level, you're looking at much higher annual fees (like United club cards with $450 annual fees).

That said, it's a solid one to keep if you can handle the annual fees.  If not, it's a good one to re-establish yourself until you can get to a better level card.

A headache Bank, uses the technologies to deceive you .

I received an email today to congratulate me on my credit increase!  A credit increase after only 90 days!  Thank you Credit One!

Absolutely horrible credit card company. From the second you start talking with a rep to the time you hang up on them. BTW I have excellent credit. I just chose to use this horrible CC company, but that's definitely done. Really spend sometime looking around but do not settle for this company.

on the phone with Credit One Bank. I called it "Kafka Calls The Credit Card Company" and all I can say is I paid my balance in full one day and never regretted it.

Nice staff. Cute branch. However I don't really understand how to bank here. Not to sound old but I don't get their new machines.  I always have to wait for staff to help me.  Usually not a long wait.  The atm is usually pretty busy.

Not a real fan. Yes the staff is very nice and friendly, but Chase's attempt to eliminate them by making clients do all the work is just pure greed. Why should I have to do everything if I deign to come inside and actually have a human process my deposit or print some checks?

Then again with how often the parent company gets fined, it is not a surprise they are trying to make banking purely robotic.

Not a bad bank.. I went in for a replacement card the guy who was at the door greeted me and was fast and efficient. I was in and out in less than 10 minutes. I tried to deposit a certain amount of cash and it didn't read all the bills, instead of the amount I had it was a few hundred under I had to take the money out and deposit into my chase account..... Worst Customer service EVER!!! I had a check for 500 and I couldn't see the back of the check online so I go to the branch and the BRANCH MANAGER told me that they couldn't see who cashed my check and they called Banking Connections to get information and they said there was nothing they could do. So he only made one phone call and gave up and was trying to send me on my way. I DON'T think so! I had to get his District Manager Tara involved to find out who really had my money.. Unacceptable!!!!

This Wells Fargo location is probably the worst one I've ever been too. I have only been here once and will never return. Jason is a brilliant tactician, with a first rate "Inside the IRS" game!
He helped me with a multimillion dollar phantom income case, and we got the best possible outcome - far beyond what I had expected.
During the course of working with Jason, I found him to be very knowledgable of even the most obscure areas of the tax code, and equally important, caring for his clients. He presented a clear plan, kept me informed throughout, and assuaged the nagging concerns I had. 
I got into the mess with the advice of a big time SanFrancisco law firm...I got out of it with a great local attorney.
Jason Silver gets my vote as Best in The West!

Citibank. You gotta Step up your game man. A lot of the Citibanks have been closed and unfortunately I had a card with them and they are also the Costco credit card now.

I went in today in attempted to change my pin for my debit card and the lady was unable to help me. -.-

By far the worst bank ever. Poor customer service. The tellers barely speak English. Attempted to get a bank account and got the run around about needing a manager not once, not twice but three damn times and 2 branches and got no help. Ended up going to Wells Fargo. Walked in, got an account with NO ISSUES in less than 30 minutes. I'm glad I chose them.
Citibank took over Costco AMEX account. Nearly impossible to reach customer service. On hold forever!  They did not apply credits due from AMEX account and it was a battle to get assistance.
Really friendly, helpful, and saving me over $220 a month is definantly a plus! Would recommend them to my friends! Thanx guys!

I wouldn't normally review an insurance company, but these guys really make my life easy.  If I need to change up my policy its a quick painless process thats usually done within hours. My insurance is also the cheapest its been in years. I literally never worry about my insurance, even the renew process involves just an email. Def at least getta quote, it wont hurt.

The first word that comes to mind is EASY.  That is what this company does - makes it easy on the customer.  The employees are nice and friendly, and the insurance rates are competitive.  I have insured my house with this company for 7 years now, and I just got a quote on my auto policy.  Gonna make the switch!!!  

Professional, courteous, responsive and friendly, what else could you ask for?  Give these guys a try.  I would be surprised if they can't save you money.
They beat my old insurance rate... Thanks Chester!  Auto(matic) pay, what else do you need?  I've been with them since 2010.

Donna has been my agent for about 11 years now. She takes care of my insurance for my cars, home, life and business as well as some retirement accounts. She has taken great care of it all, including some last minute stuff that had to be dealt with quickly due to my poor planning. Donna has also handled some claims for us, with great results. Her team is very knowledgeable and professional.

Sends me junk mail trying to get me to get insurance at least once a month. I've tried emailing to unsubscribe with no luck or response. Guess I will have to try calling, but not sure I want to risk her having my number only to receive calls from other agents... Leaving at three stars because I have not had business with her as an insurance agent.

I know I check in here a lot, but the only reason I even step foot into this horrible place is because my employer uses this bank. I try to get here right when it opens to avoid lines, but low and behold, there's a line already forming outside. When we scramble inside to form another line, look, there's only 2 tellers!!!!!! FML!!! So after learning my lesson multiple times, I decided to try the drive through. Nope it's just as bad. I pull up to the little thing, put my money inside the tube and send it via vaccuum inside to the teller. 14 minutes later, she finally sends my receipt back via vaccuum. Wells Fargo, you can never get it together. I have no choice since I use this bank for work, but thank goodness I don't bank with you guys personally.

I've been coming to this bank for years... never thought to write a review until now. The atm is great and I suppose the only time it wouldn't be is if it were empty. The tellers are rude, the managers are rude and it takes so long to do anything there! If it wasn't for my Wells Fargo accounts that I really like,  I would not bank here. I've never expected much being a bank and all but a smile and hello go a long way.

The staff seems to be friendly, but not very knowledgeable beyond basic checking and savings accounts that they're product pushing! 

Also this branch is nasty! Just because a branch is located in a lower income community, does not permit the bank to have a dirty unorganized bank! I also bank at the summerlin location which is the complete opposite, they're organized, well mannered, clean and very knowledgeable! But that location is also is a higher income area. 

Wells Fargo does a great job of investing into CRA communities in the public eye, but their branches say otherwise! What they portray in the media and ad campaigns and what they consistently do are polar opposites. Takes some of that money that you invest into publicizing your CRA investments and start running adequate branches in lower income communities on a consistent basis!

This is a very well managed bank branch. I won't go into specifics (so everybody can breathe a sigh of relief), but I have witnessed the staff handle some ...pretty interesting ... situations.

Basically, situation #1 involved a very dissatisfied customer arguing over $1.92 on a credit card she never used. I don't even pretend to know the whole story, but this lady customer in her Wicked Witch of the West way was bound to tell it if I stuck around long enough. Grade A+ on this branch for handling this unruly customer and her attitude. The 1950's called, they want their attitude back, lady.

Basically, situation #2 involved the teller machines *constantly* being empty or whatever. Service trucks working double time here. Grade A+ on this branch for handling the flow of money evenly and carefully.

Basically, situation #3 involved ... well... me. Grade A+ on this branch handling me so that I felt like a partner...not just a walk-in customer with a funny hat.

We drove through to use the ATM. It was a standard ATM experience - I inserted my card, pushed a through buttons, and drove away with $60 in my pocket. 

Good job?
Every week I come to deposit my paycheck and every week it seems no matter what time of day the atm is always broken

First time using a private currency exchange instead of a bank. The rate is a lot better, not to mention they have the lowest rate out of most local exchange shops. The process was super easy - I was in and out in about three minutes. 

If you're buying foreign currency, make sure to bring cash as that is the only method of payment accepted.

Also note their new hours - they now close at 7pm!

Was happy that they took my leftover coins even at a reduced rate!   They even took an older note that someone else said was "worthless" yet I got 80% of the exchange rate for it!  VERY HAPPY!  THANK YOU so much!

Great rates and super friendly!

No stars if I could. An employee opened a credit card in my name without my permission. I confronted him and he said I asked for the card. There is no paperwork and my signature was nowhere to be found on any documentation. I asked to see the manager and he wouldn't come out to see me he was in a meeting. I escalated to the district manager. He talked a great game made me feel like things were going to get done and nothing happened. After about two months of waiting for something to be done I had to reach out to Wells Fargo using the toll free line and report the issue. Then I had to contact each credit bureau and report that the card was fraudulently opened in my name so that when I closed it it wouldn't negatively impact my credit report. The whole thing took about 4 months to resolve and I had to do it on my own. Worst of all. The employee still works there....My accounts are now closed. They are under alot of presure to open new accounts. Apparently this leads them to commit fraud and management looks the other way.

Thee worst in the Business I will never do business at this location again as a customer that has banks with them for years I'm not happy. Went in this morning at 905 to deposit a check and the kid at the counter tells me he has to verify my check. Takes 45 minutes as I'm waiting finally I lose my patients ask for my check. Go to a different location and get treated like a customer in an out in 5 minutes
I am getting away from Bank of America. I opened a checking account and found out I will not have to pay fees. Kristen explained everything and was very helpful. Great experience.

After finding service fees for my 40+ year checking account I called the 800 # for Wells Fargo.  Took a while but finally got the fees reversed but had to switch from one type of account to some other so it would not happen again......or so I was told. 

I was not pleased with the service on the phone so decided to walk into the branch on N. Durango.  After a very short wait my husband and I were introduced to Jessica G., the Customer Service Sales Rep.  We sat at her desk and within the first 5 minutes had everything taken care of.  Turns out the account the person on the phone gave us had "strings" attached to keep it free from any service fees.....she NEVER said anything about those.  JESSICA went over each type of account, asked what services we really needed and got everything straightened out to our satisfaction.  Maybe the "help" at the 800# should get lessons from Jessica.....she knew her job and did it extremely efficiently and friendly.  It was a pleasure doing business with Jessica!!!!!

Out of all the wells fargos that I have been to this is the branch that I love.  They really take the time to make you happy and usually waves any fees that you have gotten.  Every other branch that I have been to I have had some bad experiences.  But going to this branch has given me faith in the banking industry

Horrible service. We decided to close the account after over 10 years as a customer. The banker we worked with (Taylor O.) was helpful and professional. None of the managers made themselves available when we needed their approval for a transaction. We waited half an hour for a managers assistance. Thank you to Taylor for your help.
I have been with this bank since 1998 and have never exerienced any problems. The associates are always nice and friendly. If you need a solid bank with very competent employees try Wells Fargo.
WellsFargo is ok but this location is the worst.  So many rules as a business customer is ridiculous.  Looking into changing banks. Funny how I have issues with the same guy everytime.

I hate dealing with banks.  I cannot stress this enough I hate dealing with banks.  

But at least this bank has a great manager Brendon anytime I have a issue he resolves it fast.  He is always there to help you out so if you are looking for a great place to have a banking relation ship I would try this location.

This is the closest bank to my husbands work. He would never ever come here if it wasn't for that. Anytime he goes he has to wait a hour! There's always a problem with the computers and only 1 or 2 people working in the branch. We have never experienced this kind of service in any other chase in the valley like this! we go to the best chase in our opinion right down from where we live (cactus and Tatum chase branch) 

my husband said if He ever had money in this chase branch  he would take it all out immediately. 

The bankers in there are also don't know what the heck their doing.
Best experience I've ever had and I've owned about ten houses in the past. Great customer service
This facility is always short handed...  every time I walk into the branch is a minimum of 25 minutes wait.     Try to avoid this branch if you need to go inside .....

This bank is located on Decatur between Lake Mead & Vegas Dr. 
Went on Wednesday 12-16-15 at 12:05 PM to get a money order. 
Out of the 8 windows, only three were open.  The line was about 20 deep and a bank employee was walking around the line with an iPad asking each person what they were there for and taking their debit card info.  People who had issues that can be taken care of by a banker (new accounts, questions, etc) were pulled out of the line and taken to the other side to see a banker.  When I finally got the window 23 minutes later I was asked again for my debit card info and what I am there to do.  
I tell the teller I need a money order and she has me write the amount and who it should be made out to on a post-it and she dissapears for 6 minutes.  I can see her on the phone flipping through a large binder with papers in it.  Is she getting instructions on how to create a money order?  Are they having technical difficulties?  Guess I'll never know.  
When she came back I was hounded by the usual questions: 
Lady: Did you know you are pre-qualified for an exciting credit card offer? 
Me:  No thank you. Don't believe in them. 
Lady: But it only has x amount of interest! 
Me: No thanks, lady...they're against my religion.  
Lady: Okay but if you change your mind you can bla bla bla (I stopped listening). 
Me: Ok gotcha.  Cool beans.   
And it's like that every single time I go to the bank.  If it's not the credit card thing, it's them hitting me up for renter's insurance.  The time before this they tried to convince me that if I get their credit card and anything happens to my cell phone they will pay to replace it. I feel sorry for the poor employees who have to harass these poor people who have waited in line so long they are already irritated.  I'm glad I don't work there.
Additionally they call me about once a week to ask if I want financial planning. I'm getting pretty tired of this bank.

They made an error on my deposit and when I went in to get it resolved got three different answers to why my deposit never showed up from three different employees.  The branch manager is clueless and never returns phone calls. Went to the Cranberry branch and was treated just as bad until the found out I had a wealth advisor and a huge business relationship then they tried to back pedal.  I'm planning on moving my whole relationship.  A bunch of phonies.

Total loss and it's been over a week that my claim adjuster has been off  on vacation, so no one else can help me... Not the local office not the claim department also the rental department was not able to help. I do not recommend this insurance at all.. They were not able to get me on with a manager for the past 2 days.. Also only gave me are talking for 2 days and not able to extend because of my person being off.... I pay for this ?
Shit. Real shit. Tellers are nice. Customer service and policy sucks. We have $$$ with this crew we want out.
Love this Bank, and Love this location. Staff here are exceptional.  Never a long line whether you are inside, outside at the ATM or driving through.
Wendy did just help me to get auto insurance.  She's amazing sweet efficient it was a great experience!

A convenient AAA location. They have a kiosk where I was able to pay my registration and get my tags in 5 minutes flat. I was in and out in no time and I would have been quicker if I didn't have some trouble with the machine. Luckily an employee came to my rescue quickly and was helpful and friendly.

I had a horrible experience with towing. I called and told them my car needed to be towed because it was dripping gasoline. When the tow truck arrived the driver said he could not tow my car because it was dripping gasoline. They then told me I needed to have it cleared by the fire department before they could tow it. I called the fire department and they said they don't provide that service. It would've been nice if AAA had told me they couldn't tow it in the first place before I wasted my day waiting for them. A different towing company towed it without problem. AAA towing was a waste of money for me.

AAA is the most worthless service of all worthless services.
They allowed our insurance to lapste AGAIN.  2nd time in the same calendar year.
Even though we had it on auto pay, for our multiple insurance plans (home/auto) they
can't bother picking up a phone to call.  Their only means of communication is snail mail and by the time the letter arrives it is passed the date of cancellation.  I wish only the worst for all employees at this branch and region and may karma come around for these sad sacks that don't care enough to do a less than decent job.

AAA agent Garth Amram was super helpful, knowledgeable and friendly. Third quote I had gotten and he got me a better policy for less money. It is great to have an agent like him. I would recommend Garth and the friendly staff at AAA Summerlin.

aaa/csaa  auto insurance is a defective product .

We have been very satisfied AAA auto and home insurance customers for over 25 years while living in southern California.  We recently purchased a home under construction in Summerlin. Earlier this week we visited the AAA Summerlin office to obtain information regarding transferring our coverage where it was our very good fortune to meet and be assisted by Pauline Thomson. She was amazing! Her extensive knowledge and expertise was consistently displayed as she worked with us to determine the best coverage to meet our needs. As  critical as that was, her positive and engaging personality throughout the process was important to us as well, in addition to the helpful information she shared about relocating to the area. We look forward to continuing to work with Pauline as we transition to Summerlin and know we can count on her for her continued support and knowledge. Actually, our experience with this AAA location was positive beginning with our first contact as we entered their office and we encourage others to give them the opportunity to be of positive assistance to them as well.

I have had California AAA Roadside  for 13 years.  I had checked their insurances rates before but they never compared to my current policy until recently when State Farm's rates increased so I went to the office and signed up.  I was told by the agent that she would fax my cancellation letter to State Farm.  I called my State Farm agent the following day and he had not received the fax.  I then called customer service and they, not my agent, faxed over the cancellation form.  Soon after I confirmed that it had been received.  On top of that I signed up for SMARTtrek for the additional discounts.  The agent told me that my CA account would transfer over to a NV account.  What she failed to tell me was this would not take place until my renewal was due in mid 2017.  So now because my accounts won't link I have zero online access related to anything to do with my account until that time.  So if I happen to get an alert I will be notified by email and have to call to find out what it is.  

The day I signed up for this policy the agent was celebrating her 25th anniversary with the company, so maybe her mind was elsewhere but as a customer these are not issues I should have had to waste my time calling to get answers to and dealing with customer service.  I have since transferred my account to a different agent.

I have been a AAA member for over 15 years. Today, when I REALLY needed them they were NOT there for me and I'm even a PREMIUM member. 
I will NOT renew my membership with them. 
Clearly, PREMIUM doesn't mean squat to them and they acted like getting to me in say, four hours or so is acceptable. THANK goodness I have some amazing friends, but AAA? Not anymore! 
There's way too many other companies that would probably stand behind their PREMIUM roadside service at way less than about $200.00 per year.
So, you've lost another one, AAA. You don't stand behind what you advertise and I'm voting with my feet.
Do not waste your time here. Incredibly slow. Glad I wasted my lunch break waiting around when there are literally 7 "workers" standing around. Horrible. Try the next closest Wells Fargo.
Went in Friday September 9th. Guy greeted me at the door and held it open for me. Very active personnel at this location. Easy to work with bank tellers.
Kathleen is awesome! She should go and train those idiots at 19th Ave & Bethany Home!

WORST.  LOCATION.  EVER.  If you want your cashiers checks misspelled at least three times and when you politely ask for a correction to receive attitude, go here.  If you want to stand in line forever and not be acknowledged, go here.
Went to the ATM and they don't have fees with my bank so that is a huge plus for me!!  Appreciate them having an ATM in my time of need :)

I've been a client of this George Street branch for over two decades and I have nothing but praise to give to these guys. From the cashiers to the front desk operator, to the mortgage advisor, be certain that they'll try their best to help you out.
Like most of us I've been using internet banking for a very long time, which means that there was no need for me to get to that office personally but when my debit card got charged by a Hong Kong company (via London) for some electronic goods that were paid for but never delivered I was forced to pay them a visit for a "chargeback". On producing all the relevant documentation supporting my case (email communication with that dodgy company asking for a refund, bank statements, etc.) the very efficient & professional front desk operator assured me that I'll get a full refund within 10 working days (through my debit card company) ... and I did...
Full marks for them; keep up the good work!!!

I honestly cannot fault the staff at Nationwide at all. Being the only Nationwide branch in the city centre, it is always busy. However the staff are always helpful and efficient as well as pleasant. The only thing I would say is that there should be more than 2 teller stations, however this is not the staff's fault.

The WF branch on flamingo and ft. apache is too crowded and not enough bank tellers. I prefer going to this one. Annie Vuong is my personal banker and she's always helpful when I want to inquire about anything. It's somewhat fast and efficient with bank teller services. I have to say the most quickest branch is sahara and rainbow. 

When I want to deposit, I try later in the afternoon. Lunch time and morning seems crowded.

Went to this bank with my mother in law to open up a safety deposit box. we called before heading over to see if this was possible since we had no wells fargo account. When we got there we were talked to by the store manager who we heard within earshot sigh and tell a coworker "hmph lets see what these people want" looking pissed that she had to talk to us, she very rudely told us that we couldn't open a safe deposit box contrary to what the person over the phone told us. And that "I know i'm the bank manager". She then kept interrupting my mother in law who talks very softly. 

Her name was a weird one something like Sharmi something. Bottom line if your store manager is disrespectful to potential clients your staff will follow suit. 

Stay away from Rude people like the manager in this branch. You and your money deserve better.

These stars go straight to the teller by the name of Hoi. I'm not a big fan of this branch I feel as if they can be a bit disorganized. I came in today being the third person in line when the two people in front me wanted to wait for "their" teller. She was really sweet! I would give five stars but the banker that was standing behind her seemed to have a bit of an attitude. Thanks Hoi :]
This bank sucks. I came to get some papers signed and they literally took an hour!!!! There was no where to sign in or anyone saying anything. Never again will I come here.

The employees seem friendly enough however they are not efficient in this profession. Also I was told by a teller to wait in the lobby for a banker to assist me when all I needed was to report my card lost and order/ obtain a replacement. Either the lack of training or staff, perhaps both is hindering this branch to reach its potential. I have worked for banks for the past 6 years and have not received or given this level of service before. I am appalled to call these "financial professionals" colleagues. When I was finally seen by the Banker, I informed him of my discontent & he barely acknowledged it. He basically went on the offensive starting that I Needed to understand that they are all busy. I ended up closing my account due to this experience and his attitude.

I also visited the Citibank branch just up the street(total different experience) & in less than 5 minutes I made a deposit and had my card ordered for expedited delivery in two business days. Now that's service.

In both cases I was the first in line and had completely different outcomes. Suck it Wells!!

Now this is how a bank should do customer service. Everyone is nice and goes out of their way to be helpful. 
It's always pleasant coming in here!

The worst branch I've been in. Horrible customer service, and always trying to sell you something. Had an overdraft fee of $85 because of a banker error and they only gave me $17 back.. Even had a balance statement showing that I was positive. Manager acted like she didn't care. I thought a bank was some place where you could safely keep your money? Not somewhere where you can give them money and they can take whatever they want from it? I'll probably be switching banks very soon because of such service.

I always do my taxes myself but since I knew we were going to pay this year I decided to try this service 1. I had a coupon 2. It was local .  I paid over 200.00 for a pretty easy return and was told I would receive my payment coupons in the mail.  I finally had to go and get them on the 24th of March almost 2 weeks from my original date.  As I was checking the numbers I realized Mr. Williams had forgot to input an amount ( it was to my advantage) I called and asked what should be done. He told me to minus the amount and send it in and that it should be ok, and that if the IRS had an issue we would deal with it later.  I am not comfortable with this and would like to send in a correct tax form.  I have called 3 times so far asking to have the taxes corrected and he has yet to call me back.  So basically I paid to make sure my taxes were done correctly (which they weren't ) and now I'm at this persons mercy to fix them.  Please DON'T go here, they seem very lackadaisical and unprofessional.

Axel has done our taxes for 4 years while living in the Gilbert/San Tan area.  We always received great returns.  After moving Axel has done our taxes, and it is one less thing for us to worry about.  He also makes some great bbq sauce!  Delivered it personally to Seattle 2 years ago!!!
Thanks Axel!

I thought I was getting the best rate possible by going though a company with "buying power".  Jim took the time to save me $400 for the year! More than that he educated me on a towing service that saved me an addtional $200 dollars a year! A true professional who actuall cares.  I would and did refer all my family if that tells you how I really feel.

It is too bad the other reviewer had a bad experience because I have found Jim to be nothing but responsive and attentive to anything I need on my auto or home insurance. No need to look any further, Jim's your guy for honesty and loyalty.

Jim and his staff are amazing! I always receive immediate responses to calls, emails and texts. Jim has a vast knowledge of his product and talks me through any insurance needs. When I've brought up potential needs he's reasonable about it, and if it's coverage that I don't need, he's quick to tell me so. That means a lot to me. Claims are dealt with promptly and Jim really goes to bat for me. 
I'm in another sector of the insurance industry, so I'm quite aware of the challenges of being an agent. Jim takes care of my home, car, umbrella and even my drum set that I travel with, and he's the best that I've ever worked with.
I highly recommend Jim Kreisman for any of your insurance needs.
Very helpful employees and awesome interest rates on car loans! They have bankers who actually ask questions and help you. This credit union isn't just about making money, they're about helping you.

I had lost my whole wallet at Salt Lake River.  I went to the Credit Union West inside Luke Air Force Base in uniform with my new Military ID.  I told them that I bank with NAS JRB Credit Union (shared branch) and that i needed to pull some cash out because i had lost my whole wallet.  I showed them my MILITARY ID CARD and they told me that they do not take those.  I was at shocked because 1. I was in uniform. 2. It is a military ID card. 3. The bank is located ON BASE!!  Like there is no way that you guys cannot take my military ID card when your WHOLE BANK is on base.  I asked to speak to the manager and she said that no they don't take military ID cards.   I had no money for gas or food and they still wouldn't help me.  I found another shared branch outside base and explain to them what happen and they were at shocked as well as to why they wouldn't take a Military ID Card like it doesn't get more legit than that especially on a Military Installation.  Definitely not military friendly and did not help me in a hardship situation.

Marcela has been my go-to for all of my insurance needs, from Auto, Renters, and Home insurance for the past 4 years while I lived in Las Vegas.  I wish that I could have stayed with her at this location but an out of state move required me to pick up at a new office.  I would without a doubt, come back to her if I were ever to come back to LV.  She has always been prompt and courteous in returning phone calls with quotes and has always looked out for my best interests.  I did 99% of my business with her over the phone, but she always made me feel like I made weekly visits in her office just to say hi.  She pays attention to detail and I was never worried something might not get done.  Highly recommended and be sure to ask for Marcella!!

I am so impressed by this agency its hard for me to describe it. From the beginning I had a complicated manner and not only did it get fixed right away it was done with such pleasant, honest and efficient customer service. Shout out to this location and ALL of the staff.. Looking forward to a continuous relationship.

After forty five years living in Las Vegas my wife and I recently relocated to Salt Lake City, UT and when we were considering the move one of the things that crossed my mind was, "I am going to have to find a new insurance agent."

Now if finding a new insurance agent does not seem like a big deal to you, then you are not doing business with Mike Whitford!!

Over the last four years Mike Whitford was my insurance agent and I could make a TV commercial based on my experience dealing with Mike and his team.

At one point my wife and I and our three children had five cars insured with Mike and everything that Mike did for us was professional, no better than that, it was like dealing with a friend.

Every questions, answered! Every need, addressed! Every phone call, answered! Every e-mail, answered!

One of my daughters was involved in an accident and we made one phone call to Mike, done, everything handled!!!!

If you need insurance, of any kind, call Mike Whitford ................................. you can thank me later.

Tatiana L. is exceptional! I have never spoken to someone who deals with financing who is as understanding and helpful as she is. She helped me find ways to lower my car insurance payments as well as refinance my auto loan. I was extremely distressed at first about my financial situation and she was so enormously helpful. I am so relieved after working with Tatiana.

This has to be the NICEST group of people I've ever dealt with at Chase. Mind you, this location is inside a Fry's grocery store, but they still provide all the services a normal Chase has... without the wait, long lines and ditzy tellers filing their nails. 

I always come here no matter what. It's convenient because it's in the area, and I love that I can get groceries/bath products all in one trip. If you're in this neighborhood, check this branch out.

I stopped in with a question about my checking & saving on the ATM debit card. I was instantly greeted with 2 or 3 friendly smiling voices. I ended up speaking with Angela for several minutes (it was not just at all at this particular time). And what a lovely girl! Answered all my banking questions & welcomed me call or stop in at any time. A wonderful experience.

I use the drive up services once a week.  The teller at the window is always friendly & efficient.  I never wait long.  She processes my transactions in a short amount of time.  She offers excellent customer service.
I reached out to Jim about an auto insurance quote.  He got back to me immediately, was exceptionally friendly and professional, and answered any and all questions I had.  Thank you, Jim!

Jim Kreisman is an amazing insurance broker. He goes out of his way to save you money and explain how the insurance system really works. He just sent me an email out of the blue asking if he could adjust my policy to save me money and increase my coverage at the same time. He's given me his personal cell phone just in case anything ever happens. Smart, considerate, and hard working. 5 stars all the way.

I met Jim Kreisman in a business networking group called BNI over two years ago.   What I love so much about him is that he is truly a team player!   He genuinely cares about people and wants to educate them for success - whether that be with your insurance, your business, or even your personal life.  He has made helpful videos for all kinds of things!   

Jim reviewed my existing insurance and taught me many things that I didn't realize (where I was over insured or under insured)... and I appreciate his willingness to share his knowledge!!  

Jim is just an overall good person and I couldn't recommend him more.

While visiting Phoenix I had an opportunity to meet Jim at business mastermind event,,, I am impressed with his open friendly nature and knowledge of his community,,, Since Jim works closely with other businesses and leaders in the Phoenix  Scottsdale AZ area I have to recommend talking to him for local guidance and a let him give you a quote,,
Thanks for your hospitality on my last visit Jim.....

If you have any choice, don't use this service. 
I'm a very healthy person with limited needs for healthcare. Every time I try to get a routine service done (think, a yearly checkup, an innocuous prescription), I get my heart ripped out. HA changes their coverage constantly. Go to the same doctor two years in a row, ask if they take your insurance, they'll say yes, then you'll get a fat bill.

If I could give Health Alliance zero stars I would.  

Their regulations are designed to prevent their customers from receiving coverage for procedures and treatments recommended by their in-network doctors.  Health Alliance's appeals process exists only to make their customers feel like they are taking action, and almost never results in an actual reversal of a coverage decision.  While some of Health Alliance's employees are lovely people who try to help, their corporate policies are intentionally obstacles to coverage. 

Employers, take your business elsewhere.  Your employees deserve better.
Employees, select an alternate insurance option from your employers' choices.

Jim over at Allstate helped find me a term life insurance policy that fit my budget.  Which is not much, while I am developing my business and my wife is in nursing school.  We needed something to protect my family.  If not I would be leaving them nothing.

Shelley has been awesome, I've been with allstate for over 15 years and with Shelley for the past few months. Never felt more comfortable with my agent until now. Great staff she has there as well, all friendly and take the time to get back to me with my questions and e-mails.

Best part was she saved me money!

They notarize documents!

I stopped by here briefly to get some paperwork notarized in a hurry. Because I was rushing, I completely failed to realize that I didn't have any cash on me - and, of course, they don't accept credit cards for such small purchases (understandably). Despite this, Robert was more than happy to notarize my documents and I was able to return with cash and collect my paperwork just a few minutes later.

We had a friendly, brief conversation afterwards and he gave me his card for when I need to look for new motorcycle insurance. I'm glad to have him so close to my house, and am considering returning when it's time to switch insurance.

Been at this branch for years. But know I think I will bank at another location 
From this point on! Today when I did my banking there, there was (I) teller at the desk and I stood there and stood there the only other person in there, beside the one lady that the teller was helping! Which she was doing a lot of transactions..ugh!  I looked around and there was the Manager, and others towards the back not looking really busy! And do you think they would come to the front and opened another window to help me? NO... Just let me stand in line for the longest time, till that teller could get to me! This branch use to have the coolest girls working there, they even knew me by my first name, which made you feel very good! There was always 3 standing up front, and as soon as you walked in, they nicely greeted you, and asked if they could help you. Not anymore!! What has happened to this branch?!? Oh well will go to another Chase Bank from this point on!!

This is my go-to Chase. It's near home and in a shopping center I frequent. 

I always use the ATM for all my banking needs. I have never had a problem and like the convenience of not having to wait in a line and I can go at any hour of the day or night. When I have been inside to speak with a personal banker, I have never seen lines though! The ATM takes checks as well cash for deposit with no use of a deposit slip. YAY! It is much more convenient to just put it in the ATM instead of having to fill out a deposit slip and dreading to lick the envelope. You can choose the option to print check images on your receipt if you feel weird about just sticking money in the ATM.  

Parking can be tight at certain times, but it is a busy shopping center. After hours you will need your Chase card to enter and make any type of transaction at the ATM.
I hired Mr. Hodyno to handle some financial matters for me ,he was professional,honest,and hard working. I wouldn't hesitate to use hime again in the future.
Brant negotiate my decade old judgment slashed the amount nearly 70%off and closed deal in 3 days, what a great work, well done sir

Passion.

*Paid less for my bookkeeping services

*Reduced overhead [a.k.a. increased profits] with a few cool tricks she brought to my attention [details that never seemed to catch the eye of my former firm]

I have also recommended AccountingProse to just about everybody I know. The person who recommended to me is one of those extremely finicky people whose opinion I knew I could trust. Most of my friends see me the same way. 


I cannot suggest highly enough that you contact them and determine for yourself if you feel like you are being fully served by your present bookkeeper.

TINA and her crew are simply -- AWESOME!!

Bookkeeping and payroll service management are a necessary detail of running a business that cannot be overlooked and missed. It needs to be done RIGHT and ON-TIME and PERFECT every time. 

Explaining to an employee or a vendor a bank or anybody else as to why the numbers aren't right, or the checks weren't cut, or the myriad of excuses that a TOO BUSY business owner and UNDER-STAFFED or UNDER-QUALIFIED employee can come up with, just doesn't cut it.

Accountingprose cuts through the B.S. and simply gets it done right; all the time!

We love their EFFICIENCY, we love their INTEGRITY, we love their SIMPLICITY, we love their QUALITY, we love their PRICING.

Bookkeeping and payroll services in the Phoenix area can and should be trusted to Tina and Accountingprose. ... 'nuff said!

Thank you guys and keep up the good work!

I've been using Tina and AccountingProse for a while now. She sat down and made something that was clearly confusing and intimidating become something very easy to comprehend. She is patient and will make the whole payroll process super simple. She has taken a load off when it comes to those nitty gritty details of hiring new staff. Now I'm a pro. I am super busy running around and do not have time to deal with handling all of these payroll details and feel so fortunate I have Tina fighting for me and making sure I am doing it all right.

They incorporate technology, systems, and expertise to give me reliable results and information I use to make better decisions.  I'm very happy with all the folks at AP and recommend them highly.

Joe Fazio was recommended by a real estate agent. I Was already pre approved by major banking firm, and resisted going with alpine mortgage planner. Daniel Verdugo helped us refinance our house not too long ago and he did a phenomenal job!  He kept us informed of what was going on every step of the way and made it a smooth process.
