Recently I was in the market to buy a new vehicle and in searching, I ran across Auto Paradise of Arizona. While I didn't end up finding the vehicle I wanted here, I was extremely impressed. Why?

First of all, the philosophy is great! It's awesome to find a place that is open and honest about the car buying experience and is trying to change it to be more positive.

Secondly, they only sell vehicles that they select and determine to be of worthwhile type and quality and they have a full-service shop on site to check the vehicles and also to provide any repairs that you might need later. They also told me that if you buy a vehicle, you get a lifetime discount at the shop for future repairs.

Third, they list all of their vehicles on their website and the vehicles are actually there when you go to their location.

Fourth, the pitch was very low pressure. I was greeted by Ron who told me to look around and let him know if I wanted to take anything for a drive. The pricing is upfront and they have a folder in each car that includes the CarFax, recent sales prices of comparable vehicles, and other information about the car. It's clear that they stand behind what they sell.

Fifth, they guarantee that they will get you financed. I didn't end up selecting one of their vehicles, but considering a coworkers daughter just had to return a car after a month of driving it because the dealership they went to ended up not being able to arrange her financing, this is an excellent guarantee.

In sum, while its certainly an uphill battle trying to change the reputation of the used-car dealer, Auto Paradise of Arizona is bucking the trend and doing their best to do so. I would not hesitate to buy a vehicle here.
Bought two fantastic trucks from them in the last 3years.Good service very friendly. I would recommend them
The service at Auto Paradise of Arizona is wonderful! Ron was amazing and was so great to work with! I love my new (pre owned) car!!!

Bought my 2004 Grand Prix here and it was a great experience.  I like how you don't get pressured by a sales person.  You can look and if you like ask more questions, if not you can leave with no pressure.  I was very impressed by Ron who was very helpful, and the facility, including the repair shop was very clean.  Thank you Ron for running a top notch facility!!!  I would come here again and highly recommend it.

I have purchased several vehicles from this company.  Prior to my first purchase I was leery as this is a small business compared to the huge ones on Bell Rd.  However, they had a nice assortment of vehicles and mechanically and visibly this small dealer seems to want to present a quality used vehicle.  Their prices are about the same as the larger dealers and certainly higher than Craigs list but Auto Paradise has checked the vehicles  over and their mechanic is very competent.  Rocky and Brett, the salesmen, are personable with no high pressure.

thses people will make your life a living hell if your company uses them as disability insurance. short term, they are great, but if turns into a long term disability they will not let you recover, in their constant demands they make it impossible to keep, though nice voices on the phone, you will be denied over and over appeal after appeal you will win because most people can't hack the constant harrassment when they are truely disabled. go with aflac

Liberty Mutual Insurance Co.
This review is the review of the insurance company only and does not involve any insurance agents.
My wife and I had never had nor been the fault of an auto accident since we received or first Vehicle Operators Permit some 46 yrs ago. I received an offer through the mail from Liberty Mutual Insurance Co. providing low rate premium coverage for drivers with a good driving record. After calling them I signed up for both auto and homeowners police's with them.
About nine months into the policy my wife was involved in an accident. She went to visit family members who were passing through and staying at a local motel in town.  The motel was enclosed by a steel fence with only one entrance/exit gate.  The gate was a large, metal gate, with rollers that moved on a rail by electric power, controlled by a motion detector switch. If this switch detected something in the gate it would prevent the gate from moving until the obstacle was cleared. The gate malfunctioned and began closing while my wife was passing thru it and made contact with our new Mustang. The result was a good dent and paint scraped.
We submitted a claim and were contacted by a Liberty Mutual Appraisal Representative who did a damage appraisal. The rep directed us to take our car to a local repair shop that handles all their claims work and subsequently to a rental agency where Liberty had reserved a vehicle for us. The repair shop stated they needed the car for 3 to 3 1/2 weeks. The true outcome was 7 weeks. This involved many telephone calls to the repair shop manager.
When the car was finished we went to drop off the rental and were told we had to pay the bill and give it to our insurance company for reimbursement. This became a heated argument lasting a couple of hours due mostly to the problem of trying to contact a Liberty rep to work the problem. When a Liberty rep was finally contacted we were asked to pay half of the amount and we would be reimbursed. Hesitantly we went along with the request prompted by exhaustion, and being famished and dehydrated.
It took up to a year to get reimbursed and they never got anywhere with the claim. They told us they couldn't get any cooperation with the motel management and turned the claim over to their recoupment department in an attempt to recoup their money through the courts. They suggested I file a claim with small claims court against the motel for the $1,000 deductible I was out.
I never got my $1,000 deductible back and during this time my wife was involved in another accident. She was third in line at an intersection waiting on a red light when a motorist in a large pickup truck skidded into the back end of her car shoving her into the vehicle in front of her causing a dominoe effect.
It just so happened the driver was insured by Geico whose claim department contacted us and handled everything in a courteous, compassionate and professional manner. Our car was adequately repaired and my deductible was reimbursed.
By this time it was policy renewal period when I received a renewal notice and Bill with an explanation of expenses in the mail. The renewal fee was almost double in price of my original premium. I called the billing department and was given one lie after another not to mention the worst customer service ever experienced.
First I was told the rate hike was for them to recoup the money they lost on the claims I filed. I couldn't believe what I was hearing. They doubled my rate for two no fault accidents. If you think about it there was really nothing a good defensive driver could have done to prevent a collision in those two accidents. When I tried to bring this up this rep went into ignorant mode and kept repeating her first response over and over in an attempt to prevent me from speaking.
I wouldn't treat anyone like that and immediately became explosive under that abuse. I had to raise my voice to talk over her and demanded to know what their losses were in the last claim when Geico stepped up to the plate and paid for everything. I wanted to know why they didn't use the courts when they couldn't get cooperation from the motel at fault from our first claim. She responded by telling me they are forced to raise everyone's rates every year or two to help pay for all the claims causing them to lose money. I told her that didn't make any sense. I asked her why should you punish good drivers and make them pay for the poor drivers claims. I eventually told her that I would be calling back shortly with a date of termination of my policies. Before I could hang the phone up she responded by offering to reduce my rate  by $3.26. I guess this customer service master representing Liberty Mutual just had to have the last kick.  There is no way I can recommend Liberty Mutual to anyone. I can only hope that the time it took to write this review would be worth it if only it stopped one person from insuring with them.

The team at GEICO are very professional and knowledgable! Everyone is helpful and always are willing to go the extra mile to answer any questions and assist me in any way the can. I would recommend everyone to call and obtain a quote!! Competitive prices and great customer service!!

I signed up for Geico online and saved $120 month over another major insurance carrier for my car insurance.  I wasn't sure what kind of customer service I would get, but when I totaled my car in November 2013 I was amazed at how fast the claim was processed and how helpful and courteous the staff was.  They even valued my car at more than the Blue Book value, so needless to say I was thrilled.  Great company, great prices, great customer service!
Worst insurance company ever. They make u pay automatically from a bank Acct otherwise u have to pay a fee. Can't wait to leave them. Very upset and disappointed in them

I went yesterday because a cop gave me a ticket because my rear running lights were out. Also, my lights had stopped flashing when I used my key fob to unlock my car doors.

The AAA serviceman took my car, inspected it and told me the problem wasn't any of the bulbs or a fuse. He said the problem was electrical and it would be $100 to start and increase from there depending on the actual problem.

My husband was skeptical and took it to his mechanic today.  The guy replaced a fuse and all the lights came back on.

Do not go here. They are ripoff artists.

I regularly bring my car here for service, whether it is a regular oil change or to fix a problem.  The staff is always courteous and the work done on my car is top-notch.  I've even been able to bring it as soon as they open (7:30) and have it back to me, job completed by the time I need to leave for work at 8:30.  No complaints at all!

Everyone is so friendly, from the tow truck driver Terrell to the service consultant Jim Muniz. They were all so helpful and it's obvious that they take pride in what they do. This was my first experience with AAA since I joined and I'm happy I did!

Everyone here in the SteelCreek shop are fabulous. Had oil changed and a rattle in the back end of my vehicle fixed. When I brought it in, we did not know what the problem was. They put it up in the air, explored and found the problem. While here an elderly woman came in with her car and said it was leaking fluids. They put her car on the lift, explored and found it was her AC unit. They did not charge her but did assure her that her car was safe and it was normal. Will come back and will recommend.

They have been servicing my cars for some years now. And since I'm an AAA member. There's alway 20% off the services.. They're easy to get in. From minor things line oil change to brakes replacement.. I feel very easy talking to them.. Not a place you as a female feel like they're talking to you like you're dumb and can take advantage of you.. They used to take care of my Jeep SUV til it was time to retire her. Now they take care of my Sasha aka 2012 Mini Cooper.. I feel at ease.. HOWEVER, from time to time.. There's little carelessness. Like instead doing the right thing of replace my signal light. They use glue to secure in place which didn't last long. And just recently when I have all my brakes replaced. They never close my hood all the way.. Here I am flying down the highway with my hood shaking vigorously.. I was NOT happy.. But overall this is still the place to go after I fuss at them about the minor carelessness!

Yet another bad experience, they won't even honor their own coupon, from the AAA magazine for an oil change. The front desk staff, one of them says, "there is no way my manager is going to give away 5 quarts of oil for $19.95, the other staff member Jojo says we can't honor this coupon as we lose money !! 

What can I say?? Don't go there ever. I have been a AAA member since 1995 and now I will be cancelling my membership.

Am usually skeptical of auto repair shops primarily because I used to work in some and have seen how people can be taken advantage of, especially if you're a woman!  The manager Mike Alexander was extremely helpful, no nonsense, & will definitely get my business again and I will recommend to others in Steele Creek area.  Did not have appointment but had small window to get things done.  They were accommodating and the place was clean.  Awesome to see a relatively new place in Steele Creek that earned my respect and has earned my business.

We had a serious car issue that was addressed quickly, honestly and fairly.  AAA is very lucky to have Keith Logan.  Keith  and his staff are among  the most professional car mechanics that we have encountered.   Keith is interested in helping and pleasing the customer first and foremost.   He is very fair with pricing and I recommend him and this shop to anyone who has an major issue or just needs service work.

I would like to commend AAA Carolinas-Steele Creek.  I had my car repaired and Mike was great.  He was friendly, polite and very patient explaining the problem with my car and the time he would need for repairs.  He called me with updates during the service.  Great customer service.

Love the fast and professional service. You are greeted with a smile soon as you enter. I went in for tires and an oil change.  Jim helped us he was funny and very friendly.  He was also very knowledgeable.  I will always bring my car to them.

First time trying to get a loan and called the wrong CASH1 trying to figure out where to go . The front desk girl Carmen was so patient and nice with me and helped me get to the right location . Thought it was nice that she took her time to help me sort it out!

I went to the one on desert in omg so Rude!!!!!!!!! She didnt help me at all didnt want to help!! Carmen at this location went above an beyond to help me!!!!! She's the best at her job!!! She logged in to all my accounts for me an did everything she could to get me approved!!!!! Best experience ever.!!!

I was calling to do a payday loan not realizing Cash 1 was in Nevada. (I'm in GA.) However, Carmen at the Vegas location made me feel so relaxed, I wish that I could do the loan with Carmen's store :(

I despise accounting, and yet I look forward to my weekly accounting meeting with Tina. 
She and her talented crew are a new breed of accountant firm. They not only keep on top of my books, but they actively work to innovate their own tools and processes. Unlike any number cruncher I have ever met, they abandon outdated systems and move to proven, innovated new systems and services - even if these changes help to cut their billable hours. 
In short, AccountingProse unselfishly puts your needs as a business owner in front of their own. Smart, efficient, detailed-oriented, and incredibly hard working. Worth every penny.

Tina is incredible. 

I've never known someone as passionate about what they do as Tina is, and her job is accounting. She somehow makes numbers easy to understand in a fun and engaging way. She is an expert in her field, though she dabbles in other areas. 

If you need something outside of her expertise, she will always refer you to someone qualified who can help. 

Tina uses the most current methods of accounting, and makes it easy to integrate her services with your current process. Whether it's for tax returns, general accounting or payroll, I don't think I would ever go with another firm for my accounting needs.

A++++

Tina and Katrina were so incredibly helpful, what a blessing this company was! I just started in accounting/bookkeeping this past April, and have absolutely no technical background. When my company decided to switch accounting software, I knew trying to integrate QuickBooks Pro 2014 with XERO would be nearly impossible for me to do by myself. Xero has a support page online that will walk you through it, but I couldn't even grasp the first step.
   I can't tell you how amazing their guidance has been. Tina integrated everything for us and fixed all of the past accounting mistakes so we could start with a clean slate, and Katrina conducted an online meeting with us to show us how to use Xero. You have forever costumers in us!

AccountingProse are amazing!  It's so good to meet a bookkeeper that actually understands 1) technology and 2) that the goal should always be to make things easier for the client... not for them.  My experience has been amazing so far and I'm so glad to have started with them!

I have had a great experience working with Cristina at AccountingProse.  She has been very helpful and pacient with me as a new business owner.  She's very resourceful, I'm very glad I found her! I would highly recommend her and AccoutingProse.
I visit this bank every other day friendly staff good customer service specially my personal banker (gigi nader ) she is very well knowledge of what shes doing

This location is pretty good, the people are all very nice. But I hate this bank. I hate the online services, they suck. All I want to do is make separate areas where I can put money for things like Vacation or Education. To do this, I have to create differet savings accounts, which costs 25$ each. So I called them and asked if there is any other way I can do this, without creating a shit ton of accounts just so I can physically see how much I have for each subject. 

"You can create a savings goal." is the response. Cool, so I do that. And ow many savings goals can you create for each account? ONE! How the hell is this suppose to help me!? I do not want to create a fuck ton of accounts, just to be able to separate my money. Is it so hard to let us do this!?

I've been with Wells Fargo since 2007, I think I even signed up at this location or it soon became my home bank. That was almost 10 years ago when they actually cared about their customers. I bank with this location for my job and not for myself anymore it's that bad. I drive 15 minutes out of my way to go to the location I like. This one is literally .3 miles away from where i live. That's how bad it is. Now here's why. Pay attention, business accounts newly in the area. They have 1 business line and usually 3 non business open on average. If they don't have a business customer in line, they'll take their non business accounts at the business window. No problem, that's great. But when I stand at the business line for 23 minutes behind a non business account and watch all of the employees including the banking manager standing around not taking me because I'm business. Here's there excuse. The non business lines don't have suitable change for businesses. I don't get much in change!!! Not even if I don't need change, they won't take me or any other business people. So then I start using the drive thru because I don't like the fact that they know you have a business to run and make me wait 20 minutes in the store. Well, I was told by the banking manager through the drive thru that I've been using 2 months when I don't need rolled coins in change that my change requests are too high (mind you, a hundred in $1 bills must be outrageous via the drivethru!!) and I can't do that anymore. She's never stopped me from doing that and I've been to other locations that loved when I did drive thru for change for work. Anyway. Long story short, take care of your business customers because chances are they're more than likely personal customers and more than likely moving every account they have (4!) to a different bank. Al because of one location and how they treat their customers. Loved this spot 5+ years ago but now it doesn't even deserve the 1.5 star they have on here.

I met with David to go over several things from my upcoming taxes to different incorporation strategies. He was incredibly knowledgeable, thorough and patient. I would highly recommend that people use his services.
Great service! Will be back next year to do taxes with David Ghazaryan. Highly recommend.

UPDATE 3/23/2016:

After IQTAXX sued me for defamation for this post, my lawyer filed an Anti-SLAPP motion.  At the hearing before the Eighth Judicial District Court, the judge granted my Anti-SLAPP Special Motion to Dismiss!  The case was dismissed with prejudice.  The court granted me my attorneys' fees, and even imposed damages of $1,000 "to discourage plaintiff and other similar plaintiffs from filing SLAPP suits in the future." The judge agreed with my attorney and based his decision at least partly on statements that the anti-SLAPP law "...is to ensure that lawsuits are not brought lightly against defendants for exercising their First Amendment rights" and that "consumer complaints ... do constitute matters of public concern."

The official order is still being drafted, but this is a resounding win for consumer reviews.  Before you decide to do business with IQTAXX consider whether you want to do business with a tax firm that will sue you for defamation if you write a negative review.  Looking at other reviews here, it appears that at least one more reviewer claims that they got a letter from a lawyer after writing a negative review.  If you get sued by IQTAXX, keep in mind that they already lost one SLAPP suit.  If you get sued by them as well, I would be glad to see if my attorneys will let me send you the documents from my case so that you can defend yourself against any infringements upon your First Amendment rights.

Update 1/18/2016:

Today I was served with notice of lawsuit by iQTAXX for slander and defamation, seeking damages "...in excess of $10,000" plus punitive damages, attorney fees and court costs for posting this factual review.

"The price was right" for preparing a return. Now I have the IRS coming after me. When I call, I get a telephone call center that tells me the number is inactive. That makes no sense. Inactive numbers go to recordings: "We're sorry, the number you've reached..." not a live person at a call center. A week ago, the person who handled my 1040 said she would contact the IRS and call me.

Update 11/3/15: 

Today I got, unsigned, a "Cease and Desist Harassment" letter via certified mail from a law firm about this Yelp review. Incidentally, the registered agent with the Nevada Secretary of State for that law firm is the same registered agent as iQTAXX as well as the same person as the only manager of record of iQTAXX. (This is public information available to anyone who knows how to search public records. Not slander. Not open for litigation.) I did "cease and desist" from (deleted) the one word they described in the letter as "emotional rant," "slander," "unwanted and illegal conduct." They also mistook my above comment about having "the IRS coming after me" as being their fault, which was never my intent. It is fact. I did not imply or ever think that was their fault and have no idea why they inferred that. The problem was in not being available to honor their "all-inclusive contract" when the IRS did come after me.

Here are the remaining facts, and why I STILL do not recommend iQTAXX to anyone under any circumstances:

FACT: Fees for tax preparation at iQTAXX are all-inclusive, which is disclosed on their website and explained to clients at intake. According to the explanation I was given, this includes interaction with the IRS after filing.

FACT: I was told by my tax preparer that she would file a hardship on my behalf. I signed a power of attorney which would allow her to file on my behalf.

FACT: As of August 14, according to the Las Vegas Taxpayer Advocate Office, no hardship had ever been filed on my tax account.

FACT: I put an unfavorable review on Yelp after the tax preparer didn't return my calls, mentioned above.

FACT: The preparer finally returned my calls after I posted an unfavorable review. The first thing she said was that she saw the review on Yelp. She apologized that I thought I didn't get satisfactory service and asked me to please consider removing the review. She said they were having issues with their phone system. As I mentioned above, this does not sound plausible to me - opinion; I'm entitled; free speech, not slanderous and not open to litigation. Then she offered to help.

FACT: Preparer said she had filed the hardship and that it does show on my IRS account, contrary to what the IRS employee told me. 

FACT: I spoke with another IRS agent on September 14 through their 800 number. He also said no hardship has ever been filed.

I didn't know taxes could be so easy. Very helpful with other questions I had also about starting up businesses. Lizeth is the best!  She was patient and calm, even though I was impatient and frantically trying to meet my tax deadline.  She explained everything in detail to me and I just received the letter from IRS today where she saved me over $7k!!  Highly recommend them.  Ask for Lizeth!  Keep up the good work girlfriend!
Repeat customer. Service was great and they really helped me with my small business taxes. I would recommend their services. Great for those with a side 1099 income.

My case was not an easy one. I frantically needed a tax service to file 5 years of back taxes. David and his staff at IQTaxx made a believer out of me!! I filed my taxes within two weeks and had a minimal balance to the IRS. In comparison to the amount originally billed to me by the IRS the numbers don't compare. They go far and above the call of duty. Best tax preparers in town!  thanks David, Iqtax is 100% recommended.

Tried to get a loan here, which turned into an ordeal. Provided all required documentation that I was told I needed, but then they needed more. They needed to see the mail date on a bill even though the bill clearly showed my current billing cycle. Needed 5 pages of bank statements. Three pay stubs showing I make 7 times the amount I was asking for a month wasn't good enough. Told them to forget it. 

Went to Moneytree with the same documents, half weren't needed and I was in and out in 10 minutes. Avoid dollar loan center.

I wish I could give a half  of a star. This place sucks! Avoid them at all costs! They try and make you take out a car title loan for way more than you need. They don't even give you the opportunity to get anything lower than $2,500. They waste your time going through all the paperwork, and take pictures of your car, start the car, try the heater and AC then they talk to corp. wasting way more of your time, even though they know you are late for work as it is. Not to mention, taking payments from others while still typing up your info, causing you to be even more late for work! This place is terrible!

We took our Mazda into South Blvd AAA in July 2015, after it was jumped by a tow truck driver. Initially AAA had sent their "battery specialist" out who said there was absolutely no way to jump the battery and for me to just have one installed on site that he would sell me. After waiting 2 HOURS for this guy to arrive, he says he can't work on my car after all and it would have to go to the shop. I had a weird felling about this guy, and when he called an actual AAA tow truck, that guy was IMMEDIATELY able to jump it on-the-spot.  Was this first guy flatly lying to me to make a sell?  It certainly seemed like the only explanation.

Once at the shop, I went ahead and decided to replace the battery as it was getting weak- but as soon as I arrived home my car fell out of gear and would not shift into anything but neutral. Meaning it worked when I left the shop, and no longer worked 5 mins later, less than a mile from their location  I called and asked if they could look at it since something obviously happened when they worked on it.

They told me they would look at it -- for $99.

It is my opinion that something was done to the vehicle at the shop in order to generate more work for them. We immediately cancelled both our memberships.

I recently had a vehicle delivered to me by AAA Charlotte. The driver was a very nice and efficient older lady. She was so good at her job that after the transaction was over, I felt like I had known her for a long time. This was customer service at it's best.

Made an appointment at 1230 didn't get out of there until 130 for an oil change! I also asked for them to put air in my tires since my low tire pressure light came on. The man looked at me like I was dumb and said of course we always check and add air and fluids. Needless to say my tire pressure on all four tires is only at 29 and needs to be at 32. No air was added.

I having been taking my vehicle to AAA for years. Everyone is always friendly & the service is great. The old location on South Blvd was further from my work, but I was still happy to go see the staff. The new location is closer to work, and the work has not changed along with the good customer service.

The place itself is clean and convenient even with all the new traffic on South Blvd. 

Here's the drawback: 
1) the passport pictures could be more of what you want and not what they deem Dept of State will accept. 
2) Ordering currency online will result in a fee. Call it in and more fees. This system forces you to walk into a store front so I guess they can upsell you. I'm like my word.... I'm not my grandparents. Let's just be real this set up caters to a certain population/generation. And guess what else... I may not be the target group but, "Hello!!! We are here buying your membership." and I don't always want to be inconvenienced with a phone call and a trip when I can click and do it myself online. 

3) Only way to waive the fee, online, is to exchange $1000 USD to whatever. 
Increment minimums are purchase at least $200 in USD so I asked for $100 in Euros and Krones. Well, I had to bump up because we didn't hit $100 after the exchange. So up to $106 and $102. 

4) The passport holder with RFID protection comes in nice colors but overpriced. I was okay with getting 1 because it was lime green but the kid found a nicer one in JCPenney for 2/3 less than what AAA charges their members. Well, JCP won. 

5) We were able to correct the Danish Krones to Norwegian Krones with a simple phone call and I still received my money the next business day.  Now, that's nice. They buy back whatever you have EXCEPT no coins. Beware: The 800# folks & online says it'll be 2 days. 

All in all, I think the service is 5 stars as the ladies working here really want to help and make themselves available. 
0 stars for the antiquated process of all things in person
3 stars for the options that are available 
3.5 stars for the exchange rate 
1 star for trying to always upsell. Sheesh. Worse than a car dealership.

Normally I take my car to a dealer to get maintenance work done but being that I didn't want to waste 3 hours with the drive back and forth and waiting for my car, I decided to check out this place since they are 5 minutes away from home.

I made an appointment online for a specific day and time and within hours I had a confirmation. Dropping off was easy and the staff was very friendly.

They did the necessary work but like any car repair shop they are going to try to get you to buy other services. Stand your ground and be aware of your car's maintenance history and recommended schedule before you give in.

AAA members get a discount on services and for non-members there are coupons on their website for discounted services. As a member, price wise I can't complain.

Inside the location, they also have AAA travel service reps and travel merchandise for sale. They also have a waiting room with vending machines.

It seems like a decent place but for me it's just a place I will go to when I don't want to trek out to Matthews to the dealer I bought the car from.

I took my tire to AAA on South Blvd in Charlotte this morning to have a flat fixed. Not only were they very nice but they were also very quick. They looked to be very busy when I got there, but they were done in 15 minutes. If your looking for great service I would definitely recommend this AAA.

Went there for the first time to buy some parts I needed for my Motorhome and was very disappointed by the selection they had. I am used to their store in Orange County CA, which is well stocked. Not worth the drive from The airport area. Ended up ordering the stuff I needed online from Amazon. Better prices.
This place is a F@$KING joke!!! AVOID AT ALL COSTS! We're currently out in the middle of the California desert trying to fix their F-up ourselves, will update this review later.

Fist off let me say this is my first Yelp review. I am so upset with the customer service I received that I had to rate them and if I could give them NO stars I would! The service department is rude, unhelpful and they have no idea what they are doing. First off I called and spoke to Ed, I have a Bison LQ horse trailer that is still under warranty. He said they did not take their warranty but would call and get charges approved and take a credit card. Bison said that was fine. I called again because I had another small fix and spoke to Rob. Rob said he was out Monday to bring it in Tuesday for both services. I had my mother take time out of her day to take it down for me since I work (which is clear across town). When she showed up Ed tells her he can't see her and she needs an appointment and he couldn't get it in until another week. One of the issues was my antenna broke and was hanging by wires from the top of the trail. Ed proceed to tell my 50+ year old mother to get up there and duck tape it. WTH??? So my mom makes an appointment to bring it back. My mother takes it back to the appointment she scheduled. Ed does not call Bison to get the charges approved or the credit card number from them. Instead has my mother pay $541 when she picks it up. I am so upset with the service I have received from them! I will NEVER take my trailer back to them nor will I buy a single thing from them again!

In looking at my bill, they said nothing was wrong with the antenna but still charged me $129 for it. It is clearly glued on an Ed saw it hanging by the wires just the week before.

Please read!!! Do NOT trust this place with absolutely anything! I had them do a 45 point inspection on a sportsmobile that I was interested in buying. After paying $300 for an inspection, I found out that they did not actually inspect 95% of the things they were supposed to! They checked things off as ok that were blatantly not working! The furnace control didn't even have batteries in it yet they said it was working properly. The fridge was broken and also checked off as ok. When I called them out on this, they would not admit fault and just lied more and more. This is the absolute worst customer service I have ever experienced and I will do everything in my power to make them pay for what they did to me. I am considering suing them for stealing my money, even if it costs me a lot of money in the process. PLEASE PLEASE PLEASE do NOT use this camping world for absolutely any service, you will be scammed. For the record, I reported this to a manager and nothing was done about it.

This is the worst Camping world that I've ever been to and I've been to allot of them that I've lost count.  I decided to buy a trailer and Mike Walsh was the sales person.  It must had been my unluckiest day ever to have Mikes name up next as the sales person.  The sarcastic egotistic man needs to pull his head out of somewhere bad.  Then once I decided on what I wanted to buy, I had to deal with Mr Ashtray Paul in finance.  Paul the Finance Managers office smelt like everybody just got done with a smoke-out in his closed office.  I got home still choking.  Gag!!!  But what do you expect from a Gambling City?  I leaned my lesson the hard way.  All the Camping Workd misfits and rejects must get sent here to this location.  I told them I wanted a 20 year loan and both Mike and Paul agreed, but when I signed all the paperwork a bombshell was dropped at the end that it was a 10 year loan and at the end it would automatically be started over with another 10 years, so I signed and agreed. Then, I had warranty work that I mostly pointed out before I took possession and that became a nightmare. They have several mikes and you constantly get transferred to the wrong one even though your specific which one you want.  It seems to be something that is done on purpose by the gals that answering the phones.  It gives the opertunity for the correct one to say "I didn't get your voice message".  These sin city gamblers are game players and play stupid.  They can never fix anything right the first time as if the mechanics are misfits just like the sales and finance manager.  This location should shut down completely and send all the business without the employees to the Henderson, Nevada location to handle.  And another sad thing about the Las Vegas location is when you buy a new trailer and want to buy things for it, their stock of items is horrible. I would like to say ithe hot weather is the problem, but I can't because Henderson Nevada is just as hot there and they are Great-Fantastic!  And then there is Jesse the Genderal Manager here at the Las Vegas location, who is just there without a clue of what he is suppose to do. Jesse is like the used salesman that never learned how to sell, but has the smile and Knod down, and makes promises that the problem your having is unacceptable and tells you that he will get to the bottom of it, and yet does nothing.
