I called Allstate to let them know this, they promised they would be back in 48 hours. It's been a week and still NOTHING! (the lady on the other line was very nice I might add)

But it gets worse, because it wasn't returned when they said, I got an NSF fee of $36 by my bank. Oh joy.

I call back a week later, was on hold for exactly 31:26 and then was told in order to get my $36 I'd have to fax them my info from my bank. Fax??? WTF, who has a fax machine in their house nowadays???  

After all this hassle and headache you'd think the service rep would be nicer. Instead she kept telling me that it was company policy. I kept reminding her that her company policy had already caused me massive inconvenience and I could simply email her the info...that's what companies do in the 21st century lol. 

You'd think she'd be a little more accommodating...but she was worse! I had to hang up the phone. 

So I call my local agent, explain the situation, and he blames AllState. I reminded him that I bought the insurance from him, so he bears responsibility to get this resolved. He has been a little more helpful but so far no results.

It's been a week...where's my money Allstate????
Excellent customer service and the BEST rates in town !! Thank you Michael and Team !!

Michael westra Allstate insurance agent and his office staff are awesome great experience with help and best rates I have ever had in insurance I highly recommend them they save me over a thousand dollars a year

This agent's customer service is horrible.
On several occasions I have called this office but only to get a voice mail message.
Every time I left a message, I would never receive a call back.
On my most recent attempt to contact this office. I actually got someone on the phone. I was quoted a price after I purchased a new car and when I received my bill it was off by $ 60.00 per month.
As I tried to call this agent again, I got a young lady on the phone and she said she will have someone look into this and she will have someone call me back. NEVER HAPPENED.
I called and left messages several times during the day and still no call back. After 2 days of waiting for a call back I cancelled my policy and went with another insurance company which was over $ 100 less per month with more options.

Michael truly offers concierge like service for his clients. I use him for auto, boat, motorcycle, home, and business and he gets me what i need fast whether is=ts an account change or adding additional insured to jobs I am working on for my business as required for compliance. All this and he has great rates! On my business policy he saves me more than I pay for the current policy than my old one. All other retes for home, auto, etc... he is generally lower with higher coverages. Thanks Michael

My business has used cornerstone for well over a decade.  They are the industry standard.  They offer state of the art credit card processing at the best price and with the most security.  Clay is a great representative of this company!

Had the pleasure in of meeting with Clay Overlien with Cornerstone Merchant Services.  He was able to explain the difference better the "Square" vs other swipe devices.  The overall cost of using the difference services and most important the security or lack of security between different vendors.  Clay is very professional and knowledgeable.

Finding a trustworthy credit card merchant service provider is important for a business of any size. As a growing business owner, Cornerstone has been a huge help to me, in providing information and guidance on setting up the processing programs to help us grow our business and meet our customers purchasing needs. I trust and rely on Cornerstone to keep me informed and up to date on merchant service rules and regulations to ensure our company stays in compliance. I highly recommend them.

The Cornerstone Merchant Service Team is phenomenal!  They have far exceeded my expectations and most importantly they ARE SAVING MY BUSINESS MONEY ON CREDIT CARD PROCESSING FEES!  My business had been processing with a big bank for merchant services and we were being overcharged and the customer service or support the bank provided was basically non existent!  

Working with Cornerstone has truly been a breath of fresh air!  Clay is upfront and honest and there are no hidden fees or costs. I couldn't be happier about making the change! Also the transition was extremely easy for my business. There was no downtime and the Cornerstone Team is always there to help or troubleshoot.  

If your business accepts credit cards then you should really meet with Clay.  I highly recommend Cornerstone! I truly appreciate Cornerstone's honesty and integrity!

I now have Auto Insurance with Allstate.  I recently purchased a vehicle and other insurance were giving me very high quotes. I called this agency and they surely help me. The staff is very polite. They go out of their way to help. I even talked to Tom himself and he is a very happy and kind person. I'm so glad I switched. Now I have my Auto, renters, life insurance with Allstate. I'm just thrilled to know I'm saving money. I truly recommend this agency. It's one of the best. Just give it a try. At least try to get a free quote. If your not satisfied I'm sure they will go out of their way to help you.

I have been to many Insurance offices in the Las Vegas area and this is one of the best!!!!  Great location, with plenty of parking.  The staff is always friendly and helpful! The agent, Tom, is always in the office when I stop by, some agents are locked away and you never see them! Yhara is great, very friendly and helpful.... They really go above and beyond to make sure you are taken care of. I would highly recommend this office and  would feel very comfortable referring my family and friends to them for insurance.
The staff was very nice and professional. This bank is pretty quiet inside. I love that the service was quick and there was not a line

Remember that scene in the movie Pretty Woman, where Vivian went into a high-class boutique and the saleslady refused to help her because of how she was dressed? 

That's how I was treated here by an associate named Rodney. 

I have a $200 cashiers check (guaranteed funds, it doesn't have to clear anything to be cashed, they already have been paid the money)  that is made out through Chase. So I came here. They refused to cash it, so I decided to open an account. 

Rodney was the one "helping" me. He refused to allow me to open an account because "chase frowns on people opening accounts to cash checks and then later closing them."  Well then why wouldn't you just let me cash the check?!? I told him I needed to open an account anyway as I don't currently have one. His response? "Well, it's twelve dollars a month..." As though I couldn't afford a measly $12 a month!

I left feeling insulted.

You really know how to treat potential customers, Chase. I'm never darkening your door again. 

Oh, and I will gladly remove this review if an attempt to rectify this situation is made. Which I sincerely doubt will happen, as like most banks, they don't REALLY care about customer service or they'd hire professionals who DO.

Chase always tops out as one of the worst banks on the planet, however this location takes the cake for shitty service (and of course for taking bailout money too). I'd rather be a death row inmate than a Chase customer, but their partnership with Southwest keeps me captive, as it's my favorite loyalty card. 
Oh well, all banks are horrible, but that's what happens when your industry gets bailed out once a generation for making poor and risky decisions.

I have been going to this branch for quite sometime, even when I get to the doors at, or possibly just after closing time, the staff has been courteous and gracious enough to let me in to make a last minute transaction. 

While they are quite efficient and don't take long per transaction, the conversation does not seem forced. The staff seems genuine and professional. I pass by a plethora of Chase branches while driving around, however, I will make the effort to go to this branch whenever possible.

This is the location located on the northeast corner of Green Valley Pkwy and Sunset Drive. The place is always very clean and easy to find, being right on the corner in front of the other business there.

I stop here from time to time and I have always been pleased with the service I recieve here. When there is a line, it always moves at a reasonably fast pace. The ctellers have always been friendly and pleasant, while still being efficient.

4 stars

Thank you David for saving me $5,200 in taxes!  I was not expecting this but David asked to look over my returns and found out that there were deductions not taken.  Thank you again as this was a huge savings!  - Dustin

Torchlight Tax are experts in complex tax and IRS issues. They are now handling my personal and business tax filings due to their extreme knowledge and acumen on the subject. Even if you are not a resident of the Las Vegas, NV area, I still recommend their consultation and assistance for whatever tax issues you may be confronting. Highly professional in ever regard.
Dave of Torchlight Taxes delivers a great service and he is exceptionally  service oriented.  I have already recommended him to others.

Jayson is very knowledgable, willing to take the time to really be effective with his clients, and actually cares.  He increased my coverage and decreased my rates.  He actively helps me with my business and gives me peace of mind.  Thank you Jayson.

Kenneth von Hopf
he has been very helpful and honest about money that i can save with insurance. he has integrity and thats what matters when you do business with someone!!!

I would not recommend this agent to anyone I know.   When writing my quote it changed 3 separate times getting more expensive each time of course.  I did sign up with his company, and my first bill never showed up as Mr Hoffer's office made some mistakes on their part filling out paperwork on new policy.  I signed up for paperless billing and automatic withdrawal from my account.  I never received my paperless billing email, although they did take out 2 monthly payments, and then I received a demand for an additional premium of $250 per 6 months because of Hoffer's office making an error while setting up my account and putting in the incorrect email address. I called the office to try remedy the situation , and never received a call back, called his personal cell phone  ( He gave it to me, I was thinking I would get personalized service, I was very wrong to assume this, he clearly doesn't care about the customer much past the initial sale, but he sure conned me into signing up through his company, I actually paid an extra premium (about $400 for 6 month term)  to go with his company because I thought I was actually going to get the excellent service he told me he gives to all of his customers . so after about a week of not getting any calls back I went into his office and sat with him. explained to him where he made the mistakes and he agreed and said ok he'll get it straitened out.  after sitting with him in his office while he was on phone with the provider, he finally says that he can't do anything about it even though he made the mistake.  I finally talked to the same person he was talking to on the phone and we discussed the situation and the person at the insurance company agreed with me an actually fixed the problem and the issues with the additional premium.  Again no thanks to Mr Hoffer. he said there was nothing he could do, yet I talked to the exact same person on his phone in his office and she actually did something about it.   That was at the beginning of out relationship.  I have called and asked a few different questions about coverage's and other things over the last 5 months and I never receive a call back from him personally. He   has had his office people call me back, but while I had direct questions for him, He Never returned my calls, yet while I was shopping for new insurance , he amazingly returned every one he didn't answer promptly.  AGAIN DON"T BE FOOLED BY A SLICK WILLIE SALES PERSON, HE OVER PROMISES AND UNDER DELIVERS....  Luckily I never had to deal with him on  a claim  I was fortunate in that respect. I am defiantly not renewing with his office a very poor office with terrible customer service when you need it, but amazing how helpful they are when they are trying to collect money from you...   BEWARE

After contacting Jayson but reaching him in the midst of a cat emergency I've not talked to him while trying to purchase insurance through his office. MIscommunication began after we had received our quote and decided to purchase from them. We were not informed that the Farmer's would be sending out their own appraiser to determine how much it would cost to rebuild the house. We were under the impression that the quote we received was the price that we would pay for insurance. The rate increased almost $300 per year. No call from Jayson. No call from the office. We found out when we received a call from the title company saying that more money required for closing after we'd already signed our paperwork. This complicated an already arduous closing on a home. Then we received a cancellation letter; no call. Then we received another cancellation after we thought the matter was resolved and again no call from Jayson's office.

I have been a client of Jayson's for five years. He really took the time to explain what my coverage meant and saved me money on my car and renters insurance. At my age, I didn't think I needed life insurance, but after discussing it with Jayson I decided now was a great time to get it while I am young and insurable. 

I never knew how bad my old car insurance was until we reviewed it. Now Jayson does a review for me every year to see if there are new discounts that can save me more money. For example when I moved from Mesa to Gilbert I saved more money.

Jason had me over to his office today to review our life and auto policies. If you want someone who will take care of you and not just looking for a quick buck he is definitely the go to agent for home, auto, life, disability, and just about every kind of insurance there is. Thanks Jason!

Honestly I like insurance agents as much as I like used car salesmen. HOWEVER..today we had an appointment with Jayson to go over our car insurance. We have had USAA for years and were recently given some information by a co-worker that had us looking into other insurances. We met at his office and he was awesome.  I was very impressed because he was honest with us and told us that for now, due to a fender bender 2 years ago, our best option is to stay with our current company.  He even took the time to go over our policies with us and called USAA to make changes that would benefit us..he even saved us $$$ and got us better coverage which I love! He made no money off us tonight but helped us tremendously. You can bet that next May, when our little accident falls off, we will be right back at Jayson's office making that change. If you are looking to make a change for the better in your insurance, you should definitely give Jayson a call!

I've known Jason for a number of years and I've been fortunate to see his incredible service level and expertise with his insurance clients. Plus, Jason is simply a great guy. He will help you get the absolute best rates on auto, home, life, and many other types of insurance so you can help protect your family and your assets. His office is located in Mesa, but he serves clients all across the valley in Scottsdale, Gilbert, Tempe, Phoenix, and Chandler.

I've been in and around the insurance industry for over 30 years, and today I met one of the most talented, compassionate, and professional agents in my career. Jayson's ability to thoroughly explain one's needs, his expertise in recognizing how he can best serve his clients, and his transparency in service are light years beyond the service of anyone I've done business with in the past. Truly an amazing experience... Call him NOW and schedule an appointment with him. You will only be impressed and thankful for the time you spend with him.

Jayson Hoffer was exceptionally helpful when putting together my life insurance, auto insurance, and home owner's insurance. He is extremely friendly and easy to talk to. When meeting with him at his office in Mesa, he walked my wife and I through the entire process making sure we fully understood everything. My favorite part was that the package was much more affordable compared to my previous company I was with. I highly recommend Jayson Hoffer from Farmers Insurance to be your insurance agent!

After seeing his reviews on google and yelp I decided to give them a shot. I was impressed by how personal he was and the advise he gave me for my life and vehicle insurance. He actually got on the phone with my current insurance agency and fixed my coverage even though I decided to keep my current vehicle insurance and i did decide to get my life Insurance through them....

Jason it was a pleasure meeting you and your staff last week! ! I am very excited about the retirement products you shared with me and my business partner and I am looking forward to doing business with you very soon.  If anyone is looking for a great knowledgeable insurance agent, Jason is your guy. Thanks again! !

I was issued a check FROM BANK OF AMERICA. As I am not a Bank of America Member, I went there to cash it. They charge me an 8% FEE to cash a check issued by them. I spoke to the branch manager Carrie Eiss whom barely acknowledge my frustration, and just kept stating that its policy and she cannot help me. This branch manager HAS NO CUSTOMER SERVICE SKILLS whatsoever. Can I live without a few extra bucks? Yes! But this manager needs to learn to give the customer the pickle. Maybe its time to replace her...

I feel bad for this location because its on a weird corner and i feel like the parking isn't the best. Every time I've been here the line has been long and the poor tellers are few (usually 1 or 2 working).

It seems as though the long line at B of A is a company standard. Can't wait to take my banking elsewhere. Every time I have to go into the bank, I am hopeful that it will not take up my complete lunch break. But, as usual, I am disappointed and forfeit my lunch for a nice 30mins standing in line. God bless you B of A for keeping me on my diet. Gotta love the false hope of seeing 5 teller stations but alas, only 2 tellers working. Tick tock go the minutes... Always a disappointment.

Not my regular branch but they were on my way to work and had to make a quick deposit . Hard to give them a 5 star because there is pretty much always a line or a wait at the banks. Nothing against B of A but they are pretty much super guilty of limited tellers and lines. I'm sure it's part of them maintaining profitability but unfortunately customer service times are long. Other than that they were great!
I've only been into this branch a couple of times, but each time the staff were very friendly and took care of our needs perfectly.
Staff is always helpful, friendly, and inviting!! They are usually quick, sometimes the occasional slow teller. They do a great job and I love the atmosphere!!! I enjoy coming here!!

I met Jayson a couple years ago through another comedian.  He had been at one of our mutual gigs and laughed hysterically while I was onstage.  Actually, that's what I *think* he did.  Anyway, that was 2 years ago and he gave me his card.  I just found it in my purse on the SAME DAY he found me on Facebook.  That, folks, is destiny.
I got an awesome rate for my new car and exemplary service from him and Brittany.  The guy is busy as hell, but took the time to work with me. 
He even asked for details on any future gigs. Seriously, if anyone wants to come see me laugh, they'll get my biz!

Great CPA! I just moved from California to Arizona, bought a home here,  and had to report my interest on  a few investments. A week later,  my taxes were done(had to wait for my 1099s to arrive), Overall,  Thomas Holly made a seamless move for me and in my case, was even a little cheaper than the estimate.

Hands down the BEST customer service of any insurance agency I have ever had. Daniel and his team go above and beyond when assisting me in finding the least expensive rates. My sales representative, Patrick, spent days searching for ways to lower my insurance payments and he did a fantastic job! In addition, THEY REFINANCED MY CAR LOAN at a much cheaper rate than it was before!!!!!! I would give Daniel and his team at State Farm 10 stars if I had the option! Hands down the best insurance company I have ever had.

This agency is awesome! After having many issues with "cheap" companies that keep increasing prices I decided to make the move about a year ago. Since then I couldn't be happier I changed, I can always call the office to work directly with my agency instead of some call center, they always return my calls the same day, and this summer when I was in a car accident who wasn't even my fault they were super helpful to walk me thru the claim process and cover my claim! Hands down the best insurance office, if u disagree u should really make the time to stop by and speak to someone there to review your policies and find out what they cover!

I have paid insurance my entire life never really had any problems until I moved to Phoenix where my expensive mountain bike was stolen never filled a claim thought to do the right thing by getting a police report and filling a claim this company dropped me for a bike they won't even cover so I paid them monthly to tell me I'm a liability 0 stars for criminals the only reason there is 1 star is because yelp required 1

I was in a pinch and my taxes were late, I was also juggling some issues with my small business and just moved to the Scottsdale area. I called Thomas' office and I'm happy I did. He was quick to answer questions and his prices are fair. He was able to clear up my tax issues within 2 days!  I would definitely recommend him.

Thomas was excellent. His staff his extremely courteous and professional. Both my personal and business taxes were completed by CPA Thomas S. Holly. I couldn't be happier and more confident my taxes were done correctly. I will certainly continue to do business with Thomas and his staff for many years to come. I will be happy to refer my friends and family too! Thanks again Thomas.

I changed accountants about two years ago, and I now realize I should have done it sooner. I've used a few different firms and accountants for my business in the past, but none have come close to providing the level of attention and organization that Thom and his staff does. 

Sandy T was the team member that did a lot of the heavy lifting on our corporate taxes, rec's and general cleanup. She is amazing to work with. I cannot express how much of a pleasure it is to work with Sandy and Thom. 

I know full well how arduous some of the items were that I needed done. At every turn, they were professional, poised and just powered through the pile of work. 

Thom and his team are very approachable, knowledgeable and accountable (pun intended). It's very important to me that people do what they say, and I am proud to have them handling my taxes, both corporate and personal.

Do yourself a favor and give Thom a call.

Awesome experience!!!  I was having a crisis situation when trying to file my taxes on my own.  There was a particular area of my taxes that I just couldn't figure out.  I had called a couple CPA's and H&R block but everyone was clueless.  I originally called to find a CPA to hire to do this but Tom spent about 20 minutes walking me through it over the phone.....I am not currently a client either.  He basically walked me through how to do this on my own. 

-the issue was trying to file a 8606 for for the past three and calculate my basis for an nondeductable IRA to Roth conversion.  I spent about 3 hours of my life trying to figure it out until I called Tom.  THANKS!

Oh and please don't just call him for free advice, he does have to eat!!
Friendly people but always a line. Not a log line but always a long wait. We always get good rates at Desert Schools, just wish there were more people in the branch to help speed up the service.

Huge fan of this place, because it's real close to home. This location is located next to Albertson. Parking can be busy at times. Very nice and courtesy crew. I have been coming here for two reason. My father had his account here, and my credit union in California can be serviced from here. 
Service:
When my father passed away last year, I had to deal with Desert Schools for my fathers financials. It was frustrated at times, they make sure all the paper work is in and they are very thorough. Basically that's a good thing. But in time, everything was able to be transferred into the estate account.
I was also very surprised that they will answer their phones in person. Very convenient when you don't have much time to wait around for a call back or being placed on hold. 
I was thinking about closing my credit union account, but now that I know I can make transactions here, no reason to close now!

John and Elizabeth are great.  We have our homeowners insurance with them, and they are always checking to make sure we have the best coverage for the dollar spent.  Recently, John helped me resolve my confusion, frustration, and other problems with my Medicare additional coverage.  I saved money, have greater peace of mind now, and John did all of the work, all he needed for me to do was sign the paperwork, and pay my new LOWER bill.

John Chase is my insurance agent. I guess you could say that I'm sold on his and Beth's service.

I've recently began a new business. I couldn't have done it without John's help in getting the best quotes possible for health coverage.

If you are in the market for an agent--if you want solid, dependable service at a competitive price, then you want John Chase.

We met the best insurance broker today John Chase. He's helping us with our health insurance. He will also be helping me transition to Medicare this next summer. He's a pro and works a busy schedule. It's hard to find a good insurance broker for health insurance these days since Obamacare. So sorry to be losing Nevada Health Coop the end of this year. I look forward to working with John for a long time to come. He's looking into dental plans for us.

By far the worst banking experience ever!

Came here on a Friday afternoon to have a wire transfer processed for a new home purchase. The woman I saw was telling me that whatever interest rate I'm getting she will do better. I said thanks but no thanks I just need the wire. She proceeded to badger me and tell me that I was probably ruining my financial future and she could help me. I had already been having a trying day and told her 'look I came here for one reason, a wire transfer, here is the account number, ect if you can't get this done for me then I'll find someone who will'. Well she was caught off guard and we didn't talk for the rest of the time. 

Seriously I was clear the first few times you badgered me just do what I have already politely asked you otherwise I will leave. 

This one example of how horribly I've been treated at this Bank of America and others in the area! Pretty sure I'll be moving banks asap!
Slowest Bank of America on the planet. No sense of urgency whatsoever. Had 1 person working at the window while the line was completely full. Seems to be like this every time I come in here.

Two tellers and a long line. You'd think they could do a better job on a Monday after a 4 day weekend. But they still have one person whose sole job is to say hi as you come in. Stupid stupid stupid. Manager should be fired.

Nanette has been my agent for nearly 15 years. I'm a loyal State Farm client because of her.

In this world of 'high technology' she still remains 'high touch' and personally contacts me whenever I have a need.

I highly recommend Nanette for your insurance and financial needs.
Caring people that really have my best interest at heart. Buying local means a lot to me and the customer service you receive with Nanette is top notch.

Place is good, no hassle. I believe it is Native American owned and i like to help those businesses cause lets face it, we stole all their land. Friendly place, I was a bit late on a payment with no drama, a perk you won't get with the big names (trust). I would definitely do business with them again.

What a waist of time. They will waist your time...
I went online and applied for a installment loan for 2500.00 and I got a email stating I was approved and what documents I needed to bring in to finalize the loan. When I get down there it's a whole new story. The guy behind the counter said I qualified for 200.00. I said that won't help me and laughed and said To myself I can hustle that in a heartbeat lol. Plus he wasn't too friendly and looked like racist who hated black peoples
I think this location is pretty good. I don't go in very often, but they have three ATMs, two of which are drive-through's, and there isn't usually a wait.

This locale is within walking distance of my apartment complex. The lobby area is nice but I don't go in very much at all. The drive thru is quick and easy.....friendly service.....no hassle ATM'S and considering it is located on the corner of a major thorough fare it is very safe to conduct your outside transactions here. Eat, Drink, and be Merry my Friends!!!!!

Unbelievable ineptitude!  This branch made a mistake with paperwork several years ago on my dads accounts and no one ever knew until we had to add a signature card onto the account when my dad was sick.  Bank of America made the mistake but couldn't fix it without documents from a lawyer.  My family called the lawyer and he completed the paperwork and my mother made a 9am appointment (because that's when they open). They made her wait in the lobby for 30 minutes and even then she had to go back to the counter to ask why she was still waiting.  After meeting with the bank manager, Christina, she was told everything was in proper order.  Well, they again failed to do their job correctly and it wasn't until after my dad actually passed away that we found out they had messed it up again.  Now we are dealing with problems because of their gross mishandling of the account.  Instead of grieving my father we have been dealing with Bank of America to ensure my moms bills will still be paid...which they aren't because they have placed a hold on the account!  If I could leave no stars I would!  This is a terrible branch that is poorly managed and a company that is heartless.
These folks are friendly. The bank is clean. Security officer is friendly. ATMs are conveniently located. So happy that they are also near my new home.
Everyone is very helpful and always a pleasure to work with! I have recommend omni to a number of friends and family looking for great service and competitive rates.
Nathan took the time to review all possible options.  Ultimately, he saved me literally $1000s for my insurance needs.  Thank you!!!
Christine is one of the nicest people I've ever met. She is extremely helpful, considerate, and caring. If you go to this office, ask for her!

Met Jack Jacobs through a client of mine a few weeks ago.  Was impressed with his customer service so this week, I signed up for auto insuance for 2 vehicles plus roadside assistance and another policy.  Very happy with the policies not to mention the customer service from everyone else in the office.  Very welcoming.  If you need auto, home, or a rental policy, or just need AAA roadside, see Jack.

More than AAA-OK. 

Just when you think you're headed home to work comfortably in your underwear.  Boom! You walk out to your car and you see that you have a flat tire. It's one of those instant bummer moments. 

Should I change it myself? NO! Of course not, why do I pay $45 a year for this service and never get the glory of sharing my AAA moment, until now. 

I called around 2pm and requested service for a flat tire. The operator guy was super helpful and said you're all set and that there should be a truck showing up at 2:23pm to help me, "that pretty precise" I thought. I hang up and instantly get text confirming what the operator guy just said. I decided to grab some coffee and sit down to work on my laptop. 

At 2:21pm I get a call from the AAA guy, Ian, "I'm next to your car". Whoa, I walk outside and there's Ian, patiently waiting. I get out my spare and watch this dude change the tire in what felt like 2 minutes. He even checked the air pressure of the spare to make sure it was set for the road, luckily it was. From phone call to fixed in under thirty minutes. All I can say is wow and Ian you're the man! 

BTW- I'm typing this in my underwear.
I love the convenience of the DMV kiosk!! They said hello when I walked in.  It was an easy transaction. I do not like going to the DMV so this really helps .

Lizeth is awesome as a person & as a tax professional. I've been with her the last 3-4 years and I've always been happy with the results I get. She's understanding, compassionate & she's
Very efficient at her job. She explains everything and makes you feel rest assured that your taxes are done properly. She is the ONE to see when you need your taxes done. I recommend her if anyone in NV needs one.
Liz is great. She will go out of her way to help you. Great communication via phone and email. I look forward to filing and getting a fat refund in 2017.

Liz is amazing, I can go on and on and on for her professionalism and personal  touch when she is working with you, but there won't be enough space for it. 
Bottom line, If you are looking for someone with experience and great customer service, you don't need to look further. She is representing my personal nd my business aspects, even sometimes she helps me to take the right steps to financial goals and situations.
Thank you Liz!

We searched long time for somebody who is Real Tax Pro. After first consultation, we knew Lizeth is the one and we stayed with her for years. She had to fix errors from previous tax accountant who did not do good job. She also helped us with complicated stock market taxes, corporate taxes etc. Lizeth saved us thousands of dollars. She has knownlegde that very few tax accountants have. Even dough we recently moved to California, we are definitely staying with her.

Was on my way to visit the Glockmeister and ran across this pawn shop next door.  I decided to drop in to check out what they had and saw that they had a large variety of guns on sale.  They had quite a few AR-15's and around 30 pistols.  Very nice.

The jewelry selection was limited and there was a decent amount of electronics and golf clubs.  It'a an average pawn shop with above average gun selection.

I'll be back the next time I'm in the neighborhood.

Return Factor - 70%

I had an absolutely AWFUL experience with Diana at Henry and Horne. 

I own a business and made the mistake of doing business with this company. Their faults are almost too many to list. At first, when they were trying to get my business, everything seemed great. They asked the right questions and seemed knowledgable on not only nation tax issues, but also international which is very important for my business.

But then came reality, when trying to get a budget on how much services would cost monthly, I was met with such pushback. The idea that an accounting firm couldn't understand why a budget was important and needed is absurd to me. Many many emails back and forth, with multiple people from the company never answering any questions. 

Finally, after they filed for a tax extension (without my knowledge or consent) and sent me a $600 invoice, I decided it was well past the time to move on. The cherry on top: the reasoning they filed for an extension was because "we were busier with larger clients that took priority over you". Literally said that to me and expected me to pay them for overlooking my business in favour of someone who pays more.

So in the middle of a divorce, my wife decides to refile our personal taxes so she can get a refund.  She does this without my knowledge and without my signature, and Henry and Horne processed it for her.  Then I find out they made a mistake on the return and the State of Arizona thinks I owe them a bunch of money.  They eventually fixed the error but after awhile they stopped responding to my questions about the returns they created without my knowledge.  So I would think twice about using these guys, nothing immediately wrong with them, just sort of sloppy and lacking customer service.

I just moved to Las Vegas and needed to switch my State Farm Insurance prior to heading to the DMV to get a new license and registration (which was not quite as painful as one might expect if one times the visit well and brings absolutely everything under the sun in tow).  While still in San Francisco, I picked Matt based on Randy's Yelp review, and so first I wanted to thank Randy because Matt Keim is great.  He got back to me with excellent quotes for car and renter's insurance, explained all the details of my policies, and offered suggestions for what might be better options for me (no one had really taken the time to do that before).  Matt is extremely personable and professional, and a pleasure to have done business with.  Thanks, Matt!

I have had a policy with Matt for over 5 years now for my car. I tried adding my husband to my policy and he had problems with his license and so I told them not to worry about adding him. So without notifying me that my own policy would be cancelled, they terminated it. Since I was on autopay for 5 years, I had no idea until the DMV sent me a fine for lapsed coverage for $500. Matt and his staff gave me the runaround for a few days and refused to admit it was their fault. I kept getting told that they would call me back, and I would have to call back every time. Now I just sent him an email from the same email I have always used to cancel my remaining rental insurance policy (which he had no problems still charging me for) and had the nerve to respond with "who is this?" wow. just wow. That is how you treat a long term client? with zero at fault accidents?? he used to be nice until he screwed me over.  I never get upset over bad service, but this is costing me a lot of unnecessary money. Look elsewhere for an agent who will let you know they are cancelling your policy to avoid fines.

Garrett's office doesn't respond to emails promptly. I didn't feel like he reached out to his customers at all. It just doesn't feel like I have an agent when dealing with this office. I'm switching..

I loved State Farm even before I had Curt Garrett as my agent, but since having them, I feel like the experience is more personal. They always answer their phones quickly and have great customer service. Anytime I have a question, they be sure to explain it to me so I know exactly what is covered. They also communicate with me through email which is fantastic since I do not answer my phone often. Ana and Kelli in the office are very sweet. Plus, they gave me the best rate for car insurance!
Thank you guys for everything!

Curt and his office staff are Great!  I have moved all over the country and have felt with many service companies.  This State Farm agency really cares about me and my needs.  They are friendly, remember me and my family and are there anytime I need them.  When I had an emergency, Curt and his staff acted like I was their only customer and were there to help us all the way through our claim.  I couldn't ask for better service,  State Farm always advertises "Like a good neighbor,State Farm is there"  With Curt Garrett's office, I feel, "Like a good friend, Curt Garrett and his Office staff are there for me and my family when I need them"

If you want peace of mind let these guys take care of you. I had personal and business taxes I was behind on earlier this year. Brian filed my extension, had everything submitted properly, and I received my refund on the expected date! Not only that these guys will continue to answer your questions throughout the year. They clearly pride themselves on building loyalty and not the "Tax season sale." Do yourself a favor check these guys out!

This was truly a great accounting-related experience. I found Brian based off his good yelp reviews, and right away found him to be very kind, and knowledgeable. Coming in, I had a variety of accounting questions which he was easily able to answer for me. When I went in to meet with him, I sat down right across from him as he prepared my taxes, I was pretty well prepared so the process was easy. It was also very cool seeing what he was doing as he was doing it (never saw my accountants do that before). Within about an hour and a half, I had everything done, and taxes ready to go.

All in all, had a great experience, Brian is great to work with and look forward to continue working with him!
We had a somewhat complicated situation, and they handled it with ease. Great communication!

I have been going to Expert Tax & Accounting for 20 + years and have always been more than pleased with the expertise and professionalism from everyone on staff. I guess that's why they are called "Expert" Tax Accounting. I plan on staying with this company for the rest of my career.  Don't hesitate. ..give them a call!
Have used for 10 years  Great job very detailed always get returns right if we forget something it's not a problem they give us time to follow up and get it to them

I want to give a shout out to Brian Skinner and Kathy out front with Expert Tax.  I have been having my taxes done there for the past 14 years.  No question the BEST IN THE EAST VALLEY. 
Bill Salvatore
Arizona Elite Properties
602-999-0952

We had insurance here for over 10 years. Lots of my friends and family members do too and they seem to agree with me. Every time we go Melanie or Maria help us and they really know what they're doing. Their prices are really good and they always try to check if they can help finding something lower. I feel like they take good care of me and I wouldn't go anywhere else regardless of the price. I compared them to other agencies in Phoenix and they are the most fear and I really like that the owners are personally involved in the day by day operation. Thank you Alco!  Mary

Would give this company no stars if I could.  I paid in full my late dues that were owed to my HOA.  Now, Red Rock is saying i didn't pay, and my HOA still has me on hold.    they only take cashiers check, so they can easily lose your payment, I paid with cashiers check and have recepit to prove it, spent 2 hours on the phone with them everyday for the past week and still nothing.

Even after the class action lawsuit; the same business practices persist.

I received a collections letter from them in April (of 2016) for $650 regarding a $289 bill. I called First Service Residential to ask why I didn't receive any of my bills and they said 'Red Rock handles it now'... which is essentially the same company whose President IS THE FORMER PRESIDENT OF RRFS.

So I call Red Rock Financial and they give me dates that the letters were sent out that I didn't receive. I then write them a letter to dispute the charges.. (Who even looks at these charges, First Service? aka the same company?)

I then go out of town on vacation for a month, I get back and I have a new certified letter telling me that there's an intent to lien and that I owe $1079.. so while they were processing my dispute, they were still moving forward with the lien even though I was corresponding with them trying to take care of this situation.. I called them and asked what happened to the dispute and they say 'oh that was denied'... I asked why I wasn't notified and they said they sent me a letter..not received.

I now am on a payment plan with additional charges every month and a $30 installation fee for a $1079 bill... originally $289 

In a time of phone calls, emails, online payment systems, payment over the phone; RRFS corresponds with ticking time bomb snail mail and payment via cashier's checks only... 

It's comically terrible and textbook extortion. Until HOA reform happens in Nevada to put terrible people like this out of business it's going to continue to happen.

Can't wait for an auto reply telling me how committed they are to quality customer care and so on now..

My experience is exactly like everyone else on here who has been ripped off by Redrock Financial Services.  I had about $200 in HOA dues owing.  To make a long story short, the HOA sent my account to collections without proper notice and at the time of this writing the outstanding balance is $1,600 due to Redrock Financial Services, LLC.  That's about $1,400 in fees for about $200 in HOA assessments.  About $500 was tacked on after I informed Redrock that the amount was in dispute and I had an impending appearance scheduled before the HOA board.  Redrock also seems to want to make it as difficult as possible to communicate, i.e., I was required to fax them a letter, email was not acceptable.  Redrock is a foreign entity (registered in Delaware with a manager who lives in Florida).  From a brief search of the internet, it appears that Redrock has a long track record of unethical business practices in Nevada, and one of ripping off Nevada residents.  I will be checking with the Secretary of State's and the Attorney General's offices to see what steps need to be taken to rectify this on behalf of Nevada residents.

Being somewhat new to the area, I had to find someone to help me with taxes and financial advice. I ended up with NewtonCPA and I can't say enough about the service I received !  Matthew showed interest, and listened to everything I told him with my complicated tax situation. I have been 100 % satisfied with this firm. If you're in need of tax or financial advice, give them a call.

NewtonCPA makes what can be a stressful time of year a complete breeze. I never worry for a second about my taxes. I know they will be done promptly and accurately. The online tool allows you to upload all tax documents within seconds and you're done! That is so important if you live on the west coast like I do. It's not just tax season that's important but I can go to them with tax questions throughout the year. They always respond to even the smallest of questions and I'm sure with a smile on their face. Wonderful people and a smart, efficient, trustworthy business. Thank you!

Some businesses need to ask for reviews but others have their clients begging to let them.  I'm so glad these guys have finally given me the chance to brag about how amazing I think they are not only as an accounting firm but as people as well.  I consider Jesse, Kayla and Randy to be dear friends that treat me and my business as if I were one of their own family members.  I'd give them a 6/5 stars if it were possible.

I have worked with Jesse the past 3 years and have never had a bad experience. He is thorough,  responds to emails promptly,  and always answers my questions in detail. Matthew and Kayla are also wonderful and a delight to interact with. The office atmosphere is relaxed yet professional. I used to experience slight anxiety when it came to taxes,  Newton CPA put an end to that.  I will continue to come to them for any accounting needs and refer friends and family to them as well!

I have worked with Matthew for the past few years.  I have always found him to be professional and courteous.  Their prices are reasonable and the service and is always excellent.  Matthew always goes above and beyond every time.
I've used Newton CPA for years and have been very impressed!  I highly recommend - the staff is very knowledgeable and is very responsive to my requests.

I have had nothing but positive experiences with Moe and his staff. As a client that doesnt even live in Las Vegas anymore , he and his staff still makes sure everything I need is done in a timely and professional manner. I would recommend anyone to do business with him

This guy is a scam artist, quoted me a rate, every month it was more then he quoted. I had to call in every month to get it adjusted. After a couple months of this he said he put in the wrong vin number and he couldn't do the original quote, turns out he never could get me the original quote and he was getting it for me by fraudulently altering my account ex that I was married, that I was a home owner etc, when I canceled my policy I got a bill for the difference each month of the money I supposedly saved with his quote but never did, guys a crook stay away from his branch!!!!!

I've used Moe as my agent for auto, life, home, and renter insurance for 12 years and never had a problem. I read the reviews and they just don't align with the experience I've had. Moe always returns my calls right away, emails me the quotes when I ask for them and I've had only a few annual increases ever (mostly auto when there was a big shift company wide several years ago.

Personally I would recommend Moe - he's an agent of a very large company and he doesn't set the rules, he just delivers the message. But for me, he just does it better.

We bought a brand new Forest River from the location in Mesa and was pleased with the sales and service.  We  had it out for the third trip and during this trip noticed a few things that needed to be fixed.  The manager on duty at the Avondale location was not helpful.  He told us we couldnt leave it because there wasnt anybody in service to leave it with in case something was stolen.  Scary to think thats what his concern was.  We offered to lock it up and was still turned away.  
It isnt terribly convenient for us to get it there during their business hours due to where we store the trailer and where we work.  I would suggest taking your trailer somewhere else if you are looking for service.   I am also open to suggestions.

I wish we would have read the reviews on this place! When you buy a new trailer and are promised repairs are to be done you would think that they would be up front with you and tell you approximately how much time this would take. They have had the trailer in their repair facility almost as long as we have had the trailer. Replacing a warped side panel and fixing the scratches on the interior ended up with staples on the walls and screws through to the outside panel. Mind you the sales man we worked with was wonderful but everything since then has been a nightmare. Went in to the store yesterday to check on the status of the repairs as they won't return calls with messages left, to be told by the repair person "well it's useable " seriously this is not what we were promised! If they were upfront about how long things would take they would not have so many upset customers. Just be straight with people!

This review is based on their service department. They were TERRIFIC

We bought a new Dutchman Infinity 3610RL last fall from another dealer. That was our first mistake but it was a discontinued model and we really liked the floorplan and options. We had a couple of warranty issues right off the bat but that is not uncommon (this is not our first RV).
Dutchman wanted us to use the dealer that we bought the unit from (second mistake for not insisting on Camping World for the warranty issue). After the dealer that we bought it from failed to correct the issues after 4 tries that dealer said they would refuse to do any work on it warranty or otherwise. 
Dutchman was shocked and sent us to Camping World in Avondale. We made an appointment and brought it in and 3 days later everything is corrected! They were GREAT to deal with. We had them install a tow package installed on our Chevy Equinox for towing behind our previous Motorhome several years ago also and that was great also.
Who was that dealer we went through hell with prior to our great experience with Camping World of Avondale you ask?
It was Lifestyle RV in Mesa.

We highly recommend Camping World of Avondale!

After going to other Camping World Sale who were very pleasant and honest and helpful just boggles my mind that the camping world in Avondale  is basically run by the people have no moral values I believe they take advantage of the retirees and snowbird again I would never buy anything at that Camping World . And definitely not an RV.
I am still waiting for the content of my fifth wheel to be addressed and fix .
It has almost a year.

Wish I'd read the previous reviews before I came here.  A horrible, frustrating, waste of time experience trying to get our RV water heater replaced.  Parts were screwed up resulting in a week's delay, and I had to actually find the part number for them to reorder the part.  Parts were literally double the price of other sources.  I never received most of the calls they promised and getting information was like pulling teeth.  When the reordered part did finally arrive they failed to schedule my RV in the shop and the SERVICE MANAGER refused to come out and meet with me to discuss the situation.  I waited some time and he never appeared, just kept sending out excuses (the general manager did eventually fix the situation, more or less.)  Took 10 days for a 3 day repair and when we finally got so angry we just left the water heater still did not function.  6 Camping World techs worked on it for 5 hours and couldn't get it working.  (A couple of days later a 1 man repair shop in another town diagnosed it and repaired it in under 5 minutes.)  On the plus side they did provide us with a parking spot in their lot, saving us campground costs.  Unfortunately the promised shore power connection never materialized.  Go ANYWHERE else to get your RV worked on.

Classic bait and switch. Spent an entire afternoon with Debbie the sales lady. Drove all the way to Mesa during rush hour to look at a unit. Was shown the unit and we liked it. Agreed on a purchase price. Signed contract and put up earnest money. Was contacted by Elizabeth the finance lady to set up delivery for Friday and she sent an email which included the final paperwork to sign. I noticed it contained a different vin number than the one I had looked at. Luckily I had taken a picture of the vin while we were at dealership so I could get my insurance started. After bringing up the discrepancy in vin numbers, I was told no less than three times that I had been looking at the wrong number. At this point Jim Johnston became involved. He is the manager. Again, I must be an idiot, because I was told I looked at the wrong number. Turns out I was shown the same unit only four years newer. How was I supposed to know this. I would have looked at the other unit but never heard the magic word. The whole time this was going down it kept somehow being my mistake. The magic word is sorry. This is the straight up definition of bait and switch. Get a person hooked on something then all of a sudden that deal isn't available. Everyone did seem real excited to try and sell me a unit still. Seriously?

Go see josie or eric!my family and I broke down and needed to get to our destination asap usually it takes a week with financing and inspection but josie and eric jumped through hoops as well as Liz our finance girl.this was such a wonderful experience I would recommend anyone thinking of buying an rv to go see these guys we really can't thank them enough.they also made the  out of state delivery happen that day and drove 5 hrs after a long day of work instead of the 11/2 hrs they would usually do just so we didn't have to make our trip any longer.we were really treated like family and we were never once talked in to anything we didn't want or need.THANK YOU SO SO MUCH JOSIE ERIC AND LIZ!!

My used rv trailer purchase was a great experience , My salesman Jay L. made me feel at home and is a hell of a guy. I would send anyone I knew who was in the market for an rv to see Jay.  I bought an expandable trailer as is, it does need some work in the plumbing area of the trailer, but I feel I got it at a price that is fair. They even replaced a couple of tires due to the safety inspection.   So again I think they were very fair  I am happy and the wife is getting happy.  Lol.

Awful. Not friendly. Sold us wrong products. Employees clueless. Not a typical Camping World. If you have the opportunity to visit Mesa or another store, do it and save yourself a lot of headaches and money in returning the wrong merchandise - they recommended. It would be a rating of 0 - but not an option.

Our experience started out good. The salesman was knowledgable and friendly. Unfortunately, our good experience ended there. We bought our brand new camper in May. We took it out that weekend. The gray water tank leaked and the power converter wasn't working correctly. We understand there were going to be some glitches, so we brought it back to CW for diagnosis. They reported they would need to replace both the tank and the converter. Fine. They put it back together as they said it would take a while for the parts to come in. We were fine with that. We stayed at a site with full hook ups anyway. We went out one more time. We received a call asking to bring it back for the replacement parts to be installed the end of June. My husband brought it back and was told the converter was there, but the tank would be in July 11th and it could be picked up on the 13th. He called July 12th and was told the parts person we had been dealing with no longer worked there, so they had no idea what was going on. We then received a call stating the tank would be in on July 26th!!!! 
We now have been making payments on a unit that we can't even use. My husband finally got someone on the phone July 12th and was told he would look into it and call back today (July 15th). No one called. My husband went down there to see what was going on. He told the service manager this was unacceptable that we have had our camper sitting there waiting on parts for this long. His response was, "You and 52 other customers." WTF? Seriously???!!! At this point, I don't even want the stupid thing. Their communication is HORRIBLE. Plus, they are doing NOTHING to make this right. Shame on you, Camping World. For a company that supposedly has their customers' best interests in mind, you are failing miserably. I will be sure to warn others NOT to buy here. I would recommend Little Dealer Little Prices. They might be a bit more expensive, but it's worth avoiding the B.S.

I would not refer anyone to buy an RV from here.
The sales department is awful. I literally walked in, looked at 4 units and put a deposit down. The experience was awful for the easiest sale of their month. They have no knowledge of the campers they are trying to sell. I had to google all the answers to the questions I had. The vin # model does not match the sticker on the camper, but no one seems to caste. The finance department is unresponsive, have to call over and over to get a call back. The delivery process is horrible. They barely told us how to use the brand new RV. Would have been nice to know the ins and outs and all the "extras" you need to buy before taking it off the lot. As a brand new camper, it should include very basic tools to use - or I should have been told I need to buy a black hose, before I got 3 hours away from Phoenix. Was promised that they would order missing pieces (from a brand new camper) that were broken, no response. Uneducated, no answers, clueless ... Please do yourself a favor and buy from another dealer. We wish we would have!

I went to Camping World in Avondale today to have some work done on my travel trailer. Although I had been in their store, and they are generally very friendly,  I was surprised how friendly and accommodating the staff in the service department are. The service advisor that assisted me was Phillip Mayse and he took the time to closely listen to my issues and helped me resolve them. While listening to my issues he realized my travel trailer had another potential safety issue which he later had resolved by technician Derek  Wingate. Derek also was very helpful as he gave me advice as to what to watch for and how to resolve it. Being a relatively new RVer I really appreciated the help and advice. I will definitely return to Camping World and will definitely ask for Phillip.

What an extraordinarily horrible experience.  The trailer purchased in the spring has been in repairs since BEFORE Labor Day!  They have kept the trailer without ordering the parts. The parts are still not ordered as of today. The GM Tom Alexander states he will resolve this issue. He is unwilling to even look at the account while we are in the room with him. Fishy much? We are supposed to hear from him today. I asked for invoices as well and he tried to ignore my request.  There will be follow up postings. 
And by the way, i had to make a rating of one star in order for this to post....they deserve nothing currently.

12/3/14
Update as promised.  Received call back last night as promised by GM. Also received call this a.m. from Service Advisor, Darrell.  They are still "looking into" the issue. Two more weeks for the correct tent fabric, sigh. No up date on side panels, diamond plating and hot water heater issue. Keep in mind people....this trailer only went back to this dealer because of a warped side panel!  Purchased in April 2014,  used ONCE, and it has been back at dealer since. It took a MONTH to get appointment to get it in. And she has been there ever since.  Love paying on something we don't get to use. Love making plans and scheduling time off for hunting when the dealer can't seem to fix one issue and then poor staffing creates many problems. What will the dealer do for us? How will he compensate all the time, money and emotions that have been expended?

I'll make this short. There are many choices in the Phoenix valley to purchase a RV, DON'T go to camping world, read the reviews first. How can the GM of this dealership review his establishment and give himself a five star rating? Seems most of the reviews are either a 5 star or a 1 star, can you guess who the friends and employees are vs the real customers? Something to think about.

Now thst the sale of the RV is done within a month there was no service if call th the service center they would not return ur call  n if u took ur coach  don't expect to get any better we took our coach in on Wednesday n was ot would be ready on Friday on Saturday when we went out to get our coach it was still sitting in the parking after words with the manager he then had the service manager come out and two and half hours later our fixed so thought there were fixing the steps a month later they didn't fix right and the manufacturer had to send us to a different repair shop and the whole step had to be replaced will never use Camping World for any kind of repair work there service people don't care about the customer

we bought our 5th wheel from here and have had nothing but issues, from the loan, so the set up and the service. We even took issues to the corporate office and that took  three calls just to get them to respond.
They blame the warranty company that company blames camping world. We never get straight answers or help now we have another issue and for days no one will answer the phone is service. do yourselves a  favor stay away from this place!

Absolutely worst customer service. From top management to the lower level employees, customer satisfaction is not a priority at Mapfre/Commerce Insurance. Essentially what happened in my situation was they failed to provide a supplement to the repair shop I have been working with, and caused a delay that exceeded my rental car coverage. This resulted in me paying an extra 5 days of rental OUT OF POCKET! I've spoken to numerous people throughout the company and all were unwilling to help. They rarely answer their phone, and have no regard for customer satisfaction. Save yourself the time and money and DO NOT, I repeat, DO NOT purchase their insurance

Worst insurance coverage ever. We are still going through a case and it's been over a year. My car has been sitting in an insurance lot rotting while these morons are supposedly doing work of some sort! If you want reliable insurance go to another company. Do not try or even attempt to get a quote from these suckers. I wish I can give them a 0. There employees all suck! My claim representative is in no way helping me out. I've called numerous amounts of time and no answer not even a call back. I've left manny vociemails nothing was ever responded to. This company is a FRAUD! They are great at taking money and collecting payment, but when it's time for them to do there job, they ignore there customers. Fail company! -9999999 Stars.
Yo recomiendo este lugar  con el agente diego mata llana trabaja conforme a tu necesidad.dios bendiga a personas como el.7027217575. Oficina santos ramirez
I definitely recommend superior insurance! They're great and always have such a friendly staff who's always willing to help out! Great prices too!!!!
Daniel is a pleasure to work with. All my questions were answered promptly and thoroughly. I highly recommend.

"Phone bill about two G's flat / No need to worry, my accountant handles that"

Being self-employed and preferring to have a professional to handle my taxes, I've dealt with my fair share of accountants/bookkeepers.  And by far, Daniel is the best.

He is prompt and accountable (harhar) with his correspondence.  I prefer communicating via email and Daniel usually responds within hours - making sure to address any concerns and clearly shows his excellent tax knowledge and his understanding of my tax situation.  In fact, he made a couple of suggestions to help lessen my tax burden in the future -- things that never occurred to me... and were never brought up previous tax professionals seeming more interested to get your taxes done (sometimes by a subcontractor) and move onto the next client.

Also, it's nice having a tech-savvy accountant in Daniel -- I didn't have to explain why my files 'weren't opening', I didn't need to 'follow-up' and we didn't need to kill a forest with hardcopies of everything.  Most everything was handled over email/cloud storage and we only met to handle some unavoidable paperwork at his Yonge & Eglington office.  In fact, even our meeting was productive as Daniel really took the time to understand my situation.

On top of being thorough and compassionate, his rates are reasonable and fair price for the peace of mind and excellent advice he provided.  This was the first year that I went to Daniel with my taxes and I will definitely be working with him in the future.

It's early in the tax season, yet this location is appointment only. I waited 2 days for an appointment. Upon arrival, I was asked what I was doing there, then made to wait 50 minutes. 

My tax specialist was nice, but is now out of the office for 4 days...and my return hangs in limbo. The problem was that I needed to get the proper RSP slip, which I did within 90 minutes.

So, all told, this will be a 6-day adventure and 3 trips. God forbid I waited until April! Avoid this location at all costs.

I was warmly greeted at the door and the staff was nice enough. But the food here was just terrible. I ordered the Affordable Small Business Tax Return and it just tasted so bland. Not even the bottle of Franks Red Hot I carry in my knapsack everywhere I go could save it. They kicked me out before I could even finish my meal (not that I wanted to finish it). I demanded a refund but they kept telling me I had eaten it and they were calling the police. Bathrooms we're clean tho.

Last year's experience here was great! The accountant was thorough, made sure I understood every step and made sure I saved money in as many places as possible.

Right now I'm standing outside this location. The doors are locked. It's 8:46am. My appointment was scheduled for 8:30am and they're supposed to have opened at 8am. 

Not impressed!!!

They've remodeled got cocky changed the rules and went down hill. Don't go there unless you gave to. Now they phone bomb you. And there website is always down they have zero respect for customers in lots of regards.

Glen, owner of Vantage, is a very detail oriented and caring insurance broker. He's extremely responsive and quick to get back to you with answers. Once when I blew out a tire on the freeway late on a Friday night, he called the towing company for me and then came out to wait with me. He stayed until everything was taken care of. Couldn't ask for a more dedicated person to have on your team.

Glen has done a phenomenal job of performing up front pricing, and always making sure that his customers are his #1 priority. I was referred to Glen through a mutual friend, and told me what I needed to know and not what I wanted to hear. 

I'd highly recommend Glen Netter for any future business to any of my fellow customers/friends.

Jonathun

With several real estate transactions under our belt, my husband and I are rather familiar with the title/escrow process. I must say, this was by far the smoothest, most comfortable and enjoyable experience we have had. From the start to the very finish everyone was so professional and eager to help. They even had a young gal come out to my home for the notary signing and never charged me for the additional service. I'm a fan!

Great experience this morning. Came down here with my fiancé and real estate agent, to sign paperwork for our new home. Friendly receptionist. Temperature controlled room, they even offered water and coffee upon walking in. After we were finnished they had fresh baked cookies on the counter. AMAZING! What a pleasant experience here!

If you're in real estate and are looking for excellent support and resources you need to work with National Title's "Philip Bouchard." He's my go to person for all things real estate, title, and auction.  Their escrow officers are the best too!

Very disorganized company, maybe it's just this location?
If you can get your title else where I recommend it. They argue with people about who they are!, rush you through signing your paperwork, seem put off when you ask a question. I've been through this process a few times and this was the worst. Isn't buying a house suppose to be an exciting and happy event!? Thankfully we had an awesome realtor that helped us over the bumps.

We had to change docs at the last second, and they really hustled to keep it going, and then sent us a scanned copy as well as hard.  Coffee and cookies available at the door for the homeless.  Often you are homeless when u walk in, and a homeowner when u walk out.  Constant very responsive communications were conducted.
After 12 years in real estate. Finally found a company that knows your name. Cares about your business best customer service

Recently purchased a short sale and our realtor used National Title.  What a mistake.  Obviously we purchased title insurance since short sales can be so iffy sometimes.  Well when it came time to disburse the funds they didn't pay off the garbage company lien.  Complete incompetence if you ask me! Now we can't start up our new service with the garbage company until this is resolved (and we're getting farther behind every month that goes by).  When notified of the error, they offered to pay half and we pay half rather than file a claim with their insurance company (or just pay it themselves to avoid a claim!).  If we don't accept that, we were told we could get a lawyer, but that we'd signed the paperwork so it was OUR fault.  Um, yea...the paperwork that YOU prepared for us to sign.  If you omitted the garbage lien from those documents, then you should be willing to fix your mistake...it's what you do...research and prepare title documents!  WHAT!?  I already paid over a $1000 for title insurance!!!  For just this kind of circumstance.  Well, the jokes on them--we'll take their half and pay ours, but then we'll be filing with the state agency that oversees/regulates title companies.  Not to mention letting others know to avoid dealing with them, or at the very least to check and double check that all the liens were listed to be paid off in escrow.  If you're an agent that uses them...maybe think twice about that too.  Even our realtor couldn't get them to do the right thing for us.  Shameful!

I use this bank almost every other day. The workers are beyond amazing. They are always professional and efficient. Life has been rough lately and the kindness from this branch, even when just coming to make my regular cashiers check for rent, made a big difference in my day. I couldn't ask for kinder bankers. Thank you for the continuous outstanding customer service.

$8 to cash a check?! I brought the check here because the Chase Bank account holder who wrote me the check has written me bad checks before. So they charged me $8 to cash one of their own checks?!?!  Come on Chase Bank!  And this was after I waited in line for nearly 10 minutes to get to the teller.  Chase bank will never ever see any of my business.

I adore Chase bank. The ATMs are great. It never fails me but my main focus is how amazing the staff is. I had to handle some business a couple months ago and the man who handled my requests was wonderful. He was helpful and answered every question and concern I may have had. It was a great experience for me. I don't remember his name but I wish I did so that I could give him the proper praise he deserves. The atmosphere is beautiful as well. This location is very new and lavish. Its very appealing to the eye. This particular establishment is the best!

Visit on 12/30/16 at around 2pm.
Staff at this location is poorly trained. Going to the bank should never be comparable to the DMV and this one was worse than that.
The bank was busy during our visit and they only had one person at the window. Makes no sense. So after a 30 min wait once we get to the window, we are told an additional step needs to be completed (took 30 secs), fine. What is not fine, is being told that we cannot go back to the window when done and would have to stand in line all over again.
I have never been to a business, whether it's a bank, or a post office, EVEN the DMV when you are told to go to the end of the line when you are ask to complete something additional. 
So after another 30 minute wait, another employee (finally opened a second window) confirmed that sending customers at the back of the line after they've already been on line is their regular practice. 
So, if you enjoy standing in line twice, totaling an hour for a simple transaction, this is the bank for you.

I used Leftwich Law to file bankruptcy 3 years ago.  This year, one of the creditors that was discharged in the filing tried to claim they "forgave" my debt, and told the IRS that it was income for me.  I was looking at well over a $1300 IRS bill.  I couldn't find my discharge, and called the Law office.  Mr. Leftwich personally found my paperwork, emailed it to me promptly, making it relatively painless to deal with this issue.  Thanks, Mr. Leftwich!  You've made my life easier twice now!  I highly recommend this firm for any legal needs.

My husband and I contracted this office to help with a bankruptcy.  The experience with Charles was undulating, tending toward negative.

We first met him a few years back when he was at his own office somewhere in uptown.  His services are clearly popular, because there were a lot of people waiting to see him.  The office was organized and well-staffed, which was a good first impression.  However, what was disconcerting was the receptionist at the time.  Her desk was in the open, which meant that when she took calls from customers who were asking questions, you could hear the details of the discussions.  I have never worked with a bankruptcy attorney before, but I would think, for confidentiality purposes, these are discussions you would have away from the general public.

We actually never got to meet Charles, because I think he had paralegals handling the filing.  That's who we worked with.  Overall, the impression was more positive than negative, so we were pleased.

Due to several family issues, we couldn't start the bankruptcy until a year later.  We had made the necessary payments, minus the filing fee.  So we didn't see him until sometime later to move forward.  He had moved to his own office in a nice part of town; his office was very nice, much nicer than his last.  Unfortunately, this is when our experiences took a nosedive.

He worked with us to complete the paperwork, but I found this process to be unnecessarily complicated.  On one occasion, he forgot to have us sign a form, so we had to travel down to the office to complete something that could have been handled with the other documents.

Where the relationship took a steeper nosedive was when it came to following up with him if we had questions about the bankruptcy.  He was an incredibly difficult person to get in contact with.  We would leave multiple messages for him, and it would take him up to a week to return the call.  My thought was that he could have sent a text message or e-mail, or he could have left a quick voice mail letting us know that he got our messages and would get back in contact with us at some point in the future.  No, it was a waiting game with him.  This was certainly a point of frustration with him and his services.

What was jarring was what happened next.  When we got to our meeting of the creditors, we were in the waiting room and noticed that the attorneys for everyone else who was waiting were showing up and rehearsing the meeting to calm noticeable jitters and make the process easy for both the clients and court.  This was a professional approach.  Five minutes before we were all supposed to go into the court, Charles still had not shown up.  My husband called him and, shockingly, reached him on the phone.  We confirmed that he was still coming, and his response flabbergasting:

HE HAD FORGOTTEN OUR MEETING WAS THAT DAY; HE THOUGHT IT WAS THE FOLLOWING WEEK!

He said he would "speed" down to the court after he gathered our paperwork.  Thirty minutes later, he walked in.  Thank goodness we were penultimate in our meeting, because had we been first, we got the impression that the judge would have rescheduled us, which would have been a problem, considering it was hard enough for my husband to take time off work.

When he did show up, he handled himself professionally and answered all the questions that were asked.

Fast-forward two  months to December.  We took a call from a creditor who was supposed to be included in the bankruptcy, and it was from that creditor that we were told that our bankruptcy case had been dismissed!  We called the courts to determine the reason for the dismissal, and we were told that a particular form had not been filed even though the courts sent out multiple notifications to Charles that the form was needed.  We called Charles, and, of course, he returned our call after three or four days.  He stated that he had filed the form and wasn't sure why the courts never got it.  Frankly, I didn't believe him.  Considering the courts stated that they sent multiple notifications to have the form completed, one would think that Charles would have responded to at least one of those requests.
