Not trustworthy at all.  I was supposed to meet one of their sales people at a scheduled time, and I ended up waiting for them for almost half an hour at the front door, I should have just left, but I was trying to be nice.

First off, they wanted to know how much I was willing to pay per month, which wasn't a big deal, but every-time I gave him a number,  he disappeared for 20 minutes and came back with a ridiculous quote.  Then, he told me that if I wasn't going to put down $7,000 then I wouldn't be able to buy a new car.  Which was fine, because I currently own a car from 2012, and I was just browsing, and really didn't need a new car.

But before I left, they tried to get me to buy an older corolla, which don't get me wrong, Corolla's are the best cars on the road, but I'm not going to trade in my 2012 VW for an older model car.  While I wasn't impressed with this idea, I did let him try to sell me on it, and when he showed me the car, I looked up the stock number on my phone, and discovered it was $1,000 more than what was on the website.  Of course he lied and said it was a better deal because he wasn't charging me the $1,295 "reconditioning fee".

When I left, I was so glad I hadn't made the mistake of falling for their lies and schemes.  

Overall, save your time and money and go to Autonation Toyota on Sahara, they have been the most helpful by far, and offered me a fantastic deal on a 2014 corolla for way less than Centennial with a much better down payment, and better terms.

If I could rate this 0 stars I would. I had an oil change appointment at 2:30p.

Ricardo Ascencio was the one who helped me with the process. While I was asking him about the cost etc. of the oil change Tom Blemings kept interrupting with his cocky attitude with his own questions. What happened to customer service? So instead of being helped, I had to listen to their conversation for 5minutes. Lack of customer service & lack of courtesy.

On top of that they lied to me numerous times! I asked if my car was almost ready at 3:30p. He said it would ready soon. 2 minutes before that I saw my car being pulled into the service station. I don't like to make assumptions and have them the benefit of the doubt thinking maybe it was just the same model as my car. Well it was my car because I confirmed the license plate. LIARS! I asked him why my car was just now going into the service garage. He looked flustered and said it would be ready soon. Very incompetent people here. They don't know how to manage their people, they don't have people skills, and they don't have manners. If you have a Lexus, don't go here. That was my mistake. I see a huge difference in how luxury car employees are way more professional.

Look I can understand that people get busy. I wouldn't have minded if they told be it would take longer than an hour because I could've went home and had my husband drop me off. But instead, they kept lying to me about when my car would be ready. 

I am not going here again. The customer service is horrible. The people I dealt with have absolutely no people skills, they are rude, and sleezy. 

To reiterate, my appointment for an oil change was at 2:30p, I was out of there at 4:20p. Ridiculous.

I only gave these guys one star cause I had to rate it otherwise this dealership deserves NO STARS! BS is what I get every single time I go there and even after they promised to make it better it still was a bunch of crap. Talked to Ellis who lied and sd he was in the Internet dept cause he wanted a sale and knew I only wanted to deal with Internet dept then prior to that I had bought a car from them and silvino reyes (finance) took forever to close the deal. I went back to sell my car to them because Peter Cornish promised to make things better and still it was nothing but BS!  Don't go to this dealership. I sold my car to fletcher Jones toyota who made it a wonderful experience for me. Thank God I never have to deal with centennial toyota ever again!

Took my vehicle in for warranty on a tire.  The service person told me after 4 hours that the claim was denied.  I, then, take my vehicle to an independent tire place to do the replacement.  I contacted the warranty place and am told that the claim was NOT denied, and that they just did not receive the information needed to place the claim.  After much hassle, and driving around town, I was finally able to get the warranty people to agree to reimburse me for the cost of the tire.  That does not, however, reimburse me for the day (7:30am - 5:00pm) trying to straighten the situation out.  Very disappointed in the service.  I will never buy a Toyota again.

I have had 2 bad experiences with this Toyota dealership.  One on the sales side and one on the repair side.

I have been in the market for a new Toyota truck...I went here since I saw the car I wanted and was ready to make a purchase...the salesmen was alright and after finally getting down to the terms that I was happy with the "closer" which was one of the sales manager came out and basically killed the deal with his rudeness and terrible "closing" skills.  I walked out and decided that a car wasn't worth that effort.

My wife owns a 4Runner and a received a warranty recall notice in the mail for a dashboard defect.  I take the car in to have the additional recall done and had to inquire about the specific dashboard one.  Well we get the call to tell us the car is ready...I asked about the dashboard and was told we "slashed" the dashboard (don't even get me started on the accusations this dealership states with no just cause) ...interesting since I googled the complaints that started the recall and was in the exact same place and length as mine.  I guess all Toyota 4Runner owners "slash" there dashboards.  The warranty recall even states that it can split for any reason.  Apparently this dealership didn't read that portion.  Furthermore since we complained they took pictures and said that a "regional" manager would look at it...we waited 5 days for a call back and nothing (not shocked by the way).  We called to inquire at the progress and was told...no we haven't heard anything but you should find another dealership for your business.  Actually the last part was the best advice we were given.  And your right our business and future car buying/repair will be with another dealership along with all my friends and family I will tell about my experience.  

Oh and just to let you guys know who have repair done there...the time quoted is never right, and they have at least 5 guys standing and watching parked cars instead of servicing.  

Tomorrow Toyota will also be hearing my complaint.

I cant thank Doug Chen and Robert Lane enough for the hard work they put into my deal! We recently had a very bad experience with Towbin Dodge, we returned the car and that dealership destroyed my husbands credit!
Doug was very professional,informative and most importantly not pushy! He worked hard to find the car I wanted. After our horrific experience with Dodge, Robert went above and beyond to get us financed as our credit dropped because of Dodge!
In the end it all worked out and they got us the deal we needed to make the purchase! 
I AM ONE HAPPY LADY WITH MY CAMRY XLE!!!!!
If you are in the market for a car I highly recomend Doug! Tell him SuzieQ sent you! I'm sure they will make you feel appreciated for bringing them your business!!!
TY Doug and Robert!!!!!!
SuzieQ

We did not purchase our family vehicle at this location, but ever since we bought our 2012 Sienna I have used the service department.

Today, was no exception. We didn't have an appointment, nor did we call ahead. Just showed up, they asked when we would like the car back and they said it would be ready.

Every service has been completed on time and with suggestions of additional services and accurate estimates provided.. Love the honesty, friendly staff and the speedy service.

We will continue to use Centennial Toyota.

Went here to trade in my car. I'm very low income and they got me an awesome deal for financing. I'll be recommending this place to friends in the future. From the time I arrived, and test drove the vehicle to signing the papers was also very short. Make sure you ask for Jay Gentry. He helped me tremendously.

I took my 2014 Prius to Centennial Toyota for service because after I bought it at Auto Nation Toyota, I vowed never to return there or give them another penny of my money. I have been treated with respect at Centennial. My phone calls are answered and appointments made  with no problem. The waiting room experience is wonderful with specialty coffees and donuts while you wait, surfing on your phone with the free WiFi. If the service is going to take longer than an hour, I will take advantage of their free shuttle service. The drivers have been friendly and call to give me an estimate of when they will be there to pick me up. Next year, I plan on visiting Centennial first for a new car. I hope their sales staff is as respectful and honest as their service staff.

I come here to get my oil changed usually. The service worker guys in black shirts are usually not very good with communicating with you. I have had more than a couple of occasions  where I'm just standing there and not knowing exactly what I'm supposed to do. I didn't know where my car keys were after I was told my oil changed was finished at one time. Although the Filipino black shirt service dude is awesome. I usually ask for him when I go there 'cause he doesn't pressure me into buying things in an annoying way, he gives me great info, and gives me exactly what I need without the BS. Other guys here are kind of terrible at communication. 

This old Middle Eastern employee inside kept trying to hit on me and tried to sell me a car while I was inside looking at the new cars. I was not in the mood to be fake nice in this situation, and plus I was with my senior mother. I was just walking around 'cause I got bored while my oil was being changed, but he kept following me!

Anyways, the cashier women and front desk woman are very nice and usually know what to do, so if those guys out there are being idiots, just go to one of them and they will get things going for you.

Just bought a Scion here and I'd like to thank Daisy for being very patient with me, answering all of the questions I had and also showing me all the features in my new car. She really went above and beyond to make sure my experience was great. I'd recommend her to anyone looking to buy a car.

If you are into being scammed and treated like dirt, buy your car here!!  
My wife and I ordered a 2014 Highlander LE Plus to be built exactly to our liking at another downtown dealership.  We live in the Centennial Hills area so we thought we would just take a look to compare.  Of course, dealerships are good at getting you to go in and sit down to have a "chat".  We told them our situation and they couldn't compete with our pre-ordered vehicle because they don't have any LE Plus models on their lot.  The manager then said that they want us to walk out with a Limited edition.  We told them that it is outside of our budge as their available inventory was well above $40k.  They told us to name them a price and after some hesitation, we did.  It was a low one, and we told them that we know its a low one simply because we didnt want to exceed our budget.  We were ok not getting the Limited as we were excited about our LE Plus that was soon arriving.  They went back to the GM who approved the deal.  We have told them our plans to trade in my wife's old car, including our owing balance.  They also came back and said, no problem... they will do it.  So we were excited.  We wanted to go back the next day with money and all but our sales guy said he was off so we went back Friday (2 days after the deal was made).  We go Friday with a cashiers check and cash to pay for the vehicle planning maybe an hour tops for paperwork.  We sit there for over two hours, waiting for the documents to come so we can sign and drive off.  Then sales guy comes back saying that the same GM, who approved and lured us into spending over our budget, is now over the phone saying that he can't sell it to us at that price.  Got Joe, the floor manager involved.  He tried to do the typical car salesman buttering up but that doesnt fly with me.  So all he said to me was "we dont even have to sell you this car at all!".  They said they won't take our trade-in either and that we have to pay more for the vehicle.  Long story short, because we needed a bigger car, we paid their proposed higher price anyway.  But during the entire process, even the finance manager, who chimed in annoyingly, was very condescending.  They treated us like we just robbed them and took advantage of them... like we were scums... when really they were pulling something shady last minute.  Since then, the only person kind enough and cared enough was Debbie, the customer relations manager, who has been wonderful... however, there are limitations to what she could assist with.  None of the higher management is concerned enough or have the courtesy to call me back to discuss the situation.  
Lastly, our title has been sent to the wrong place TWICE... and still at this point (over two momths after the purchase) we dont know if that issue has been corrected by the dealership yet.  It was a piece of paper our bank provided to give to the dealership, with all very clearly stated instructions and address to send the title.  Somehow it is done incorrectly twice, and counting. 

So yes, if you want this kind of first-class service and this kind of hassle-free experience, buy your cars to your hearts content here!

Unorganized. Made an appointment knew the advisors name and I have never been here before so how would I guess the right name ? Made a huge ordeal and I came first thing in the morning at 7 am and they put me behind all the appointments even though I had one OH AND this one lady said I don't deal with certain mileages  and passed me to the next guy lmao. Sure come for the doughnuts and drinks that's it lol

Car sales staff are great. The service department on the otherhand, not so much.
It took them 3.5 hours to change the oil and rotate the tires. Most of the time my truck was sitting on the rack with no one around. I watched. They had it parked right in front of the window. I dont care how short handed you are, if I have an appointment that was to take 1.5 hours, why am I leaving 3.5 hours later?

I actually had a great experience with the service department here a week back. Took my daughters Avalon in for service and a recall on the airbag. They were super nice called to confirm the appointment, offered a ride, finished the repairs quickly and accurately. Easy to deal with and seemed genuine in their customer care.
My mom and I bought a car here from Mike G! He's a great salesperson!!!

We went there to browse vehicles and as soon as we decided we didn't want to make a purchase the service changed. They were stalling to return the key for our potential trade-in. I entered their showroom and asked for the key and they continued to stall. The manager then approached me and I said I simply wanted my key to go home. He then stated that there was "something wrong with people today" and shoved the key to me. He walked away with an attitude and when I told him he was rude, he responded saying that I was rude. I do not comprehend how someone that lacks customer service skills can function in a workplace where customer service is essential. This is one of the worst experiences I've ever had in a dealer and will never go there even if it was the last Toyota dealer left.

Centennial Toyota normally provides pretty decent service. They love to "up-sale " so be on the look out for that. If you require to get an oil change it will be quite pricey. They will charge you anywhere from $80 to $600. A basic oil change will run you about 80 dollars. Nevertheless, they have an oil change called a peace of mind that will cost you over $600 dollars (up-sale). They suggest you get this service whenever you reach a mileage marker  (15,000/30,000/60,000) etc...However, the service people are very kind.

Walked in with my family and surprisingly the vultures completely ignored us. Even the receptionist just glanced in my direction without so much as a hello. Ever been to a dealership and all the cars in the showroom are locked???? That's right. We couldn't sit in a single vehicle to check it out. Again receptionist and a 'finance mgr, saw us trying to look at a new vehicle but no one came to offer help. Pretty pathetic visit to a new car dealership. Only as we were outside going back to my car did a salesperson ask us if we needed help. I just snickered and walked away.

This place is a joke. I made an appointment to have my car in for its very first service since purchasing it AT Centennial Toyota. When I arrived for my appointment I was told that they were too busy to help me and that I needed to come back another day and offered to schedule an appointment for 2 days later. This was unacceptable as I have to work on this day and could only be in on the day for which I scheduled my original appointment (isn't that the point of making an appointment in advance?) Completely unreliable and unacceptable service it makes me question my overall choice of choosing Centenntial Toyota and will definitely not buy from here again. Thanks for wasting my time. I am taking my car elsewhere to get serviced.

I recently bought a car at Centennial Toyota from salesman DYLAN SHUAIB. I was nervous at first for obvious reasons: the rating were either really great or really terrible, it's a car dealership, and this was my first experience buying a car. 

I was amazed by the surprisingly honest and service-oriented team that sold me my car (Dylan Shuaib-salesman, Randy Brooks- sales manager, Russell Shan- Service Advisor, and Scott - finance guy). Did I mention they all gave me their cell numbers? 

They spent hours with me finding the perfect car and deal to fit my tight student budget. I am so beyond happy that I bought this car and even a week later any time I have any concerns, the above team is ready and quick to help me/answer all of my ridiculous new car owner questions. 

Overall, I would recommend this dealership to my grandma, neighbors, friends etc. I am really pleased with all of these fine gentleman.

Service department took me on a Saturday morning, even though I didn't have an appointment.  Took care of my care problems and got me out by lunchtime.  While waiting, got free coffee, donuts, and internet use.  Much nicer than any other Toyota dealership I've ever been to either in Las Vegas or Los Angeles.  had the parts I needed for the repairs.  Price was also very reasonable.

Stopped by after seeing a commercial for 0% financing on Camry models.  I wanted to check out the Camry Hybrid and met salesman Raul in the parking lot.  Normally, I avoid sales guys like the plague when I'm "window shopping" cars, but I couldn't find the damn Camry Hybrids, so I caved and asked for help.  

Raul was very nice and I told him up front I'm not buying today.....he was cool with that and walked me around the main lot and rear lot to show me the various models of Camry.  Many of the cars were in the back lot, with only a few in the front.  Why do they do this?  It's very inconvenient to walk to the back.....I guess it forces you to talk to a salesperson......damn slimy car dealers.  Why do I always feel like I'm about to get screwed when I visit a car dealer?  I consider myself pretty good at negotiating a deal and always carry my HP 12c financial calculator when dealing with them.....but I still feel like I get screwed over.

Anyway, I test drove a few of the models and was very impressed with the Camry Hybrid....it has a lot more power/speed than I was expecting.  I guess I was expecting golf cart performance.....but it was much more powerful than that.  I left without making a purchase, but the experience was pretty good.  I was never pressured to buy.  Thanks Raul for great service.....if I decide to buy a car here, I will give the sale to him.

Return Factor - 60%

This place tries hard to win your loyalty.  Free coffee and donuts, a decent waiting area, and on-the-outside friendliness.  However, each time I bring my car here to be serviced, I end up waiting for at least 3 hours, despite having an appointment.  Definitely bring reading material, paperwork, SOMETHING to use your time productively.  I don't know if I'd recommend this place if you don't have a Toyota, but since I want to take care of my vehicle and have all my mechanical records in one place should I want to sell my vehicle, I'll keep coming here each time my "go to car doctor" light comes on in my Toyota.  :)
Awesome service (thanks Eddie!), nice waiting area, and very informative on everything. We have since brought both of our Toyotas here for routine and needed maintenance and it's been great.

This place is an unbelievable NIGHTMARE. There's a reason car dealerships and salesmen have such a HORRIBLE reputation for thievery, manipulation and dishonesty. Try buying a car from this place and you'll discover WHY. Centennial Toyota is the perfect textbook study of scummy, crooked car dealerships. How these people conduct themselves in their business borders on CRIMINAL. Oh, they'll pretend they care, but it's ALL a LIE designed to draw you in. They don't give a SHIT about YOU: their only objective is FORCING you to buy the car THEY want; and, they ABUSE you as a customer throughout the ENTIRE process. I know, because what I experienced here firsthand was one of the most HORRIBLE customer experiences I have ever had with any business anywhere.

Walked onto their lot at 5:30pm and was greeted immediately by a salesman named Irwin (Irwin later confided he only had one month experience selling cars). Told him I was looking for a used car that would seat more than 5 people and that $15,000 was my absolute TOP limit to spend. We spent a few minutes talking specifics and found only ONE car, a 2010 Toyota Highlander, that came even close to my requirements. The Highlander had a $18,999 price painted in BIG letters on the windshield. I test drove this car with Irwin and it drove well, but I told him it was TOO MUCH MONEY for my budget. I told him numerous times I couldn't AFFORD it. He informed me that this car was priced slightly higher because it was a "Certified, pre-owned," Toyota. I found this strange, because there was a HUGE, DEEP key scratch across the ENTIRE driver's side of the car. There was also a bent and crumpled rear wheel well liner, a broken CD player flashing an ERROR signal and other conspicuous signs of damage and wear on the car.  A "certified, pre-owned" car with SO MANY obvious problems? Really?

Instead of being HONEST and admitting there were currently no used cars in inventory that matched my criteria, Irwin dishonestly lead me to believe they would bring the price of the car down into my $15,000 range. That was a flat-out LIE that subjected me to the next three hours of the most stressful, brutal sales beatdown I have ever experienced anywhere. He just wasn't going to let me get away. They threw EVERYTHING they had at me. They pushed me to commit to buying the car before they would give me a final price. They repeatedly asked me how much I would be willing to pay in order to buy, then IGNORED my answers. They INSISTED I needed to buy THAT night before I could leave the dealership. WTF? They brought in extra sales people and mangers to the table to tag team and pile on me. They used GUILT ("Buy the car, because you're wasting our time!"). They used FEAR (that car will be sold by tomorrow). For their opening offer, they showed me a piece of paper with a $23,799 price crossed out and $18,999 written in below. Apparently, even though $18,999 was painted on the WINDSHIELD, they told me that the car was really $23,799 and they were giving me an exceptional DEAL at $18,999.  Wow! Such a "deal." DIRTBAGS. They refused to let me HOLD or KEEP anything in writing they presented to me. DIRTBAGS.

After about two hours of this I started getting angry, but they still wouldn't let me leave. I even TOLD them I was getting angry...numerous times. They DIDNT care, they just kept working to wear me down. I finally got completely disgusted and walked out. Irwin ran after me in the parking lot, where I had a heated exchange with him. He ended up throwing a business card at me and yelling, "F___ YOU! I don't want your business anyway!" I turned around and stormed back in and went to the service desk to talk to the sales manger. I told him what had just happened and he looked at me like I had three heads. In an smirky, smart-ass, condescending tone of voice he said, "So WHAT? What do you want me to do? Fire this salesman? Would that make you happy? Why would I do that? You're the only person here who has a problem." They talk and act like they're selling timeshares. They don't CARE. They operate on a business model where they make the customer WRONG and humiliate you if you resist their manipulation. DIRTBAGS.

That night, I went online to autotrader and found that EXACT, SAME Highlander I had driven at Centennial Toyota. Centennial had it priced online for $16,999. Holy POS business practices, Batman!  DIRTBAGS! The final insult came a few days later. Obviously forgetting who I was or what had happened, Irwin called me and left a VM on my cellphone, addressing me by the wrong first name and told me he now had a nice used 2010 Toyota Highlander on the lot for only $19,000 and that I should "drop by and check it out." It was the SAME car. I kid you NOT.

Hey, Centennial Toyota, I'm going to repost this review on NUMEROUS social media review sites. I'm also going to send it UPLINE to CORPORATE at Toyota. Feel the LUV, you WORTHLESS MFs! You DESERVE whatever you get! BUYER BEWARE.

I went in the other day just to look around for something newer to drive, Peter Nguyen was my salesman and he was awesome. I wanted to look at some Camry's and he helped me find the exact one I was looking for, not to mention the great deal I got on it. Peter and Tim made everything super easy and I'm more than satisfied with the service!

I am very dissatisfied with the quality of work.  This dealership misdiagnosed my vehicle problem and put my family at risk.  

While on a road trip from Phoenix, Arizona to Salem Oregon, the air conditioning in my 2007 Tundra goes warm.  I diverted to Las Vegas and went to the service drive at this dealership at 6:30am the following morning.  The technicians waited almost two hours for the A/C to fail, finally it does and they assume the amplifier switch needs to be replaced under the dash.  This is a $700 job and of course, the part needs to be ordered in.  Another day in the hotel.  The next day, its installed and I'm on the road again.  Before I am even out of Las Vegas, the A/C fails again in the exact manner as previously.  I immediately call the dealer, very upset as I am having to drive across the hottest desert, at the hottest day, on July 31st. I am very upset and informed the dealer I was.  I had my wife and two babies in the backseat.  A 1-mth, and a 17-mth old. 

As we are driving through the Mojave desert at 117 degrees with two young children in the backseat, the service advisor, Tom Bleming, calls me back and apologies and says his Service Manager Gerry is behind me 100% and to get to a Toyota dealer as soon as I arrive in Salem.  I did so and sent Tom an email informing him that I dropped the vehicle off at Capitol Toyota.  In the first few minutes at Capitol Toyota, they diagnosed the problem by checking the A/C system with their charging station (duh!) and saw that its pressure was 250lbs when normal is 150lbs.  They immediately suspected the expansion valve was plugged.  They removed it and saw black slime on it which came from the compressor.  Compressor replaced, $3000 job and very satisfied A/C is running perfectly.  Why couldn't Centennial Toyota do the same?  You would think a Las Vegas dealership knows something about air conditioning?  

During this whole process, I am emailing Tom Bleming at Centennial Toyota.  I sent him several emails and he never responded once.  I finally called and left a message with all details and he never called me back.  

Finally, I write this review.  I am angry for the incompetent work, I am angry for ignoring me.  I purchased this truck brand new from Centennial and this is how they treat their customers.  I will never go back and will continue with leaving negative reviews on both Google and Yelp so that others may be aware of the shotty work they can receive at this dealership.  I'm also considering filing a complaint with the BBB.

PLEASE READ!!! 
This place doesn't even deserve a star... 
I bought a 2014 Toyota 4Runner about 3 weeks ago, a Friday. I notice something was wrong with car when I test drove it (exhaust issues)... I didn't want to purchase it until it was fixed, however I was told I should by the salesmen (who RUSHED ME). Because I am gullible, I went ahead and purchased it. Wednesday was the day they SUPPOSEDLY fixed it. And in the state of Nevada, once you purchase a vehicle, it is yours. Of course the next day I drove it and it still sounded shitty. And not only that, but the brakes were squeaking. I just purchased this vehicle. I complained and COMPLAINED about it and wanted my car that I traded in back and of course that didn't happen. They insisted to fix it or I had the choice to trade it in for another one that would cost me over 850.00/monthly. If I was gonna pay that much I'd go somewhere else. And because this place and the sales people are ridiculous, I waited for my green slip, 3 weeks later, and I took my business elsewhere. FINDLAY TOYOTA helped resolve this problem and I happily purchased a 2015 Toyota 4Runner. I wish I went to FINDLAY TOYOTA first because my experience at Centennial was a complete NIGHTMARE!!! Purchasing a car is a big deal. People at Centennial Toyota are so RUDE and don't care about YOUR NEEDS. They have very bad customer service!!! If you're looking for a new car... PLEASE CONSIDER ELSEWHERE. My experience at FINDLAY TOYOTA was amazing and I'm happy that I ended up going to them. They are so good with their customers and focus on you. Just upset that I went to Centennial Toyota. My biggest mistake was going to Centennial Toyota. Don't let it be yours!!!

Zero stars for this place!!  Very unprofessional to say the least. Would recommend to never go here ever. They don't give a shit about helping you with exactly what you want. As I was leaving two of the salesmen outside were making some disgusting gestures behind my mothers back. This place is beyond a nightmare. I ended up going to Findlay Kia and walked away with a brand new car with exactly the price I wanted and they treated me great.
I never feel I have to complain or share a bad experience but this one was the worst. Don't go to this dealership!

I purchased a Toyota Camry Hybrid at Centennial Toyota in August 2011.  First of all I was happy with the purchase experience and felt as though the online pricing/sales was above board and honest.  I was more concerned when I was "handed over" to financing and told to watch for hidden fees.  Seriously?  I was actually called back and offered a better deal within 48 hours if I could put down an additional amount on the car, also.  So much for having a good sales experience.  
On to the service department (which is why I'm actually writing this review tonight).  I was told when I purchased the car that I didn't need an oil change for another 10k miles (due to it being a hybrid) but the mechanics set the sensors to go off at 4,000 like a regular gas model.  I went into the shop and instead of the 39.00 oil change that I was quoted over the phone I was charged 69.00.  Afterward I was called to pick up the vehicle and told that a nail was in my tire and it would have to be replaced for another 189.00.  Who has heard of a Camry tire running 189.00?  I told them I couldn't do it right then and promised to come back next week.  Wow.  I won't be going back to that dealership EVER again.

I have been using Centennial Toyota's service department since they opened. I love Greg Allen. He is my first pick for service people and always does great. He never suggests anything that isn't needed and is always fun to deal with. The only thing that I have had go wrong there was they once accidentally changed the transmission fluid in my Highlander, but they didn't charge me for it so it was actually a great favor to me. Service is always great and they don't have your car for too long. I don't know what the previous reviewer had happen there, but I can't say I have ever had an experience like that. I have referred all of my friends and family to them and no one has ever had an issue. I won't take my car anywhere else.

Jay Gentry and the team at Centennial Toyota blew us away with the awesome experience and deal we got.  We are customers for life.   Well done.   

Tommy and Dee Mihalko
I have bought three cars from here And all three times they've really helped us. Slade is the best, he's very helpful and is super friendly. If you need a car, go with Slade, you'll be satisfied.

Unscrupulous business practices and questionable ethics at Centennial Toyota********

On or around, April 11th, 2016, I expressed interest in purchasing a 2015 CPO Prius stock # 00460545. The business manager contacted me on the phone and requested a deposit of $100 via credit card to secure the vehicle. I provided my credit card # and was repeatedly assured that the vehicle would be set aside while I travel from Los Angeles (LA) to Las Vegas (LV)  to purchase it the next day.

I then proceeded to rent a one way rental from Burbank, got a cashier's check and started to drive to LV.  As I was halfway towards LV, I decided to call and inform the Sales Person Ron Shirley that I would be arriving at 6 PM.  Much to utter disappointment, Ron casually mentioned that the "vehicle has been sold."  When inquiring what was the point to place a deposit if the car was to be sold in an unscrupulous manner, he seemingly mocked and commented that "stuff happens."

I have since contacted the General Manager, Anthony Woods explaining the matter in detail.  I was assured the deposit and expenses incurred (rental, gas) would be reimbursed the next day.  Almost a week later, I have yet to have the charges refunded.  I have since disputed the charge with my credit card.  I also plan to pursue a civil claim should the matter not be resolved favorably at the earliest. 

I would stay away from this dealership as they are unprofessional, dishonest and unethical.  Rather than customer service, the entire apparatus is geared towards fleecing a customer.  You can read my detailed report on YP, Google, BBB, Dealer Rater.

This review is for both Centennial Toyota and salesperson, Elton Rosas. First let me establish my credentials. I am a retired detective lieutenant from a major eastern city. I am skeptical, unbelieving  anytime the human element and money are involved. We (my wife and myself ) came to know of Centennial Toyota through TrueCar.com. Not all Toyota dealers participate. The basis of TrueCar  is transparency and the elimination of the game playing auto dealers are known to do with pricing.Utilizing Kelly Blue Book for invoice price and the MSRP on all available accessories for the RAV4 and in conjunction with TrueCar.com we had in print the total price of the car with the specific accessories we wanted and the standard delivery charges in writing and agreed upon before we ever left our house to drive from St. George, Utah to Las Vegas. I am not prone to give compliments but the following is well deserved.
Our salesman, Elton Rosas was fantastic! Right from the start he dealt with my flurry of questions and obvious disbelief in a professional but friendly manner. I was looking for the hidden costs, the up-charging on accessories, the last minute add ons and those things that dealers state they have no control over, it never happened. Everything he stated, everything we wanted, everything agreed to, everything in writing  occurred exactly in that manner. We drove to Centennial to complete the paper work , down payment, the ordering of the car in person. In addition to assuring us we would receive the rebate from Toyota, other dealers would not, everything went exactly as Elton Rosas stated. The different extended warranty plans were presented to us but we were never high pressured. Elton kept us informed as the car we wanted was located and the options were being installed in "port" and when the dealer would take delivery and install the other options we selected. In addition to keeping us informed I had numerous questions on the process which Elton explained in detail. When coming to pick up our new RAV4  Elton was there to greet us and stood by patiently while I examined every inch of the exterior and put the car up on the lift ( my request ) 
for me to examine the under carriage without hesitation. Then we finalized the paperwork and payment. He went on to explain to my wife all the features and nuances of her Ruby Red RAV4. The amount of time from the first phone call to when we drove away from the  dealership Elton gave us is beyond calculation. The service, the patience and professionalism he exemplified I have never seen in a salesperson anywhere! Least you think we overpaid for the car, we did not. TrueCar shows you the low, high and middle amount being paid for the car within the last 30 days. We paid between the low and middle price, $2300.00 less than 
the dealer in St. George Utah AND received window tinting and vin related window etching... Right from the start I was waiting for the deception, game playing, fight to start and the "other shoe to drop", it never happened. Did I mention the car was spotless AND a full tank of gas. Elton as a representative of Centennial Toyota was perfect and professional, words I do not use often!  Was Centennial and Elton Rosas this way because of how I am or is this their way of doing business. My educated observation and experienced evaluation indicates to me  our problem free new car purchase is the standard operating policy of Centennial Toyota and their staff. Great dealership with fantastic personnel !

My car buying experience with ELDON BROWN was amazing  I went into centennial Toyota on two occasions the first time I knew I needed a new car but wasn't sure what I wanted ELDON walked me to the 2014 Toyota corolla and I fell in love it was perfect for me and my 2 year old son. The second time I visited the lot ELDON helped me again but this day I drove off the lot with my brand new corolla. ELDON was amazing this was a no pressure buy and he got me an out of this world deal on my car. I will always buy and recommend Toyota and Eldon to any one who is looking for a car

Don't go to this location.  I am a total fanatic about keeping my car clean and am very aware of any scratches, dents and what have you to the paint of my car.  I had a service done there due to a recall.  When I had the car returned to me there was two spots on my hood where it looked like some chemical was dropped and it ate through most of my paint.  Of course when I confronted them the same day they denied it was there fault.  I called Toyota and they opened a claim and when it was inspected of course they said it wasnt them.  I know it was because I walked my car before I left it there and walked it again when I picked it up.  Now I have two spots that I have to fix and pay out of my own pocket.  I have even talked to other mechanics and painters who both say the same thing...a chemical was dropped on my hood. BEWARE!!!

Dylan Shuaib is professional and his service was on point. From pulling up to Toyota until the end of our sales. He didn't pressure us or ignore us and he answered all our questions. Thank you Dylan we appreciate your honesty and appreciate the  awesome service.
STILL waiting for my refund. It's only been 3 months. I literally got a "checks in the mail" line.no

Es menos 5 estrellas cuidado con la gente mayor por quede aprovechan tengo un conocido que adquirio un carro Nuevo no le quisieron bajar el precio no lo ayudaron para nada no por que lo Pago en efectivo  el senior esta mayor solo se lo enchorizaron es poreso lo de menos estrellas creo que con lo extra bien me huviera traido un usado con lo que pago este viejito

I've purchased three vehicles from this dealership now and I've been extremely satisfied with their service.  Sales has never been pushy and have always been open to negotiating prices down to fit my needs.  I live across town but even after my warranty has ran out, I will still drive up here to get my car serviced because of the trust and professionalism I can expect to receive -good job Centennial Toyota, keep treating your customers well and we will continue coming back to you!

I took my Rav 4 in to have my brakes checked because they were squeaking. I left my car there all day only to be told on picking it up," There is nothing wrong with the car, 2 mechanics checked it out bla, bla, bla. They even denied hearing the squeaking noise!
   2 months later, took my car to a private shop to have a tire repaired and they told me my brakes at 1% in the Red zone and that I needed to have them replaced immediately!
The service department at centennial does not like to change your brakes even if they are squeaking. Be aware when you go to this dealership to replace brakes,they will avoid replacing them at all costs! Get a second opinion and go back and DEMAND that they do the work!! Especially if they are under warranty.

I brought my 14 Tundra here for its first oil change a few days ago.  Overall a pleasant experience, especially considering I did not make an appointment.  I was greeted by a service writer within a few seconds. He explained what service was included with my Toyota Care program (synthetic oil change and tire rotation).  The waiting area at this dealership is very nice and includes a vending area with FREE cookies, computers with internet access and a smaller room with ESPN on a TV.   There is ample seating, wifi and plenty of magazines to read.   The parts department has a nice selection of accessories and I passed some of the time browsing in there.

The service to my truck took about 90 minutes, which was fine considering I did not make an appointment. 

I did not buy the truck at Centennial so I cannot speak to their sales practices but I will be returning for service again.

Update:  Had another oil change on 11/22/2014 and the experience was better than the first time.  They had the truck done within about 30 minutes.  My service advisor - Doug Falla - was great to work with.  Updated to 5 stars for the service department only.

Update: Had another oil change and some recalls done on May 22, 2015. The experience this time was not quite as smooth.   I mentioned to the service writer, Ed, that the truck is making a "knocking" sound on cold starts.  A few hours later I got a call that the truck was done and was advised they were unable to duplicate the knocking sound.   I expressed some frustration that of course they did not hear the sound as the engine was warm.   They agreed to keep the vehicle overnight so they could try to duplicate the sound in the morning.   I did not receive a call the next morning to let me know the vehicle was done so around noon I called.  Ed was on vacation and I got shuffled around a bit before someone was able to look up the status of my truck.  They were not able to duplicate the knocking sound (which I understand - it is an intermittent issue).  I had my wife drop me off a few minutes later and, once again, got passed around a bit because no one seemed to know where my keys were.  Kind of strange that there was not one person assigned to be Ed's backup but finally after about 15 minutes the cashier was able to secure my keys and send me on my way.  

I'm not lowering my star rating, yet.  Still happy with the overall speed of service at Centennial.

Terrible! Made an appointment to bring my 2011 Prius for mandatory 15000 mile service. It took over 2 hours for them to check the fluids and rotate the tires. This place has consistently slow service. Would not return if I didn't have to get mandatory service. 

They get one star for having free cappuccinos and one star for the not discourteous staff.

Scratch, Match & Win.

After receiving a letter from Toyota with a scratch card saying that I won a $50 Visa gift card, I was hesitant to waste anytime investigating. However, after calling the dealership they assured me it was legit.

I was told to pick up my price the next day which I did. After being welcomed and waiting for salesmen who quickly asked me what I drove and if I was interested in a new car, I said no and that I was just there to pick up my price. Minutes after a salesman saw the piece of paper and going somewhere to ask what to do, he came back with a Target gift card saying"here is a gift card". I shop at Target so not being a Visa card did not bother me as I left.

I called to check the balance of the card, $5 and 0 cents. I bought my car elsewhere but do take my vehicle for servicing here. Will I come back for any business after they lied and wasted my time assuring me I won $50 Visa gift card? No thanks.

Honesty is not part of their business, SKIP THEM!

This place has disappointed me so much, we tried to make a deal ... All I got was no worries so I didn't ... Well after reviewing my contract they added 3 extra months when I told them specifically how many months I wanted , then I tell the salesmen what is this... He's like well I told you ... No he didn't he discussed this with his manager not me! But it was his word against mine! I'm so upset I'm now responsible for an crazy payment and 75 months. They are crooked and don't care about the customer they just want a sale and money. I called several times to the manger no call back !!! They lost my business of ever buying from them again ! Be care and read the fine print because what they say and what they do are two different things !!!!

About three years ago I leased out my 2011 Venza from Toyota in Wa. My wife had it serviced at this place the past three years while I was stationed in Japan. I recently bought out my lease a few days ago. I must say the experience from the maintenance and sales dept has been truly great one. I would encourage all service members to visit this dealership if they are planning on buying a vehicle or having it serviced. Ask for a gentlemen named Rocky or Randy an they will assist you...cheers!!

We try to avoid this dealership at all costs... We've tried to give this dealership a go MANY different times thinking maybe they've changed but each time we leave kicking ourselves and vowing never to go back. Trying to leave the lot without buying a car is by far the worst.... manager after manager will come to talk you into a car, even after saying "Toyota doesn't offer the options we are looking for in a second car", another manager came and stood behind our car so we couldn't back up. The most recent was this past weekend- we own a Toyota Matrix (with lots of miles, but its paid off so we'll keep it around until it dies) and took it in for a warranty issue, we were told they would order the part and to come back Monday morning... giant waste of time since that is something they could've done over the phone. We called Monday morning and was told "part is here", show up Monday afternoon and guess what... no part, but OF COURSE tried to sell us another car. 

PLEASE PLEASE PLEASE AVOID THIS DEALERSHIP AT ALL COSTS.

For a company that prides their selves on customer service, they should be more ashamed. They basically told me they sell their "certified used vehicles" with used batteries and don't know how old! As long as the battery works they'll stuff it in your car and say its certified. My battery died a year and a couple months from my purchase and I look on the battery that says 84month warranty. I call and make sure I would be covered, make an appointment, and drive all the way down there. Upon my arrival, Chuck says the battery is not only NOT covered, but it would cost $160 to replace. Essentially, they sold me a car with a half dead battery and then when it died, they said it wasn't their problem. How are you going to sell a car with a used battery on its last leg and then not replace it when it dies? Your warranties and service are crap! I cannot wait to trade in this POS Corolla and rid myself of the entire Toyota brand. They do not care about customer service whatsoever. I even asked the director if he thinks its ethical to sell cars with batteries like that not knowing they are almost dead and then NOT replacing the crap battery a couple of months later. He paused and started giving me the runaround again about the warranties, coverage, and regulations. All I can say is AVOID THIS PLACE AT ALL COSTS! They will tell you everything you want to hear when buying the car and say all these cool things you'll be covered for and when it comes down to it, its all lies. You're covered, but only for a certain amount of time, miles, and they throw so many different stipulations at you, you don't even know exactly what's covered and what isn't after the whole ordeal. Did I mention everything in their service center is 30-40% overpriced?! How they ever get good customer service scores is beyond me.

I am banking with bank of america  for 5 years and i trust bank of america,I have been at this banking center for at least 10 times for past couple months.every employee in this banking center are very nice and helpful. Lou and Greg have been helped me a lot for the past two months. especially LOU,I cant tell you how nice she is,and how much I thankful her .

You heard of "Buyer Beware". If you are the seller of a property and your Buyer is using Victorian Finance for the mortgage, BEWARE! Even though I was presented with a pre-approval letter from the Buyer/Victorian which stated it was based on 2 out of the 3 credit reporting agencies, my Buyer was not able to quality for the loan based on their credit. When I asked Victorian why they would issue such a letter, they responded that it was based on what the Buyer told them their credit "should" be due to the fact that there were errors on the report. I then waited for months while Victorian tried to straighten out their credit. In the end, the Buyer chose to terminate the agreement since they could not qualify for financing.

Absolutely the worst experience I have ever dealt with. As I sit at this moment filling out closing paperwork, 

I asked for a check list of everything I needed at the beginning. Never received such list. And they misplace paper work to distract and confuse you. And I'm getting back no where near the amount I was supposed to after my deposit and sellers assist I lost out in another 1000+ dollars.

They also made my fiancé cancel a dispute with the credit agencies, which would have cleared by the end of the closing time costing us another $400.

When further investigated the account we paid was paid in 2009. 

Lois is a pain to deal with and Ernie just didn't have the numbers right. All and all I was rushed to hang drywall to hurry and close and that was a month ago.... So I got ripped off for that job as well another 320 down the toilet. 

I would highly recommend going to your bank and abound these people at all cost!

Our home purchase in the summer of 2013 posed some unique challenges given the extended close time, 90 days, and general volatility of interest rates throughout the summer. Victorian Finance was not helpful in helping us navigate these challenges and added substantial anxiety to the home buying process.

We had an offer accepted to purchase a home in early June with closing to occur in late August. We were working with a realtor from Coldwell Banker. Coldwell Banker refers clients with financing needs to Victorian Finance. We decided to go through Victorian Finance even though we liked our mortgage broker when we purchased our first home because we thought it would be beneficial to our agent who we really liked.

Given the extended close we were not able to lock in a rate right away. Since this is standard practice this was understandable. Even though we couldn't lock in Victorian wanted to get started on the documentation required for the mortgage which we provided and confirmed with Victorian they had received it.

The problems began 6 weeks later when we had to prove our financial viability to the seller. Our contact at Victorian was on vacation and his associates were unable to locate our documentation so we had to re-send everything. It's summer people are on vacation it happens.

What I felt was egregious was that instead of taking responsibility for the oversight Victorian communicated to the sellers that we had not bothered to provide the documentation needed to obtain a mortgage. This was especially problematic for us because this gave the sellers the chance to back out of the sale and this was a possibility because they were having some challenges in closing the sale on the house they were buying. This would have been a devastating outcome for our family because we had sold our home with a traditional 60 day close and had already moved and were temporarily living with a relative.

Luckily things worked out and we were able to proceed with the process of buying the house. The next problem occurred when we tried to lock in a lower rate when it became available. We immediately locked in our mortgage when the opportunity arose 60 days before our close. We had the opportunity to re-lock once if interest rates moved in our favor. A few weeks before the close rates moved down and we decided to execute the option to re-lock.

When we contacted our representative to facilitate this we received notification he was on vacation again. Shouldn't have been problem anyone could help us with this. Unfortunately our representative's colleague who attempted to assist us misunderstood the parameters of our mortgage and told us we could not re-lock. By the time our representative was back from vacation and things were sorted out we had missed the opportunity to lock at the lowest rate possible. This is going to cost us $30 a month for 30 years or over $10,000 in total.

The final issue was relatively minor. As I mentioned we provided documentation first thing when we started the process of buying a mortgage. Well it turns out all of the documentation was out of date by the time we had to close so we had to re-send everything. Given Victorian was unable to located the documents when they were initially required this was a frustrating turn of events for us.

My rating is 2 stars because we did get a mortgage in the end and were able to move into our new house. Given the challenges of dealing with Victorian though I would not use them in the future and would not recommend them.

Convenient location (closest intersection: Jones and Spring Mountain). 1 ATM in the front, possibly 2 in the drive thru area in the back (never used before).

The one time I had to go in to deposit a check and pull out extra cash for rent, the line was not too long and moved quickly (think it was a Wednesday around noon) . Staff was pleasant to interact with, just the way they were trained to do by corporate or the branch manager.

Plenty of parking spaces whenever I am here.  So I would say this is a good branch for customers that mainly utilizes ATM to conduct their WF transactions, with the occasional in-branch visit.

Getting out of the parking lot to head North on Jones can be a pain, if you are there during peak traffic hours.  In which case try to use the center turning lane, and Frogger your way over as needed. Just be careful of north-bound vehicles that want to turn left onto Spring Mountain Rd.  Don't want no real life Game Over head on collision or hassles with insurance companies and Five-Os.

4 stars.

Be safe!  Peace in the South China Sea.

This review is long overdue, but just can't forget the bad experience I had here!

I had $200 in cash. What I wanted was $100 to go toward my credit card and to exchange the other $100 bill for $20s. Sounds simple enough, right? Apparently not! The teller (wish I remembered her name) took the first $100 bill, processed the payment and printed out the receipt. Then, another employee comes up to her and asks if she saw a cashier's check "lying around somewhere." She looks around her area and tells him no. Then she takes my other $100 bill, puts it in her drawer and asks "is there anything else I can help you with?"
Me: "Ummm, I'm waiting for my $20 bills for the other $100 bill I gave you...."
Her: "Didn't you only give me a $100?"
Me: "No, I gave you two $100 bills."
Her: "Did you really?"

So she calls her manager over and tells her what happened. Then she said "I got distracted because ______ interrupted me and asked me a question." The manager tells her to count her drawer. Just great. So I have to stand there waiting for another 10 minutes because she didn't do her job. BS I tell you! When she was done, she laughed and said "Oh, you were right." Duh!! Seriously, WTF?!?! If you can't multi-task and/or pay attention to what you customers are giving you, maybe you SHOULD NOT be a teller?!?!

I did complain to Wells Fargo over the phone about the incident, but who knows if that even did anything. Ugh....never again!

This branch is awful.
I'd rather be in line at the DMV!!!
Service slow.
A man is yelling at a teller.
A women is yelling at a personal banker.
Can't seem to resolve my issue.

Scott made all my credit issues disappear and was simple and clear to deal with always. I didn't have any serious problem but I had several issues on my credit report that could not get off that had been cleared up by me so i was very frustrated and scott looked at all my paper work and said he could help and for a very reasonable fee. Dennis Z.

Desert shores insurance was very very helpful getting a great price on my insurance, couldn't have had better service!

Gloria Johnson is the real fake. She was dismissed from her job as a result of accusations of fraud and forgery of contracts. This is a newish branch of TD Canada Trust located in Maple Leaf Square.  It's pretty small but has a nice open feel. We recently visited the AAA office to pick up maps at the check-in counter. We were in and out of the facility in less than two minutes! This is par for the course for AAA. That is why I have been a member for 34 years. Thank you.

I was afraid that I was too late to prepay my car rental in France-only a week before. I was assured I could still prepay and Kim was very helpful because Kate was busy with another client. My European adventure will be smooth thanks to AAA!!

Just went there for an International Drivers License. Called 3 times before I showed up trying to find out what all I needed to bring. They never answered. Other than that, everything was great.   Of course I could not find my AAA card but no problem. They looked me up, loaded me up with road maps and information, and explained their free services. We will be back to this friendly office again.

It's the place I go to for travel. Just booked my 4th cruise through them and always have hte best experience!

The nice lady, Amber, was so awesome. She greeted me and helped me open a checking account. I never had this experience at my previous bank. I got checks printed, new card, and  her service was awesome. I'm glad that I switched to Mountain America.

I have never done a yelp review before so this is my first one because thats how horrible this plavr is...I would give this place -100 stars if i could..  the first time I went the teller was super rude threw my ID and pay check stub back at me and made me thow away the little stub garbage!!
