This issue is with Liberty Mutual Homeowners insurance and local claims agents based in AZ but with a regional office in Westminster, CA. Once we get a resolution we are pulling our business due to a lack of trust and horrible customer service.

On the front of our home we have a decorative column. It is not structural or weight bearing but in October we noticed that it had shifted several inches and was leaning with some damage to the top and bottom stucco base.

The slope of the roof tends to delver rain runoff onto the base so the assumption was that settling or water damage - or both - had contributed to the shifting of the column. Concerned that there could be further shifting - and because my wife and I are not familiar with what could have caused the damage or if there was a possibility of the column shifting further and "falling off" - I called our insurance company.

I placed a call to Liberty Mutual to introduce this concern and they initiated the claims process. Mark, the local Scottsdale Liberty Mutual claims agent, visited the property.

His first thought was water damage - something not covered by insurance. However, he decided to have a structural engineer take a look at the internal structure of the base which would require the stripping of the stucco and removal of the column in order to see what was going on inside. The Liberty Mutual agent and the structural engineer both assured me that this was investigative and that the stucco would be replaced.

At no time during this process did I commit to making repairs. We put in the claim in order to see what the issue was and what would be covered or not covered.  Our claims agent stated that he needed to get inside the structure to look inside and confirm his thoughts.

In January we received the Liberty Mutual report stating that the damage was indeed caused by water and would not be covered, just like Mark thought before his teams took the column down and ripped out the stucco at the top and bottom of the support where the column once was.

I followed up with Mark about the report and to find out when they would be out to repair the stucco, as the internal framework of the already damaged base had been subjected to additional rain storms, now with no protection. The front of the house has 3 ugly pieces of wood standing where the column once was and there is no stucco where there once was stucco.

Mark became defensive and said that "I have no intention of fixing anything" - note his use of I as if it is his money. He continued on saying that he did us a favor by having the teams take the column down and get into the structure.

I countered by repeating what he and the structural engineer said about repairing the stucco that they tore out when Liberty Mutual insisted on looking inside of the structure. He said that he never said any such thing and that it is up to us to repair it and move on.
I ended the call at that point. A few days later I called into the Liberty Mutual main line and asked that my complaint about this treatment be noted on the account, and that I needed to speak with Mark's boss. The lady I spoke with took the information down and tried to reach Jim Smith, who apparently runs the local/regional claims office. She made a note for him to call me back. 

Several business days later I called again. Same conversation. I provided a new phone number as well. Still no call from Jim.

A week later I called again. Same conversation. I stated my unhappiness and that I would be pulling my business once this matter was settled. Still no call from Jim.

What bothers me the most is that I called Liberty Mutual because there was a potential issue. We at no time stated that we planned on making imminent repairs but they felt that filing the claim would allow us to learn what the problem was, if it was covered, and then sort out the best way to proceed.

The claims agent could have just said water damage - not covered - and we would have been able to proceed with repairs on our timeline, based on when we'd have the funds and availability to do so.

However, they insisted on digging into the house for a diagnosis that they already had in mind and now refuse to fix the mess that they made. If they did this for investigative reasons then they should repair the damage once they saw what they needed to, or they should have been crystal clear with us that once the stucco was stripped and the column removed that we'd be on our own from there.

When you take your car in for a diagnosis the mechanic doesn't rip out all the parts, tell you the problem, and then force you to pay to fix it. No - they investigate and tell you what the problem is before taking all the pieces out.

This company is mostly very good.  They have decent pricing for insurance on investment properties.  In eight years with them for up to nine properties, I have only had one claim, and they handled very quickly, no hesitation.  My main complaint with them is that their bills don't say which property it is for.  So if you only have one property, no problem.  But if you have several properties, you have to dig up and look up the policy number in all the paperwork and see what property it is for.  I have contacted them several times over the years, and they agree it can be improved, but they haven't done it yet.  Maybe this review will push them to do it, finally.  But overall, I'm happy with them.

In 2016 I contacted Liberty Mutual Insurance for a rate quote. 
They were very quick to offer a great rate for my needs. 
In 2017 my rates went up almost 30% across the board. The old bait and switch and I fell for it. Please beware of this! It was not this paticular agent but the company as a whole may be deceitful.
If it is too good to be true than it probably is!!

I have been a client for 1 year now. Recently my Pitbull had his second ACL tear in the last 10 months. We are so happy with Healthy Paws Pet Ins. that I am posting my first Yelp review. After emailing the bill to them we were cut a check in two days! The process is so easy too. I can not say enough great things about this company. They even sent me an email checking up on my dog. I would only wish that my personal insurance worked this quickly and efficiently. Thank you Healthy Paws for keeping my pet healthy!!! :)

Make no mistake about it... Healthy Paws is not a charitable organization. When it comes down to it they are a business first and foremost and if your pet doesn't meet their starting specifications then you are out of luck.

In January 2014 I rescued a Savannah Cat from a terminally ill lady who could no longer care for her. My cat had been through two homes at this point and was not taken care of. I took her in and had a few thousand dollars worth of work done to her out of my own pocket (mainly, teeth all removed and antibiotics). I then applied for insurance through Healthy Paws to which I was accepted ( as they will always accept you as you pay up front and then they will accept/deny your claim later). I took her in for infection and breathing and Healthy Paws denied my claim outright. They even denied the claim for ruptured anal glands. 

They said that everything was a "pre-existing condition" and thus denied it all.

For granted, I am not a doctor/vet but I feel like everything could and would have been called pre-existing just for the sake of denying my claim. After all, she was neglected by the prior owners and even when in my care she needed medical care. For me to bring her to the vet for care, then months later apply for insurance, and then go back in probably did seem like me trying to scam them.

I understand their denial in part but I still find it unfortunate that one cannot rescue an animal who has been neglected and get a helping hand to try to make the animal at peace. It is not like I had the animal for 8yrs and suddenly problems set in and then I went "oh shit, I better get someone to help me pay for this." I rescued a sick cat and needed help. I even emailed them before applying and told them my situation. Still to them all was pre-existing.

I paid almost $4k caring for my cat but in the end she need more care than I could afford. This story ends as sad as it can - she needed extensive care and even that care was not guaranteed to completely fix her (she may have suffered brain damage). So in the end I did as much as I could an opted for euthanasia.

If you read the reviews of pet insurance you will notice a trend - people bought insurance long ago and probably never had any issues. After paying $25-$50 a month for nothing for 8 years sure, the insurance would pitch in. It is much like an extended warranty - the sellers hope that you never cash in. The same is true of Healthy Paws - if you buy from them and (in their opinion) think it is too soon or if they can link it to something earlier... then they will deny you.

They aren't charitable in that way.

Beware.

Really excellent customer service! Everyone was super friendly, and the woman who helped me (Heidi) was really great. This chase has been the best one I've been to yet! Unlike all the other ones where I would be waiting for almost 30 minutes for someone to even notice I'm sitting there.. Plus you just get a good vibe coming in here. Went in there with the questions I had, and left satisfied with the answers I received. Definitely gonna be my go to place whenever I need to handle anything with my chase account.

Let me start off and say I was a loyal customer for years! I got a ticket in January 2014, and went to Craig Kenny and associates lawyers and got it reduced to a parking ticket, no points on my license & paid the $300. All finished right? No it wasn't because I tried to continually pay my car insurance for 4-5 months afterwords and couldn't figure out why my payments were not going through. I called the office but they didn't answer it just rang off the hook. Time went by and I tried to pay a double payment the following month the website wouldn't work and I couldn't understand why I went through 4-5 months of this hell & by the 5th month the website said I had no account with them however the direct debit (LIFE INSURANCE) was still taking out money from my account, so that statement surprised me. I knew I was late because the website wasn't working and I had placed unanswered calls each month. Basically THEY dropped me with no notification!!!!! No phone call, no letter, no E-mail. I got the ticket on January 9th. They dropped me January 10th with no notification! That should be illegal. They had no problem keeping my life insurance though and taking that money each month though. That's the thanks I get after YEARS of being a loyal  customer. I thought Heather Spencer, the head agent played nice but when I got a E-mail of lies saying they informed me when I was dropped, I knew she wasn't in the business of honesty.
Amercan Family Insurance saved me $145 a month on my car insurance by switching from Farmers! Lena, my agent is super sweet and was very helpful with the whole process!
Horrible service. Usually 30-45 minutes just to make a quick deposit with the lines. Typically only 1-2 tellers as well and no drive thru.
Small bank with long lines,sometimes you can See people waiting in line when you pull up. B of A should hire more tellers.
What can i say...its a bank.  I like BofA because of it's ease of access.  I can find one everywhere.  People are always freindly and they give me my money when I need it.

5 pm today (Friday) and a long line with 2 tellers that worked through it super quickly! 

HOWEVER not quickly enough before each of us were approached by an employee called a RELATIONSHIP banker who speaks to each customer 1 by 1 in line about why they are in the bank today. This location is small with tile flooring. Vanessa (I think was her name) was really nice, but this was extremely intrusive. She asked questions in a loud perky voice, and as a result everyone in line could hear your personal business. Her job is to make sure you know that there is an atm outside and online banking, and tries to shorten the line by sending customers to use these resources. And she tries to make it personal by asking personal questions. Bank of America this is extremely inappropriate. The lady in front of me (after I regretfully and awkwardly answered about 10 questions out loud, going into my method for paying rent and the fact that I'm moving and where and why etc) finally told her she thought this was weird and didn't feel comfortable explaining her business for everyone to hear. Why didn't I think of that? Ugh. 

The 5 of us in line proceeded to discuss how odd and uncomfortable the whole experience with that was. No offense to Vanessa, but it was extremely offensive to us. I still feel uncomfortable.

Solid workers, good location and they make sure everything goes smoothly and all is well. I would say that the 1st and 15th are the busiest at not oly this branch but every branch so look out for that if it's near the 1st or the fifteenth.

A-Ok describes this branch perfectly. I usually have a decent experience with friendly employees and a fairly short wait time. This is the only branch I know that has a drive-thru option. I suppose it's convenient for a lot of people.

Sadly, SSSCU closed down the only 2 locations that were truly convenient and close to me. Now I'm forced to go to this branch. It's easily a 15 minute drive minimum to get here simply to make a payment or deposit a check. I used to be able to just go around the corner to Albertsons. The staff there was much more personable and the wait was nonexistant. I suppose that's why they had to close?

Either way, driving here sort of makes going to the bank a chore and something I don't enjoy doing. Since they don't go out of their way to make it more pleasant, I'm not going to say I'm a fan. ;)

First, their customer service is TOP NOTCH! I received a call from Visa Fraud Prevention about sketchy purchases made on my Visa Debit card. I hadn't even noticed anything was wrong yet--they were so on top of it! THEN one charge was for a Groupon. Nicole called me, then waited on hold with me while Groupon figured it all out to get me a refund. Nicole was fantastic. I have been a customer for 21 years, and I will likely be a customer for life!

Slow service, the branch manger who is an older blonde lady with glasses is very rude.
If it wasn't for member rep Keri I would have given this place a zero. The branch manager could learn how to treat customer from her member reps. There were about 7 people in line and 2 tellers. HAd to wait forever to get service in lobby from a banker though

This credit union is amazing!!! There is never a long wait and the tellers here are amazing! Especially Nicole. She is very upbeat and always has a smile on her face. She is my go to teller from now on! Its also nice that we share the same name! I highly recommend this credit union!!! Everyone go open an account with SSSCU you wont regret it!

I have had the worst luck with real estate agents in the past. Until Sean that is!  I am starting to invest in real estate and really needed some guidance and someone to explain the process without being pushy or acting like I was wasting their time. Sean never acted like I was wasting his time or annoying him by asking to see multiple properties. He is also one of the most honest real estate agents I have ever met which is what I love most about him and why I will always buy properties through him going forward. He points out things I need to be aware of and he asks questions I never knew I should ask. Sean you are amazing! Thank you for your time and your guidance every step of the way.

Sean is honestly a dream to work with. I have not only worked once, but twice with him. He helped me in finding my condo AND my boyfriend and I in finding our house! It is refreshing to work with someone in real estate who isn't just trying to make a sale but truly wants you to be happy with your decision. Sean listened to our criteria and concerns to find the perfect home that fit our wants and price range. He never pushed us to consider a place we didn't like or tell us that we won't find something better (I've heard this happens way too often!!!). With our difficult schedules, he was flexible and able to work with us when WE were available. To top it off, he worked to find the true value of our home that it actually appraised at, so we didn't have to over pay and put more money down up front. Basically, Sean is pretty awesome and probably the best choice you could make if you're looking to buy or rent in Las Vegas.

I was referred to Sean from a guest of mine from work. I was just calling to ask some questions about new and resale homes. Sean always picked up the phone or called back very quickly to answer my questions. It's nice to see a friendly realtor who cares about helping people. I have had a few run ins with other realtors that have that  "if you are not ready to buy a house don't bother me". I get we all need to pay our bills but taking care of people will help your business out in the long run. After a few discussions I have house in escrow. Sean has done a great job. Real good honest guy. I will be referring him!!!

Sean Bob was the best. He helped us find a rental in no time. He listened to what we were looking for, and managed to find every available place that fit the bill.
He is super friendly, and his witty banter helps make the viewing property process less annoying and awkward. At the end, he helped us rate our top choices and decide the one we really wanted. 
He didn't stop at that though, he then helped us through the paperwork and applications, even sending me screen shots of how to fill out each form. 
He is truly committed to helping people find the best place for them, and he does it in a way that makes you feel comfortable and positive that you made the right choice.

Sean was great to work with.  He is knowledgeable and was willing to work around my schedule to show me homes that I wanted to see.  Sean was willing to go the extra mile to make sure I was getting what I was looking for when buying my home.  He has many resources at his disposal and though he may not always have all of the answers right away, he will find them and get back to you very quickly.  I couldn't ask for a better experience.  I highly recommend Sean to anyone looking to buy a home in Las Vegas.

I have worked closely with Sean Bob for the last few months. He is a great realtor and so easy going which makes my job as an escrow officer that much easier! Every transaction we close together is just smooth sailing and never tense! I appreciate how on top of things he is but not too smothering either :) Stellar guy! I hope I get the chance to close out more transactions with him!

YOU ROCK DUDE!

Sean made the buying process not only easy but fun! He was available whenever I needed him, always returned texts or phone calls very quickly, and was kind and friendly the entire time. We moved here from across the country and knew very few people, Sean took the time to show us around and make us feel welcome to the city of Las Vegas. GREAT realtor and GREAT guy overall!!
Very helpful and friendly staff, Ulysess is always nice to me and considerate. High interest but it was worth it, as I had a medical issue

I am a real estate professional and have been using The Lending Company as the primary lender for my buyers since 2005. Every single one of the loans has not only closed successfully but has closed on time! In many cases they have closed them early. There are always issues and challenges that pop up for every buyer but TLC always helps to quickly get it resolved and back on track. I would never EVER consider using another lender for my buyers!

The professionals at The Lending Company were wonderful to work with. My husband and I just finished refinancing our house with Andrew and Mary L. and they made the process quick and easy. Mary was wonderful to work with and communicated during every step of the process - she was detail oriented, incredibly responsive, professional and a great pleasure to work with. TLC was working hard for us and got our loan completed and closed earlier than we expected - even though it was during the holidays. Through their knowledge and expertise they were able to help us find an even better loan than we originally thought. I would recommend them to anyone needing a mortgage or refinance.
If you like wasting your time trying to refinance a loan, this is your place. The mortgage consultants are worthless and have no clue what it takes to close a loan.
Great office , great staff very helpful , I'm happy with everything over all , Allstate is by far the best insurance company I have dealt with yet ,

Jason and his staff are an excellent choice if you are looking for a good agent. I have been with Jason for 6 years now and have always been pleased with the service and their willingness to take the time to answer my questions thoroughly.
This location is fine for normal banking. If you need a banker it always takes forever. I just walked out because they wanted me to wait 25 mins to send my wire.

Worst Bank of America! Came here today to get something notarized. I was the only other customer besides two who were already with a teller. There were two other employees on the side having a side conversation. When the first customer left, I went up to the window and the lady told me her computer just went down. All I wanted to was ask a question, but she told me to get back in line and wait until the next teller was done. Well, after waiting for another 5 minutes, the next teller (a man) was done, and I said I wanted to get a document notarized. His response, "I'm sorry, but you'll have to ask the two over there." The "two" (a lady and a man) he meant were the other two employees who were having a side conversation. Well, I went up to the lady and she told me Philip was the only one certified to notarized and apparently NOW he is with a customer. Of course, after spending 20 minutes there I'm not going to wait. I rather drive to another B of A branch tomorrow to get speedier and better service.

Bank of Wasting My Time is what their name should be changed to. I recently opened an account online with Bank of America. After nearly completing the application, my computer timed out. I didn't want to resubmit the application and have my credit pulled again, so I called their online technical support to see if they could verify that my account application had been received. But due to their crappy system restrictions, I was told that I would need to wait three hours before they could tell me if the application had been completed or not. 

The following day, I received an email stating that my account application had been approved, and documentation would be sent to me that I would need to return. I don't live at the physical address provided (in the process of moving), and they wouldn't accept a PO BOX, so I wasn't able to pick up the paperwork until about a week later. 

Going through all of the mail items (5 separate pieces of mail!), I found the signature card letter, debit card, debit card instructions, debit card pin number, and then a letter stating that the entire account had been closed. 

I called customer service to find out why the account had been closed, and the girl on the phone (who sounded like she had marbles in her mouth and was incapable of properly reading the script that was no-doubt right in front of her) told me that the account was in the process of being closed and nothing could be done. I asked why the account was being closed, and she told me that it was due to suspicious activity. I asked her to tell me what the suspicious activity was, considering I hadn't even signed the paperwork for the account yet, and there wasn't any money in the account. She told me that it was suspicious I hadn't returned the paperwork right away. It had only been a week since the application had been submitted online, and somehow that was suspicious??? 

I asked to speak with a manager, and have currently been holding for 50 minutes. Unless you have buckets of time to waste with this financial disaster, DO NOT open an account with Bank of America.

Been here a couple times and never had a problem. Very nice banking center and the staff is great! Especially Robert Nguyen. He helped me change my address over and things when I first moved here. Really funny and polite man. 

This bank only notarizes Bank of America documents which I found odd but the teller pointed me in the direction of a couple places that do.

I always get accused of being an imposter of myself... The large annoying manager interrogates me 2 out of every 5 times I'm there (hence the rating)... doesn't let me access my money, wastes my time and makes me sign my name 900 times because the "T looks different"...  It's an electronic signature!!! Who actually signs like that... "How do you not remember me by now?!"

My husband & I have used JD's Tax Service for the last 2 years. We used them both for very complicated personal taxes & my business taxes.  We love Jimmy Epley and his staff.  They are the best and very knowledgeable, too.
Highly recommended to anyone !

Efficient, friendly, professional and a great price and service. Call for an appointment, work with a tax preparer and voila! File electronically and get your refund quickly!! Love JD's Tax & Financial Solutions!!

Had a few questions regarding my taxes that I thought I owed money on. Not only did Gerry find me a little money, but he was totally professional and answered all of my questions. 

I'm done with other tax services. Totally worth the money.

JD's tax has been helping me with my corporate and personal taxes for at least 4 years. Every year I pay less than I thought. I love the personal attention and the expert advise.
Every year they send me a letter to let me know what important information to gather and call to set an appointment. They always call the day before to verify my appointment and are very friendly if i have to reschedule.
If I am unable to make it by the deadline they send out an extension for me without me having to ask.
I highly recommend JD's tax!!

I have been using JDs Tax for 15(?) years now (as long as I can remember).  They have done a great job at handling my taxes (both personal and business).  Very prompt and efficient, and they help to identify any additional deductions that can be taken.  Definitely recommend them.

I was very impressed with Jim Epley's tax knowledge. I particularly liked that he took the time to explain the implications of the new Obamacare tax rules and how to best avoid their associated costs. Would definitely recommend him to a friend.

Let me first start off by saying that as a family, we have been with State Farm for over 30 years, in California and then Hawaii and have had nothing but exceptional service up until now. 

We recently moved from Hawaii to Arizona and contacted Mr. Swanson's office as it was closest to our new home. When we moved to Hawaii from California it was a smooth transition of simply updating our information with a local agent and we had absolutely no issues for the 10 years we were there. I assumed it would be an easy transition when we moved to Arizona as well. Boy was I wrong. After contacting his office we went in to meet with one of Mr. Swanson's agents, Tyler. He was helpful and kind and made it seem like the transition was all taken care of. We wanted the exact same coverage we had in Hawaii, the only change was to simply add my husband's newly acquired classic vehicle on to our existing policy. He gave us temporary cards and sent us on our way. 

After that day we have spent the last six months trying to correctly update our policy. My husband travels for work so he has very little time home with his family and literally  every weekend since we moved here 6 months ago we have had some kind of State Farm issue we need to spend hours on the phone trying to correct. From the get go there was an issue with the underwriters and our policy was completely changed from what we discussed in the office with Tyler. We thought, okay, not his fault mistakes happen and attempted to correct the issue of my husband's classic car being reclassified as a regular vehicle and tripling in price along with several other policy discrepancies. No one at Mr. Swanson's office called us to let us know the policy was changed, we only learned of the change when we received incorrect insurance cards and policy information in the mail. 

We then contacted Tyler (he never contacted us) and he assured us it was taken care of. We receive another letter in the mail a week later letting us know our policy was being cancelled due to lack of automatic withdrawal and a lack of information about my husband's classic car. At that point we learned that he never updated my husband's classic car information (we drove there 2 different times for him to take pictures and document the car) and did not put our payment information through even though we signed up for automatic withdrawal and both of us went in to his office to sign the auto withdrawal paperwork the first week we were here. We called his office again and did not receive a response so we spent hours on the phone with State Farm's assistance line trying to pinpoint all the issues. They let us know nothing had been updated or corrected from that first initial meeting.

So, with our policy in jeopardy of being cancelled we received a call from a woman at Mr. Swanson's office (still not Mr. Swanson himself) letting us know Tyler was no longer working there and she assured us they were correcting the issues to get us up to date. They had no idea what Tyler did and seemed to have no information from the initial meeting we had. We made an automatic payment (more than we were supposed to pay) just to insure our policy was in good standing until they corrected all the issues. We again wrongly assumed that it was all taken care of. We received another letter in the mail that seemed to show our correct policy and updated information from the underwriters but received a call from the woman at Mr. Swanson's office telling us they had never received that policy and in their records we still had the incorrect one and they had no idea what that correct policy was. I had to go to their office and physically give them a copy of this policy so they could bring our policy and account up to date. 

After several other issues and miscommunications, we received a call from Mr. Swanson today now letting us know that the woman who took the copy of our correct policy was no longer with the company and they had no information about it. Between the run around, lack of communication and the countless hours we have spent trying to remedy this with customer service, I am very disheartened. 

In 30 years we have never once had any issues and now during a hectic time in our life, a big move to a new place with three small children and my husband traveling for work 85% of the time we have lost all peace of mind with our insurance company. Isn't that what the point of insurance is, peace of mind? I'm very disappointed and don't wish this mess on any one else.
This office goes above & beyond to take care of your needs! We've used them for auto insurance, mortgage insurance & even life insurance. We worked personally with Dawn Neitzel and she was awesome!

I recently got married and wanted to combine my insurance with my wife's. Her agent, Dondrell Swanson, was closer to where we currently lived so we we headed over to speak to him about the merging of our accounts. Mr. Swanson took his time (2hours!) with us, explaining in depth everything we had questions about. My wife and I had been speaking about life insurance lately and we felt very overwhelmed by all the information out there. Mr. Swanson clearly and patiently took his time explaining all our options and made us feel confident about making a decision. All in all, Mr. Swanson made sure we understood our entire policy and made sure we left his office feeling more secure with our insurance policy. I've never had a bad experience with State Farm as a company, but this was positively the best experience I've had with one of their agents.

BMO Harris bought out M&I.  The services got pricier and not as good.  Their online business banking is at least a decade behind in terms of real time data, even the branch employees cannot see things in real time.  If it wasn't for the fact all the folks held over from M&I know me and I can ask questions and get help at the branch level I would have found another bank.
I come here all the time today there was a new lady she was not nice at all. Go to the one on Jones and Desert Inn better customer service.

This was the first Wells Fargo bank at which I did business when I moved to Nevada.  At that time, it was the branch most west and was the most convenient.  That's no longer the case and I rarely go here.

This is an OK place to stop to use the ATM, but depending on your direction, it can be a bit dicey getting back on your way.  Sahara and Rainbow is a busy intersection.

I can't really say what it's like to go inside anymore because I haven't done that.  This branch merits an OK and nothing more.
0 stars if I could horrible customer service. Rude need a lesson on how to speak to people.

I think this is the branch I go to... anyway, they are awesome!  The staff is very helpful, friendly and professional.  I went in to get proof of my new address and not only did a personal banker help me but she helped me to open a savings account which now allows me to have free cashiers checks, etc.  So yesterday I go into Bank of America with my boyfriend where he has an account (HAD an account, that place sucks and we are dumping them) and he requests a cashiers check for a large amount and it was going to cost him a $7 fee.  They run his debit card from the 2nd institution where he has his money and BofA says it's too much and it won't process.  So he calls the other bank, we wait for about ten minutes and when he gets the larger amount approved to be run through his debit card, the teller at the window unapologetically tells us that because she already ran his card once she can't do it again.  Why didn't she tell us the precaution before she ran the card in the first place?  Or how about telling us after it was rejected once that she cannot run it another time and so don't waste 10 minutes of our time calling the other bank to get it approved?  So we run to my bank, Wells Fargo, which I have been a faithful member since age 16, and the process was so turnkey and friendly.  No charges, just smiles and a 'have a happy weekend!' on our way out the door.  Wells Fargo definitely rocks :)

I was really in a hard spot. I didn't know what to do. I took a chance calling around and the man that answered the phone seemed so sincere and helpful, I was willing to drive there while I passed other places...I'm glad I did! He was just as nice and sincere and caring in person! He knows a lot about loaning money and he never made me feel like he was trying to screw me over! Rare! I've gone back several times since then because when I need a little extra, they're always there for me and never make me feel judged! He will do his best to work with you! It's worth it!

Las Vegas Title Loans saved my life! The man that owns the Company was extremely helpful and patient with me. He made the process quick and easy and I was able to get the highest loan compared to other places I sought out!!! He made it so easy for me and when I was in a tough spot, he spoke with me, calmed me down and was so kind and giving! Its very few and far between you find people like that in the World today! Thank you so much Las Vegas Title Loans!

Awful place, Mr. Alexander (major drama queen) will say anything to get you in, once you get in they slap a confession of judgment form at you and balances increases, be careful.  Everyone wants to keep their credit ratings good so when you see collection, you want to take care of it, but this place is impossible.  try going to the original debtor first, my mistake was signing a lease and not moving in.  In Nevada they can still send you to collections for one months rent plus keep your deposit.

Weirdest phone call ever attempting to collect a debt. Spoke with someone named Mrs.Johnson who was pretty nice to me given the fact that I was being vague and I was irritated for having to deal with the phone call in the first place... After I spoke with her she transferred me over to a heiffer called JULIA ALVAREZ ... This stupid trick hung up on me once I told her I didn't want to answer any personal questions. This is a really skeptical collection agency , they make it so you can only see them by appointment only . And who the heck needs to verify an identity? A stranger is not going to want to sit on the phone talking about paying a debt. Don't fall for it. Luckily for Julia I'll wait for my appointment to curse her out ... Hang up on me again Julia

I wish there was a "negative" button but this was the lowest rating allowed.  Please, Please, Please...STAY AWAY FROM THIS BANK.   Employees are very low quality....they don't seem to care that mistakes are made and they don't correct them.  In all my years of banking, I have never come across such a LACK of professionalism or work ethic.  So many issues with this bank...too numerous to mention.  All I can say is, please read other Yelp posts...it's not just me....
I have never dealt with this bank before and if I can save one person from going through the nightmare I am now dealing with, it will have been worth it.

This bank is an awful choice for small business.  Excessive fees for everything.  Charges for depositing too much cash in a month, high monthly service charges, etc.  The staff from top to bottom isn't knowlegable about business or even their own policies.  They aren't any good for personal checking either.  I was told my expectations were foolish and I should have known it's most advantageous to bank with whomever held my mortgage.

STAY AWAY!  The place is a complete joke and you will be left feeling so incredibly frustrated until you finally take your business elsewhere.

Worst bank ever!!!

System down and they could not access our account so they utilized the Overdraft Option and charged us 21 times at $38 each!!! Refused to reinstate the fees, branch manager lied about system being down to my husband, accused me of cussing out a teller, which I did not, and then called my husband this afternoon to let him know that we are no longer wanted as customers and they are closing our SEVEN Accounts....2 of which are BUSINESS ACCOUNTS!

They make promises to get your business and then renege on them....Charge a $38 overdraft fee instead of declining a transaction as we have asked them NUMEROUS times to do....Great way to make (steal) money!

Completely incompetent personnel! Rude and forever changing! New Branch Mangers constantly.....on the 5th one since we brought out business there 3 years ago!

Drive thru takes at least 10-15 minutes to make deposits....ridiculous!

Bring back Cynthia Taylor!

Business Checking Account.  This is the worst banking experience I've ever had.  Poor customer service, a fee for every little thing (including cash deposits), and creative accounting on their part to extract more fees.

Michael my broker in Prescott, AZ is fantastic but the organization as a whole is the pits.  The first house I made an offer on, they sent out an appraiser that was illiterate using an appraisal which looked like it came from another property then he appraised it $20K below what its actual value was.  So there went my appraisal fee.  The the next house, I was approved for the loan and was ready to close and had movers scheduled to move my furniture and then because I accepted an advanced position making more money with another organization, they tried to delay the closing for another 2 weeks to a month.  Resulted in me  losing the house and expedited appraisal plus the additional expense.  Needless to say I fired them and went with another lender.  Very unreliable.  Had me doing a lot of the foot work to obtain financial documents that they were being paid to gather themselves.  If you have any other options for a lender go with that one and save yourself a lot of expense and aggravation.  I feel sorry for anyone that has the misfortune of dealing with this lender.

This organization is so incompetent, if incompetency was an Olympic sport they would win a Gold Medal every time. 

Not only did CNN give us completely misleading information, they also caused us to waste a great deal of time and effort on the back of their shoddy advise. 

I do not recommend this company and am of the opinion that people seeking a Mortgage Company look elsewhere. Both my wife and I have been left totally bewildered by the unprofessionalism of the VP and Operations Manager.

I do not recommend.  This was the preferred mortgage company for a builder that I was using and there was a financial incentive to use them.

I had a unique situation where I am a 50% owner of a rental property in another state.   I also run a home-based business.  I spoke with Chantel and she told me that it was not an issue, and let me know what I qualified for.  I provided all of the required financials and all was good until 30 days out.

Then the problems started.  I had to keep providing financial information for the business in various formats.  Suzi, the loan underwriter, sent a rude e-mail waiting to know why my YTD numbers had October blank.  It was only 10 days into October and I don't do the books until the end of the month.  That was not sufficient.  But sending the same document minus the last month (through the last completed month) was OK.   Same numbers, same totals.  Bank statement after bank statement was sent.  Profit statement after profit statement (the business makes a fair amount of money).  They were requesting documents from financial providers that didn't exist.  Statements without a logo on them were insufficient (seriously, had the bank name, but not a logo).  Finally that was taken care of.

Then the next bombshell just a couple of weeks out.  Chantel was "not aware" that the they changed their rules on rental properties.  I'm a 50% owner, I claim 50% of the income and expenses on my taxes which Uncle Sam is fine with.  CNN, not so much.  They now require that I need to be capable to cover 100% of the expenses.  That would be fine if they would let me claim 100% of the income, but for that they can only use what is on my taxes!  So I'm responsible for 100% of the costs, but can only use 50% of the income toward that.  Basically I was showing to be at a huge loss each month and it affected my qualification.  We're now days out from closing.     

I had to get the builder involved to smack some sense into these guys, otherwise I wasn't going to have the house.   7 Month process and the issues arise in the final days.

They were able to find a different loan that for my situation, but it wasn't the type that I wanted to be in and it costs me more per month.  

Once the loan closed (fortunately on time) the fun continued.  CNN Mortgage "forgot" to have the final appraisal done and it had to be done after we moved in.  They also "missed" documents that we had to sign AFTER CLOSING.  

These guys are a joke.  Avoid them at all costs.  The builder has dropped them after many similar complaints.  I have a profitable business, plenty of money in savings and they treat me like a criminal.  

And the ironic part, they sold the loan immediately to another company.  And that document says by law they (CNN Mortgage) are required to notify me 10 days prior to the transfer.  I got the notice from them 5 days after.  Ugh!

I highly recommend Dave Bourland and CNN Mortgage. Dave and the entire team at CNN worked tirelessly with me to get the best loan for my home. If honesty, perseverance, and success are important to you, then CNN Mortgage and Dave Bourland would be the team to call.

I would never use this company again. This was the preferred mortgage company of my home builder and had a financial incentive to use them. After a certain point in the transaction, all phone conversations ceased and the communication went strictly through email. Angie often would not pick up a phone call, but then email me right back. 

During this long process, I had to work in Texas, and kept getting requests for more and more items to be provided, signed, etc... I wasn't able to take care of this while in Texas and asked Angie if we could meet in the 48 hours I would be back one week because I would be gone again for another long period of time. The reason for this 1 star review was because I never at any point in this experience felt like I mattered as a customer to her and her communication is absolutely horrible. In the end I just wanted to meet at an office, that has a printer and internet, and I would have been able to provide her with everything she needed right then and there, instead of these long email threads going on and on and on, and being drawn on and on because she is shuttling her children to and from different places.

Angie, if this is something you want to do as a career, make the people you work for feel like they matter. Your inconsistent communication, and reluctance to pick up a phone call is very off putting and borderline offensive. I had to stop and think about what the heck I was getting myself into, signing all these papers from someone who won't even pick up my calls, but is about to originate a loan on my house for me. Big or small, mansion or motor home, everyone you talk to should be shown some type of priority. I highly suggest you pick up the phone next time one of your clients call you, because I'll be honest, I ONLY went with you because of the incentive, a mistake I will NEVER make again. Thank you for teaching me that lesson!

We came in because we got one of those scratch off prize things in the mail. We called first and they told us our prize number guaranteed us one of the Grand prizes on the mailer. Figuring we might at least win an apple watch, we came in and waited probably an hour before someone talked to us. The guy who met with us was the mascot for sharky car salesmen and honestly pissed me off. He led us over to the prize board and had us match up our number to the prize. It was a $5 gift card, which we received and were smugly told not to spend it all in one place. Thanks for wasting our time and making sure we never buy a car from you jerks.

Needless to say I was Bold face LIED to, INSULTED and HUMILIATED...

They told me after my experience at Larry Jay Mitsubishi "We don't care about your credit past, we can get anybody financed they only work with about 10 banks, we work with over 40 and we'll do everything we can to get you financed." 
 
WRONG AGAIN!!!!!

Here's my scenerio and experience with them;
Went in, I know my credit stinks because of a number of things (divorce, economy etc.), I'm trying to rebuild it...

I work contract, income is about 3.75 times the Median Income for the zip code I live in.

(Wednesday 12/10/2014)
Sat with the salesman, they ran my application through the banks they use, the salesman came back with an offer from Sterling Bank $3000 down, I accepted but needed to do $1500 that week and $1500 the following. There was nobody from the bank available (7pm) to authorize that and probably wouldn't be before they closed so the salesman was good enough to have me take off and he'd work on it the next day...

(Thursday 12/11/2014)
Got a call from the dealership the next day, she said I was approved, after clarifying a few times and she said "I spoke to Rick in finance, Sterling has approved the loan, $1500 tomorrow, $1500 next Friday, so you can come in, pay the $1500, they'll finalize the paperwork but you can't take the car home until the full $3,000 down is paid next week"... I was totally fine with that ... then she said "the only thing they're working on is whether they'll possibly be able to let you take the car home tomorrow or if you have to wait until next week, but it is a 100% done deal, the car is yours, congratulations"!!  Needless to say I was pretty stoked, was offered to work overtime the next day but I was like "nope ... going to part of the down and secure my new car tomorrow"... Had I only Known...

(Friday 12/12/2014)
I was so excited I could barely contain myself ... so my wife and I ran to the dealership, figuring we were going to be in and out in short order, after all, all we had to do is sign the loan paperwork and give them the $1,500 towards the down right?!?
Well, Gus (the sales manager) had us come into his office, started out by saying "you know what your credit situation is...", (my thought of what would come next was 'we're not going to be able to let you take the car home until next week when the full down payment is satisfied') ... NOPE!!!! his next words were "we couldn't get you financed because they don't think you have good job stability being at the company you're with for only 3 months and living in 4 states in the last 5 years (didn't seem to matter that they know I'm a contractor and have been doing the same work for over 22 years and the longest lapse of employment I've had (once) was about 2 weeks over the last 10 years).  Then Gus proceeded to say "We can still get you in to a late model low milage car, if you're interested I can compile a list"... We said 'sure, it would be worth a look'... well, he came back and said "the best one they had we "qualified" for is a Suzuki Forenza" ... come to find out it is a 2005 or 2006 with about 160,000 miles on it ... it was everything I could do to maintain composure...like we were so desperate we would jump on something that was worth less than the down payment we were going to pay on the new Outlander Sport

Then to add Insult to Injury ... I got a text the next day saying "We have recieved your request and have som GREAT NEWS!!! Please call us, CONGRATS!!!...

Needless to say, I have a loan on a 2013 Harley Davidson (they were willing to take a chance) in "Good Standing" so my credit score is increasing, and when it gets in to the mid to upper 700's where I want it, I WON'T GO TO ANY PLANET AUTOMOTIVE DEALERSHIP!!!

Go somewhere else and save yourself the anguish ...
