There is always a long line inside because 1 teller is on duty. If you're lucky, a 2nd teller may be around, but for the most part, they come up to you while you wait in line to encourage you to use the indoor ATMs. Pretty personable, right?

I'm not going to lie, I really do enjoy walking into banks where there are 5-6 employees behind the counter and most of them will know your name. If I'm in a hurry, I'll use the outdoor or drive thru ATM. But honestly, this place is ran by a bunch of robots.
They don't know how to handle money properly they lost 173 dollars of my money sending a check to a bill pay .go to Wells Fargo because chase employees are all idiots
Used to be great. Now one teller. 20 min lines. Directed to a machine that can't help me. Three guys standing behind the window screen shooting the bull. What happened Chase, you used to be cool.

Some of the reviews are pretty low but in my experience, it wasn't that bad. Came in here on a Saturday and I'm not gonna lie... Service is slow. We walked in at 12pm and left the bank at around 130pm. Granted there were a lot of things we had to do but there were only 2 personal bankers which is why we waited a long time to be helped. The banker however was nice, friendly and personable so it offsets the long wait and slow service. I recommend coming in on a weekday when there are more associates or come in earlier on a Saturday and be prepared to wait!

Absolutely the best flower shop in Las Vegas. Great customer service, beautiful arrangements, and friendly local shop owners. I've sent at least ten different arrangements over the last year and every one has been received fresh and as ordered. Their web site is very representative of the flowers and arrangements that arrive at your destination. The same stellar service on shop pickup and delivery. The various arrangements featuring the cute little pooch are some of my favorites.
On the way to see my mom at hospital and stopped to ask for a wrap for a pot and the gentleman at this flower shop was so gracious and helped me out. Will definitely send business this way!

Susie was very polite and helpful when I walked into the flower shop today. She helped me choose an arrangement for a special occasion and gave me a guideline as to how the arrangements ranged in price. Also the best part was that she said the arrangement could be delivered same day for no extra delivery charge aside from the standard delivery. Checkout was excellent and prices were reasonable. I'd definitely go back to place another order here because of Susie and her great customer service!

I have experienced wonderful service from the Dancing Dandelion family but yesterday they outdid even themselves! My daughter's Master Graduation ceremony was held at UNLV Sunday afternoon.  I called to have flowers delivered to a restaurant unaware that Dancing Dandelion is not open on Sundays. Greg made a special delivery for us and phoned me with delivery  confirmation. The lily arrangement was simply magnificent and I cannot find the words to thank Greg and his family for all they have done for my family.

Visited The Dancing Dandelion in search of small peace lily plant to be given to our boss who'd just loss his father.  Immediately when I entered the shop I was greeted by Greg who determined my needs and picked out the perfect plant - but it wasn't in a suitable arrangement for gift giving.  Greg at first thought he didn't have a proper container in which to present so he quickly searched his stock finding one lone wicker basket (which needed some modifications), repotting it, and applying 'leaf shine' spray.   With 2 lilies about to open, the arrangement was beautiful.  The peace lily was presented to our boss last week and he truly appreciated it!

When my husband presents floral arrangements to me, he always uses The Dancing Dandelion.  However, this was the first time I'd ever visited their store.  I can see why he's a repeat customer.  I appreciate how fast Greg was able to troubleshoot the matter while ensuring that I left happy & satisfied. This family run business is top-notch and I would not hesitate to call on them in the future!

I had came here upon "researching" on yelp to find flowers for my best friend for Valentines Day. I came here about a week before the date to place an order. I knew my best friend loves purple so i tried my best to find close to it. 

The workers are super nice and tried to help me find what i wanted. I've always liked lilies and i thought it was a nice that they had an arrangement with roses and lillies. Its not the purple i had in mind but it worked out in the end. The lilies were white edged with a purple that was fairly close to the roses. They helped suggest what would look best (especially since i asked for purple roses) and what not (hey i havent bought anyone nice flowers in ages ! so i asked quite a bit of questions to make sure they know what i wanted and i knew what i was getting). The guy said they had a limited amount of purple roses but guaranteed they would have enough for my order. *crosses fingers* 

Order was placed and paid for and they said i can pick it up any time day of. 

Our plan was, we had dinner scheduled at 6pm so i'd pick it up as close as i could to it. I found out they closed at 4pm on Saturdays but they said they'd be open longer for pick ups. I didn't want to be THAT guy who holds up the entire store from getting off work so i picked up the flowers at 3:30. Originally on order, i had asked for a wrapped bouquet but when i picked it up, it was in a water filled glass vase. Oh man how am i gonna give it to her at dinner? Lol But they recommended this would keep its shape the best so i went with it. 

The flowers held up in the car. the owner? suggested how to put it in the car and how to make it stay put in the seat. The flowers sat in the car with some windows cracked open (oh man they smelled strong XD especially in a "confined" space like a car) XD o well. luckily my nose didnt go FUUUUU! lol XD They held up all night and next day til she went home. 

Only downside about lilies is they didnt last as long as the roses and the pistils? tend to fall off and stain whatever they fall on :( sad face ! hope she liked the flowers XD 

Overall back to the store. Great customer service ! :D

They really go the extra step to accommodate customers desires at The Dancing Dandelion Flower Shop.  I've picked up flowers here on numerous occasions and always had a great experience!  The staff is knowledgeable and genuinely helpful.  DDFS was easily able to accommodate special requests for me on a couple of instances. Even when they didn't have what I was looking for they willfully pointed me in a helpful direction.  

Customer service is top notch...as another example, for a nominal fee they will even clean-up and prepare potted plants purchased from Plant Nurseries, Home Depot, etc. making them gift ready.  Prices are slightly above average for flower shops, but spot on when you consider the quality product and service that accompanies your orders.  

They deserve a very strong 4 Stars in my book.  The shop is on the small side and their on-hand inventory is a little limited because of this, but if you can give them a couple of days the sky's the limit.
They had the freshest flowers and were very classy in the creativity and the delivery was quick.

This lovely shop is a small family run business and their customer service was amazing. I went in two days before my wedding to order a bouquet in peach roses. They were out of stock that day but confirmed a new delivery the next. Friday afternoon I received a call that my order was ready to be picked up on Saturday. It was beautifully arranged and hand wrapped in a white ribbon, which was placed in a glass cylinder vase and white box for easy transportation. I couldn't be happier or excited for my big day with this gorgeous bouquet. I want to thank everyone at Dancing Dandelion for all of their help and the work that they do.

Greg is amazing! Beautiful flowers and better than I ordered since they were out of the size vase it needed! If you're worried about ordering from out of town/state like I was (I have horror stories from dot com mass flower companies) this place will ease all your fears! I will use them every time I order flowers for friends in Vegas from now on and will be telling them to do the same!

Great service - great looking arrangements. I was just about to drive away because the front doors were locked, when the owner came back from getting a drink at a store in the same parking lot. Suggestion - leave a note on the window saying you will be back in 5 minutes. You almost  lost a sale because I was in the process of driving away when I saw you unlock the front door. Will definitely use again.

While planning my wedding from CA, I found this shop on Yelp! So glad I did! Greg is by far the best priced in Vegas, and does superior work! He did 10 centerpieces for us, 8 bridesmaid bouquets and a throw bouquet. I told him my budget and ideas and he made it happen! If you're looking for someone to do your wedding flowers, call Greg! The whole process was so painless and easy! He was on time, and set up and delivered everything for us! Thanks Greg! You're the best.

I stopped in at 9am this morning (opens at 10) and peeked in and met the owner. I desperately needed a last minute corsage and no one could do it. I spoke with Greg and he was so incredibly kind. He made me a corsage with roses and orchids right on the spot! Great customer service and I highly recommend this flower shop. They are a great local business.

I've been on the receiving end of Dancing Dandelion's beautiful floral arrangements.  My husband has used them exclusively for the past 1 1/2 years for Birthday, Anniversary or special occasions.  Each arrangement is unique and beautiful.  The arrangement I recently received for my Birthday is especially nice.  Lots of bright vibrant flowers that are just stunning.  In the past we used Tiger Lily but became increasingly frustrated at what we received for the price. Often the arrangements were very small with very few flowers and lots of filler.  Since we found Dancing Dandelion we couldn't be happier!
Received an arrangement from them for my birthday, it was gorgeous! Susie was really helpful in making it exactly what I would want...so I just wanted to say thank you, and I absolutely loved it!

Greg was amazing!  He was patient and thoughtful as we discussed how to make a beautiful flower arrangement for my mom's memorial service.  

I found all the traditional arrangements really tacky and boring; with his help we designed a gorgeous arrangement truly reflective of my mom.  It also coordinated well with all of the printed materials and we were able to incorporate my mom's clan scarf.  He also designed corsages (for my mom's sisters and best friends) with my mom's favorite flower (gardenia) that he had to special order, and then wait on me to deliver the specific tartan ribbon to incorporate into the design.  They all loved them and took special pride in wearing them.

They delivered the arrangement (despite it being quite a distance from their shop) and had it set before I even arrived, which was such a stress relief.  

I cannot say enough nice things about them.  Their shop has cute little knick knacks too, and I bought a friend's birthday card and my friend bought herself a handmade art deco vase.

Love their service I browsed through many other shops and none could compare.
I had many questions and Greg was so QUICK and straight forward replying to me by e-Mail

I purchased:
The 4 Dozen Red Roses Ultimate Elegance Premium Long Stem with a Medium size Teddy Bear.

And she loved them 
I couldn't be happier 

I would recommend anyone to do business with them.

Also the delivery person was quiet polite and nice.

We just lost a very good friend of ours and wanted to send flowers to her family.  Their website isn't the best and the options they had on display were pretty limited and pink due to valentine's being next week BUT i called them and was able to figure something out that was more appropriate. I was very very impressed with them for calling me and sending me a picture PRIOR to delivering them so i could tell them to change it or whatever but i ended up loving them and didn't change a thing.  
Thanks for making such a beautiful arrangement. That pink lily in front is Tina all the way.

Ordered online before they opened as I live on the east coast.  Flowers were delivered with so much care and such a genuine spirit.  Will never use any other florist in Vegas to send gifts to my family - AMAZING!

On Mother's Day at noon is not the time to shop for flowers. After a quick check on Yelp I saw this place close by and rated VERY well. My daughter walked in and they were pretty much picked clean. Even though there were only a couple arrangements left they were flawless and we came out of the predicament looking like rockstars. Now if wife never sees this review I'm home free.
Thank you for the repeat great service! I recently ordered flowers and they were delivered fast and as the picture shows on the website.
Bought some beautiful flowers online for a friend that looked like a little dog super cute! Great service and product .. will be using them again!

My wife and I celebrated our renewal of vows in Las Vegas and hosted guests in a Bellagio suite. We found Dancing Dandelion and discussed what we wanted for arrangements, we actually supplied a picture of an arrangement and they matched it wonderfully. Our ten arrangements we delivered as scheduled and our guests complimented us on their beauty. I would definitely recommend The Dancing Dandelion Flower Shop to everyone in need of floral service in Las Vegas. Customer service was exemplary!

I don't live in the area, but ordered some flowers and balloons for my uncle who just got surgery through their online portal and everything was executed perfectly. Same day delivery!!  Greg is definitely the man who you want to talk to.  He was so easy going and even called to let me know that delivery was successful. Exceptional customer service and willing to go the extra mile. If you're reading this Greg, THANK YOU from the bottom of my heart, you really made my day!!

i have been using The Dancing Dandelion for the last two years to order flowers for different school events.  in the past, they have made me what I call "podium arrangements".  Today, they made me some beautiful hand-opened roses with succulents ( I will post pictures).  The arrangements were beautiful and everyone kept asking me who my florist was.  The shop has always been very helpful and I am able to easily communicate with the owner via email.  I highly recommend this shop.

I had the pleasure of doing business with Greg for a baby shower I was hosting. He paid close attention to detail, to make sure my vision was created. Greg going above and beyond allowed me to worry about one less thing. Thank you the beautiful arrangements and amazing customer service!

extremely friendly staff! susie, is always the one who answers my calls and always so nice. this was my fifth time ordering from this place and they are very nice every single time.  the mixed assortment that my girlfriend just received described as the "prettiest bouquet of flowers that she had ever seen in her life".  i will post a picture, you can judge yourself.  these people never disappoint!

Ordered two of the princess paws. Greg was able to make one a boy for me. They turned out perfect! They delivered when promised as well! The customer service and quality is what makes it 5 star. I live way north west and will still utilize then in the future.

Ordered my flowers long distance for my upcoming nuptials.  Spoke with Greg who was very patient and accommodating. I called and told him what I wanted and the flowers came out exactly as I pictured them. Days later they are still alive. I highly recommend a this florist for any future bouquet orders. Flowers were delivered on time. Thanks!!

Needed flowers to go to hospital same day. All flower sites online couldn't do it. Called and Greg texted me pictures of 3 beautiful arrangements and hand delivered on his way home. Good customer service is so rare I give them an A+++
They were open late on the evening before Valentine's Day, and had plenty of beautiful product to pick up. Great Flowers! Great service!

Our one and only florist for Las Vegas because of their customer service. 

On a couple of occasions, they helped with custom orders, but the one order I would like to highlight is how they helped with our wedding floral. 

When I called and asked for fresh lavender, they said they would ask their distributor but could not guarantee this as it was not in season. After they spoke with their distributor, they were going to order from out of the country. But being as it was coming from out of the country, they could not guarantee the quality. Long story short, the fresh lavender quality was not top notch. They still made the bouquet but did not charge us full price. 

Our back up plan was using dried lavender stalks to make the bridal bouquet and this worked out perfectly. I actually like idea better because I am now using the dried lavender bouquet as a floral display at home. Every time I see it, it reminds me of our special day. 

If you need a good florist, you should see and talk to the folks at Dancing Dandelion!

This is a warm and friendly run business. The owners are very personable and you can tell they enjoy what they do. The flowers are fresh, I know this through our conversation and saw them bringing in flowers from the flower market a minute after our discussion..lol and the best reason you should visit them is the great pricing! I found my go to florist, definitely will be back!

I had a friend that was in the hospital so i wanted to brighten her day by sending flowers. I looked online and found several hard to navigate websites. When i finaly found something and called i was told sorry cant deliver today several times ontop of extremely unreasonable prices. I got super lucky and found dancing dandelion on yelp. AWESOME website too many great options at great prices. I picked a design that i liked twice as much for half the price. When i called i Spoke with Greg and at 2:30 on.a saturday assured me my arrangement would be there by 4. When i told him the design i wanted he apologetically told me they did not have a floral arranger in the shop but he had something just as pretty but a bit larger and it was aboit $25 more because it was larger. Greg said he would give it to me at a better pricr and the price he qouted was exactly what i wanted to.pay including delivery...DO NOT WASTE YOUR TIME OR MONEY GOUNG ANYPLACE ELSE.....THANK YOU GREG AND THANK YOU DANCING DANDELION.......YOUR NEW LIFELONG CUSTOMER
TODD TODD

My favorite bank hands down! I went into this location to handle some business and the service was quick and exceedingly exceptional. They are Very informative knowledgeable about their services. Only draw back is that this location closes at 5pm and there is no drive up ATM.

This bank has a female manager with dark hair, who is a young girl on a powertrip. I wouldnt reccomend anyone dealing with her unless you want the worst customer service and a power trip attitude. She was not helpful to me at all and I will be switching banks because of her. Go to any other branch forget this one.
They have the worst customer service. Their stories never match up always running you around in circles. I recommend using another branch. By far the worst service I've seen in 15yrs.

I have been with Geico for years..... always  thinking well this is the best I will ever do for insurance... I happen to be online looking around for some more reasonable priced insurance one day. I don't even remember checking out Farmers insurance, but I received a nice letter in my mail box with a quote on insurance that I could not even believe was true. I work some crazy hours and Ashlee dealt with all of  that and all my emails back and forth on info and setting me up with this awesome low price but excellent insurance for my home and my 2 cars. I will  be saving over 700 dollars a year with this insurance,,,, thank you Ashlee for all you done and assisting me... I really hate change but this change was wonderful because Ashlee was caring and so helpful

Ashlee and her staff are amazing. They care more about the coverage and service that you get and less about just selling you a policy. They will be my first point of contact from now on for all of my personal and business insurance needs.

I had a great experience buying home insurance (which is not something people usually say!) because Ashlee was so caring and professional. Insurance is confusing, but she helped me understand my options better than anyone ever has. I was impressed how quickly and thoroughly she responded to my questions and that she took the time to get to know me not just as a client but a person. She could not have been more friendly or helpful. Thanks again, Ashlee!

Let's face it, dealing with insurance companies is probably about as pleasant as rolling around a mound of fire ants in your birthday suit. Well, typically it is anyway. Ashlee Candelaria and her staff are an exception to that rule of thumb. She has been my agent for about 2 years now and I can't imagine dealing with anyone else. If I have a question regarding my coverage or changing my policy, she gets back to me faster than Honey Boo-Boo can finish a giant bowl of 'sketti'. All jokes aside, if the last thing you want to have to worry about is how your insurance (and the headaches that can come along with it) is handled, then look no further than Ashlee and her staff. I promise you won't bother going anywhere else. They make everything painfully easy. And that rules. 

P.S. Make sure you check out their life insurance policies. I wouldn't be caught dead without it.
I wholeheartedly recommend Ellen Cherry for superb service! Ask for her when you go in.

Its not just about the company but also the agent. Wes Stahler's office has been a great experience. They are responsive and want to understand your needs to ensure you are accurately covered. They even talked to me about products to ensue that I am covered in the future. I not only recommend State Farm but specifically I recommend Wes Stahler's office. Great business to support.

I have had my Insurance with this company for about 23 years now.
They have always been very helpful to me in all situations. I have my car and home. Also my family members came here for insurance as well.
You can do everything over the phone, or by email, or even go there in person.
All requests are taken care of immediately so how can you beat it?
If you need insurance this is a very good choice.

I had Progressive Ins for 5 years, my insurance started at about 65 per month and ended at  above 125 per month.  I did have two accidents one was a no fault,  one was at fault but received no citation from the police, because the Police said there was not enough damage  requiring  a citation.
One rainy  night a deer ran into my car. It took about a month to have the repair completed which cost them about 3000 dollars. All of the replacement parts were after market or used. Its been two years now and the car is still not right. 
When Progressive first looks at my car they did not document all of the damage. When the repair shop founf the extent of it, at every step the adjuster had to  verify the damage and then approve payment . This took many subsequent visits by the adjuster. This also causes the repair service a lot of time and they  likly skiped some repairs. Progressive is a nightmare if you have a claim. Ask them the formula they use if you total your car, OMG ask them. I found the same Insurance at a very well know Nation Wide company at a much lower cost. I had one claim with them and it was night and day. I am glad I no longer have  to suffer Progressive nightmares.

These crooks quoted me $83 per month for boat insurance. My boat is only worth about $3000 and their quote would have paid the boat off in 2 years! I'm not sure why I chose Progressive for a quote but I will not do that again. My State farm agent ended up quoting me $16 monthly which is way more reasonable.

this company is the worst never missed a payment in both policy's i've had and they time i need help they let me down the customer service is he worst the always just say "sorry no we cant do anything about that" we im going to cancel my policy asap as soon as i find a company who help the policy holders instead ok just taking thousands of dollars and never even try and help there customers out. ill explain someone broke into my car and tried to steal my stereo so i had to get the window fixed and my deductible was higher then the cost of the window had to pay out of pocket they wouldn't even help my out with a little of the cost of the window $185 they couldn't even give me half of that out of all the thousands of dollars hat ive paid them of the years and never used my policy anything so they could even pay half of the window 92.50 for me just sad. then i asked to a few days to make my payment 3 days because i just had to have my window repaired they said sorry there's nothing we can do. this company sucks and treats customers like we should be glad to have them taking are money for nothing

Hahahaha some ppl's review crack me up "They randomly Jacked up my rate after 6 mos, I DID have a moving violation, but but but...."  All I can say is (and I won't tell them this) is that I would not be on the road if it wasn't for Progressive.  They were able to quote me a "Normal" rate for the type of driver I am (I was suspended for 4 years, 7 years ago, and didn't renew until 1.5 years ago as I did not need it) when every other company was like $6/$7k/yr!!!!!!!!  I bought the car for recreational purposes ONLY, only paid $9k for it and plan on putting maybe 6k on it this year, do not use it for work, but wanted the freedom I haven't had in so long.  When I called and spoke to the reps at Progressive they were all quite literally SHOCKED to hear the quotes I had been given and even pointed out that the only reason my insurance was "So expensive" through them is due to a ticket 2yrs 11mos and 28 days ago, so if I waited 3 days my rate should go down.  Sure as shit I re-did the numbers starting my policy the next Friday, saved ANOTHER $400 and am on the road this weekend...  My dealership dealt with them but said they were quick and a pleasure, hopefully they're as good as they say if I get hit!!!!!  Loving Progressive right now, time to go for a cruise :0)))

Quite simply, they are a terrible company. Hurry up and give them your money, then wait when you need customer service. There are so many insurance companies out there, just pick any other company and you will do better than these people.

Not again.
We have 3 cars insured with AAA, one with Progressive and two motorcycles also insured with Progressive. 

It was renewal time so I shopped around.  I could not get a straight answer from Progressive about the combined cost for a 6 month period. "We can't tell you the cost since one car is renewed in August, the others in October." WHAAAAT.
Since they were more expensive for less coverage, we went with yet another company. Out of being p'd off with Progressive, I canceled the one auto policy I had. What balls they have.  Charged me $75 to cancel, then the rep tried to SELL ME MORE INSURANCE. AYFKM ?  Can't believe this.

I hope they recorded the phone conversation. 
Next June when my motorcycle policy with Progressive expires, GUESS WHAT !!!

This company uses a traditional "bait and switch" tricks to entice customers to use their service. The latest and greatest is the "set your own price" guarantee. They don't tell you this is only for the 1st 6 months of service, then they jack the insurance price to whatever they feel like.
And just as quick and easy as they let you sign up, they will let you cancel - this was the only great thing I found about Progressive. 
6 months of basic service at average cost, followed by a 25% increase after the initial 6 months. No explanation, just a new bill for the next 6 months at their desired increase.

In their defense, I did receive a 1 point moving violation during this 6 month period...the 1st one I've had in 3 years...and the one prior (3 years ago) dropped off in the same 6 months. No change in driving habits whatsoever. 
Bad business Progressive.
It's not worth it to leave your current company only to go back 6 months later for better service and guarantees.

wow, I can't believe these people can still be in business!  I will try to summarize my interactions... My 70yr old mother was hit by a progressive insured driver.  Took her car to progressive to get it fixed.  They then informed us the car would be totaled because to repair a trunk and bumper was more expensive then the vehicle was to replace.  Surprised at the low valuation (and check offered), I ran my own comps and requested their reports.  In their comps they willfully low-balled our vehicle by saying it didn't have AC, sunroof, CD player, power windows etc. ALL to get a lower valuation!!  APPALLING!  Talked to two other insurance providers and two auto body shop and ALL said that Progressive is notorious for being the biggest lowballers in the bisiness.  Upon calling them out on the "oversight" they adjusted their numbers and ran new comps - only to have their mystery software give a LOWER number... 

I then supplied them with NADA valuations, KBB valuations, and EVERY single same make/model car that was being sold across the nation as comps (all for 30% more).  And their response was "my comps didn't take into account individual markets and mileage.  I am simply appalled at how horrible this company is - and even elevating it to supervisors, and the BBB produced no further results.  They just hide behind the fact that their software is "state approved".  Within 3 days of dropping off the vehicle Progressive forced us to return the rental car, threatened to have our car towed off their property, and sent us the settlement check because they didn't want to discuss it further.  

I really hope someone with more $$ then us takes these criminals to court.

I got insurance for a scooter through Progressive since USAA (my beloved insurance company) does not cover scooters. The policy was supposed to be $75. However then there was some confusion over some form, and the increased my coverages and cost to $555! I contacted them and signed the forms the same day electronically (something they conveniently did not mention could be done in their correspondance).  THey changed by policy back but charged me an additional $126 as part of the prorated higher policy that I did not want or use. What a complete and total scam. I would never use them if I had any other choice and I don't recommend them unless you are desparate.

Damn Progressive's good.

Cheap insurance rates.  It's so easy to pay your insurance bill.. literally 4-5 clicks and I'll have my insurance paid within 15 seconds.  

Got into an accident and they immediately post all information online for you to review.  Agents calling ME with LOTS of support to help me through the ordeal, even going out of their way to help me get my money back ... when they found out I wasn't working, they tried to get my deductible paid for before I had to pay it myself, even going to the police station to pick up the report for me.  Answered all my questions with complete information.  Very professional and personable as well.  

Nothing's confusing..everything's very simple and very fast when it comes to Progressive... they really made this accident issue very easy for me.

geico who?

progressive allows a semi truck driver to hit a pregnant women in the middle of a city and declines to process the claim. Not only was the agent rude and inconsiderate with comments such as "you are being emotional" but cleaned theirs hands off the claim event after the semi driver offered me cash to fix my BMW to not run their commercial insurance. the driver seems to be son of the owner of the company, and progressive had no intentions of doing the right thing. his name was Said Hamed, from company Said & Sons Delivery 922 Little Creek Rd Orlando Fl. 

their 27 year old son and driver, ran my car off the road while i was 8 months pregnant offered me cash before leaving the scene. i am sick to my stomach on how the progressive agent treated me. they are in the business of collecting money without taking responsibility when accidents do happen (i had progressive for over 7 years, i am so happy i am now with Geico)

Been member for 5 yr. Paid thousands dollas... and some theft (lots of them in us) took an auto part and damaged my (i have to spend around 800) car but they are not able to pay me a dime since there is $1,000 deductible/case

I want to like them but they do some strange things.

I had Progressive a few years ago.  One of the "discounts" which is included in their basic quote which they don't tell you you need to do until towards the end of signing up is to sign your documents electronically.  When I tried to do that from Linux, the Progressive website kept failing.  I spoke with a woman at Progressive customer service(?) for about 10 minutes.  She kept arguing with me that I needed to run Windows.  Why in the world should it matter for car insurance what computer operating system I run at home?!?  Finally, I spoke with her boss who allowed me to sign the documents offline and still get the discount.  What a bunch of fudge.

I had left Progressive after they raised my rate 27% a few years ago just because I was a good customer.  The Progressive customer service(?) guy told me there had been TWO rate increases within the six months I had insurance with them.  So I dumped Progressive.

Now I am looking for car insurance again.  I got a good quote from Progressive.  But just before I went to purchase insurance with them today, they raised the quote more than 30 PERCENT(!!!) just because they found a NOT AT FAULT accident on my record from three years ago.  (By the way, I never even made a claim with my or the other guy's car insurance for that accident.  He forced me into a median, totaled my old car, and then lied to the Travis County, Texas police who screamed at me for five minutes until I thanked them for coming out.  Those Travis County police officers didn't seem to like me because of my flowery shirt indicating I am gay.  I took about a $6000 loss on my car; the other guy who was a bully only suffered a broken drivers side mirror.  But that is beside the point.)  Can I charge you for something that was not your fault?!?

BS!  Enough with Progressive.  I keep feeling like they are Lucy holding the football for me kick but then they pull it away time and time again so I can fall on my backside.

Progressive does have good rates when you are a new customer and can get through all their hoops.  But otherwise, they are worth avoiding.

Update: as I get quotes from other companies, so far Progressive is lowest for my car, circumstances, and location even with the 30% increase due to the not at fault accident on my record.  So I am bumping them up from two stars to three.  If I do go with Progressive and I can sign my documents without the mess I had last time, I will bump them up another star.

They're good.  They're really good.

Here's the story:  Last week Sue was driving her 2003 Honda Accord through a parking lot when this fellow backs out of a parking space and smacks the front bumper of Sue's car.   It's about 4PM Monday afternoon.

The guy is very apologetic, takes full responsibility for the accident and gives Sue all his info - a real mensch.  By the time Sue gets home, there's a v-mail from a Progressive Adjuster asking Sue to call him.  They have Sue an appointment the next day at the body shop.  

When she takes the car to the shop Tuesday morning, the folks there  call Enterprise rental car, who then comes and picks Sue up, takes her to their lot where she gets a rental car.  Thursday, mid-morning, the body shop calls to tell her the car is done.  She drops the rental back at Enterprise, Enterprise drops Sue back at the body shop and by 4PM Thursday, Sue's fully repaired car is sitting in the garage.  Three days from rough to buff!!  Simply amazing.

All through the process the Progressive adjuster was checking in with Sue, visiting the body shop to check on the car, etc.  We are really impressed with the level of customer service Progressive provided - and Sue wasn't even their customer.  Sue and I both agree that if you're going to get hit by someone, make sure they have Progressive insurance !!

As far as I am concerned, this is my new gold standard for auto insurance.  If my rates weren't so low with Farmers, I'd sign up with Progressive in a heartbeat.  Next time you're in the auto insurance market - check 'em out!

Dear Flo,

A young driver backed into the side of my car in a parking lot.  I was driving through the lot and the other driver just didn't look when she started to back out.  It crunched in the side of my right rear passenger door.

The sad part is you promised you'd be out to visit me with an adjuster within a few days and now two weeks later, the adjuster says I have to call the other driver's insurance company in order to get them to pay for the damages.

Since I haven't been involved in an accident in over 30 years, I thought you'd be there for me Flo... I thought you'd have my back and negotiate this claim for me... like you promised.

So with with my deepest regrets, we are going to have to break up and I'm going to have to start dating the English Gecko again.

Frank

Worst insurance company ever. Charging me for a month that i wasnt cover cause i reinstated my policy when it lapsed. Who the fuck charges customers for coverage they did not receive. That is like paying for a product that you didnt receive. Insurance? I think not more like robbery

Snapshot, Progressive's MPH tracker, is awful and completely impractical. It beeps obnoxiously whenever you "hard brake" more than 7 mph per second. If you're driving 45 MPH and brake at a constant 7 MPH / second, you will need 280 feet to completely stop. Progressive thinks you're "hard braking" if you have less than a football field to stop. Yeah, good luck with that. 

SAFETY WARNING: Snapshot is probably unsafe for new drivers. It may cause them to hesitate in a situation where a hard brake is required to avoid an accident. 

While I really like the concept of insurance rates being affected by real-world driving data, this system is so poorly thought out (counting 8 MPH/second as a "hard brake") that the only way to avoid getting beeped is to drive dangerously under the speed limit. 

The final straw for me was when Snapshot claimed I was "hard-braking" while pulling into my driveway.

Okay, so you bought a car.

Maybe you paid cash if you're Thurston Howell III, or financed it if you're Gilligan.

Anyway, you'll need insurance, right? 

There are worse choices than Progressive, and there are better choices. 

Why choose Progressive?

- They're relatively inexpensive, if you want to pay for bare-bones, state minimum liability insurance.

- If you want to go all Richie Rich with the extras, buying comprehensive, collision, and uninsured motorist coverage or your car, it's still a bargain. 

- Claims are handled in a [sort of] timely manner. If some douchewallet scrapes your fender and you need to get it painted, an adjuster will usually make it out to the bodyshop within two or three days to pay for the damage, reducing the time you need to take buses or taxis.

Why you SHOULDN'T choose Progressive:

- Really slow customer service. If your car is broken down in the middle of the road and you're calling Progressive to send you some roadside assistance, it's not uncommon to be on hold for ten minutes or more, while people are honking at you and telling you to get a horse.

- If you DO call Progressive to send you roadside assistance, count on the operator saying "they'll be there in thirty minutes". Then count on help actually arriving two hours later. (NOT hyperbole)

- Even if you pay a huge premium each month to protect yourself, Progressive will fight you tooth and nail to save themselves a few bucks on repairing your dented bumper, at a cost of time and increase in blood pressure for you.

- Speaking of which, count on Progressive to try to tell you that your one year old Audi A4 is a "total loss" so that they can give you $3000 scrap value instead of paying to fix your door. Seriously, WTF?

- Their spokeswoman, the beehive-sporting "Flo", will haunt your dreams.

Basically, when it comes right down to it, Progressive is decent insurance if you just want to prove to the policeman who pulled you over that you're legally insured to drive a vehicle.

Walking in a straight line and following the pen-light is still up to you...

-- but for serious insurance, buy Triple A, which is what I'm going to do now (and which is what I should have done, FIRST).

Stay safe, hottie. I call shotgun.

In late August 2016, a tree branch speared and shattered the back window of my 2016 Audi Q5 in Rockville, MD. I used Progressive's suggested repair shop  - Safelite Auto Glass - and the repair was not done to my satisfaction as I could hear glass rattling around within the back hatch of the car. I was unable to reach inside this back door myself with a vacuum and I expected the clean up to be done during the repair- apparently Safelite does not have this capability.  In addition to being an irritant this is also a safety hazard, so I went to the Audi dealership for them to blow out the remaining glass shards using compressed air. Progressive did not reimburse me for the full amount (after deductable) stating that they had an estimate from a different shop for a lesser amount. Then why didn't they send me to this shop to being with? I don't have time to travel around at Progressive's whim to repair centers I neither know nor trust to complete a job that should have been done right the first time. To add insult to injury, the callous Progressive representative I spoke with over the phone said that Progressive does not normally pay for clean up and I should be happy with what I got. This was only a simple glass claim - what would be the attitude with a more serious claim? If this unacceptable cavalier service is how Progressive is able to keep the costs of their policies down then I want no part of it. I can guarantee today that I will not be renewing this policy in July 2017.

If i could give negative stars i would. I'm not even a customer nor will i ever be. I am an insurance agent myself and my parents switched over to my company from Geico. I noticed my quote for them showing that my dad has a Progressive policy for about 2 years. He does have a commercial policy with them so thats what i figured it was. It turns out someone with my dads same name somehow found my dads name, date of birth, and license number to open a policy with his information. I started noticing wrecks for people i didnt know and a wreck in July 2015 coming up for my dad in Houston. We have never lived in Houston or owned a 2013 Tacoma so this threw up a red flag for me. I have been trying to get Progressive to fix this situation by giving me proof that the wreck is not his to remove it from the policy i have for him and also to cancel the policy. My dad has at least twice already, told them i have authorization to speak for him and they refuse to notate it so everytime i call they keep refusing to help. My dad doesn't speak english very well  plus he's a business owner so he's a very busy man. It has been over a month we've been trying to solve this and we are starting to get a feeling that Progressive is just wanting to take advantage of my dads information to give those other people a good deal. They're treading a fine line at this point and we are about ready to get lawyers involved if this doesnt get fixed soon

Progressives treatment of me , told me they don't want me to do any Bess with them!  Rude , and lairs!!  Sent me a quote and the cost was not on it!! then when calling them back to start auto Ins. the cost change's  Now u see why the numbers weren't in the Email!   F  U  Flo

When I got this insurance everything was great. They fail to keep you updated with all their gimmicks. I moved to a better living area(less dangerous as to accidents) but they argued my rate had to go up an extra $20 because of my new location. My coverage was high enough and after a year of making all payments on time and always being on schedule, I was hoping my coverage would decrease. but instead kept getting higher.

Decided to cancel my policy and swtiched to Geico-- actually did save on so much more. A total of $150 in savings. FOR THE SAME COVERAGE. 

When I cancelled w. Progressive the rep. told me there was an $11 cancellation fee. I TOLD HIM TO WITHDRAW IT FROM MY ACCNT. on the day it would be due. He said okay, and I thought there would be no problem.

Well.. after a month of not being w. them anymore, I get an email saying I have a past due balance of $11. That they had contacted the collection agency now. 

ARE YOU KIDDING ME? I called immediately and made the payment and asked for the conversation that I was recorded in when I had specifically said that "I authorize the withdrawal of $11 on the due date" Well.. since this was their fault that conversation was "impossible" to obtain.

Honestly, some people owe $100s and I paid on time ALL the time and I get the collection agency called on for $11? 

PATHETIC AUTO INSURANCE COMPANY!

Make sure you do your research well people!

We have been clients of Progressive for well over a decade. Our rates have stayed far lower than our previous insurer, who kept raising them despite a clean record. We have used roadside assistance a few times and they have been consistently excellent. 
Other insurers are sometimes ordered to refund customers due to excessive charges. Progressive to my knowledge, has never been the source of such controversy. We plan to stay with them for life. I noticed that the average rating for Progressive is only three stars. Perhaps competitors are planting bogus reviews. Perhaps customers are venting prematurely. In my experience, Progressive is as good as it gets. My car has been hit while parked a couple of times and they always were there with sound advice. Our monthly bill is about half of what we used to pay. Great service and low rates: Why go anywhere else?

Blamed me for everything saying that i started the accident.  Proved with documentation and statement saying that i was not at fault for accident.  Didn't help me with anything, and my case was tossed around in between 5 DIFFERENT CLAIMS REPS!  What company in their right mind would do that.  My case was handle for a little over a month now and i'm at a lost of words on how my claim was handle.  I'm done with this BS company and taking my other 2 cars out from their policy!!!!! 

Jeremy Morgan, Erika Javier, Meritza - You guys are extremely unhelpful.  Made senseless claims regarding my accident and antagonized me for asking questions!  Get out of the customer service industry and learn to treat people nicer!

I would score Progressive lower if possible.  We bought a new 5th wheel RV and had it insured through Progressive.  It never left the dealer lot as we had some work done to the RV and had the insurance one week when Progressive canceled it suddenly.  The reason Progressive gave us is that since we were using it two to three weeks a year it was declared our primary home.  When asked where we were supposed to be living the other 49 weeks of the year, they said that was not their problem since the RV was our primary home.  We will not recommend or use a company that thinks that three weeks a year is a primary home.  When we talked to another representative she could not explain why they canceled the policy, but indicated that we must have told them that the RV was going to be our primary home because they would not have made that type of mistake.  No matter how you figure it Three weeks is not even close to 52 weeks a year and Progressive just made themselves look like unprofessional incompetent people.  WE WILL NEVER USE THEM AGAIN!

I am writing you because I am EXTREMELY disappointed in the service I received from Progressive after my accident. When my car was returned the first time, I complained because there was a noise coming from the right side of my car (the side hit in the accident and had been "completely" repaired). It sounded like a popping noise and metal rubbing together, I brought my car back to the service center, it was sent back to the mechanic and upon my vehicles return I was told the mechanic could not find anything wrong and I would have to pay a dealership to do a diagnostic and then only if the dealership told Progressive that it was accident related would it be covered and possibly the cost of the diagnostic. Which did not make any sense to me because the noise was coming from the side I was hit on and it was not making that noise before the accident or at the sense of the accident. I continued to drive my car while I saved to pay additional money for a diagnostic from a dealership. A few weeks go by and the noise has intensified and was constant, there was a new additional noise being made every time I put the vehicle in reverse. 
I called your 1800 number and explained that there is something wrong and the Progressive Representative told me "your car does not sound like it is safe to be driving please bring it back to the center for repairs." With a sigh of relief I do just that upon arrival my car is driven by an employee they acknowledge that the sound is not right and there is something wrong, then proceed to tell me there is nothing they can or would be willing to do and I have to take it to a dealership because the mechanic will not find anything wrong. I was floored, to say the least, how could the mechanic not find something wrong the car screeches and makes noise whenever in motion.  Also an employee of Progressive told me to bring the car back for repairs!! I left infuriated 
I took my car in for an oil change to Big O Tires and asked them to take a look while they were working on it and guess what... MAGICALLY they found something! My rear right brake pad was badly damaged due to "scrap metal" being wedged in it and the rotor was broken due the extreme damage from the metal. $300 dollars later Big O was able to replace the rotor and brake pad and my car is like new. 
I find it unacceptable that your "mechanic" was not able to figure that out forcing me to pay an additional $300 dollars for my car to be fixed. Not to down play the employees of Big O Tires but if they can figure out this issue that your mechanic said didn't exist, it may be time to send your customers cars to someone new and step it up! I cannot even give the benefit of the doubt that everyone makes mistakes because when my car was returned the very first time there was a MASSIVE crack in my windshield that required me to take it back in, that was the free pass. For this accident I had to take my car back 4 times due to this being handled poorly, I was lead to believe that customer service was something Progressive prided itself on. That is not something that I experienced at all. 

I would like to know if I will be reimbursed for the rotor and brake pads that I had to pay to be replaced after my accident repairs. I feel like I should receive a reimbursement due to the fact I tried twice to have your "mechanic" fix this issue and my rotor would not have had to be replaced if it was taken care of when I took it back the first time.

Progressive raised my rates. Switched to geico. Did save money. I Called progressive to dump them. They said don't leave, we can give you a better rate. Should have given me the best rate in the first place. Almost 20 years with them.

F U, Progressive.  I have never heard of an insurance company that charges you to cancel your policy early.  Any time I have canceled for any reason with other insurance companies, I have received a nice check in the mail for the remainder of the policy.  Not Progressive.  I canceled our motorcycle insurance a whole month early because we sold the bike.  I got an email back from Progressive stating that they are charging us a $30 cancellation fee.  Wha??  $30 to cancel a $250/year policy, with only one month left?  I called & spoke to a robotic, non-apologetic customer service rep who stated that the $30 fee stands & they will be sending me a final bill.  I'm pretty sure that bill will get "lost in the mail" cuz there's no way I'm paying it.

BTW I hate Flo, too.

I had a very bad experience with Progressive Claim Department.  This auto insurance has a very weird policy: if there is an incident, even if it is obvious there is no way it may cause bodily injuries, if there is a claim for such, the insurance pays them the minimum liability $700 for bodily injuries even if it is fraud or a lie.  Check out very carefully their liability - it literally says "even if it is fraud or a lie".  

This happened to me when backing out of a parking space touched another parked car.  The police did not give me any tickets, we were asked to exchange insurance info.  I reported the incident to the claim department and the associate assured me it was a minor incident of no consequence. 

The other car owners were outside of the car, even one of them inside a store.  These two people kept screaming at the top of their  lungs and acting as if something terrible had happened.  They started hitting and kicking my car .  

Ordered by the police these two persons were asked to stay inside the car till I took pictures of their bumper, which I sent to my insurance.  There were NO damages on the bumper! NO damages!

I stayed in touch with the CD for a while, and I was always assured this was a minor incident.  Only three months later I learned quite by chance from another source, my driving record had registered "bodily injury".  Calling back the CD, the supervisor told me what their policy was and he added: as ridiculous as it is, we have to pay them, even we know that kind of incident can never cause any sort of injuries, we have to pay them so that they do not pursue other claims and don't sue us".

I tried to fight it as much as I could but Progressive defended this ridiculous policy of theirs and even when they admitted there was no way I could have caused any injuries, they still did not fix my driving record.  

This is clearly a policy that invites wrongdoers to have their way and make an easy breezy 700 bucks!  Thank God there are plenty of other auto insurances out there!

I got into a car accident, and the person who was in the accident with me has Progressive Insurance. Thank goodness I have Allstate (their customer service is AMAZING, i noticed that after this experience). Having to deal with Progressive was nothing short of a nightmare.
Police were called to the accident scene, they determined 50/50 liability for the accident (half my fault and half the other person's fault). They inspected the vehicles themselves and the position they were in. Allstate, my insurance company, determined 50/50 liability based on the evidence I provided them.
Progressive, on the other hand, determined it was 100% my fault. No questions, no options, they wouldn't budge on the decision. Somehow out of thin air this was completely my fault.
NOT ONLY did they falsely blame me for the accident (so that way, they don't have to pay for any of my damages) BUT Xavier (his direct line: (813)371-4022) was EXTREMELY rude on the phone. When I asked to have my vehicle inspected by Progressive, his EXACT response was "Well, we aren't going to cover it anyway, so we're not going to inspect it." Talk about SCUMBAG customer service. Even when I explained to him how the accident went down, he said "What you're saying doesn't make any sense." Maybe I started speaking a foreign language while I was on the phone with him, who knows. I will never deal with Progressive or Xavier and his unapologetic, uptight schoolgirl demeanor. If you're going to be employed by a company, at least attempt to act like an adult and provide solutions to people. Provide customer service... You can guarantee everyone I know will hear about this. Progressive seems to have a crappy reputation anyway, so I doubt they will care to change much. The way it looks, they already have this problem enough. I guess that's what happens when you employ a bunch of greedy, useless lowlifes to work for a scumbag corporation. You get treated like dirt!

First off I want to say: I will never be a Progressive customer again in my life. Never. And I will actively, now and forever, try to deter potential customers. I've already switched my SOs and brothers car, rental and motorcycle policies from Progressive as well. You'll notice I have an active motorcycle policy? Yup, that's gone too. The new truck and my other 3 motorcycles sitting in my garage (one being brand new)? Yes, I will be covering those under someone else, too. It is not enough of a Risk Transference to be 'covered' through Progressive. I was a customer for YEARS, and enjoyed my customer experience enough to recommend it to anyone for insurance needs because the price was alright and I never had a bad experience, that is until I had my first and only claim with you. 

My experience was 100% terrible. There wasn't a good moment through the entire process. Not once. Your customer service was rude. It was extremely difficult to go through them to get a claim agent on the line who could even do anything. The claim agents were also rude and not helpful (think "Computer Says 'No'" from Little Britain). And end the end? My claim was denied, because "my policy didn't cover it." It did cover the damages?! It absolutely did cover the damages. At the beginning of financing this vehicle I was required to get full coverage. I had the lender AND the dealer fax the copy over to the number the representative their copies of my original policy. Not only was my policy changed, but Progressive completely denied actually changing my policy!! AND I was still paying the amount for the ORIGINAL coverage!

You'd think that I must have had an accident that would have caused Progressive so much cost in damages I'd be a liability to keep as a customer, right? No. I grazed a pillar in a parking garage. The repair bill came out to just over $900 on my cheap $14,000 car. My original deductible was $500. It would have only been a $400 and some change bill vs a $900 bill. That's nothing. If my rate would have gone up more than the $400 in the next two years I'd have paid it out of pocket even. But it's the principal of the issue. You were rude. You were unhelpful. You were impossible to get a hold of and to get an update out of unless I was breathing down your neck multiple times a week. And you didn't provide me the services I very clearly paid for, in a legally definisble way. I have the copies of the original policy that my lender and dealer provided me. You have the copies of the original policy that my lender and dealer provided you. You're damn right I'd have sued if it were worth the time and effort, but dropping you as a customer and switching all of the policies I pay for ended up saving me that $900 over a 14 month period.   

Over the 7 years I've been a customer, I've paid probably $8,000 to you. I hope you enjoy that $8,000 - because you weren't there for me in transferring liability when I needed you. I've made it a personal mission to take at least 4 times of that out of you by convincing and deterring potential customers, whether in person or over social media. I'll just include the evidence I have, and let it speak for itself so they can form their own opinion. The copy of my policy with the $500 collision and comprehensive deductible and the list of coverage and your terrible (and slow) responses and emails. People should know there is a very real possibility they won't be covered under an insurance policy that clearly states they'd be covered, or that their policy can get changed magically at any time without them being aware of it (or being recorded by Progressive). That should be illegal, and I wouldn't be surprised if it is. 

I can't even imagine what would have happened if I a serious claim. You can see why I'd be this upset. $900 is nothing, It was my first EVER claim I've had and I was treated like shit.  

You and your rude and non-responsive customer service can shove it. I feel like I've been robbed.

BEHIND THE TIMES
In today's modern world, it's bad enough that I have to constantly call TD Bank to get a new password for my online banking account.

So, I wasn't surprised when their iPhone app could not scan my check deposit.

Before you rave too much about how wonderful or fancy TD can be, you need to understand how sneaky they can be. Google Mortgage Collateral Charge and learn what it mean, the cons as well as the pro's.  Then if you have a TD mortgage, ask yourself, did they tell you this?
TD Bank is the only bank that registered all mortgages as a collateral charge. Not because it is good for you, but because it is good for them and it becomes a bit of a trap. Don't believe me, google it.  If you have been burned by a TD Collaterial Charge Mortgage and didn't know what you were getting into click on the useful bottom. Lets see how many of us were fooled and taken advantage of.

Josh helped us with our home and auto insurance.  We hadn't checked our home policy in a while and when we did we realized our premiums had gone up almost $400.  Josh's firm was recommended and I contacted him, he took care of everything, found us a great policy and even saved us money in auto insurance too. Completely love this company! We have been with them for years. Communication is thorough, and complicated insurance information is explained really well. We receive responses from Josh quickly, normally within a couple hours. Josh is awesome. He has great communication skills, is super responsive and always gets us the best price. Josh is an absolute professional and gave me options to save me a lot of money right away!  He was very responsive to my questions and extremely quick with a a high quality auto quote that was hundreds less than my current policy!

I worked with Josh Berg and I can't say enough nice things about working with him. Not only was he fast and very efficient he got me the lowest quotes possible which I was very grateful for. I was referred to Josh at Blue Lion Insurance by one of my friends. I was initially a skeptic as my job causes me to cross paths with a lot of insurance agents. I have been extremely happy with Blue Lion. I work with Josh and he is always on top of everything! THESE EMPLOYEES ARE THIEVES!!! I went into to get a money order and they took $20 from me. Then once my friend went in for a money order as well as they tried to tell her that she was short. Sales calls don't stop. Trying to win business back and sell more stuff by being pushy without excepting any responsibility. If Paychex issued me a full refund for all the money I spent with them and gave me free service for life, I would pass. Avoid at all costs. Would not recommend them at all.

   We use PAYCOM now. They are LESS EXPENSIVE and so much BETTER!

 I have spent more than an 1-1/4 hours trying to get technical support to assist with some minor changes i did not know how to make. After one year and many things not being done as we requested we went somewhere else and are pleased with did. As a business owner my time is too valuable to deal with this stuff.

Wow now I can see why people think Yelp is a lot of BS! you leave a review for a business and you don't factor it in????? Your a Joke Yelp and your reputation is being exposed!!! If you are looking to sell some jewelry and want to deal with intelligent, honest professionals who care about the customer, Biltmore Loan and Jewelry is the place. Sent an e-mail initially, no response.  Called the office a few days later and spoke with Wayne, he gave his direct e-mail.  He seemed interested and asked me to send photos directly to him for a "quicker" response. He stated he got my e-mail and that was it.

Just moved back from San Diego and have to take care of my parents estate in Fountain Hills. Liars, I have a very rare gold medal that's ONE OF A KIND. I called Biltmore jewelry and loan, and the idiot said that they just sold a medal just like mine for scrap. Do not come here!!! Lady who runs this place is BEYOND rude. They also lost my W2s and tried to convince me I lost them. They handed out cards claiming to give 50 in cash or 75 dollar off your fee for filing. When I brought it up to her she told me they don't give people money for walking in their door. They got me a cheaper quote than Geico by $96 a month and by a better rated company as well. I'm happy and paying less. Friendly, quick, and knowledgable staff. 

I've now been with Oasis for 3 years and am pleased to hear that when I refer others they have the same experience as me.

Dustin is always excellent. I love the Chandler office. I can send an email and get a response almost immediately. They get you in and out as soon as they possibly can. The best part is that most of what I need to do can be handled via email so I don't have to take time off. He's very polite and I don't feel rushed. This office has been great since the first day and continues to exceed expectations! Thank you

Lakreesha did a fantastic job with her customer service! Upon entering, I was greeted. She assisted me in what I needed and also, listed various options. Lakreesha was patient and answered every question I had. Loved her personality! I recommend this location.
Tina is my tax lady and seriously is the greatest. She explains any question I have to the T. She is quick and very efficient. Ask for her if you're looking for a tax person! She's great!
I love my Serene and Eastern Branch.  Everyone is professional, caring and enjoys greeting their customers with a smile.  Their personable skills are bar-none.  Thank you for all that you do.

I am extremely frustrated with Silver State right now. Every time I try to logon to their website I get a notice that they are having technical difficulties. After sending 3 payments I get a notice in the mail that my auto loan is in default and in separate envelopes I received my checks from Wells Fargo stating that they are unable to accept my payments. eh.....you gotta get money from ATM sometimes

Ryan is extremely knowledgeable and helpful every time I have spoken with him. You can truly tell he is passionate about his line of work and takes pride in what he does. I highly recommended anyone interested in opening an account or has an existing account, to go see him!

Small, cramped location just off of Eastern and Serene. 

I used to make deposits here using the shared branching, but they recently discontinued that. 

Most of the tellers I encountered were pleasant. Although one of the clerks gave me inaccurate directions to another branch recently which led to a frustrating,  wild goose chase. 

Meh. I've experienced better.

Great bank and great people! I went in to open up an account and to see if they were going to have an account that would fit me. We were helped immediately and we were helped by a good guy named Gilbert. He was very accommodating and willing to do everything we needed to get done. ALL of the people are friendly and all have personalities. Its very nice to see that and give this good of a review to a place I am handing my money over to.

My job includes title work, so I have a very good understanding of how it all works. I have had the displeasure of working with these folks on several occasions, one of which was me AND my customer coming back to fix their mistake. The entire staff is very inexperienced and confused. They actually told me they couldn't transfer a title and lost us a sale, and our future business with this place. Not to mention they are SLOW and EXPENSIVE! I wish they were better, their location is perfect for me, but I will stick with other 3rd party title companies, don't waste your time and money.

I had very positive experience with them! Their APR for my title loan is the lowest in the industry. Literally, if you are in the situation that you need to pawn your title, and you are in Phoenix, AZ area, then don't even think where to go. I suggest 1Stop!

It's tax day so I just thought of writing this review for my accountant and tax person. I am an attorney and personally use Jessica for both my personal and business returns. I also refer her to numerous clients who have been very pleased with her services. She has been especially helpful with clients who are handling final tax returns as personal representative of a probate.

What I really appreciate about Jessica and her team is how often they communicate with us throughout the year to make sure we are taking the most advantage of our payroll, quarterly taxes, deductions, etc. If she sees we are doing something wrong in our Quickbooks we are able to quickly adjust without waiting until "tax- time." This proactive approach gives me confidence that she is truly concerned about my business and our goals. Her tax and accounting counsel and advice makes her stand out from other individuals who have merely just filed our returns at the end of the year.

If you are looking for a proactive accountant/tax person for either your personal returns or business, I highly recommend Accounting Services by ACP.

Have to say I was very disappointed in their services. I went to establishment to get my personal taxes done and I am not sure if they deal more with businesses to complete taxes or what but when I attempted to follow up regarding something I didn't think I was informed of by them during initial session I reached out at least 5 times, maybe more, with emails and calls, I even talked to their staff and I never received a return call back. Unfortunately, I would not recommend to anyone I know.
First class service all the way!  We have been going here for three years now and I wish I had found them sooner.  Thank you for making things so easy.

We needed someone to help us navigate our tax return this year with an out of state move, home office and real estate transfer. I turned to Yelp and trusted the 5 star reviews. Let me say we were not disappointed at all! What we felt was a "complicated" situation, Jessica handled with ease and confidence. She even found some deductions we overlooked and gave us advice on future withholdings. Her price was affordable, too. Will definitely return next year!

I have been working with Jessica and her team for several years. First for my personal tax needs and now for my business. Jessica's tax advice has saved me a lot of money over the years.  Her knowledge and expertise extends beyond my own personal needs and allows me to give guidance to my clients. Of course, with a referral back to Jessica for the expert advise. 

I consulted another CPA, after being referred by a colleague, based on a need for my foreign investor clients. After interviewing the CPA, I felt comfortable, but in trying to follow up with additional questions, my emails and calls were never returned. 

Jessica always returns my emails and calls. Furthermore, she had as much, if not more, expertise as the high priced CPA!

I highly recommend Jessica and her team for your business or personal tax needs.

Jessica and the rest of the team at ACP Accounting have been my accountants for years. I'm extremely detail-oriented and picky, I go through my numbers with a fine-toothed comb and I trust Jessica completely!! 

When my husband & I were scheduled to close on a house and I needed some tax information in an emergency, Jessica walked me through what to do while she was sitting in the chair at the dentist's office!! She was getting her teeth cleaned & asked them to stop for a minute while she helped me. Can you believe that? What amazing service!!!  What accountant do you know that would do that for you?!? I couldn't believe it. I was able to get what I needed and close on the house as scheduled. 

Jessica has been a great consultant for me with my business as well. During our semi-annual financial review, she asks thought-provoking questions, provides significant feedback and takes the time to answer all my questions while acting as a sounding board. 

I'm so impressed with ACP Accounting, I can't imagine I'll ever have another accountant.

I've been working with Jessica and Adam for my business and personal taxes/accounting. They have been nothing but awesome! Always very punctual, informative and will tell you exactly how it is. If you need to change anything or do something different to improve your current position, they are all over it. Highly recommend for business and/or personal services.

I started my business about a year ago and as much as I enjoy accounting I just couldn't keep up with it and still manage all the orders.  Jessica and Adam took the time to meet with me and understand my business.  They took a very hectic situation and transitioned all of my accounting needs into a very seamless part of my business.  

My taxes have become complex with so many different forms needed.  They put everything together very professionally.  

I can't say enough great things about them.  Plus they have the best location ever, right in the middle of down Gilbert.  I always just stop by when I'm having lunch or breakfast, it's really great.

I highly recommend them to anybody who needs a professional accountant.

Jessica, Adam and her staff are really fantastic.  They truly understand both the small-business owner and how to save them money on taxes, as well as the average person that just has a W2.  They will make sure you have the lowest possible tax bill allowable by law.  Last year, we had 2 years of our taxes "reviewed" by the IRS because my husband travels extensively for business purposes.  The first year was the year prior to working with her.  She helped tremendously - so much so that we walked out of the review with no further documentation required, which NEVER happens with the IRS!   They are actually...dare I say...FUN to work with!!

I've been coming to Aces Tax for years and they always give me professional service. Service is always friendly and fast. I'm in and out in no time even when they're busy. I'm greeted then soon I'm sitting with one of their friendly staff members. I've never had any problems with their service all of these years and they always get me my full tax return. I always look forward to seeing these foks during tax season. 

I remember they used to be at Commercial Center, then had an establishment on west Sahara. Now located on S. Maryland Parkway close to Goldilocks Bakery...mmmm MAMON!!!

NEVER EVER coming back here again!!! They did my tax, and I recieved my refund, then a few weeks later I recieved a notification from IRS that I owe almost a thousand dollars!! Which confused me, because I provided all legitimate paperworks (W2form, bank reports, and school reports) to ACES TAX, and they did the rest! So I dont understand why this happened. Never had this happen before! I called IRS, and they said that I owe that amount, I asked them how and why when It's this company that did my taxes, and they said to talk to them, I went back to Aces tax office, and talked to the owner CHITO, he looked at the letter, and completely told me somehting different from the paper as if he didnt even read or understand what the paper said, and guess what his solution was?? He said to call IRS!! I was like are you freaking serious!?!? I paid them pretty big plus tipped them when they did my tax, and now I owe IRS money because of their mistake, that they DIDN'T even try to help fin a solution or FIX it.! Horrible people! Horrible Place! they seemed uneducated when I came back to have him fix the problem! I guess the people who does taxes here only knows how to INPUT numbers from the paper we bring them to the software they have on their computer!! DO NOT COME TO THIS PLACE!!! Til now I stilll have problem with IRS because of this! Andmy family and I are very good abiding citizens of the UNITED STATES! Do not come here!!

This place is awesome. Great DVDs for only a dollar and video games in good condition for 5 bucks each.  I got 5 really good xbox 360 games for a total of $25 and they barely had any scratches on them. This is my second time coming here. Last time I bought a ton of movies. I guess this time was video games time. The workers are nice and quick. The store is small but there's a lot in that little space somehow. The games I got were Fallout 3,  Bulletstorm, Tekken 5,  Soul Calibur V and Town Raider Underworld. I'll come back in another week or two to see what other games they'll have. One of my favorite pawn shops. This place is way cheaper than gamestop for video games.

I went in trying to buy a laptop. Friendly staff but didnt know anything about what they were selling. I asked if i could get a cheaper price on 2 laptops since i am buying them together and after confirming with the manager the employee tells me "only if you buy them as is which means no return." I called back less than an hour later realizing that the laptop battery connector was broken. The manager told me that since i got the "as is deal" i would not be able to return it even though i purchased it less than an hour earlier. I went to see how much it would cost to fix and it was more than the purchasing price for both macs.

This is a sketchy business that sells broken goods to people. The only reason anyone should go their is to try to sell their broken goods because this pawn shop seems to sell them

It's a pawn store so I'm ranking this place by selection, price, service, and flexibility. If you pawn anywhere, only expect to get about 1/3 of an item's lowest sold price on eBay. Is that a rip off? Yes of course it is. But thats how stores make money, pay their employees, and how one gets cash money fast (hint: use Craigslist for fair market prices). Try to negotiate at least 50% if you have desirable stuff or solicit here often. I don't do jewelry so no experience here. 

Selection is often better than most but small--the usual tools, electronics, jewelry. Some decent guitars every so often. Prices are on steep side, negotiate whenever you can. They have some flexibility, unlike Super Pawn. Service is lacking but generally good for what it is: a pawn store. Oh, yeah, no grace period. Return policy not too shabby but make sure you establish terms up-front. 

Pro tip: always hard case your guitars, or otherwise  protect your pawned gear, most folks don't care about your stuff until too late.

I could not believe how terrible this store is.  They are new at this location and the first day I go to sell something, which was like Memorial day I think, they are closed, so I go back and they offer me $70 for my guitar.  I said I would think about it and they said come back in and we will give you the $70 if you do decide to sell it.
