So I take it back in a week later with a few other items and they say $65 for everything. I could not believe it, they said well maybe you should have taken it at that time.  They are ripping people off, giving them low dollar amounts for their items and then jacking up the price to almost 3 times what an item is worth.  They were selling a used play station in there for $450. I will never recommend this place.

Wow! So first of all their stuff is overpriced, criminally overpriced.  Second all they do (pretty much all pawn shops FYI) is look up eBay prices and offer you like 25% of what they could sell it for on eBay. Even knowing that this place fails hard.

$100 offer for iPhone 5c with all the accessories. What a joke.

I had researched all of the title loan places in Las Vegas and found Money USA to have the best rates. In most cases, it was not even close. The repayment options were also very favorable. The Manager was very helpful and did a great job explaining everything to me. 
Thank you,
Phil Upchurch

Today, 12/7/16, I had the pleasure of being helped by Claudia in the West Ann office. She was incredibly efficient and helpful, and could fully answer all my questions. After talking to her, I was fully convinced that a USA Money Today title loan was my best option, and I thoroughly trust the process (and the company).
I recommend this office to everyone. There is no need to shop further for a title loan- this is the place, Ask for Claudia.

Gary Gibson and the staff truly goes above and beyond to take care of the needs of their customers.  So glad to have them working for me! Anyone looking to have honest, reliable, trustworthy people looking after their insurance needs should consider this team.

I have never really had a positive experience with any insurance company, that is until I met Gary Gibson at his State Farm Agency.  Gary has probably been the only person that I can remember that actually truly listened to my needs and really seemed to care about my situation rather than just selling me something!  He sincerely tried to help me in choosing the best program while saving me money when it came to both my auto and home insurance!  He changed my whole outlook on insurance and how it can help you.  The customer service by his staff was also superior!  I will be back soon to start life insurance policies for my daughters!  Thanks Gary, for a wonderful experience!

I have been a member here for about 7 years now.  The staff is always helpful, the benefits of this Credit Union are great!  Multiple locations makes it easy to stop in no matter where you are in Eastern Cuyahoga, Lake, or Ashtabula.  Their rates are unbeatable.  They have a very comfortable waiting area with TV, Keurig and other mild refreshments.  For members, they offer a coin counting machine.  Check out Cardinal Community Credit Union, they are WAY better than any bank out there!

All banks conduct legalized fraud, but PNC does it under the radar.  This review has been a long time coming, but unfortunately, you won't care what I say until it happens to you. :)  Let's start with ATM's, you wanna use one?  Then you better use a PNC or an extra $2.50+ fee will be added on top of what ever the other ATM charges you.  That's right, lets say your in Tokyo (only 1 bank in the heart of Tokyo will accept your card anyway,  all others will fail ) and they say $5.00 fee (in Yen), well PNC will tag on their own $2.50+ just because they can.  What dicks you say? well let me also say another thing about international travel.  DON'T USE YOUR PNC CARD INTERNATIONALLY.  PNC uses Visa which they decided to set a 3% charge too.  So spend $100 PNC will take $3, ON EVERY PURCHASE.  My previous international travel bank Fidelity has since sold out, but before they only charged a 1% fee.  Before you laugh and giggle about pocket change then picture this.  International at that you can only pull out up to $200 from, sub-track 10% (3%+ ATM Fees) of that and realize that it goes directly into the pockets of your financial institution, of which your money is supposed to keep afloat while they rob you blind any which way they can.

Sheetz ATM surcharge free?  Think again, Sheetz won't charge you, but PNC will. .

Heads up: I haven't been in this location and don't even do my banking with PNC, so don't put much weight on this comment.  (I wouldn't if I was looking for a place to handle my money.)

This place is a neighborhood eyesore - has to be the filthiest bank branch I've ever seen.  PNC is reasonably profitable, so why can't they spend a little cash to clean up their parking lot, plant some new trees (they let the current ones die), and pick up the thousands of cigarette butts from the front of their building?   I'm not asking for a renovation of the place, but a bank building should inspire confidence in what they're doing inside.  I wouldn't trust these guys with the bowl of pennies on my dresser.
absolutely the worst customer service! with plenty of banking choices literally within a block of this place. run as fast as you can away from here!

Had to replace my debit card due to fraud / data breach. Much easier experience than at my previous bank.  So nice to drop into the branch and have a new card printed on site. Sometimes there's a wait at this location but today I was in and out in 10 minutes.

After a pipe burst in our home and water drained for days while we were on vacation, we needed to find temporary housing right away. Our insurance company, Farmer's, assigned us to a contact at CRS who was supposed to help us find a place to stay. I emailed them several potential properties that I had researched myself and they promised they would look into them. When I didn't hear from them the next day (we were supposed to move asap) I emailed and they assured me they were looking into it. The next day they assigned me to a "level 2" specialist since inventory was hard to find, but that person did not even try to contact me for two days after. I ended up booking a place myself on Air BnB -- it was one of the properties I had sent them and the person renting it got back to me within 30 minutes of me emailing them. My experience was CRS was less than helpful -- it was a total waste of my time.

Agree with the review below me. I've become a regular at this location because of the Asst. Manager Ralph. So helpful, caring, and always willing to go out of his way to help me and the other clients. Love the whole branch in general. Everyone is always in a good mood, greeting me as I walk in and always have smiles on their faces. Definitely the #1 bank in my opinion. :)
The customer service here is amazing! Debbie the manager will go out of her way to make sure you are satisfied and that all your needs are taken care of. Their staff is friendly and very outgoing.

I had been all around the area looking for a way to withdraw cash for a down payment on a lease and NOWHERE would anybody accept a debit for the purchase of certified funds.  Thanks to Silver Stare Schools i was finally helped. Latoya in the Albertson's branch was friendly, helpful and professional. Highly recommend this location!!

I currently have a vehicle loan through them which I have had no issues with. Very easy and secure payments. I just recently acquired a personal loan through them which I luckily was approved for, but it took a week and a half for them to say anything back about it. I was told that their committee only meets once a week for loans and that's why I feel it took so long. But the service that LaToya gave me was phenomenal! She kept in touch every step of the way and kept me informed with everything that she knew about it. Just from her great service is the reason why I rate this branch 5 stars. Thank you.

I only have positive things to say about David Habart state farm agent and his staff. David is one of the few agents that truly care about his clients. He will take the time to not only make sure your auto insurance needs are met but your life and health coverages. He has invested into a knowledgeable team, if you can't reach him Anna can answer any of your insurance questions. If you need insurance cards or help with a claim ask for Tina or Christina.

We have been with State Farm for many years and David Habart has been hands down the best agent we have dealt with. He is responsive, extremely helpful and easy to reach. He has taken the time to review all our policies on a regular basis and found ways to save us money. He really takes an interest in his clients and we have referred him to many of our friends, family and colleagues. Not sure what happened with the other reviewers that were not positive but our experience has always been positive.

A couple of years ago I bought a new home with the help of Todd Revenig and Academy Mortgage in Scottsdale.  I had previously lost a home due to the financial slowdown and job loss in 2008.  Todd helped my family get into a home without making us feel like complete losers.  We have been in our new home for two years and are very happy!  If anyone can guide you in your home buying process it is Todd.  A great guy who will help in any way possible.  By far my best experience dealing with anyone in the lending business.
Academy Mortgage were excellent to work with. They answered any and all of my questions and were very responsive. I would highly recommend them.

What more can I say about my experience with Bryan Nuorala?   He helped me with my initial loan, as well as my refinance.   With my original loan, we closed in less than 28 days!   The realtors were blown away.  He is prompt with responses, and my initial interest rate was even better than we initially expected. Will use again for sure.

Brandon was awesome! We tried to do a refi with another company before Academy and it went horribly wrong. Brandon and the team were amazing and were able to still get it done for us. Communication was on point and the whole process was super easy. Will highly recommend!

My experience with Dean Wegner and his colleagues at Academy Mortgage was absolutely exceptional from start to finish! Dean kept me well informed during my loan process and he found a loan that suited my unique needs. (I had a short sale 4 yrs ago.) He was always available and made sure I understood the whole process and answered my questions thoroughly and timely. The personalized videos of my loan's progress was fabulous. I loved them and they are so unique and I have never seen anything like them. Dean is amazing and I be back when I have any other mortgage needs and I will also refer anyone who will listen how great I was treated and how satisfied I am with my loan. Thanks much for everything!

We have used this branch of Academy Mortgage- and specifically Bryan Nuorala- for both refinancing a home, and for a new home purchase.  Bryan is very helpful and knowledgeable about the processes involved and was always available for our questions.  He even reached out to us after we had moved into our new home to see if there was anything else he could assist with.  He is a top-notch mortgage broker.
I worked with Jerry on my 30 yr fixed refinance and get very taken care of through the whole process. Whenever I had questions, Jerry did a wonderful job of making himself readily available.

Really about a 2 1/2. We t to Academy on the recommendation of my real estate agent. Probably a mistake. The loan officer never met me even once throughout the whole process. Everything was on the phone or via email. I even took papers to his office 4'times and he was never there - not in yet, went to the gym, is in the bathroom, etc. not very professional. Did everything get done on time?  Yes. For me, that's the minimum I have a right to expect. Fees are expensive compared to my eight other purchases, but this is the first in Arizona, so maybe they are in line with the area. I'm just disappointed that my loan officer seemed to work overtime avoiding me. I can't recommend this company.

Before I switched to State Farm I was spending an unbelievable amount of money for just insurance. Thanks to my agent Vanessa, I have saved a lot of time and money. She also provided me with a plan me and my wife are happy with. Super friendly and very informative on my purchase at State Farm. I recommend seeing Vanessa at State Farm to any one looking for insurance! Thanks!
I recently switched to State Farm thanks to Vanessa! She saved me a lot of money, she was also super friendly!!!

I have been working with Jen's office for over 5 years!  I have my car insurance, homeowners insurance, and life insurance coverage thru Statefarm.  I also have had a car loan with Statefarm bank and have my IRA through them.  Jen is highly educated on all that Statefarm has to offer and she provides nothing but the best service for her clients!  I highly recommend her office! A++

Been here awhile. Kate Olson is great. Very helpful and resourceful. Was able to save money in ways I wasn't aware of. You can always call her if you need your  insurance docs emailed to you. Highly recommend.

Jodi C. at this office is amazing. She helps me with every seemingly stupid question I have ever had with a big, genuine smile on her face. She is a true professional that knows what she is doing. Highly recommended to EVERYONE!

My loan officer was Cindy. I'm sorry girl, I never name drop bad reviews, but you need to learn how to return a phone call. Her card did tell us her work and cell phone number, but she never exclusively said we could call her cell, so it was alittle awkward calling her cell, especially since she never answered her work phone. I gave her two stars because she was very nice and attempted to answer all our questions. The main reason why we called was to get down payment assistance and she didn't even check for that, then my realtor tried calling her, both numbers, and it's officially been a week. Not one answer. Very disappointing, especially since we told her we were on a time crunch as well. Maybe the company isn't bad, but Cindy made us (first time home buyers) feel that we weren't important and that maybe she had better things to do.

Bought my first house with them quite a few years back and Jim Flynn made it super easy to get the loan for the house I wanted. Fast forward 3 years and he was there to help again when me and the wife wanted a new house. They have always been amazing very prompt with phone calls and emails they even gave me their cell numbers to make sure if I ever had questions they could take care of me. All in all I have used them 4 times twice with new houses and twice for streamline refinances. Thank you JIM, Sara, and Marie!! You guys are always the best over there!!

My wife and I purchased our first home and I have nothing but great things to say about Starboard. Our lender Jim Flynn was awesome! He walked us through every step and made all of the confusing details easy for us to understand. Thanks so much!

I went in here looking for a loan officer as a first time homebuyer. I met with Matt R. He seemed completely disinterested, provided me with false information that I cant find anywhere, and never even asked for my info to follow-up. I tried contacting him by email asking him where I can find these first time homebuyer programs because the website he gave me was for a town in CT and had nothing to do with buying a home! But, never got a response. The reviews are what made me want to go with Starboard Financial, but I see now they are probably fake and done by employees and their families. I found a loan officer elsewhere that provided me with several options as a first-time homebuyer and has kept in contact helping me through the process.

What a nightmare! If you don't fit into the perfect mold--forget about it. I spent more than two and a half months trying to get a simple refinance done. They charged me for an appraisal (that was a joke) and other fees and then couldn't get the loan done--it was a complete waste of time and money. My broker was very nice, but I'm sure he had his hands tied. I would NOT recommend this company.
Exchanged US for Canadian currency today.  No fee,  and the % was only .01 more than my phone reported.  My parking stub was validated and the transfer was fast and efficient. How easy is that!

As great as their reviews suggest. Fast, friendly, and extremely knowledgeable. Exchanged some US dollars for Mexican pesos. Garage is well lit and plenty of spaces close to elevator. Get your ticket validated for free parking. Great exchange rates to boot.
Great service, easy parking in the underground garage, and the exchange rate was fair.

Found this place thanks to Yelp. Lady at the desk was very nice. I didn't know if I was being charged a fee or not. Which it really didn't matter, since I just wanted to change my extra pesos for dollars. At the end I was just charged 2bucks and some change which was way better than what I was expecting, and better Than what I would of been charged if I would if sold them back in Mexico. The place is a bit hidden. I parked back in the suites by channel 8 since I did not see the underground parking for the building, until the lady at the desk told me about it. So I will know next time I come back.

I was greeted by a lady. She was really nice. I exchanged dollars for Japanese yen. They asked for my for my address info and that was it.  I paid I cash. I was in and out of the place in less than 5 minutes. 

The only issue I had was I didn't know that I had to park in the convention garage. I thought I had to pay, but they will validate the parking garage ticket. So all is good. 

All you gotta do is Park, go up the elevators and you will find this small hidden gem. Will be back for sure for any needs to exchange money. This place is cheaper than my bank wells Fargo.

I am incredibly surprised that this business has such high reviews. I was treated so rudely that I will never come back. I don't care if I have to pay a higher exchange rate. 

I arrived around 8:15 & waited for them to open. I waited until 8:30 to walk in & politely asked the woman behind the counter if they were open. I didn't want to rush them if they weren't ready for customers yet. She rolled her eyes at me & nodded that they were indeed open. I told her what I needed & she gave a big exasperated sigh to show me how much of an inconvenience it was to help me. I guess if you need a currency other than Pounds or Euros, they don't have it & they get aggravated at you if you didn't know to place an order beforehand. 

It totally would not have been a big deal if this lady wasn't so incredibly rude. Maybe she was just having a bad day, but if that's the case - don't come to work & act like an asshole to your customers.
First floor of PLAZA building.  Good exchange rate. Google said 39 they charged 41, much better than the banks.

We were greeted by Shannon she was extremely nice kind and helpful.. She made it soo easy to exchange the money and explain how much everything was worth .. The other lady's in the office were also helpful .. Thank you all for the exceptional service and smiley faces

The parking entrance isn't very visible from the street. You have to turn into the curved driveway in front of the building. It doesn't look like it, but there's an opening that leads into the underground parking lot. Look for the signs directing you to the "Tower" elevators.  

When you exit the elevator, take the doors to your right to enter the "Tower" building. Go down the hall then make your first right. Otherwise, you can enter through the front of the building. If so, the place is on your left as soon as you enter. Oh, don't forget to bring your parking ticket to get it validated at the shop.

The rates are pretty reasonable here. Stopped in, told them what I wanted, filled out a short form, and receive my currency. Straight forward and simple. Cash only.

I'm so happy I found this place! They're friendly and no hassle at all! I just went today during my lunch break and I was in and out of the place in no time even with 2 people ahead of me! They also validated my parking which was super nice! This is definitely the place to get the most current exchange rate of any type of currency with NO added extra service fees! You got most here than you would at a bank or the airport! I'd call ahead to make sure they have the currency you need in case you need a lot of them. From now on, I'll only go to this place for any currency exchange.

By far the place to exchange money! Got 18.05 PESO to 1 USD! In and out. Very nice staff! way better than airport rates (or bank)Located behind the Peppermill Lounge/ Ross.. Worth the drive! Ps.. Might want to call first to check on the amount of available funds that day.

So I had to go here  to exchange some dollars to Thailand Bahts, Philippine Pesos, and Korean Wons for my Asian trip. This was was located on convention drive Between Paradise and Las Vegas Blvd near the Ross.

Kinda far from where I love. I live in Henderson but oh well it's the only place that gives good rates on foreign currencies.

This place is great if you ever need to change dollars to whatever currencies. It beats waiting in the banks for your money to come and they will not rip you off.

This place is by far the best when it comes to exchange rates. I have been coming here since for about 12 years now at least once or twice a year.

The staff is great parking sucks though i recommend parking across the street over near the Ross and just walk to the building this place is located at.

I highly recommend this place for all your foreign exchange currencies you need done before you leave for your trip or for when you come back!
this place is great, good rates, fast service and friendly! i hardly ever write reviews.... park across the street at no charge

This place is awesome for exchanging currency.  The staff have always been friendly, the service is fast and you really get the best deal in town coming here.

I've used them several times before going to Mexico and this last time coming back, I came back with money and exchanged it back to US.  I guess I did not drink and eat enough in Mexico to come back with as many peso's as I did, but it was nice they were very friendly here and had no issue changing them back.

I highly recommend this place, its pretty easy to find and the new office they have is so much more welcoming then the other building they were in.
Quick and easy money exchange at great rates. Funny thing is, the ladies behind the counter have not traveled much. But they are making their kids travel (study abroad, live abroad, and so on).

Wow! I was literally in and out! There was no line, and I was assisted by Elizabeth, who was very kind. I needed to exchange my US dollars to Canadian dollars and my bank, Wells Fargo, was going to give me $470 CAD for $500 USD on top of their fee! So I heard of this place and decided to check it out from the positive reviews, and I'm glad I did!
They gave me $585 CAD for $545 USD! With NO FEES! Plus they validate your parking! Come here!!!! They are the best :)

I'm torn as to whether or not to take two stars from this place as opposed to just one but I decided, a single negative employee shouldn't ruin an otherwise great experience. 

I called ahead (I strongly recommend you do this), to see if they had two relatively rarer currencies available. The lady I spoke with said yes and that she would hold the money under my name for me until I could pick it up. I told her I would be in within a few days and thanked her for her time.

I went in on the day I asked and when I opened the door I said "Hi, I called on Monday and someone said they were going to hold some currency aside for me until I could come in today and get it." The lady sitting at the back desk responded very rudely and abruptly with "And?!?!?!? What am I supposed to do with that information?" I said "Well um, ok then..." and she then asked "can I at least have your name or something? How am I supposed to know who you are?" After I gave her the information she asked for, she went to the back and got the currency, and returned. She was a lot nicer to me after she returned. It was almost alarming actually how quickly her personality changed. Regardless, there is zero excuse for this behavior. That is not how you treat customers, especially customers who are not being rude to you. 

The office is a little difficult to find, but there are lots of people around and they will easily show you the way if you get lost from the parking garage. The office itself was clean and well kept. They validate your parking which is a nice bonus. Finally, and perhaps most importantly, the exchange rates here are AMAZING. I honestly do not think you can get currency for these prices ANYWHERE, and you certainly cannot in Nevada.
Nice people and great rate. If you park in the garage they validate your ticket so you're not charged for parking.

Thanks fellow Yelpers!! Once again you were right. I had no idea this place even existed. Their rates are the best plus as Yelpers report the office is efficient  and super nice (thanks Shannon for assisting us and thanks for the extra information about Ireland!)   Plus I felt secure and confident buying my euros here. Bring your parking ticket in with you to get validated  (even the parking was reasonable  $1.00 per 30 minutes). We were only in the office for 10 minutes (with 3 people ahead of us). And of importance....while facing the building from the street Foreign Money Exchange's office is part of the building to the right. Otherwise you will be looking for it. We were lucky to have a security guard suspect that we were looking for this place and went out of his way to show us to the office. Saved some money finding this place on Yelp (Foreign Money Exchange rate was $1.15 per euro while Bank of America was $1.18 plus a hefty service charge!  We will be returning for future trips.

This is my "Go To" spot for exchanging foreign currency.  Whenever I travel abroad I do some research on exchange rates in the country I'm visiting vs this joint.  9 times out of 10 they are very competitive with their rates and I'd rather exchange large sums of currency in Vegas than in a foreign country.

I was here the other day to convert some US Dollars to Chinese RMB in preparation for an upcoming trip to China.  I called prior to driving down here and asked what the exchange rate was.  They were offering 6.53 RMB to 1 USD.  Luckily, I had a classmate in Beijing that just exchanged some currency the day before and she said the exchange rate at banks in Beijing was 6.45-6.75 RMB to 1 USD.  Not a bad deal!  I'll pay the small vig for the convenience of dealing with someone in my home country where communication is easy.

One of the bad things about this place is the parking.  If you're a visitor, you have to park in the underground parking garage.  That's the last place you want to walk to after converting a lot of currency.  

Which leads me to my second complaint about this place.....there's no privacy.  There is a large counter in the office where you conduct your transactions and a large window facing the street where people can look inside and see what you're doing. (see pics)  Not a cool situation if you're counting a lot of money on the counter.  I've always felt uncomfortable in that sense.

Overall Value - they offer great exchange rates, I'm always satisfied with the value they offer.

Will I return?  Unless a better option presents itself, there's no doubt I'll be back!

This place is the best!! I just went in to exchange a bunch of Pesos from Mexico and some other bills from The Bahamas and the transaction was seamless. I checked the exchange rate online before heading into Foreign Money Exchange and their rate was spot-on. They also told me they exchange money from U.S. to other nations currency. It's always nice to have some domestic currency when you hit the ground elsewhere so as to not have to find a bank right away and Foreign Money Exchange can facilitate that. Glad I found them.
It's a little hard to find but definitely worth looking for. Excellent exchange rates and great customer service. Highly recommended.
Best rate there is in vegas... changed my usd to japanese yen, easy transaction, the attendant is very helpful and nice. For sure my next exchange will be with foreign money exchange...

This is the to go to place if you are in Las Vegas Nevada and you need your money/currency exchanged.  The staff were very welcoming, friendly and helpful.  I parked in the building next to it underneath it has plenty of visitor parking.  $1.00 for the first 30 minutes which is all you need.  It used to be you can just park across the street for free and walk across but now there is so much road construction and what used to be a parking lot is torn up right now.  I would recommend going to this place over others.  Banks don't have certain currencies in stock and you have to order it a week in advance.  Not at this place.  It's available for same day service.  No appointment necessary.  Just walk in.

Stopped in today to convert currency from 10 years worth of travels a la Uncle Sam... We had a lot of coin, but... newbies that we are to currency exchange, we learned the only currency they can take is paper... no coins... Best advice to travelers is to use ALL the coin you have in country and only bring paper "bills" back with you :).   The location is rather nondescript and we must have been oblivious to any signage once we parked the car in the garage as we "finally" found FME by asking a postal worker walking by:).  They are located on the FIRST floor if the "PALACE" building at 101 Convention Center Drive... not the "Tower" building... We got a little exercise finding the place :).  I must say, the gals running the front office there were wonderful, sweet, and very knowledgable... We exchanged currency from Poland, England, and Canada without issue and at a very fair rate... We were glad we checked Yelp for advice before we went elsewhere... We know enough not to exchange money at airport$$, but weren't sure if local banks could help us out... Apparently they aren't in the business much anymore, if at all... My daughter enjoyed the memorabilia on the walls... I would recommend FME to anyone with foreign currency needs... The gals are sweethearts and will treat you very well...and even validated our parking!
Called this place and rate was same as casino and women on the other end was arrogant and shouting . Don't bother exchange somewhere else !

Fast, Easy to Find, Reasonable - Facility is only open Monday through Friday from 8:30 a.m. until 4 p.m. (Closed Weekends).  However, extremely easy to find.  When you drive to facility, park vehicle in underground parking under "Visitor Parking."  Take your ticket with you to be validated at Foreign Money Exchange.

Enter the building marked TOWER not Plaza.  As soon as you enter, Foreign Money Exchange is on the left side.  I requested $100 worth of Euros evenly divided between two people and staff complied.

I had to fill out a sales slip with my name and address.  You must pay in CASH ONLY.  I then had my parking ticket validated by staff placing a green sticker on it.

My only reason for getting Euros in advance rather than waiting while in Europe is my concern of an ATM Machine being broken.  Otherwise, I will also use an ATM while there.

Was in and out in under 5 minutes.  Would definitely return again.

Just changed money here again for a trip to China.  Wholesale market rate per Yahoo Finance, OANDA, etc. as of today is 6.47 yuan to the dollar.  I received 6.36 to the dollar with no fees.  That is not even a 2% spread.  How anyone can say this place is not the best in town is beyond me.  Apparently, anyone who disagrees does not travel or change money often.  I have used this place at least 10 times already for trips to Tahiti, China, several trips to Europe, Hong Kong and Japan.  Everytime I get by far the best rate, and there is NO surcharge, NO fees. 

I WILL concede sometimes they are a little gruff on the phone, but they are pleasant in store, especially when you are a regular.  There is absolutely no way a casino offered the same rate as this place.  Next time you are changing money, call this place and ask for the rate on a given currency and then call or go to an American Express travel exchange place or similar locale, and make sure you ask about any fees, surcharges etc.

I called in to see how long it would take to get mexican pesos. The lady said it's always good to call in 2 weeks advanced. When I finally put my order in, my currency came in sooner than expected.

The location can be a bit of a challenge to get to as they're doing construction. The parking garage is directly across the street from the Somerset Shopping sign.  Just a tip, when you pull in and get your parking ticket, park in the first available spot as you drive in.  Then walk out where you drove in and you will see the Tower building in front of you.  (They moved buildings).  It's a shorter walk than going through the garage and going up the elevators.  Don't forget your parking garage ticket so they can validate.

The lady was friendly and gave a receipt breaking down my transaction. She even exchanged my random Australian money I had. Very easy and would go again.

Giving it 2.5 stars because my FSR decided to stop responding to my emails. Ummm ok, I guess my inquiries aren't that important anymore.

Time to look for another person I can go to.

I don't wanna leave a star at all, i requested a credit card for 3 months but didn't get it or any call at all. And when i go there, they said that they already returned it to visa. Their employees are so rude and stupid, they didn't provide any solution. they underestimated the customers. Never go back there again!

Went in today to do the job I hate the most each month-wire money into my loan at home. It's kind of miserable to watch the balance in my chequing account plummet after this task, but the people in this bank make it less painful. They are always just so friendly and efficient. I haven't come across anyone who didn't beam and chat while they tapped away to drain my account, yet they still manage to do the job well.

Bullet point summary:
-Shiny and new
-Open Sundays
-Friendly staff. So pleasant they make me feel like a grumpy old person in comparison
-Lines can be long but they're pretty efficient
-In Chinatown and they have the language skills to prove it
Very convenient location right outside st Patricks subway station. Very down to earth people work there who are very helpful and friendly. Never a bad experience here!

@Chris O. You got too caught up in sales process maybe. I did not feel that way at all. The overall team is excellent and always willing to help and answer questions. I think they have amazing online resourses through the OTA website student center. I have taken three classes and all three were great. Greg Hadley for options. Toddler Davis for MMC speciality class, and Steve Bobbitt for equities. I am scheduled for my futures class in February 2017.

A very aggressive sales team trying to sell you a very expensive program with timeshare selling tactics. It starts at 60k then they tell you that if you sign now it's only 40K-is. If you don't budge they refer you their expert colleague that will give you a special rate of 23K then down to 13K now only. Tomorrow the price will be 40K. This happens in the 3 day "free" $300 class. They snatch you literally from the classroom in your breaks and take you in the "back" office. Very unprofessional and condescending sales team personnel.

This branch is very frustrating! Always long lines. One of the older tellers (with dark hair...forgot her name) can be very unfriendly. The managers don't know anything when I ask a question. It's always a waste of my time going in here. Once my credit card is paid off, I will close my account with Chase altogether. Not good customer service.
I just had a bad experience at another chase and wanted to let you guys know how much I appreciate your friendly service every time I'm in here!!

I made the mistake of  using Chase as my mortgage lender, and it was one of the most frustrating experiences I've ever endured. Robert Page, my mortgage lender, said that we would close on October 16th. Then he pushed it back until October 18th. Then he pushed it back until October 21st citing some ridiculous reason. Of course, we couldn't close on the 21 because of another ridiculous reason, so Robert pushed it back until October 25th. You see the trend? Then, we were supposed to close on October 28th....which didn't happen either. If you can't close on a certain date, then don't make a promise. It's that easy! I would have been much happier if you told me from the beginning that we wouldn't be able to close until October 29th...in which case I could have chosen a different lender.The situation got so bad that I had to reach out to Robert's boss, David Campbell. He said he would "take care of us" which is also another broken promise. In an effort to rectify the situation, Chase promised to reimburse us for the rent we had to pay when we couldn't move in on October 16th. Of course, they reneged on that as well.

If you love being lied to, then Chase is the way to go for your mortgage! I had a terrible experience getting a mortgage at Chase. I had to call multiple managers at Chase before anything was done. They reimbursed me about $1000 for all the headache and bad information they gave me. $1000 seems like a lot, but they should have given us at least $3,000 back for deceiving us. 

If I could go back, I would have gone to a federal credit union for my mortgage.

Have been with Steve Froehle for more years than I care to admit, but maybe it will be useful to share... almost 20 years. Unbeatable rates (and believe me, I've looked around in those 20 years.... and have never left). Besides cost and protection, this office has an awesome staff. Actual people who answer my calls!! Yes, it still exists AND they know who I am.  But most importantly, they provide the answers I need when I need them. Highly recommend this agency.
Great service, Advanced technolgy.  Iv'e Used their services last year and I highly recommend there services especially Due to the fact that the banks don't have much availability With safe deposits.
Great experience!!! Easy and pleasant! Highly recommended. If you need assistance you should go.

This is an awesome place. Strait forward security and on point service. Looks like something from a movie with an eye scan and all. 

Thank you so much for making my life much easier and much safer, now that I don't have to worry about leaving town and leaving my precious jewelry collection at home.

Easy access, close to the airport makes even better. 

You need a safe deposit box?
Look no more.

This is an awesome place. Strait forward security and on point service. Looks like something from a movie with an eye scan and all. 

Thank you so much for making my life much easier and much safer, now that I don't have to worry about leaving town and leaving my precious jewelry collection at home.

Easy access, close to the airport makes even better. 

You need a safe deposit box?
Look no more.
The only place in Las Vegas I trust to protect my valuables...Thank you so much for what you do!

Really glad I found The American Guardian. Heard about it from my accountant and decided to go ahead and rent a safe deposit box while I was on vacation in Vegas. The enrollment process was quick, easy and informative. They use a very cool iris scan recognition for access and I have to say that it's much quicker than to get a safe deposit box in a bank! 

Very recommended!

i have only good things to say about this business
i have been a costumer for few years now and i get to sleep good at night
knowing that this company watching my belongings.
im rely recommend this place for anyone who's  looking for a safe deposit box.

The only place I trust to store my valuables. Many of my friends got a safe box here thro the years and I decided to get one as well. After few years of great service it's time for me to leave a review and spread the word.

If you need a safe deposit box and don't want to deal with the banks - this is your place!

Thank you guys for the fabulous service you give me and my family 365 days of the year! 

I will stay your customer for many more years!
I felt very safe and secure leaving my stuff here ...Thanks for always escorting me in and out also with your well trained and armed security ...

I like them as they are a shared credit union, so convience- a plus.   However i haven't found many friendly tellers there. They barely say hi, don't smile, and i feel uncomfortable as if I'm bothering them or such.  They're also kind of slow...or maybe it seems they are due to the uncomfortable aura.    Not always had such bad customer service, but tbis past year has gone down. Prior it was just average .

I've been a member of Heartland Credit Union for about 34 years.  Service with a smile has always been the case, and I'm never just a customer.  I've used three different locations of the credit union, this one, the one at Williamson Street and the one on High Crossing.  I will say that I've only had one experience in those many years that wasn't up to snuff, and that's a teller who doesn't speak good enough English.  If your money is in a bank, you're really missing out on the credit union MEMBERSHIP experience.
___________________

Updated 21 Oct 2016 from Germany - I'm glad they waited until I'd moved out of the neighborhood to close this location.  A loss for the community, I guess, but economics get to us every day, don't they?

We used Scott for our personal estate and cannot say enough. He was diligent, hard-working, intelligent and most importantly took the time to rephrase the different issues we came to, into layman's terms and helped us understand EXACTLY what was going on. Understanding the entire process really helped us feel comfortable through the case and made me never doubt his successful outcome. Thank you Scott!!

We have been doing business with Scott at Family First Estate and Corporate Services for almost 20 years. He is reliable, honest and trustworthy. He is always available and responds quickly in order to address concerns. I have never had an issue with his services. When the laws change regarding trusts Scott has notified us of the changes and makes sure we are up to date. My wife and I first dealt with Scott in San Diego. He now also has an office in AZ. He is always available no matter where he is.

I just had my Trust done with Scott last night. I didn't know what to expect, but he spent so much time with my husband and I explaining everything. He covered more than I expected. Scott was very professional and personable. I would highly recommend Scott to my friends and family.

Scott. I'm not sure why you are posting that you just saw my comment. You emailed me about it, many weeks ago., saying exactly the same thing. You said then that you had seen it on YELP then. 
A lawyer redid what you had done. He charged less for the entire thing, than your "changes" would have.

When we got married in 2006, we wanted to set up a family trust.  We were referred to Scott Schoeller who listened to our concerns, assessed our situation and prepared a document that fully addressed our needs. We were impressed by Scott's knowledge and professionalism and the product he produced for us. Nine years later, in 2015, our circumstances had changed and our family trust needed to be revised. We were delighted to reconnect with Scott who prepared an update that fully met our requirements. We highly recommend Scott for estate planning.

Judi & Bill

Burke Files and his teams are great financial investigators. Our law firm is almost 2000 miles away but he is our exclusive provider of financial due diligence and investigations. Their reports are easy to understand, thorough and always delivered within budge and on-time.

There are many divorce and personal investigators in the marketplace but investigators do what FEE does and no one who does so as well. They are the "go to" investigators for sophisticated financial fraud and due diligence. Anywhere in the world, Burke's team can help. (We recently used them in a case in Central America.)

I've had the worst experience at the East Tropicana location, for starters aside from one banker named Shane the whole staff is worthless. Headed by "branch manager" "vice president" Kristin Leupold who was extremely unprofessional, unhelpful & a down right weak excuse for a manager. I felt very uncomfortable with her handling my customer service issue, she came off inexperienced & did not appear to be an authority figure what so ever. When I saw her card I was shocked, whoever put her in that type of leadership role is no Einstein let me tell you that. 

Now for my story, so I tried depositing my paycheck at an atm at this location the machine ate my check & didnt register anything in the account. So I went inside & for hours went in circles with Kristin until she finally credited my account for the eaten check. A month later chase reverses the credit & completely wrecks my account naturally I was upset. I showed up at the bank with a fresh paycheck I needed cashed for thanksgiving & to resolve the issue. Shane helped me get some cash from my check & assured me Kristin who was on vacation at the time would straighten out my account when she returned on Friday that was Wednesday. On Friday I needed to pay my rent so I went in expecting Kristin to recredit my account since it was chases fault the machine ate my check & the credit never should have been reversed in the first place. Again Shane assured me Kristin would fix the issue or I never would have deposited my check there being that I needed to pay rent. Kristin acted completely oblivious to the situation when I arrived, she then kept on repeating herself that she could not issue a credit. I told her calmly I wasn't leaving without my hard earned money I needed for my rent. I sat down & told her to call her boss again. She's such a coward she sent out a little college student teller to tell me nothing could be done for me & the police were on the way to escort me out. Yes, that's how chase treats their customers when you come for the money that is rightfully yours they call the cops to have you escorted out. After this issue is resolved I will never bank with chase again & I will make sure that everyone I come in contact with knows how bad their customer service is. DONT BANK WITH CHASE UNLESS YOU WANT TO CHASE THEM FOR YOUR MONEY.

Open saturdays until 3 pm- that's convenient. As you enter, there is an ATM to your right side. Inside, there is a small waiting area with a coffee pot on the desk on your left. The deposit slips (no need for your account number) are on a tall desk along the line (in the middle of the room). There were three bank tellers wearing the blue shirt uniform with one manager supervising (new trainees?). I was in line for less than three minutes. The trainee was courteous and asked if I wanted my balance. Speedy trip to the bank- nice & easy. 

Formerly WAMU, there are so many locations of Chase Bank throughout the city and beyond.

When I first waded into the world of opening a packing and shipping store, the task was pretty daunting. Finding DRSS was a godsend. They assisted with the entire process from searching for sites for the store to building out the store. Now, even two years later, they provide support and answer questions and help solve problems that arise. The staff are friendly, knowledgeable, and professional. They are truly invested in helping you get your business off on the right foot. Even now with the experience I have, if I'm fortunate enough to expand my business to additional locations, I will definitely use DRSS.

I've been open since Nov 2013 and DRSS really helped me through the process of finding a location, financing, my leasing contract, merchandising, ordering and building/setting up my store and many other things.  Unlike owning a franchise, I felt I had a say in every step of the process and at any point IF I wanted to I could've stopped and said No to anything I didn't like/agree with.  Some owners might not like having a merchandise package pre-set for their 1st order/opening but it's truly the best way.  No one knows based on your location what is gonna be hot or not.  Just because it's hot in many other locations it might not be the hot item for your store.  So after the initial opening, you have 100% freedom to re order an item or choose something different based on customer feedback.  This isn't a franchise, do what you want. There is no sure thing in anything you do.  I've learned for my particular store to have a small amount of an item but have lots of variety and it has been great for me.  Some vendors might not be so flexible with having smaller case sizes for what you want and we've learned that there are SO many choices/other vendors to order from out there that we typically end up much happier than getting stuck with lots of something that didn't end up selling.  DRSS is very helpful anytime I need to call and ask for advice with a product or vendor or a display or anything at all.  Remember it's advice, it's not a franchise, do what you want. Some things work out great, others don't. You really just have to keep talking to your customers and find out what is popular for your location.  I also HIGHLY recommend attending trade shows like toyfest and ASD here in Las Vegas (they are here twice a year).  This gives you a chance to meet with current and new vendors, touch and play with new merchandise that might interest you and you can do this on your own or a representative of DRSS can spend time with you to help you as well, it's totally your choice.  All I can end with is what you get out of your business depends on the effort you put into it. It doesn't run itself.  Thank you DRSS for what you've helped me with and the flexibility to do what I want with my own business.
Justin knows how to get things done and with no inconvenience or worry to me.  I know I am in capable, knowledgeable hands.
Thank you Justin for all your help and professionalism.  I appreciate how quick and how responsive you were to all our questions and concerns.

Came here as another location (Desert Inn and Durango) didn't have the sufficient staff to provide the service...

This was previously a Washington Mutual location before it turned into a Chase. It has quite the .... different design than a normal bank.... Upon entry through the main double doors, you have the ATM to the left, a wall in front of you, and another set of doors to the right. After going through those doors, you have a huge wall leading you into a huge room. Bankers to the left, tellers to the right. According to the banker who helped me, this was the design of the previous WaMu. She described it as like a huge living room. xD

I had came to Chase because I wanted to get the new Chase Sapphire Reserve credit card as its an amazing travel card (look it up !) As a currently holder of the Chase Freedom (5% CB quarterly) and Chase Sapphire Preferred, it was a great card to get and "replace" my Sapphire Preferred with. 

Process was seamless and quick. Apparently i was already pre-approved for the Sapphire Reserve so it was essentially quick print and sign and i was on my way. Banker stated card will arrive in about a week in a non-labeled white envelope. My friends had told me it arrived by UPS either overnight or within the next day or two, which it did. 

Super fast. Super easy. Time took here was less than the amount i waited at the other branch for someone to tell me they were "busy" and "understaffed"

I used to drive past this location a lot (Albertsons on the corner of W.Sahara and S. Fort Apache), and my ex-housemate used to bank at this location when it was still Wachovia.  But our latest banking crisis lead to Wachovia being swallowed up by Chase, and now we have a bunch of these rebranded Chase locations around town.

Before today, I have never been inside this location, so I can't say what exactly they did to the interior of the bank. But it does not even look like a bank, in the traditional way.  Meaning no bulletproof barrier and counter separating you and the tellers. But there is still the counter with the deposit slips and courtesy pens to help you fill out your forms near the enterence.  There is still the rope and stanchion to queue banking customers on a busy day (which it was not on my visit just 10 minutes ago).

Anyway, I thought it is kind of refreshing how Chase is going out of their way to try and make the banking experience more personable (at least at this location in Summerlin).

There are 3 tellers stations and one desk for the rep that is going to handle opening new accounts and what not.  And all of it is situated inside a large room without partition (not including the one in the front that helps block out the sun and some of the heat, once you get past the small ATM room.

I don't bank here currently, but I may have to occassionally drop by to make deposits into my parents account in the future.  However I might down the road, seeing that there are hardly any HSBC locations in Las Vegas and the lines at Wells Fargo have always been crowded whenever I have to see a teller.

Convenient location right off Sahara but I only go to this branch when I absolutely MUST. I've only been here a handful of times and each time Kristin has assisted me. Each time she's acted like withdrawals and deposits are an inconvenience. She always has this look on her face like she hates her job. Today she was literally looking down at her nails while asking what I needed help with. When she speaks to me she is very condescending. Not a reflection of quality customer service or someone I want handling my account.
All the employees are prompt and extremely helpful. Very honest and provide affordable prices. I would recommend this tax office to anyone.

They have prepared our taxes for years. They have worked with complicated dual state returns. They are knowledgeable when it comes to finding tax breaks. We usually can get an appointment a day or two from our initial call. They are a little pricy, but we'll pay it for a complicated return. This year they gave us a break on the cost.

This branch closes at 3:30 on most days.  That's ridiculous and unforgivable.  It's bad enough that a person can't go to a bank after work in this city, but you can't make it here even if you leave work and hour and a half early!!!  

The ATM is inside a nice two-stage glass door thing which is also large enough to take your bicycle inside with you.  This is especially nice in the winter since you don't have to take off your gloves until you're inside and you don't have to fiddle with your bike lock just to get some cash out.

This review is more about one man than the actual company, but I still deem this as a worth representation of my brief usage and encounter with BMO.

I am from the UK and my debit cards had been blocked as I hadn't notified my bank that I was holidaying. Jackie Chiu one of the bank assistants at BMO smiled and came to help when I mentioned my difficulties. He walked me through working the cash machine, which I patiently let him do. When this didn't give me any joy he allowed me to call a premium number from there phone to my branch in the UK, even though BMO are not affiliated to my branch. The bank was actually closed but Jackie gave me all the time I needed. My card was reactivated. If all the workers at this new BMO branch are like Jackie, I would open an account immediately. Sensational customer service.

My girlfriend was looking for insurance because she is newly divorced. I proceeded to search independent agents in my area and sent out emails to all of them. Immediately Jimmy texted and emailed me letting me know he was there to help. The other agencies responded two to three days later. We eventually received quotes from all of them and Jimmy's rates and professionalism were by far the best and their speed of doing business was phenomenal. I have not experienced this level of customer service ever in my dealings with insurance companies or agents. I was so impressed with my girlfriend's experience that I immediately cancelled my Geico Direct auto policy and signed up with him myself. I recommend anyone looking for the best of the best to call Jimmy at Elite, you will be glad you did!

Amazing company, very personable, clear, and concise.  I was very apprehensive at first, as I was with my last insurance company for many years, but after a friend referred me to Elite Insurance and I spoke with Jimmy Kelley, I was immediately sold and switched that day! Jimmy returned my phone calls promptly, he "listened" to me, and took my needs/wants into consideration when designing my policy. I have since, told many of my co-workers and friends about Elite and I hope they give them a chance as well.
Switched immediately due to outstanding rates (they represent numerous companies).  We have been astounded by the high level of service.  Apparently, great rates and service CAN co-exist.

Elite Insurance Group is a great company to help you find the best insurance that works with your budget and coverage needs. I had the pleasure of working with Jimmy Kelly, he was helpful, fast, friendly, and kept me updated thru the whole process. Jimmy made switching my insurance easy and hassle free. Even took care of canceling my old policy. I would definitely recommend this company.
It's pretty simple: I received a quote , the rate was superb and so I switched over! Jimmy even handled the cancellation of my current insurance policy, which I appreciated. Highly recommended.

You have to make coming to this bank a real errand and time. I just don't get why they see there's a line and they only have one or sometimes two bank tellers. Hope they can get it together no one likes waiting 30 min or more for something quick.

Came to cash my check to pay an overdraft and the clerk said No you have to deposit it and the funds won't be available till tomorrow go to Bank of America they can cash it for you. wth?? So I left very upset, sat in my car for a minute then I went back and signed in to speak with a manager. Carmen Martinez the branch managerwas so understanding. Amazing CS she cashed my check. THANK YOU! Now I can pay my bills on time.

I don't know where else to turn. The line right now is out the door and I hate leaving bad reviews for places but every TIME I come to this bank, no matter what time of day, the wait is at least half an hour. I was the 2nd person in line with an estimated wait time of 10-15 minutes. Seriously, this marks 30 minutes waiting to be helped. This is also my SECOND DAY back because yesterday took over an hour! I am fed up with this location. I have complained several times to a manager and other staff members and their answer is always "I don't know why it's taking so long."

But here's the funny part, they redid their lobby to literally take tellers away and add 2 machines to replace people. Which is fine I guess, but can someone explain why the line right now is out the door? Seriously, drive the extra 10 minutes and go to a different Chase.

If used several different banks so far and Chase has been the one the most satisfies my financial needs. This specific location has great customer service and makes sure everyone is helped as soon as possible. The Manager also comes around to greet and make sure we are taken care of.

It took a while waiting for somebody to get to us when we signed in to start a new account and took a while to set up an account, but the customer service by Roosevelt Waters was really good.  He was friendly and explained everything thoroughly.  He made us feel like we knew each other and were having a conversation with a friend.

They were able to fix my credit and debit card problems when the branch on Rue University couldn't. Unlike that branch, they were able to solve everything without asking too many questions, and they were patient. Even though the line behind me was getting very long and the place seemed to be understaffed at around 4:30pm, they weren't rushing anything. Best service I ever received at a financial institution.

Bonus, the supervisor helping me out was a very attractive young man. So 5 stars instead of 4, despite having only gone there once.

Located about 1.5 blocks from the Place des Arts Metro stop on de Bleury, this was a convenient location for us when we were in the city to pull some cash out.  The only issue was that the doors do not close all the way when accessing the ATMs, and there was a loud beeping noise that never seemed to shut off.  Currency exchange can be done on the premise during normal operating hours.

+ATM doors do not shut completely
Wow!  I am sure glad I read these reviews.  I will not be going to Capital One for my car loan.

I would give this company no stars if I could. My husband has an account with this company. We've been trying to close it however they haven't posted our payment which was sent over a month ago. We have confirmation from our bank that it was done however capital one claims it takes a month to post. Funny how all my other payments took mere days. Last year we paid off the balance however the account was frozen. Apparently there was interest of 17 cents between the time we paid and the time they posted the payment. They froze all of his $5000 credit for 17 cents and he now has a negative report on his credit score. 

Most recently we called to speak to customer care about the payment of $2500 that was made a month ago. What a waste of time. The rep was either chewing gum or eating. My husband had to listen to her chomp in his ear the entire conversation. 

This company's service is subpar. Never in my life have I dealt with a company like this. 

No capital one isn't in my wallet. It has been shredded.

I just got the Capital One Platinum Mastercard for shopping at Costco. Costco determined that they had to discontinue using American Express and what a mistake!

I called them with a few issues. I wanted my billing date changed to be in harmony with my other credit cards and to make my life easier. I was told that it was impossible. 

I asked how long ahead of time should I make my payments by online banking? I was told they required at least 3 weekdays to process a payment. Their payment are processed in the U.S., and that is just that.

Do they have physical location where payment can be made? No!

But, I was told I can pay at any bank, but it will still take 3 days to process my payment.

I asked if I could be with Capital One drafting my account monthly, so as not to worry while I travel. Another resounding no!

I don't know why Costco, after stellar service from American Express would get into bed with these rascals?

I am sure they will be charging a plethora of fees.

For those of you that have gotten their unlimited travel card, someone has just posted a warning. But here is the simple math of it. One travel mile with any airline has a market value of between $0.01 and $0.03 as a rough comparison tool. Most airlines will allow you to go anywhere in the U.S. for 25,000 miles. This ticket could cost anywhere from $350.00 to $2,000.00, that does not matter. It is still the same number of miles.

The Aspire Card does not come anywhere near giving you that kind of return, in spite of the their advertising. It is very, much like the Visa Royal Bank Avion card.

Just beware of Capital One. For those of you who might be late paying, I am pretty sure we will be seeing "American style" financial penalties.

I got the capital one aspire card for the rewards. Big Scam. I called and they told me I had $1800 worth of "No Hassle rewards". So, i bought a ticket for a trip for about $3,000 and i called them and asked them to apply the $1,800 towards the trip. And unfortunately, they said that they can only apply the points if it covers 100% of the ticket. So, if the ticket was $1,800 then there is no issue. But if the Ticket is $1801, then my points are worthless and cant be applied. Even with Air Miles they let you pay the difference in cash. I also have an AMEX and they have no issue with partial redemption's. Calling these rewards as "No Hassle Rewards" is extremely misleading when they place restrictions that no other reward companies have.

Unable to register at website.  Customer service is horrible and talking with someone is a bear and you feel like you are ruining their day.  For being a "community" credit union, they have the behaviors of a big bank.  I had not heard of this credit union until my auto loan was picked up by them.  i am sorry I did.  I have ZERO interest in giving them more business.

I've been a member with Landings CU for almost 10 years. Back when they were Tempe Schools Credit Union.  While I have experienced stellar customer service in the past, my most recent experience makes me want move my financials elsewhere.  The customer service rep I started working with was nice and helpful.  However, the issue I had required me to be transferred to a manager.  The manager I spoke with was rude, talked over me, and didn't treat me like a valued member but more of a hassle.  I was guilty of being a delinquent before I had a chance to explain the situation.  It was like working with a debt collector with a bad attitude.  The kind of person you hang up on because because they are so rude and unprofessional.  The fifteen minute phone call ended with me wishing I never did business there.

We have been a member of This Credit Union from day one when they opened some many years back when it started as a little Tempe Schools Credit Union. Now it is much bigger and the people don't know us as well but, I have always received great service and care. They have made me feel valued even when we moved to Monticello, UT and we did business by phone. I love Credit Unions and this one is a keeper.

I had to give it one star for the mere fact it has ATMS. The customer service at this location is horrible.  I can't tell you how many mistakes this branch has made. They fix one only to create another. Staff is constantly rotated, so you have to reexplain the problem because the last person didn't leave good notes. I won't step foot in this branch.

This branch has the least customer friendly policies/tellers I've ever encountered from a chase bank anywhere. On occasion when it was pouring rain in middle of day they told me the drive through teller was closed and I would have to park and walk into the bank. Recently they refused to accept a deposit to a checking account I've had with 0 problems for 9 years because of an insignificant difference between the name on the front of the check and my endorsed signature. They insisted on stamping the back "REJECTED." I went down the street to another Chase branch and had no difficulty making the deposit. Do not go to this branch.

Worked with Michelle A. And she was GREAT!! I ended up with (4) good policies for much less money it was costing for 2 policies with another company.  Michelle  was extremely helpful in finding me exactly what fit my needs! All of the staff was friendly welcoming and I felt very " taken care of" down to the diet soda that was offered! HIGHLY RECOMMEND!!

Everyone at this office is so nice and helpful. My agent Ryan, is always there when I need him and gets answers to my questions quickly. He always listens to my needs and comes up with the correct solutions for all my insurance needs. I was very luck to find him almost 3 years ago and I do not plan on leaving any time soon.

I love this place. People should not use MVD anymore. This was quick and easy def worth the 
time time savings!!!

Professional, fast and accurate this place is knew how to process my complicated request with ease (no pun intended!) I highly recommend for any one who needs title and registrations; instead of going to the tedious DMV. I will be back to you guys soon.

Great place.  Very helpful and the service was quick.  I was able to squeeze in getting my car registered during my 30min., lunch.  Totally worth the convenience fee.  Keep in mind though there is a small additional fee if you use credit or debit, so bring cash if you got it.  All-in-all though great place.  No doubt, I will be avoiding the DMV and coming back here next time I need something.
Just moved from Cali. Went to mvd first and they told me an hour and a half wait. I got done in 5 minutes at EZ title. These guys are awesome!!
I really like this bank too, I come in here to buy the money orders to pay my son's tuition. The staff is always prompt and wonderful, and they remember my name!

called the customer service to close my lost secured credit card because also I was charged an undisclosed fee of 25 bucks annually. Neither the branch or cust service was able to help me and now they're sending me a new card so I can come to branch and close it. What ?

This bank really went downhill over the years. First it was starting to charge us fees, and when we complained we were told that it was our responsibility to keep our friends and neighbors in their homes and cars. (Yeah, no... live within your means.) 

Then today we get a notice saying we will be charged an inactive fee for the account. I write to their chat to try to close the account and get told only my husband can do that, even though it's a joint account... then the woman starts discriminating and referring to me as "Ms. Wolf". Glad to know that your company employs ignorant bigots. 

Called in to complain and asked to speak to the branch manager at the McLeod branch, the woman asked why, I explained it and she starts doing the same thing. I went off on her, and now they're claiming we can't speak to anyone in a position of authority and they will only take requests in writing? What a load of bullshit. 

This bank really needs to go out of business already, or learn that proper business practice states that when a customer wants to speak to a manager, they get a manager. Period.

EDIT: Despite giving them instructions on where to send our money after we closed our account, they sent it to an old address on file. Luckily we still had address forwarding on our mail, so the ignorant bigots couldn't prevent us from receiving our money. Keep it classy, Silver State!

We've been using SSCU since 2008.  Our closest branch is Stephanie Street.  All employees there have given us great service.  Nicole Hill helped us with our auto loan.  She walked us through the entire thing, kept us updated, always made sure that we knew how to contact her,  and never made us feel silly even when we would forget and ask her the same question twice (or maybe three times!).  We would always seek her out and in many ways Nicole became our "personal banker" as she always takes care of any banking needs and/or questions we may have.  Although Nicole moved to the main branch we do still use Stephanie Street and still receive excellent service there.  With that said, we do make it a point to now go to the Main Branch to continue to have Nicole assist us with our banking.  We understand Nicole will soon be moving to the fraud department.  We are sad to lose her, but glad to know there will be such an excellent employee assisting customers when they are in such a delicate situation.
My only real issue with this bank is that my account keeps getting hacked. They've had to change out my card several times now.

Definitely agree with the horrible customer service comment.  Especially when it comes to the mortgage department.  If u were thinking about using this bank...keep searching.

I should also add I have been doing normal banking with this bank for years; I would gladly leave but I guess I am just that lazy.  The only time I have a problem is when I have to actually go into a branch money orders, deposits, withdrawals, it doesn't matter....I always leave thinking the same thing 'Why do i bank here?'

I would give zero stars. I have banked with SSCU for 11 years. Since they changed their computer system there has been nothing been trouble. Yesterday, I made a mobile deposit. Not only, did they not make all of the money available. They did not make the $200 available as their policy states. They charged me an overdraft charge and claimed that I made the deposit today instead of last night. I spoke with Daniel who insinuated that I was lying about putting the money in yesterday. He refused to resolve the situation. He said, "Clearly, you do not understand how our bank works." He then explained that $200 was made available, but it was made available at 11:36 am today instead of when the deposit was made. He then said that the current disclosures, which are different than the disclosures I received 11 years ago, state all of this information. 
So, the representative by the name of Daniel refused to correct the situation, acknowledged that I was being held to a disclosure agreement that I never received, and said he would not help me. He was more concerned about being right than correcting the BANK error. 

Account will be closed at the end of the month. Worst banking situation I could ever imagine. 

Beyond the incompetence of Daniel the representative, I've had to have my card replaced over 5 times due to fraud. They DO NOT PROTECT YOUR MONEY.

Stay away from this catastrophe of a bank.

I love my bank.  I really, really do.  I don't know of anyone else who says that, ever, so I'll say it again.  I love my bank.

I messed up at banks, just as I messed up at credit, when I was a wee lass and no one would give me an account.  I got a job at UNLV and was eligible for membership with the Credit Union and they accepted me with open arms.  I've been with them for eight years and I've never been dissatisfied.

Sometimes I do banking for other people and I have to go to one of the big banks and the lines are ridiculous.  At SSSCU if you go inside it takes about, oh, 3 minutes from the moment you walk in the door until you're out.  Everyone's always very friendly and helpful.  There's free coin cashing, this particular branch has always been pretty for a bank (they're remodeling right now) and....darn it, it just rocks.

You don't have to be employed by a Nevada school to be a member.  If you're related to a member of the bank, you can be a member.  Also, if you want to belong so badly, if you donate to Vegas PBS you are eligible for membership.  And you should donate to Vegas PBS cause...uh...I work there.
Just as rapacious as any big bank about collecting fees for everything they can think of but a lot less convenient because they have closed down most of their local branches.

I absolutely love silver state schools credit union.  They always have the best rates and the best customer service. When I go to the main branch I always feel important.  There is always someone at the front desk ready to greet you with a smile and the staff really takes the time to get to know their customers.  Thank you for being the best at what you do!
It's another lackluster performance and nonexistent customer service from SSSCU.  You would be better off at a big box bank. Shame on me for not learning my lesson yet.

I have been with SSSCU for about 7 years. They were good to me over the years...until recently. I financed my car through SSSCU last year. My payment was about $170 per month, but after a couple of months my payment jumped to about $270. Apparently, they never received my proof of insurance (which I was never notified of), so they tacked on their own supplementary insurance. As soon as I found out I provided proof of insurance; I was told that my payment would remain at $270 for 8 more months. I filed paperwork to modify my loan (by modify I mean get the payment back to what I agreed to pay when I signed the paperwork). I was told that they couldn't modify the loan since I hadn't missed any payments...I will never understand how being responsible is a bad thing...

The icing on the cake is that I was told by a representative of SSSCU that I wouldn't be responsible for any loan payments until the paperwork had been reviewed and I was notified of the outcome. This was COMPLETELY FALSE. Not only did I miss my payment and get charged late fees, but they automatically took out the payment resulting in 5 overdraft fee equaling $150. When I contacted the bank to try and rectify the situation and get at least some of the overdraft fees reversed I was basically told that I was S.O.L.

I don't know what happened, but at some point they just stopped caring about customer service (just like most companies nowadays). I have recently opened an account at another financial institution and will be transferring my loan ASAP.

This company is a joke.... I called them directly after seeing their Groupon, the owner told me not to buy the groupon and I made an appointment with him directly to have 1 Sofa cleaned on Wednesday of this past week.  The time I was given was 10am - 2pm but was told someone would call me the evening prior by 7pm to confirm a more specific time.  At 8pm when no one had called I had to call them and had to leave a message on the machine.  At 8:30pm someone called to confirm however not in response to my message.  I was then told it would be more like noon for my appt the following day but no later than 2pm.  The next morning the owner called at 8am to see if I heard from anyone....I told him I did and that I was scheduled for 12-2pm.  I was also told I would receive a call when they were on the way.  By 1:45pm with no call and no one showing up I called back, someone who clearly doesn't have any customer service skills answered the phone.... Didn't know when they would arrive, actually told me he couldn't get in touch with the tech because the tech wasn't returning his calls..... That reassuring!   After about 30 more minutes of waiting I was told that it would be more like another hour before they would arrive... That meant almost 4pm.  Unacceptable!!! Finally the owner called and wanted to "make up" for the mistake..... there was no mistake, the company is unprofessional period!!! However he insisted on coming to clean the sofa for free.... I will admit I did give in and agreed, we confirmed for an appointment today Saturday between 8am - 10am.  I am sure you won't be surprised to hear no one showed up, no call..... Nothing..... The owner did give me what he said was his personal cell phone so at 10:00am today when I called to see where they were.... Would it surprise you if I told you he didn't answer..... I followed up with another call, again now answer and then I sent 2 text messages... NO RESPONSE...... As I am typing this review my cell phone just rang, it was the technician letting me know he was on the way...... I said you were supposed to be here between 8-10..... He said no I have 8-12..... What a joke, I told him no thank you, I would rather pay twice as much and have it done professionally then deal with incompetent and unprofessional people.
