It's painful to watch old people struggle like this.  It's so very clear that B of A doesn't give a da#n about old people or anyone with mobility issues for that matter.  Why must you close the drive thru lanes that would really help these older people??  I REFUSE to use any part of B of A for my own business purposes and if I weren't employed by a man that uses B of A I'd never set foot into another branch.  

Oh yeah, that's another fun piece of being forced to deal with B of A, if you're not an actual customer of theirs, you don't even have a way to complain!  There is no way to even contact their customer service unless you have an active account number...  WOW!  Talk about blatantly not caring what your neighborhood or community have to say about you!  Hence why I'm yelping today, because it's the only way I can warn others to not use this branch unless you have nothing else to do with your day or your time and you don't mind watching elderly people struggle.  

Sad, pathetic business practices... B of A, you should be ashamed of yourself!

2 drive thru's (ATM)

I've only been inside ONCE but the service was prompt. (I was the only customer, so I guess thats good). 

I use this location more so for the ATM. They have one on the inside as well that's open on the weekends.

Clean, never broken "Out of Order". 

So, That's always a plus.

This is the most unprofessional bank that I've ever had the displeasure to deal with. After starting a joint account with my fiancé, we waited over a month only for the cards to never show up in the mail. We called multiple times during this month and the TruWest employees told us multiple lies. The first time we called, we were told that the cards were sent out on the 8th of October. The second time we called, we were told that they hadn't been sent out until the 20th of October, keep in mind this was already on the 30th of October and we still did not have the cards for our accounts which were opened at the end of September. Finally, they lost 20$ on our account and almost lost all 75$ since it took them almost the whole month to transfer our deposit. We had to file a claim against them with Bank of America in order get our money back. If you like a bank that will fail to get your credit cards delivered within a whole month and lie to you about it multiple times, then TruWest is the bank for you! Also, after telling multiple employees about everything that happened to us NOBODY offered us anything to make up for the situation. Since TruWest doesn't want to offer me anything, I will offer them this bad review so that potential future customers can see the way that they treat their current customers. After a month of being lied to and still not receiving our cards we went in to a Chandler branch to pull out all of our money and we will be canceling our accounts soon. I would not trust this bank with a single penny as they have proven countless times that they are not trustworthy.
I love truwest. I have been with truwest since I got my first job. They are extremely nice and helpful at this location. Ive never had any issues at all with them. Highly recommend.

My husband and I just purchased our Kia Sorento here yesterday and I just love it. The salesman that helped us was named Hany and he was very nice and informative. They were able to work with me on the price and get me on a lease. The car is just beautiful. It took a while to get the car clean and the paperwork done, but I guess that's to be expected when you purchase a car. Even though they were closed by the time I was done, Hany took the time to go over some of the features of the car with my husband and I. :) I've only had the car for a day, but so far, I love it.
I purchased a KIA Hany Fadda. The purchase went will and they worked well with the car that I had for trade which was flipped. I will lease my next KIA thanks all.

**This review is only for Courtesy Kia's service department, NOT sales**

Came here for an oil change for my Kia Sorento and was pleased with the quick and friendly service.  While there, my husband pointed out an issue with fit and finish (that side panel on the driver's seat wasn't flush, it was sticking out, and was just a defect).  They ordered the part, received it quickly, and replaced it without hassle (covered by warranty - no charge, yay!).  

Will continue to come here for oil changes and service.

Bought my daughter's used Kia there almost 2 years ago.  It had low miles and has been a pretty good car, but the salesman told me they ALWAYS put new tires and battery on every car before you drive it off the lot, for safety reasons.  What a joke and a LIE.  I had to replace all 4 tires in the first year.  They were NOT new!  

The salesman also had no idea what kind of factory warranty we got.  The manager said the remaining of the factory 100,000 / 5 year.  Who knows??  Hope I don't have to find out.

It's been awhile since I've bought a new car...if I'd known it was this easy, I would have come a lot sooner. Both our salesperson "Chef" (and I use the term 'sales' loosely- there was NO sales pressure at all) and Manager Kim did everything they could to make our purchase as painless as possible.  We now have a great vehicle at a great price A+++++++!
Good experience Jesse Quintero. Got the exact car I wanted! Mazda6 Grand Touring. Thanks so much! Tanya and Marc Reyes

I made a last-minute appointment and Ed took me right in. I needed an oil change and  My car was sounding funny so I brought it in. Ed was honest with me. He took great  care of my car and didn't take my wallet for a ride.

I got my 2nd car from here a few months ago.  A Mazda 3 2014.  Beautiful car.  I had shopped online, put in a request for the features i want.  Sugarman (his name, awesome guy) called me, setup an appointment that day for after work.   He had the car that matched what I wanted ready, we did a test drive, I said it was what I wanted, and about 2 hours later (which to me, is impressive when buying a car) I was on my way home.  

I value my time, and Sugarman always delivers with a minimal amount of BS.  They took care of registering my car too (there is some service they use which I've used before, pretty cheap and worked well, but this time they were going to register other cars so took mine too to save time), yet more time savings.

I've only used the service department a few times, but it was a great experience, car came back clean, the price would have been high if not for coupons, but it seems like the coupon fairy is pretty liberal with delivering them via mail, so make sure to sign up for deals!

We lease cars all the time.
We decided to lease a car three years ago from Courtesy Mazda. We turned the Mazda 6 in to the dealership on September 11, 2012 which was the end of the lease.  The car had its inspection well ahead of time, and nothing was mentioned about mileage.  We knew we had some body damage.  When we turned the car in, we got some negative comments from Sergio Brooks about not releasing a Kia.  Again nothing was mentioned about mileage.  He also said nothing about fees owed. He just took the keys and said we could go like we were a big aggravation to him.  On December 13, 2012 we received a surprise bill from Chase Auto Finances for not only turning in the car, but going over the mileage.  Wow nothing like receiving a bill 3 months late when it was supposed to come 4-5 weeks after turning in the car.  The bill included a fee for mileage overage which no one mentioned.  In speaking again to Sergio Brooks, he said that we had signed for 10,000 miles.  Really?  At the time, we had negotiated for 12,000 miles which they conveniently forgot to change.  Also they let us continue to drive the car with no advance notice about mileage overage. He was condescending reminding us that if we had leased again, all those charges would go away.  He also reminded us that they lost money on the deal.  I guess they will be recouping that with the mileage overage fees that we got charged.
SO BEWARE WHEN YOU LEASE OR BUY A CAR FROM THIS DEALERSHIP.

I was in the market for a new vehicle and started my dealings with Sara in the Internet department. She let me know what was on the lot and got me set up with Hany, a sales rep.  We test drove and I fell in love with a Jeep from their used vehicles inventory. He was able to work out a great deal for me and got the vehicle in tip top shape with an AMAZING detail!  They were able to get the vehicle road ready and my green slip to me in a timely manner and with very few hiccups, which they were quick to resolve. I'm very happy with my purchase and would recommend this dealership to my friends and family!

Horrible horrible service department

Had a AM appointment.
When i got there no one was outside with the service line almost 10 deep.
Then a service tech came out and said I am the only one here, I need help.
after 30 minutes finally someone came out to help me.

I asked how long will my service be? My advisor told me 1 hour.
I came back 2 1/2 hours later and they said I am set to go.

I checked my car and it just sat there for 2 1/2 hours. No one even looked at it.

I was told they were short handed.

Why was I told work was done when it was not?

I talk to the Sr. advisor and he told me there is nothing I can do? WHAT?

I sat there waiting. And waiting...Until my salesperson came and he said he would take care of it.

If I had known I was getting this type of customer service that took nearly 5 1/2 hours, I certainly would NOT have bothered to get my car here. 

Buyers beware.
Very unprofessional, does less than baseline of work, poor communication. Will not go back here again.. Would sooner given my business to a small business car store.

We just bought a 2014 Kia Soul yesterday and was very impressed with the service. We started communicating with their internet sales person Steve and he was very prompt on getting back to us. Yesterday, while we were out we received a reply from Steve and decided to go check out some cars at Courtesy Imports. We were greeted as soon as we walked up and immediately directed to Steve when we asked for him. Steve was WONDERFUL! He was very pleasant and personable and showed us a few vehicle options within our price range. We test drove a couple vehicles, one pre-owned and the other a new 2014. He went over the difference in pricing, as well as the pro's and con's of purchasing each car. What I loved most about us going to Courtesy Kia was that they didn't BS us around. We tried to purchase this same car from Findlay Kia, whom we have done so much business with in the past, and whom we had referred so many people to and they tried to low ball us on our motorcycle trade in. At Courtesy Kia they gave us what we considered fair for our trade in and made sure to work with our budget. When they came back with the final offer the payments on the car were literally like 5 dollars off what we told them we wanted. All of their staff was very pleasant and nice and made us feel very comfortable. There was not a lot of negotiation that needed to be done and the whole process was pretty painless. Within a few hours we walked out happy customers with a new car! I will definitely be recommending my friends to them!

My husband recently purchased a Kia Soul for me at Courtesy Imports.  The sales representatives and management team were extremely helpful and knowledgeable. I went for my first oil change recently and the service was quick and efficient and the service representatives were fantastic!  I highly recommend Courtesy Imports if you are searching for a new or used vehicle.
First time at Mazda, it was a quick and easy experience. No hassle, no haggle. AJ and Harold made the deal with me within 5 minutes of deciding on the car.

If I could give them negative stars I sure as hell would! Walked out with my car on Sep 25, it's now Oct 21 and still no green slip..so I called them and was told "oh yeah, it's been here. We tried to call you but there was no answer and no voicemail" ...bullshit! I did get a call 2 weeks ago and when I answered, they hung up on me! Figured after the bad review I wrote and told my salesman off when he emailed me my congratulatory email that I would get no call from them! So if I hadn't of called them asking about my green slip they would've just brushed it off...what do they care, they made their sale! 

They will kiss your ass when you are there, but once they lock you in with the contract, don't expect any additional service after that..makes you wonder why car salesmen have such a nasty reputation, they are unscrupulous here...you've been warned!

Walked in today to pick up my green slip, needless to say I didn't even get an acknowledgement from anyone in there! Scumbags...

Sales manager LUIS is rude, bullying, dishonest, pushy, and will say anything to make the sale.  DO NOT COME HERE TO BUY ANY VEHICLE.  Worst customer service ever.  Would'nt suggest this place to anyone.  Whoever runs this business is doing a piss-poor job training their employees for proper service.  All about the making the cash here at the expense of any sort of dignity or respect.  Never coming back here again.

This review is for the service provided only, as I did not purchase my car from this dealership.

I've been in twice to the service garage for oil changes.  The second time on 8/20 I had a crack in my windshield from a chip that had gone unnoticed.  Peter, the gentleman working the service desk, was INCREDIBLY helpful and resourceful.  He answered all of my ignorant questions (I'll be the first to admit I don't know much about cars and their inner workings) and even called Safelite for me to get a quote for windshield replacement (instead of trying to sell me on getting the factory original which would have been around $800).  When I called Safelite to set up an appointment, the guy told me that Peter had gotten me a really good deal on a dealership quote as opposed to what I would have had to pay if I had just called myself.

I was very pleased, as it seems Peter had gone above and beyond to help me get my windshield replaced.  If you need to get service done, Peter is the guy to talk to.  I believe both times I went was on a weekday during normal business hours and I understand that's not possible for everyone, but if you can swing it, he's the best customer service at a service garage I've ever had!

Avoid the lot on Sundays.  The mall cops they hire on Sundays are rude morons.  Sales men are like any other used car salesmen.  One star because the mall cop insulted me thinking an asian woman with a one year old is out to steal a car at 11 am on Sunday.  I'll drive to LOs Angeles for a better deal and service.

Dealing with this car dealership has been one of the worst experiences I've had in my 12 years of business transactions.

I inquired about a lease of a Mitsubishi electric car because of an article I read online which suggested getting an electric car would end up costing $60+ a month due to a $7500 credit from the government for getting an electric car.

I spoke to the General Manager and he told me that the 24-month lease program with Mitsubishi would qualify for me to get a $7500 cah back.  He explained to me that I don't get the $7,500 right away but that I file a form and I get $7,500 within 90 days from the government. I then continued with the process of submitting an application.  Not only did I get stalled for several days but I had to continuously make phone calls in order to get an answer. Then the salesman tries to sell me another type of vehicle whil we were going through the process... wtf?! Finally they tell me that I had to redo the application inorder to qualify for the $7500.  You would think that since they only sold 7 of these vehicles over the last year and had 4 left would encourage them to make the deal happen... The way they dealt with me as if the business I was giving them was a favor to me and the unprofessionalism made me question if the information they told me was true.  Too good to be true right? 

So I did more reseach online and contacted a nearby dealership to confirm the information Courtesy Imports gave me and found out it was completely incorrect!!  Not only was the $7500 a tax credit and not a refund, it is also not applicable to leases because the IRS guideline for the tax credit is only if you purchase an electric vehicle.  The leasing company gets the tax credit, not the lessee.  I called Courtesy Imports back to get their feedback on the information I had. Two of my calls got disconnected and when I called again, I was told they were "in a meeting." 

No wonder car dealerships and car salesmen have the worst reputation! But Courtesy Imports is by far the worst of them all.

We went around to different dealerships but ended up buying a car here at Courtesy Imports - Mitsubishi. PHIL treated us the best of any dealership salesman we have encountered. They stayed open late until we could finalize the deal. PHIL was savvy, easy to talk to, and negotiated with us. So far our experience has been a positive one. We are still in the process of completing all transactions. We ended up purchasing a 2014 Mitsubishi Mirage, the car that we ended up liking the most. 

Upon completion of our purchase we will update further.

Would not buy anything from this dealership . Went in to look at Mitsubishi outlanders they only had 2 on lot both 2014 models.  We were told not going to make a 2015 model so if we wanted one it would have to be what they had. Of course that was a lie. (We saw a commercial advertising 2015 models).  Didn't matter because we were also interested in a Kia Soul. After driving both we decided on a soul and went in to make a deal. We told them we were going to pay cash.  They still wanted us to fill out a credit application just in case!  Why. I have cash.  Went into finance guy he again tried to get us to fill out a credit app. I said no and we decided to go somewhere else as we were walking out some Guido Jersey Shore wannabe shouted across the showroom floor for everyone to hear that we probably didn't have the money anyway and probably had bad credit! Very poor way to treat customer especially one who wants to do a cash deal.  We ended up at team ford the next day and within 1 hour my daughter was driving a brand new Ford Focus.  Salesman said he loved cash deals and didn't know why courtesy would require a credit application on a cash deal!  Steer clear of this place. Something shady going on here and The Jersey Shore Guido is a real meatball!
Always a good time at courtesy. Great experience trading in for a new Mazda for the wife. We have always used the service dept.with the old Mazda and will continue to do so with the new.

I had a very positive experience shopping for my car here! I was assisted by Jessie and Verkler, they were very informative and really nice. I loved that I never felt pressured to make a purchase. GREAT JOB GUYS!!
 

I would recommend this place to friends.

Bill has been preparing my individual and rental property taxes for years. It is absurd to me that anyone could have anything negative to say about the guy. He thoroughly explains everything to me and answers any questions I have, even throughout the year. It has been a great benefit for me to have him handle my complicated IRA's and rental property taxes including some additional write offs I would have never known about. He is very honest and will call me if anything comes into question so that I always remain in compliance. My parents and brother have trusted his services for years as well. I recommend him to anyone who is serious about a tax and accounting professional.

Bill is the right person to trust.. He is professional and very friendly. We are new in Arizona and we had to search for a tax expert and thankfully we found bill based on yelp reviews. Every one who writes a positive something about bill is vey true and correct. Get your tax needs and even payroll done there you will be very satisfied. Good luck :)

I was self employed last year and when it came to tax time, I had no clue in the slightest what I was doing. I met with Bill who not only did my taxes and fixed everything, but he helped me know what was going on and how to be more proactive. I was expecting to pay a fortune but his fees are super reasonable, I wasn't disappointed at all. The fact that he returns my emails day or night is something I have never found elsewhere. I'll definitely be a customer for years to come.

I had been looking for an accounting professional that has experience with small businesses since it is a bit overwhelming to get everything up and started and wanted to make sure I did everything correctly. I received many recommendations and Sapphire was the most recommended so I booked an appointment and met with Jonathan. Very professional, friendly and knowledgeable! He explains everything thoroughly and makes sure all your questions get answered. I would highly recommend!
Phil was our salesperson in purchasing a 2013 Mazda 3 sedan. Did a test drive and gave us our options.  Quick and easy process. Happy with purchase!

Very knowledgeable sales man. Happy with the deal I am making. So excited to experience what Mazda has to offer. Their mid grade CX-5 blows away the competition by offering more on the standard level.

Courtesy Imports and their Yo-yo scam!  My husband and I thought a second car would be nice to have. Went in knowing what kind of car we wanted, we found the car we liked, great!...Not so fast.......

Courtesy Imports "approved" my credit....this "approval" was all part of a SCAM! We signed the financial agreement which stated that I was "approved". Steve Corbin, the salesmen calls about a week and a half later, telling me they couldn't get financing, so I would need to find a co-signer!! I asked him how that could be, because we had signed the financial agreement stating that I was APPROVED....he said he would have Rob, the finance guy call to explain .......2 weeks went by without any phone call from Steve or Rob. Then Steve calls again, saying they still can't get the financing "done" so I need to bring the car back! Um What? I say again, how can this be? and asked him to explain.....he tells me again that "Rob" will call me with more info. Well "Rob" NEVER called. Today, we took the car down there to give it back and for some reason the "financial" guy was STILL not available to speak with us.....they said all they needed from us was the keys to the car. Fine... I was done with their run around scam! 

One other thing I thought I would include as well......

They had agreed to install xm radio...they would pay....We go to sign paperwork, and they added it into the cost of the car! We finally came to an agreement that we would pay for half. fine *rolls eyes* whatever! We pick up the car, and the "factory" install, looked like awful, it was not the nice factory install we were promised. They also put a huge crack in the side panel of the car while installing it. They said that the factory install we were looking for (meaning no wires and extra junk running out the back of the car) was not possible. My husbands was so annoyed with the xm install issues he asked if we could just give the car back and they said NO, THE SALE WAS DONE AND FINAL, THEY COULD NOT TAKE THE CAR BACK....HMMMMM, then why did I they call weeks later asking for the car back. We gave the car back.....not worth our time.

Took my finance's brother in to buy a car at Courtesy Import Kia, however the sales manager was a complete douchebag... rude and unknowledgable of his own product, their reputation totally precedes their low online reviews. However, we met another salesperson, Mike Sharma, sales manager of Courtesy Imports Mazda and he totally blew us away. He took us around on few test drives on the car that my brother was considering. I've met a lot of car salesman and by he was the knew so much about not only Mazda's products but other companies as well. Sure enough he was able to convince us to buy him the new Mazda Moto 6 2014. From beginning to end, he was so cool and never pressured us to buy a car unlike the dumb salesman from Kia. We stopped by the same weekend with my fiancee's grandparents and made a purchase. The deal was fast, quick, and painless.... how a car buying experience should be. Despite the horrible reviews on yelp and on google about both these dealerships, I have to say, Mike Sharma is seriously the guy who is holding this place together by a thread. Thanks man! FYI, the douchebag is LUIS, the sales manager of KIA. What a idiot!!!

This review is for Courtesy Kia Henderson Auto Show Mall, Las Vegas

DO NOT BUY A CAR FROM THIS DEALERSHIP!!!

I purchased a Kia Sportage a year and a half ago.  The sales experience was difficult at best and took 5 hours.  I paid cash for the car and it still took 5 hours.  

When I was given the key to the car, the sales rep stated there was no secondary key - valet key and promised to find or get a new key for me.  This never occurred.  I made multiple calls and at every service tried to get the key, but no one would get me a key.  They called me a liar and that I had lost the key and was just trying to get a new one.  This is not true as upon purchase of the car there was no key.  A year and half later, nothing!

I have since sent a letter of complaint to Kia Motors Headquarters Orange County.  They state that they have nothing to do with any dealership and are a completely separate entity, however they did call the dealership and between two customer relations persons, Amy & Jason, neither could make the dealership obtain a key.   Upon the last call from Jason he stated the dealership told him, I, the customer, waited to long to obtain the key.  I told Jason this is a blatant lie and that I'd been trying to obtain the key since day one.   I went on to state that the last year and a half dealing with this issue had caused me emotional and physical distress.  He laughed at me.  I told him it wasn't funny.  He said there was nothing he could do.

Funny how a mutli-billion dollar company cannot obtain a $5 valet key for it's customer, BUT THAT KEY WILL COST ME $150.  Amazing how both the dealership and Kia Headquarters can belittle the customer, call him a liar and resolve absolutely nothing and remain in business.

My advice is to stay away from Kia Motors as a whole.  The headquarters will not stand behind it's cars or dealerships as they are a complete separate entity.
They couldn't even come over and say hi to us. Very poor customer service, walking back to our car there was a sales man right infront staring at us and he couldnt even say have a nice night.

This is also Courtesy Kia. I have bought 2 vehicles from here and the reason has always been THE SERVICE DEPT! Especially Ed!!

I recently heard that they changed ownership and I think that is good  - WHY? Sales service was always spotty and the new owners kept the best people  - Ed and the Service Team!!

Ed always knows your name and answers all questions. He tells you what really needs to be done and even where you can save a little $.

If you need car repair or basic maintenance there are definitely cheaper places to go but if you want to get an honest assessment and know you are not being hustled go see the service department at Courtesy Kia/Mazda.

Even moving to the north side of town I am continuing to take my car to them.

Thanks for keeing the best!

Thanks for all you do Ed!

The service department here is horrible.

I take my car in for them to look at a possible TSB that I recieved in the mail for a possible turbo defect (Mazdaspeed 6). I wasn't sure if I had it, so I took it in. Keep in mind my car is still under warranty. 

So I wait in the waiting room for an hour and a half and they finally take my car around the block for a minute or two. I wait another 20 minutes or so, and the service rep comes out to tell me that they found a bunch of wear and tear items that needed replacement. He pulled out a bill for $120 and told me that this is the bill for them to take my car around the block and a minor 20 min inspection. If I chose to get the wear and tear items replaced, they would take the $120 off of it. What a scam. I refused to pay the bill as my car is still under warranty. The service rep did not mention ANYTHING about charging me for them to inspect my car that's still under warranty.

The funny thing is that I walked outside to look at the new Mazdaspeeds when my car was being "looked at" and a sales rep stopped me and asked me if I had any questions. I asked him about the new Mazda 6 and when they are coming out with the Skyactive-D (twin-turbo diesel). He had no clue as to what the Skyactive-D even was.

I left the stealership and I'm never going back.

I went to Courtesy Kia with the intention of purchasing a 2012 Kia Sorento. I wanted a 4 cyl with a few added features. I was specifically told that they did not have the 4 cyl model I was looking for, but they did have a V6 with the same features in stock. I crunched the numbers and determined I could afford it, so I bought the V6... or so I thought.

I later found out the car they gave me was the 4 cyl I originally wanted, regardless of the fact that the contract said I was buying a V6. When I returned to the dealership to ask for reimbursement OR for the V6 I was told I was purchasing, they said they owe me nothing. They told me the price I negotiated on the V6 was so close to the MSRP of the 4 cyl they gave me that they didn't have to give me a penny. That would be great if it was true, but in reality, the car I drove away with MSRP'd at around $2,300 less then what we agreed on as the selling price of the V6. I confirmed this with Kia's corporate offices.

All they offered me to "fix" the issue was to pay 1 month's car payment OR upgrade my warranty. I denied both of those. I want what I'm entitled to and will continue to fight for it.

Buyer beware!!!!!

I just wish there was a way to give negative stars. Went to do a lease return with my friend and got extremely disappointed. They tried selling a new car, when we said we are not interested they threatened to charge extra for cleaning, dents, any wear and tear that the car might have although the car had just been at a body shop, polished, washed and looked spotless. They started ignoring us to a point where noone was talking to us, not answering our questions and telling us that they will only take the car back today if we bought a new one. It was my friends first kia and he will never buy another one. The ac didnt work on a brand new car and they were never able to fix it. They blamed extreme heats in las vegas. Cmon, we all own cars and a car without an ac is worthless here. This dealership is the worst there can be. Even if I was looking to get a Kia I would get it from someplace else and not this dealership. The management lacks customer service skills and all they care about is selling a car at any cost.

One would think that when you go outside of California you could get cars for cheaper. That is not the case, both Mazda dealerships are basically owned by the same folks (or family) therefor there is no competition so they can do whatever they want. 

In the end I bought my car in California and got a killer price. Competition is key to buying a car. 

Service here? Plan on paying, I got pricing from the california dealership and this one, Courtesy was 20-50% higher priced on every cost I got quotes on.

Courtesy imports was a pleasure to deal with. From the get go Mike was more than gracious with us. He spent a few hours with us making sure we were comfortable. I would recommend to ask for Mike directly when planning a trip to courtesy imports. Very knowledgable, friendly and completely opposite from the typical car salesman you expect to be selling cars. He knows it is a big purchase and makes sure all the finer details are covered.  He introduced us to his manager Louis which made us feel even more special showing that they truly care about the experience and the service. Everything about this experience was exceptional as they did everything right. Thank you we will definitely be in for our next vehicle and all future servicing. 

Alissa

My experience with the service department here is complete opposite of what I am reading on these other reviews.

Gary Fox is who we dealt with and he was very professional and courteous with us. He greeted us and checked in with us as he could. He didn't b.s. us or try to get us to more work.

We went in to get some sensors replaced. My only suggestion is to shop around. It ended up being the best deal for us to go to the dealership for what we needed fix.
 Now, I can't say this is going to be the case every time but I feel confident that a dealership is going to use new factory parts versus what another place might use.

Would I come back? Heck yes. I was a very happy and satisfied customer.

I went in knowing exactly what I wanted and what I didn't want. The salesperson was nice, but since they didn't have what I wanted, he kept pushing me to buy cars I didn't want. Like other reviewers have mentioned, the floor manager was extremely pushy and rude, he got very pissy because I said I wanted to think about, purchasing a car I didn't want to begin with. It was just a terrible experience over all. If you want a Mazda check out the dealer on west Sahara or centennial. Both were very helpful, not pushy, and honest.

About a week and a half ago 6/7, I embarked on a trip from southern California to the east coast with my mother.  I had recently gotten my air conditioning fixed in my Mazda 3 for the occasion knowing that we'd be driving through several deserts. Leaving without that fixed is just dangerous, right?!

Well, it had been working well for a couple days but, by the time we were on the outskirts of Las Vegas it started to blow 117 degree air at us. I heard one person say that it was the hottest day of the year so far. I called my mazda dealer from socal and they said to bring it to a dealer out there to keep the warranty on the new parts.

 SO! I came upon COURTESY Mazda in Henderson. I walked in and told them my story (1:00pm I'm guessing) by this point my temperature gauge was reading 119 degrees. They flat out said No, and that they would not be able to get to it till Monday (6/10).  Trying to go anywhere else would have been dangerous at temps like that and the closest dealer CENTENNIAL mazda said the same thing. I even considered driving at night but, that wouldn't have been safe either. That would have forced me to stay in Vegas over the weekend with no air conditioning and probably paying for an expensive hotel.

Luckily, there is a good person there. The woman at the service desk was very helpful in finding us a great shop. They fixed it that day in a matter of hours while, having to order the parts too. He tried to get the parts from COURTESY and they turned out to cost $900 alone. For the parts and labor I payed $700.

!!!BEWARE OF THESE SWINES!!!

You people give American business a bad name.
You should be receiving a package of elephant poop (1 Gallon) from poopsenders any day now, think of it as a metaphor for your shitty service...  

Yours truly,

Your very own anti-customer.

Was coming here to leave my own review of the service department not knowing what others have said about their experiences. After reading their reviews I must say that I am shocked that Kia (Hyundai), Mitsubishi or Mazda would allow this to happen at a dealership and represent their brands. 

Every time we brought our Kia in for service we also had similar issues arise. They would try to sell us things that we did not need. They were also not very easy going or polite. The final straw (and the reason we did not lease another Kia) came on our last oil change last month. My wife drove her car out of the bay and heard a strange clunking sound. She made it to the end of their property and got out to see what it was, she found a giant screw sticking out of her tire. She returns to the bay and the service manager looks at it and say's she must have ran over a screw and then tries to sell her a new tire. Furious that this happened on their watch in their garage she protests and the service manager agrees to pull the screw and fix it at no cost. Only after she got frustrated. 

Had no issues with the sales department and we got a great deal on the car when we purchased it. Think that they need to overhaul the service department experience and take them off any sales quotas or commission structures they might be working off. Too bad as Kia makes some good and cheap vehicles but it was not worth it to us. Too much competition and great deals to be had.



UPDATE: all people who lease from KIA should expect to get hit with a BS $400 "Disposition Fee" when they turn in their lease. Handed back a mint condition Sorento and was told we were good to go. This bill arrived weeks later charging us $400. KIA claims they charge it to "take your vehicle back" and put into inventory. Yes, they charge you to accept their own property back. They would waive it if we bought a new KIA only (extortion). This item is sneaked in when you sign your lease agreement. Was never explained to us. BS charge. Be aware of it.

On 11-7-13 Me and my wife traded in a H2 for a gas saving Kia Optima.  Our sales person was good.  We spent several hrs working on the trade. Finally paid full price less 10k trade in.   We were ok with that.  Now on the 11-26 the finance department wants us to resign and won't return my calls.  With Thanksgiving only two days away we can't make it  in until after.  I really just wanted the finance guy contact us so we could relax and enjoy our Thanksgiving day off.  Now we are stressing about the contract and not happy.   I will let everyone know on Friday if we still have our Kia. Also I almost forgot they never payed off the balance owned on the H2 and the payment was due on 11-18.  Now I look like an idiot.   Thanks a lot :(

Yay only 4 days later and was called to pick up my green slip. Walked to the cashiers area to see Jesse. He of course was very nice again asked how my car was. I say great but the tire pressure light was on. He says right away "give me the keys I'll have them fill em up."  Asked if I had any other questions and  I did about the phone book set up he took me out to the car and went over it with me again. So happy!
Amazing experience! Everyone was really friendly and we got a nice car! Robert was very professional and most importantly he understood our needs.  We got the car that we wanted and a good deal.

BEWARE of Courtesy Imports when purchasing a used car. Verify all the charges on your contract. Shame on me! We've purchased two cars from the KIA side. It was very late one night and car buying is not my favorite thing to do. I was asked to initial by figures on my contract. The figures didn't line up very good. They still use old school printers. What I thought was the sales tax turned out to be an AFTMKT charge. Aftermarket? Nothing on my SUV was after market. Plus, I came in with my own financing and they still shopped around and dinged my credit with inquiries. I will never buy a car from them again and I hope after reading this you will go elsewhere.

Seriously, you guys are a joke. 

You never even mentioned that I had the option of using your lawyer. I don't know how I can "insist" on using my own lawyer when you don't even give me the option. Given the poor attention to detail at the company, this shouldn't be surprising. Furthermore, if someone does choose to use their own lawyer, you should make them aware of the maximum reimbursement. Let's also not ignore the fact that in the contract, it says "Est Cost". Nowhere does it say maximum. 

Now you accuse me of threatening to write a bad review. Lol. I never did and never will. I tried to resolve this amicably, and since we didn't, I wrote my review. 

People reading this can clearly see that there is a pattern here with a lack of service. Choose wisely.

If i could give them less i would but 1 is the lowest and trust me these company is much lower than the lowest! shady, bait and switch!, written quote, verbal quote all good until the actual agreement and then its way UP and the written agreement is nothing like the verbal conversation or the initial written quote!They couldn't even spell my simple name correctly.  In the end I was told "take it or leave it!" Customer service? If you want a MORTGAGE: GO SOMEWHERE ELSE and I DID. I am telling you about my first hand experience with this less than honest company.  5:00pm the quote was one way, the email agreement 5 minutes later was TOTALLY DIFFERENT.  Do yourself a favour and save any aggravation and GO SOMEWHERE ELSE and be sure of your lender.  This company is not honest.  I am glad I read the agreement before i signed anything.  MOVE ON TO ANOTHER COMPANY, why chance your money to these people?  You have to TRUST someone before you sign an agreement.  You have been warned!  I would rather not say, "I TOLD YOU SO!"

Went with Butler for my first mortgage and also for a refinancing. Never had any issues and the process was fairly straightforward each time. Rates were good as well. Not sure what everyone else is complaining about but we worked with William, Tara, and Ashley and it was a pleasant experience.

Terrible experience. They got me to fill out an online application, pulled my wife and my credit (which are good) and never followed up. Left a message and an email, but still no reply. Given that we try to limit how many credit inquiries hit our file so as to not negatively impact our credit, don't appreciate the non-follow up after doing a credit pull. So unprofessional! Recommend avoiding this place.

Yelp keeps deleting my reviews of this place and I'm sure they have deleted similar reviews for no reason.

worst Bank ever... i closed my account today after noticing a few bogus fees.. one was for using a teller when I supposedly only had an E account which was news to me seeing as I set up the account in person!! and had made several deposits in person.. but they decided to charge me anyway.. 
the next charge was for a bad address.. when i asked why they told me some mail was sent back to the post office.. I asked the bank manager to look up my address on their computer and saw with my own eyes that it was correct, so was the address on my Drivers license that they had a picture of on their computer, but that didn't stop them from charging me anyways.. then I asked why if I have an e account are you sending me mail anyway its an e account doesn't that mean email only, and I've signed up for paperless billing.. she said yes..im going to have to research that... I said no close my account I'm sick of these bogus charges.. Then they charged me 10 bucks for closing the account because of the unwarranted charges... This location also has some of the worst customer service I've have ever seen, when first going in person to set up the account they told me to go home set it up online first then come back and i could finish it in person.  I have never heard of that before.. then when I asked how to set up an online profile so i can check my about they basically ignored me, I told them i tried and because of the confusing layout of their website set up a totally new account, which i had to delete later.. I'm surprised they never charged me to delete that account...

Thursday afternoon I explained how I was looking for an auto loan Asap. I needed to email over additional documents, which I did. It is now Monday and I still hadn't received a response in to whether or not I qualify for the loan. When I asked Christina if I would have an answer by Friday morning she said "Yeah." So here I am days later... I asked to speak to a manager and it went straight to voicemail! I called back and Christina (the woman handling my loan) and not suprisingly wasn't available just like the other times I had called to talk to her I even had to get her email (to send my documents she requested) from a different employee. I then spoke with Andrew and he was helpful and nice. He explained to me they had only received my tax return, I had also emailed Christina a copy of my income so I guess she didn't even bother to look at it! Andrew explained she denied my loan so I had to get a co-signer. I now have to wait till 3 or 4pm for an answer.... They really need to work on being more time efficient and accommodating to their customer's needs. I won't be coming here again.

My husband and I love working with Duane.  He has experience with every situation we throw his way and is very efficient when we meet with him.  We leave every appointment knowing that our taxes were done the right way.  Not to mention he is a great guy and very easy to talk to!

Duane has done our personal taxes for several years and we couldn't have been more pleased. This year, however, he really helped saved my small business from a storm of self-inflicted IRS issues. You couldn't find a more knowledgeable, skilled and compassionate advocate than Duane. Plus, very reasonable rates! :)

Duane and the staff at Beckett Tax either know the answers or they find them. I've had some complex situations that they easily worked through. Superb service and super friendly. 

I've been very very pleased with Beckett Tax and will continue to go there. I have recommended them to friends and will continue to do so!

Great staff, honest and reasonably priced. I had called H&R block for a quote, and it would've cost nearly twice as much as it did at Beckett. Additionally, the woman who did my taxes didn't charge me for two smaller forms I wasn't expecting because it put me $25 over the quote they gave me over the phone. My appointment took longer than expected due to the complexity of my business expenses, and I didn't feel rushed or like a nuisance. All my questions were fully answered, and I feel confident going forward that my complex self-employment taxes were finally done right (as opposed to by me in an online program)! They were also helpful over the phone and said to call anytime with additional questions. Very friendly and down-to-earth.

I talked to a regional VP-type of customer service relations a few days ago and she can't help me. I went to Comerica and in five days had the credit I needed and the cards in hand. Unfortunately, I'm severing a long relationship with the BMO Bank. That's four accounts and many years of trust. They just don't have the same expertise and willingness with small business as I'm seeing at Comerica.
I've been a member 12 years and they always provide great service with low loan rates.

Worst experience for the entire process. Please save yourself and avoid this place. Two and a half hours to get approved for a loan when I was a previous customer. You would think that would speed up the process. During that long wait no one bothered to tell me about title fees or anything else. After talking to a manager it was very clear that he did not care about any of my issues or frustrations. When I finally went to pay off the balance and close my account, somehow they said there was a remaining balance of 40 cents. If I paid the balance remaining in full I should not owe a penny! Again no one cared. I was then misinformed again that I should receive my title in approximately 2 days since its been paid, only to wait two weeks and call and be properly informed of the actual process. All in all it was a huge nightmare and no one wanted to make any effort to make a better experience.

This is the slowest bank of America I have ever been to in the United States. They are always understaffed and are in no hurry to change that.Ive tried them on several occasions and a 20 minute minimum wait just is silly! Don't ha e a branch here if your not going to staff it correctly! I recommend any other Bank of America in the city!
What a waste of time! Slowest bank I've ever been to. Just one of the reasons I don't bank with them anymore.

I can't say enough wonderful things about this branch! The manager is fantastic, the other employees are happy, enthusiastic, and efficient.  Not to mention that everyone there has impeccable manners and they treat their customers as customers deserve to be treated! Go to this branch, you'll understand what I mean!

I have banked with B of A for over 20 years and have always been very happy with their services and customer service. From San Diego to Florida and now Arizona, I've found nothing but helpful, approachable employees who seem to enjoy what they do. This branch was very helpful when I was transferring my accounts to Arizona. Soon I will be checking them out for mortgage loans. I'll check back in at that time.

This Bank Of America is the WORST of the worst. The customer service is terrible, they treat you like they own your money and how dare you ask for it back. Then charge you an arm and a leg to access your money. Not to mention they were complicit in the biggest financial scam this world has ever seen, contributing first-hand to the the subprime mortgage crisis and the credit default swaps that had a significant negative impact on the creditworthiness and net worth of almost every single American family. I'd trust my money to Bernie Madoff rather than this scum-sucking company.  BANK WITH A CREDIT UNION http://www.moveyourmoneyproject.org/
Highly recommend!  Been a customer at this Anthem branch since they first opened.

This not just a rating of this particular branch it is a rating of Wells Fargo in general. They are an unbelievably poor banking institution. I have been with Wells for more than 20 years with a business account for 5 years and 5 years with a Non Profit business account. They are mediocre at best with personal banking and they are horrible at business banking. Their biggest problem in the area of Business Banking  is they have kids as "business bankers." Every time I have to have something done I get an 18 year old that I have to explain to them how it was done the last time I had it done. As difficult as it is to move to a new bank with multiple accounts, they have finally convinced me that banking with anyone else is a better idea.

Last week I posted a negative review of my first initial interaction with Platinum Home Warranty. While at first I admit I was upset, Platinum Home Warranty really stepped up to make sure my opinion was heard. They really went above and beyond to take care of me, and I emphasize they care about customer service. I was  really impressed with my experience with June. 
After she explained the policies and worked with her managers to find a solution. I can say I was wrong in my initial comments.

June displayed a true customer service focus and I'm glad to have Platinum Home Warranty and I would recommend them to any new first time home buyer.

Worst customer service I've ever experienced!

If I could give them a 0 I would.  My relator talked me into giving them a try when I purchased a new home.  1 week after our move-in the water heater stopped working.  I called Platinum and they were rude, dismissive and did everything in that initial contact to delay getting a servicer to the property.  I was so disgusted by their behavior that I opted to just cancel the contract and go with a trusted provider.

Even the cancellation was problematic.  They requested that I send an email with the written request to cancel the contract.   I did as requested and never heard back.  Several days later, I sent another email to confirm that my request had been received and processed.  I got a flippant response that "I had not requested confirmation so they didn't provide it."   

What business operates that way and claims to have the customer's best interest at heart?  

If you want an example of a company that has customer service right - check out One Guard.  
In the end, I had to replace the water heater out of pocket....I'd gladly pay that $800.00 out of pocket just to avoid having to do business with Platinum Home Warranty.
Platinum Home Warrant is exactly that - Platinum! I have used them for over 2 years to give me peace of mind in my home

Yelp needs a zero star option! I rented a house with their warranty. The AC quit working when it was 110 out and they would only come mon-fri 8-5 and I can't miss work, so after a few days and talking my 75 year old dad into staying at my house to wait for them we had an appointment. They came and started to replace the fan motor outside, once my father saw their tech struggle with it and damage the fan blades he started to help. Once the guy was done he said it was good and left. I checked on it after work and the whole unit vibrated bad, must be normal if their tech left it like that. So two months later I came home to a hot house and the unit outside making an insane noise, I noticed the blade for the fan had came loose from collar that is mounted to the motor shaft and the motor was just spinning without the fan blade moving. I knew making an appointment would be a mess so I welded the blade to the collar since they were both trash and replaced as one piece and still made an appointment so it could be corrected in a more permanent way. A few days later a tech showed up and told my friend that I asked to be there for them that there was nothing wrong and it looked good. I almost had to argue with him about what it needed and once he realized he said ok and would order a fan blade and left. The next day I was told I need to pay $300 to have the blade replaced because I welded it. Seems obvious from all their reviews this place is quite the scam and try's to snake out of any repairs but more than happy to fix it for an extra charge. Save your money, it'd be cheaper to pay a competent company to just repair it right the first time

Worst home warranty company ever! After piddling around for over a week trying to find a cheap fix for a water heater & us paying extra for FedEx shipping of a part that didn't work they promised to have the water heater replaced on Saturday. No shows. Company doesn't give a crap because the home is under contract for sale so they'll lose our business anyway. Their serious lack of customer service & caring for customers just cost us another $1000 trying to close the sale. They'll be seeing my fiancé in court to recoup what he's lost. Zero stars for this company. Don't use them!

I have had better to say the least. We ran into a water issue and rather than fixing the problem they simply put a band aid on the real issue. I was even told that, by one of their own, that when this was all done I would be ready to kick Platinum to the curb, couldn't be more right. Speaking with them on the phone all they would do is come up with reasons why they did not really make the true fix. I've had home warranties in the past and they were far superior to Platinum. I will not be renewing my warranty. I'd rather pay out of pocket because that's essentially what I have to do with Platinum.

Yelp obviously seems to disagree, avoid this business and the customer service that comes along with it.  The actual field workers do good work. It's the office staff that will scam,lie,and do anything it takes to make a dollar.  Used to be a good company but now it has gone the same route as most business in the US....screw the customer any way possible

My air conditioner broke on a Saturday at the worst time. I was released from the hospital and came home to a hot house. I called platinum home warranty first person I spoke with said that they couldn't do anything. Then I called again explaining my situation and someone told David. He called explained he would work with me. David helped last minute with a smile. He was very gracious and accommodating. David is a great repairman. Thank you

This company is horrible to work with!  We got the warranty as part of our house purchase, it came with free changing of the locks.  They lost the check and it took more then two weeks for them to get us in their system.  I should have taken this as a hint of what was to come.  
My first call was for two appliances.  The microwave was sparking and a burner on the stove was not working.  Since it was two appliances it was two separate service calls.  Annoying but I paid the $120.  The microwave needed to be replaced so I was told that they would pay $250 for a new unit but they do not pay for instal.  
Next call was for the outlets in the kitchen.  The GFCI was popping for no reason.  Nothing plugged in and sometimes not even in the room.  The electrician that came out was great, super helpful and friendly.  After the one outlet was replaced all of the other GFCI's started popping.  So I called back and explained the issue.  The electrician was sent back out.  I was told that since it was a different circuit that I would have to pay $60 again.  I called to get more info about why i was going to be charged again.  After a long unpleasant conversation I asked the lady if she knew what all of her circuits did and was told "No, but I'm not the one have electrical problems".
I feel like they are just after money and do not care about customer service.  I will not be renewing my warranty and I would NEVER recommend them!!

Criminals who hire shifty contractors.
I was their customer for only a week. Called in my first work order, had to call back 2 days later because a plumber never called me as promised. When he finally did, he started walking me through one of several potential ways to fix the problem (no...you do it). Called in about this, they didn't know why I couldn't just take he long drawn out advice.
When we did call back to schedule an appt.. We got offered a very narrow window because he "doesn't live anywhere near us." When we asked for a different time, he said he'd have to charge us more than the warranty fee for that. The nerve!
Called in to cancel. I'd been a customer for a week. Asked for full refund, and they tried to charge a $50 processing fee! Really?
Manager finally waived it. Will Never do business with them again

I just called Platinum for the second time.  My wife and i are school teachers and have a difficult time with schedule.  Platinum is very helpful.  First time a garbage disposal was replaced with a new one.  This time there is a unit air conditioning problem.  I am impressed with both the competence of the workers and the accommodation for people's time.  thank you PLATINUM.

I got a warranty when I purchased my home earlier this month. It is the end of the month now and I've already had to call them twice, and they delivered both times!

First, about a week into living in the house (on a Saturday), the A/C stopped working. I called Platinum and they immediately had their tech call. The tech was kind, but initially when I talked to him, he didn't seem to want to come out to the house. He asked me if I could wait a few hours to see if the A/C would start working again. I  didn't want to risk having no A/C overnight, so I insisted that he come out and he complied. The tech was at my house 20 minutes later, and after getting up on the attic he determined the cause of the problem to be the compressor motor, which he was able to replace immediately. I paid $120 for the weekend service call (business days are $60), but it was worth it to get my A/C working again.

Second, about a week later, my kitchen sink was backing up. So I called and scheduled an appointment for the next day. The tech showed up early (same guy from a week earlier, actually) and he snaked the sewer drain pipe and cleared the blockage. The sink drain is working fine now.

The service has been great! I'd recommend Platinum to any homeowner. I will definitely be continuing my warranty with them.
Platinum Home Warranty was responsive, polite, courteous and efficient when we requested service for our garage door opener.

We have had excellent service from our Platinum Home Warranty.  They have repaired our AC, replaced our garbage disposal, repaired our water softener and replaced a toilet tank mechanism.  All of our requests for service have been promptly taken care of within 1-2 days and all of the service/repair people have been very knowledgeable, efficient and professional.  Could not be happier and we will continue to renew our warranty.

This past weekend, I had the pleasure of receiving a push notice on my phone that the temperature had reach 119.  I also had the amazement to find that my air conditioning was not working.

I called Platinum.  In the past I have had mixed results.  Jeff the technician called me back in about ten minutes to say that he was on the way.  I remembered Jeff from the last time he was here.  He is the type of guy you want to see when this type of thing happens to you.  He is a positive guy that knows how to service a heating/cooling unit.  He went on my roof and minutes later I heard the unit turn on.  I was impressed.

I had discussed with him my previous rating due to my frig which I stand by.  The bottom line is that Platinum is good at some things (heating/cooling, plumbing and other things that they have on staff) and not good at other things (e.g. electrical and other contracted services they provided via a third party).  

I feel that this company is getting it together and may actually go forward with renewing my contract.

Thanks Jeff.

Not a fan.  It's an inexpensive plan but when you do need something fixed there are hidden charges like recovery and disposal fees on A/C units that companies like AHS don't charge.  I will be canceling this week.  They also charge double on the weekend which other home warranties don't charge

I have a rental property in Phoenix and was very pleased with the way Platinum took care of my renters this past weekend when the units A/C went out. They arrived within a couple of hours of my initial call, and got the A/C working immediately! They also educated my tenants on simple maintenance techniques to avoid future outages. It's a great feeling to know that my rental properties will be in good hands with Platinum while I'm out of state. It's hard to find reliable, trustworthy technicians these days. Platinum earned itself a life-long customer!

First, let me say their technicians are great, very professional, and competent.  Unfortunately, their hands are tied by the home warranty contract.  Most of you are probably like me and received the warranty with the purchase of a new home.  I was not able to review the contract ahead of time.  The contract excludes most major repairs and they will find any reason possible to avoid fixing almost everything.  They will charge you the $60 service fee just to tell you that something is not covered.  You're much better off setting aside the warranty money into your savings account to pay for unexpected home repairs.

Received a platinum warranty as a gift from my real estate broker.  I was having an a/c issue...the tech came out the same day and figured out the problem.  I called the next day to see progress of claim.  When they called back to say it was approved to be repaired but there was a "recovery fee" of $150 that needed to be paid BEFORE I could schedule the part being ordered.  The recovery fee is for the freon that will be lost during the repair.  Then the service woman called to tell me it was 2-3 weeks before the part would arrive...didn't they tell you?  No, they just wanted my $150 now. Then she proceeds to explain my other options...if you want the part in a day or two it is $60 more or in one week it is $25 extra.  Talk about extortion...I'm new to this home warranty game...but this sounds like a scam to me.  If the freon is lost in the repair why would I need to pay an additional $150 and then if I want the part in a timely manor I need to pay $25-60 dollars extra.  You be the judge

Read the other 1 star reviews for Platinum Home Warranty and that pretty much sums up what I have to say about them. I have been with them for 1.5 years. No problems and great repairmen. I have PHW's Platinum service for my condo as I had older appliances and an older A/C when I bought my condo 1.5 years ago and I wanted to be able to have them replaced when the time came.  The time has come. My A/C, having had 7 service calls since I joined PHW, finally gave it up. Will they replace it like they say they will? NOPE!

The story: My A/C is too old and the sun has faded the serial number, so they can't tell what it is and can't order/get the cooling coil it needs. Per their fine print:
1.) Section D under Limitations of Liability, Item 6E., "Platinum is not liable for the replacement of the "complete" system or appliance due to the non-availability of one or more of its parts or incomplete or missing model numbers".

If the appliance is old and the parts no longer exist, it will not be replaced - especially if the serial/model number has faded from sun exposure or age, which is an act of God, and therefore, is not covered. Bottom line, they will keep repairing an appliance until it is too old; therefore making certain they are not bound to replace that item.

2.) Section F under Covered Systems and Appliances, Item 12 for Heating, A/C, Heat Pump, and Evaporative System, under "Not Covered", "Platinum is not liable for complete system replacement in the event of a non-repairable leak"

My A/C cooling coil has a leak and Freon has to be added all of the time. As the model is quite old, getting the appropriate coil will not happen. Therefore, Platinum does not have to replace my A/C.

I have spoke to two people today in Claims and Service at PHW about replacing my A/C. I received an estimate of "this GREAT deal" (NOT!!!) for a Heil 3 ton heat pump at their wholesale price of $6837.35 and they will give me a $1500 discount and expect me to pay them $4837.35 + $60 service fee. Heil is not that good and when I researched this on the internet, I found a company that would sell me this same heat pump for under $3000 total cost incl. installation, etc.  I am currently trying to obtain quotes from other companies. I did speak with one company and received a quote for a better quality Bryant 3 ton heat pump for a total cost of $4200, which is $637 less than what Platinum wants to charge me for an inferior product. When I told the second person I spoke to at PHW, she got upset and tried to tell me that they were giving me a great price for a quality unit that is superior to the Bryant as one of their managers is having a Heil installed in her home and she only wants the best. If you look at the consumer ratings, Heil is close to the bottom of quality brands for heat pumps. My response to her was, "If your manager decides to jump off a bridge, we should all jump off a bridge because your manager has such a good idea?"  DUH!!! C'mon, Platinum! You all got a deal on some Heil's and your manager is probably getting this unit for free or at least a very low price making it worth her while.  Then, you pass on her savings to my fee!  No thank you!

Think twice before choosing PHW.  Read the fine print first.  I wish I had.

Going through AAA is a bit worse than your average DMV. The woman working the front desk was nice, but that was about the sum of it. The guy who processed our registration was patronizing and slow. He also made a mistake that required fixing after the fact. I can't say I'm enamored with the peculiarities of Pennsylvania licensing laws.

Avoid this place/service if you are military.

Place was a little bit of a disaster. Its easy to be dissatisfied and rant about a customer services organization. So i take my hits with a grain of salt with these places (and not yelp about it). But this place's incompetency took the cake.

Im military living outside of PA. Made calls to AAA and asked if i could renew my PA license on the spot - was told i could. So i drove 6 hours there on a weekend to renew. Upon arriving i got three different stories from three different AAA people (all adamant on their stance of how to renew). It ended with the last person telling me I couldnt do it (had to wait 10 days for a camera card first before renewing - which I couldnt do). The confusion wouldnt have been that much of a gripe to yelp about - but the 'matter of fact' language used with all the conflicting opinions of a non existent policy was the nail in the yelp coffin for them. Having a 12 hour drive wasted didnt make it any better as well.

Not that bad of an experience is what I keep telling myself, and that's what I'll stick to.

Confusion sets in as soon as you near the place, and before you step foot in the door.  Do I park on the street, do I pull in that lot that has all the confusing signs?  Take your pick it doesn't really matter.  Careful crossing the streets to get here.  

Once inside, the confusion continues.  Signs are somewhat lacking and really don't directly tell you where you need to go.  Getting lost is easy in here.  Majority of the time, escalators are down for maitenence, making it that much harder to navigate the building.

My soul purpose to coming here was to get my license picture taken.  At usual locations for the DMV, you walk in, take a number and sit and wait.  Not here.  Without a sign to indicate that you need to stop at the reception desk until you make it to the DMV portion of the floor, you have to turn around and wait in a line.  And when you wait, you get to hear the receptionist make a snarky remark about how you can't read a sign...MAKE IT BIGGER AND PUT IT WHERE A PERSON, not a dog, CAN SEE IT.

Thank god that all I had to do was get a picture taken while in here, or I might have lost it.

Sidenote: Is it just me, or would this place have been better used if it was a market to buy fresh meats and produce in.  Or an indoor shopping center?

It is so painful for me to give this place a 5 star review, but when I think back to the bad times I've had here, it's because I was in a terrible mood when I walked in and it just didn't get better. 
When you come here, be prepared to wait. I routinely wait for about an hour. Seems ridiculous? It used to piss me off but now I bring a magazine. 
It is better to have a AAA membership when you go here because you will get a discount, but it is the only DMV in the area. It is convenient because of that, and they do validate parking.
I recently bought an SUV out of state. The transfer could not have been easier, even with the messed up mileage written down by the idiot I bought it from. Can you believe he actually tried to sell me the truck with a Bill of Sale?? Yeah, um NO! (I'm just justifying calling him an idiot).
You can get pretty much everything done here, even get your license renewed. Do not go here on the weekend. It is a zoo. And don't go here during lunch hours during the week. Around 2 in the afternoon on a weekday has done me well. 
Just be patient and treat the employees with respect, and you will get out of here in one piece and maybe even in a good mood!

I moved to Pgh from San Francisco in 2010, and every single dealing I've had with AAA since I moved here has been great -- straightforward, super helpful people, and mostly quite brief wait times. 

The agent that I have worked with from the start, whose name I think is Heather (long dark hair, second desk from the left), has always been willing to spend as much time with me as I needed to understand what I was buying and/or the process that I needed to go through.

Also, my car was totaled a couple of years ago (some jagoff who was texting rear-ended me, ahem, please don't do this), and they were phenomenal. I had a check for the full amount in less than a week.

I see a lot of negative reviews here for services that are title related. I don't know if those people are even AAA employees, they might be DOT for all we know. I've had three title transactions, including one for a car that was from out of state, and they all went smoothly. 

I've been with AAA for more than 40 years, and when I lived in California I was seriously considering switching. Not anymore.

I've had a wide range of experiences here.  Let's just say, when I first moved here, one of the employees gave me poor advice and ended up totally screwing up my title.  It's been a tremendous ordeal to get it fixed.  Another employee tried to help me fix it and screwed that up too.  Now I'm working with a third person who seems very competent and committed to helping me solve this problem, but even she is like "I can't believe those other people told you to do that....they made this so much harder than it needed to be."  My thoughts exactly.

Work with Barb, if you can.  She knows her stuff.  I don't quite trust anybody else to help me properly.  Also they're only open from 830-4 (or is it 430?) so you pretty much have to go before work, or on Saturday.  And I will be going in tomorrow at 830 until my car title saga finally comes to its conclusion....

Also, parking is free in their lot.  And if you are a AAA member, I think your fees are lower, or something like that.  I do have AAA, so it makes sense for me to come here - I can't say what the experience is like for non members.
Note that they CANNOT process your out of state license into a PA one. Learned this one the hard way even though the person I called beforehand insisted that it was a full service DMV.

This AAA is very large, has its own, free parking lot, and is staffed by helpful people.  I was able to renew my vehicle registration in 10 minutes, total.  I love it.  This is my new, favorite place.

there is no option for zero stars so i was forced to give one. 7 weeks ago i wasted an hour of my time and $5 to process a title transfer. BTW, east liberty/motor square garden-their parking lot is awful! who makes paying customers fetch tokens to park? 7 weeks later, no title? for some odd reason, local AAA offices dont post their phone number online? instead, you get the generic 412-363-5100 number which is a call ctr and they have to "transfer" you to the local office? naturally, i get an automatic voicemail. and again naturally, no return phone call. CANT WAIT until AAA calls me to renew my membership. complete incompetence. might as well deal with penndot!
Worst experience.  Slow, rude, unhelpful, and completely clueless.  After one hour here and talking to 4 different people, I was absolutely no closer to getting my driver's license renewed.

I called the phone number for this AAA listed on Google yesterday, and I asked the lady about Travel Visa cards. My husband is going to the Bahamas, works during all of their business hours here, and needs a travel card. I asked about the foreign exchange markup and about what I needed to bring with me to get a card in my husband's name. She said nothing and that you can get up to 4 cards on one account and give them to anyone. So I said OKAY! and then the next day drove the 25 minutes into East Liberty (my LEAST favorite place to drive in Pittsburgh), and I get there, sit down with the cashier, and find I cannot get my travel card because my husband isn't with me and he needs to be sitting there in order for her to assign a card to him. She told me about companion cards, which apparently can be given to anyone, but only if they come with you to the office. She tried to be helpful by offering a suggestion to visit my bank, but she should have been able to give me the companion card for my husband to use in the Bahamas. I should have the right and prerogative to set up a dedit card, put a ton of cash on it, and give someone the card and the pin to use. I will never come to this place again. Sad to say the other reviews I read of this place are accurate.

If I could give negative stars I would. After this review, I'm writing the president of AA and if action is not taken to correct the disservice at this location, I will never be a AAA member again. (been one since 1999) 

I recently moved from TN and needed to transfer my title and register my Dodge Ram in PA.  (a Dodge Ram is a truck... in case you didn't know... cause they didn't) This process is costly regardless of where you go, but adding $36+ for every transaction makes AAA the most expensive.  I'm willing to pay for people to deal with this inconvenience for me, but AAA has made it worse than going to the DMV.  Each and every clerk at this location is incompetent, uneducated, and aloof. I should know, I've dealt with at LEAST a dozen. Go to the DMV.

For my very simple transaction, I've had to return to this location 7 (yes that is SEVEN!) times, and it still is not resolved. They've forgotten to request the title from my lien holder, issued the wrong plate for my vehicle, neglected to inform me of steps required by the state... I mean seriously, why would you pay $36 for EACH visit, just to get it wrong. Go to the DMV!

Why did you return there if you were so unhappy, you might ask.  Well once you begin the process at one branch, you cannot transfer to any other branch. (We went to Monroeville to transfer my wife's car and it took 30 minutes, ONCE.) Go to Monroeville, or cancel your AAA membership and go to the DMV!!

Oh, and 30 minutes? that's a dream... I'm waited between 45 minutes and 3.5 HOURS at the East Liberty AAA. Prepare to take the day of work... nay, the WEEK in order to complete any transaction at this facility. Go to the DMV!!!!

It has now been over 5 months since I started this process and it's still up in the air. they don't know what I still need to do, but they are happy to keep charging me to figure it out.  Save yourself hundreds of dollars and a weeks worth of lost wages and just GO TO THE DMV!!!!!!!! Yeah it might seem sterile and slow, but at least they aren't serial criminals. It'll be over with like waking up from a bad dream, instead of the reoccurring nightmare that is the East Liberty AAA.

Oh, and if you think this is a harsh review... Call their number, 412-365-7196. 9 times out of 10 it just rings and rings.. once I timed it for more than 30 minutes before I got an answer (with no apology).  If you are in the AAA, you'll know I'm calling.  It's the constant ring in the background that NOBODY answers.

I have to say that I have had quick and efficient stops in here for all of my car needs. Firstly, walking into this building is quite a spectacle, from the beautiful exterior and interior. I have to be honest, my first trip in here I felt like taking my escalator down into the pit that is AAA was equivalent to taking a trip into the fifth ring of hell. I hate anything dealing with the DMV, registration, license, tags, blah blah blah. However, both of the times I stopped in here it was not crowded at all, and the women that helped me were very nice and thoughtful. The stations you must go through are quick and effective. Both times I had business here, I was in and out in less than a half hour- which was far better than the marathon nightmare I was expecting.
So grateful I found this place! Staff was incredibly helpful with everything! Couldn't be more happy with my reaults

Don't do it! I spent $1500.00 to have my credit score go from 500 to 579. Really no help, just a big waste of money. Also they don't follow up with communication. I had to drop by and ask to see someone to see where things were at. Nothing went as they said it would. I feel ripped off.
They were fast and efficient on my mortgage refinance.  No hiccups or speed bumps.  Everything went off without a hitch.

Served 6 years in USAF. I was active duty during the the Gulf War. I went in with my DD-214 and was denied because I was not active duty or related to anyone active duty...pitiful!!
