Happy Veterans Day...or as Navy Federal would say....happy Veterans Day to all those who are active duty and piss on the rest of us!!!!!

I've banked with Navy Federal since 2009. I had an unauthorized charge come out of my account in August and they're telling me that there's nothing they can do to help me. So basically, my money isn't safe in my account. Now I need to cancel my direct deposits and open a new account at a REAL bank that can actually protect veterans money.

Aw Yeah, my reaction when I heard they were adding a Henderson branch of Navy Fed. I was introduced to this Credit Union 5 years ago. I was with old Wells Fargo, that charged monthly fee to keep my money in their bank. So it was a no brained to go with Navy fed which required no monthly min balance and NO FEE's to keep your money in their bank :D. When I moved to NV I was saddened to find out that the closest Navy fed was in North Vegas. So I was doing back flips when they announced that they were opening one right down on Sunset. The staff is very friendly and helpful. They have a FREE coinstar type machine that deposits your spare change right into your account (with no fee). Not to mention that they always have little perks and promotions, to make the best of your hard earned cas$h. They offer home and auto loans and amazing rates. Always helpful and going above and beyond this place has my loyalty.

Just went in and waited in line for 30 minutes to be told by the navy Fed worker at the counter that I needed to go to a separate area/line to get a new debit card. She basically gave me that too bad so sad look. I told her a sign should be posted and her quick response was well call a manager if you like. Navy FCU I've been a member since 2001. Sad excuse for employees at this location.
Wonderful service with an awesome staff!  Always willing to assist..... With class,and a smile!  Highly recommend!

Great location with friendly staff.  They have a computer to log into your own account right there at the bank which is very convenient to pay a quick bill and manage your accounts in addition to the normal amenities a Navy Federal provides.
5 STAR! Teresa Salas is the best! She always helps us and is so sweet! She has the best personality!

This place is a joke. 

I know several people that walked in and simply told them (without proof) that they had family in the Navy and were not only given accounts but they also received a $50 cash bonus. I'm not even sure if these friends were even telling the truth LOL but when I go in they request all kinds of paperwork on my father, who recently passed away, paperwork which is extremely time consuming and costly. And if I get that paperwork the bonus cash is off the table as well. Needless to say I went with a competitor. It still stings because I had heard many good things about Navy Federal and the credit union I went with has been unsatisfactory.

PS - The older woman receptionist/greeter/front desk person is pretty rude and isn't the least bit helpful.

I only use the ATM at this branch. I have had bankers open accounts in the past without my knowledge and when I asked for the District Managers phone number, I was given an assistants name and number under the impression that she was the DM.  I understand bankers need to make their numbers but opening accounts without a customers consent so that you can make your "numbers" is illegal.
Very awesome friendly service at this Wells Fargo. The staff here smile and provide customer service like it should be.

I drive an extra 15 min to go to this branch.  I have one right in my town and will go to this branch.  They go out of their way to help you and are very friendly.  They don't rush you even when there is a line.  This branch should be a training branch for other B of A employees.

I've been banking at this branch since 2004. I have a personal account and a business account here, and my adult kids have also opened accounts at this branch as well.

The two drive-thru ATMs are convenient, and there is rarely a wait of more than one or two cars. The same could be said for the single walk-up machine outside. There is ample parking, and the location is a convenient stop as I head down Horizon Ridge to head into town.

Inside, I have found the tellers to be well-trained and exceedingly friendly. Although dozens of tellers have come and gone over the years, the same friendly demeanor at the counter has been a constant.

My single complaint about this branch is it often seems understaffed with tellers at the busiest times of the day. Some of the longer waits there have seemed excessive, and I've never experienced such delays across the street at Wells Fargo.

That single complaint aside, I have generally positive feelings about this particular B of A location, primarily due to its prime location and friendly staff.

Having to go to this location practically every other day and week for the past two months ... One teller and other employees just doing nothing while there's a long line is not a good look ... I don't appreciate the customer care here and I wish my husband doesn't bank here but considerate enough that the regular branch I go to are nice and considerate unlike the ladies at this location !!!! To me they just prefer to stand around than help the needs of customers .. However there's one teller I see the outstanding service she gives unfortunate the other two should take lessons on customer care ... Now I know I have no consideration in ever banking here honestly I didn't like the first impression when I first came to this location !!! I see long lines one teller and two employees chatting in a room not a good look ... I'm at a different location and u see two tellers and others actually doing this than just standing around ... Ladies find urself a job behind the doors cause your image is not a good look bad enough you have no customer care !!

Every time I come to this bank they have one teller working. The tellers are nice but when you wait 20 minutes to see the one teller they have it's pretty ridiculous. The manager says they are going down to one teller. That's bullshit. Avoid this branch if you can.

I agree with the previous reviews that they are seriously understaffed for tellers.  Waiting 15+ minutes every time you need to go in the branch is not acceptable.  I also belong to Chase directly across the street and their wait times are much less.

The two ladies at the front counter are fantastic. Even with multiple customers they had a big smile and made everyone feel special. When it was my turn, I was given their complete attention. They really know their stuff and made my experience very positive. I have enough stress prior to a trip. I was dreading having to make one more decision. They were wonderful

My parents gave me a membership to AAA in high school or thereabouts, and I have kept it active, even in the day of cell phones, simply because we go in periodically to pick up maps or tourbooks.  You can also get help planning your trip (including cruises and just about anything else you might want to go on), and even score some luggage while you are there.  I think I have probably only used their actual roadside services once in all these years, so otherwise I am not sure that they are worth it.  Discounts on insurance?  I tried, but it did not work for me, though it may for you.

But for a relatively low cost each year, you can load up on almost all the maps and touristy information you can carry, all for no additional cost beyond that initial yearly investment, and even better is that a decent number of places (hotels, restaurants and even tourist attractions) offer discounts to card holders.  Naturally, if you do not travel much, it may not really be worth it.

As to the location, it is nice enough, but if you do not visit, that does not matter.  It is a bit of a challenge to find if you are not familiar - the "approach road" is "executive circle" (in fact, the insurance is now on the circle, not the main building).  Then there is a little offshoot that takes you to the main office, which is on "aaa drive".  So both are really correct, in a way.  But "aaa drive" should probably be called "aaa driveway" or "aaa parking lot", because there is not much of a road there.

The drive through customer service at Chase Bank in Aliante Parkway is horrible. BEWARE do not utilize the drive through around 5:00pm they do not acknowledge you and when they do they act as if you are bothering them! Horrible drive through service. However, great personal bankers....
Finally a chase opened up in my neighborhood. Clean, nice bankers, no wait and friendly.

Friday night at closing time is the worst time to visit any business, so when we arrived at this Chase at 5 o'clock and change to finalize the purchase of a vehicle I was fully expecting to deal with a little attitude and to not hold it against them. So, I was blown away to receive patient service with a smile for the entire time we were camped out there. If you bank with Chase, you receive complimentary notary services, and that was delivered without a hassle. And, when we needed copies, the reply was, "No problem." I was impressed with the level of customer service every step of the way, especially when I know everyone in the joint was eager to lock the doors and do their best Johnny Kemp.

Awesome agency!  Jay and team are always so helpful and really give a personal touch. Highly recommend this agency as they will make sure you have the best coverage at the best possible price. Wish I would have gone here sooner!

I have used this office for years for both my personal insurance and as a landlord for multiple issues and claims.  I can honestly say that 95% the issues have been handled with stellar customer service.  I wasn't quite as thrilled with the actual 800 customer service line, but this office has ALWAYS helped me quickly and politely.  Even with the 800 line.  I was an insurance customer service rep and claims adjuster for years and I know good service when I get it.  I hope I was half as good to my clients as this office has been to me.
I love USAA. Best bank ever! My husband has been with them since 1996, I've been with them since 2006!

I love that we still have solid American companies still around that value and appreciate veterans of this great country. USAA has been my one stop shop for banking, insurance, car buying service, life insurance, and financial advice. They recently helped me out when I had a local auto body shop in Las Vegas try to make frivolous complaints in retaliation to my complaint against the auto body shop for deceiving local customers to include myself. They documented the frivolous complaint against me appropriately and immediately notified me to assure me they have my back 100% and will be assisting me with any documentation I will need. Thank you USAA you are the best!

We have our main credit card here b/c my dear FIL served in the Air Force. I'm grandfathered in for marrying his offspring - the benefit ends here, I think.
So if you've got any military in you one generation up or less, make sure you take advantage of USAA's appreciation of Service. They work with you on life insurance, auto loans, home loans, all things financial. Cha cha cha.

Extremely disappointed in this branch. Went for banking services only to be told they don't do that at this branch. All banking, loans, ect. must be done online or over the phone. 

What is the point of having a branch and having people sit around if they are not able to do basic banking?

Definitely the worst military bank I've ever banked with! I already swallowed the fact that they don't have an actual bank, a sister bank, a co-op bank, or anything else. You get charged atm debit fees though refunded up to $10 because they don't have an actual bank you can debit from. 

Entered my account info for 1 company who sold my account info to a 3rd party. Then started receiving ACH debits from random companies I didn't authorize and USAA said there was nothing they can do because I authorized the first company. 

If that's not bad enough, their customer service never know the products or services they sell/offer. Their tech support don't know how to navigate or walk you through their website. Their hold times are ridiculous and their customer manner is even worse.

I have banked with USAA for over seven years.  They are hands down better than any local bank.  They treat us like family.  We apply for all of our loans on our phone and have an approval fairly quickly.  We have been car shopping on a Saturday and completed a loan application online and had the money FedEx'd to the dealership so we never had to hassle with wheeling and dealing with the dealership.  We don't have their insurance, so I cannot vouch for that, but all other services are great. I believe this location is just a satellite office that offers very little service.  But why even go there?  You can do almost everything online - to deposit a large check you can go to a UPS shipping store to make the deposit.  I take photos of my personal checks and deposit via mobile.  I can take money out at CVS - I cannot deposit cash, but I do not find the need to do that; it spends just as easily as whipping out my debit card.

I have been with USAA since 2001 and I love them. I have never had s bad experience with them. They have always been great service and I love the app as well! Wouldn't change banks I have had bad experiences with other banks!

We we're quoted insurance on 4 vehicles 2 which had full coverage. Three months later we find out that all 4 only have liability. Dimitri on the phone said he would fix this right away and not to worry. Six weeks later they draft $500.00 out of our account for a monthly payment. We find out then that our insurance increased from $2400 to $5100 a year. You know why he didnt say anything? Because we would have canceled then. Our full coverage insurance at Farm Beauro Indian Trail with Mark Rains is only $2400 a year ,why would we pay more then twice that amount. They made the initial mistake and had us driving a brand new car without full coverage. In fact they still owe us for the windshield on that car because we couldnt claim it because of their mistake. Please call Mark for insurance and dont make the same mistake we did.

I would give no stars but since I had to give one, one is all they get. After working with the loan department, I have decided to pull our money and move our mortgage. We were approved for our re-finance and then canceled at the last minute once they found out I was working a contract job. We have been a 20+ year B of A customer, currently have our mortgage with them and never have defualted. Yes i was laid off work like 1/2 of America but have managed to keep working a contract position. The contract jobs out here in California usually run for three months at a time and after each quarter, they extend them. I have been at my job since August 2011 and I am due to be extended at the end of June. However they used this as a reason not to go through with our loan. You think  Bank of America would want to help us make it easier to get through the economy crisis. Just to let you know I am speaking about the Loan Department in Chandler Arizona. Not only did they take forever to get the paperwork done, they called and told us to return documents as soon as possible so that our approved loan will get completed. We were told we could sign the paperwork while we were on vacation but never heard anything. Got home and found out they canceled our loan. Never will I use this Bank. Their commitment to customer service sucks.

Dropped by to grab some cash for a trip on monday. They have me my tens and fives,quickly. Carmi heard i was leaving the country and offered to set my country codes on the spot. Whether my issue is big or small they can fix it. Even if its a flurry of deposits they are so nice and quick. I love this branch

Extremely slow service and understaffed a busy times of the day.  I came here on a Saturday to talk with one of the private bankers to change a form and there was a 40 minute.   Typically I would understand occasionally extra busy days but this happens in every visit.    It seems as though they would know from their historical census what are the busiest days and times and staff appropriately

I like this bank because they are always professional and quick. There is 1 main drawback however, it is not easy access from the road due to medians, you cannot leave the bank and go eastbound or southbound without doing a U-turn.
The employees at this branch always make you feel your business is valued! This is a good branch. Jose is the greatest! The branch manager is friendly as are all employees.
The service is always prompt and the tellers are well-trained. No complaints here but minus one star because no extraordinary friendly service

David is Awesome! Walked right in and up to his desk, asked if he was busy...no sit down he responded. We talked about some financial scenarios, and I was in and out in no time. I really love this branch. You would think that it would be busier, but they always have 4-5 tellers working. Great Job B of A!

I no longer use bank of America and yet they are soliciting my business. That's normal you may think, but listen up.  I received personal banking info of a Bank of America customer in my post office box for years. I opened one by mistake but lucky for that person, I'm honest. I took the mail to Bank of America and told them about the problem. I spent much personal time on many occasions to bring it to their attention.   Months and months pass by and I still received the bank statements.

I finally contacted the head departments at Bank of America, and no, the bank statements that belonged to another person did not stop coming to me, but NOW I started receiving marketing mail to get my business. I had to close down the P.O.Box to solve issue. Hope the next person that gets these bank statements is honest as well. There is enough fraud, don't need a bank making it so darn easy with other peoples personal banking info floating around and they don't care!

I have a mortgage with RBC Bank... even though the rate was pretty good, I regretted having my mortgage with them due to the extremely poor customer service. 2 hours on hold to talk to someone till I gave up. I tried more than once at varied times of the day. The recorded message always says "very high call volumes that will further delay your call"... If your call volumes always exceed the number of reps.... WHY DON"T YOU DO SOMETHING ABOUT IT? that's if you care about your business. 

I once got a voice mail that said "we will return your call within 1 business day." I left a message. That was over 3 weeks ago and no one called back. I have an issue that cannot be resolved through the "automated system" or through the website. anyone knows the contact info for the president or the CEO of RBC Bank in the U.S.? That's not the first time I'm shocked about their level of service. I should have taken heed by the early signs I saw before signing the mortgage papers with them. Stay away and go to WF or someone else if you can. Even if the rate is slightly higher. You get what you pay for, trust me. Very frustrating.

Worst On line Bank I've  ever encountered.  Brain dead IT, the eStatements never works for me regardless of the browser I use.  The former parent RBC Canada is great but avoid RBC USA or you will be very sorry.

I wish I could choose something lower than one star.  I have had a home equity line line with RBC since 2008, and I've been pretty shocked by how much the bank lives in the stone age.  I bank with Charles Schwab, which is awesome on rates, zero fees, range of banking/lending/brokerage/retirement services, customer service, and  super hip technology.  I don't expect Schwab-level performance from other banks, but my first mortgage, for example, is with Wells Fargo, and they at least auto-debit my payment every month like a normal modern bank so I never have to deal with their bureaucratic customer service in the first place. 

I'll get to RBC's customer service in a minute.  But first, let's talk about the fact that they offer me no option to even make a payment online, much less to choose auto debit.  What's more, they send me a paper bill every month WITH NO RETURN ENVELOPE so I have to go buy a freaking box of envelopes, buy stamps, write out addresses, and then find a mailbox to drop my bill in.  Over four years, this has become a tremendous hassle. 

As for the customer service, I've had to deal with them several times when my bill didn't show (lost in the mail - shocker!) or when my payment didn't arrive at their offices (lost in the mail room - shocker!).  They pretty consistently do what they can to not think (the robotic, canned response voice of a complacent bureaucrat - you know the sound) and not be helpful.  The people in the branches are nicer, but definitely not snappy.

If your mortgage broker turns these guys up, I'd recommend paying a couple extra basis points on your rate and going with a real bank.  The lack of time wasted buying envelopes and dealing with customer service will be well worth it over time.

I simply loved the experience of buying my auto insurance from Geico. Their rates were the best among the 5 quotes I got... I have got the same feedback about Geico's rates from almost all my friends too... 
I bought the insurance over the phone since I had to clarify a few things about the policy... Christie from the local Tempe office was very helpful and the whole process was over in a matter of minutes. While buying the policy I did not have my bank's routing number... Christie just asked me the name of the bank and she got my bank's routing number within seconds (its same for all branches within a state)... now thats what I call awesome customer service... 

Awesome customer service from local Tempe office and great insurance rates!

This was a quick and easy transaction with the help of Kelsey. Others workers also offered help as soon as I walked in the door and answered all the questions I had. 
I highly recommend this office.
Moved over from State Farm and saved some money. Talk to Anthony for a great deal ! He explained various options to us clearly.

We were doing some price comparisons for auto insurance after being with the same company for several years.  We got several quotes online from several different companies but the ONLY company to have an agent reach out to contact us if there were any questions was GEICO.  Good move and Molly was very sweet so she made it very easy to decide to switch companies.

Great experience buying car insurance from Geico. Was referred by the salesman at Tempe Honda and had insurance at a competitive rate before I drove off the lot, super easy. Everyone I dealt with was extremely professional.
I had a great experience getting my first car insurance with GEICO. Rates were decent and customizable based on everyone's need.
Kelsey was very helpful and provided me with all the information that I needed to set up my policy

I had geico. I was hit by a red light runner and geico put me at fault. I was in the hospital with a neck brace on and had sever tbi and the agent was calling me threatening me to get the police report to him or else. My wife got me a lawyer to protect me FROM MY OWN INSURANCE COMPANY!! Thank god she did because they changed their tune fast. Stay away from geico!!

I was recently involved in my very first automobile accident while merging onto the I-10 via I-17. While stopped on the on-ramp, this crazy ass woman whom I had been eying in my rear view for at least 5 minutes while making snide comments about her crazy hair to myself, SLAMS INTO ME going at least 40mph. I spin onto the gravel and slap my head against the driver side window obviously shocked and wondering what the fuck just happened. I get out of my car, donned in stilettos and all, and strut through the gravel shaking my finger and explaining to her the rules of driving and how she, clearly, was not obeying them. Thank you for the whiplash and for ruining my day. Luckily, for me, she and her totaled 1999 Chevy Cavalier were fully equipped with Geico Auto Insurance. 

Now, I have always thought the gecko commercials were a little silly, but man, these people do no mess around when it comes to accidents. Within ONE HOUR of my collision, I had received a phone call making sure I was alright. Within 4 hours I had already been offered an inconvenience check along with medical bill coverage for up to 2 months.. Since I hit my head pretty hard, I had to decline.. to cover my own ass just in case something is really wrong. Their estimator came to us to give the verdict on the damage.. and cut a check on the spot. Everything, for the most part, was taken care of within the first 24 hours, including my rental car which they are obviously paying for as well. I have received letters in the mail and phone calls everyday and have not been intimidated or disappointed with anyone i've dealt with. 

I myself do not have Geico, but rest assured, if the person who slams into you does, god forbid, your life isn't over.. they are extremely helpful and professional, and genuinely do care about you.

I just signed up for a great price (by comparison to State Farm) and better coverage with GEICO. My agent at State Farm was almost to the point of harassment. She was constantly trying to sell me additional services and trying to drag my significant other into it. When I spoke with Marc at Geico it was quick and easy and instead of pressuring me with tragic scenarios he explained and informed the coverage I was getting. By the way, I got better and cheaper coverage for 16 dollars less. 

You would think by having an agent you would have a smoother transition but from what I've researched they are commission based and your premium pays for having an agent. Well I'm happy I dropped that agent and became my own representative. She was a regional sales manager also.Now if I ever needed to make a change in my policy I can do so online, no middle man/woman.

Do Not get auto insurance from Jack or any other Geico office my cars were wrecked and they tried to put salted down parts on my avenger. Stay away . Phillip Muskat with geico claims says parts from Ohio are OEM go to invision auto body on yelp to get my whole story DO NOT USE GEICO

This review is long overdue. I hired Robert in 2010. He was able to reduce my amount due and get me an affordable payment plan. His services were affordable. Three years later I contacted him and he was able to reduce fees and interest significantly. I asked him how much? He said: It was already included in what I originally paid him. I was floored. Wow. If that wasn't enough. I recently found out that the IRS was still charging an amount under my spouses name only. We were just 1 payment away from finishing a 5 year Tax nightmare and we find out that...no no no...we owe more??? Well, I called Robert and within a couple days found the error in the IRS accounting and we are done. DONE. Thank you Robert. What did we pay for this? Nothing. It was included in the original payment. Ladies and gentleman. This Attorney stands by his work. Is prompt. Reliable. I can't recommend him enough to friends and family.

This service has saved my life! If you are looking for a reliable service you can trust please use this Attorney. Robert was always a pleasure and took the time to explain the complete process to a tax rookie. I appreciate the honesty offered when it came to realistic expectations of my case. It took away the anxiety of having to talk to the IRS and I felt I had someone on my side. All of the staff were courteous and patient. Thanks again to the Tax Resolution Professionals.. I have recommended them to my friends and family.

I sent in a request for a quote last night and received an email early this morning from Robert Kayvon, the managing tax attorney at TRP, stating he received my inquiry and would be calling me at my preferred time. He also let me know what number he would be calling from which I appreciated. Robert called me at the exact time on the dot. He was very polite and had a good phone demeanor. I explained my issue and Robert gave me his expert advice and also sent me emails with attachments of forms I would need for the IRS. Robert was extremely helpful! He went above and beyond helping me with things and ideas that would help my case. I can tell he is knowledgable and an attorney who gives his time to do free consults is a winner in my book. I highly recommend Robert and his team. Thank you Robert for your help!

I had some issues with both the IRS and State, one due to my improperly registering my withholdings and the other was from California Franchise Tax Board. California said I owed them money when I was not living in the state and Robert my attorney got that cleared off completely. The IRS took a bit longer but was worth the wait and was settled for about 1/25th of what I owed. I always got quick responses from Robert and I felt like everything was handled perfectly from start to finish. Much more professionals than other places I had called and also much lower price. They are definitely worth giving a call before you hire someone else.

I will NEVER use this company again! I recently had my taxes done by Gemma Mitchell at the S Durango Office. I was told that I would receive a phone call once my refund check was ready. I had to contact the IRS for a status on my refund because Gemma could not provide me with one. When I contacted the IRS I found out that my money had already been deposited into one of their business accounts without my approval or my knowledge. It has now been multiple days since they have had my money and when I try to contact them they do not answer my phone calls. I have left several messages and text messages asking for an update. They have yet to answer me and I have even driven to their office which was closed and all locked up. I find this a little concerning a week before Tax Day that no one is in the office. I currently have an investigation into Channel 13 news along with the IRS and Metro. I would advise everyone NOT to use them!!!!

One star for the affordable plans, but that's it. As long as you don't need their help everything is fine. I had an accident and even though I had full coverage they didn't repaired the car. It was very difficult to get in touch with the person responsible for my claim. It took more than a month to receive an answer about my case. According to them my car was damaged before the accident. The mechanic who was contracted by the insurance said that they always had problem with Nevada Direct Insurance because they never want it to pay. You get what you pay for.
Great bank great employees! Feel like I am wanted when I come here. Everything is also super quick
I visit this location about 3 times a week and I am always pleased with the friendless of the tellers. They are quick and efficient, never have had am issue.

I'm giving the joint the 5 star treatment !! They do have good customer service but mostly I'm giving 5 stars because of the Whine tit people crying because of the ATM set up and WRITING A NOVEL ABOUT A DEPOSIT ISSUE!! FIRST WORLD PROBLEMS FOLKS!!! PUT ON YOUR BIG GIRL PANTIES AND SUCK IT UP!!! .   That's all folks!! That's my 5 cents.   It's worth exactly what you paid for it!!!

I have been a Wells Fargo customer for the past 10 years and this is the worst branch from all of them ! I needed a letter to be notarized  and they refused to do that because it was hand written and she couldn't advise me if the letter should be typed or not , basically she refused to help me and she didn't do her job , I went accords the street to Chase and they did it right away for me and the customer service was great even thou I am not a chase customer . Shame on you Wells Fargo on Durango and shame on you blonde lady who is lazy and doesn't want to help her customers and doesn't care about customer service . It's the last time in going to that branch !

Can't believe Wells Fargo made a mistake like this: the teller deposit my money to someone else account! And when I came in to the same location, she say " why don't you check it yesterday when she give you the balance?" 
Omg it's my fault now? 
I have no words to say!

I come to this location almost everyday with work deposits and personal. They never have me waiting long and great customer service. I read other reviews for this bank and I have had nothing but great experiences. I only come to this location!

Uuuhhhhhgg!! Again!! Depositing checks for immediate funds, was told funds will not be available, mind you the Checks are drawn from a Wells Fargo account!  Asked if I could cash the checks then deposit and was told they no longer do that....WTF!!  What kind of banking society is this coming from?!?!  I had the same crap with BOA the other day!!!! I'm so sick of this!!! I should just deal with off shore accounts!!!  I'll probably get Bette faster service!!!

Julie Hagan is truly amazing! What would I do without her? I suppose I would find another banking institution. 

Julie Hagan goes above and beyond. 

Her name tag should read: 
JULIE AMAZING HAGAN
Champion Banker

Thanks Julie! You're A CHAMPION!

The staff at this wells fargo branch are great!!!!!!!!
Friendly and very helpful.
They notarize no charge to customers!!!!!!
Thanks for the great service.

Where do I start.... had to go with a hard money loan because of only 1 year income tax records... knew I would get a high rate but 12%, I thought was a bit excessive, went with it... but I didn't know that hard money loan meant they had to reem you on each and every line item too- underwriting on a conventional loan is usually $450, they charged $1250, then I signed a credit card receipt for an appraisal at $385 and it shows up on my statement at $450.  The appraiser did a quick walk through my high end home and then ended up just going off comps... the tax records showed $50k higher!  The loan officer David Jordan kept giving us closing dates and then blowing them.  Then was aggravated when I would call him... you know- the old next day, next day, next day routine... or, you know the mortgage business... And the title company was just as lackadaisical. And the closing costs 4.5 points!!  But you know it's a hard money loan (I was told) thus giving them the right to charge outlandish fees on all line items. Well I guess I'm i Vegas and loan sharking is the norm.  I did close because they wasted so much time...  Even if you have a normal loan... I'd go somewhere else.
Welcome to freedom of speech, Southern Fidelity Mortgage!

Horrible experience from start to finish!  Look out, no one will take responsibility for any problems, or mistakes!  We had our refinance done through them and it was a nightmare from day one!  The person who prepares the documents, gets the loan payoff info, escrow info and accounts, made at least 4-5 mistakes that cost us over a thousand dollars!  Now there was an over payment in our taxes and they many not refund our money!!!!  It was money we had to bring to closing and now they want to keep it?????????????  DO NOT USE THIS COMPANY!  Headache after headache and weeks of work to actually get your old loan paid in full and the new one financed.

I was trying to refinance two of my properties in January of 2016 because rates came down dramatically. SFR had the lowest rates. I began working with them on Feb 7th. I submitted my documents promptly. I paid about $1000 for the appraisals. (One of the properties was a rental). First they said We'd be closing at end of Feb, then beginning of March, then end of March. Here we are in April and we still have not closed. Every time we have a delay they come back and want more bank statements, more pay stubs, soon they will be needing my 2015 returns. I have submitted and gotten mortgages over 16 times ( I have multiple properties). These guys are far far far away the worst brokers I have ever worked with. I plan on filling with the consumer financial protection bureau soon. STAY AWAY!!

Where do I start. We picked SFM to be our mortgage broker and the nightmare began. Besides the obvious disorganization in the office, consistently asking for documents that were already sent they TOTALLY dropped the ball on our qualification, assuring us that all would be good at closing when in fact it was not. Not only did we loose the house but we also lost our earnest deposit due to SFM's negligence and non-performance.

When I approached the company to make things right I was met with a brick wall and that is where we are today....No House....No Deposit. Take my advice ....go elsewhere.

The culprits in this debacle:

Kari Phillips
Carlos Garcia
Rowe Nelson

If you choose to go to Southern Fidelity and end up with Heath you may want to either go somewhere else or ask for a new loan specialist.  Whole process for obtaining a loan (and I have an excellent credit score) was a nightmare.  Mistake after mistake. No communication. Very chauvinistic attitude. Blamed me for the difficult process. He's a smooth talker but full of mistruths. You will thank me.

I have received a letter almost every day for the past two months from this company.  Called the office to cancel what ever mailing list I'm on and they have no idea of what mail I am receiving from them.   They are a great company.

This branch is located inside of the Albertson's. There is an ATM and a small counter with about 3 tellers for your convenience. I have always found the wait time to be under 5 minutes each time I have used a teller. They are friendly and ask if you need other assistance. They do ask that you take off hats and sunglasses while using the facility which is totally understandable because of safety concerns.
There is sometimes a wait and no matter how often I come in they never recognize me.

If I could give negative stars I would. Not for this branch, but the Company. As a member for over 8 years with thousands of dollars of transactions, I was denied a measly loan of $1000. I saw a brochure for one of their "Teacher Supply Loans" and decided, "What the heck, I'll apply". They were even going to do automatic payroll deduction, so they would have gotten their little $ back--go figure! Well, they are about to lose a customer, because I will be searching for a better bank. Thanks for nothing-literally!

Sherryll is my bank lady, she's got a great personality and a strong handshake. I trust her with all my business.  Amazing customer service at this location too.  I'm always around, I actually get my nails done in the same plaza too. At Chau's Nail & Spa so I'm being honest.  I've been banking here for over 2 years now, love it. :)

This is the worlds slowest Bank of America.  I came here around 2:30pm to deposit a savings bond and had to wait in a line for over 30 minutes with only 2 tellers open.  One who knew what she was doing and the other one seemed to be arguing with every guest, I couldn't help but notice as I had nothing else to do while waiting.  Hoping this location gets their stuff together as I'm moving to this side of town.

This is one of the bad location branch of BOA.there are always one or two tellers,no more than three!the waiting line always long,just need one transaction need more than 20 mins wait in the line,if you have any other choice, please choose other location

How many people have to be waiting in line for over 20 minutes before you open another teller line? Meanwhile, you have not one, but two greeters standing around doing basically nothing trying to look busy. Every single time I have to go into this branch, regardless of the time of day, I wait at least 15 minutes. I have banked here for 20 years, but my patience is wearing thin.  Maybe they should start serving lunch while people wait so it would not take up the entire break!
One teller with 12 people in line. Two tellers playing with slips. Seems manager doesn't care.
15 people in line and two tellers. They have a host just standing around. Very slow tellers at that. This is why I bank with US BANK. just here putting money in a relatives account. Never again.

For once in my life I actually got great service. Keith Graham (teller) was very helpful and courteous. I have nothing bad to say about the service I received. It was excellent. Hire more tellers like him. 

Usually bofA always gives me problems but not today! 
Thank you

I've been a customer for over 15 years. I come here because it's close to work. Every time it's the same scenario... Over 30 minutes in line, line to the door, ONLY TWO TELLERS!  Horrible service from the greeter. I wish this wouldn't happen every time I come!!! Thinking Wells Fargo down the way might be earning my business thanks to this location.

As a Las Vegas local & small business owner I was hesitant to choose a "big" bank over a credit union for my business & personal banking. After talking to many business owner friends I found that Bank of America was used by most all of them & they were happy to refer me! I'm always in a rush & quickly explained my needs to Heather Pearce while making my appointment. She instantly understood my personal & business financial goals & had an outline ready for me! Within an hour I was fully setup with everything I needed and knowledge about the next level of banking that I may need soon. Heathers personality is fantastic! She got to know me in such a short time & knew how to cater to MY true financial needs. I would not have expected to have such superior customer service & I am so grateful to finally have peace of mind & simplicity in my small business banking. Thank you again Heather Pearce.

***Yelp Challenge 2016 14/100***

Setting an appointment up here doesn't mean anything. I always find my self waiting to speak to someone. The people that work there are really nice and I think need to set up the online appointment to give them more time to work with clients.

I have been with Bank of America for 10 years now and I have never had more problems in the last 2 years. The ATMs at this bank are ALWAYS down & unavailable to take my deposits (wait.. So you don't want to take my money??). I'm constantly inconvenienced with this bank. I have been considering closing my account and taking my money to Wells Fargo (right across the street)!

I've been banking with BofA for a while now and have yet to be impressed. They continue to disappoint me with there lack of communication and never have enough staff to keep up with the flow of customers. Fuck you BofA, I will be looking for another bank to handle all my personal business!!!!!

The service is terrible and I think I may have been DISCRIMINATED today by the bank manager. I very upset and confused, or maybe I should show up in suit and tie I may get better treatment . I came in to cash a check from a real estate flip and I was told by the manager that my id's were not valid. Let me ask you Ms. Manager how is it that an ID from the department of homeland security not valid in your system. By the way the branch on Blue Diamond told me you did not know what you were talking about. Please take more training, my cashiers check and my id's were just fine at the other location. And you guys wonder why I do not have business. (btw I am a former personal banker of 4 years)

If you want to spend your time waiting around for absolutely nothing this is the perfect place to do so. My boyfriend and I were second in line to see a rep regarding an account. We checked in with a rep and he had told us to have a seat and that he'll be right with us as soon as he helps the couple in front of us. As we were waiting, three other parties had checked in with another rep, Henry, for help. When the first rep was done with the first couple, Henry brought the party who arrived after us into the room. We had told him that we've been waiting to see someone for over 45 minutes and that we were next in line. Henry told us that because we had not checked in with him to begin with we would have to be seen after every one else who checked in. That's 3 different parties, mind you. It was a little disappointing to have came early and waited long before everyone else to be seen. Apparently Henry was not familiar with playing fair. Shame on you Henry. Shame on you.

This is seriously the absolute worst bank to go to at any time during any day of the week. They are extremely short staffed and it takes a minimum of 20 mins just to see a teller. I recommend going to a different branch!
Worst bank ever. Standing in line for 30 mins or more most of the time. No sense of urgency at all. There is always 2 tellers working with a line out to the door. Awful.

Don't go to Celeste Caday(teller), she hates her job; horrible service. 

I came from a commercial banking back ground, I never knew it takes 25 min when depositing at the merchant window(no cash, just checks)


Actually, word to the world, don't come to this Bank of America, in fact don't bank at BOA

The staff is very nice but there is always a line as they only have two tellers. Today I waited over 35 minutes in line while the line is growing and almost out the door. Every other transaction the agent is calling a manager which is causing the delay. I dread coming here and feel bad for the tellers who are working hard while the managers have to complete the transactions.

This location is not customer oriented. The banking industry is very competitive, unfortunately employees here don't get it. Today I had a very unpleasant experience with Jose, who seemed to make it his personal pleasure over my loss and basically told me that I was stupid in an indirect way. I completely gave up on using this location, though it is the closest to my home.
The lady upfront was very nice, but the bottom line it is not only about how nice the people that work here are, but how efficient and competent they are.
Even while waiting for my appointment (it was on time) I witnessed how a banker kept telling a lady at the window phrases like "I don't know" "I am not sure" until she asked him to go ask someone else who knew the answer to her question. My previous time I had the same experience with the same banker. 
I don't know if it's improper training or poor people skills, but it is unprofessional and I wouldn't trust these specific people to handle my business.
After I spent 4 hours in total today for going back and forth between locations for minor thing, I ended up going back to my old branch, where they were surprised, that people (Jose in particular) at this location gave me hard time over minor issue. 
I spoke with the manager over the phone later on. She was nice, but didn't seem to care to listen to my side of the story, her attitude was as if she already knew everything she needed to know and in resolution she decided to speak with employees at the other branch as if they were wrong by accommodating a customer (me). Oh well.

In the day and age of DOT COM insurance, it is great to know that there are still agents out there that have their client's best interests at heart!!! Brian Stevens and his team are phenomenal!! I have been a State Farm insured for a long time and love the personal attention that I receive.  I bought a new house and moved to Chandler and both my wife and I were heartbroken to change Agents. OR at least I thought that I would have to change agents. When I called to ask how to get the new quote in the new city I was super happy to find out that I could stay with Brian and his team, but he let me know that I could do what was best for me and my family. Well I have been in Chandler for almost a year now and I am still getting the personalized service from Brian and his team as if I was still next door. I made the right decision not to change agents. They are willing to communicate with me via: email, phone, text or in person. They really do make you feel like they are a neighbor. GREAT JOB TEAM, keep up the great work.

Brian is an all-around great guy, and a great agent. He and his team are knowledgeable, friendly, and accomodating. 

We have our home, jewelry, autos, and life insured with Brian, and we also bank with State Farm. State Farm Bank is the best - we have our checking, savings, credit card, and vehicle loans with the Bank and we couldn't be happier with the service and rates. 

I have been a State Farm customer since 2000 and with Brian for 10 years. As long as we're in Arizona, we'll be customers of Brian's!

Brian has been my insurance agent for nearly 10 years.  I appreciate him and his team.  They have taken care of my insurance needs quickly, efficiently, and with the utmost courteousness and respect.

What I appreciate most is that Brian and his staff check with me periodically to make sure that my insurance needs haven't changed.  I recently sat down with him to conduct a thorough review of my insurance needs as well as my retirement needs.  We spend nearly two hours and were able make some important changes to better suit my current situation.

I highly recommend Brian and his team!

The Brian Stevens branch is amazing. I can't say too much about Brian himself since I haven't talked to him too much, personally. However, I can make a safe bet that he is an amazing agent soley based on the team he's surrounded by. First off, hats off to Bonnie. My dad has been with State Farm well over 20 years and he can not say enough great things about her. I'd also like to recognize Clayton, who helped initiate my insurance with State Farm. He explained everything clearly from the get-go so there were never any, not so pleasant, surprises down the road. Finally but DEFINITELY NOT least, the newest team member I have spoken to has gone absolutely above and beyond any expectations I would EVER hold for any person but especially as an insurance agent. I always felt that insurance companies were out to get you the highest rate to extort as much money out of you as they can. Oh boy, did Rob prove me wrong! Rob is, by far, the best team member I've spoken to! (Although not to deminish the value of all the other hard-working team members) All in all I guess what I am trying to say is as long as you come to THIS State Farm Branch, you are in good hands (even if you don't speak directly to Brian Stevens) becuase his team is professional, very courteous and, according my standards, very genuine/honest people.

This is a great team.  Bonnie is efficient, courteous, and flexible.  She drove 45+ minutes across the valley to come meet with me after work one day.  She returns phone calls very quickly, and helps to save me money.  Thank you so much for all that you do, Bonnie - your hard work is appreciated!!!

Great experience dealing with great people. At review the called to make sure we had the best coverage possible. Brian and his team are just the best! My parents were in the business for 30 years, so I can tell you this is how you Should Be treated!

Brian is wonderful! He was referred by a friend who has been using his services for years. I am happy to recommend him too!

I went to him for auto, jewelry and business insurance. He sat down with me for 2 hours reviewing my options. He didn't try to sell me products I didn't need, but took the time to find the right insurance for my particular needs. (His prices were really good too; my auto insurance is more than half off what it was in Boston.)
What an absolute professional office with a warm, friendly atmosphere! Brian leads a strong organization dedicated to customer service.
Excellent service through and through. Talked with sales rep Rob T. and he was stellar, took no time to setup our policy and give us a great rate. Highly recommend him and the rest of Brian's team.
I've been using Brian Stevens for 6 months now. He not only saved me $ over my old company but I got more coverage. I'm saving $120 over safeco. Thanks Brian!
Been with them for over a decade and have never had an issue, they have always been good to us!

If I could put zero stars, I would do that, but I can't so that's the ONLY reason they get 1 star.  I wanted to pay off a credit card that I had through them, and had several issues with their services which is why I also wanted to close out my accounts there.  For starters, if you use their bill pay, you have to submit things about 10 days early so that their pre-historic systems have time to get the payment back in time so you don't get a penalty. Terrible. 

When I went to close my accounts, I couldn't because I had a $9000 (approximate payoff) credit card with them, so they would not let me close my checking/savings until I paid that off.  The following month, I went to pay it off, with a DEBIT CARD, not a credit card.  The teller (was a young guy) decides to run it as credit and a cash advance without telling me and they cost me $274.92 in fees for being careless.  My card says Debit and I was on the phone with my other bank right in front of him increasing my daily debit limit so it could be ran as debit and then he fails to tell me that they don't have the capability to run it as debit.  There is a chase bank 1.3miles from there and I could have easily gone and got a check to pay it off or cash, and would not have been an issue.  On top of that, after I paid the $9000+, they wanted another $18 for interest that he didn't think to include in the payoff...just more inconvenience from FCU.

Oh, and they have the oldest and worst website I've ever seen.  For a company that holds a lot of money, you would think they could invest in an upgrade on the website.....and they have a tab called "More Cool Stuff"  --- Are you kidding me??? Real Professional. 

This place is a joke.

I've banked with this bank for almost 15 years. There is nothing special about them. They are impossible to get ahold of. If they call you don't bother trying to call them back because they don't answer.  There are only 3 locations in the valley so hope you live close.

FIRST IN NAME ONLY...THIS PLACE IS THE WORST CREDIT UNION IN ARIZONA!!!

I recently moved to Arizona and belong to a credit union back home. My credit union is a "member" of the shared branch arrangement that creates a nationwide network where you can bank anywhere in the country.

Well, I had an important transaction to handle, and was in need of a Medallion Guarantee Stamp. I called several credit unions in the Phoenix/Chandler area and many said that they did not provide that service at all, so when I contacted FCU and was told that they could stamp my documents I was elated.

Upon my arrival, I was told to sign in and that someone would assist me shortly. I waited approximately 15 minutes without any further acknowledgement while two employees held what sounded to be a personal conversation. When one of the women finally came over to help me, she did not introduce herself, or display any customer service etiquette. I explained my situation and she promptly told me that they could not help me because I was not one of their customers.

I told her that I phoned the branch prior to driving over there, and was told that they could, in fact, provide the Medallion Guarantee. She asked me if I spoke to the call center and I said yes. She phoned someone to ask if my information was correct, and laughed throughout the entire conversation with the person on the other end of the phone. She hung up and again told me that they could not help me because I was not a "member" of their credit union.

Of course I was frustrated because they had not only wasted my time, but their poorly trained staff gave out incorrect information despite placing me on hold several times during my initial call. 

Long story short, this was the most unprofessional, substandard level of customer service that I have ever experienced from a supposed "shared branch". This person didn't even bother to ask if I would be willing to open up an account. However, after the despicable customer service that she exhibited, I would never consider doing business with First Credit Union. 

I am happy report that I went to Chase Bank about a mile away, and was pleasantly surprised.  I received the most OUTSTANDING customer service from the Assistant Branch manager. I explained my situation to her, and she went above and beyond what I expected. They had the same policy of not providing the Medallion stamp for  non-customers, but her approach was very impressive and a stark contrast to my experience at FCU. It's abundantly clear that Chase places a premium on customer service and FCU does not. 

I am happy to report that I opened an account on the spot. CHASE ROCKS!!!

Michael was at my hotel within 20 minutes of me calling. Very easy to find on Yelp. I was able to scan the document and fed ex original to PA while on vacation. No banks were available neither was the notary at the hotel. Michael was quick,convenient and he was in my area and inexpensive considering what it costs in PA.

Michael Moore of 24/7 Las Vegas Notary was outstanding in his dedication to make sure I had a notary at my home at 6:15 AM due to a telephonic court case I had with Florida.  I highly recommend calling Michael when you need someone to be prompt and professional.

As good as it gets. Fast, courteous, helpful, super friendly, extremely knowledgeable, and above all honest. I have no doubts that Michael can address any concerns you might have as well as help guide you along the way. A true professional. It sounds corny but this guy is a complete package that I didn't even know a notary could be!

Apparently he has other notaries that work with him in order to provide 24 hr service and accommodate customers in a timely fashion no matter where they are located or if they have special needs. I suppose this means your experience might be different, but I'd be very surprised if anyone associated with this operation served you wrong. I mean the guy will refer potential customers to chain stores if he feels that their needs (time / cost) would be better met ... what a guy!

Trust me when I say this is the place to call if you have any notary needs. It's been a long time since I've felt so cared for as a customer! 
Do not hesitate, call now :-)

As a customer service professional, I appreciate being treated how I treat my customers at work.  I called for a notarization of a passport form and Michael went the extra mile; broke down the fee structure and gave me options, including his competitors.  I like that he didn't have anything to gain from helping me, but he still did.  I plan to recommend him in the future.

Very friendly! Explained the entire process to me of what is needed to certify a copy of someone's documents. 
They are open 24/7 and come to you wherever you're staying. Only problem is, that not everyone accepts certified copies in Vegas. 

Very friendly people.

The purpose for the notary service was because I needed my firearms and suppressor trusts notarized as my brother being the benefactor.  Michael called me ahead of time that he will be running late and that was cool.  It was inclement weather at 4/25/2015 around 8:30pm.  He showed up around 9:15pm and that is okay for us tonight.  He also brought lots of different colored pens which I acknowledged my signature with a blue pen.  Good he had one on him.  He was thorough, helpful, knowledgeable and passionate to do this mobile notary service.  Price is fair being that it is at night and on a weekend.  The nature of my brother and my work, waiting on UPS to save money is not worth it.  Mike's mobile notary is worth the extra coin for us.

The guy that I talked to over the phone was nice. Alisa I think was the lady that came to natarized my documents. She had no clue what's going on. I only needed 3 docu and it took her almost 1 hour to get done. On top of that she had to play lawyer on me. Not cool. Very unprofessional.

I went to Mr. Randolph on a friends recommendation after I was unsuccessful in dealing with the IRS on my own regarding a Notice of Intent to Levy (bad move to begin with).  Taylor was open, honest, puts you at ease and without making any promises, gave me reassurance he could help at least minimize the amount owed.  Taylor and his staff were very helpful and he was able to reduce my debt by 50% along with negotiating a payment schedule.  This was after I had already used my one allotted Collection Due Process hearing with the IRS collections agent on my own.  You won't regret retaining Randolph Law Firm for IRS or Bankruptcy related issues - He is one of the BEST.

Mr. Randolph is an amazing tax lawyer. I had a really complicated case and he took care of it with ease. He was flexible on payments and made sure to answer all my questions in a timely manner. His staff are great and extremely professional. He resolved all my tax issues and that lifted a big burden off my shoulders. I will use Mr. Randolph for all my future tax need and I will  definitely  recommend him to all my friends and family. A very compassionate family man, thank you Mr. Randolph.

Taylor and his firm are a first class operation who understand what the client is going through and walks them through the process during difficult times. I've dealt with many attorneys over the years and he is one of the best.

When I went looking for an attorney to represent me in my bankruptcy case, I was referred by a friend to Randolph Law firm.  I went there terrified and worried and upon my first meeting, Taylor set my mind at ease.  They allowed me to make payments so I could come up with their fee.  This saved me months of worry and frustration.  The nerve-wracking process of filing was way less humiliating due to the services provided at Randolph Law Firm.  Nicole helped me out a lot and was always willing to respond to my incessant questions and emails.  I am grateful for their help.

Fantastic firm! Taylor and his para legal, Mariya, are so knowledgable and will fight to the end for their clients! They were amazing in expediting a resolution to our case. Time wasn't on our side but Taylor and his team got it done. We are so grateful.

I've known Taylor for about a year now and can say that he is without a doubt one of the best Tax and Bankruptcy Lawyers in Las Vegas. He has the expertise to help people save money with their tax issues and is very helpful in explaining different options to his clients. I'd highly recommend calling their office to speak with him about any bankruptcy or tax legal questions you have.

We are a new client with the Randolph Law Firm and after interviewing several attorneys we were confident immediately after meeting with Taylor for our consultation.  Yes we met with him directly.  
.... the staff have shown us competence, knowledge, professionalism, and kindness. Taylor was immediately on the case and within days of diligence going to the top, we received an email saying "GREAT NEWS".  And it was!    A big sigh of relief!

We are looking forward to telling the world more success stories as we work through our issues.

Taylor's firm helped me out with a financial issue and everything went very smoothly. My situation changed after my initial meeting with Taylor, making things more difficult for them, but they were able to handle it and everything still turned out great. Most of my contact was through Taylor's paralegal Leo and he was always very responsive whether it be by phone or email. 

In the end, my expectations were exceeded as the outcome was better than initially expected. I highly recommend Taylor's firm.

Low staff!!!! Every time I come in I waste 45 minutes to an hour trying to do something that should only take no more than 5 minutes! Sometimes only one teller while the other one is counting money and 13 people in line. Really?

AMAZING!!! 
As a Realtor I can say there are not that many lenders out there that cares as much as Eitan does! 
I have done numerous deals with Eitan and the level of professionalism, courtesy and creativity (when needed) was off the charts!!! 
Highly recommended!!!

I have had the opportunity to work with Eitan on a couple of transactions (I am a realtor) and he has come through both times and my clients loved him.  I have had more rough experiences with loan officers then I care to remember so its GREAT when you meet a good one!  Keep up the good work Eitan and I'm sure we will do more business in the future!
Eitan Took all the stress out of my purchase. He's easy to work with and very professional. I will definitely be using him again in the future and would highly recommend him.
I don't know much about this type of stuff, but Eitan made it really simple for me. Very professional and friendly.

Do not, I repeat, do not go and have your car serviced at this bait and switch place!!
My husband wanted an oil change and we called before coming to check on the price ---let me state we are AAA members . My husband got a quote and made appointment for afternoon. When he arrived, he told the man at the counter that he did not want the high performance oil (they try to sell you this) and that the regular oil for his truck was what he wanted. 
Well, when the work was done , my husband was presented with a bill for $59.00 and on the bill it stated he was given the high performance oil---needless to say, he was furious when he saw this !  Also, the quote we were given was $24.95 on the phone---they do not inform you, the customer, that they charge a $5.00 fee , a installation charge for the oil---and an extra fee to dispose of the oil. 
I was not present at the time of this transaction so when I was told by my husband what had happened , I called the place and Tom Bates answered the phone. I asked what they had charged for the service and told him you charged us for something we did not ask for. He was lying through his teeth when he said my husband wanted the high performance oil change--NOT!!   What really is funny is that on the bill there is a paragraph that states "if you are not satisfied for any reason contact Tommy Bates to give you the opportunity to achieve our goal". Well, I received no satisfaction when I called to complain so I called the customer service number at the AAA office and registered a formal complaint with them regarding the service.  If the matter is not resolved to our satisfaction I will be contacting the Attorney General's office for the state of NC as well as the BBB in Charlotte. We will never use their services again and I am thinking of cancelling my membership altogether. If any of you folks out there plan to use this place for your car care, please make sure you write out your own instructions as to what you want done so that you have proof as to what you told them---they bait and switch and change your order without your permission. This AAA car care center is located in Matthews on Independence Blvd.

Very strange of me not to check Yelp before heading out... But I will have to say that I'm glad I didn't. Shocker I know! 

I had a very nice experience this morning with this AAA - had an appointment for 10AM and they were ready -- which is amazing because that never happens in my world. 

I actually had an appointment for them to change my oil, check fluids, rotate tires, etc.. a package deal. 

The waiting room was quite nice - I was able to use their wi-fi and surf the web using my laptop -- nice touch (but they also have PC's you can you use as well should you not wish to bring your laptop). 

It took about an hour and half and they didn't try to sell me anything... The gentleman that was helping me even gave me a tip on how to save money!!!! What? Are you kidding me? Amazing. 

All in all, I was very please with the service and the staff - so why only the 3 stars... I will wait for my second return to see if they are consistent.... 

I always get screwed over at these types of places... So we will see. I have to go back sometime in the near future to get a leak in my something ma-gigger, but waiting to get a second opinion.

Went in to have a state inspection and tire rotation.  They were courtious, efficient and only did what was necessary to pass.  The shop seemed clean and the mechanics all seemed to keep busy with their work.  The customer lounge was comfortable and clean.   I am definitely going to use them again.

This place has got to be one of the worst places to take your car.  I only needed brake service done on the front brakes.  I told them that I do not need rotors and that the front brakes were squeaking.  They pulled the car into the bay then LOOKED at the car for about 10 minutes and came to the conclusion( without touching it at all) that I needed rotors on the back and new brakes.  

They gave me a quote on the job and began work.  I also asked for a balance and rotation.  After they received the new rotors from across the street they promptly put them on and put the tires back on without doing the balance/rotation.  

I brought it to their attention that the front brakes are what I wanted done and they restated that the front was fine since they checked it (LIE) but they still had not looked at the front brakes.  I tell them that this is not true and also that the tires have been put back on the car but the balance/rotation has not been done.  They were going to have me pay for a 40 service that I never received (potential costly LIE of OMISSION).

She then tells me if I want them to check to see if there is something wrong with the front brakes it will cost an additional 50.00.  I am too livid to think straight at this point and tell her to forget it since I will be charged an extra 50 in order to have them do what I brought the car there for in the first place.  

When they finally finish after about two hours the price ended up being well over 330 (another LIE) since I was not quoted anything like that.  

Lastly, when I get ready to leave they hand me a broken emblem from the center of my wheel and told me that it was broke when I got there.  I had driven over 60 miles before I pulled into their parking lot and I am sure that if it was broken it would have fallen off before now.   The reason it broke is because of one of the techs was handling my car tire like it was a basket ball.  That is what broke it.  I will not use any AAA Car Care Center ever again.  I will use ANYBODY BUT AAA Car Care.  They have all but ruined the name of a very respected company.

I had a great experience - car had a shudder in the brakes, they had it in and out same day, and had a shuttle that I could take so I wasn't sitting around the whole time. The staff were super nice and friendly, and the price was on par with other shops, if not a bit lower. I thought they were great! Worked with Steve Guthrie, highly recommend!

Jason Cunningham has been outstanding. Our son from Birmingham came home for a weekend visit and we needed a number of things done very quickly on his car. The service and repairs were done quickly and exceptionally! We now have a go-to reliable service center at AAA Matthews. We would not hesitate to recommend AAA to any of our friends and relatives. Jason will do everything he can to help you and make certain the work you need is done right.  We also found their prices to be very competitive and lower than most dealerships.

Been here twice, once for an inspection and new tires, another time for an oil change and tire rotation. The staff are courteous if not exactly cheerful, the place is clean and it has a decent waiting area from which you can see inside the shop (could be good if you're watching what's happening to your car, or bad if a visit to the repair shop for you is kinda like going to the dentist - a painful wait to find out just how much money it will cost you). 

With the tire rotation, I just managed to drive back onto Independence when it became clear the car is not driving in a straight line anymore. Back I go: Apparently the tires were worn out in a way that didn't allow for rotating them anymore. They hadn't noticed that before. 

After my 30 dollar oil change, I got a quote for another half dozen repairs that according to them needed to be done and would have totalled close to 1000 dollars. Thankful for the pointers, but since I was having no car trouble, a three page quote of stuff that "needs" to be done seems like they're trying hard to squeeze money out of me. Although to be fair, I am no expert on cars, so I can't say too much on how fair their quote was.

The inspection and tire change was fine, except for the wait. They said getting the tires would take 45 minutes. It ended up taking them 1.5 hours, and with changing them, the inspection and various wait times in between, I spent over three hours at the shop. 

Lastly, I am a AAA member, which should give you 10 percent off labor at AAA car care centers. I asked if they needed to see my AAA card, they said no. No discount applied. I had to ask right-out for the discount on the labor costs before they granted it. 

I came here for the credibility and fairness that I hoped the AAA name would guarantee, but I think I'll now give somewhere else a try.

If I can give it a zero star I would. Juan Pagan is an idiot. He is slower than a sloth. He made a mistake on notarizing our Deed of Trust that costs us to miss the locking deadline. How hard it is to copy the name from one piece of paper to the next.
Lj is the best! Super helpful and friendly. He definitely deserves a pay raise. Thanks for he help :)

Good location as it's sitting right next to I-10.  Very difficult to leave the branch especially during rush hours.  Friendly staff as always.  I would not want to be there after sunset as there are a lot of homeless people around.

A lot of insurance agents throughout the city, you find them on every corner, but Paulina Kalaj's is very friendly and helpful.

"Drivers who switched to Allstate saved even more than before"
Paulina is AMAZING, she has redefined the meaning of above and beyond and should be the poster child for the tag line "You are in good hands with Allstate".

Loan is pleasant to work with. She listens to your needs and make sure that everything I wanted was included. She was also the only one who responded right after I shopped for a new insurance online last night (even though it was past her regular business hours!). If you need insurance, don't forget to check out Allstate and Loan! Her other colleagues in the office were very friendly as well.

Loan worked with me and my husband to find the right coverages for my cars and home. I don't understand insurance and she took the time to explain everything to me. The rates were great! I love having an agent that cares about me. And I got a discount for getting life insurance !

Let me start by saying, you need to look no further than here for an amazing real estate team.

Richard and his team are "Super Agents" and will truly make you feel like a part of the family.

I recently was hunting for a house and my partner stopped in at one of Richard's open houses. I was not there for the initial meeting but my partner fell in love with the house and Richard . 

Once we made an offer, Richard worked tirelessly to make it ours. We had some snags with the mortgage company that were very irritating and frustrating but Richard got on their case and got it done.

He was at the closing with me after-hours and did not leave until the last document was signed. 

During the process,  I had an eye doctor appointment that conflicted with some document signing so Richard came to the appointment with me and waited while I got new glasses. That is real customer service.

After the closing he checked in to make sure all was well and that we were happy. 

I really hope that you give them a chance whether buying or selling as the will go to the moon and back to make sure you are taken care of.

So, what are you waiting for? Give them a call and tell them I sent you. You will not be sorry.

I use Team Emanuele for all of my real estate needs. I am both an investor who holds properties as well as flips properties. I have conducted over 20 transactions so far with Richard. I would not entrust anyone else to buy or sell my properties besides Richard as he truly ethical & cares about his clients bottom line. He always ensures my best interests are priority. I can't say enough positive things about Team Emanuele. I'm so glad I found your team.
Helped me in various real estate transactions. Rich is professional and hard working.  I would highly recommend him and his Team

Pro tip: If you need to go to a bank branch to see a manager or banker (as opposed to a teller), go early. I got here at 10:30 and still had to wait a good hour until it was my turn to be seen. When I left, all the seats were taken and there were a few folks standing and waiting.

The banker I dealt with was helpful even if he needed a store manager to perform the transaction I needed. Unfortunately, there was no store manager working today.
Tuesday late afternoon and busy!  Looked like enough tellers behind the counter (wandering around) but the line was moving slow.
Just another normal bank but the staff are friendly and will be more than happy to help with whatever you need. Mostly come here for the drive-trough ATM.

Friendly staff, always feel welcoming in the mornings when I stop by. I'm not much of a morning person but a quick stop never hurt. Victor C is a great help and I will continue to come as long as I keep my Wells Fargo account. Lol

I have been using DHI Title for my mortgage needs for years. They are amazing at what they do. Jennifer M, Lisa B, Karen G and Paul are a great team that work very well together. I send my refinances as well as For Sale By Owners to them and they handle my clients with care. I also have recommended many Realtors to use DHI at this office and they love them as well.
Karen at this office is fantastic.  She has a real passion for helping others, I highly recommend giving her a call.

Karen and the team at DHI title are amazing. She is knowledgable, personable and friendly. She will take care of any of your title needs. I have friends that are realtors and have horror stories of working with different title agencies. DHI title and specifically, Karen do great work, I highly recommend them!

I have worked with Andrea Kahan at DHI title on marketing materials. Their Graphic Arts department does an amazing job on my marketing pieces, and their prices are less than the cost of the paper if I had to print them myself.

I have used an accounting firm for several years and felt as if they were "the man behind the curtain". I decided I wanted a more "hands-on" firm that educated me more about accounting practice so I could ask more intelligent questions - Greg was the guy! This fiscal year has started with a chart of accounts that makes more sense and is more logically organized. I am no longer "on the outside". Greg took the time to ask good questions and offered suggestions that made me think about better ways for measuring my business and bettered prepared for tax submission reporting. You will not regret enlisting his expertise - call him.

Greg was a very pleasant person to work with.  Last year I started my own business and I also got married.  I had a lot of questions and concerns about filing my taxes as a married man as a new business owner.  He did everything I expect him to do and more. He was extremely helpful in walking me through the differences of filing jointly or separately.
