If you're looking for a someone who will go out of their way to ensure you get the best possible results, please give your business business to Shayne.  I promise you will be very happy with your decision.

Shayne provides excellent and thorough accounting / tax services. She is knowledgeable, efficient, and friendly, and has made tax season a breeze for my mom and me. We've recommended her to friends and will continue to do so!

Shayne Neuwirth is a fantastic and very educated CPA. Whenever I have any questions regarding my taxes she is very helpful and is great at explaining things in lamens terms.  Shayne is very friendly and because of her I actually look forward to getting my taxes done! I can't say enough great things about Shayne and am grateful for all of her help.

I recommend Shayne Neuwirth to anyone who is in need of a CPA.

I was referred to Shayne by a colleague of mine; I was looking for someone who was competent, organized, and reasonably priced.  Like many small business owners, I'm very busy - it's easy for me to let my bookkeeping get out of control or to forget about a tax deadline until the last minute. Shayne stays on top of things for me, which allows me to focus on what I do best - running my business. I've recommended her to everyone I know.

Shayne has handled my accounting and personal income tax needs for two years going on three, and I couldn't be happier with the quality service, accuracy and knowledge she provides and possesses.  She answers all of my quirky questions, gets everything correct on the first run, and has the capacity and knowledge to handle a fairly complicated tax return.  Multi-state, out-of-state (IL), K-1s, tax estimates -- all handled accurately and seamlessly.  Wouldn't want to go anywhere else, and love to support a small business!  Definitely recommend -- I've known Shayne for over 10 years now, and can't think of a more professional person to handle my accounting and tax needs!

I had the pleasure knowing Shayne through our academic years into our professional careers.  She has played a major role in my personal and business's (tax) accounting.  Her professionalism, organization, efficiency and attention to detail gives me the best peace of mind.  And knowing that my filings and are in the best hands is the best customer service one can ask for.  Thank you, Shayne!

I was recommended to Shayne from a friend who said she was the best. It was no lie she helped me tremendously!  Her professionalism and friendliness along with insite is what will keep me coming back.
Shayne is knowledgeable and accommodating.  She makes the process simple and convenient for me, documents thoroughly, and is very personable.  Nice work Shayne!

I am very happy with Shayne's service.  She takes great care of me and my clients.  She is knowledgeable and easy to work with.  More importantly she is easy to get a hold of and follows up in a timely manner.  I highly recommend for someone to use her as your CPA. Accountant, and bookkeeping services.

Wow! Shayne does a fantastic job. She was recommended by a coworker, and I'm very thankful I filed taxes with her.  She will see you promptly at your scheduled time and key in your taxes faster than most people speak! I was out of her office in exactly an hour, knowing without a doubt, that my filing was done right. I would recommend Shayne to anyone, but at the same time, I hope she doesn't become too popular- I'll need her next year, too!
This is my first time using Shayne for my taxes. She works fast and have good prices. I will be using her services again soon!

Just moved here from Washington state. Usually do my own taxes but had a very unusual (for us) year with sale of a home, transfer of rental property, charitable donation of real property, change in income due to retirement and a bunch of other stuff. Wanted to do some strategic planning before tax year ended.

Found Shayne here on Yelp, never having been a client before. Very efficient appointment scheduling. We spent an extremely productive hour looking at different scenarios and "what if'ing" ideas. Shayne did an excellent job evaluating my situation and responding to my inquiries. She has a knack for explaining when appropriate, but not when unnecessary so as to make our time more productive. She made excellent suggestions, and I left feeling I had gotten far more than my money's worth from our time. I couldn't have had a better experience and would highly recommend her.
Thank You for your Time and Patience, in explaining my loan transaction in detail. As well as making my move across  the states stress-free.

The thought of buying a house can be a scary process especially when you don't know the legal jargon of all the papers you will be signing. I was fortunate enough to have been recommended Jody by friends. 

From the beginning, he sat down with me, and I explained my financial situation and told him an estimate for a mortgage that I would be comfortable with. He calculated my debt to income ratio, and told me what I would most likely be approved for. He then had me gather documents that would be needed throughout the process (before I even started looking). 

Once I submitted my offer, and had my loan process started, I hardly even had to think about the process. It was almost too perfect, but it was because all my documents were ready to go when the funding bank asked for them. If there were any issues, Jody was prompt with his correspondence, and contacted me both my email and phone. During the month long process, he would update me on my status, without being asked. When I went to go to my closing signing, he was there to answer any questions I had with the documents, and was straightforward with his answers.

I've never bought a house, and I've heard many horror stories about the loan process. I'm grateful that I didn't have that same experience. Jody knows his stuff. He's prompt with his responses and will spare you all the commercial b.s. that others use to manipulate you. For example... the house I bought required a pre-approval letter from another bank. This bank was giving me a difficult time and was delaying my escrow process. Jody stepped in, provided the representative with the required paperwork, and asked that the approval letter be processed immediately so I could proceed with my escrow. The representative quickly changed her tune. Apparently these banks try to offer incentives to gain your business and end up costing people more money at the end. 

I can't say how much I appreciate Jody's help. Like I said, my process was so much smoother than what I pictured, and it was because he anticipated all the games that banks might play and he's willing to help No question is ever too stupid - he'll answer them all (I asked tons!).  If I had to do it again, I would go with Jody, and I would have NO problem recommending him to anyone else.

Jody is a great guy. He has helped me through two home purchases now. The thing I appreciate the most is his honesty. When woking with jody I have always felt that I could trust him which is important to me when big money matters are on the line. 

If you are working on your finances do your self a favor and talk to Jody. You wont regret it.

In February of 2016 I closed all of my accounts at WELLS FARGO, business, personal and merchant. I closed them, because I was told non truths. In July of 2016 I tried to reopen the merchant account through WF, because they stuck me with a 4 year lease on a credit card machine. The denied me for the new merchant account, and yet they are still trying STEAL money from me on an account I was not approved for, or opened.  
STAY AWAY from Wells Fargo bank. I would like to say that I would give Wells Fargo bank a minus 10 STARS if it was allowed.

Rosario and janeth are the two worst Wells Fargo employees on earth.  


No wonder this place has one star. 


Can't handle a simple transaction and rude.

I've known James for many years and I can say from experience he tries his best to make all of those around him happy. He is generous and he has an amazing group of people working in his agency. His specialist for life and retirement is knowledgable and excels in his performance! Highly recommended!!!

Our family has been with Nevada State for over 20 years.  We have always been very happy with the quality of their service, but, we wanted to single out our Business Banking Officer, Chris Berry.  Chris is very professional, friendly and helpful.  He always makes our personal and business banking experience easy and stress free.  Thank you Chris for making us feel like a valued client and we look forward to working with you for many years to come.

I have been with Nevada state bank for almost 10 years. It's an excellent bank to bank with. In this amount of time I'm sure you understand that I've had a couple skirmishes with them here and there. Nothing big where I needed to open up a new account somewhere else. I like that there are a lot of these banks in town so it can be quite convenient. I don't like that it's stationed in nevada only and that I cannot withdraw cash in other states without getting fined for it. Other than that, customer service has never been that bad. Could be better at times, but once again I have nothing to really complain about.

The only reason I'll even give SECU two stars is that I did end up with a pretty decent mortgage for my house here, and I also bought a nice birdhouse from them (inexplicably sold in the front lobby).  But my praise begins and ends there.  

The biggest problem with the SECU is their terrible hours.  Why, oh why, is the bank only open when we are at work???  Closing at 5:30?  Not even open on Saturday mornings???!!!  It's just crazy.  I've also found their customer service to be lacking (at least, on the phone), and they have NO ATMs uptown.  While I wanted to get away from Wachovia/Wells and BorA, I'm starting to realize that all these banks are the same (i.e. terrible).  Unfortunately, no bank I've found down here matches up with the service and convenience of my former bank, Citibank.

DONT EVER USE THEIR ATM FOR DEPOSTS!
Their ATM jammed mid-deposit. I called. THey said someone was on their was to clear the jam, they'd balance the machine and I would have my funds available in a few HOURS. (I was on my way shopping and now couldnt go). They never made the funds available. I called and talked to 4 people who gave me the runaround-should have been deposited when machine was balanced. Money will be held until NEXT WEEK. I have NO money, and no one cares. It is on "hold" until next week. I can'g grocery shop to feed my family. It was all the money I had. No one I spoke to on the phone cared at all that the only money I have is tied up due to their mistake. One rep said it happens regularly-WHAT? How can they hold MY money so my kids have to starve until next week? I'll be leaving this institution.
Prior to this we were going to buy a home-called THREE times to get the ball rolling. Each time we were told they'd get back to us. They never did. Customer service is awful. Family member did get a loan through them, loan person gave wrong information and they had to come up with thousands more at closing due to inept employee-was a manager too! 
This is an awful place on so many levels.

Oh, and telllers have to have their last names displayed-leading to awkward questions from members. I witnessed it on many occasions-WEIRD to say the least!

I love the girls at this particular location, always nice and helpful. The bank itself bothers me because it's so outdated and frankly, that gets annoying since their policies are outdated as well. I do love their change machine though!

Great place to bank with. Also great care in establishing car and home loans. Have been taken care of by this place in Glendale AZ. The folks are very down to earth, not fake in their care at all. 
I am glad to be a customer to Navy Fed

My favorite people at my favorite financial institution are at this Navy Federal location by Luke AFB.  I know just about all the faces every time I walk in and it's always a comfortable feeling.  They've helped me with all sorts of banking needs, from home, to auto loans, credit cards, multiple accts, etc etc.  I've never had any issues with them and I'm glad they exist.  I can't wait for them to open up a closer location as this one and Mesa are very far apart.

Do not go into this branch or start an service with this credit union. I've had the WORST experience I've ever had with a bank . I tried opening an account with them and the representative told me she could do nothing for me because I started the application online . So then I called the customer service number and they deleted everything I did online and that I should be good to go . Nope when I walked back in the manager said there is still nothing they could do for me . Pretty sad for what type of service I got for just wanting to open an account because I leave to bootcamp next month . If I can give them 0 stars believe me I would .

Excellent service. The bankers are very informative know all of the information we wanted to know. Even though the appointment we had with the original banker called out sick the branch manager was there to aid us, and got all of our needs met within a reasonable amount of time. I will be back to do my further banking.

Joe, Logan and Carlos are THE BEST. I've been with this State Farm office for  3 years and it is all because of them, I can't imagine going anywhere else. The customer service here is off the charts, these guys are friendly, professional and truly care about you. I've never had a problem, I've never had trouble reaching them and they continue to exceed my expectations. Thank you Joe, Logan and Carlos! You guys deserve a raise :)
Shaine Stevenson's office is always quick to help with last minute requests and get the info we need! They jump right on the task and get it done! It's always a pleasure to work with them!

Extremely pleased with Shaine and his team and State Farm. He provided exactly the coverage I needed without all the hassle and irrelevancies. 

Shaine is great because he not only offered help with my insurance, but gave some quick financial advice that is really beneficial.

Thanks again!

I am very happy with Shaine Stevenson and his entire staff! Carlos was incredibly helpful and took care of everything I needed, including saving me $135 a year on my policy! Everyone I've spoken to in this office is friendly, polite and easy to talk to. Thank you so much for taking the time to help me out!

I've been with State Farm a little over a year now and these guys seem to be extremely helpful with all of my issues. Whether big or small, they're quick at getting back to me, answering my questions and taking care of my requests. I am very satisfied working with such fine gentlemen. Shaine, Carlos, Joe and Logan. My sister suggested I join, since she's been with State Farm Insurance for a few years, and it's been a great decision ever since. Please keep it up, guys!!!

When I first walked in I was greeted by many people. It was my first time so I was shown to the application form.. that I must say was set up nicely everything was clean and the staff seemed friendly.  A little goofy although more chattery then the other loan places

I am very happy with the service I receive from DLC.  I physically visit the location on Horizon ridge but I've done online/direct deposit the last few times and upon receiving the satisfaction survey this is the location the link brings me to - I'm assuming the agent processing my app works at this location.  When you process an online app it is very idiot-proof (website navigating-wise) and a rep will call you soon after.  Three times now I've gotten the same, sweet girl by the name of Britney (spelling?) to process and complete my loan.  She is very professional and friendly - same goes to the reps I've visited at Horizon ridge.  The entire process is discrete and while I avoided short term loans before because of the taboo - it has been my saving grace in times of need.  Very untrue that these reps will hassle your references - only if you default.  I've always been quick to pay off my loans which is how it should be when using them bc the interest can rack up reeeeaaaal quick.  

Bottom line: I believe if you are a risk-worthy customer who will pay off quickly or bare minimum, make on time payments, then you will have a great experience.

I hold the belief that almost all insurance salesmen are snake oil sellers... Not Kevin. He took the time to sit down with my wife and I and find out what was important to us and then he recommended coverages that we appropriate for our lifestyle and our goals. Oh, an it didn't hurt that he saved us over $1,000 off of what we paid the year before. I recommend Kevin to anyone who asks about insurance!

The best service in Arizona! They know me and my family personally, we're not just another policy holder to them. They explain everything completely, and even call when I can save money or just to wish me a happy birthday! Love them so much that when I got married and moved to Yuma, I combined my husband's existing State Farm policy from here to Kevin McGraw's office up there. State Farm is great, but even more fantastic when you do business with Kevin and Marilyn. The State Farm offices here in Yuma couldn't even recognize my husband's name after 5 years of doing business with them. We haven't been married a year and Kevin and his crew know his name without looking on the policy. Made a claim this morning and less than 30 minutes I got a call from their office. They had everything handled already and just wanted to make sure our car was being fixed immediately. Very easy to do business with them even though we're 3 hours away!
I went in to get a money order and Vanessa was a great help!!! Loved her customer service skills  enjoy going to that office

I really can't believe I haven't checked in or reviewed this place yet...

I've been coming to this Check City location for over 2 years now.  

I have a Netspend card, which is a prepaid debit/credit card.  I come here all the time to load the card so I can pay my bills, order my bf beard oil, buy concert tickets, etc. 

I also just found out that money orders are FREE here.  How amazing is that?!

The staff is always very friendly, and the place is clean.  

I love that they are open 24/7.

My only complaints are:  
1.  Miscommunication and information. I was given two different stories on getting a "refund" on a money order I'd purchased earlier in the day...it ended up not being a big deal, but having consistent information is vital to good customer service.  

2.  Their parking lot SUCKS.  I tried to stop in yesterday, and had absolutely NO WHERE to park.  I know its not really their fault, and I'm sure that some of the spots were taken by people visiting the bar that's in the same shopping center, but...ugh.  

I really do like this location though, and come here often.

So I frequent this location once a month for my free money order to pay my rent. Why go anywhere else and pay for a money order when I can come here and get a free one. Mind you, if you need an envelope they will charge you a small fee of $0.10. I find that quite funny. 

I never have to wait in line long. If all their employees are busy helping others, someone is always walking up to one of the windows to assist their customers. 

They are fast and speedy.

CHECK CITY is by far the worst pay day loan company you could ever use! Don't take what I say lightly. I mean it. They are awful. I have a loan out with them and unfortunately I'm going through struggles with income at the moment. THEY COULDN'T CARE LESS. They are so heartless and cruel. They will harass you constantly until you pay. When I say harass, I mean if you don't pick up the phone when they call, they will call your references and your job right after!! They don't care! I've called and explained my situation and they say " let's work something out" and nothing gets worked out. Total scum bag of a business and I highly recommend you choose wisely before getting a loan from CHECK CITY. By the way I've used other loan companies and they call but never harass or call my work or references. There are much better businesses who will loan you money and treat you well.

Nice location inside but my biggest qualm with this place is the drive up ATM. Every single time I've gone to this drive up ATM there's been something wrong with it.  Whether it's "can't accept cash deposits" or "can't dispense cash", they're always something wrong!  Can't dispense cash!?! That's the main purpose of an ATM! This just leads me to believe that they're isn't proper, regular maintenance on the machine which translates to bad customer service.  Shame!

Ok. First i have had a fantastic experience with chase bank overall. I actually like Chase.   I hate posting this but maybe just maybe someone will read this and figure out a solution. The holidays are a busy time....very busy.....people are shopping cooking shopping shopping......whoever is managing this branch needs to ne replaced. The manager is either too concerned with profit or simply does not understand staffing at all.  My husband came home very frazzled from this location a couple weeks ago due to taking a so so so so so long making a transaction.  Now I came home from the same bank completely exasperated. ...after standing in line.......for at least 25 minitess I watched about 6 or more people walk out due to waiting a long. There were 2 tellers then 1 left. I would have walked out as well however I needed to put cash in someone's account.   After my nightmare at this bank I had to come home take tylwnol and lay down.    The rest of my day shot.  Aomwone needs to address the management at this location NOW!
Its a bank,  they take your money, invest with it, make money off of it, they take a bail out, and still charge you a monthly fee.
Chase all day. Lost my card and gave me a ATM card no questions asked and the whole time I was there was only 5 minutes!! He also took cash out for me too when I asked!

My wife and I are extremely sorry that we opened up an account at Chase Bank in Las Vegas on Durango we have been trying to call the branch over and over and over for hours and hours and it tells us to put in the persons three digits of the persons name and even though the person is been working there for a long time it doesn't recognize their name what a stupid system with a stupid company

Last week I visited this bank to deposit cash in their outside atm. After inserting nearly $500, the atm took the money, said transaction completed but failed to give me a receipt. I immediately checked my account and the money had not deposited. I went inside and spoke with an attendant you confirmed the money did not post. I was fortunate enough to get Ashley Lopes, a representative (vp of some sorts) who sat with me and filed a claim on my behalf. She was the most genuine and professional individual. She followed up with me the following day to let me know she'd contacted claims and all way returned to my account. Giving this bank a 5 star NOT because of their atm, but their exceptional team.

Ok this bank is full of nice people who share the secrets of saving & investments. I give it 3 stars total. They are sweet people but I love this bank 4th. Three other banks come before it in my book. It's true everyone can't have first place but I think this bank don't try to come in first. Customer service could be over all better.

I love this place thus far!! They have great customer service and remember who I am every single time. And that's because I hadn't been in for a very long time and yet they would ask my boyfriend whenever he would go in how I was... by my name! That nowadays is as rare as a unicorn lol!!! They've tooken care of previous issues I've had and have answered all my questions and if/when the banker couldn't answer a question they would seek advise from someone there who would've known or knows the answer. Over all I love it!! 2 thumbs up  if I had more I'd put more up ha

I know I can't always expect good service from the big banks but this branch was fast, courteous and informative with a very complex banking situation. 

They even waived some fees to get money sent out.  Thanks

We transacted a loan from one wells fargo account to another. Even though Wells Fargo had all the paperwork, they delayed payment as long as they could delaying and blaming every possible source.  The paperwork was  sprung on us at the last minute AT CLOSING with no ability to have it reviewed by an outside attorney. Those are the facts so judge for yourself.   Very shady if you ask me.

The staff is incredibly helpful and they know customer service. I will gladly go into Safeway (& go out of my way in general) to use this Wells Fargo as opposed to others. Joey is very professional and personable, as well as the rest of the employees.
Just tried to deposit cash into a friends account and they don't accept cash as a deposit. Chase is still one of the worst banks ever.

This is for all Chase banks...not just this one. And it is not regarding the great service, FIVE STAR, I would normally give for how great they have been.  I am very disappointed they have chosen to go almost fully automated. Ive been to two branches in the last 3 days and both have eliminated their drive thru windows, their tellers and only have one teller available.  This lacks the personal touch I've always enjoyed there. I realize this is how the world is going...not happy about it one bit. 

If I can find a bank or credit union that will continue with the old fashioned style of real customer service, I will move my business.

With all the fed rates plummeting, and my money barely earning more than inflation in my Wamu savings account, I decided to transfer a large portion of my savings over to Arizona Bank & Trust.  

**I interrupt this review for an important news flash: Arizona Bank & Trust currently has a 6.01% APY rewards checking account with a $20K cap on it. This blows away any online savings account out there, and best of all the money is liquid -- you can access it at any time you please. There are three basic requirements: 

1) Sign up for e-statements (easy - and one of the bankers will call you up and help walk you through it if you have trouble with it. If you're on Yelp, I figure you can navigate a computer though).  

2) Make 12 signature-based debit transactions a month. This means don't use your pin, and run it as a credit card. You can buy 12 packs of gum. Or buy 10 cents worth of gas 12 times. You can also use it to pay online utilities. This is not a hard requirement to fulfill, really. 

3) Direct depost OR ACH bill pay. This is great, because as a student, I don't have easy access to direct deposit, so I just used my AZB&T account to pay my Cox cable bill online - just make sure to use your bank account # and routing # to pay the bill, because if you use your debit card # it will NOT go through as an ACH debit.

The other thing that makes this deal a beauty is that the 6.01% rate is guaranteed until April 2009. Guaranteed. 12 blissful months of earning twice as much interest as my stinky online savings accounts. 

So after doing my research, I headed on over to the AZB&T branch down the street from me. From the moment I stepped through the door, I received very attentive service. I've had a bit of experience signing up for bank accounts, and the process was similar to most. Unfortunately, the day I was there the entire computer system had shut down, so they had to hand write my application and enter it after I left. Also, my initial deposit slip was handwritten -- which seemed a bit shady. And sure enough, the next day I noticed $2000 had been taken out of my other bank account, not the full $20,000 that I had written the deposit check for. AZB&T immediately caught their error though, requested the remaining amount, and it was in my account within the next couple of days.

Based on my initial experience, you'd think I would rate the bank poorly, but even through all the mishaps the bankers were very apologetic and professional and they followed up with several calls throughout the next week.  In fact, I have definitely gotten on a first name basis with a couple of the bankers there, and every time I call, I just have to say my full name and they know immediately who I am. I haven't gotten this kind of personalized service since leaving my teeny tiny hometown in Hickville, AZ. 

The only reason I wouldn't give my experience at AZB&T 5 stars is because the whole application process from beginning to end is a bit on the slow side, and the computers crashing was a bit of a nuisance. The friendliness and accessibility of the staff, however, has made it a real pleasure to bank here despite the few hiccups. I sent my friend over to sign up, and he's had no issues so far. 

Ask for Nicci or Nicole and tell them Heather S. sent you!

Unfortunately I had to go to this LOSER of a branch today, d/t an emergency and couldn't get to MY credit union. Again, this is "supposed" to be shared banking with other credit unions. 

Now the restriction is that I can only do a deposit/withdrawal/whatever with a designated shared banking teller. I made the mistake of going in while SHE WAS AT LUNCH!!! But no one else could help me. 

This place sucks! :-(

I've had my personal and business accounts with DSFCU for many years.  I always recommended them to anyone looking for a place to bank.  No more!  The last several years banking with them has become very disappointing.  The staff in the branches are always very pleasant, that's certainly not the issue.  One major problem is they have closed so many locations!  I used to have 3 within a 10 mile radius, now the closest location is 14 miles away.  The inconvenience is bad enough, but they can no longer seem to get their low balance alert working.  I keep a spending balance in checking, then transfer funds as needed to cover my bills.  Their low balance alert used to work.  I've contacted them 4 times regarding this problem and each time I've been assured the problem has been resolved.  It hasn't been, and I refuse to call a 5th time!  It's time to focus my energy on finding a more convenient, more capable banking institution.

I've been a long time Bank of America customer, almost 15 years which is upsetting cause either I'm old, started working too young or a combo of both.  Either way the people at Desert Schools are amazing, they actually seem to care, are personable and seem to be looking out for the customer.  Also there is a chuck e cheese nearby which is where a kid can be a kid, so thats a plus.

All my daughter wanted to do wash cash her  friggin' birthday check from her grandparents. And so you know, we tried at two Desert Schools branches!
Yep, that was the major issue that dumbfounded these mental midgets at Desert Schools on a Saturday morning. A lousy $25 dollar check. Why was it so confusing? Because my daughter just turned 12 and according to these idiots at Desert Schools, she wasn't able to cash her check because she didn't have a "government issued ID." What 12 year old kid has a driver's license or state issued ID? NONE!!!
Maybe I should be more understanding. I'm sure it's the 12 year old girls of the world who are trying to swindle financial institutions out of their hard earned money, 25 dollars at a time.
Desert Schools, you lost another customer, but more importantly, you really should be ashamed of yourselves for treating children this way!

LIARS AND THIEVES
There are many ethical banks to deal with in metro Phoenix --this isn't one of them. Stay clear--this is my experience with Desert Schools.
Went in to discuss an auto refinance. Had great credit -no problems. They advertise 60 months-that is what I wanted. Came to an agreement for the 60 month loan and was told the documents would be ready the following day.  Came in the next day to sign and was handed the loan documents and--they had written in 63 months.  After a discussion on the absurdity of what they had done--I was in a predicament as I was out of time-had to take it.
I had opened a savings and checking account previously as they required these accounts in place for the loan. They lied to me about how the savings account would back up the checking and started hitting me with penalties -which is just the opposite of what I was told.
They have been trying to gouge me on fees and penalties ever since.
Without  qualification this is the worst, most unethical financial institution I have ever dealt with.
Had to give 1 star --not only would I give them 0 stars I would like to see them shut down. Will complain to every agency dealing with banking and business.

Ive been standing in line for at least 30 mins. There's only a few people in front of me in line. The tellers are SO slow. This is horrible! Never coming back to this branch. One teller has only helped one lady this whole time.

ahhh....Desert schools.

This was my first checking account, I was 16 and just got my first job! They were a great bank, always helpful and friendly. They didn't have 24 hour customer service which I needed, I have pretty decent memories from banking with them but I won't return since they don't meet all of my needs. but i definitely recommend them for opening up your first account.

i also didn't like that there were few and far between locations compared to larger banks.

This place is the worst for loans. It took four times for them to get my auto loan correct. Of course its always someone elses fault too, I never really got a straight answer as to why I had to come back 4 times to close the loan... Its enough for me to switch banks & I've banked w/ them for ten years.
Standard disappointment. Allowing customers to balance account at the teller. 15 minutes to do a simple deposit when they have 10 people in the line

I feel sort of strange reviewing a bank, but it is a place I frequent often so it seems ok to review. Plus, at my old job, my crazy boss dealt with SEVEN different banks of which he had me personally take deposits to each (sometimes on the same day, fun drive...not) so I feel well qualified to judge it in comparison to other banks.

Anyways, on with the review already...I love Desert Schools. I don't see myself ever switching to another bank for any purpose. I have been banking with them for 4 years and have never had even one issue. In fact, they often resolve issues for me, such as removing those nasty little NSF fees. I always have a really pleasant experience when I go in, all of the tellers are super friendly and are well-trained. I also never have to wait in much of a line. 

In comparison to the several other banks I used to deal with, I feel that DS takes the time to educate each of their employees far more than other banks. I also feel as if they don't pressure you to open other services. Many of the the banks that I used to deposit at for my old boss would constantly hound me about opening up another account, or line of credit, etc. 

If anyone talks about bank issues, I always find myself raving about my wonderful banking experiences!!! Thank you Desert Schools for being awesome!

I love this bank. I go out of my way just for them cause the other one by me doesn't  make me feel as welcome.  This one though is great. I always get welcomed and they have helped me and answered every question no problem. Highly recommended
Do not use,  Manager Danielle in the call center is the most rude shady person I have ever talk to in my life.

Not happy sad 16 years being a customer now move.  I agree with some here they have gotten just to be nasty at time not very caring. There was a time customer service went along with desert schools not any more. sad.

I have been a member of the credit union since 1986. I have had basic accounts, car loans, and other loans and have gotten the best interest rates around. Never have had a problem. Service is great too. I am always asked when I go in (which is rare) if I need an extra check register. That is really nice because I usually do! Then they give me 2!

I have financi als but can't get any where DSFU. Only make $275 to many fees direct deposit done Friday didfn't post till Monday keep in mind thinking deposits were made nope they NFS charges so bad my next pay i won't get . I have notification set up on mobile site do get notified not once nothing came through only about direct deposit ...    been a member for over  10 yeas and get treated like this. Bad business any suggestions for a good bank

Scott Madison's State Farm office has taken care of multiple policies for me over the years. His rates are very competitive but his attention to details and personal service is what sets him apart. 

I've never had to use any of my State Farm policies but I feel safe that I would be fine if something were to happen.
Scott and his team have always been very helpful when ever I have any questions or problems. I'm treated like family here.

Stay far away from this bank! I opened a simple checking account in 2009 when I decided to leave Chase after they made some policy changes. Little did I know that was going to be the biggest mistake in banking I ever made. Sure, this bank starts out looking like a good idea, and then you realize that there are little to no ATM's in the valley, and the customer service is sub-par. After a few months I decided to close my account and move back to a big bank, and that's when all the BS started. A week after I closed my account, they reopened it and started charging fee's without an explanation. When I went into the bank to find out whats going on, they stood there and told me that they can do whatever they want without speaking to me. 
So I paid them their stupid $5 fee and walked away thinking that this issue was closed.

Four years later, I was looking at my credit report and noticed that One Nevada had charged off $105 with no explanation. I went over to the bank only to discover that they kept the fee's running just because they felt like it. After a long heated discussion, I demanded that they remove the charge off immediately. Their collections department decided that they would try to muscle me into backing off. These people are low class, unprofessional, and display some of the worst customer service I've ever seen.   

I filed a small claims suit against them in 2015. It took a judge 15 minutes to realize that the bank violated several FTC laws, and quickly ruled in my favor. The bank was forced to remove the charge off for failure to communicate the charges with the customer. It turns out that they are all talk until you take them to court. All i can say is that if looks could kill, the look the bank rep gave me across the court room, would have done me in. 

The Bottom Line - They are poorly trained, rude,and aggressive towards their customers, because most locals here lack the customer service skills that the rest of us learn in the real world. Save yourself a lot of trouble and don't do business with small Nevada banks. This experience has taught me that when I feel that the big banks are treating me wrong, it's far from the BS that people are putting up with at the local level.

I've been a member of the credit union since 2014. I love Krystin at this office; however, see nobody but her and the manager. Kathy is nice too. Do NOT SEE NORMA. She personally disrespected me and humiliated in me in front of other members.

My mother signed a check over to me on Friday. She did it at 7 PM, so I couldn't go into the credit union branch to make the deposit. I had to do it via the ATM deposit. I explained to Norma that I needed help because my rent is due tomorrow and the money wasn't available yet. Norma had a terrible attitude and said, 
"I'm not releasing a DIME to you. I don't care!" I have never felt so disrespected by anyone, especially at this branch. She was ridiculous. Krystin, Emily & Kathy are the only ones anyone should see at this location. Norma doesn't deserve to be working there if she's going to speak to customers that way.

I brought a check into the Farm/Durango location and asked if they could verify it before I accepted it as it was from someone that I did not know. The account rep. verified the check for me!! I deposited it right then and notified the customer that the check would be accepted as payment. A week later I get a notice that the check bounced and they charged me a fee!! What good was it to verify the check...? I feel there is no longer any customer service at this credit union. I have had problem after problem since they changed to One Nevada. I am closing my account after 30 years!!

I've been in banking and finance for over 10 years, working closely on the front end and backend of banks and I have to say, this is by far the worst banking experience I have ever had. While most policies are in place for a reason, their logic and barriers are just absurd and their willingness to assist is beyond ridiculous. I would not recommend this bank to anyone and would highly suggest anyone using them find another banking partner. Having dealt with hundreds of banks over the years, I have never encountered such a horrible experience on all sides.

I'm glad to see One Nevada reads the reviews, I would like to see a reply of my review. I've been a member for six years. I needed to replace my car with a used car. The purchase price was $6,000 and I was putting down $2,000. On their denial letter it mentioned my 790 FICO score. Now some background about me, my income is $40,000 plus, my total debts (charge cards) are $5,000, not owed to One Nevada. So I applied on line to Capital One, they approved a $30,000 auto loan, which I didn't use. After this experience I had with One Nevada I withdrew $5,000+ from my savings & checking accounts. Now they have $5.01 in my savings & $11 in my checking, which to loan you.

This is by far the worst Credit Union ever!!   My mother and sister are on a joint account. My mother passed away and during the worst moment of our lives this piece of crap credit Union found a way to make it worse. My sister went into the branch to withdraw some money to help out with expenses and was told the account was put on a hold because my mom had a charge card with a balance. They would not let my sister withdraw some VERY much needed cash because they wanted to pay off the credit card first. There was no late payments on the account and there was no issues with her credit card. Because the credit card was in my Mom's name only they decided to keep all the money in their JOINT account and pay the credit card with it. I spoke with some real winner named Kathy and told her to let my sister take out the money she needs and I will pay the credit card in full when the bill arrives. She said ' We are not a bank and that's not how we do business"....Wtf!!!  I told her to just keep the money that's in the account and good luck getting the rest of the balance from me!!!   Heartless bastards!!!

It's too bad about the negative reviews. I am a new member and I used them for an auto loan recently. So, I don't really plan on banking much there but I did have to open a checking account in order to get a loan. The loan process itself was relatively smooth, quick and hassle free. I got an awesome 2.98 interest rate. Teresa Popp was my loan closer and she was very nice and friendly. She has been more than helpful.

I might see how the ATM only use could frustrate people, but I am not going to be using them much for that. However, I don't see the big deal. My main bank that I use, I do everything online and through ATM. Makes life easier that way. Who would want to go inside and deal with a teller all the time? Anyway..If you want a loan for something you should try them out, as I had a good experience.

The guy who opened my account made a mistake or lied AND left out pertinent information that ended up charging me $75 over 2 1/2 months. 

They don't switch the checking account to the cheaper checking account automatically after the trial period (lie/mistake). 

They failed to tell me that there are two different credit card charges. One that incurs a $10 fee each time even though I have money in my accounts. Some BS about manually transferring money between accounts which was never disclosed to me, ever.

I switched from Chase to a "less evil" credit union but the mega bank ended up costing me less.

Taking my money out.

The number of branches they have has gone down to one or two in Vegas.  Their customer service is non-existent.  I would say don't give them your business, but at the rate they are shrinking they won't be around much longer.

Still haven't needed to use customer service (and I'm honestly considering this a good thing) but I wanted to make a quick update for anyone looking into making the switch to One Nevada. In my experience, major banks can take pretty much forever to put a check through if they feel like it and you only have access to limited funds from the check. I've deposited my paychecks without any issue at One Nevada and once the deposit is approved (usually within hours on a weekday, understandably longer on the weekend) I have complete and total access to my money, which is really important to me as someone with a smaller income and a student loan to be paying off.

The main point for this update, though, is the efficiency with checks overall--I've deposited checks from Ebates and from relatives and I expected these to take much longer than my paychecks, which One Nevada is used to receiving from me, but sure enough I had the money from these checks ready and waiting for me within hours of using the mobile app to deposit them. I highly recommend the mobile app's deposit feature to anyone who has a smartphone and uses One Nevada, because it's simplified my finances so much.

I'm bumping my review up to five stars because I can't see a real reason for subtracting a star over customer service when I haven't NEEDED it at all. With Chase I was calling nearly once a month to clear up some unknown charge or order a new debit card, so this is a refreshing change of pace. Will be back to update again if I do have any issues, to let Yelp know how One Nevada handles it!

While I have had some helpful service representatives from this place...I swear I have the worst issues with my account. At this rate I am having so many needless issues that I could just go back to a major nationwide big bank! The point of the credit union switch was that they would be better with service and more for the customer. I have had issues with traveling and you guys freezing my accounts and not having a way for me to get a hold of anyone over weekends or holidays! The most recent thing over this weekend is that I, as usual made my paycheck deposit on Friday. It clearly shows it was processed just after 7am on Saturday morning, yet this time suddenly my funds are not available?! Wth?! It is the holidays people have shopping to do, and gas to put in their tanks, and even holiday traveling. I have never had this issue with my paycheck before being clearly processed but still showing pending! I was under the impression the first $100 of every check had to be released regardless, per federal law. My limits are at $1500, and my check always clears as soon as the bank processes it, so within the same day or before opening the next day. Now my account transactions and bill pays have gone haywire! In the new year it sounds like I should just say screw it and switch back to a real bank where I can call someone 24/7...instead of not even being able to put gas in my car or use my card until you all have someone in the office! Epitome of "banker's hours!"

I have been a member of Nevada Federal Credit Union for 21 years and only ever had ONE problem.  When the notice to change to One Nevada Credit Union came I was concerned with what changes would really impact its members once the board got its way.  The paperwork and newsletters that came were so clearly one sided, I knew there had to be a negative side that was being over shadowed.  I read each notice that came with caution and attention to the details.  When I had questions, I called to have them answered.  I decided to vote against the change due to the changes in the Member's Rights and Notices.  It was clear that this would no longer be a "Member's Credit Union."  I realized that most other members were likely to vote with the Board's advice to change and likely without reading the disclosures at all.  Now its members are starting to feel the results of change.  True enough and as I expected, the customer service has declined and the fees are on a steady increase.  I am saddened to say that this is no longer the credit union of choice.  Keep looking, there are other Credit Unions still out there with the original mindset of getting its members the maximum benefit at the lowest cost.  I am switching to one that has zero monthly fees, loan rates that are averaging 3% lower than One Nevada and it is still paying interest on their Checking and Savings accounts.  This is what this credit union used to be but I cannot recommend it anymore! :(
Cindy was very helpful and had a lot of patience assisting my parents and I! I recommend this branch very much!
The drive thru atm doesn't take cash deposits 80% of the time! A huge inconvenience! I am considering changing banks because of this reason.
Excellent location. Wonderful customer service. I am new to this credit union and I found them to be professional, kind and helpful!

Good bank if you make all deposits with a check. DON'T EVER deposit cash - as their machine can malfunction - and they will take " several days" before even looking at the case. 

Also, their customer service is very rude. When the banks has errors, they will not even apologize for the inconvenience. After several years of dealing with this credit union, and it's lack of respect for your money AND for the customer - I am closing my account. 

I no longer trust this bank with my money..  . and this is very sad, as I had high hopes for this group.

Awesome bank!!! They got my car refinanced, went from a 30% interest rate to a 7.9%. They did it fast and made it really easy. Krystin Grant was my banker and she was really great, she made me feel comfortable and at home while I was there. Thank you One Nevada you guys really made a difference in my life!!

I had the pleasure of being helped by Marco Wibowo. I had such a pleasant experience dealing with him. The customer service is top notch. He answered all my questions thoroughly. Not to mention I liked his tie. It really caught my eye. I will definitely be back. He told me that he is not always at this branch, I would travel all over the Valley for his excellent customer service. Thank you Marco for such a memorable experience.

I recently encountered Mr. Gray and he quickly displayed a complete lack of professionalism, immaturity, and a remarkably pompous attitude.  All of the accolades in the universe cannot compensate for Gray's disreputable behavior and utter lack of customer service skills.  With various options for insurance agents available in the Phoenix metropolitan area, I'd certainly suggest opting for an agent that exhibits professionalism, competence, as well as concern for his clients, in contrast to Mr. Gray.

After losing my fiancee in 2003 I relocated to Chandler. While at my desk one day the nicest man came in. I had just been looking for new insurance since the tragedy, so I knew this was divine intervention. Not only did I immediately get life, home & car insurance but i also got a new friend. Jeff Gray and his stellar team are amazing!! They truly care about YOU & YOURS!!! You can't go wrong with these with this extended family!!!

I have had my insurance with AmFam and Jeff Gray for over 10 years now. I recommend him and his services to all of my family and friends. The reasons that I stay with AmFam is because of Jeff and the outstanding customer service he provides. 9 years ago we had a tragic car accident in my family; Jeff was so personal and helped us through this nightmare of a time. You can imagine the hoops people have to go through when, we had no hoops and he treated us like we were his family! You can't always find that in companies like this.

I am not sure about the other two reviews, but like I have said I have been with Jeff for over 10 years and I am not going anywhere. You should give Jeff a try.

The tellers here are always the best. They are always happy and move super fast. 

I drive father than I need to just to come to this one.

I do all my business needs here. 


All around ATM thanks you.

I was visiting from out of town and the atm took my card. Within 3 hrs  Jose and Jessica had someone come out and physically remove my card so that my trip wouldn't be ruined. Thank you so much for the customer service!

I've been to this location at least 40 times. I have my mortgage with them. Every time you walked in you are greeted by a smiling face. The colors are extremely friendly. I haven't had a breath of an issue with anyone or this businesses practices.

I've got no complaints! They do everything the bank is supposed to do. Bank of America has been giving me problems with my account... So since I have my mortgage with Wells Fargo, I was thinking about switching to them anyway.

We just moved all.of our accounts to this bank.  They were very helpful in setting up a new business account and moving the rest of our personal accounts. Michael the bank president was great to work with, and I would recommend them to anyone.

A complete disaster. Every time I deposited cash, the teller asked me if I sold a car and if I said no, asked Where did I get the money. Anytime I took money out, they would ask what would I do with the money. IT'S NONE OF YOUR F****ING BUSINESS !!!!
Michael (manager at this location) treated me like a criminal when I closed my account. They were whispering to each other, made me wait for very long time to close the account. They insisted to issue cashier's check instead of giving cash. Complete bunch of JERKS !!!

This location is right next to my work and is incredibly convenient. 

I have been a member of this bank for 6+ years after converting from Satan's Lair (BofA). They are incredible as a banking establishment. I have been VERY happy with this company as a whole. Unfortunately my boyfriend handles the finances so I do not have the specifics on his experience (look for Seann C.) but we have adored them and they have gotten to know us personally at the Tempe location. 

They're knowledgeable, nice and do not take me for all that I have (low standards from my abuse at BofA). I am loyal and will stay until I potentially move from the state. :)

I would like to choose 3.5 stars.  It's pretty hit or miss, depending on what you need and who you get.

One thing I found out is their mobile app has a glitch on some people's iphones to where recent transactions don't appear in the "Pending" section under your account because there IS no Pending section.  This makes it hard to know your REAL balance.  This can cause erroneous NSF fees for which you can be reimbursed, IF you ASK and can email them your screen shots proving you are missing the Pending section.  Their IT Department is working on this.

My father died and I needed to transfer his IRA and I spent an hour trying to work out what to do. The woman I talked to spent 45 minutes on the phone with me sitting at her desk while she ignored me. I spoke to three people and the only one who said they were sorry for my loss was the manager who dropped by for 5 minutes to see why I was so upset. All-in-all, I hope none of you have to work with these people while you're in greif.

I had both my home and auto insurance quoted. As a person with essentially no claims against either policy, I was skeptical that I could save on my policy by making a switch. Actually, I saved hundreds, and the process was made extremely easy for me as a consumer.

Great company for transportation and insurance needs. They have made a couple airport pick ups for some of my friends and business associates. Their vehicles were clean and the driver was professional.  

I would recommend them for insurance and transportation. I look forward to doing more business with Lux in the future.

I'm all the way out in California, but I've met Ari and I'm impressed by his work, and his company.  He has great referrals to resources that can help you immediately.  His group also supplies you many great services, and they're top quality because of his dedication to create an experience for his customers!!!

I just want to complain the guy who came for  --- supposed to be ---  "service." He was rude from the beginning, as not listened to me, or communicate me (from the beginning - I know everything and you don't know anything attitude).  I explain why I want to change the tire (I do not feel safe to drive & handle is heavy) but he did not change. He was rude and not explain well why he did not change.  SO, I would like to complain his attitude and tried to write down the name and ID#.  He hide the ID in the pocket. I tried to see the number and tried to pulled the ID from the pocket, he shouted at me "DON'T TOUCH ME," even I do not touch him at all. He states "YOU KNOW, I'M NOT GONNA CHANGE THE TIRE & I CALL BOSS.  Why did he need to hide the ID?... I believe if he did nothing wrong, he can show me his ID. He also called the company to complain about me with the twisted story, such as "she grabbed me," "she said -  do not change the tire," but no word about I was trying to see his ID. Besides, he states to the dispatcher "put a note that this customer is rude" in front of me.  I used more than a couple times AAA road service but never had this kind of rude guy. I've never complain their service even waiting for a long time under AZ heat in the summer (one time I waited for 2 hours).  I liked the service before but anymore. He was totally jerk.

I have been a member of AAA since 1993.  I gave my wife and each one of my children and membership.  We have used it periodically for different issues, from saving my daughter nasty snow storm to unlocking cars. I can truly say that having that card available and someone on the other end of the phone has been money well spent. 

I recently had to have my car towed twice due to mechanical problems. Both times the drivers were courteous, friendly and very helpful. 

I can't thank you enough for being there during a time in need.  That little card in my wallet is a real large serving of peace of mind. 

Thank you

After buying my first used car in 5 years, I looked up third party mvd locations (I hate going to the mvd, long lines and a huge wait usually) and found out that this AAA location could assist me in transferring the title, registration, etc. After picking up the car, I went straight to this location. Colleen Winkler assisted me in getting everything transferred over, gave me my new plate and tags, and I even signed up for AAA. I was in and out in 20 minutes tops, with everything I needed. She was SO pleasant and talked me through everything. Thank you, Colleen, for making my exciting day of getting a car even better. I will tell everyone I know to come here!
First time I have used AAA to make my vacation plans. Amanda was fabulous, everything was taken care of including the reservation for the rental car. Will be using AAA again.

ring ring ring... hi. aaa az? am i in a safe location, yes, in the parking lot. oh where? at kohl's in Chandler, crossroads, ummm.... hmmm wait a sec. Oh ok Arizona Ave and I think WIllis rd. Its by the 202 Santan freeway.... how long will it take, an hr? color car... well that's a toughie, it's a pathfinder and sometimes it seems silver and other times it's champagne... but maybe silver with a tinge of brown, no, it's not brown... it's silver-ish. Ok i'll wait... toodles!

yea that's my usual dialogue... I am an example that shouldn't be... I play up the stereotype that gay boys are unable to change the tire, i do try and i do know but hell... i don't like my hands to get dirty and plus what's the point of having AAA plus if i can't use that 100 mile towing to tow me to a discount tire to get my tires replaced and checked?

I love aaa arizona for my roadside assistance, for my towing, getting my batterty charged up, or tire changed... it's awesome. Not I'm not useless nor am I helpless I just believe that if you have the funds and want some peace of mind aaa arizona provides such a service. I also love my membership gets me discounts at certain places and since I don't have a gold card it looks good in my wallet!

Great for a jump or flat tire change, but be wary.
If you need a tow, they give you five miles for free, each mile thereafter will cost you five dollars a mile.
That is... unless you signed up for the premium, super duper elitist package. 
Then you get one hundred miles of towing for free.
Good to know when your truck breaks down on the way to Vegas, and you need a tow to Wickenburg....sixty miles, ahem, make that three hundred dollars away.

The other thing no one tells you when you sign up is how your wait time will be in the two hour range for a flat or a jump.
That is, unless you signed up for the......

AAA
Another would-be roadside samaritan who's succumbed to the corporate, classe system.
Bullshit, but it's better than sitting on the side of the road crying in your coffee mug.
I called for a tow at 7:20. They quoted me 15 minutes and got there at 9:20. I was 2 hours late for work. Fail! I am going to call my insurance company and get towing through them.

Awful experience with AAA. Flat tire. The tow truck driver overtightened the lug nut, stripping the threads on the tire stem. So it's off to the tire shop where they have to cut the tire stem off just to remove the spare. Then, off to another auto repair where they replace the tire stem. Then, back to the tire shop. So far, I'm not angry - it's just a mistake. Next , I file a claim for reimbursement and two weeks later a guy calls from AAA and leaves a message with no information about why he's calling. I don't hear from him again, so I send an email to membership services last night at 1:30am (working late for a big project today) and then 7:20am this morning he calls - to verify my address! This can't wait till after 8am? Seriously, after a month of waiting for my reimbursement, you've gotta call me at 7:20am to verify my address? the SAME address that's on my membership profile, my claim, and all the documentation submitted with the claim? And you couldn't mention in your first voice mail message that this was the purpose of your call?   
I didn't get upset with the bungled job changing the flat tire, but the call this morning to verify my address at 7:20am put me over the edge. My girlfriend didn't get to sleep till after 2am because I was working late, and then this joker calls at 7:20am with a routine address-verification question. 
I've got AAA  Roadside Assistance and I've got Geico Roadside Assistance. Guess which one I'll be cancelling? One flat tire should not be this much trouble.

The culture of service is amazing at AAA Glendale office. From the moment I walked in I was greeted in a friendly way, made comfortable, helped to pick out travel books, and assisted by Deb Stauffer to make complicated travel plans. I returned a couple of days later to pick up EuroRail tickets and make more plans, and same thing...over the top friendliness and courtesy by everyone in the office. I wish more companies had this kind of culture. It makes dealing with them a pleasure. I strongly recommend membership and taking advantage of the many services it offers from a group of trained, friendly and professional staff.

It's been 3 hours and I'm still waiting for someone to come. I've called to ask where they are a few times and they have been unable to reach the service that agreed to come to my assistance and YET they still are not sending a different service.

If you're planning a trip anywhere- USA, Europe, Asia.... Make this AAA office your first stop! 
Make an appt w Gene, and he will help guide you through all the details, and offer great advise, and knowledge of flights, hotels and trains.
There are many wonderful travel related items for sale, wallets, socks, wine bags, and Purses just to name a few.  Theresa at the front desk helped suggest some necessary travel items.
You will be helped by all of their friendly advise, and travel knowledge! So thankful that we have AAA membership.

so, as an auto owner, i've had nothing but good experiences with AAA, from Georgia to NM to California to Mass, and back home to AZ, never a problem. 

it's the travel department that nearly screwed us for our wedding. way back when, we looked into destination weddings with a AAA AZ branch. our rep always said "i'm looking into it, i'll call you tomorrow" and then a week later, i'd call to ask what the hold up was and was met by the same thing. a month passes by and we find out that rep was fired. 

so we've got plenty of time and decide to go to a different AAA AZ branch, the one on Glendale Ave. We were greeted with smiles and elations by their travel rep who said she had a great deal of experience with destination weddings and she would handle EVERYTHING to make our experience hassle free and a joy to remember. said she did the same trip (although not for a wedding) for a group of friends every year, so she "knew what she was doing". things went sour from there. 

we hardly EVER received return phone calls on time. all the guests we invited that were to book through this AAA branch never received phone calls back. so every-single-one of our guests did their own booking with the hotel and airlines....not just 1-2 guests, all of them. and when we pressed her about this, it was always "oh, my system crashed" or "oh, my phone wasn't working"....come on!

fast forward to a week before our trip departure...for our wedding and honeymoon. still no word from the AAA rep. Three days before, we FINALLY get confirmation. you want to see stressed? how about a bride and groom having to wait till the last minute to find out if all their rooms and flights were booked after paying everything up front?

but the proverbial icing on the cake? we were advised to have our invitees "donate" a wedding gift to our wedding through the AAA travel website. that way, those guest that couldn't attend could still give us something and at the end, we'd get a check. 

unfortunately, it wasn't that easy. at no point were we informed that 10% of "donations" would be kept by AAA. furthermore, my now wife has had to make numerous calls to the AAA office to actually get our wedding "donation" check. it was always "they're cutting the check today"...a week later...."they're cutting the check today", etc. 

to summarize, i'll keep my AAA for cars only. their travel department was probably one of the most unprofessional, unorganized, and untimely departments i've ever had to deal with. we would've saved ourselves a boat load of stress by doing it ourselves.

Thank you thank you thank you!!!

I've had AAA roadside service for two years now, and before today I (luckily) never had to use it. On the way home from running errands today, we got a flat tire in the middle of rush hour on the northbound 51, near Thomas. 

It's not the best stretch of highway under the best conditions, but at 4:30 when it's 111 out, no thanks!! I called AAA and not only were they there within 20 minutes, but the technician brought us cold bottled water and got the spare tire on at lightening speed. 

Nobody wants to have to call for help, but it's great to know I have such good service waiting for me if need be.

Why oh why is there not more emphasis on AAA Discounts?  Went to the Glendale office for Disneyland passes and left with a 2-night stay at the Disneyland resort.  Had looked this up whilst planning the trip to CA and decided that the price didn't justify staying there, over another, local hotel (there are PLENTY of them, in Anaheim!).  Overall (between tickets and hotel), my AAA Travel guy saved me $800 (2 adults and 3 kids).  Sold!

Thank you for responding Leonard.  I sent many letters out to various people including Arizona department of insurance.  AAA headquarters got in touch with me and I think we will be able to resolve my issue.  I will change my review as soon as I get some resolve.

Very nice AAA office in the Safeway shopping center. I never noticed it before and it's huge when you go inside. 

I stopped in to get an international drivers license for an upcoming trip. 

Very friendly staff that can take care of most travel needs. They also do vehicle registration/license plates at this office. They don't do drivers licenses though. 

There is also a large retail section that has everything from luggage tags to luggage sets. Travel books galore and everything in between. 

They took my photos for my IDL and I was in an out pretty quickly. I love being a AAA member!

I am very disappointed in AAA. I have been a member for over 17 years but that ended today! I believe their auto renewal "service" without your permission is at the very least deceptive and most likely fraudulent.

I flew in from Washington, went to my house, and headed to the golf course.  Unfortunately my van wouldn't start.   How could this be?  My son had just purchased a battery for the van from AAA several weeks before, so I called AAA and they had someone out in 10 minutes.  He checked the battery, and the charging system, and everything seemed all right.  He then checked the battery again, and found that there was a dead cell.

He replaced the battery with no questions asked, and apologized for the dead battery.  He was very professional throughout, and definitely knew what he was doing.  

And I did get to the golf course in time.  What more could you ask!!  Five stars definitely.

I find AAA to be one of the best decisions I've ever made as an auto owner. Top notch customer service with no frustrations thus far and I'm a member for the last 5 years. Highly recommend them to everyone.

I needed an International Drivers License.  Stopped in and was helped promptly and they even did the photos without having to pay to get them done at CVS or Walgreens!
Help was great.

I've been a member of aaa since 1984 with cal state aaa and az aaa I haven't used roadside assistance much. Unfortunately when I need az aaa they let me down. All they seem to do is send out requests to upgrade or do add ons. I figured since I'm in the 6 largest city in the USA  plus service would be good enough. Apparently maybe if I was in the premiere group I wouldn't be sitting on a neighborhood sidewalk for more than an hour and a half. It's sad because I'm about a mile from the corp hq on cback and 24.

This is a fantastic location, especially because of Teresa M! She is so friendly, helpful and knowledgeable. I went in for travel information and came out with some great products and travel information. Teresa really took the time to educate me on both services and products. Will return to this location for other things because of the great service I received!

I was satisfied with the service I got from AAA. I thought I locked my keys in my car and called them right away. They were so fast getting back to me and sending someone to help, but I did eventual find out that I had my keys with me the whole time and when I called them back about that they were not upset and just happy I was able to get into my car safely.

I went into the East Glendale office to get a new Title, Registration and License Plate and also to get a duplicate Title.  I was greeted immediately upon entering the office and was signed into the computer system.  I waited only a couple minutes before being greeted again by the person doing automobile titles, etc.  I received all my required and requested paperwork and license plate very quickly.  I was very pleased with the service, cost and convenience and will return for other services in the future.

This place has all kinds of agents in one office; travel agency, auto, home insurance, motor vehicle services, international drivers license, etc . . . Its a one stop shop. 
If you're shopping for insurance just ask for Anthony and he will be able to help you very efficiently.

Very polite and welcoming on the phone when I inquired if they had a notary and could do passport pictures.  Receptionist very helpful and friendly.  Notary service and photos done quickly and efficiently, by another excellent employee.  An A+ experience in terms of courtesy and helpfulness.

UPDATE:. After all the headache detailed below, I did finally speak with an individual who was able to fix my membership quickly and efficiently.  Finally someone who knew what they were doing!  And then I received a call from a supervisor or manager, who had read my post here and reviewed all of my calls to customer service. She listened to my complaint again and also compensated us for all the trouble.  I do appreciate when a company is willing to reach out and try to make things right so I have changed my rating from a 1 to a 3.  I do believe they need to better train some of their employees so hopefully this type of situation can be avoided in the future.  END OF UPDATE

This review is not about a particular location, but about AAA Arizona member services. 

I had been a AAA member since 1996.  Yes, 20 years!  Those 20 years were with AAA Southern New England.  When we moved to Arizona in May, I contacted AAA about transferring my membership.  Ended up having to call 2 different numbers and talked to 3 different people.  I was assured it would be no problem, although i couldn't exactly transfer it.  I had to give them all my info again for them to set up the AZ membership.  So I did, including my credit card info for the automatic renewal.  I explained that my current membership was set to end June 30.  No problem, I was told.  The AZ membership would take over then.  I get temp membership cards emailed to me.  I email back because the dates make no sense.  No response.  Then I get a bill in the mail, which makes no sense because it's telling me to pay by a date 3 weeks prior.  I go online and I see it says auto renewal.  I call again.  Yep, you're all set.  You can ignore that bill.  Your payment will be charged to your card on July 1.  Get another bill a few weeks later.  Still dates make no sense.  I call again, and told the same thing.  Ignore the bill.  Your cc will be billed July 1 and then your new cards will be sent.  You should get them 3rd week of July.  I ask...even though they'll be effective July 1, I won't have.  Yes, but it's no problem, they can just look up your membership to verify it.  Well now it's July 30 and still no cards.  So I try to log in and check my membership.  My membership number is no longer valid!   WTF!!!!   Checked my credit card statement, and I guess the bright spot is no charge either so at least I'm not paying for nothing.  But WTF!!!!   On Monday, I will be going to the local office and speaking with w human being face-to-face.  And  depending on the service I get here will determine if I renew my membership.  20 years!  5 phone calls and not a single person seems to know what they're doing because after 20 years, my membership that I was assured had been transferred, has actually been cancelled.

AAA Arizona offers excellent customer service. I had a dead battery and the field technician came out right away. Their customer service representatives offer genuine service. You can tell this organization supports employee development. They don't black nail their employees. The customer service quality shows in the training and resources the organization provides. Both of the field technicians were wonderful to work with. They came out right away and resolved my inquiry in a timely manner. I'm very proud to be a AAA customer and member. Thank you so much for a wonderful experience.

Amazing service out of the gate from Rose Bergeron. She was quick to understand what I was there for, and was able to very quickly find the solution to the problem and got me in and out of there within a very few minutes. Very impressed with her and her willingness to make sure I was a very pleased customer.

Thanks Rose! & Thanks AAA Arizona!

My car had some issues on the way home from the airport today.  I called AAA and they were on it!!  They asked a few questions about my safety and really did care.  I had the tow truck there in just a few minutes.  Wish I would have gotten the name of our tow truck driver.  HE WAS SUPER NICE!  He greeted me with a cold water which was very nice. He dropped my Jeep off at Big O Tires (my choice).  If you are on the fence and not sure if you should have AAA I 100% recommend it!

****************** SO SO VALUE *********************************

When my membership is up, next May ....... its Adios.
I used their jump-start service, this past July ........ Great Service ..... No Complaints.

*************** WHY WILL I BE DROPPING THEM ??? ***********************
I don't need your mapping service ..........Got GPS'S in both cars.
I don't need your travel service ............... You're ALWAYS more expensive.
I don't need your Motel service ................ I'm using coupon books from truck stops.
I don't need your Auto Insurance ........... You're EXPENSIVE....I do better on my own.
I don't need your jump-starts ............ I bought portable jump start units.
    FOR FLATS & TOWING ...... I'll add it to my auto coverage.

I'm not sure what the towing benefit, on my insurance ......... will cost.
                 Thus, at this moment ........ its not a done deal.

AAA responded to my review ....... click on the below link.
****It reads as ..........an  AAA COMMERICAL ...... the above is based on******** 
                            REAL LIFE EXPERIENCES WITH AAA

I am so happy to have AAA. They have been a total life saver on more than one occasion. They will tow your car. Bring you gas, change a flat tire, and jump  start your car. Once i even purchased a battery from them and  their mobile van service. You can also get trip tiks, discounts on travel and many more items. Certain restaurants will give you a discount with your triple A card.. hard Rock anywhere in the country for one. This is something i think everyone should have. It is a life saver.

I eventually got the help i was looking for after i had to advocate for it pretty determinedly... Front desk woman gave me limited amount of literature, sold me $50 in books and tried to shoo me out door. I explained i called ahead and expected to be able to discuss my trip with a planner. They acted like that was a very complicated request and told me they don't take appointments which i know to be untrue. I waited for the planner (which they tried to talk me out of). The trip planner told me i needed to tell her step by step which points of interest i wanted to see on my trip while i was there to discuss which route to take and what each route offered. It was incredibly exhausting trying to navigate continuous road blocks to the service you have repeatedly expressed needing. I ultimately got the service i was requesting despite the woman telling me she doesn't "deal in campgrounds". Frustrated - i shouldn't have to convince service people to provide their service.
