Tell me how you CAN help me not how you CAN'T.

My AAA membership is so worth it! Their roadside assistance has been a boon quite a few times for me - flat tire on two occasions, dead battery on another two occasions. Calling for assistance was easy, the people I dealt with on the phone and on the road were very courteous, and the roadside assistance guys arrived in reasonable time and performed the needed services very efficiently.

I was thoroughly impressed w my CPA. Charles Mason was very knowledgeable and quick with all my accounting needs. I felt very at home with this practice and CPA. He did my business and personal tax returns and I will continue to use him.
I Use my Chase~ ink card & my CAHSE ;)freedom)". Card For all my Purchases On Yelp N the staff at Chase Banking centers are always so Freindly N Help with all my Banking needs.

The tellers were super knowledgeable, helpful and friendly. The only reason I came to this branch was to get an on the spot debit card. I was told by 2 different branches that the Apache & Rural location is the only location in the valley that can make you a debit card on the spot. 

I wasn't trying to be nosey, but I couldn't help but overhear another customer in crisis because her account had been hacked through a Home Depot transaction. The Chase banker was able to resolve the issue on the spot and bring the customer's anxiety down.

Good job Chase!
I needed insurance for a house that was closing in 3 hours. Patrick was not only fast, but got me the right coverage at an affordable price. I would highly recommend Hassett Insurance

Patrick totally rocks!  I have my car and renter's insurance with him.  I'm pretty high maintenance wanting things to get done extra quickly.  Patrick always responded to me and had answers for me.  It was a painless switch  :)

5 stars for a 5 star business!

Patrick really enjoys what he does and it shows in his Business. He takes care of his clients as well as ours in providing a myriad of insurance options at the best available price. He is always very responsive and willing to answer questions. If you have any insurance need, don't hesitate to call Hassett Insurance, you will not regret it!

Patrick is hands down the best insurance agent out there. I called him on a Thursday night to see if he could bundle my auto, my wifes auto and our renters insurance together to make it cheaper for us. By Friday he had everything set up, quoted us a cheaper rate than we were already paying and we were good to go. He isn't contracted through any specific insurance company so he can get quotes from multiple different companies in order to find you the cheapest rate. Don't hesitate to give Patrick a call!

Patrick is the best in the business. He does shop for the best option. Then when it comes up for renewal, he shops again to get you the best deal for your money. He is honest, fair, transparent, and exceeds in the customer experience. I highly recommend having Patrick evaluate your situation.
Patrick helped me with some insurance a little while back.  The guy is  really good at what he does. Friendly courteous, always reachable and he'll save you money!
Always the best service.  Been coming here forever and top notch crew.  Keep it up and keep your employees happy.

The process was quick and painless. The guy who talked to me first was abrupt but not rude. He called for a woman named Trinity who was very nice and showed sympathy to my almost week long cold. She didn't try to up sell anything and was very pleasant.

There wasn't any frills, I didn't receive any thorough explanations about where my money was going (there wasn't any proof that my money went into an account it just kinda disappeared. I went to the ATM and got a statement to prove it was actually in there!) The best part about it was the option for free checking and the option to exempt yourself from overdraft protection which I LOVE.

Went in yesterday to set up an account and Irene was fantastic. You can tell she enjoys her job and that she really cares about her customers. After I deposited my cash she noticed my checks that I didn't give her to deposit..  She asked if I wanted to deposit those as well. I really appreciated her awareness that I was slacking in

Lauren is awesome. She stayed late with us tonight when we rudely showed up at 5:58 p.m., two minutes before closing, to sign some papers. Five stars.

The employees at this branch are very friendly and helpful. Generally young and energetic. The member focused, non profit, orientation of the credit union really shines through here. Five stars.

The only negative? No drive thru at this branch. One star. There is, however, an ATM out front you can use if you don't mind getting out of your car.

If you're not familiar with credit unions in general, they can be a good alternative to big banks for individual consumers. They will make you open a $25 minimum savings account to become a member, kind of silly, but it's something the regulators require. They're non profit, but they still have to cover the cost of salaries, rent, computers... Still, there's a chance they may offer better deposit and loan rates than the big banks. Sometimes they're not as efficient, or lag in adoption of technology, but they usually make up for it with friendlier, less adversarial service. Not a bad trade off.

I had to reduce the rating of this location DRASTICALLY......here is why. I originally came here 8 months ago for an original car loan and was denied despite the fact I have 3 accounts here. I was told I didn't have enough "Car Credit History" despite the fact that I have AWESOME credit and have been doing business with these people since 2010. So I tried to be understanding because I was told to come back in 6 months and they would refinance my loan. I decided to wait for 8 months.....walked in with my even MORE AWESOME CREDIT SCORE......and 8 ON TIME payments towards my new Jeep Patriot. So after filling out the application.....running my credit and even receiving a glowing comment from the manager of this location.....I was still DENIED. Reason being is because they wanted to see a year's worth of payments toward my new Jeep......WHATTTTTTTT? It seems funny to me that I can afford to pay close to 2500 bucks for the first 8 months but I can't pay about 1200 over the next 4......hmmmm. I even have more money in my 3 accounts combined to just pay the 1200 up front if that truly was the issue. 

So needless to say I was extremely disappointed and I will be closing all of my Desert Schools accounts and taking my money to a Credit Union that can ACTUALLY help me. Eat, Drink, and be Merry my Friends!!!!!

Yes, it is a bank but it is my neighborhood bank that has fast friendly services. Besides teller service they offer all banking services to meet your needs. 

This location is on the corner of 7th Street and Glendale. Across from Walgreens. There is plenty if parking and a drive thru for quick access to your cash. 

Majority of the time I have used the services for drive thru but I have had the opportunity to stop in several times and met with the friendly staff. Never had any problems only to receive outstanding customer service.

Worst bank branch in Phoenix! The tellers are rude and the assistant manager has no customer service skills. They'll charge the $3 ATM fee to use their ATM, but then they wont change a single $20 for a roll of quarters! At least give me a kiss next I'm getting f*$#ed.

I just want to post how grateful I am after using so many other banks. I don't have overdraft protection with them because I don't want it. So with U.S. Bank, when I run out of money in my account I just start using my credit card from them. I never have overdraft charges now ever!!! I probably have been charged $300 or more from other banks because I would make a mistake in calculations and the banks would be merciless. I will never change banks. Ty U.S. Bank for being the best bank I've ever had. You rock!!

Not the greatest costumer service. I have not had many good experiences at this particular branch. When in a hurry the last thing I need to do is wait for 10 mins in the drive through for someone to even come to the window. If it wasn't for the fact that I had my small child in the car and I had already sent my transaction over I would have left. This is just one of the bad experiences I have had here. This was just the one that caused me to make the decision to change banks.
Pam and everyone at the bank are very nice and provide great service. Have been there for 15 years and never have had any issues with the service. Highly recommend

Express bail bonds made my process extremely easy. Couldn't be happier with their work. Whoever needs a ball bond call them!! They'll take amazing care of you, you will not be disappointed in the slightest.

I'm in Las Vegas and unfortunately I had to find a local bail bond service for a situation that my son in law is in.  I'm very happy to so the staff at Express bail bonds was extremely helpful and we're able to explain in detail about how the bail bond process works here and gave me a very good time line so I was able to handle the situation and we did everything right over the phone.  Thanks Express
I know these guys take great care of thier customers.  Great choice for bail bonds!  They are polite, understanding, and fair.  This is a family run operation, not some heartless corporation.

Great staff! Very helpful and understanding. Had to get my buddy pretty early in the morning and I had a flight to catch. They made it as quick and painless as possible. Never thought I would need this but they were great!

I never had to bail somebody out before and heard about Express Bails Bonds through a couple friends who have used them and told me they would make it a very simple process and it was exactly what my friends told me and more! The staff made it.. Very easy, friendly, and walked me through the whole process of what needed to be done!! Thank you express!!

I unfortunately had to bail a friend out of jail a few months ago, and it was not a pleasant experience. I called Express around midnight and the guy on the phone (forgot his name) was very helpful and accommodating. The bail was a lot more than I had anticipated, and he told me I could pay half up front and then pay the balance later. Then he told me to come on down to their office located on Charleston and Casino Center. 

I arrived close to 1am and filled out all of the required paperwork, then paid half of the money as was discussed. I was then told that the bail would be taken right to the jail and posted, so I would be able to pickup my friend at 9am the next morning. Since I had never done this before, I trusted him and went home assuming everything would be taken care of. 

When morning came, over 6 hours later, I called the jail to verify that the bail was posted and they told me it wasn't. I called Express right away and the same guy told me that the runner had already dropped off the money and the bail was posted. "We have a receipt and everything." He told me. I figured maybe it took some time to process, so I trusted what he said. An hour later I called the jail again and was told no dice. Express still stuck with their story and I was getting nowhere, so I decided to drive down to the jail myself and find out what was going on. 

When I arrived at the jail, I was told that the runner had just gotten there, and the paperwork was not correct so the bail was not accepted. The runner was told to go back to the office and redo it. I was beside myself! They had not previously been there as I was told before, they were just now showing up after 9am. A good 8 hours since I first dropped off the money! I was pissed off and angry that I was lied to. Also the cutoff time to post bail was 8am, so my friend was not able to get out until 9pm. He had to spend an extra 12 hours in jail because of this incompetent company. 

I ended up calling and using another company, who posted my friends bail right away without any money up front. He was finally released after 9pm. I returned to Express the following day to pickup my money and I expressed my frustrations to the guy who was working the morning shift. He seemed genuinely concerned to hear about my situation, but there was nothing he could do at that point. If you need to bail someone out of jail, do yourself a favor and stay far away from this company.
Best bail bonds company in the world. Their staff is not only extremely good looking, they give the best service. I would recommend this place to everybody and anybody in need of getting out of jail.

We all fear a day that we would ever become accused of a crime or be arrested.whether it is a unpaid ticket or a felony you don't want to be incarcerated.
The process can be confusing but this company help me get my dad out of jail they were really professional  and fast to assist and easy to work with.
Give them a call if you ever in a situation like mine-you'll be glad you did.

If I could rate my brother he would get zero stars for being a knucklehead.  Fortunately the folks at Express Bail Bonds helped his situation and got him back home safely and quickly.  Thanks again and hopefully will not be back soon.

Express Bail Bonds is the place to go when you need help fast. Went to Las Vegas with my two sisters. One got a little out of control and ended up in Jail. I called Express and they helped her get out quick. Very friendly staff, answered all my questions, and calmed us as we were upset. I would recommend them to anyone. Thank you Express Bail.
They guys are awesome!  I live out of town and they were great with helping my son out and communicating with me so I understood the process.  I highly recommend this place!

I had a wonderful customer experience with Swimmer Insurance Agency.  A human being answers the phone, no long menu to navigate.  Matt Frazier was top notch to work with directly.  He's available and happy to help.  He made insurance easy for me.  Matt is personable, knowledgeable and has integrity.  Matt wants to build a relationship with his clients and if you should have a claim, you'll be glad you have Matt on your side.  I highly recommend this agency for ALL your insurance needs including your business insurance needs!

Swimmer insurance has been very helpful in helping my family procure life insurance. They were there every step, from calculating how much coverage my wife and I needed to making sure the policy is with a reputable firm. Excellent one on one personal attention.

Fullers tax service is my yearly go to guys and gals for my taxes. I have been using them for over 15 years for personal taxes and my complicated business taxes. They know all the right answers and always get back to you with your questions. 
Their office is conveniently located right off the us 60 and stapley, I just think they need a better parking lot or a drive thru perhaps!!! Support your local family run business and get the job done right.

Fuller Tax Service is top notch.  Aaron has assisted me with taxes for the last 7 years.  While I have only had the pleasure of working with Aaron, I can honestly say he is trustworthy, reliable, patient, and professional.  Aaron has always made himself available for questions, concerns, and is always looking out for the customers best interest.  The service I received has been so memorable that I was concerned when I moved to Utah I would have to find another accountant.  Lucky for me, Fuller Tax Service has the ability to fulfill my service even though I live in Utah. I would recommend this company to all my friends and family!!
First time in a few years that I had a painless experience having my taxes done! What a relief so happy to have found Adam at Fuller tax.Definately recommend them.would give more stars If I could:)
I have used Fuller's tax service for 10yrs and love them! They are very quick and get you the best return possible
Fantastic customer service!!! Opened the door for me, got me a water and the teller was super friendly not to mention good looking ;) haha!!!

Made to wait 15 minutes in first position in line because the teller wanted to flirt with a customer. They were understaffed at the time. The only reason I was in there was because the ATM outside was broken. The building was empty.

This Wells Fargo location is amazing! I've been in here twice and both times were great. All the employees are very friendly and professional and don't try to sell or rush you at all when helping you. I definitely will be returning to this location as needed.
I love the customer service here. They process patrons through the lines quickly. They lost a star because of the horrid parking situation.
Howard was my first client when I started in the title industry 11 years ago.   He is still s client, which shows his dedication and loyalty.  He gives 100% to his clients.  I highly recommend him.
Fantastic group of people! They helped me with a loan and were the most responsive group of mortgage folks I have ever worked with! They were so awesome that I moved in 2.5 weeks early. Thanks!

We had an excellent experience buying our home in Chandler recently, and Nova home loans was a big part of that.  I am so amazed at how much can be taken care of electronically, and we never met the staff in person or had to go to the office, but I wish we had.

Chris Callen is amazing and the nicest person ever.  They need to make sure she doesn't get away.  I called her early in the process with a question and then she got to listen to me vent about things that were only tangent issues, but she was very patient and funny.  Hey....buying a home is stressful, but Chris, Carly, and Colleen made it a pleasure.

We received frequent email updates with figures and status updates of where our loan was in the process.  And then today I got home, still very much in the process of moving, and had just moved the pets over which can be very stressful for them and me.  And then the ding dang doorbell rings and it's some dude trying to sell me Dish TV and ADT home security.  Now, this is one enterprising young man, but I am not interested in either of those products and had to say "No" about 7 times before he would mosey on down the road.  

I looked down and saw a UPS package by the door.  Lo and behold it was a gift from Nova thanking us and welcoming us to our new home.  Two Tiffany champagne flutes.  Very nice.  I feel bad that we generally only drink cheap booze, but maybe this time I'll splurge to break in those glasses.  I can't say thank you enough...Thank you!

Definitely recommend Justin Oliver and his team. I had a smooth transition throughout the entire process. I was always informed and contacted immediately with answers to my concerns and questions. I was recommended to Justin Oliver and his team through my realtor. I could not be more grateful. If you have your ducks lined up in a row and are serious about rolling up your sleeves and getting things done in order to get into your home, Nova Home loans is ready for you. They work just as hard to get your approved and loan approved ready, but you need to put in the work to gather all the information they need. Trust their judgment because they are working for you and they want to see you realize your dreams of owning your home. Highly recommend and will use them in the future. I have recommended my family and friends who are looking to get into their own home.

Ryan and Fabian are at the top of their game.  Their responsiveness, industry knowledge, organization and professionalism was outstanding.  I will most certainly recommend them to my colleagues and friends and will use them again for investment property.

Terrible experience with these guys. Specifically the loan processor Fabian. He made a mistake because he misunderstood something (not a big deal, happens to the best of us), but then he refused to return calls for days while he tried to figure out what to do. It was like he knew he messed up and didn't know what to do so he panicked and cut all communication. During that time he gave incorrect information to the people we were trying to purchase a house from which caused them to panic and ultimately pull of out the deal. The correct information was presented to him several times throughout the process and he just didn't seem to understand it. Granted, it was a bit of a complicated situation but that doesn't mean it shouldn't have been worked out. Fabian just did seem to understand very much nor give much effort into solving the problem. Overall I felt our experience with this company was very negative and unprofessional. I can't speak much for the rest of their team, just specifically their loan processor.

Do not use their ATM

Attempted to withdraw $ for a bike cab when in Phoenix using my bank's card. Their ATM proceeded to charge me the withdraw amount plus $3 but game me no money. When calling the branch to ask for ATM reconciliation, nobody picks up the phone. If anybody has been to downtown Phoenix during the day, they would know only people at conferences are walking around that section of town so I couldn't imagine who they would be helping. After getting routed to their 800 line several times and being told to only the branch or my bank could start that process I decided to give them the ol "call repeatedly until someone picks up." After about 30+ tries, I reached a girl who told me only the phone support number could start this process. Explained to her that several agents had told me the branch had to start this process and ask to be introduced during a transfer to someone who could help. Guess what? I was just sent to the start of the 800 menu again. Was not able to reach anybody after another 10 calls, I gave up defeated but still victorious. Victorious in the fact I don't have a bank account with these unresponsive a holes. Would never consider opening an account with any BofA after my experience with this branch and will be sure tell others to heed my warning.  Thank FSM for local banks!!

Very unprofessional and rude employees. Bank of america is already a terrible financial institution, but the lack of knowledge and respect for customers tops it off. Strongly recommend Chase. Steer clear of this BOA location and the institution all together.

(Update: I guess I was getting too noisy, because my mortgage was dumped onto another lender so I don't have any more recourse. Do not do business with these liars and thieves.)

I was offered a loan modification, were misinformed about process and our payment was increased instead of reduced. Caused us to file for bankruptcy.

One year after I bought my house, I received a notification that there was a mistake with escrow the way my mortgage was written, and that my payment was increasing by nearly $200. This was not something I was capable of doing, I signed a specific mortgage to make a specific payment. So, in 2010 I applied for and was considered for a loan modification, after signing on with a third party agent who failed to perform any of his duties and forced us to file a lawsuit, we contacted BofA directly who finally claimed to get the unfinished paperwork processed and started the modification process.

The first packet we receive for our three month "trial" period stated a new payment that was an INCREASE of approximately $300. I called specifically about this and arranged an in-person meeting with one of their loan modification specialists at one of their corporate centers in my home city of Phoenix. I was assured every time that this increase in payment would not be permanent and it was a direct result of being behind on my payments. I reluctantly accepted this, and forced my way through the further burden on my finances. 

After my three month trial period, I received my final paperwork. Contrary to everything I was assured by every level of employee at Bank of America I could contact, the $300 increase was, in fact, permanent. Managers I contacted to complain behaved as if they were doing me a favor because despite the $300 increase, the months I was behind were being forgiven.

So, they were basically telling me I could accept the new payment and be forced to file for bankruptcy, or deny the new payment program and face foreclosure instead.

In doing this, Bank of America caused me to file for Bankruptcy in order to keep my house. And were thoroughly unapologetic and unwilling to correct this injustice.

It has been over a year now, and we have just completed our Bankruptcy and had the case closed. What do I receive in the mail? A statement from Bank of America saying I owe late fees on my mortgage payment (approximately $250) that they refuse to correct, which was a direct result of removing our mortgage from their Bankruptcy department and failing to inform us of doing so. Then, I was sent (via overnight FedEx) a packet that they claimed I requested for a Loan Modification.

When we called to complain, we were told that this was just "mass mail". Not only is overnight FedEx not mass mail and clearly a lie, their records should show more than clearly that I had been thoroughly through a "Loan Modification" program with them previously. This is a gross misappropriation of funds and just further evidence of their negligence and abuse toward their customers.

A letter of complaint was written onto their Facebook page. It was deleted with no response. Bank of America agents are unwilling to correct their own errors and rectify the abuse I have suffered by their actions. I have been mistreated time and time again by this organization and they do not care. I have finally had enough. I can provide any paperwork necessary to substantiate my claims, but it is nothing that Bank of America does not have on record.

We have filed a complaint with the BBB (CASE#: 438356), and will continue to complain to every organization we can until this is rectified. I have been abused by this organization quite enough, thank you very much.

I submitted all the necessary paperwork for a $10 rebate for a computer tower that I purchased on 7-01-2016 at NewEgg. I received a letter on 9-12-2016 stating that the rebate was rejected for being outside (after) the promotion date. The promotion date was 7-1-2016, I purchased it on 7-1-2016, the rebate paperwork from Newegg says 7-1-2016. So, I called the 1-800 number to find out what was wrong. I spoke with Megan at Velocity who said that her screen showed 7-2-2016 was the valid date for the promotion. I told her I had the paperwork from Newegg in front of me saying otherwise. She said I could fax in my information or re submit by mail. I asked if I could scan and email, but she said no they wouldn't accept emails. Seriously.....let's step back in time here and use an antiquated device that most people don't have access too. It is so frustrating dealing with companies that don't honor rebates and make up excuses so they don't have to pay them out. I'm not sure why NEWEGG would choose to be associated with them. NEWEGG please help me understand this?

Same complaint as many others Velocity Fulfillment, Inc. does not send you the rebate check after you provide all required documentation on time. I have been waiting over 10 weeks and today was told to wait another 6 weeks.  This rebate thing is a scam. Think about it. We all paid for our products and it does not take them 10 weeks to get our money, but yet they cannot send the rebate amount back. I have two rebates out with this company both for Swann security cameras. I am going to be writing Swann also to let them know that I will not be buying their products if this company is going to do their rebates. I also filled a BBB complaint.

Terrible customer service and bad telephone service (do they disconnect phone calls on purpose when they do not want to talk with you? )
Supervisor Alicia is not capable of  being a supervisor there; she is also a dishonest person.
I have been dealing with them for 40 days and still my problem remains unresolved.

In my previous review, I mentioned experiencing rebate delays and a phone system glitch with Velocity Fulfillment. I'm happy to say that within a day (wow) of me posting my original review, Greg, a high-level investor in the company, personally contacted me through Yelp and offered his apologies.

He agreed that I should've received a check in the mail by now, and offered to have a check overnighted to me. He was sympathetic to my concerns and not pushy. He really did seem to care about righting a wrong.

I'm always impressed when a business looks at (honest) negative feedback, takes that constructively and tries to make amends, and uses that experience to do better in the future. That does seem to be the case with Velocity, after all.

Followup: Looks like the check came as promised!

It appears many people have had the same problems with Rebates for the Cooler Master product. 
I too have become a victim of this fraudulent company.
I purchased and submitted my rebate with ALL the required documentation filled out as requested and waited until a week after the date they said to call them back (3 months later) if I had not received a check. When I called, they told me I had purchased the product AFTER the promotion ended. After hours of looking for the original receipt, I had proof I purchased it within the correct time period. I called them back and now have to send a fax to them and call them back again so they can reprocess the request. 
This is a complete scam. I believe this rebate company is making up lies in hopes that people lost their receipts, or plain forgot to call back regarding the rebates. Then this Velocity Fulfillment company receives the rebates and cashes them in or something for their own good or receives kickbacks from the manufacturers for purposely loosing or misfiling customers paperwork. 
If you have invested in this company, back out now before the Better Business Bureau or Television Networks investigates them for fraud. I guarantee this irresponsible handling of customers will not be dismissed. 
Only reason I give it 2 stars is because the lady on the customer service line when I called was extremely polite and respectful and gave me all the information I requested.

Freedom Tax goes above and beyond for their clients! I used to do my taxes with H&R block, but after I went to Freedom Tax, I was educated on all the money I was missing out on that the competitors never told me about. With Freedom Tax, I didn't feel like a number, but rather a valued client and family. Now I see why they average $500 to $1200 more back on your refund compared to the other guys. If you want the best service and max back on your tax refund, Freedom Tax is the way to go! Always convenient and thorough with their services! Did I mention they have raffles for tv's, tablets and free rent?!! What's not to love about this place!!

A team of professionals that have a heart for service and finding solutions for each and every client.  Positive attitudes with the knowledge in the industry with over 20 years experience maximizing your refund. Looking forward to working with them each and every year for taxes retirement planning,  life insurance and College planning needs for our children.  Financial Freedom is possible with Freedom Tax and Financial Services.

If there's an embodiment of efficiency and practical knowledge, Stacy is it. 

He was on top of things and always straight forward and honest.  The purchase of my first home couldn't have  been smoother. Choose Prime lending  and for God sakes, pick Stacy!!!!

I have worked with Stacy Williams to obtain the best lending products for my clients for the last 3 years. We have helped several people obtain a new mortgage. The feedback I have obtained from past and current clients on the overall performance of Stacy and his staff over the years has been outstanding. Stacy is prompt, professional and a great communicator, I am very happy to be in business with him and if I was buying a home tomorrow; I would start by talking to Stacy Williams today.

This Citibank branch is A JOKE.  I went into their branch with a Citibank check issued by Citibank in New Castle, Delaware.  They told me that they couldn't verify the funds so they can't cash it.  I called the Citibank Corporate office to verify the funds myself and they told me the check was definitely valid and good.  They said that any Citibank branch should cash the checks.  I went back to this branch and they again refused to cash the check.  They even refused to speak to the person at their own corporate office that confirmed the validity of the check.  Why is this branch even open if they don't want to act like a bank.  This branch needs to their close doors since they refuse to do their job.

This is our local branch, so we come here out of convenience. The representatives are sometimes rude, and the tellers have counted our money wrong on multiple occasions. The drive-thru ATM is also poorly designed. It's laid out in a very strange way that makes depositing rather uncomfortable.

Like I said, it's convenient more than anything. Several of their Las Vegas branches, including the one we usually went to, have recently closed. I also noticed that they shortened their hours for certain days. Perhaps Citibank just isn't doing well here in Southern Nevada. Whatever the case may be, I seriously hope they consider making some changes at this specific location. Their customer service in particular could use a lot of improvement.

I've seen the customer service here decline each and every time I've been here over the last 2 years. They will disrespect your time and refuse to explain the delay. I tried to speak with the branch manager who did little more than offer a hollow apology. Not likely to return.

This review is for the West Sahara branch. Every time I attempted to make a transaction with this branch there was a new manager to deal with. The tellers were friendly and efficient, but when transactions mattered the most, I give them "F". My savings and checking accounts were linked from the beginning. When I requested a transfer from another financial institution from my savings account and the funds were in checking, Credit Union 1 RETURNED the transfer for NSF. (I have NEVER had a NSF check previously at any banking institution!) Then, they transferred funds from checking to cover the $29 NSF charge. I was charged $25 from the other financial institution for a total of $54 when the money was in the bank with linked accounts. When I called and received yet another manager, he used a lame excuse that transfers only work from savings to checking, not checking to savings. He refused to provide a refund for the NSF charge even when I explained I would close my account if he did not refund the NSF charge.  He chose to close both my accounts rather than be professional and fair.  I would NEVER recommend this savings account to anyone!!!
If you are looking for a credit union with impeccable service, great rates and no lines than this is the place for you. It's clean and everyone is happy to help you!
Worst drive thru customer service I've experienced ever. It's like they're mad at me for giving them money. Very rude. I've banked here for over a year and it's been this way the entire time.

Maybe it was just a bad day, but it was absolutely horrible...  The lady who was helping me to open an account was not friendly at all.  No smile or anything!  She acted like if she wanted to go home, so I left and went to Bank of America.  They made my day!!!

After moving, I needed to switch banks as my old one didn't have a branch in AZ. We ultimately decided to open an account here and worked with Eli, who was more than happy to help and explain all the details to us.

My main complaint is that the offer of getting my first few sets of checks free of charge was never followed through by any of the staff. Chase seems to tout the fact that every client gets their own "personal banker" to work with during each visit, but so far I've had one single interaction with mine - and that was setting up the account. Doesn't seem very "personal" to me.

Sitting here for 40 minutes waiting for a banker who apparently cant stop chatting and help other clients. Every branch is the same way. Horrible.. decided to close all my accounts with them.... rude staff.

Worst bank ever!
Went in to close a credit card I had with the bank. Went to a teller and was told I had to speak to a "banker" they put me on the list to speak to one. 

So there I am waiting and a different teller came crossed out my name and the lady who was after me. Then she proceeded to put the lady that was behind me in front and me after. 

See picture of the sign in sheet.
Decent bank (they all have their issues) and you can get free checking with direct deposit.  Lots of branch locations, too.

I have banked with Chase since way back when it was Washington Mutual.  A very long time customer.

I have also, for the most part been a happy customer - until recently.

My niece took a Chase money order that I gave her down to cash it at the this branch, the branch I purchased the money order from.  They would not cash it.  Though she had two pieces of ID and I even called and told them that she was my niece  - I was told in no uncertain terms that her state issued drivers license had a number that was not clear and therefore they would not cash it.

She went two blocks down and cashed the money order.  Last I recalled money orders were like cash and she presented what they asked for.  Worst I think for me, was that the person I spoke to had zero interest in what I had to say.  She was short, to the point and cared not whether I continued to bank with them or not.

That was two days ago. Today I called to verify that a cashiers check that I had purchased at Chase had indeed been cashed.  When I called the 800 number I was treated as I had become accustom to being treated by Chase.  The home office folks did all they could do but told me that I had to call the branch I actually got the cashiers check from, lucky me, the Peoria branch.

And guess what, when I called they listened..then the person who answered the phone said "You do know it's 4:45 and we close at 5:00... I am with a customer at the moment (they answer the phone while they are with a customer??) so she proceeds to say... I will have to take your name and number and someone will call you back.

Do you know... she only asked for my first name and when I asked her to repeat  my number she said "no I got it" and hung up.

I do not know what is going on with this branch or chase as a whole but it is pretty disappointing as I have been one of those customers that frequently recommends them.  In fact, I hold a position in a very large company with thousands of employee's.  We are a company who requires direct deposit and I use to encourage my employees to use chase.

That will no longer be my recommendation.  I train folks on customer service and it only takes a few bad experiences to change an entire companies reputation.  This branch is putting it all on the line for Chase in my opinion.

I have not changed banks yet, but I have definitely changed branches.

Branch in henderson closed, I was turned around after I was inside the building at 5:00 lady said they were closed. Already hard to pay the mortgage and getting harder. Citibank is the worst I only bank through them because my mortgage through them otherwise I wouldn't step foot in that place!

This branch is nicely located-- just east of the Strip on Flamingo.  There's a drive up ATM.  The best thing about it is it doesn't ever seem to be busy.  Also, the tellers are always super friendly.  When I went in today, all three ladies were just sitting there.  When I walked up to the transact my business they all made conversation with me and were extremely warm & sincere.
The manager of this bank is so helpful and had just moved here from Calf! About time some nice people with respect in Las Vegas!!

Worst customer service ever! I came in because I had some questions with but my car insurance and a agent would not help me. She kept telling the front desk what to say. I switch companies after and got a better quote!

This place really is as bad as the bad reviews say it is. THE STAFF WROTE SOME OF THE 5 STAR REVIEWS!!! I have been her customer for years so I have known her staff by name over that time. If that alone doesn't tell you to stay away, let me do it for you...

When Jen first opened up she was the ONLY State Farm agent near the new Mountains Edge area. This is why she grew so quickly, not because of great service. However, now that she has grown so quickly she doesn't have time for her clients and leaves you to her untrained short-tenured staff, who give you wrong information most of the time, incorrectly code your policies so that you are paying MORE than if they did it correctly (which I believe is intentional since they're commission based), and don't give you the time of day unless you are adding a policy. I have easily paid over $1000 over time because of their incompetent staff/lack of attention. For example, not putting multi car/accident free/multi line discounts/ etc even after you notice and ask them about it only to find later they lied to you and it was never added. 

Don't get me wrong- if you are trying to create a policy they will be all over you. They'll call you 2-3 times a day to make sure they get the sale. But as soon as they get it, along with that commission, you will just be another number to them and won't get an ounce of service in return when you actually need it once in a blue moon. You will have to call repeatedly and beg someone to call you back. Meanwhile, her staff don't stick around all that long and you will be working with another new face before you know it... and all of them are young and active on social media... and they will continue finding ways to get Jen 5 stars here and there.

I gave them the benefit of the doubt for years until I finally had enough. Oh, and the 3 people I have referred feel the same way. There are a million other state farm agents out there that would love to have your business and treat you like a customer rather than a commission check. If there were a 0 star rating I would definitely use it.


UPDATE: After 2 weeks of practically begging this office to transfer my policies to a different agent I finally got fed up and contacted the corporate office to make it happen without their 'assistance'.

Transferring your policies AWAY from an agent is an extremely easy process. I wish I did it sooner and It took me less than 5 minutes.

I'm still with the agency and I've been with them now over five years! I now have my auto/renters/life & health insurance with them as well as my paintings.  Whenever I have questions Ashley Mastowski takes care of me. She's professional and quick to get back to me.

I love this office!!! And no, I don't work there. I have been driving for more than 20 years, and this is absolutely the best insurance company I have ever dealt with. Kate has helped me and my family through some really difficult times, including getting burglarized a week before Christmas!!! If you or your family need insurance, you MUST call this office. Kate and the team have never let us down.

Recently moved my insurance business to this State Farm Agency having been with State Farm over 25 years. Jodi & Jen were both pleasant and professional and made my experience with this agency amazing. I know my house and 3 cars are well taken care of. Thank you!

Love this place. The staff is so helpful. I just move to Las Vegas and I decided to go with this office, and I do not regret the decision. Ashley and Kate helped me and the transition was SO easy. They had my best interest at heart and they answered all of my questions and put my worries at ease. I highly recommend this office.

After being with Nationwide for 3 years, their rates just got too high. Almost $300 a month for 2 drivers and 2 cars, with perfect driving records. I called around and when I called this office, I spoke with Ashley. They do bundle policies and she didn't give me the cheapest quote, but she was extremely helpful and knowledgeable. I told her I was still calling around for quotes so I'd let her know. In the mean time while calling other companies, she called me back with an even lower rate, saving me $100 dollars a month over my current policy. So we decided to go with them. We went in to fill out our paperwork. Ashley was so friendly and it didn't take us long at all to get everything done. We ended up with renters insurance, 2 life insurance policies and full coverage auto insurance for $100 less per month. I would recommend this office to anyone needing any insurance coverage. They work hard to get you a good rate & exactly the coverage you need.  Thanks Ashley! You're awesome!

When I met my husband, he was insured with State Farm and we began shopping around for an agent who was local as well as accessible.  Having been with Allstate for over 10 years, I wasn't really wanting to change companies.  Then I met Jen and some of her other agents. I immediately felt like I was in good hands and that I could go to them with all of my insurance, as well as other financial business as well.  Since 2011, we have our mortgage insurance, 3 vehicles  (2 of which are brand new) and I recently rolled over my Roth IRA with them as well.  I am strongly considering opening a bank account with them as well as a line of credit.  One stop shopping within walking distance!  Can't beat that!  But more importantly, it is so nice to walk in and always feel so welcome.  Oh! And we pay under $300 a month for everything.  If you are shopping for better rates and great agents to work with, call Jen!

I've been with State Farm Insurance company for years and this is THE WORST place to go. After moving here we found this place thinking it was so close to home only to find out location is not always everything. From day 1 we've had problems with our car insurance. Each month we were the ones trying to figure out why our monthly premium was always changing and doing higher and higher only to be given the run around. Like any agent who's trying trying to get business, they start out pleasant and friendly hoping to get your money and even go as far as providing you with their business card and says "call me" if you have questions. Well, that friendly service goes out the window once you become there customer. When you try to call your agent/owner of that office, she never calls back, and when you call the office, she's always too busy and will call you when SHE has time. Sorry to say I'd rather pay a little more for better service somewhere else. I will never go back to this office.

Even after I switched agents, I am still getting calls from her office.  I spoke to her personally to get setup and and it still was not done correctly.  Jen has a poorly run team and keeps terrible records.  I REPEAT save yourself a ton of headaches and DO NOT TRUST this agent with your insurance.

This is probably the worst insurance company I've ever gone though. Every time you have question or concerns they keep you on hold for a very long time  or respond to you saying they will call back and never call back. They raise your insurance and claim that they raised it on all cars that are a specific model. When I finally decided to cancel they told me that if I cancelled before a specific date I wouldn't be charged for one of my cars and they would prorate the bill and refund me the rest. When I called them week later letting them know I haven't received anything they told me they would call me back letting me know what was going on and never did . My husband and I called several time and every time they gave us the same response that we should be getting a check of $300+ in the mail in the following week. The check I received was $15 and when I called to speak with the manager she rudely just told me that's that was the amount . When I asked for the break down or a number to contact billing she responded that they were closed. I told her I would call the next business day and she responded with that billing was only internal. I don't understand how several workers repeatedly told me I would receive a certain amount and then the manager just comes out with some bullshit like that.

Horrible place!   Every month they would charge me more for my car and life insurance at first the agent Jody would say it's ok. I'll fix the problem but she wouldn't and when I tried to call her back she wouldn't unswer my call they woul say she was busy and she couldn't talk
And she also would not call me back she would put in my policy items without my approval and that's why my bills were  more. I went through that for months and no one else would help me they overdrew my bank account several times because they would pull more money the they should have my experience and my family's there was very bad the manager is not any better I went to her few times but she would not fix anything. Their custumer service is very bad they seem friendly but when it comes to getting to bussnisess they are horrible bad castumer service they are not proffecional at all. I cancelled state farm and went   some where else and I'm very happy with everything there.

I needed a quote 1.5 years ago, I got many. But NONE of them even came close to how low Kate at the Jen Sias-Lyke location got my rate, and I had Auto, Renters, and Life.  My girlfriend had already been with a different location, so I had her switch to Kate, and she lowered her rate too!! We have Kate's cell number and contact her any time we need something and she has ALWAYS gotten to it right away! She's fast, responsive, efficient, and super funny. Every time we see each other or text, there's always a good laugh. We LOVE our Agent!!!!!!!!!! HIGHLY recommended, ESPECIALLY KATE!!! Don't believe me? Your loss  ;)

If I could give them no stars I would. These people mind my language have fucked us over every single month. And every month I have to wait for a refund cause they want to auto pull money from my account and last time I spoke to them they told us that it was in the noted and taken care of. Welp guess fucking what. They pulled the money and then I got over drafted AGAIN!!! And every time I call they tell us that we never requested it. They are the worst insurance company ever and so is ditsy agent that doesn't know shit from a hole in the wall. Save yourself your sanity and go through another agency.

Been with this agency for a few years now my initial agent Kate always had great customer service but any time one of the office staff calls (the girls) they have the biggest attitude and act like the end of the world is happening or they're going to send me to jail. I maybe at fault for my payments not always on time and I pay them when I have the money too you still don't have any right calling somebody with an attitude it's just insurance not the irs learn to relax!!!!!!

This so called insurance company deserves no stars. After months of going back and forth with this company for their error, I was left to pay a penalty from the v for not having insurance. How? Why? It all started with incompetent employee that didn't report that I had insurance on my car, which I did and showed a copy, that lead to this nightmare. For 5 months all I heard was their underwriting team was working on it, I was insured and not to worry about the DMV. Needless to say, I wasn't insured, no idea what this so called underwriters were doing and I ended up paying a penalty with the DMV. My review will not stop here. I will be reporting this company. I had everything I needed to move my insurance over and this is company is the very definition of ignorance and being unprofessional.

Ashley Mastowski is hands down the best insurance agent I've dealt with. She is always available to answer any question I may have and will go above and beyond to make sure I'm always taken care of. I can't say enough good things about everyone in the office. They are all sweet as sugar.

I was shopping around for a better policy and let me be the first to tell you, nothing beats these guys. I was originally only going to switch my auto insurance over but discovered they could beat my existing rates for homeowner's/life insurance as well so I went all in.

Highly recommend their agent, Kate Olson - she was such a darling to work with!

jodi caramanica hooked me up!!!  unlike other insurance firms, i absolutely love coming to this one.  from the friendly and knowledgeable staff, to the great snacks and sodas while you wait.  it makes me feel at home.  thank you good neighbors!

My family and I have been customers of this office for eight years and currently have our auto/home/life insurance policies with Jen and State Farm. We are always met with phenomenal customer service and the utmost professionalism. The importance of consistent reliability when choosing an insurance provider cannot be over stated and you absolutely find that here with Jen and her team. If you need one policy or 50, you've found your agent here!

I have been a client here for over 2 years and receive prompt and great customer service.  Angela always take good care of me and provides top notch service.  If you need an ins quote definitely give them a call.

Sal Diaz is my financial planner and is extraordinary helpful!  When I was deciding on the best route to invest in my business, Sal sat down with me and asked a bunch of questions that made me think about what I wanted for myself and my employees.  He helped me put something together to help me reach my far-reaching goals. He's available if needed, and I look forward to doing some other investment vehicles with him.  Call Sal Diaz for your financial planning needs.

I write reviews very rarely. Only when I am truly inspired. And this is such a case. I worked with Alderus, Jon Gedde in particular there, on a fairly complicated mortgage for a brand new home. With all of the added stringency and raised bar to qualify for a mortgage these days, Jon and Alderus were able to marshall their savvy, their thorough document preparation and various funder relationships to get us financing for our dream home. We couldn't be more thrilled or more satisfied. 

Alderus' many extra efforts truly defined the phrase, "going the extra mile." I wouldn't hesitate for a split second to recommend Jon and his team there... which is why I'm Yelping him/them for all to know just how good a mortgage company can be.

So, unfortunately our closing is delayed for the third time. It's always the appraisers fault. That parts over but we are waiting yet again on a third party in Michigan. We were supposed to close on the 13th, then the 16th , then today the 18th. We found out they are selling the loan and waiting on that . ( I had to call that third party in Michigan to find out what's going on !) Meanwhile, we are sleeping on a mattress on the floor, have no winter clothes, the family Thanksgiving will be spent at a hotel. We have to shut down the Pods, movers, appliance delivery for the 4th time tomorrow. (with NO date to close)
I can't say I would ever recommend this company- and my husband and I are both in the Business. I've never experienced such poor communication and unkept goals.  They should have been more upfront with us. Some employees are nice, but their hands are tied so it does not help us. We were so loyal to THEM that we bypassed the builders lender and $2000 credit because we felt they had worked and deserved to be paid. Now we're getting the shaft. Beware, and get personal references in this industry. 
Sadly, the Chapman's

Julie is a savior! Her and her team worked day and night to help us successfully close on our first home - and the home that we wanted all along. The Team at Alderus is very responsive, and works for their client. We had a very complicated situation with moving cross country and trying to get financed with income that was not continuous. We had essentially given up when Julie came up with a clever solution which worked and stayed very close to our timeline. Overall, so happy with the final outcome. Will continue to work with Julie and Team Alderus in the future (as long as Julie is there!)

My boyfriend and I recently purchased a new home and got our loan through Alderus.
Writing reviews isn't the norm for me; However, I feel these guys deserve some praise for helping us get our new house. Julie and the rest of the team (Shaun, Jasey, and Jonathan) were excellent, friendly and informative; they helped us get our mortgage in a very 
convenient and expeditious manner. Getting a mortgage can be stressful and difficult but the good people at Alderus made the process as seamless and stress free as possible. Julie made sure all our questions were answered and made herself available for questions even when outside the office(hopefully we didn't bother her too much!). If we ever hit any bumps in the road or needed to give more information, the people at Alderus made sure to notify us immediately so we could resolve the issue. I have nothing but good things to say on how our 
mortgage loan was handled.

Maria and Isabel were the best! They made me feel so comfortable. They were so welcoming and made the place not so scary for me. I don't know about other people but I was scared cause it was my first time doing this. They welcomed me with open arms and treated me so kindly. I loved it and I really appreciated the help! Thank u Maria and Isabel and Maggie (I think that's the mangers names lol) 

Thank you again
Gen.

I have been a Wells Fargo customer since 97.  I had not  been to this location before so here is my review.  Employees are pleasant and efficient.  They understand you just want to take care of your banking needs and go.  The teller took approximately 5 minutes to handle my business.  The line took much longer than that.  I would have rated my experience a 5 star because of the tellers but the manager really should know better and have other employees (who were from what I observed not doing much) crosstrained to assist on the Friday evening rush.  So my experience gives WF a 3 star rating.

Wells Fargo isn't even my bank, my boyfriend uses them and We just had the best customer service experience we've both ever had at a bank. The manager Aaron was so friendly and helpful, we were in and out within 5 minutes. If you're looking for a Wells Fargo this location is definitely worth going out of your way for

Will never go to a "bank" again. Love this place. Free ATMs at any credit union nationwide.  The place oozes sanity and unslickness. In the rare cases I have to go to a teller, they have always been really friendly in a non-fake kind of way.

Absolute joke. I recently opened a small business (no employees) and when I called to inquire about whether they had options for me (I already had my personal accounts with them), I got a snotty person saying they didn't really cater to small businesses and that there weren't any benefits to me available. She had such an attitude. I finally decided to stop into the Northside branch and ask about this. We opened my business account with almost no problems. Annoying little glitches everywhere, though. Everyone just seemed to fumble. I have been having a mediocre experience until this last week. 

Being that I am a small business owner, I occasionally receive personal checks. I deposit them with mobile banking no problem. Suddenly, with NO explanation at all, the mobile deposit feature is gone. I call and find out that because my personal account had some overdrafts in the past (stupid Paypal ACH thing ughhhh) this feature was taken away from me as punishment. It's six overdrafts in a YEAR. ONE YEAR. It's not like I wrote bad checks (never once) or had a mobile deposit that bounced (NEVER). Mind you they collected $180 in overdraft fees from me, AND I corrected the account within hours as I have money in my other accounts. So let's get this straight: You overdraw, they take away your ability to deposit. That's right. YOU WILL BE PUNISHED. It's like some mean old lady taking away your Halloween candy because you got sick on one piece. 

I received no notice of this. I just opened my business the 1st of September. I'm still trying to find my footing and am just coming out of poverty. My business is profitable and has had no issues. I can no longer mobile deposit to my business account, even though it  has nothing to do with my personal accounts. I will admit, I threw quite the colossal fit over the phone. The man I talked to talked to someone in account management  (FOR FIFTEEN MINUTES while I was on hold) and told me that that ONE person had decided that they didn't want to reverse the decision. So one person has all the power to make my life a huge pain because...oh say... he/she had indigestion or a fight with their partner. 

I expressed that I would be closing all of my accounts (including a loan) and moving elsewhere. No one cared at all. I will be switching to another financial institution tomorrow. I need to get away from this completely backwards credit union. You've been warned.

I have been using UWCU for more than 5 years for checking, savings, and credit card and I love it. I switched over to UWCU from Associated Bank and I'm very happy with it. The online interface is great and the service at the branches is superb. Would recommend this credit union to anyone in the Madison area.

Tried to open an account at the Main Madison Branch and the State Street Branch this week. Half hour plus waits at both location. Did I want to schedule an appointment to take 5 seconds to open an account? No thanks. We're sorry but all the students are coming back and we have a lot of people on vacation. Huh? You need to have additional staff.

I would never, ever return to this credit union, and would advise you to stay far, far away. Here's my story:

I had a car loan with them. I moved, and called to give them a change of address. I also sent them the change of address several times. My loan payments finally arrived, and I paid them promptly and usually double- so I could finish paying off the car early. Finally, I decided to pay off everything I owed in one lump sum. I sent them the check for the remainder of the payment, and never heard from them again, which I thought was odd at the time.

Little did I know- that they reported me to the credit reporting bureau for default of my car loan! WTF? I called to ask what this was all about, and they said that I had made a mistake on my check ( written amount didn't match the number amount) so they didn't apply my payment. They sent a notice to the OLD address, and when I didn't respond, promptly reported me to the credit reporting agency!! They never apologized for the mistake, never made things right with the reporting agency, and it is the ONLY black mark on my report- all because of THEIR mistake!!!

Take my advice- stay far, far away!!

I've been a customer of UWCU for almost a year and have been very satisfied with the service. The branches are conviently located and the staff is always super friendly. The website is OK but it often seems to be quite slow to load. My favorite thing about UWCU is that they offer full overdraft protection, if I overdraw my checking account it will deduct from my saving account for free. I guess since they're a credit union and not a normal bank they're not all over screwing you out of your money which was my experience with other banks in the past.

While my Dad was dying of cancer last December, I was spending time with him at the Mayo clinic.  I had been in the midst of contesting a credit card charge at the time, and while I was on the road was updating UW Credit via email through their website regarding this unauthorized charge and how the company was harassing me about payment.  UW Credit still snail-mailed me a form they needed filled out to my home address in Salem.  Of course I wasn't there, so I never received it, and so they sided with the company and made me pay instead.  During the week of the funeral preparations, I emailed them when I saw the charge on my credit....and they told me that since I hadn't contested it, I must have agreed with the charge.  Really?  I was a good customer for a decade, you soulless bastards.

UWCU is the BEST credit union EVER!! I moved to Chicago and refused to close my account here, because I wanted to keep my relationship open with them. I tried to find a credit union that even comes close to UWCU, and it was such a fail.

The customer service and financial planning services are phenomenal. I LOVE YOU GUYS!!

I am not sure how we can get Erica a raise, but this young lady is truly an angel in disguise.  Erica has provided me with information that has definitely been of help to me and my family.  She also went out of her way to make sure that we have been satisfied with our service and shared other services that we may be interested in.

At first I was pleased with Joe Dufek's office, but that has completely changed.  I have been getting letters for the last 8 months from the dmv stating that I need to provide proof of coverage, so I called Dufek's office.  They told me they would take care of it after I called about each letter that was sent on both of my vehicles.  Four more letters from the DMV later and getting stopped by the police who threatened to impound my vehicle because my registration had been revoked was enough for me to take care of things on my own.  Joe Dufek and his staff are a joke. 

 I like State Farm as a company, but I think they need to revaluate the agents who represent them.  I will be moving on to a new agent who values me as a customer.

I always get such great customers service at this chase. The staff is so friendly as well as professional. I always feel so well taken of! I only go to this location!

Thank you all for the great customer service!
Great customer service! They really know their stuff! I love banking here! Thank you chase!

I've never been inside, but every time I want to rush through and make a deposit it never works! I'm so fed up I could scream! 

Every single time (5+ now) I've tried to make a deposit at this ATM it fails. I mean, I'm using BRAND NEW bills in this thing and it's rejecting them straight up. You can clearly see the magnetic stripe running through it and yet still, rejection.

I get that you don't want to get counterfeit money, but at this branch they don't want any at all! It's insane. I hate this ATM.

They take extremely long! Being the only bank near the strip they should be fully staffed. As a Merchant I'm expected to be in the merchant line but its always closed and they never say who is available to help.
 So one stands in the regular line but gets told to move to another line. 
Get it together Wells Fargo! Have clear signs and a designated area.

One can see this massive tower from miles away but it's helpful to know that there's actually a bank here and it's not just an office building! I'm new to the area and don't know anyone so it was especially refreshing when the greeter smiled and welcomed me to Wells Fargo. The teller was equally friendly and helped me through a slightly tedious banking issue. It's nice to know that people are friendly wherever you go. Will definitely come back to this branch as it's very close to my new apartment. :)

Not designed to be a walk in friendly bank. The manager does an excellent job of walking around adjusting chairs, but clearly doesn't know how to be of service- a teller that actually helps customers.

I work in the Wells Fargo building and therefore thought it would be fairly easy to go downstairs and get a money order from the bank. The teller refused to allow me to purchase a money order as I did not have an account with Wells Fargo. I've never heard of this before. I can go to a gas station but not a bank to get a money order. I was willing to pay the $10 fee so it wasn't as if I was looking for any free service. With recently having moved to the West coast where Wells Fargo banks appear to be more prevalent (there were none in my home state), I will not be moving my business to a Wells Fargo any time soon and I recommend you do not as well.

This branch was exceptionally helpful! Brandon is a great teller, helped me resolve issues as I was using this branch to access a different credit union (they are a shared branch.) He explained how everything worked and was so nice, and explained that I wouldn't be charged any extra fees. The only reason I didn't give 5 stars was the person helping me before Brandon didn't really seem to understand what I was doing and wasn't very helpful. Thanks Brandon!

We use Dare Insurance for our home, auto and umbrella policies. After years of dealing with someone at the other end of the phone who doesn't know you, it has been great to deal with an agent who knows and cares about us. Bev has gone above and beyond to recommend coverage and provide personalized service.

I have been with Rick West for years now and have had NO problems.  I have Homeowners and Auto policies with them and have been pleased the entire time.  In 2005, when my entire house flooded they were there to help me though every step and make things as easy as possible.  Quite a crash course in homeowners insurance for a 26 year old, but overall a good life lesson and a great story.  I won't get into that one here. 

With my recent engagement, the one of the first calls I made (after my parents, of course) was to Rich West's office.  Again, they made it so easy to add my engagement ring to my policy and explained my options and everything I needed to do.  Amanda and Sam were very kind, professional, and were sure to make my experience a personal one.

The other day I was on the bus on my way to work and heard a man in front of me calling his insurance company to replace his windshield that was cracked in one of the recent dust storm (I don't really like that trendy H-word for dust storm, so I'm not going to use it).  Well, needless to say, he had one of those "we have the cheapest rates" insurance and as it turns out, the windshield wasn't covered and he got upset with the person on the phone.  

What did we learn from this?
1 - Just in case you forgot, the expression ' you get what you pay for" is 100% accurate.
2 - Also, don't have long, extended, personal conversations on a bus.  It is just rude to make all of the other passengers listen to your business. 

State Farm? Rick West?  Yay! I'm a fan!

This guy is the biggest waste of human flesh in the insurance world. I make a late payment on the 11th thinking "Whew got it in before the cancellation date" They take my payment which even thought its late is still within the date given to pay it. My bank statement says right on it that they charged my card on the 11th.  I find out my policy is cancelled on the 13th so I call the customer service number and the lady on the end of the line tells me Ive been driving uninsured for two days since they cancelled me on the 11th.  She then informs me she can do nothing for me and keeps telling me I have to see my agent (whats the point of customer service if they cant do anything without sending you right back to the agents?) and I will have to wait for Rick to waddle his ass back into his office on Monday before I can be reinstated which is two more days. I call Rick and leave a message that I want my payment refunded and to cancel my insurance. I get a snarky response back that he agrees I should go to another agency, I reply I have switched to Geico and want my policy cancelled. He writes back "Gladly!" and then sends me another email telling me it will take a month to cancel me so I don't get any of my last payment refunded and I had to contact customer service to tell them not to take the next payment out. They say they will refer my inquiry to my agent, which is the completely worthless guy who cant seem to figure out how to cancel my policy like hes asked in the first place. Right now I'm paying car insurance to two companies because one of them cant get their head out of their ass.

I had car issues a week ago and it was the last thing I needed in the last few weeks before my wedding. The dealership was a horrible experience and everything was going wrong. However EVERY SINGLE AAA associate we came in contact with was so polite, enaged in conversation and made us feel like we were getting the help we needed. It may have only been towing the car but it was made so much less stressful by these wonderful employees.

I love doing all my business banking at this Chase branch. Christian, one of the private client banker's, is more than accommodating and is a great guy to work with. I've never even written a review for a bank before, but this one really stands out because of the customer service experience there.  Ask for Christian and you always be taken care of!

Terrible customer service. 

I came in on a Saturday morning to change my name on my accounts. There was one customer in front of me in line and so I waited for about 30 minutes. In this 30 minutes, several more customers arrived. The young male employee working helped two customers who arrived after me before he helped me. I asked him why he did that and he said that he thought they would be quicker. I told him that was poor customer service and he refused to apologize. What a jerk!
Then, as it turns out, he also failed to do his job and complete the tasks he told me he did. What a loser!
Luckily, I went to the Chase on Cactus and Tatum and they fixed everything and apologized for this employee's unprofessional behavior and failing performance. 

Love Chase, hate this branch! Avoid! Drive the mile up to Cactus and Tatum.

Hi Readers, 
On a Saturday we took one of our cars into AAA to have an issue fixed, We wanted the car there to be looked at first thing Monday morning. It took some time to figure out what the problem really resided, but that was fine with us, we were in no hurry. We picked us the car on Wednesday. Service was great. very polite and professional. We have an unusual car and not alot of mechanics know how to work on it. 
There is a discount for being a AAA member and have been for many years.
They have a shuttle to take you home or pick you up. 
A lot of people don't know they actually have a few locations that provide Auto Repair. 
Not just for your travels and tow trucks. 
We don't look forward to car problems again, but if we do, we will bring it back to AAA Arizona.

Peter Murillo was my guide through the easiest lease I have completed so far. He was amazing compared to the dealer and another leasing company I used in the past. The process was thorough and organized. All of my information requests were completed in a timely manner. I think I spent 30 minutes for the  overall process from start to finish. 
I highly recommend calling Peter for your auto purchase or lease needs.

Based on another friend's experience, I tried the car buying service. I called Peter, told him a little about what I was thinking of, and made an appointment to go into the office.  When I got there, he already had two cars for me to see and test drive. Great service! I wanted to look at a luxury car so he went to the dealership with me. WOW.....what a difference to have him with me rather than going in alone. We test drove a car there too.  Back at the office, we chatted and I made my decision on the car I want.  About an hour later, he called with a price on the car and the trade-in value for my old car. What service!
Annette Prewitt is great.  She's organized, on top of our request and very pleasant

I have been a member since 2000, but only used my membership for the car service calls up until a few years ago when I discovered many more reasons to use the membership perks.  I have used the DMV services regularly and haven't had to go to the DMV since.  LOVE it.  The people are helpful and really take the time to explain what needs to be done.  Then about 2 years ago I made the decision to take my first international trip.  I had the pleasure of getting set up with Annette as my travel planner and I can't begin to express how knowledgeable and helpful she has been.  Her tips, patience, and attention to details have made the traveling planning process a great deal of fun.  I've had to move the dates twice, and plan many side adventures and Annette has given advice all along the way.  I was nervous to go on the trip, but felt that Annette has been instrumental in the process.  AAA has a gem in an employee such as Annette and I look forward to planning many more trips with her leading the way.

We are traveling out of country some time soon and needed international drivers' licenses.  AAA AZ was great - we were able to download the applications on line so that we could walk in with them ready. The agent took our photos, gathered our information and presented us with our international permits all in less than 30 minutes and at a very reasonable price.  I don't know where else you could get service that good.  Thank you AAA

Upon entering the location on Greenway I was greeted by receptionist that was informed professional and courteous.

 I cannot say as much for the representative that helped me from that point on. I needed information on passports and the current situation in Arizona with driver's license as identification. The receptionist was knowledgeable however referred me to the representative for factual review. 

After taking my picture the representative who never gave her name, did not answer any of my questions directly she referred me to the website and said "I can give you forms that you can fill out that will give you all the information you need".

I asked about passport vs passport and card and she said Oh yes one you can fly to Canada or Mexico  with and the other you can only drive. A big piece of information that would have been helpful to know without having to go to the website.

I said that I needed airfare hotel and car rental information for my destination and I was told that's available online, here are your pictures thank you. Her lack of patience continued ending with I would just give $200 to the courthouse and cross my fingers as to when you will get your  passport. 

It gets worse however the punchline to this joke of customer service, is that on my way out I told the receptionist that I had someone who must have had a bad day, her answer was but it's Friday and you're our client.

I ended up with a broken key today & fortunately I have AAA roadside assistance. I wasn't sure if they'd be able to help since my key has a chip in it, but I set up a service call and Keith, the service member, arrived at my house within 15 minutes. Keith was very friendly and handled the situation quickly and professionally. I ended up being able to get my spare key reprogrammed to my car, along with a new key with a chip in it for less than $50!! I have used AAA a few other times this year for towing, and the experience has been consistently good. Thanks Keith!

So, have had AAA for 12 years and have never had to use them. Today I called. Our 2005 Ford F150 truck has a dead battery. Husband had chemotherapy this afternoon and is in no shape to change a battery. Battery is DEAD and needs to be replaced. Guess what, they don't have a battery to replace this one.
