Not that they don't have one on their truck, they don't have one in stock. The girl I spoke to on the phone, offered to tow our truck. Tow it where? It's at home in our garage! Does thus make any sense at all? Her only offer was " let us tow you" we couldn't get it they her head we did not need a tow, we need a battery. Canceling this worthless $200.00( ish) a year service. Service for what? 

I would like to update this review in all fairness. I received a phone call from AAA a few days later as I also wrote to them describing the above incident. Krista left 2 messages and apologized for what happened and went above and beyond in compensation. I can only assume the rep we spoke with initially was not familiar with what batteries fit which commonly USA made trucks!  Nevertheless, I feel AAA handled the complaint fairly and wanted all to know this must have been a blip that won't occur again. I change my ***** rating:)
We were surprised at the services offered.  Plus everyone was very pleasant.  We picked up a trip tix and they gave us the maps and books. We waited a little while but not unreasonable.

We went to AAA on Greenway yesterday to take care of some MVD biz...we were helped by LaTanya who was amazing. She not only took care of what we needed but also suggested a couple of items we overlooked, thus saving us a return trip later. Awesome service again!

This is the second time I have gone to the Greenway office for help with my travel plans, and I was lucky enough to have the same agent Kathy help with my plans. She is sweet, professional, and knowledgeable and it takes only a moment to see that she loves her job. 
   She pointed out to me the "must see" places  in my travels, that I otherwise wouldn't have known about. Many thanks, Kathy. Marie I.

I've been a AAA member for more years than I care to admit and never really used any services other than roadside assistance. I recently discovered that there are numerous third party businesses that can handle your vehicle title, registration, plates, and everything that the DMV can do. 

This office is awesome. Walk in show them your membership card and they give you a pager, a few minutes later you're handling all of the business you need for your automobiles, travel, vacations, etc. I can only speak to the title, registration and tags piece, the office is great. The two young ladies that handle the DMV stuff are awesome and make long dreary tasks easy. Friendly, courteous, extremely helpful! Stop going to DMV, if you're an AAA member this is a total five star experience. Kudos to Saundra and LaTanya!

Great service for car titles. They even printed a replacement title for my car so I could sell it. All title etc places charge a fee that's not as cheap as you'd think. But it's close and fast. Don't have to be a member either (not sure if it's cheaper for members). Very nice people, great location, safe (some title places are scary looking!!).

Fast prompt service.  Needed a 3 day temp. license, they informed me I was qualified for a 3 month temp. license.  No service charge.  The 90 day permit gave me breathing room to get my out of state vehicle title copy in.  Great service.
My request for some maps and booklets for a few states was handled very professionally and quickly.

I don't know why anyone would ever buy a car another way.  We went to the AAA office on Greenway and Peter Murillo helped us find and purchase the perfect car with the perfect price for our needs.   It was so stress free.  We highly recommend this service.   It is our second time using it.   

Thank you, Peter Murillo!  You are the greatest!!
Went to register and file title on used vehicle we purchased. No muss, no fuss. So much nicer than the Arizona  MVD Zoo.  Don't mind paying a little for the extra service.

Thank goodness for AAA. We signed up so that our son, a new driver would be covered- just in case. And boy have we gotten our money out of our membership! Plus I love getting the movie tickest cheaper there!

The staff was helpful in finding items for our upcoming trip to Europe.  I only wish I would have been offered some maps, etc,  but can get them another day I guess, but a 30 mile drive I'd rather not make.

My boyfriend bought a car from a private seller and needed to get it transferred into his name. He was dreading the 4 hour wait at the MVD and I told him to come along with me to this office of AAA to get it handled. He had about 95% of what he needed to get it done.

We waited about 10 minutes in the very comfortable seating area. The office is clean and welcoming. It's very peaceful and compared to waiting for 4 hours in the MVD office, it's a little slice of heaven. 

When our turn came. the two women on the Vehicle registration desk were charming, efficient, fun, and just plain wonderful.  Samantha Jourden helped my BF sort through all the documents and paperwork. She went over and above for us and helped me sell my BF on the Grand Canyon Railway Tour AND a membership for him. When we left he was so impressed with the service in the entire facility that he agreed to join AAA, and we're planning that Rail trip! Yay! Bonus!

I have been a member of AAA since I first left home after college. That's too many decades to list! I'm a Premier member and the extra perks and benefits are well worth it. From the discounts at the AAA travel shop to fees being waived for vehicle services, they really take great care of their customers. I would give this office six stars if I could.

Very pleased with Sheila and how she educated me on auto policies. She showed true knowledge on coverage and gave great "if" examples. One great attribute was not pushing me towards a AAA policy but to attain the best policy for me. She briefly talked about her history at AAA and made me feel comfortable that I was in good hands. From a late night online quote to her contacting me the following day, I was able to get everything answered and attain a policy in one phone call. 

I never walked into this location nor any others, who knows if i will ever meet her face to face. For one agent to emotionally touch a prospective customer that much in just one phone call, is very impressive and that is why she deserves every bit of this shout out. I highly recommend Sheila. 
* I accidently posted this on the auto repair shop location.

Just brought my Jeep in for work and was told I didn't need to spend the $300 it would take to fix it. Wait!?! A repair that doesn't really need to be repaired? These people are honest, fairly priced and super nice!

My brakes had been squeaking very badly and my brake light randomly came on one morning. I checked yelp to see what brake companies where around. This one had the best reviews. 

Not only did they give me a FREE brake check up, but they sanded down and conditioned the brake pads on all four tires. They also changed my brake fluid, refilled my windshield wiper fluid, filled my oil with a "special oil" that gets me better gas mileage AND filled all four tires with air. ALL of this was FREE. 

they're a family business and truly believe in great customer service. Will definitely be going back in the future.

There's nothing good/great that I can say that hasn't been said.
I went in for them to check on my brakes...I left with brake changing 101 knowledge.(I'm the type of guy that loves to learn everything he can) I asked the mechanic if I could watch...not only did he say,"sure" but explained everything in detail & answered all of my question. 
I don't think I have ever left a car shop with a smile on my face til now. 
Great Job Guys
Yelp reviews well earned!!!

Amazing work on my supra brakes! Put them back together so that I could live to see another day! 
Best in town

I took my car to this brake specialist based on Yelp reviews and was not disappointed. The owner, Jeff, and service specialist, went over what had to be taken care of with my front brake problem. They got to work on it right away and the price was cheaper than what I was quoted from the car service department. Highly recommended and great to know of an honest brake specialist in the Las Vegas area.

My friend told me about this place after the horrible experience I had with a different brake place last time. I was very pleased with the price for new brake pads.

Since I was so happy with the service they provided, I called to see if they do "other things" to cars. I was happy when the owner told me to rush in before close so they could look at my car. They were able to perform the service and they beat a competitor by $110! The whole staff is super friendly!!!

The owners are the nicest people ever! If you decide to sit and wait for your car, I'm sure you'll get to know one of them...I had the pleasure to talk with both of them since I went on two different days.

The waiting area is small but you have chairs, a tv, and magazines. What more could you ask for? If you don't feel like sitting there the whole time, there is a PT's right next door. (Same parking lot)

I stumbled upon this shop years ago and Jeff and Mary have always been very friendly.  This shop has worked on two previous cars I owned as well as my current car.  I have brought a friend's car as well as my dad's car and they have NEVER let me down.  These guys work hard.  Craig and Mike have been around since I started coming here.  All the guys in this shop are very personable, very professional, and always explain things to the best of my knowledge.  I've never been charged for anything that I didn't agree to and I've compared their quotes with a friend who use to be a mechanic and he's told me many times that this place is true to their word.  Cheap doesn't always mean that it's good... you pay for what you get.  I love this shop! If you go here and you're satisfied- bring the guys in a pizza for lunch one day, stop and grab subway for them, drop off donuts in the morning... just do something nice to show your appreciation.  It's not always about the dollar... Thanks guys!

Best car shop experience I have had in the 10 years of living in Las Vegas!!!!!  Thank you for being am honest shop!  They go way above and beyond!  So happy I read the reviews and stopped here.  The 5 star reviews are correct!!!  They added a polish to my head lights with no charge and its mind blowing! They look brand new!

I come in after work and they take just a few moments to check out my car.  The place is nice compared to most other body shops I've waited in.  The owner, Jeff, made sure I was comfortable and even offered to change the channel :)  Jeff was thorough and gave me all the options and what they cost.  Luckily for me, there was a free option to lube up my rotors to see if the noise would go away.  They didn't charge me a dime and just reminded me that if the noise didn't go away, then the other option would probably be what I needed to do.  There's so many awful car repair places here (please see my review of Huskers Auto, Professional Brake Service's neighbor), I was very lucky to have found such an honest, decent, and professional one!!! :)  They've definitely made a customer for life outta me and all my future referrals!!

Went in to get my brakes looked at and Mary was thee sweetest help ever. Michael took the wheels off and found out that there was a problem with my rotors. In the end they were probably the most honest shop I've ever been to and suggested that it was still safe to drive on them and that I could just get them changed with my pads in about 15,000 miles. I will definitely be back for car maintenance. HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS PLACE!

So after getting my rear brakes replaced at this shop my brakes were still squealing. I thought was weird because I had just had my front brakes replaced less than a month ago from another shop in Washington state. Brought my vehicle beck in and Craig who had helped me before took my car in and found out that it was the front brakes that were making the noise. he then had the shop take off the front brakes had them sanded and conditioned as well as resurfaced the rotor, and best of all he did it for free even though his shop didn't work on them! The amount of professionalism and honesty from this shop is unmatched. I will return to this shop for most of the maintenance on my car.

I took my car in to get my brakes fixed because they were squeaking. The guy told me I didn't need new brake pads but I just needed them "deglazed" well that was 100$ and they squeak worse than ever!!!! I took it back and he said he would re do it but if it still doesn't work I would have to buy new brake pads! So that original 100 I spent just went down the drain! My boyfriend told me what deglazing meant and it's like spraying a coat on there. And I got worked! They were just taking advantage of me because I'm female like most audio places do!

These guys are outstanding, I brought in my car needing new brakes on a Monday at 8am and I was on my way by 10:30, and the price was outstanding. I was quoted over $500 by another shop and saying I needed new rotors which I didn't need. I spent $228 out the door, let me say if you want a good honest shop then come here. Craig and Michael are the best and I will be a loyal customer from this point on.

Went here today and spoke with Jeff about my brakes. I let him know that it was making a really bad squeaky noise and I wanted to get it inspected. He politely asked if he could hand it over to a mechanic to get the information because he was in the middle of closing out another's persons reports. we spoke with Craig, who worked on my car and he took all our information. when it was time to review my brakes, Craig took me in the back and showed me everything that needed to be done. told me how much longer I had on the brake pads and rotors and had a few suggestions. he never once tried to upsale  me on anything or push me to do something I didn't want to. he explained everything in detail and made sure I understood what was wrong. while we waiting in the office, we watched Jeff explain to each person he finalized paperwork with, easy ways to prevent things from happening & helpful tips that you never would have thought of! now before coming here, we went to meineke to inspect my brakes and they tried to charge me just under $500 because apparently I needed new everything! so I came here to get a second opinion and thank god I did! my brake pads were still at 70%, my rotors didn't need changing and neither did my rear drums! the only thing that needed to be addressed was the adjustments to my rear brakes and some fluids that only cost me $60!! after they fixed it, my brakes felt like brand new!!!

All the strong reviews are accurate - these guys are great.  They took the time to explain and SHOW me what they needed to do to fix my car, and they were very friendly and fair.  I've been here in Vegas for 10 years and I'm so thankful I have *finally* found "my" local car mechanic!  Highly recommend!!

My car broke down on the way home to LA from Vegas on Sunday. I had to get towed from Primm. Needless to say the day was a complete nightmare. I got to Professional Brake Service after they had closed. When I was putting my keys in the overnight lockbox the owner, Jeff, came by and not only took my car in the garage until morning when they could look at it but he let me wait inside until my ride came to get me. 
My awesome experience doesn't stop there. First thing in the morning, Craig, looked at my car, fixed it, replaced my broken lights (I'm embarrassed by the amount of lights I had out), and had me back on the road by noon. He also triple checked to make sure I would be safe for my long drive home. 
They not only were helpful, knowledgeable and quick; they were extremely kind and empathetic to my situation. 
I hope I never have to go back, as it would mean my car broke down in Vegas again, but if it does, I know exactly where I'll go. If it's not obvious, I highly recommend this place! I wish I could give more stars!!

I recently took my car to them because it would shake when I applied brakes. I found their team to be very friendly, courteous, and professional. They took time to check out what was wrong (warped brake drums), and told me it is not a safety hazard. I still wanted the shakiness (or pulsating as they call it!). They gave me a very reasonable estimate and I was out with a car running as new in couple of hours! Very happy with the service and the results!

I created a Yelp account just so I could write a review for this company.  I would highly recommend them to anyone.   They handled me as a walk in and my brakes were screaming at me.  I thought I would need brakes all around, but it turns out I only needed service on the rear brakes.   I forgot the owner's name, but he was very honest and trustworthy in my opinion.  I would definitely use them again.

Great service, reasonable pricing.

Was recommended to this place by several different people, and I'll be back with my other vehicles.

They take the time to thoroughly explain what they're doing & why it needs to be done & what your other options are.

And most importantly, they do good work.

I have been searching for an honest place to bring my car since I've had bad experiences with the national chains like Midas and will never bring my car to Purfect Auto again. So I searched yelp and found this shop. I knew I had problems with my brakes on my car that I just bought so when my brake light came on I brought it right over. They showed me all of the components to my brakes and explained what needed to be fixed and what I could wait on. I could have probably gone somewhere else to save a little bit of money but brakes are so important and you need to be able to trust that they are doing a great job and I truly did trust them. They know what they are doing and did a terrific job. Not only did they do an overall inspection of the car but they topped off my fluids and even threw in some free wiper blades! I am thankful I found this shop and will definitely use them for more work in the future. They had coffee and a tv in the lobby so that was another plus.

I HATE taking my car in, it's always something and it's never cheap! BUT if you need stuff done this is the place to go! They are always friendly and they do there best to give you the best price. They even recommend you call around and get a second opinion,but don't waste your time, they have the best prices. They have my trust, thank you for not wasting my time or money!

Best customer service I think I have ever come across here in Vegas. I had a noise in the break area, got new breaks (cost 250) , that night after work the noise was MUCH WORSE. I thought I got hosed. Jeff took care of me though. Apparently it was a different problem, but Jeff said he would do the new repair for free and lent me his car so I could drive my 6 month old daughter home to be fed. Above and beyond is all I can say. Thanks Jeff.

I don't really care how much the cost is really. But the fact that I don't have any knowledge about how much brakes really cost and how it's done then I went to Facebook and ask for feedbacks. 

The issue with me is... How and why did that guy who worked in a "professional brakes services" parked my car close to the cement block is just Unacceptable to me. My family goes to your company to change brakes. That's the reason why I went there. But I guess I won't be going to this place anymore. Can't trust my car in this place. 

Please learn your lesson this time around or take some parking lessons. Thanks for reading

Jeff @ PBS is as professional as they come. My brakes were squeaking, so I went to see PBS. After inspection, Jeff informed me that the pads were in great shape, but the front rotors were worn kind of thin. He said there was no real urgency to change them, but that the thinness was probably the cause of the noise as the rotors were probably not dissipating heat as well as they would if they were new and thick. I changed the rotors and am happy I did it. (All noise has stopped) The cost was about what I had expected to pay.

These guys are the pros, pros! They continuously go above and beyond their scope of work to make us happy! They are true and just in all of their business dealings and I personally recommend them for ur car or trucks brake needs. They really know what they are talking about and put the customer first.

Don't let the name throw you off, they do more than just brakes.  I had two experiences this same week.  First, I thought one of my vehicles needed a brake service.  After their inspection, they informed me I did not, only some very inexpensive adjustments to stop the squeaking and play in the brake pedal.  Other places would have performed the unneeded service anyway.  Second, I had a vehicle in storage that needed to get back in working condition.  The repairs on this vehicle were more expensive of course, but I believe their price was very reasonable for the exceptional service that I received - they included a lot of things I wouldn't have expected for the quote I was given.  I even told them I wasn't in a hurry, and they still had it done much faster than I would have expected.  Many thanks to Craig & Michael.  I will definitely be back.

THE BEST!!!! I will never go anywhere else to get my car work done. I drove all the way across town to Professional Brake Service because of the reviews on Yelp for a second opinion on an inspection that was done by another shop. They gave me a list, and it was over 800.00, after checking it out, we found that only 130.00 of repairs needed to be done.....Loved the personalized experience and the service was AMAZING!! One of a kind.....

This place was awesome. This was the first time I'd ever heard of a year long oil change. That makes easier on me. 
Place is family owned and mechanics are salaried so they don't need to rip you off! Big plus in my book.  They also rotated my tires and double checked the brakes and let me know that they were in good standing for a while longer. 
I will send people here and will definitely be coming back myself!

I was on my way back to Cali from Vegas one late Sunday night when my car broke down by the Primm Valley Resort and Casino. Turned out my alternator needed to be replaced. I had no choice but to call out from work the next day and get it fixed. I did not know of any auto shops around the area and there was no way I was gonna tow my car back to Cali. I decided to yelp auto shops and this was the first one that came up. I called first thing in the morning and a woman by the name Mary picked up the phone.(Turns out she is one of the owners) She was awesome and very helpful from the start! I explained my situation and told her I needed to get back to Cali that same day. She told me to just bring the car in and they will have it taken care of right away. I got my car towed into the shop and the moment I walked in, there was Mary at the front desk. I could tell it was her by the sound of her voice and how sweet and polite she was. She started working on things right away and even introduce me to the mechanic that would be working on my car. I've never gotten service like that! Anyways, to make a long story short, I found out I had a warranty on my alternator (I had gotten it replaced over a year ago and bought the part from Autozone). The mechanic then went out of his way and went to the local Autozone to have the part replaced! They could have  just left that work up to me or could have just charged me to replace it with their own parts but they didn't. They went above and beyond with their service! I was very pleased with the service that was provided!!    Everything was taken care of like she said. I definitely recommend this place! I wasn't ripped off like other places. You can definitely trust this place. :) Thanks Mary!

I want to brag on Craig and the team. I had drag and screeching with my brakes and thought it was my front brakes. Craig and his team let me know it was the back brakes. 

Great service and upfront pricing plus the little things makes these guys different. I support the 5 star rating. 

Part 2- my wife's car window actuator broke and Craig and they gang fixed it quick and at a great price. Always professional and we don't live in Las Vegas just go for business.

I found this place online and decided to check it out because of all the great reviews it had. Now I see why! I think this is the friendliest staff I have ever met and the owner is super nice. They gave me a fair price to replace my rotors and pads and no more squealing brakes! They even helped me out and replaced my windshield wipers for free! I would definitely recommend this place to everyone. It was a bit of a drive for me since I live on the other side of town but was totally worth it. I will be back!
Came in for check engine light and they checked it out for free and referred me to somewhere that could help, then also cleaned my front headlights and buffed them for free!

once again professional brake service have saved the day - did you know they have a mechanic - mike - that does pretty much all repair work on cars, vans & trucks and is verrry honest and reasonable!!!

thanks mike!!!

Yes, I am afraid I'm going to have to chime in with everybody else here... believe it or not, folks, there is indeed an honest brake shop in Las Vegas.

After driving around in the heat, I stopped at the store and heard this horrible creaking noise from my brake pedal and suddenly it felt mushy like never before. Needless to say, brake failure is a scary thing, so the next morning I dropped my ride off at Professional Brake Service to have 'em check it out.

Mary, who remembered my name from my earlier phone call (nice touch), called my about an hour later and actually apologized because there was nothing they could sell me. My brakes were at 90% and she said they couldn't duplicate the problem and the car stopped on a dime. She mentioned that some cars acted this way occasionally in this heat.

Not only wouldn't they rip me off, they also corrected my tire placement that the last shop I visited screwed up (high end wheels that have to be on a specific side of the car). They even reset my check engine light!

Let me tell you, there is no better feeling than to walk out of a garage not feeling like you've been **you know what**. 

Give these people your business!

Look, I was raised to believe that I am always--always--getting ripped off by mechanics.  My mom taught me that mechanics see a woman walk through the door, and they know that they can jack up the price.  So far, this has pretty much been true for me.

BUT, I saw the amazing reviews here on Yelp, and I thought, "Maybe."  A dealership told me that my front brakes were at 20% and definitely needed to be changed ASAP, but I didn't believe them (see explanation above) and had been driving around with increasingly squeaky brakes for a year.

When I called this place, Jeff (the owner) was SUPER friendly and he fit me in that day.  I got there, and we had a good time talking and laughing, and I just had a good feeling about these people.  Turns out, the dealership totally lied to me, and my front brakes were at 55%.  Professional Brake Service cleaned up my pads, sprayed some stuff on them to prevent squeaking, and told me to come back in a year.  After being straight up lied to at the other place, this was totally refreshing!  An honest mechanic?  Whaaaat?

I will absolutely be back when my brakes need to be changed or fixed.    Thanks, guys.

They were sincere about what my car needed.  Time expectations were realistic.  Very friendly and detailed mechanics.  The budget was worth the money. 

What can I say that other reviews haven't? 
These guys are loyal mechanics and that's what I wanted. I just had a 120,000 mile maintenance and my car runs amazing!! I will be taking am my car needs to them for both our family cars.

This is by far the best Brake service place ever!!  I've lived in Las Vegas for 14 years and been here a few times. They are always very honest and nice and helpful and give the best price possible without ripping you off like many auto shops do. I will never go anywhere else!  Definitely recommend this place to everyone!

I also went to Professional Brake Service due to the reviews and location. The owner, Jeff was polite and honest right from the beginning. And best of all they have fair prices and my brakes are great now.

They just finished my car, I have to say this is the best place to take your car in town. I called several places and they were quoting me way too much. Not only was the owner Jeff extremely honest and helpful, he told me I didn't need a lot of the things I was told I needed; I saved so much money.  It's hard finding a mechanic being a girl, but I got lucky with this place. I am extremely happy and will continue to be a customer here :D
Friendly, professional and honest. Not the cheapest in the business, but if you're looking for quality these are the guys. I would definitely recommend to my friends & family.

Awesome service by Craig  ! Had my front brake pads replaced , rear brake rotors and pads replaced plus a royal synthetic oil change (lasts for a year) only costed $745. I only come here! It's a long drive from centennial hills but it's worth it.

I want to tell anybody reading this a story; a true story that sounds so much like a fairy tale I should begin it with "Once upon a time.......".

Like many people, I always research the source for repairs of any kind and to anything, I own on the web.  Having done the due diligence I found Pro Brakes, which coincidentally is just a short drive from my home.  Since I own an Acura TL which is now out of factory warranty, I know it can be pretty expensive to fix.  The great news it has NEVER failed me.  But even though it has been very reliable, scheduled maintenance is still pretty costly.  Since I don't recall ever having replaced the brakes, I took it to Pro Brakes at the mileage when the owners manual says replace the breaks.  I did this, having first stopped at the ATM for some ammo and 7/11 for snacks and magazines.   Expecting the be there for at least an hour and expecting to spend about $400, I was barely into the first story in Sports Illustrated about the USC Trojans new QB when the owner broke the news to me, "this car doesn't need brakes; not even close.  I mean I can change them if you insist, but you still have 30% on the front and more like 40% on the rear.  You are good to go".

Still shocked weeks later I felt compelled to write this review.  These folks are honest beyond definition.  They very easily could have done the brake job, charged me the quoted $400 price, and still retained me as a customer.  But now I am extremely confident in both the Acura TL I chose to buy, and Pro Brakes as the source for everything regarding the maintenance to keep it running, hopefully, for a long time.  We've recently replaced my wife's car because it began costing a fortune to maintain as soon as it was paid off; it was an Audi A4 which still appeared as nice as the day we bought it.  But literally every other month something broke or a light cam on.  When that happens in an Audi A4 you are pretty much forced to begin researching your next ride, because when an Audi starts acting stupid (even with impeccable maintenance records to prove EVERY scheduled service was performed), every time something requires a trip to the mechanic its $1,000.  Now, to be honest, I had not discovered Pro Brakes for the Audi issues.  European Motor Cars was where that hunk of junk went for service; and they, in my opinion, did more damage to that car than good, while still averaging $975 per issue.  That is another story for another day.  So we ridded our lives of 2 cancers at one time by trading in the Audi for a 2015 Subaru Outback and then we could jettison EMC along with it.  

Pro Brakes may have odd hours (being closed on Sat and Sun), but their work and fair pricing makes getting to them and using their services worth the extra effort.  We highly recommend this company and will continue to use them for any services we need.  Hopefully you will be as please with their service, conduct, honestly, pricing, and integrity as we are.
I'm sure they did not use actual Acura parts (please correct me if I am wrong) but they saved me $100 from what the dealer charged and I have not had any issues in over a year.

I was in desparate need of a brake job. My '07 Ford Focus ran great, but the brakes were getting soft and the pedal was nearly touching the floor. After looking at a couple of reviews from competitors (the majority of them really bad), I finally came across this business on yelp. Just about every person was satisfied with their service and giving them 5 stars. "Yeah right" I thougt, but boy was I suprised! My entire visit lasted roughly 30 minutes, they checked my vehicle out and gave me a free estimate. 
It turns out it was an easy fix (brake re-adjustments), at a very fair and affordable price, they even rotated my tires and put air in them. The staff is excellent, professional, and very friendly. I highly recommend ProBrake service to anyone looking for a reliable and trustworthy garage! They've definitely gained another loyal customer. Thanks!

I tend to avoid 5 star reviews, but this place deserves it.  The only negative thing I can say is that their hours are inconvenient to me.

My brakes had been squeaking for a couple years.  I had taken it into 3 different dealerships and over 5 times overall.  Every time I got the same answer that there was nothing wrong and was just a bit dirty.  On my last trip to the dealership I was notified that the brakes were starting to get low and I should replace in the next 5000 miles or so.

Anyways, I took the car into Professional Brake Service.  There actually was a problem with the brakes (some sort of alignment or something).  Jeff was glad to explain in detail, but I was in a bit of a hurry.  I was fixed up within a couple of hours.  Additionally, it seems that the pads weren't low as the dealership told me.  Jeff told me that I actually had plenty of brakes left and could easily go 10s of thousands more more miles.

They were honest and well priced....in the world of auto repair that deserves more than 5 stars.

I believe I have shared my experience with fellow FB'ers, friends, and family.  Now it 's time to share with my fellow YELPERS.

I think a good , honest, mechanic is super hard to find.  I am so delighted to have found this place and close to home.  But even if they were not close to home, I would drive to them if I had to. 

I was trying to put off getting my brakes done as long as possible since funds are tight at this time.  But of course my brakes started "the grinding" sound which I could not ignore anymore. 

I searched in Yelp to find a brake place and get the work over with. 
I chose to go to PROFESSIONAL BRAKE SERVICE since they got high ratings.  (I was going to go to T&M which is in the same area but they were always busy.  That is another good place to to go)
I made an appointment with Jeff and he seemed so warm and friendly on the phone. 
I get to the shop and Jeff was at the front desk who greeted me with a smile.  He listened to everything that was wrong with the car besides the brakes.  To my surprise this shop was not just for brakes.  They pretty much do everything there. 
I am almost ready to get rid of my truck and just get a new car or used since there were so many things wrong with it.  
Jeff assured me he would check everything out I told him about and he would check with me first if any other work besides the brakes were to be done.  
There were only two mechanics on hand.
The guy showed me the parts that needed fixin and what needed to be changed.  I gave them the green light  to go ahead and FIX IT!
I left for the day and came back with some food for them since they are really nice people.  
Jeff even gave me a deal as far as the fee.  By the time it was time to pick up my truck...I even came back early.  The truck was all done!!!

I was really impressed with their service, clean office, clean bathroom, comfortable waiting area for customers, well mannered and professional-just like the name.  
I could go on and on with more details but this is getting too long already.  
CHECK THEM OUT....YOU WILL BE HAPPY YOU DID

Took my car there in the morning and spoke with Jeff (owner).
Told him my brakes sounded funny and might need replacing. 
Left car and went to work.  Jeff called and told me brakes were fine and had plenty of life left. I asked if they repaired tires as I had a slow leak on one of them.  He took car to Discount tire and had them fix tire.
They went above and beyond on not trying to sell me something I didn't need, plus took my car to get something fixed they did work on.
AWESOME!!!!

I've never had a great service in auto shops until now. Mary was there helping us today and she is very welcoming and very hospitable. I highly recommend her  to everyone. She is very honest and wants to help not rip you off.
Amazing customer service!!

This is the first time i've actually enjoyed going to a car service place.  Called in at around 830 in the morning asking if they replaced lug nut studs since mine cracked off and to my surprise, they do! most places i've called don't replace it.  When i walked in, i was greeted by the owner, while he was talking to another customer on the phone.  He didn't let me stand there for a minute and asked one of the employees to assist me and i'd say 30 minutes later, i was out of the place.  From what i've seen with the employees and owner interacting with the customers, this is the place to go when it comes to basic car care needs.  I will be returning should the need arise.

This place is great. I took my SUV to Professional Break Service and they could have sold me on unneeded service but they didn't. I drove from summerlin just because they had great yelp ratings. They are good at what they do, friendly and really helpful. We need more of these places in Vegas!

I'm so pleased I came to yelp to search for a brake service company!! That is how I found them!!!  Previously,I had gotten a first opinion by a national company and it just didn't seem right!! I called PBS and the gentleman on the phone confirmed my suspicions!!!   I was about to be ripped off! If I had gone to the other guys!! I decided to drive here all the way from North Las Vegas and was willing to wait the two hours quoted me.  It look less than one hour and they saved me over $200!!!!! I definitely recommend this shop to anyone and everyone!! They aren't out to screw you over! They're the good guys!!

I had excellent service from Craig & Jeff, this company takes care of their customers. I recently had a horrible experience at a Nissian dealership I purchased a vehicle from. I turned to yelp for a reputable business specializing in my needs. Professional brake service was affordable, they use high quality replacement parts, and the turn around time was amazing.  At a time when customer service is at an all time low this place hits a high note.

I recently went here with my boyfriend to get his car brakes fixed. The service here is absolutely amazing! The staff is very friendly & welcoming. We spoke to the owner, Jeff, who is a really down to earth guy & really knows his stuff. They are VERY honest, which is hard to find with all the shady mechanics in Vegas. They did an amazing job on his brakes & we didn't have to wait very long. We will definitely be back here for our future car problems.

Craig and his team are awesome!!  The professionalism when you call on the phone to how you are treated when you arrive, is something that is hard to find in Las Vegas/Henderson.  I went in thinking I was going to be spending more money than I wanted and was pleasantly surprised to find out how much I was actually charged.  They are an honest and dependable business who can be trusted and it is a pleasure to work with them.  I was recommended to them by Jason at O'Reilly's at Silverado Ranch and Eastern.  I called them to see who they would recommend for brakes and received the referral.  I will definitely recommend them to others and thank them for their honesty and professionalism.

I am thankful that I found  this place and its great reviews in advance. The reviews are no lie. My brakes will be better then ever after I leave here today. Also note they have a very generous military discount!!!!:)

I had my brakes done by a family friend. Unfortunately, he did a bad job. I drive a ford expedition so everything is expensive to fix. We had the front rotors replaced with pro brakes. They were very honest and reasonable. They got us in right away and the price didn't shock me. Pro brakes went above and beyond for us. Would give them more stars if I could. Refreshing to find an honest mechanic. We will definately go back and refer family and friends.

If you look at my history I rarely give 5 star reviews. It was easy here. No pressure, just the facts. 

I met three current customers while here today. All told me how the focus is on treating the customer right and thinking long term not making a quick buck. 

My experience today adds me to the list of the three folks I met today. I'm a lifetime customer now. 

See for yourself.

Although I didn't get any work done, Jeff gave me a free estimate on what my current percentages are for my breaks. Some shops won't even do this without a charge. After the inspection, Jeff explained the timeframe when I would need a repair job and answered all my questions. He's a great guy who really cares about his customers. A++

Much like everyone else, I found this place to be 10/10. Scratch that, 11/10. 
They were quick to diagnose the problem (drivers side wheel bearing), gave me a quote which was well within the range (protip: use repairpal.com to estimate repair bills), and fixed the car faster than they'd originally anticipated. 
Best of all, Jeff and Mary are both incredible people, which is pretty much the hallmark of this business. Love their staff as well- you're in good hands with these knowledgeable people.
I'm definitely going to be a repeat customer, and encourage everyone looking at my review to pay Professional Brake Service a visit.

I've been to the Professional Brake Service twice, mainly because of all the positive yelp reviews. Jeff, the proprietor, is very friendly and it's a family run business. 

I went to Tire Works a few days ago for a routine oil change. I mentioned that my brakes squeak when I go in reverse. They said they would examine the car and came back with a $407 estimate (after some coupon that was only good for that day). They claimed that my front rotors were hotspotted and needed replacing (which means that the pads needed to be replaced as well) and that the back rotors needed to be surface cut. Both front and back brake pads were 6mm (at 40%). I called my husband and he wanted a second opinion.

So a few days later, I went to the Professional Brake Service. I've been there before when my service light came on (which turned out to be a light notifying you of the next oil change). They turned off the light for free. I told Jeff what Tire Works had reported in their estimate. Jeff had his technicians look at the car and had me look at the rotors. They were perfectly fine on both the front and rear tires. He pointed out that the front brake pads were at 85% and the back ones were at 60%. He said all I needed was to have the rotors sprayed with lubricant and he didn't charge me a cent. I tipped his men $20 just because they were so honest. 

If you need any brake work done or need auto service, visit Jeff at the Professional Brake Service. If they can not do your repairs, they will give you a reasonably-priced, good referral. This is definitely the most honest auto place I've ever been to!

I have a question for you, my esteemed Yelp users: Who in this town is going to give you incredible car repair service time and time again (at great rates I might add) AND also purchase an expensive piece of equipment so that they can continue to meet your specific needs?  These guys, that's who!

I was nursing my rear brakes for a few thousand more miles after Craig worked some magic on them the last time.  You see, he wasn't able to change the pads because Audi decided to be really fancy and implemented an electronic parking brake. That's cool and all but it also means a special tool connected to the computer is required any time you change the rear brakes.  Good way to ensure you keep coming back to the dealer. Not so fast!  I got a message from the owner, Jeff, letting me know he got the tool and was ready for me when I came back in.

Well wouldn't you know it, I was ready. So, a quick call to Jeff and I had the parts ordered for me and ready for my visit on Monday. I showed up at 10:30AM...and was on my way with new rear brakes by high noon. 1.5 hours to change just rear brakes you ask? Ok ok...30 minutes of that was me poking around and chatting in the back with the techs. Yes, unlike some places, you are allowed to be involved in the process while your car is being worked on.  I used to do all this stuff myself; now I have neither the space nor the time for all of that. I'm glad I found these guys a few years ago (via other Yelp reviews). Seriously, if you need your car fixed up...head on down to these guys. Tired of the chain scams, BS they feed you and the tech school dropouts they employee? Head on down here and let the pros take care of you. 

Mary, Jeff, Craig and the rest of the crew: keep up the great work!

OMG this place is AMAZING!!!!!!!!!! thank you sooo much i had taken my mini van to multiple places and was quoted from $400-$800 for work. i read the reviews here and boy they are so right this place is honest fair and fast... i first called and spoke to JD absolutely awesome customer service and was extremely helpful!!!! when my husband brought in car he was helped by Jeff who was also amazing thank you for everything!! BTW my brakes were $250.00!!!! what a saying and he checked my car over being im very nervously taking all 4 of my kids on a road trip and i have ZERO car experience. thank you soo much

After a little research on Yelp my husband and I drove from NLV to PBS, mostly because of the positive reviews.  Let me tell you they were great!  Friendly, honest, and funny.  We have an appointment for my daughters car, it is hard to find an honest place to get work done on your car, we are willing to make the drive.  

Thanks Jeff and Mary!

When you find a good auto repair place in Vegas you keep it , no matter how far the distance.. This one is a keeper... I went to Ford and they were going to charge me $1000 , went here and they charged me $185.. Service was great, honest and friendly.. Truly a mom and pop place which I LOVE..... Stop looking everyone this is where you need to go

NO CHARGE was my bill.

Recently had some engine work done and was advised to have my brake pads replace since it's getting thin. The brakes were squeaking when applied.

Went to YELP  and typed in "Brake service las vegas" a number of shops came 
up but PBS caught my attention due to the amount of postives.

Jeff was working the front desk i explained my problem gave him the keys and went out for breakfast.

He calls later and advises that the brakepads are at 40%, mechanic sprayed it and NO CHARGE.

I belive that if i had gone someplace else the outcome would have included some $$ for unnecessary work.

Have to give this shop 5 stars for their customer service and honesty.

Nothing new to add from the previous reviews about how great this place is, but I had to give a little overview of my own experience. 

My rear brakes had started making the worst scraping noise a couple weeks ago and I was looked for a good place to take a look at it on my side of town. Two friends recommended Professional Brakes and now I see why.

I took it in for a diagnosis today and found out I needed new rotors as well as brake pads. The gentleman who I believe is the owner, Jeff, even took me out to look at my rotors and brake pads to see how bad they were and explained everything that needed to be done. He was very friendly and seemed genuinely honest about everything he was telling me

They provided a shuttle service to take me home while working on my car and when I returned to pick it up, one of the mechanics had even restored and shined my headlights for free.

I usually only trust one place in Vegas to work on my car but I have now added Professional Brakes to my list.

I've been here twice and both times have been an absolute pleasure. 

The first time they took my car in and checked my brakes and rotors (because I complained of a grinding noise) and told me everything that was wrong, and even though I did not have them service my vehicle there was no charge for the inspection. 

The second time I had a coolant leak and after some checking they determined they were unable to pressure test my radiator due to not having a compatible connector for my car and referred me to a shop next door. Mary assured me the other shop was trustworthy and I did not doubt her for a second. 

All of these positive experiences and they have not even serviced my car yet, but for any issues in the future I will always go to this place first.

I will be a customer until the day I leave Henderson. I was able to set up an appointment for the next day and they worked me in. The wait wasn't too bad considering the number of vehicles they were servicing. They have an open shop policy and allowed me to spend the entire time talking with and observing the work on my car. Michael did an excellent job on my brakes. He went above and beyond the call of duty for me and I will be recommending this shop to all friends and family in the area. The prices were fair for the quality of service. Thank you all.

I don't write reviews but this place deserve a 10 star!!! Mary explained to me the issue with my car in details with pictures and the whole shebang. Gave me a FREE check up didn't pressure me about getting anything done she even told me I don't need anything done and that I'm safe but she gave me the options of what needs to be done to stop the pulsation of my car. Why can't all car shops be like them I wish they do a full service and I will drive to them anytime for any car service. Thank you!

I have always found it difficult to find an honest mechanic...until I came to Professional Brake Service! I was recommended to them by a family member because I had several horrible experiences, especially because I'm a younger girl.

I called an made an appointment, and they fixed an engine issue in one day! Not only was their quote 400 dollars cheaper than anywhere else, they called me and said it would be 100 dollars less because they didn't need a part they thought they needed. I was SHOCKED! 

I highly recommend this place, especially to those who have been burned by dishonest mechanics. Extremely friendly service as well! When there is an issue with your car, they will explain exactly what is wrong and why they need to fix it.

I always get the best service here for my automotive needs.  I came across this place a few months ago when I needed my brakes done.  They did a great job, and cost hundreds of dollars less than the dealer.

Since then, I have consulted them whenever I need any kind of service, and they have been willing and able to help every time!

I made sure to check the reviews before I had my brakes worked on. Originally I was going to go to Sun auto but after reading the reviews about the lack of honesty I cancelled my appointment and instead I went to professional brake service. and they actually do live up to the name. he did an excellent job replacing the brake linings on my car. They were up front about the cost right away and the price that they quoted me on the phone was the actual out the door price. The price is after taxes and fees. I can honestly say that they really were professional.  Nobody gives out the door prices as far as I know.  This shop is one of the few places that are more honest and transparent.
Great people with good, honest work. I have two vehicles and bring them to here for pretty much everything.
I took in my Acura MDX and I received great service. Do not hesitate to bring in your car to them.

I am so happy I found this place, Jeff is the most honest guy in the business. I just moved out here from Orange County and my brakes started squeaking real bad, I went to two other places before Professional Brake Service. Both places tried selling me the world on top of telling me I needed new brakes because they where completely worn out. I talked to Jeff he put my car on the rack and showed me that I had 80% of my brake pads left. He took apart the brakes sprayed the pads down and charged me nothing. I tipped the mechanic and drove off with no squeaking. He gave me a very very reasonable estimate to get the rotors resurfaced if it does come back.

Great place they will always have my business and referrals.
Best place ever friendly service honest and checked everything for.free due to my concerns for taking a road trip ill definitely be backthanks Jeff and team:)

I'm usually a do-it-yourselfer, but I ran into a problem I couldn't resolve.  Professional Brake Service is close to my house, so I dropped in based on the recommendations of other Yelpers.

After inspecting the brakes, they called to recommend replacing the well-worn rotors and cheapie brake pads I had just installed.  Certainly legitimate issues, but I didn't have enough money to cover it.  Jeff did the best he could based upon what I could afford.

I thought the communication was good and I appreciated Jeff's efforts to help me get the most braking value out of my limited budget.  I left perfectly satisfied that day.

Anyway, their customer service shined brightest a few weeks later.  I went to take off a wheel to rotate my tires and found that one of the lug nuts had been cross-threaded.  Believe me, these things happen to everyone.  I called Pro Brake and JD explained that they would be happy to fix it, but they were heavily booked that Friday.  JD asked if I could come in Monday, and not only would they fix the lug, but they would also rotate my tires for me.  Unfortunately that didn't fit my schedule.

Jeff, the owner, agreed to squeeze me in.  I took the truck and even though their lifts were full of cars, JD worked on my truck behind the shop right away.  I have to tell you, replacing the stud is harder than you'd think on my truck, requiring disassembly of the whole wheel down to the bearings..  JD spent an hour on the job.  They even tried to order a genuine Nissan lug nut to replace the one that was damaged.  Unfortunately, it wasn't in stock, so they found a serviceable replacement in the shop.

Every business can be pleasant when they're taking your money, but their true colors come through in a situation like this.  They cheerfully owned up to the problem and did everything reasonable to see that I was satisfied.  Trust me, some other places forget you as fast as they can process your payment.

Thanks Jeff and JD.  I appreciated your efforts and your honesty.  Professional Brake Service is my go-to from now on.

Finally a shop that has amazing customer service, and are honest and up front about everything. I had almost thought there were none left. This is now my go to place for anything going on with my vehicles. They did exactly what they said and more! I am Very impressed.

Pro Brakes more than lived up to its ratings! I took my car in to get my A/C fixed. I thought I would need a whole new A/C compressor, but it turned out to be a small part that was more than affordable.  The owner and the service guy told me what was going on and how much it was going to cost as they fixed my car (instead of waiting till the end).

I am so grateful they didn't take advantage of me because this was the first time I ever got my car fixed.  The owner really does value repeat service and referrals over a quick buck and I really appreciate it. The owner is super friendly (and funny) and the service was more than quick!  I just wish other auto shops were as honest and affordable as this one. No doubt, I will definitely go back if I need something else fixed! :)

I went to Purrfect Auto on St. Rose/Eastern to get my oil changed and they suggested I needed new brakes. I was aware of that location's shady practices and quickly declined the service. However, to be on the safe side, I wanted to get a second opinion. Professional Brake Service has amazing reviews on Google and Yelp, so I came in to see if I really did need brakes.

Mary, one of the owners, was working the front desk. She was very welcoming and friendly, making sure I got the best service possible. After the technicians looked at my brakes, she informed me that my front disc brakes were far from needing to be changed, and my rear drum brakes were still about a year from needing it. While most places would have no problem selling me services I didn't need, this place was honest.

She did recommend getting an adjustment. I had a coupon that I printed from their website, so the price was very affordable. On top of that, future adjustments are free, so I can come in every 3-6 months and not have to pay again. Free is always a good thing.

If you have any brake needs for you car, come here. Quality workmanship, great service, friendly, and honest. Can't ask for more.

They are so nice and honest.  I appreciated the fact that they didn't insist that I needed both front and rear brakes, as many other places/the dealer certainly would have said. They came recommended as a family-run shop and I liked the local feel. Plus they were really quick.  I will definitely be back.

Great experience twice in a row! They really took care of me and didn't rip me off (or attempt to rip me off for that matter). They really seemed more interested in the repeat business and referral rather than getting me for all I've got in one shot. Very honest and friendly staff. The owners were both extremely helpful and friendly. I would recommend this place to anyone in the Las Vegas area, just all around good people, which unfortunately is rare these days. And ladies, don't be intimidated, they won't tell you your air filter is a $60 fix :)

I would give them 10 stars if I could.

Being a girl...I'm always wary of what auto repair shops try to talk me into, but this husband and wife team are extremely honest, friendly, and all together upright people!  

I went to Meineke first to have my brakes checked for the squealing noise and they told me it was just brake dust...so I went with it...but the sound returned after 20 minutes of driving the car...I went back and they gave me some line about how my brake pads aren't compatible with the Nevada weather because I got them in Connecticut...and that it could not be fixed.....clearly full of crap.  

On a happier note, I took my car to Professional Brake Service and they told me there was a misalignment in my brake shoes and even showed me a visual of what was occurring.  They fixed the problem and I am squeal free since.  And they accidentally charged me less than what it cost for the fix and I mentioned it to the owner and she just told me that it was fine and to just bring in some Dr. Pepper/Mountain Dew for the mechanics next time I was in, instead of paying the additional cost.

Excellent repair shop....would recommend them to any women out there who don't want to be swindled by all the shady repair shops out there!

I started searching for a new mechanic after feeling like the mechanic I had been going to for more than 10 years was ripping me off. I found PBS on Yelp. I took my car there after being told by my previous mechanic that I would need rear brakes in three months. I took my car there and dropped it off expecting to have to have them replaced. After about 20 minutes the owner called and said my brakes didn't need to be replaced, just cleaned. Instead of the $300 I was expecting it cost me $59 and was ready in an hour. I was so pleased that I took my other car down to have it checked because the check engine light was on. They did a diagnostic check and determined that it was because I hadn't tightened my gas cap enough. They reset the system and sent me on my way free of charge. I have sent several people there and they have been equally pleased. I have definitely found my new mechanic.

I have to thank my fellow Yelpers for this one. I found this place on Yelp! and was blown away by the sheer volume of 5 star reviews PBS had gotten...

I don't even know where to start so lets just start with...Wow! I just picked up my car this morning after giving them a laundry list of services that my car needed and that I had been procrastinating about fixing. Lets just say that, after 7 years in this city I have FINALLY found a shop I can bring my car to and feel good about!

The shop is owned by Jeff and Mary. I just met Jeff this morning after talking to him on the phone several times. I mostly dealt with Mary, and you would be hard pressed to find two friendlier and more down to earth people in the city. They were so rediculously friendly, helpful, and informative.

I did my homework and have a friend that works at a dealership and their prices are very fair and very reasonable! They always went out of their way to be as accomodating and helpful as humanly possible. I have a co-worker who went to them last year and had nothing but good things to say about his experience there as well.

 I cannot recommend this place highly enough! After so many bad experiences at different shops around the city, it feels so good to have found a place where you can take your car and not only not feel like you are not being ripped off, but that you are in good hands with good people. 



You owe it to yourself to check this place out! 


5 huge stars!

Alrighty..I came here on the Reviews of My Fellow Yelpers! And Lemme Just Say...You Are All Right!!! 

I came here to have my Brakes Changed, I was Greeted by the Most Awesome Lady Ever, Mary ( or Mar-Bear) She owns this Shop with her Hubby, She asked me what was Wrong with my Car, Wrote it down, and one of her Boys took it for a little Ride & Checked my Car soon After. 

I was then given a Brief Brake Course by Mary, she explained EXACTLY what was wrong with my car, and I did learn a thing of two! 

The Whole Procedure took a little less than 2 Hours...Thing were Changed, Filled, Flushed, and Rotated & I was Happy with the Price I Paid!

I Highly Recommend this Place for your Brake Needs, They Also do Oil Changes, and Other Services...but Call First, this Service Shop does tend to Get Busy... =)

You Will Not be Disappointed with this Service Shop...Mary is AWESOME!!!

Craig and Michael and their team have all ways taken great care of my vehicle. Their customer service is by far the best that I have ever dealt with in the automotive world. I will highly recommend anyone to them because of their continued great attitude and customer service! Great job guys!

It is not often these days you find a shop with such integrity. AutoNation Toyota informed my wife that she needed brakes on her 2013 vehicle with only 18k on the odometer. Being skeptical I took the vehicle to Professional Brake Service where they informed me that at least 50% of my pads remained and everything was in perfect working order. No charge. Even rotated the tires.

Called to get a quotation for Audi Q5 brake replacement.  Craig told me that they can only quote  upon physically inspecting the car.  

Thought it was unusual, but trusted good Yelp reviews, I interpreted it positively - perhaps the shop pays attention to details. 

When arrived, Craig came out and asked some info.  Provided all and expected he would start checking the required parts and provide a quotation.  But instead, he asked me to leave the key and wait.  It was getting little awkward....drove 30 mins and wait 45 mins just to get a quote??  

When I complained, the attitude Craig showed me was indeed unprofessional.  

Not sure if it is this person or the general attitude of the shop....in any case, they should definitely learn what "customer oriented" means.  

What a waste of time and energy.
The reviews helped tremendously - they were effecient--fast, reliable and did an outstanding Job - I have kids and Grandchildren in my SUV so reliablity is paramount.

Can't say enough good things about this place. Believe the reviews. Been here three times. Had brakes repaired, got Purple oil change, and another minor repair. They are honest, fast, and reliable. What more can you ask for in a mechanic?

It is a rarity for me to give any business, restaurant, or anything I review on Yelp 5 stars. This place definitely deserves the 5 stars for their friendly, professional, honest and prompt service. 

I am a car newbie and really don't know a whole lot about cars. I heard a light squeal in my brakes and thought I would need new brakes or something. I first went to a dealership and they informed me that I did need new brakes and that it would be around $250 with labor to have the front brakes replaced. I scoffed at the idea that brakes would cost so much, and as a comparison shopper I decided to go to a third party and see what they had to say. To me I always shop 2-3 places before I make my decision. It is like going to a doctor's office and having them tell you that you have cancer. Get a second opinion! 

I decided on this business since I heard some positive things online and they had a coupon for brake service with free inspection. I walked in and was greeted by Jeff the owner who was very professional and courteous. He asked the standard questions and then lifted my car to check if I needed new brakes. 

He informed me that I in fact did not need new brakes and they were perfectly fine and that the squeal could just be the dust. He adjusted the brakes and sprayed them down and filled up my brake fluid. He walked me through and showed me my brake pads and invited me to stay at the lift to watch the mechanic do his work. I happily agreed as I am always looking for any opportunity to learn. 

I was in and out of the place in about 30 minutes. I would highly recommend them for your brake service. They will be honest and courteous to your needs and make you feel comfortable. Jeff is a great guy and will chat with you while you wait. Highly recommended!

Obviously it's a 5 star. I sent my great Aunt here to get her air conditioning fixed on her vehicle. Yes, these guys specialize in more than just brakes. They treated her with kindness and respect. She left extremely satisfied and spending only $100 to have ice cold AC for the upcoming summer. Thanks guys for treating her great.

I drive a 2006 Toyota Corolla with about 150,000 miles on it.  It's been shaking/vibrating like crazy for probably about the last 8 months or so every time I step on the brakes.  But I kept putting off bringing it in because I was scared to death of how much the repairs would cost and because I absolutely HATE going to mechanics (hubby never has time to do it since he's a pilot and out of town most days).  But finally the car was making enough noise that the fear of dying in a crash outweighed the other fears and we decided it was time.  Hubby did some looking around at reviews and picked Professional Brake Service after seeing the great reviews it had here.  

I have to say we absolutely made the right choice and I can't recommend this spot enough if you need brake service.  They were very warm and friendly from the time I called to make the appointment to the time I picked up the car to go home.  I have one small complaint but it's a typical mechanic issue, let me explained what happened.  I dropped the car off, telling them what it was doing and pretty much expecting the worst.  About 2 hours later, the owner (Jeff) called me to give me the details, he said I had 2 options.  The rear brakes were fine and didn't need anything.  But the front brakes were about 80-90% worn and really needed to be replaced.  He said he could do the whole thing, including using "premium rotors" that are "powder covered", and it would cost $497.  After I recovered from almost dropping the phone, I said the car is a 2006 and we probably won't keep it much longer, it doesn't need premium anything.  He said ok, that our second option was to go with the non-premium rotor package and replace the whole thing for $397.  I said ok, let me call my husband and relay the info to him and I'll call you right back - I've learned the hard way never to just say ok, go for it!  

So I got my husband on the phone and he immediately sounded confused and a little unhappy.  He knows a lot about cars and car parts (he's the one who fixed the rear brakes) and he said $397 sounds like too much for just front brakes.  So he called Jeff himself to talk about exactly what that included.  Apparently, it included new everything including calipers and rotors (and the pads and other parts) - but my car's calipers were fine and didn't need to be replaced and the rotors weren't in great shape but could be saved for at least a couple more months by being "machined".  I am not at all mechanically inclined but I think my husband also said Jeff wanted to use very expensive pads that were unnecessary when the cheaper ones would be just fine for this car.  So after his conversation with Jeff, Hubby called me back and said he gave him the go-ahead but it's going to only cost $250.  I know this is partly my own fault for knowing so little about cars and brakes but this really does bug me.  I would never have even though to ask if my calipers needed to be replaced - if you tell me you're replacing them, I'm assuming it's because they need to be.  I wouldn't know to ask what kind of pads they were using.  It really feels like just another way for a mechanic to take advantage of a woman (or any uninformed customer for that matter).  I would have had to pay the $400 and never known the difference - and I sure as hel* don't have that extra money laying around!  

Anyway, aside from that, they did a great job.  The car really drives like it's brand new again.  The brakes don't make a peep and they respond quickly and easily just like they're supposed to.  Since the quality of the work is what matters most to me, that's why I'm giving them 4 stars despite the above issue.  Also, like I said, everyone was very friendly and kind  and helpful for the entire process.  They had the car done and ready to go within a few hours, as promised.  And it's the owner Jeff who is there doing a lot of the talking and I like that about a business - and he's a very nice man who takes his time explaining things to you.  It's very obvious that he really cares about his business and his customers - rare find these days!  I very much wish they did everything and not just focused on brakes because I would go back but they don't at the moment.  But if you are looking for a brake place, please give this place a try, you really won't regret it!
I curse the day I ever heard of Equity Trust.  I hope there is a special place in hell for the employees of this company.  THE WORST!

I have had an IRA account with Equity Trust Company for about 5 years.  Normally, I don't have to deal with the customer service, but now that I have, the service is terrible.
2 days ago, they debited over $450 from my regular checking account without my authorization.  I have contacted them 4 times now, via phone, email, and fax, and no one will return my calls or explain why that amount was debited.   I am lucky that I had enough balance in there to not go negative.

Why are they taking money out of my bank checking account?  Why won't they refund the money or at least explain their actions?  I don't know.  Whenever I call customer service they say that the accounting department will look into it.   I asked to speak to a manager, and they said that they were all in a meeting. Right.  A manager was supposed to call me back within an hour, but they never did.

Also, I have paid my yearly fee, with a check which they cashed, so I have no clue why they feel justified with debiting my account and holding the funds.  What gives them the right to steal money from my bank account?
The worst part is, the bank won't deal with them until the funds clear, so now, I have days (and who knows how long) until the funds are released.

My advice, if you are thinking of opening a self-directed IRA:  look somewhere else.

Update:  Now, on the 3rd day after not hearing back from them with 4 inquiries, I call again and one of the service reps admitted that there was a computer error on their end and they were putting the money back into my account.  The only problem is:  they said it would take 7-10 business days!! So now we are pushing 2 weeks of them holding my funds in my checking account due to an error on their end.  They refuse to overnight a check, they refuse to refund any maintenance fees.  They seem to really care less.  I will be moving this account ASAP.

Equity Trust is s remote and difficult company to deal with. Phone calls and emails result in notes to your file but no action. 

ET takes unilateral actions without notice or discussion with the purpose, in my opinion, of enhancing their own position exclusively while potentially negative effect of harming their clients. 

Doing self-directed transaction with them is a test of patience and an ordeal. Stay away from Equity Trust. One Star is too high of a rating. 

Dennis

I concur with the numerous reviews noting incompetent customer service.  Seems a number was left off my last DOI and they just sat on it, never contacting me to advise there was a problem.  "Oh, but we list it on your account" they say.  So, I'm supposed to check in daily to see if there is an issue?  I've been investing for 40+ years and never had to do this.  A 59 minute phone call with a pleasant but untrained/incompetent person yielded nothing but confusion.  After giving me clear instructions, downloading a form, reviewing the next steps and on and etc. etc. she said "Disregard that".  Reminded me of Rosanne Rosanadana on the old SNL!.  This was after 30 min's of work!  I demanded and received an experienced, competent supervisor who finished the task.  Over an hour of telephone work that could have been resolved in about 4 minutes.
I am also concerned about the slow, problematic disbursement issue I see others raise.
My advice? Run, do not walk, from ETC.

Customer service is lacking, their account site is occasionally non-functional, further hampering anyone attempting to provide customer service, My service rep sometimes doesn't respond or return calls at all, and getting anything done is a lot of work from the customer's side. Reviews for investments take forever, so if you have a contract to purchase something, it might take as long as getting a mortgage, or might not get approved at all, leaving you holding the bag, possibly with damages or claims against you if you didn't write in a contingency for ETC to just stall or fail to approve. If they don't approve they aren't required to give a reason- just a toss to the trash. If you have any alternative to ETC for a self directed retirement fund management, look at other choices and read all these reviews- and others- first before deciding.

Horrible customer service at Equity Trust(ETC). My minor son and I for years had an account at American Pension Services (APS) self directed IRA company. Couple of years ago there was fraud and embezzlement in that company, it was taken over by government and our accounts (along with 5000 other accounts) were transferred to ETC after losing 10% of the assets to fraud. So I lost $15,000 of the cash balance and few hundreds lost out of my son's account. Back in Sept 2015, I filed ETC forms to transfer and close out our accounts out of ETC to a local IRA company in California. Apparently there was an 'asset'  left in my son's account, it being an IOU from law suit against APS. So few weeks ago in early May 2016 I found out I can get that IOU portion out of ETC also, don't have to leave it there until it settles. ETC wants to charge me $230 to close that account lol OMG, after being victimized by $15,0000 and being forced to ETC as part of the government deal, ETC wants a piece of me to close my account there. Unbelievable. I spent so much time explaining this to their customer service and all to deaf ears. If I have to, I will escalate this matter to ETC chairman Robert Desich to expose how bad they are handling my account closure. I left a voicemail today for their VP of Marketing Michelle Lee. This should not be happening!

I have been a client with Equity Trust for 10+ years.   The one thing that has  remained the same is poor, horribly poor, customer service.  You call in and the hold times are upwards of 60 minutes.    When you leave urgent VM in their general mail box, they are not returned, ever.  You make a request to speak with a Customer Service Manager and they do not call.  They send you e-mails stating that your request has been received and will be process, only to find out that it was not. You send in Deposit Coupons and they are not processed.  When you call and complain about a urgent problem, they assign a 'specialist', who is often of little help. This company could be so much more if they just made an effort to act and  respond professionally.  This place is one big train wreck.    I am actively looking for another provider. Can someone recommend one?

I would just echo everyone else with the same littany of issues, but just to summarize,  they have happy service people that drop the ball, then you have to restate your unsolved issue to the next happy well-intentioned person that then drops the ball.  My statements have been in error for several years and it is like an act of Congress to get it resolved.  In 2009, they actually closed my account in error and after months of arguing, they finally reopened it.  I currently am trying to get them to fix a statement error from 3 months ago.  I went through 4 well-intentioned non-responders and am now at the next level.  Why do I not move to a new firm?  Well, I'm concerned that it might confuse the partnership that I invested in and might make matters worse.  Has anyone ever broken through the wall to find the contact information of an upper management level person to complain to?

Horrible Customer Service! avoid this company at all cost. They charge an exuberant account cancelation fee. The people that run and work for this company should be ashamed! I went to TDAmeritrade with my money and could not be happier!

Equity Trust was my FIRST AND LAST experience with a self-directed IRA account.    If I could give Equity Trust  zero stars, or less than that, I would.  After deciding to close my account,  Equity Trust sat on my transfer request for more than 2 months!
Because I had liquidated the majority of my stock holdings intending to purchase real estate, most of my account was in cash.  Equity Trust MADE EXCUSES AND LIED  about having to check an issue with the IRS before transferring my  cash from my IRA account to my IRA account at another firm.  I threatened to contact the OH State Attorney General Office.  Even the other firm, one of the largest, most reputable firms in the business, said Equity Trust is one of the "most challenging smaller firms."
