Do yourself a favor and invest elsewhere!

Outstanding customer service, professionalism and expertise! Highly recommended. We have been quiet for about 6 months and I've been pleased with all of the feelings we have had with this company. I highly recommend them if you wish to make non-traditional investments with your individual retirement account.

If I could give a negative 100 stars I would. Worst customer Service EVER. I am 60 years old and I can honestly say I have NEVER had such poor customer Service. There is never any follow through EXCEPT asking for more fees. I am closing an account right now that has taken since July to get this far. They have lost forms I have sent in, then claimed they couldn't open duplicate forms sent via email (which three other companies were able to open when I tested it) then they have the audacity to charge me fees to close my account and maintenance fees during the time I have tried to close the account. And oh yes fees to have my stock re-registered - which by the way, I'm the person who re-registers them for the company I hold stock in so they are charging me to do my job. Their fees are endless. Their maintenance fees are exorbitant. The worse thing is since July I have been given different directions by different Equity Associates on how to complete the closing of my account. If you talk to one person they say one thing and then the next person tells you something altogether different. DISASTER place. Stay away stay away stay away!!! I'm still in the muck of it all so hope the pain is over soon!

Answering email questions has taken a day and a half to two days.  I have gotten precisely opposite answers from customer service concerning whether our property manager can make direct deposits of the rent (you can't) 

Normal processing takes too long so you have to expedite.  The $50 fee to expedite is per individual item i.e. buying a piece of property ... transferring the money in is $50, earnest money is $50 and the actual purchase is $50.  Signing documents is $5 apiece.  

Wire fee is $30 to send and $30 for receiving and is supposed to be what they actually pay for wire transfers according to one of their supervisors.  Fidelity charges $10 to send, nothing to receive.  The bank my wife deals with charges $15 for outgoing.  

Hopefully they will do better long term, startup was pretty rough and expensive.

Too bad there's no option for zero stars; that's what Equity Trust earned.

I had a self-directed IRA that was supposed to be processed by Equity Trust.  It was done incorrectly and the investment has set dormant for several years.  After some minor investigation with all the follow-up coming from me, I was finally informed that we "are not able to help".  

Luckily they "apologize for the inconvenience" and it only took 4-weeks to get that answer.

So I'm left with an incorrectly administered stock certificate for $60k+ with the custodian unable to help.  

Don't "Trust ETC", you should Run from ETC.

Before retiring I handled retirement plans for clients. I recently diversified into real estate loans that require more service than stocks and bonds. ETC has helpful staff and seems to know that part of the business. I am new but setting up was a good experience. A local bank trust co. wanted an annual fee of twice ETC amount.
Fees upon fees. Don't throw your money away in this place. Poor customer service.

Avoid Equity Trust Company (ETC). It is definitely NOT OK. Why? Slow transaction processing. Long hold on phone to talk with a pleasant, but fundamentally under-trained Customer service reps. CSR's operate off a limited script. If your situation requires something they don't have a scripted answer for, watch out.  If you do need to talk to a manager, they say they will call you back but don't hold your breath.

After years of loaning money from my IRA to real estate investors, I had loans go bad and took the property deeds in lieu of foreclosure. ETC messed up all of the associated transactions. The trouble is the Loans and Properties are all titled in Equity Trust account names. Escaping from ETC by transfer to another company is not only time consuming and expensive it is near impossible. 

Errors in my accounts and transactions have required hours of escalation to resolve. 
I've also had problems with ETC failing to properly apply pay-offs to loan balances resulting in a doubling on my account. It takes weeks of emails and calls to correct their errors.

Checks and Cashiers Checks generated by ETC will be rejected by Telecheck. This means you cannot buy appliances or services for your IRA Real Estate Properties through any major retailer. Home Depot, Lowes, Best Buy ... Wal-Mart all of these retailers use Telecheck and refuse to take any checks generated on an ETC bank account. ETC Knows this is a problem and has not solved it. ETC Customers owning property in their IRA are being screwed. ETC says, well we don't know which retailers will refuse these checks. That is not true. ETC knows all the retailers using Telecheck will refuse their checks. 

ETC will use fear, uncertainty and doubt to tell you Equity Trust company policy as if it is IRS law. I have had a supervisor tell me two different stories inside of 30 seconds both in conflict with the other. Both were not true. 

Never give Equity Trust any paperwork related to property ownership to hold. They will hold it for ransom. If you lend money from your IRA they want the mortgage and note. If you own property in your IRA they want the Deed. Never give them the signed documents. There is no requirement in law for you to give them the documents.

Oh, there is more bad stuff, but I'm out of space.

Run Away.

Equity Trust is OK.  I have been with them over 2-years and have close to $500,000 invested through them.  Fees are a bit high for an IRA, however it is non-traditional and compatible to other non-traditional IRA providers.  My biggest complaint is the processing time for my rent checks to be deposited in my account.  I can think of no reason why they take so long.

Yet another one-star review. It would be zero if they'd let me do that. I just don't know how these folks stay in business, but I am trying to figure out how to close my account and transfer my real estate to another IRA. The customer service SUCKS. I rolled over funds from two 401(k) accounts - both clearly marked rollover by Fidelity. Equity Trust characterized one as taxable and been unable to reclassify it. They sent me (and the IRS) a 5498 that only had one of the two transfer on it, which means I not only will have to pay tax, but an early withdrawal fee! After MONTHS of waiting, they sent me a corrected 5498 that STILL only had one of the two transfer on it! And now, yet another three months later, I am STILL waiting for the corrected form 5498 from Equity Trust. They are incompetent morons - there really is no more accurate way to describe this company. I, too, as so many here have commented, wish I had seen these reviews before I opened my accounts several years ago. Don't walk, RUN away from this company.

If I can have a choice of 0 star, I would give it to Equity Trust. I open an IRA account with Equity Trust. All I can say is the service is terrible. I called and left the messages 4 times and sent email several times. No real person will contact you except for automatice reply email to acknowlege they have received my email. I am buying a property using my IRA with $5,000 earned money deposit. Before my account was short for $20,000 and I sent the paper work with "EXPEDITED" email asking them to transfer my IRA from Fidelity to Equity Trust. After 17 days my IRA has not been transferred so I called Fidelity, it turned out that Equity Trust has not sent the paper yet. So I went ahead and did it myself, the next day the money was transferred. Now that I had enough money in my account, I ask ed Equity Trust to sign the loan docs and fund the money to the escrow company. Nobody takes any action either. The contract was expired for the 2nd time.  Finally, the seller could not wait and cancelled my contract. I lost $5,000 for the earned money deposit. 

By the way, if you are a new customer someone will talk to you right away. Or if you are just thinking about it, they will keep calling you. so becareful

I had a fine experience opening my account. Life changes necessitated me rolling these funds to another custodian after 2 years. A full 6 weeks after the new custodian, a major corporation, sent ALL the proper paperwork to ETC, ETC decided one of the forms was "too light" and needed to be resubmitted by the new custodian. Then they said that they would need "at least" three more weeks to "review" the replaced form before they would transfer my funds. I am about ready to book a flight to Ohio so I can scream at them in person. They talk around and around in circles, pathetic excuse for a company.

I agreed with Rick M. comments regarding the processing time to deposit my rental check.  For example; every month my property manager send the check to them between 10th to 15th.  Today I check and the deposit did not post on my account until today 12/30/14.   On top of that they hold the money for another 7 days until the cash is fully available in the account.  Total the money is not available in the account about 22 days.  This is happened almost every month.

When I called them and all they just said that the check did not receive yet.  Common Equity Trust.  In America, the post office does not take 15 days to receive the domestic mail.  

I believe they have our money and use it to invest something else for few weeks and did not post in our account at the end of the month.  I am investigate into this matter right now.  If they do this, it will against SEC practice.    You can imagine how much investment return of our money if they have thousand of customers sending the rental check every month to them.  This is the same issue that when we transfer our money out or rollover to other custodian, it took them more than a month to send the money out + $75 fees.  Why is it taking so long?  because they use our money to invest to others for their benefit.

If there was 0 they would get that. 

Never once did they get a real estate transaction handled in a timely manner.  They will always tell you its another department that needs to process something, and they have no way of contacting that department.  I've been trying for 6 weeks to transfer my money to another IRA custodian and they are holding my money hostage... Still it has not been transferred.  

They have the worst customer service imaginable!   DO NOT USE THEM!!!  Be warned...

The sales department is all over you. After a shaky start with this company, they have finally staffed up their customer service.My only complaint is that when a check is sent in for your rent from your property manager they hold it 10 days "to clear" before they will pass the money on to you. Ten days in today's electronic age, really?

I rarely take the time to write Yelp reviews, but in this case I feel like I need to so I can hopefully warn other people away from this company.

They offer self-directed IRA and 401K services ( as you probably know if you are reading this review ) but they are absolutely terrible! Among the things I can't stand:

- None of the staff that I've talked to there (about eight people now) seems to care, including two who were supposedly in management. They almost never call or email you back; you have to call 2-3 times to get an answer to a question. Answers are frequently different between reps (e.g. one rep said my plan had its own FEIN (tax ID) number; the next one said it didn't. Neither could tell me what the FEIN number actually was due to 'confidentiality' reasons... even though it was MY plan. )

- It took me almost six months of effort to cancel my account with them, while they continuing racking up custodial fees ( which they'll take directly out of your account with them ). For the first three months, I couldn't get answers to my question about what paperwork they needed to close the account, what needed to be notarized, etc. Once I finally got the paperwork, they claimed there was a mandatory 60 day waiting period before the account could be closed. Once that finally expired, there was it took an additional three weeks and lots of phone calls/emails for them to wire my money to me, even though they said they'd do it the day the plan closed.

- Plan administration is done by ExpertPlan, a third party. They'll regularly say 'oh that's ExpertPlan's problem'. You'll call ExpertPlan, and they'll say 'that's Equity Trust's problem'.  I think I know how little kids feel when Dad says 'go talk to Mom' and Mom says 'go talk to Dad'.

- They have an internal brokerage ( Mid Ohio Securities ) which lets you invest in stocks, etc... However, it doesn't talk to the IRA/401K side. In my case, I had to transfer money from the brokerage to the 401K side, which meant I had to call the brokerage 800 number separately ( the 401K rep couldn't connect me or request the transfer from her own company ). After that, they lost the money... brokerage division said they'd sent it, and 401K division said they didn't have it. It went on that way for several days, with multiple calls and emails from me, until 401K finally figured out they had received it but mis-coded it, and it just hadn't been put in my account. I requested several times that they talk to each other to figure out what happened ( after all, both divisions are in the same physical building in Ohio ) but no one on either side wanted to take the initiative to help out.

And last but not least, the fees between ExpertPlan and Equity Trust are very high. For example, my termination fees:
- $200 ETC termination fee
- $700 ExpertPlan termination fee ( which they reduced to $400 )
- $400 'Asset Re-registration' Fee

So that's $1300 (reduced to $1000) for simply closing the account! Other fees are equally high.

I would stay away, and find a small/local firm to help you if possible.
Best bank ever & Vanessa is awesome super nice ! Ask for her when you go in she'll give you great service !!

Decided it was time to leave BofA. Just opened an account here with a personal banker who has amazing follow through. She actually called a few days later to make sure everything was as it should be. What a difference!

I have been using TSCU for about 8-years now (and I'm not a teacher). Nice folks, fair deals, and a really nice office right on Mill. They don't have much in the way of online banking yet (bill pay). I much prefer dealing with these guys over the big corporate banks.

If you live in Tempe I would sugggest you stop by and see what they have to offer.

I haven't been a member of Tempe Schools Credit Union since a divorce years ago, but they were great, except for criteria for membership. Thinking about joining again, I Googled TSCU, which didn't come up in search results. Then I found this: TSCU Becomes LANDINGS CREDIT UNION Nov. 1,  2013
http://www.cutimes.com/2013/09/16/tempe-schools-credit-union-becomes-landings-credit

I been a member of this place since I was a young boy who didn't know the value of a dollar. My parents opened the account for me and put $50 in to start me out. I remember the sheets of paper reams with the perforated sides you have to tear off that they used for receipts. 

This place was also where I got my first credit card. And first car loan. Then my 2nd. Then it was the first time I paid off the car too. Now they financed my first cab for my taxi business. So yeah lots of fond memories. 

This branch is very convenient and centrally located in Tempe. The staff here are really friendly, and if you go in a few times they will probably start knowing or name, or least stop asking for your ID for every transaction. 

TSCU as a whole is a great financial institution. I don't pay checking fees. They have been good about waiving any overdraft fees. They always have great rates. 

Their website, although not the prettiest gets the job done and I never have any problem doing what I want to do. In fact I love making these sub accounts online to save up for my Suns season tickets or car insurance easily. 

They have a couple branches in the East Valley and even though I moved to Scottsdale, I still will keep them as my bank. 

Protip: They are part of the Allpoint network and you can pull money from your account with no fees at tons of places all over the valley and country. I downloaded an Allpoint app to tell me where all those ATMs are at. 

In addition, they are part of a credit union network so you can deposit money at other credit unions like it was a TSCU and it will go into your account. Take that big banks!!

So, I've lived in Tempe all my life, needless to say, TSCU has been there for the majority of it. They have only gotten better since my first savings account started there, back when I was a wee lad. I recently had the pleasure of closing a mortgage with this bank to which I can say 'kudos' to TSCU for helping me buy my first residence. They were super helpful and laid everything out for me in easy terms. The situation was pretty atypical though-- After applying for a lender that bank sometimes uses, it dragged on, and I was very nervous I wasn't going to be able to close on the property. The loan officer I was dealing with, actually went all the way up the ladder to see if she could move the process along. Needless to say, the company they normally used, decided to be buttheads and take forever, so she talked the people in charge and was able to get everything financed in house... Booyah. Now I'm happy owner of a nice little condo. 

This bank is super awesome, they've always been friendly every time I've been in there. As long as you avoid the lunch rush, I've never had to wait more than a minute or two to get to a teller inside. They have 3 drive-thru tellers, so you won't waste any gas sitting and waiting to get helped.

Customer service in store is great! Great personalities who seem like they love their job and really want to help customers. 
I bought my membership and then decided to cancel the next day. The guy gave me no problems canceling and said 7-10 business days it'll be back on ur card. 10 business days pass & nothing, so I call customer service. Apparently the guy who took my refund didn't specify if I wanted it back on the card or check, hence, the "long delay".  (stupid excuse) Waited 3 more business days and called again due to receiving my membership card in the mail (don't know y? bc It should be cancelled). I got a different excuse this time saying the refund was never even processed and that she magically approved it to become a refund & to check 3-5 business days for it to be on my card. Of course they blamed it on the local office, therefore, easy to sign up - idiots to cancel.

AAA (Triple A) is a great company that has been helping drivers and travelers for decades. Their roadside assistance service is inexpensive, top notch, and has gotten me out of more than a few jams during my times behind the wheel when things didn't always go the way I expected them to. The fact that their individual branches have installed DMV kiosks to simplify the process of car registration.

Unfortunately, the guy that "assisted" us when I went in to register my car was the biggest asshole in the world.

I went in with my mother to do the registration, we said what we were there to do, and that we knew what to do. Despite this, the guy (he was a bigger, older guy with a stereotypical East Coast accent) stood over us, watching our every move, bitching about every little thing. He bitched at me for not scanning the barcode right, for trying to put the wrong card in the machine.... you get the idea. Triple A is a "service" company dedicated to helping people. This guy was just a piece of shit who wanted to feel like a big shot by making other people feel stupid. 

As a life-long sufferer of Asperger's Syndrome, social situations and dealing with people are twice as hard for me than so-called "normal" people. Jerks like this are a big part of the reason why I am the way I am today, having trouble dealing with people at places. If anyone at the AAA company is reading this, I unfortunately do not have the guy's name, but if he's still there, I would appreciate it if he was fired.

Still, I don't want one bad experience to tarnish the AAA name. This is a great company that does great things, and goes the extra mile to help motorists and travels in need, and with basic services. But if this guy is still working at the GVP location, go the extra mile to a different location for your needs.
I had to call AAA today and I didn't get the gentlemans name but he showed up before my husband lol and was very polite and changed my flat tire all in under 30mins! Great service!

Nina is our expert travel agent.  We booked our cruise through a different agent in town. When she found out that we didn't get help with anything other than booking our cruise, she jumped right in and assisted us with everything we needed. She handled safe transportation for us will we are in a foreign country and got everything printed that we need for paperwork. I feel safe to know that once we get to where we are going that we will be well prepared. I am recommending Nina to all of my family and friends!  Nina is funny, helpful and has a great personality that puts you right at ease!

After a nice meal at Wendy's, stopped in here for maps and tour books for the camping trip.

I was practically greeted like a celebrity.  I had my card out but they didn't ask to see it.  One lady was the professional greeter.  Another woman sat behind the counter.  I gave my request to the greeter and she relayed it to the other woman even though she was sitting right there.

I would rather have just dealt with the woman behind the counter.  She didn't have much to say (or she couldn't get a word in). I don't have the temperament to deal with someone as talkative as the greeter, pleasant as she was. Travel plans are exciting, however, so I don't blame her for getting worked up.  

She told me about a website http://www.findyourspot.com/.

Between the two of them, I got all the maps and books I needed and they sent me on my merry way.

If you have a car, why would you NOT belong to the auto club?

Let me start by saying that Myself and my family have been members of AAA since as long as I can remember in Los Angeles and the branch in LA has never been anything but extremely helpful and attentive. This is why the treatment I have received from this particular branch is so infuriating and outrageous I cannot fathom how these people still have jobs. I have waited for 3 days to have any kind of roadside service and each day for a minimum of 5 hours in 105 degree heat. I ask what I have done as a loyal paying customer to deserve such egregious treatment. I would not trust this department as far as I could throw them. When I explained to their supervisor Ron that I had been waiting for 3 hours in the heat outside he told me to wait in the lobby. To which I replied it was a resort and I had already checked out and was not allowed in the lobby. Please help me understand why you're horrible time estimations and terrible customer service is MY fault because I'm not in the lobby?! Absolutely ridiculous. I will be filing formal complaints with both AAA headquarters and whoever else I can to remedy what I would call a malignant tumor on the AAA company.

I've been with Truliant for over 10 years.  The call center is always a very long wait and then you get passed to so many people even after dialing a direct extension.  Reps will not call you back.  You have to keep calling in to get what you want. I paid for an overnight check to be deposited to avoid fees for drafts coming through.  Of course this was not done and they came out.  I called 4 or 5 times trying to find out where my check was and to PLEASE get it deposited for I paid for the shipping.  I'm giving 2 stars ONLY because the branch mngr of the corporate branch picked up the phone and called me after I sent 2 emails to her directly.  She seemed sympathetic, but at this point I was exhausted from all the calling back and forth with no answers.  Finally, they found my check and had been sitting at a tellers desk for 2 days b/c they didn't process them at the branch.  However, the call center rep the day before is the one who gave me the branch address to overnight to! This is a credit union and I truly felt I was a bank customer. Glad there are other credit unions out there to choose from!

I have banked with Truliant for years after having the typical bad experiences and ridiculous fees with a big corporate bank.  My need to actually visit the bank is rare, as I have direct deposit and seldom use cash.  My only apprehension about joining Truliant was the lack of local branches, but I work less than a mile from the Tyvola location and the branch in Matthews is less than 20 minutes from my home, so no big.  My visit to the Matthews branch over the holidays was painless (MUCH less painless than the visit to Wells minutes before that) and yesterday I needed a cashier's check so I visited the Tyvola branch near my office.

When I have visited this location, the inside always seems to be pretty busy.  But on Friday they had all 4 desks open with tellers, so the line moved along quickly.  The drive thru almost always has all 3 lanes open, so when I have had to visit the ATM, the drive thru lanes seem to move quickly as well, with a limited wait, if any.  At 37 years old, I had never had to get a cashier's check before (I am sheltered, apparently), but the young lady who helped me made the process as quick as painless as possible and didn't make me feel like a complete idiot for not knowing how to obtain a cashier's check.

I have been nothing but impressed by Truliant and their customer service for as long as I have been using them and I highly recommend them to anyone looking to escape the big banks.

I applied for a home equity loan.  I found out online and with a phone call that rates start at 4%.  When I applied in person, I was told that the rate was 8.5%.  I told her this was wrong, and she looked embarrassed and checked through her sheets again and said 3.25.  45 minutes later (the app process took 1 hour!), she figured out it was 4%.  

I told her I was retired, and a week later got a call saying the underwriters needed my w-2.  When I explained again that I don't have them, she said that they probably would not approve my loan because I have no standard income sources.  (True, I don't.)  

A week later, I got a call from her saying that she was thrilled to let me know that my application for a credit card had been approved.  I told her that I did not apply for a credit card.   I asked about the home equity loan, and she seemed confused for a moment.  Then she said my status was "pre-approved", just like the credit card, whatever that means.  She seemed to be making it up.   After 3 weeks, I know nothing at all.  I have received no standard forms with closing cost estimates, no official documentation of any kind.

Previously, I had a business checking account at Truliant.  The people were friendly enough, but were always confused by my account.  Every time I needed to talk to someone, I felt like they had never seen a business account before.

I joined Truliant a year or so ago after my other credit union decided to pull out of Charlotte.  The things that impress me about Truliant is their customer service is outstanding - the best I've ever experienced with a financial instution.

They have the usual options of accounts and they send out regular tips on how to manage your money.  They also have a decent online bill pay service and other online tools!

Credit Unions don't charge the fees that banks charge because they are non-profit and here to serve you.  Most of them were established to provide financial services to employees of specific companies so you must meet the membership requirements to join a credit union but many companies now have 2-3 credit unions they work with.  

This branch is super convenient.  It is a full service location with 3 drive thrus, 1 drive up ATM and an inside ATM.

If you're looking for a change from banks or another credit union, check out Truliant!

Wonderful option in a city built on big banks picking your pocket. All people that are not making money with their banks should immediately switch to a Credit Union.
Wish it was closer, but 2 miles isn't too bad.

I don't removed truliant n Asheboro NC the reasons r they r under staffed n u have  to wait at least n hr to b seen to either speak to someone or cash or deposit a check( Friday or sat).. my opinion is to stick with a regular bank that can handle the flow of people!!!

My experience dealing with Shelly so far has been nothing short of fantastic.  She is extremely customer oriented and will go way beyond what is expected to make sure all questions are answered.  Agents I've used in the past would sometimes not listen carefully to what I wanted or was describing.  Shelly is as sharp as a tack and picks up on everything being said.  Her enthusiasm and down-to-earth personality make communications easy and pleasurable.  You can really tell that she is trying hard to get the best coverage for your needs and for the money.  

As with other forms of insurance, it sometimes does not make sense to call around to each insurance company in order to compare offerings and talk to multitude of representatives as it could get even more confusing than it already is.  In the case of health insurance, my recommendation is to just call Shelly since she specializes in health insurance, knows what's available, and can tailor coverage to suit your budget.

When I called based upon their website,  I had anticipated some intelligent conversation regarding the High Deductible Plan F for medicare supplement insurance. I had talked with a salesperson named  Shelly to find out the difference between plan F high deductible and regular plan F and regular plan G other than the $2180 deductible.

When I reviewed the plans online I had thought it was a no brainer taking the high deductible as essentially your paying a 65.00 premium as opposed to 160 to 220 a month. So you're paying 1200 to 1800 a year to insure against a 2180 loss! 

But Shelly had no input on that and essentially said she had not written a high deductible policy in over 3 years and had no idea what it involved now. That's very interesting considering that when I asked her for the name of someone else I might talk to in the company  she indicated that she is the "senior" expert for the brokerage and no one else could help me.

Now I can assume the commission on the high deductible is much lower than plan f or plan G. But it's amazing to me that a person and company that puts themselves out as being helpful to seniors would act like they have never heard of plan F hi deductible.

I am still astonished at their approach. Myself at this point would not even consider any plan from this company. It's a new low as far as I am concerned for insurance salespeople. 

My next complaint will be to the Department of Insurance for the State of Nevada. This is a serious disservice to seniors that wish to learn all their options rather than just the ones the broker wants to present.

The team over at Brooks Whitmore (State Farm) branch have been a blessing. They're very friendly, trustworthy and go above and beyond what anyone could ever ask for. Working with Carlos with this process of getting a decent rate has been easy and he's proved to be very reliable and understanding. I was able to put all of my faith in the company and definitely recommend them to people searching for insurance in the future. State Farm and the people at the Brooks Whitmore location will always have my support! Thank you Brooks Whitmore for hiring people like Carlos, we need more of him!

I would like to think Dino at State Farm for providing me with the best insurance rates. I would highly recommend this company and Dino to all my friends and family to get better insurance rates coverages. Thank you again do you know for your time and for providing me with the most excellent customer service

I love Chase Bank! I have had Chase Fraud call me every time I have used my card outside of my home town to assure the charges were mine. I have never had any fraudulent charges on my account due to their wonderful service. In addition, the staff at the local Chase, as well as every customer service person I have talked to on the phone have been helpful and have ALWAYS solved my problems. 

Chase is a great bank that I would highly recommend!

Chase bank is one of those exceptional banking institutions. Now it's true- their customer service reps at the Chase call center are like middle line backers for your account, and getting one question wrong can get you sacked. But your account is the quarterback- that is their job. Inside the branches, the representatives are always nice and super patient; thanks- my brain is like dial-up at times. I also like the new ATM's where you can withdraw cash in different denominations; not everyone is about that 20's lifestyle- I'm not here to make it rain. If that's your style though, the ATM still gives large bills. The drive-up is exceptionally fast and accurate too, I'll admit I'm a bank drive-up customer that's always in a rush, but these folks are fast, friendly and efficient- which is great! Chase, I'll continue to bank with you because you guys are awesome, and I love awesome. Keep up the good work.

I always have a good experience at this bank, and it's been our bank for years. The only thing I can't stand is the remodeling of the teller windows. I can't hear what the heck the teller is saying to me, though they can hear me loud and clear. Always nice happy people no matter what day or time. Fast, speedy, friendly people. Most like to chat, and when you come in the door there's always someone asking what you need today. I also noticed they have coffee and cookies now. Neat. Comfy chairs too. 
One unfortunate event I had was when I needed checks and was sat down with this lady. Don't know her name but she didn't care to service me and it really showed. Was a tad rude and kept telling me things that weren't true about account plans and such and such and I told her otherwise. 

Nice place though.

I've always had a pleasant experience at this Wells Fargo. The tellers are all courteous and polite. They handle my transactions without issues and always wish me a pleasant day. I've become somewhat of a regular at this location as my office is just down the street. They greet me by name and always offer assistance if needed. They are one of the busier Wells Fargo's in terms of foot traffic so their lines can get long on pay days. If you can avoid the bank on late Friday afternoons as well as the 15th and 30th/31st of the month I would. For a big bank they don't make me feel like number.

I have been a customer of Wells Fargo for a year and have deposited a good amount of money.  Since now the economy sucks and I dont have a job my account overdrafted.  I will be getting money on the 1st to pay off my overdraft.  The overdraft department has called me non stop and been very rude, treating me like I am lower than dirt.  Im sorry  but I thought I was still a customer.  Today Briane from that department hung up on me and was very rude.  I cannot stand a business that treats their customers like best friends as long as you are giving them money but then are complete ass holes because of circumstance.  I DO NOT RECOMEND THIS BANK TO ANYONE!!!  I hate banks period but this one needs to be gone.  This actual location has some of the nicest tellers but overall I HATE WELLS FARGO! I hope they all know they could be me tomorrow with no job.

Quick, easy & great customer service. 
Not my part of town so didn't know what to expect. Someone greeted me at entry & directed me. No line, there were more than enough tellers open.

Best insurance company around!  Great customer service.  Cameron and his employees are top notch.  They return calls and get you the information you need fast!  Love this company!!  Thank you again for being great!

Insurance Brokers of Arizona's staff is professional and always friendly. They take care of their customers with efficiency but also with their customers' best interest at heart. Will continue to refer to them.

I backed into the car of a very nice lady. No one was hurt and we were both in good spirits after. When she told me in 50 years of driving she had never had to make a claim I felt particularly terrible. So I really wanted to make the process as simple as possible for her. I called Dave's office to report the incident.

A few noteworthy things. First, I was feeling pretty dumb and clumsy, but Jennifer was thoughtful and understanding, insisting that that parking lot is a hard one to back out of. We both knew it was my fault, but she was kind. 

And instead of just taking my details and waiting for the other party to call in a claim, Jennifer immediately started a claim for her. This both sped up and simplified the process for the person I bumped. 

Very professional, efficient and helpful. I absolutely recommend the David Scher American Family Agency,.

You guys, I feel dirty. 
Real dirty. 
I kicked Flo to the curb. 
I basically said after 8 years, "F you Flo!" 

Since February Am Fam has held the policy on my condo and today I made the giant leap, the giving up my first born sort of leap, and made Am Fam my sole insurer, divorcing myself from Progressive, bringing my auto policy to the friendly folks on East Wash. 

It was emotional. 

It was monumental. 

But in the end, it wasn't so bad. 

(I'm still waiting for Flo to call me and ask me why we broke up.)

Lisa who drew up my home policy in Feb is out of the office right now so Jenny hooked me up with a comprehensive auto policy that's no more than I'd be paying with Progressive AND I get a discount for bundling both AND they're right across the street from where I live AND they're human/real people AND they're more local than spotted cows. It just seemed like the right thing to do 365 days after my move to Madison. And if you're in the market for a super stellar staff and competitive rates, I highly recommend them!

This is a beautiful, clean branch with well-operating ATMs outside. If all you need to do is pull up and deposit a check, you're golden.

What I can't figure out is what's going on inside. I've been inside this branch three times, all of them to get something notarized. I was greeted by a friendly person, and noticed the comfortable atmosphere and other workers lingering around smiling at me. The only problem is that twice I was told no notary was available, and the last time I was told it would be a 10 minute wait, and then a 15 minute wait. There are no customers inside this branch! I don't know what they're doing, and why they can't notarize something for me in a timely manner.

All three times I drove down the street to Chase, where a nice guy notarized my stuff for free and told me there are always at least 3 notaries in the building at all times. I can't be buggered to switch my account over to Chase, but I would if it wasn't such a hassle.

I never go into the branch I only use the ATM.  I live a mile away.  I don't know why I don't use the branch.  I used to go to the one on Chandler Boulevard in the Fry's grocery store before they shut it down.  Now I use the branch on 48th and Ray Road.  That's funny I don't use the branch thats close to my house.  I must have had a bad experience and have blocked the memory.

Relative consistent service. The only reason that they do not get 5 stars is because they have missed a couple of appointments with me ( or canceled the appointments last minute ). Again I keep with 4 stars as maybe the issue is with BoA corporation not staffing this location as they should. If I felt it was local branch issue I would give lower rating. Please do keep branch office open as without this local branch I would not bank with BoA.

This is probably the worst bank I have ever used.  I wish i could close my account.  They basically charge you for walking through the door.  Customer service is the worst in the industry.   They will never be able to resolve anything for you.

I have been a member of DSFCU for almost 20 years. I have no significant complaints about their customer service. They have always been friendly and helpful.... but I am about to close my main account (a checking account). 

I understand that banking has become incredibly competitive and it is now difficult to avoid fees at any bank or credit union unless you go all online with Ally. As DSFCU enacted new hoops to jump through to keep my checking account free, I leapt throught them because they weren't too much of an inconvenience. There haven't really been any compelling reason to stay with DSFCU for years but I did. Their online banking interface is incredibly dated. As with most credit unions, they don't have many of their own ATMs and none outside of Arizona. Yes, I know "shared branching" exists but it's a lot easier to find a "Chase" or "Bank of America" sign. I will admit, they finally addressed the poorly designed phone app so that was a plus.

But... when I found out about this new "Relationship Rewards" program, it pushed me off the edge. After being notified a month ago that all accounts were being switched over to this program, I received a detailed mailing a few days ago. It contained a welcome letter, a four page explanation of fees and a large, color fold out brochure loaded with graphics and text explaining the new "Relationship Rewards" system. 

The letter told me I was at the "achieve" level. I am a college educated professional. It took me some time to figure out what factors lead to placing me there. I followed the X/Y table to determine where my row and column met. After that, I wasn't entirely clear on the parameters so I had to carefully read the fine print. I ultimately figured out that I could avoid the checking fee by either making direct deposits of $750+/month OR maintaining a balance over $2500 OR making 25 debit card transactions/month (that's ridiculous!). It would have been a lot simpler to just include those three parameters in the letter rather than solving a puzzle. 

Of course, there are a bunch of miscellaneous benefits of the "achieve" level but there's only one that really matters to most people - waiving monthly fees. I had all these benefits on my checking account before this "Relationship Rewards" program. Before this program, I knew the three things, the same three things mentioned above, that allowed me to avoid fees.

So, DSFCU, there really was no reason for me to stick with you and this convoluted new "Relationship Rewards" program makes banking with you more complicated. I'm not going to jump through this hoop.

My advice? You have become a big bank (err... I mean... credit union). You've managed to become just like a big bank but with even less convenience. I think you may sometimes have a little edge when it comes to loans and that probably helps your bottom line. I think you should rethink ways you can return to being an option to the big banks rather than becoming so much like them.

Now... you still have my mortgage which is fine. I don't have to traverse a maze or solve a sudoku puzzle to determine or pay the monthly bill. Please don't screw that up.

I have been a member for 14 years.  My savings account was inactive for 3 years so they decided to withdraw my money and give it to the Arizona Department of Revenue as Unclaimed Property.  It will take me 4 to 5 months to get my money back, plus they charged me a $15 fee.  WOW!!!  and thanks for the courtesy call!!!!  I talked to the manager and she just said sorry. I will never bank there again.  So bad!!
I do all my banking and DSFCU.

I opened my first bank account and credit card here at 16 years old. I still have my measly little $300 credit card, yearsssss later. I had three late payments over 7 years. My fault, but due to incredibly stressful situations and starting as a special ed teacher (i.e. no paycheck that summer as I was also a college student and couldn't take on another job). Besides the 3 late payments, my credit report and debt to income ratio are SPARKLING. But the late payments dropped my credit score A LOT. Wrote to the bank, explained my situation, let them know I've been a LONG TIME customer... they don't give a fuck. Won't help me at all... Keep in mind they have the option of givimg "goodwill afjustments" to customers (which is what I requested). And they took the MAX amount of time they possibly could as allowed by law to even reply to me. Going to pay it off, close all my accounts with them and warn friends to stay away from their heartless company. 

Do NOT recommend.

CUSTOMER SERVICE LINE WAS THE WORST PEOPLE IVE EVER TALKED TO IN MY LIFE.... Worst bank I've ever had to deal with... I called to get business account number, simple task, after numerous attempts of having to hang up and call back, they finally gave me a number, the WRONG number on purpose after we exchanged words.... That's got to be illegal and she needs to be fired. Then she even has the nerve to freeze my account while I'm out of town and can't go into a branch when they're clearly in the wrong.. Grow up and get better employees. I'm making sure everyone knows how I feel about this credit union. I definitely would not ever bank here for anyone in the future.

Glad I switch my insurance over to them, saved me a lot of money.
Great service and an excellent staff.
Go see Brianna, great agent.

Sibel was/is great!!! My move from California to Las Vegas was a difficult transition; Sibel was always there to answer my calls. Not only did she assist me with my car/home/life insurance but also offered suggestions on the local spots in Las Vegas. When my car got a flat, totally unexpected, I called Sibel and she eased my anxiety by transferring me to State Farm Emergency Road Assistance. They arrived within 20 minutes and changed my flat tire. I truly appreciate Sibel's exceptional customer service.

Brianna at the office is very very efficient, knowledgable and professional. I dealt with other State Farm agents in WA and CA and they were nowhere compared to this office. They make getting/updating/changing policies smooth and easy. I highly recommend Chade and his staff!

Negative stars if I could. Have had auto and homeowners policies with this agency for about 5 years  these policies are for my home and auto in Nevada. I live in NJ and have always requested all my bills/policies to be sent to my NJ address. Well somewhere along the line I stopped getting any mail for my Nevada policies. My husband came out to Nevada to find outdated insurance cards on a paid in full policy. Had to call a State Farm service center to have temp card emailed. Since then, I have never received any insurance cards from them. We always have to have them emailed with the promise that hard copies will follow. Only they never do. The latest debacle was finding out that our homeowner's deductible had been raised to $3441 and our auto deductible to $2000!!!!!  Needless to say we have cancelled with State Farm in Nevada. This agency is definitely not a "good neighbor".  I highly recommend you find a different office to handle your insurance needs.

Spoke with Brianna at this location and what a joy! She sounded as though she enjoyed speaking with me and was able to get my Renters Insurance policy completed - signed, sealed & delivered within less than 30 minutes! She also answered my questions with certainty and never once said, "I don't know" which is a huge deal for me when asking questions of someone! I came to Chade Nehring, after previously using another State Farm in the SW Las Vegas area when I lived here from 2009 - 2013, I called them today - but they never answered their phone. Their loss and my gain!

I work with this State Farm insurance agency for my business insurance needs . From day one Briana has been so knowledgeable and helpful . She read my lease agreement requirements for insurance and she made a policy accordingly . She also was able to get me a liquor liability insurance which is not a common thing . 

This agency has one of the best customer services I've had (and I work with Allstate, American Fam, and Badger as well) . They answer emails and phone calls right away and get us whatever we need . Thank you so much !! Appreciate the business partnership .

I have had the pleasure of dealing with this office for many years. Brianna is always prompt at responding and is very knowledgeable when it comes to my questions or concerns regarding multiple policies as well as Mutual Funds/IRAs. This office is committed to their clients and it really shows. Also, I love that I get $10 just for referring someone! Highly recommended!

Sibel is wonderful to work with. I moved to this area couple of months ago and because I was a State Farm client for many years before I find an office close to my house. It was Chade Nehring's office. I was not disappointed . Now I am sure is no luck to get nice people and great services in State Farm. My "girl" - agent Sibel made me feel like family and her help was always prompt very professional, genuine and pleasant.

I'm so happy I found Don on Yelp and interviewed him. I actually interviewed several CPA's and Don was the best by far overall. I'm the type that is willing to travel pretty far for a great tax person that knows their stuff but luckily he's conveniently located. I have since referred a handful of people all of which have used Don for their services and have been extremely satisfied with his services. If you're one of those people that do the online H&R block or those other ones, I'm telling you that you're paying for what you get and it's not good. CPA's are the only way to go as they identify things that us regular people may not know that we can deduct and more. 

On your first visit he'll ask you to bring last years taxes, along with anything else that is helpful, then takes a look. I then submitted all my reports, taxes, etc to him via email he completed the we met in person to review and sign off. Overall it was the easiest and most convenient meetings that I have done and process for my taxes. He doesn't charge much and what he does charge, it's well worth the cost. Saved me over $1300 on taxes I thought I had to pay and realize I did not and now the IRS approved my amendment on prior year taxes and will be sending that money back to me. Just this year alone, he's saved me over $2K on taxes that if I used online services (which I've done in the past and never again) I would have never seen that money and would have probably owed. 

I will continue to use Don and I know that the people I referred to him that have used him also will continue too.

Don delivers!!!  We went to him to do our rather complex 2013 taxes.  To be honest, we were expecting to have to owe Uncle Sam.  When all was done, we ended up getting a small refund!  Yes, he is busy and can take a while to do the job.  However he always answered our questions, and finished the job exactly when he said he would.  When it comes to things I'm not an expert in, I always go to someone who is an expert.  Don exceeded our expectations, and has earned our future tax and business needs.  Skip the computer software and go see Don!
Doesn't pick up the phone during business hours and there is no option to leave a message. Closed during business hours, don't waste your time.
Donald is very good at tax preparation and very accommodating to your needs. He was willing to stay after hours to meet with me and was very affordable. I would recommend him to anyone

Very nice and knowledgeable gentleman. Took time to meet with me and address some of my questions and concerns about our tax situation and liability. He was able to answer all my questions and helped me realize my return for that year was straight forward and I wouldn't require his expertise yet. He gave me advice that I very much appreciated -- I will definitely be using him in the future.

PNC owns and services a real estate loan for us and it could not be worse, we have tried for a year to change the due date from the beginning of the month to the 10th or 15th so we could avoid late charges but they refuse.  The interest rate they charge is above market and I would do everything you can to avoid doing business with this bank.

What makes PNC really stand out as a one star is their customer service.

A few weeks ago I transferred a nice chunk of money, using paypal, to a friend. Long story short the funds were transferred out of my account twice which was not PNCs fault.

I called Paypal and they sent a letter to PNC and myself stating they had made an error, that the funds were on their way back to my PNC account and to please forgive any fees which may have been incurred.

I had two overdraft fees of $36 each, two overdraft protection charges of $10 each on my credit card, and one $7 continuous charge as I awaited the funds. 

None of this bothered me. 

A week later the fees still hadn't been return so I emailed PNC asking about the status. I received a canned response saying it could take up to two days to receive the refund IF IT IS APPROVED, meaning since there wasn't an error on their part, they felt entitled to keep my money. What a bunch of scumbags.

A week later, well past the two day waiting period, I emailed again. The rep simply said there was a response to your last message that stated..... And copy pasted the previous message from them stating it would be 2 days. 

What a joke. PNC can keep the $100 because they have lost my business.

If I had written my review of PNC Bank five years ago when I was naive and getting my first debit account I would have given them five stars. After my experiences this past month, I am embarrassed by the fact that I remained loyal to this bank for so long.  While in the past I have not had many issues with their services, transferring money from another account into my own never proved to be simple  It was always such a long process and who has time for inconvenience these days in our high maintenance, technology driven world!! But, that's not why I'm giving them one star.

What makes them really stand out as a one star? Their customer service.

The customer service representative I spoke to tonight was entirely unhelpful when I required her services.  I recently relocated to the Midwest from the East Coast and decided to open an account with a different bank that is actually prominent in the Midwest, WellsFargo. Therefore, I was neither making any more deposits into my PNC account nor using my PNC card.  I forgot to change the payment information for an online account I had been registered with that required a monthly payment, so when I noticed my account was overdrawn I was taken aback but then came to the realization of what had happened. The means that PNC took to inform me about my overdrawn account was through a mailed letter... which i received almost a week after my account dropped below zero. Each day after I had irresponsibly overdrawn my account, PNC charged me a fee of $7. Even though I was entirely unaware as I awaited their snail mail. In the age of technology we are in, I would expect them to at least send an email or try notifying me in any other way. This was a huge disappointment but I blamed myself for the mistake in the first place.
This was entirely my own fault and I immediately took action to solve the problem by paying off the amount to get my account to a balance of zero. Now all I wished to do was close out the account. The first attempt I made was "too soon" after I had paid off the charges from overdrawing the account.  So I let the account sit for about a week. 

Then I called back during their customer service representative hours to close out my account tonight. After waiting on hold to terrible elevator music and wanting nothing but to put in ear plugs for about 15 minutes, I finally received a representative, Anita. I informed Anita that I had been wanting to close out my account for awhile now due to relocating and using a different banks services. She then told me that my account was overdrawn the small amount of $8.95 so she could do nothing to help me. I explained that I was confused as to why someone had tried to cash a check from my account today for that amount since I haven't touched the account in a couple of weeks and she said I'd have to call back tomorrow if I wanted to figure anything out. She was very rude and did not give me any information. I'll admit that I don't know everything about how banking and their processing works but I could not believe that I sat waiting for a customer service representative to not give me a single piece of advice or more than five minutes of her time. When I asked her if she could note that we spoke tonight regarding my concerns, she acted defensive and rude. I am very very disappointed with the customer service I received tonight and I hope that tomorrow I will be able to rid myself of this company and my account with them for good, because I have only faced problems and poor service lately. 

Whew, it feels good to get that off my chest.

I've been a customer of P&A for a few years now and what I appreciate most about them is that I was charged fairly for the work that they did do and where they could've easily charged me for another service, both Xenophon and Judah didn't. Instead, they educated me on how best to handle my situation on my own. Being that I was in a financial bind to begin with, the fact that they didn't take advantage of me speaks volumes.  This is why I recommend them to everyone I know.

We used Peters & Associates for our bankruptcy. They were amazing!  X Peters was wonderful and answered all of our questions. The court took all of 5 minutes and now we are debt free and ready to move on with our lives. I would highly recommend Peters & Associates to any of my friends or family!

If I could give zero stars I would!!! Court yesterday and my lawyer never showed!!!!! After waiting nearly an hour I represented myself and the trustee went on record that my lawyer was a no show!!! When leaving the courthouse who do I run into...my lawyer!!! She was returning from lunch, then proceeds to say it was a scheduling error, sorry. Sorry, are you for real?!?! Where were you when I needed you, you know the service I paid for! Still haven't received a phone call from the partners. And love that as a client you would have to pay $250 for no show/continuance but the attorneys rules don't apply to them. Would never recommend this place!

This was my first time having to deal with filing for bankruptcy. I was scared and had no idea what it was going to do to me financial or even how to file for it in the first place. I called PandA and set up a free consultation. They were very friendly and made me feel good about meeting them. I meet with Xenophon for my consultation. He was very informative and made me feel good about choosing them to do my bankruptcy. When ever I had a question I would email him and he always got back to me. My bankruptcy is now over and I have to say the office and staff of PandA made it a much easier process to deal with. I would highly recommend PandA to anyone I know.

I went to meet with Judah, and was surprised to meet both Judah and Xenophon!  They were both extremely patient, and answered question after question from me.  I thought I understood a lot more than I did about bankruptcy, but I walked out with a head full of knowledge about debt relief in general.  

They are two young lawyers and they seem hungry.  They told me that they were just about the only lawyers in town that were able to do a bankruptcy OR a debt settlement OR a loan modification OR a short sale.  I didn't realize how many options were open to me.  I'm underwater on my house and felt trapped.  I don't feel trapped any more, just from knowing how many choices I have.  

Here's the kicker: I talked to both lawyers for a long time, maybe 30 or 45 minutes.  I didn't sign anything, and I didn't give them any money.  I plan to, but haven't had the opportunity yet.  There was no pressure, and I feel like we parted friends.

I wanted to subtract a star at first because I was on time for our appointment, but still had to wait 10 minutes.  But after meeting and talking, I can't do that to these guys.  They made the time for me and answered every question I threw at them.  I can forgive the fact that they're busy people.  They did acknowledge their lateness and apologize, which only makes me like them more.

My husband and I thought Attorney Peters was informative, and very charming, soft spoken, and explained all of our questions, with much patience. We explained we originally had used the law firm Aaron and Patternoster, 6 years prior and our experience was not one where we would recommend our family and friends to use. Thank you Attorney Peters, for your patients with 2 seniors, who really appreciated, your patience, and understanding, in explaining all our concerns .  Victor and Dianne Corsaro... God Bless.

Friendly service every time and I love the drive-thru ATM.  It takes pictures of your cash and check deposits and adds the funds to your account quickly.  I've been banking with them for 8 years and they are great!

I hate this bank. Their drive thru is inefficient as well as most of the staff. Everyone always seems to be "busy" and not attentive. There's nothing worse than walking into a place with 3-5 people working and being told they will be right with you.  I know that there is other business besides walk ups and drive ups but that doesn't mean you should sacrifice fast, efficient service. It looks horrible from customers standpoint to be put second to other daily jobs when they're the ones right in front of you. I run a small business and don't have time to spend 20 minutes a day making a deposit or getting change.  I'm not sure if you need to hire more people or make the offices not visible to the public but something is not working. Peters and Associates is the best!  They handled my personal injury case and delivered exactly what they promised.  I highly recommend them to any one needing legal assistance.

This firm is the best!  They do great work and work really hard to make sure you are satisfied.  I couldn't imagine using any other firm for a loan modification.  I highly recommend Peters & Associates!!

From the day I stepped into their offices and met with Judah, a huge weight was lifted from my mind and I will forever be thankful for everything Judah did to get me a good loan modification deal with my lender! They offer fair payment plans, solid and clear advice, and professional service! I highly recommend Peters and Assoc. for your legal needs! Thank you, Judah

I highly recommend this law firm.  They do great work in lots of areas, but especially bankruptcies and issues with making home mortgage payments.  Xenophon and Judah have a great deal of expertise in these areas, and I rely heavily on their legal advice.

I really didn't know what to expect from a law firm I first learned about via a call-in Las Vegas radio show, but after spending over 2+ years unsuccessfully trying to solely negotiate a loan modification and eventual short sale on my own I was desperate.  Judah & his team--especially Kristen--worked absolutely tirelessly to resolve my case, and in just a few months my short sale was approved and both my 1st AND 2nd mortgage balances were completely forgiven!

During this process my property also experienced severe water damage and P&A intervened to ensure that the repairs were made and that the insurance funds were properly disbursed to the contractors involved--thereby preventing the funds from being confiscated by the mortgage holder(s) who could have applied the insurance $ to my outstanding loan balance(s) without my knowledge.  ALL of this for NO additional charge!!  

To this day, I still can't believe that a "saga" that took nearly 3 1/2 years to resolve is FINALLY over ONLY because of P&A Law.   VERY reasonable flat-rate fee--no $urprises or retainer$--and worth EVERY penny!!  Even more so, the sense of relief and peace of mind I am now able to feel is priceless.

For all of this & more I will forever be truly grateful that I just happened to be listening to that call-in radio show one Saturday afternoon not too long ago :-)

Judah and his team are awesome and they will be with you every step of the way.....Scott C.  Is very knowledgeable and can help with all your legal needs.  Give them a call for legal help and you will not regret it.

Everyone here is so nice! I'm not here very often, but I swear something's in the water because every time I come in everyone has a big smile for you. The branch is extremely clean, even by bank standards, and even when they're busy it's relatively quiet. They also have two drive up atms and one walk up atm as well.

Never using Bank of America again. Hidden fees everywhere, unable to make a credit card payment through the website, and then when I close my account I've gotten a new notice every month that I owe money from some fee. I've gone in to ask a banker for the last two months how to stop these fees and they tell me that it is closed and not to worry about it. Then the next month there are more. Still really have no idea how to stop these $32 payments from coming in every month for an account I closed in March. 

Also, bankers who are unable to answer basic questions. I asked how to receive my rewards points and they said that I can't get rewards points on Credit Cards. Then when I close my account I was told that I lost the $150 worth of rewards I had on the Credit Card. 

It's not even the money that's coming from them, but the time and effort it's taking to get them out of my life. It's like a bad ex girlfriend ;)

Please don't try to get me to open an account with you if I am there to pay for my credit card bills.  I left you for a reason, there's no need to try to lure me back in.  They removed the drive-thru services, so now everyone will have to go into the branch if you need to talk to someone face-to-face.

I had the most wonderful experience working with Richard to purchase my first home. Richard and his team worked with me for over a year while I was searching for the perfect home for me and for my budget. I received sound advice at every step along the way. I would recommend New Penn for all home loan guidance and services.

Home buying is stressful. Having the right team makes all the difference. Richard was an integral part of my team. He was very helpful in explaining everything and keeping things moving. He even made it easy for me to get things done while traveling. He was a real hero at the end when things were getting down to the wire.

Working with Richard and his team was such a wonderful experience. He provided guidance throughout the whole process. Very professional , helpful, knowledgeable and precise. Look no further, Richard will help make your refinance and home buying experience headache free

If you're looking for a knowledgable lender, look no further. Richard takes time to understand his clients needs and updates you every step of the way. You're never in the dark and he anticipates any issues that could come about so that everything keeps moving smoothly. I highly reccomend Richard and his team for assisting in one of the biggest purchases people make.

Working with Richard and his team was amazing. My wife and I recent refinanced with Richard, and the process was seamless. We will certainly continue to use Richard as  friendly, knowledgable, and honest help is incredible hard to find. Multiple family members of mine have since used Richard for various services and are just as pleased as we are.

My husband and I were incredibly fortunate to be able to work with Richard and his team for the purchase of our first home. On a personal level Richard was such a pleasure to work with: he was responsive, professional and helpful. We were so impressed that we recommended Richard and his team to our brother and his wife and they were just as pleased with the service they received. I would absolutely recommend Richard if you are looking for a great person to work with in securing the loan for your new home.

As newbie's to the homeowning process, we could not have chosen a better place to help us with our mortgage. Richard and his team at New Penn Financial were fantastic to work with and made the transition into our new home seamless and simple! Additionally, we were kept in the loop on the process and provided thorough detail on each step so that we fully understood everything. We could not have asked for a better experience. Insurance Restoration Services are quick and thorough. My house flooded, they came out, packed my belongings to store in their warehouse, and cleaned my house. No old water smell, no mildew smell, no attitude. They are so professional. Love this place! The asian girl sorry I didn't get her name is amazing. The customer service is spot on!

I am a real estate broker.  We had a bank owned listing that had some discoloration, which was tested and turned out to be black mold in every wet area of the house.  We called Insurance Restoration Services after a recommendation from a friend.  They came in, handled the project professionally and were actually able to keep our buyers happy so that they would still purchase the home.  They were super accommodating to my deadlines and got the job done very well.  I appreciate the help and they are now one of our companies preferred vendors!

I hired Rich to clean mold inside my unit at the MGM Signature and Rich did a fantastic job. Rich was extremely honest, respectful, and did everything that he promised he would do. I gave Rich and his crew some instructions and they followed my instructions to the T. I would seriously give Rich and Insurance Restoration Services 6 stars if I could. If you have any type of damage in your home, just call Rich and Insurance Restoration Services. You will be glad you did.

I ended up having a middle of the night water leak in my home. Based on previous reviews, I called IRS early that morning, and within an hour or so, I had Richard here surveying the damage. Right behind him came his crew, and in an impressively short amount of time from my first call to them, they had begun work!

Because he uses the latest in water detection equipment, Richard was able to show me exactly where water damage occurred...and where it had not...all before disturbing or cutting a single thing! It saved me from having any more of my home torn up than absolutely necessary. 

His crew is very professional and courteous. They were careful not to make a mess and always clean up after themselves. I was given constant updates as work progressed. 

Hopefully I will never need them again...but if I do, they would be the first company I'd call!

My home ended up getting flooded due to a leak in the toilet. Rich and his guy showed up within an hour and started working. I was relieved that he was able to show up so quickly to take care of this emergency. They worked all night sucking up all the water and drying out the carpet. They worked with my insurance company and made an otherwise tedious and confusing process very easy and straightforward. Hopefully you never end up with a home disaster like a flood or fire, but this is a great company to work with in case you do have any type of home damage.
It was a real pleasure talking to Heidi R., she answered all my questions and got me the help i needed RIGHT away. Thank you very much

IRS came immediately and spent days working long hours to get our home back to some semblance of normal after we had a massive flood. Returned from a vacation on a Fri night and entire house was full of water. Was easy to get in touch w IRS and they explained the entire process as they cleared water from the house. Best remediation in Vegas. A neighbor had a flood and wasn't nearly as pleased with the company she used.

I use Insurance Restoration Services on all of my water and fire losses. I manage the office of MRC Builders and we always have good feedback from our customers when we send in IRS to do the mitigation ahead of us. I have seen hundreds of other jobs from restoration companies and they aren't as clean or timely as IRS. IRS cares about their customers and making the process easy through a challenging time. I strongly refer IRS for all mitigation work.

Perfect from the first phone call.  I talked to Rich.  He took the time to explain the whole proceess.  He answered my questions.  No pressure, no sales techiniques, no bs just the facts.  He came to my house and it was more of the same.  The crew came in to do the demolition and dry out.  Mike and Henry were extrememly professional.  They were very friendly and courteous.  They stopped what they were doing to addess my questions and concerns before proceeding.  The damage was so stressful and they did not cause any additional stress to me.  In fact, they helped me feel a little better considering.  I am 110% satisified and can fully recommend them.

We used Rich and his team to address some water damage on the floors of a rental property.  Not only did the team get the job done right, and in a short period of time, but Rich also walked us through some of the insurance pitfalls that could have a been a major waste of time and money for us.  I don't hope to have an emergency flood damage need again, but if so, we would use IRS Vegas in a heartbeat!!

As a Consulting Firm having Clients as amazing as Rich and Mindy at IRS is a dream!  Our consultants and our company highly recommend their work , their tests do not fail and coordinating with them is a breeze.  Their clients are always super happy with the work and we pride in having clients who care about the quality of what they do. Rich has many years of experience and it definitely shows! IRS Knows so much, and can guide you through every step of the way.  I know if anything happens in my home who I would call. More then Highly Recommended!
This company took a big problem with our house and made the correction of our water damage easy to handle. They are professional and get the job done quickly and easily!

This guy is great! He checked the water damage with a cool device that lets you see where the moisture is behind the walls!  He let us know that the damage was much smaller than thought and saved us from having to rip out the entire shower like another company said!! Gave us advise on what to do next and left without even taking a tip! Will definitely call again if we need help.p

I appreciate the customer service and great communication between myself and Insurance Restoration Services. It's like my house was never set on fire in the first place. They communicated with my insurance company so I never had to deal with that. :)

Rich was responsive to all communication and he was very honest when he came to check out our issue. We purchased a home that was built in 1977 and we are doing our demolition and came across a big patch (6 ft by 6 ft) of mold on the drywall and studs in one of the rooms. Rich came and checked it out and was very thorough with his inspection. In the end, he provided his honest assessment and provided us some DIY tips to clean it up, which we absolutely appreciated. The mold isn't "alive" and there's no dampness, so take some bleach and water solution and wipe it down to clean it up. 
Cost: $0
Great advice and it was truly a free consultation. 

Thanks Rich!!

We have some water stains on our ceiling and were thinking the absolute worst! After the bad rains this past week we thought we better get these checked out ASAP! We will call him should we have an emergency or need some restoration on the house!

When I discovered that my house smelled like cigarettes, thanks to its prior tenant, Insurance Restoration Services came out very quickly with the ozone machine!  Their team is extremely professional, efficient, and reasonably priced!  Thank you so much for your help, Rich!
very professional company  !!! Very helpful .. responds quickly .. nice people .. very knowledgeable  !

This company is outstanding! If I could give them a 6 star rating I would.  Not only did they offer the most competitive pricing, but extremely professional service as well. I love the atmosphere in this office!!  These are 'realist' business people you'll ever meet!  Jon and Amanda are professional but lots of fun, very informative and always have what's most beneficial to me at heart!  Love, Love, Love these guys!!

This group is amazing to work with. They make the process easy and fast with great coverage and rates. Brad has always been right there for us, with awesome professionalism and courtesy. I opened my account at this location 3 months ago but have had the same stellar service at every location I've visited. This excellence is no accident and MUST be company wide. 

This bank is family owned and it shows in the quality of service. Everyone is very friendly, professional and knowledgeable. I'm greeted with GENUINE smiles and pleasant attitudes every time I go in.  

Upon opening my account, my debit/Visa card showed up on time and I activated it by calling the customer service number. Even the phone representative was super friendly and pleasant. I am happy to say I was wrong. I still continue to receive first class service.

The bank locations are very clean with higher end interior design. Convenient hours. 

This is banking like it should be. Other businesses could use this bank as a perfect business model. 

Oh yes.......very very FEW fees (other bank ATMs and those are refunded at the end of the month!).

Top Notch Customer Service. I was in last week an opened a new account. The representative that assisted Shea was knowledgeable and made the account opening process smooth and quick. The branch is conveniently located and beautifully designed.

No, my 14 year  old doesn't want a savings account for the birthday check grandma sent. If I have an account and cosign, the words, 'bank fraud' should never be used in conjunction with a child's birthday present. I don't care if It is policy.

The place was packed due to the holiday rush. The line was long and I can't ding them for the customer's lacking. They were working pretty fast in trying to get people in and out. The teller was efficient in getting my specific requests accomplished. Good service.

Great wells Fargo. One of my favorite ones in this area. They make sure your taken care of as much as they can. Every time i go through the drive through they know i have a little one in the back and will always send a sucker out.

So I asked my wife to open a credit card with azccu. We get home and we can't log in to the account. She went back to the bank and took care of it. Next, she received two credit cards. I've had an account with Arizona Central Credit Union for years and I love them.  They have excellent customer service and low fees.
