Anyway, I've never had a single issue with AZCCU. 

Another big plus for AZCCU is, like other credit unions, I can make a deposit or withdrawl at any other credit union because they are all linked by something called shared branching.  That is very nice if I need to make a deposit to my account and I am miles away from a AZCCU branch.

This branch has great customer service every time we use their drive-thru ATMs. The reason I'm not giving ACCU five stars is that they've recently tacked on a bunch of fees for services that were previously free. Had a great experience with Holly making my banking quick and easy!! Made my day and it's rare to get great customer service these days but this bank has it down!

We needed to acquire health insurance on our own (as in, not through an employer). It's crazy trying to wade through all of the choices that are available. Trish C at Nevada Benefits knows all of the companies, their different plans and types of coverage - takes time to listen to your individual situation and then helps you choose which type of coverage and plan is right for you. 

I first met Trish in August 2013 when our COBRA medical coverage was ending from Tim's previous job. She was super nice and patient, explained everything very clearly and really helped us sort out our options. We decided that a short-term "catastrophic"  type of policy would cover us for six months until either our job situation changed or until the new government insurance plans kicked in. The six month policy, instead of a long-term policy with all of its hoops to jump through, saved us thousands of dollars in premiums and a ton of time in medical questionnaires and the qualification process. The best thing is, we didn't use the insurance the whole six months. We were covered if something major happened and were prepared to cover the expenses if it was something minor - but nothing medical ever happened - nothing at all ! It was a roll of the dice that we wouldn't encounter minor medical issues or a broken bone or something in these six months but it worked out really well. 
 
Now more recently, with Tim still being an independent contract employee and not being under the umbrella of a company that provides health insurance, Trish has again helped sort out the differences between companies and plans (and different levels of coverage in the different plans!)  I had a ton of random and specific questions and she always responded quickly to emails and phone calls - would email me different breakdowns in plans, along with the prices -listened to me talk about the differences and steered me in the direction that was right for us based on what level of risk we felt comfortable in taking. She treated me so nicely and was even more patient than the first time - is professional and yet would joke around with me at the same time. Now we have a health insurance plan that will work out for us until a change in job situation - it's good for peace of mind for sure. The plan we chose is definitely way more expensive than the short-term plan (and some of the long-term plans !) but it looks to be something that will cover us and protect us not just for emergencies or major major things, but for minor and even preventive care/screenings as well. 

Without insurance coverage provided by a job, the cost is all ours. It would be really tempting to try to live with more minimal health insurance - but with no crystal ball to know what will happen in the future, there's no way we can do this. It's a real maze if you've always had coverage from work and then suddenly you choose to go out on your own. USE THIS COMPANY ! Trish and the rest of the Nevada Benefits staff are very friendly, easy to talk with, very experienced and confident and really enjoy what they do. . . and it really comes across in the way they interact. It has been so great working with them.

Brent Leavitt, CFP with Nevada Benefits is by far the most knowledgable, friendly and extremely helpful Advisor, we all know how difficult and frustrating it is to purchase the right health plan, Brent made the entire process simple and he explained the plan thoroughly, I couldn't be happier with the service he provided! 

Brent,

Thank you so much! You have been extremely helpful, I will definitely recommend you to family and friends, you were very patient, took the time to understand my insurance needs and provided the best plan for me, you made the application process extremely simple as you did all of the work on my behalf. The entire signing up process you provides was professional, friendly and your expertise with the healthcare insurance plans were extremely helpful. Thank You Brent!! 

If anyone out there is looking for health insurance, Brent is your guy!! 

Thank you, thank you, thank you Brent!! 

Sincerely,
Laila

I wanted to post a review because I really think these guys know what they're doing. I've done H&R Block, and even attempted to do my taxes by myself this year but I actually had to have someone fix them!!  I've used Liberty at Detroit for a few years now and it's totally painless.  They're really nice and will explain anything I don't understand. I'll be back again this year....

Worst mannered and discriminatory service I've had in banking. If you are an immigrant I don't recommend this bank at all. Phone operators will be rude to you even if you're in the right, and each representative will say a different thing than the next one.

For those who don't know the principle of Tangerine, it's a bank without any brick-and-mortar branches; they claim to offer an alternative to traditional banking with their online services. To compensate the fact that they don't have any branches, they offer phone customer service 7 days a week 24 hours a day + online chat sessions. If you really want to talk with a real human in front of you, they have this "Café Tangerine" where you can talk to Tangerine employees. Cool concept! 

Pros: 
Given that their only physical presence is the café Tangerine, they do a huuuuge amount of savings on rent expenses; that makes them able to give A LOT of services for free that the other banks can not afford: for example, a free checking account with unlimited transactions, for everyone!! They even give money for free: when you refer a friend, both of you win a 50$ reward in your account (sometimes it's only 25$). Now let's talk about their online banking: it's ok. There are very useful features with their mobile app, such as the one that allows you to deposit your cheques with just a picture of the front and the back of the cheque. Other banks do that too, so nothing exceptional, it's the same as the online service I have with RBC, but still pretty useful and it works very well. 

Cons: I guess they had to pay a price for all the savings they do with their no-branch system, and the price to pay is definitely a lot of problems with their customer service. 
The chat simply doesn't work. EVERYTIME I tried to chat with somebody it says: "All of our chat team Associates for Saving and Chequing are online with other Clients right now. Please try starting another chat session later.", and it's not me in particular, I saw the same comments about the chat service in a lot of other reviews. 
Their phone service:  terribly long wait time, always. 
Regarding the 50$ awards when I refer a friend, yes it does work, and I made 150$ referring 3 friends; BUT I always had to run after them to have the reward, which means waiting forever on the phone to talk to somebody. 
For me as a young student who has a lot of free time it's not a big deal, but for dynamic professionals, I guess they have other things to do than running after 50$ rewards and that they would rather pay fees and have a good service. 

Regarding the service at their Café, I went once and it was ok. It was fast to deposit a cheque, but for more complex questions, they just connected me to the phone help.  They were very friendly, simple, less boot-licker than RBC (lol). It was very relaxing to sit and have a coffee there.

Overall : the Cafe is a cool concept, and it's a good bank if you only want to do online transactions and save a lot on banking fees. I use my Tangerine checking account to manage a family budget, so 99% of the operations are just online transactions to other accounts; in that point of view, I am totally satisfied with Tangerine, but I would never use it for day-to-day banking.

Very easy to use as an online bank, good smart phone app and web service. Went to the cafe one time because I was having problems; they just connected me to the phone help (which I could have done anyway)

Friendly enough staff but I have yet to find a reason to go back in person.

Worse service you can get. Please stay away from this bank specially this branch. You can't get a hold of anyone ever. I left several messages and no one ever bothered to get back to me. Worse experience for short amount of time.

I should say that I was referred by a good friend that got a loan from them and had a good experience. I was expecting a smooth process both based on my friend's experience and my history with loans. I am 840 credit, annual income better than the property value, and 25% down.  

John Edwards was not helpful and tried to charge in excess of 8k in fees on a real estate lot loan that I would have less than 6 months!! It would have been cheaper and less painful to get a loan from a loan shark. A week after expressing discontent at the insane costs (and my decision to pay cash for the property) an appraisal was apparently ordered and $325 was demanded.  

John insisted that I had agreed to the appraisal (signed in my packet) so I asked for copies of authorization of the appraisal and was refused multiple times. I asked if I would be able to use the appraisal for a future construction loan and he refused to even answer that question... It was a silly interaction and very unprofessional on his side. To top it off, apparently asking for copies of my authorization made him mad because just 4 days after being notified of the payment for appraisal, he gave me 4.5 hours to pay it or take me to collections. 

This is a company/person at the top of the avoid at all costs list!  Despite many emails back and forth, John continues to refuse to provide a copy of this document. Ironically had he told me he had ordered it without me authorizing in order to expedite I would have felt compelled to pay for it. Had it applied to a future loan, that would have been a bonus. At this point I believe he has outright lied about it and threatened me (all communication via email, and have to provide to anyone wanting) not only with collections, but also with a threat to share personal information "when my business(es) come up in conversation".  I never attacked this man, and kept all interaction professional whereas he has resorted to name calling and threats...

I'm shocked at his insane responses and would encourage any and all to steer clear (and definitely not provide and personal information).

(I will update this should any more action happen/take place). Very disappointed.

Mendoza approached us and was nice at first but then looked at us like we were crazy when we were asking where this random debit card number came from. he was trying to tell us we had another card open and that we couldn't and it didn't work like that even though we didn't even have a card with this number on it. we knew what we were talking about and he yet still insisted he was right until he pulled up our account and we pointed out the mistake. A follow up to my previous post: Two things have happened since our exit as customers of Wells Fargo. 1.) We still get emails asking us to do our banking online. Thete is no "unsubscribe" and no way to opt out of communications, and 2.) We were victims of the recently exposed Wells Fargo employees scam to open phony accounts, debit cards and credit cards. At the time of each occurence, a Wells Fargo "banker"explained it was a security plan by the bank to open shadow accounts (their words, not mine) for customers. Now we know at least 5300 employees have been terminated and Wells Fargo paid a near $190,000,000 fine in California.

After more than 20 years being a Wells Fargo customer... checking and savings accounts, CDs, mortgage loans and line of credit, business accounts, ...used a lot of their services, including domestic and international wire transfers. During the last 10 years or so, the personnel at the three branches I used (Anthem Center, Hampton Road and Bicentennial) have become less knowledgeable and much less willing to be helpful. In fact, what has prompted this review is yet another mistake and lack of good judgement. This one cost me time and money to fix not to mention the stress it created for me. The "banker's lack of concern and treating me like I am an idiot was the proverbial LAST STRAW. No one at Wells Fargo will care that I am gone along with my accounts, but acquiring a customer to take my place isn't cheap.  It felt good to walk out of Wells Fargo today knowing I would never have to go there again.

One Of the worst pawn shops I have ever dealt with. These guys are so cheap and so rude. They are very stand offish and could care less of what your going thru. This pawn shop has a security gate and sometimes some seedy looking folks trying to sell something stolen. The products available for purchase are televisions, computers, laptops, dvd players, stereos, game consoles, dvds, blu-ray discs, a few musical instruments, gold, guns, and tools. 

I suppose I just described just about every pawn shop. The prices here suck. I imagine the buy prices are terrible. The people that run the place I wouldn't trust to park my car - or stand behind me in line at the bank for that matter. Actually it kinda makes me uncomfortable that they are right down the street from me. 

Did I mention this place has guns? So many guns. If you need to kill something, they have shotguns, knives and handguns and I think I even saw a crossbow. It's actually an interesting visit wandering around the tiny shop. They have a few nice things... the prices are damn near retail prices on items that haven't been a retail item for a few years - for example, they sell a 3 year old desktop that cost 499 new for 399. Just keep your money in your pocket (and your hand in there as well to protect it) and you'll be fine. 

__

I have been with RIS for four years and they are by far the best retirement insurance specialist in Phoenix. I have referred six if my friends to Justin and they are now customers. Their attention to detail and customer service is outstanding.  Tgey get my highest recommendation. 

Terry Sherman

I have been with them for 13 years, and I would highly recommend him and his team to anyone for all  types of insurance.  I have been completely satisfied with all of their services.  They have taken care of my personal insurance and business insurance since I moved to Las Vegas 13 years ago. They take are of my workers comp insurance, car insurance, business insurance, home insurance, rental property insurance and all of our life policies.  There are so many more aspects to my families lives that they insure and I would not go to any other insurance agency. My trust in Jeff Venuto, Devicia Venuto and the Venuto Farmers team far exceeds any other insurance agents/ agency I would trust.  Their staff is very friendly and knowledgeable. It is not often I would recommend someone/ some business with such high regard, but the Venuto agency comes with my highest regard. They are the best and deserve far more than 5 stars!

If we can add more stars for the review...we would.
Amazing team.  Ever so attentive.  A prime example of what not just an insurance agent should be but  prime example what all business should be..... Hands down best service..best follow through...best team...best company...best in Vegas.

Jeff and D are the best in the business. We initially came for a homeowner's insurance when our insurance went up. We ended up setting our homeowners, auto, and life insurance with Jeff and D; One stop shop for all your insurance needs. By having all our insurance fulfilled by Jeff and D (Farmers Insurance), it is more convenient handling all insurance business related matters and we get the most effective discount. Service is top notch! Service is very personal and very individualizing. Not everyone can fit in the same cookie cutter product. With Jeff and D, they listen carefully to your needs.  Afterwards, they do what they do best in the business which to find the product that meets your criteria.  Think of them as your tailors for your insurance. With the services they provide, one would think one would have to pay more...think again. I, personally, saved at least $1,000 a year average by using their services with my home, auto, and life combined when compared to my previous multiple insurance carriers. They have an excellent business model. They grow their business by earning your business for life.  Once you switch over with them, your expectations from your insurance carrier customer service skyrockets. NO other business can compare; they set the bar sky-high. Anytime I have a question or I need something, they are always there to take care of us. It's like talking to your friend not a 1-800 multiple redirects. In fact, you get so personal that I wouldn't be surprise that not only that you would have an insurance agent for life; you will also have a friend for life. They are your mom-and-pop shop that you want to support.

this man is a crook! He lied to me about my auto insurance rate and coverage, if I hadn't caught his error I would have been without car insurance for 2 weeks, luckily I caught it first. Then I realized he lied about my rate. He bought my term life insurance from another agent and when I tried for months to cancel it he wouldn't even call me back to tell me how to do it, instead he just kept deducting my payments through my back account. This man makes Farmer's insurance look bad. Stay clear he can not be trusted, either can his office.

I've never been happier! Customer service is top notch. A simple phone call and this team is on it. I've dealt with a lot of different insurance companies in my past and they by far go above and beyond. I now have all the services they offer. I also refer all my real estate clients to them cause I know and trust their customer service and product! Give them a call and watch what happens!
Jeff and his team are great! Always there to help with whatever pops up. Super knowledgable and looking out for the insurance products and packages for your needs.

The best and friendliest insurance agency I have ever experienced! Jeff is the man when it comes to anything and genuinely cares about you and your well being. Been going to him for several years now and have all of my insurance needs handled by him and his wife. If you are looking for a new agent or new insurance do not hesitate to go see him, but be ready to be blown away!! :)
Absolutely the best agents and agency I've ever known. Top notch professionalism.  Jeff and Devecia go above and beyond the call of duty for me at the drop of a hat. Love u guys.

Super friendly staff. As soon as I walked in I was greeted right away and directed to where I need to be to get what I needed taken care of. The branch manager and the account manager both went above and beyond in resolving my issue for me. I am one happy wells Fargo customer!

I am now the proud [AND informed] owner of a Roth IRA! Much thanks to Francisco, Kris, and Sonja for pooling their knowledge to answer all of my questions and help me make the decision that will best benefit me in the future.

I graduated a little over a year ago and had a TON of questions about general financing for... life! With little to no knowledge of what I should be doing with my money, I scheduled a meeting with Francisco to cover all of this. I was nervous he would get annoyed with so many questions, but he was very patient, understandable and friendly! We pulled in Kris and Sonja to help with a few things and they were equally pleasurable. In addition to answering my questions, they let me know about other related services I can take advantage of in the future. It makes me so happy to know that they care about helping me, and understand that money can be stressful. Wells Fargo is the best. 

Every time I walk into this branch, someone is eager to help with whatever--from a simple deposit to financial planning for life. They understand that money can be unnerving and confusing, and they will put in their time to make sure you leave better off than when you arrived. That being said, some of these processes can take time (I was in the office for about an hour and a half) but you will be so happy you took that time to cover everything. I am so happy with what we got done during my visit Saturday, and I'm looking forward to returning to talk about other future financial ventures!
Tom is awesome! He goes out of his way to help you get the right coverage and save money! Tom is a great guy!

Awesome guy! Great customer service! Great communication!! I got a lot of quotes and phone calls when I was buying my house but I never spoke with an actual agent in my city except Tom...and he actually had a nice personality on the phone!! Best of all he gave me the best quote out of 4 different companies I spoke with.

Tom is amazing to work with. He talks to you like a real person and puts everything in easy to understand terms. The customer service here is unmatched. I highly recommend stopping by and checking them out if you need insurance or would like to save some cash.

Tom is not only a great insurance agent I consider him a friend, he's first class.3450 N Buffalo Dr, Las Vegas, NV 89129
Northwest

Not certain why this location has such a low rating. Every time I visit, it is very clean and well managed by staff. The tellers are very professional, nice and accommodating. I hate going to the bank but these employees make it not so bad. 

If you're in the area and need to make a BofA run, I don't find any issues stopping here. It's pretty much on par for me. Kudos!
1 teller and the line till the door. 3 people behind teller and No one takes responsibility to help other clients to speed up the process. Very bad customer service.

today was my first and last visit.

we have a mortgage loan through b of a and i have made the payment myself at 2 other locations no problem whatsoever.

some lady who sounded scottish, first attempted to help with a slight attitude i did not at ALL appreciate.

"how can i help you"
"i need to make a mortgage loan payment."
"ok..''

long pause as i set the money on the counter.

unsure what she was waiting for i finally said, its not under my name its my husband..

'ok do you have a receipt'

um, no?

'do you have the account number'

no.

then with a heavy sigh and an attitude, she replied
"ok then lets start with what you DO have."

so i snapped back..
"THE MONEY."

'hold on.'
as she gets her manager..

'she doesnt have any information and she wants to make a mortgage payment.'

so miss manager now partakes in this inconvenient situation.

she tells me that without my name on the account and without an account number she cannot accept the money.

how odd..
i have made the payment myself on three different occasions in which all that was asked was what the name on the account and address to the property was.

her response
'well we cant do that.'

so i went to two different locations with no problem and now you guys suddenly cannot accept a payment because i have no information you claim to need?

'well those locations are not following procedure.'

so you mean to tell me out of three banking locations all over town, you are the ONLY store following policy and procedure?

i highly doubt that.
first of all,
very unprofessional to throw the other locations under the bus like that, and second, the original teller that was helping could lose the attitude.

then on top of that an employee NOT EVEN INSIDE THE BUILDING AT THE TIME THE SITUATION OCCURED, chased behind me as i left.

lady,
i already spoke to two different associates and made it real apparent you guys were inconvenient as all hell, you really think i wanna stop and speak to you?
i have shit to accomplish today, and because your bank is SO great at policy and procedure, i now have to go to ANOTHER b of a to complete the transaction.

which i DID by the way.

thanks for nothing, Margarita.

This company as a whole is ridiculous I've never been with a bank who looks for as many excuses to take your money.... Never again. Us bank and chase have treated me very well and I will stick with them.

Very unimpressed. They have one teller only at the first of the month. Waited in line for over 35 minutes. She actually got pulled to the front of the line and was helped. She might have been there 15 minutes total. I guess the moral of the story is make a huge scene so they take care of you? New management necessary

I think I have finally found my 'home' with a bank. I have been with Wells Fargo for 4 years. here is my list of postitives and negatives.

positives:
- 24 hr customer service
- great online banking
- many locations
- text banking
- free checking for students
-upgraded to the next free checking account and now i get free checks too!
- AWESOME savings plans. you can set goals, time limits, auto transfers and it will tell you how close you are to your savings goal. i LOVE this feature.


negatives:
- you have to have your account number (not your debit card number) when you call. maybe im crazy for not having it memorized but it's a pain in the butt
- they charge you for the phone call if they think you could have been able to handle it online yourself( if you call and complain they will usually take care of it)
- there is a $10 transfer fee if you move money from your accounts too frequently or if they need to pull from your savings for overdraft protection
- when i first opened my account i was ready to start building my credit score but had really young credit and they wouldn't give me a student card without paying a huge down payment first. i went elsewhere to open my first credit card but it would have been nice to have them all on one website. Chase ended up taking a chance on me and I have been with them for a few years now(credit card wise, not checking!) and have been satisfied.

I currently have three banks: Wells Fargo, Desert Schools, and Chase. I use them all fairly equally. This particular branch is very nice. Everyone always acknowledges you when you walk into the branch and when you are leaving. The tellers will ask you how your day or weekend was and they have fairly fast at getting you on with your day, which I like. Overall, I would recommend this particular branch because I haven't had any issues. 

The lines have always been short around 11 am on weekdays (right before the noon lunch people get there). I haven't been to this bank on the weekends because it is by my work.

This review applies to most Wells Fargo branches, but this one in particular. I'll also disclaim upfront that I'm not a deadbeat. I always keep a fair amount of money in the bank and never overdraw my accounts. Then how could I have a problem with a bank?

They wouldn't take my money! Yep, that's right. I walk in with a check written from my partner's Money Market Account from his broker. Now maybe there are a lot of deadbeats out there that walk around writing bad checks from their brokers account, but I'm not one of them. 

I so long for my local bank back in Chicago that called me by name, allowed me to cash checks without ID and were generally much friendlier. 

At Wells Fargo they ALWAYS ask "How are you today?" Like they really freakin care. No they were brainwashed to ask that. And then when you have a deposit over $2,000 they give you the third degree and have to call for teller assistance. Why not just train the tellers in the first place how to do their jobs? By all means don't take any large deposits to the grocery store branches they'll never be able to help you out. I think it's the training ground before you go to a real branch.

Wells Fargo = banking Wal-Mart style. NO - THANK - YOU!

I do NOT like Wells Fargo banks! 

I am not writing about this branch specifically, I am writing about EVERY one I have been in within the last year or so. I have a business account here that has myself and my 2 other business partners on it. The only interaction I ever really need to have is depositing rent checks- that's it. It should be so simple, but for some reason it NEVER is! Whether I drive up or walk in, it is by far the longest deposit process of any bank I have ever been to. For reals, it takes me about 5-7 minutes (yes I have timed it) once I am at the teller window. 

So today, I walk in and hand over my check and my slip. After a looooong pause (and way more typing than I believe is required to process my deposit) she asks me to confirm my home address, NOT the business address on the account. I do it, realizing later that I just confirmed some marketing departments opportunity to flood me with crap mail. Then she asks me to confirm my name... yes my name. I do it. She then asks me to sign the check right below where I have clearly written "For Deposit Only" and the account number. I do it. Looooooooong pause........ more typing. 

"You're all set, have a great day, sorry I stole 7 minutes of your life" (I added that last part). 

Wells Fargo, I am NOT your fan! Peace out!

I moved here about 6 months ago.  I took out our mortgage with WF and they opened 2 checkiing and one savings account for me, and I was told I would not have any fees associated with this account.  Since that time, I have had to reopen all accounts because of some sort of breach in online banking, and now have been receiving charges for the accounts.  When checking in to it, they are going to start charging me, for no particular reason.  In order to get my free checking, I had to open 2 new accounts to replace one of the accounts, and "jerry rig" 2 transactions per month to go back and forth between 4 accounts in order to do this.  Of course that means new checks, fees for this, etc.  Now I log on to my account to find that I have no access to any of my accounts for past statements, even the ones that did not change.  When I called, the rep acted like I should know this.   They are a very unreasonable bank to deal with.  When I find another bank, I will be moving on.

The turn over rate is fairly high here for tellers but it seems to be for good reasons - they are often being promoted. Very friendly people but this location is definitely a busy one. If you're going to try the drive thru teller I would suggest hitting it before 4:30pm if at all possible. There are only two at this location- the third lane is a drive up ATM.

For those that know me, you know that I rarely spend my time writing negative reviews.  I tend to lean towards writing positive reviews for those establishments that are epic.

This time, I just had to write this.  I learned more in five minutes inside this "credit union" than I thought possible.

I have just moved down the street from this business.  As I was out shopping, I figured I would stop by and use the ATM and then look into this credit union.  Having done that and paid the $4 transaction fee, I walked up to a teller.  It should be noted that from the ATM to the teller (about 30 feet) I watched a supervisor/manager scolding an employee publicly.  Everyone could hear it.  

Back to the teller.  As I approached, she asked what she could help me with.  I asked her to exchange some bills from the ATM for a couple of larger ones and was starting to ask her about an account, but she literally cut me off with "do you have an account?" to which I replied "no, not yet" and she matter of factly stated that she could not help me and that I would need to get my business done elsewhere.  She was extremely rude.  The lunacy of my having just taken money out of their ATM and there refusal to exchange a few bills for a larger denomination baffles me, but it was truly her attitude that cemented my decision to leave.  She even went on to say that maybe I should take my business to Wells Fargo.  I was stunned.

Between her and the manager yelling at the other employee, it was easy for me to see that this was DEFINITELY not a place I wanted to be associated with and I stated that I definitely would not open an account and left.

If this is what an ordinary customer sees in 5 minutes inside this place, it is apparent that this credit union is very broken and you may be better with your financial needs elsewhere.

'nuf said.

I've been using this branch since it opened and have never had any issues with customer service. Everyone has always been polite and helped me with exactly what I needed. I've had to bring my small children in with me several times and the employees go out of their way to interact with them, giving them stickers and such.

I have been in sured by Lynn Hennessy for 12 years.  I just spent the afternoon with her and her FABULOUS assistant Judy reviewing all of my insurance and making sure I had enough coverage for me and my daughter.  The passion these ladies have on educating you on insurance is amazing.  Lynn also sits down with each teenage driver before they become insured and goes through an AMAZING presentation showing them how their insurance goes up if they get a ticket, or a DUI.  You can tell she is an agent who goes above and beyond.  I really enjoy working with Lynn and her team, they work very hard and out of integrity.  That is hard to find in the insurance world now adays.  Go TEAM HENNESSY!
Very helpful and responsive staff.  Their customer service is top notch.

There are few agents who care so much about their clients. Lynn and her office are very knowledgeable with the services they provide and willing to take the time and explain them. Not many agents will call their insured during the claims process to ensure the experience is as smooth and painless as possible. I have personally experienced the care and concern Lynn had for her insureds during a claim.  I would highly recommend anyone who is looking for an insurance agent who is genuinely interested and personable to contact Lynn's office today!

Don't bother to come in. I was banking here for 5 years and today I closed my safety deposit box. I waited for 45 minutes to get access to my box and decided it doesn't worth it. They are saving $$$ by replacing employees with ATM machines. It does not work!!!!!!

This chase is stupid as hell now, when did it get renovated and remove all of the tellers and replace it with two stupidly large iPhone-looking "ATMs" god forbid people have jobs. One star for the drive thru ATM (and because I can't give it zero)
Nice, brand new bank

I've bank with Chase Bank for 5+ years already and I really enjoy using all Chase ATM's.  There are 2 drive-thru ATM's and 1 ATM inside the branch. EVERYONE at this WF is friendly & the one on Green Valley Pkwy, but let me continue on about who & why this St. Rose location is 5 star.

Edgar offered us water when we walked in.  The drive-up teller didn't have any cars coming thru so she came over to help the tellers.  Phil came in from his short break & offered us a water again on the way out.  

Cindy the manager was behind the tellers greeting everyone in line & as you walk up to the teller.  If the line is long, everyone pulls together w/ a smile on their face to quickly help.

I am a recent convert to Silver State School Credit Union.  I switched to SSSCU when I got married a couple of years ago because my husband had been a member for a long time and liked them more than my bank.  My last bank was such a headache with everything and anything you would need from a bank, so I was ready for a change! Luckily I married a SSSCU member!

I have been slowly closing out my other accounts and moving my stuff to SSSCU because of the great customer service.  I decided to switch over because this bank was so much better than the one I was with before hand.  This bank has just been so helpful, great with customer service, and it offers good rates, especially for a local credit union.  

Now speaking of this branch specifically...Such a great location!  The most important part of the branch is that it is a regular store front with an outside ATM available 24/7.  Many of SSSCUs are located within grocery stores.  Normally this isn't a big deal, but I have a small baby and getting her in and out of the car just to go to the bank is a pain in the butt, especially since she usually falls asleep in the car ride over.  And remember, you never wake up a sleeping baby, if you don't have too!  Having a stand alone location with an ATM in front means I can get the quick ATM run done without having to get the baby out of the car.

This location also has a branch available for when you need to speak with someone personally.  It seems to be a secret because when I have gone inside, there is rarely a line and if there is one, it may be 1 person ahead of me.  What a blast it is to be in and out without having to waste an hour just waiting in line.

The people at SSSCU are also quite lovely.  Everyone is happy and nice.  It is also a pleasure to walk in because everyone smiles at you if you catch their eye.  No grumps here!  I hope it always stays that way.

So if you need a new bank and can qualify for SSSCU, go sign up because I bet they are nicer than your bank is currently.

I was in line at the drive-through for 15 minutes and noticed that no teller ever came to assist the person in the drive-through before me so I backed out of the drive through and came into the lobby and found a line 7 customers deep with one teller. Terrible planning on behalf of the branch. I will likely never come back!

Very bad experience when I went for opening checking and savings account today. I have four chase credit cards and still they wanted lot of documentation. Made me wait for an hour and then asked me for a documentation which I don't have. Decided not to open account finally, happy with Bank Of America. Funny part is Chase is ok to lend me money via credit cards but they don't like me giving them funds via checking and savings.
Lamise and Mindi are the best!  Their customer service is fantastic.  Chase got it right with these two.  They are definitely Key employees.

I was going to use 1 Stop for a DMV related issue because they are close to my home.  I called and tried to ask a quick generic question anyone answering the phone should be able to answer. I was quickly cut off and transferred.   I was on hold for 9 minutes when someone picked up and quickly said "sorry picked up the wrong line".   Back on hold 6 minutes.    I hung up and will never go there.   Terrible customer service.  Whoever owns this, your staff is just throwing money out the window.

Having a loan on my car is a very scary experience... 
Luckily, One Stop Title Loans has made the experience very easy and painless for me. I am working on paying off my 3rd loan with them and will never go to another company.  Sonya and Jennifer always help me to ensure that my visits go quickly and smoothly. Overall working with One Stop has been great and I would definitely recommend them as a short term financial fix for a friend or family member.

I love State Farm. They literally saved me $100 dollars on my car insurance. The Girls there are very friendly and welcoming!  State Farm has such a differnet feel than all the other agencies. The office feels warm friendly and inviting as opposed to other places. I refered my cousin and my sister and state farm was able to save them at least $20 a motnth each.  They made me really happy since I am on such a limited budget. I would recommend the mto anyone if theyre looking to save money!

Eric is the WORST agent I have ever dealt with!  From not adding a driver to my policy when I spoke with him directly. (I called and questioned his office when I got a summary and was told he was on there. It wasn't until I received a check from State Farm for overpayment that it came out that he failed me as a customer.)  I called about a false claim someone was trying make & of course my agent cant help me.  I contacted the claims department they assured me they wouldn't pay out anything, I called after 90 days & was told nothing was paid and it was closed.  Of course when I started a new policy they did payout on the claim. . . . . . . Now after cancelling with Eric directly I am still receiving a bill from state farm for a policy I canceled before I was due again and now State Farm is calling me as well.  Of course I cant get a hold of anyone at Eric's office to resolve this.  All I can say is DO NOT use this agent!!

I was recommended by a close friend to go to Ron: an older, good humored, friendly man who made doing our taxes incredibly easy! Went into the office and was immediately greeted by Peggy at the front desk (who was even extremely nice on the telephone prior) showed us to free coffee and drinks before she paged Ron who came up in and led us to his "cube" as he calls it and makes you comfortable, he is quick proficient and explains it so it's fool-proof. Got me a great refund and made taxes actually painless and somewhat enjoyable. As long as I'm in Las Vegas I will be coming back every year! 

Update: Ron actually called a few days after to thank me again for coming in and to have a good day! Now THAT is great customer service!

My experience with h&r in the past has been pleasant, however I had never been to this office. My experience with this office on sunset and green valley parkway was the complete opposite. It was awful and I wouldn't recommend this place to an enemy. My agent never discussed prices up front so I assumed it would be the same reasonable price from the year prior- wrong! He did my taxes which took an extremely long time. I asked questions about future filing and write offs and he didn't have many answers. Which was frustrating, but not nearly as frustrating as his attitude towards the end. When he told me it would be well over $200 I was shocked considering I had very basic tax documents, and when I asked for clarification I got an "it is what it is" kind of response. He had the nerve to say I didn't have the option of paying later which I questioned and he suddenly didn't bring it up again. I stated I should have gone to a CPA I know who already told me he would charged me less. The agent had the audacity to both ague with me about how much the CPA would have charged and also ask me why I even bothered coming back this year if the CPA was going to charge less! Well, had I known it was going to cost over $200 I would have gone to him. I didn't pay half that last year so I figured h&r would be the same way. He was very rude and argumentative. He even said in a snarky manner I should bring all my paperwork to my CPA and see what he has to say about it all. When I called the manager, Jennifer, she stated she would talk to him and look into it. Hours later she called back to let me know they would send me a discount for the future. Ha! She did absolutely nothing about my experience there. Rather than trying to do anything she simply gave an insincere apology and stated she couldn't do anything. Awful customer service. Oh and did I mention that the receptionists are 3 catty women who talk about the drama and their clients from the day before? Don't expect your visit to stay confidential. Better yet, go elsewhere and make sure your expectations are met and that you aren't scammed. 

***h&r sent me a survey to fill out and gave me the option to share my thoughts online but when I attempted to post this and rate it a 0 and stated I wouldn't go back, it suddenly wouldn't let me post... Hmmm the irony. Imagine how many people have bad experiences that they're trying to cover up.

This is my favorite branch and not because of anything other than the fact that they have three separate routes for the arm. You can pull up immediately and thereby having less wait. The other locations in my area usually only have one and it can get pretty bottle necked. Now I don't go inside very often., however, the few times I have been in, the whole staff has been extremely friendly and helpful. Now the one downfall is all of the construction that has been going on for months. Not the banks fault though so I won't consider that in my review but it is super annoying.

Worst bank ever they removed all the tellers and made it harder to do basic banking for businesses such as make a deposit. Instead of a teller they send you to an ATM that a person pops up on as if you were on skype. I could not understand the person that popped up. They messed up the deposit for my business at which point I requested all the checks back and had to another location that actually had people. Go figure BANK OF AMERICA would outsource and take jobs away from Americans. This is horrible and big corporations like this should be penalized for out sourcing. The people who suffer are the businesses that have to us them and the people who need jobs in our country.

Been an account holder for 2 months and im very annoyed with the "modern" machines already. Both times I had to deposit my rent money $1150 into this machine. Instead of filling out a deposit slip with the cash and simply giving it to a teller there are now several inconvenient steps involved. First, you need to dial up a virtual teller that tries to have a convo with you. Next, you have to put the 20's that their atm only spits out into the slot. No 100's. The machine only allows up $1000 deposit. My rent is $1150 so i had to wait for the guy to process 1 deposit before doing the next. Also since my rent is $150 more and all i have are $20's, i put in 160 and he tells me that i cant get $10 back change over the machine. So, now my landlord gets an extra $10 for me putting in the leg work. 

On top of all of this i could barely hear my teller because the next machine is 2 feet behind me and the volume was at max.

This is a failed attempt at being innovative and i wont be back to this branch and may even cancel my account just for creating such a ridiculous process.

Very excellent customer service, drop the lines and the wasted time at DMV . I managed to handle my registration for both my vehicle's, i was in and out. I appreciate you Mark Anquillano for your time and quick service. For the previous customers below whom wasted there  time and energy leaving false statements, yall really dont know what your talking about but I highly believe they appreciate your service anyways.

what a joke, just go to the DMV or, even easier, myDMV online, or any kiosk at a grocery store or AAA location (both within 1.5 miles of this outfit). all are less of a hassle than these condescending scammers. in their defense, they're only preying on the lazy and uninformed in this city, so there's that. I've utilized DMV drop/registration services before, all pretty cut and dry: pay a convenience fee for them to go to the DMV for you, get your tags in the mail a week or so later. NOT ONCE have I not received DMV correspondence in the mail, yet somehow it happens to this place "all the time". counter guy's words, not mine.
so, after I pay my registration and convenience fees to DMV Drop, I'm told my tags will come in the mail 7-10 days later. of course, I can pay a higher "convenience" fee to be able to come back to pick up my tags same day (kinda ironic how inconvenient that is, right?). obviously no need to do that since I've always received DMV mail.
well, a month later (went on vacay for a couple weeks), no tags. now I hafta go back to this place (inconvenient) and listen to this clown veil his condescending tone with niceties, like we some kind of homies, making it sound like he's doing me a FAVOR to not charge me another $50 appointment fee to go back to the DMV. uh, ok.
ALL I have to do is run around town (inconvenient), pay to get forms notarized (inconvenient), and pay for the duplicate tag form's service fee (inconvenient).
yes, these are minimal amounts, and yes, I have since done my research and taken care of this debacle on my own (no notary, no running around town, tags in hand) without any more "assistance" from DMV Drop. not the point. my novel here on Yelp is meant to warn of the BS business practices of this particular DMV registration service, and urge fellow motorists in Vegas to overcome our laziness and get informed. businesses and people like DMV Drop are everywhere in this city, just waiting for the opportunity to take advantage of people. do your homework and be self-reliant. and DO NOT GIVE DMV DROP YOUR BUSINESS.

5 stars for promptness and politeness, 2 stars for the actual services. I would have to agree with the rest of the Yelpers that you are probably better off doing things yourself. But they did get me the plates/registration processed ... fast. Then why 3 stars? Well, these folks, as nice as they are, don't seem to know the most basic things about the DMV services. 1) Could not tell me if I needed the smog check. (I chose not to do it and was correct.) 2) I was getting special plates done and they could not figure out how to arrange 6 letters. (Told me that there would be an automatic dot between the groups of three letters. Wrong, the plates came with no dot or anything ... just three letters then space then three letters.) 3) They forgot to include my apartment number on the registration. (I had to change it myself at the DMV while I was getting the DL.) 4) They are pricey. (They do not show you the price breakdown ... so it's hard to figure out where their fees end and the DMV fees begin.) 5) After I lost my decal (my fault), I called these guys for advice. They offered to "fix" things for $50 bucks and told me that I would need a notarized letter to get a new decal. Wrong. I called the DMV and was directed to the nearest kiosk less than a mile from my house. Got a new tag/decal for under $10 in 5 minutes. By the way, DMV is not that bad. The old days of waiting for hours and rude workers ... those days are gone! Today's DMV is nice, efficient, and computerized. Do your pocket a favor and skip Drop, Smog or whatever and go straight to the nearest DMV. I will .... next time around.

After searching for a great engagement ring elsewhere (traditional retail Jewelers and brokers) I was left unimpressed. I wanted a beautiful stone but didn't care for the markup so it could 'traded in or traded up'. Enter Bancless Loans-upscale/trendy stores that feel like a European Boutique with a friendly and helpful staff in a relaxed environment. Howard and the staff did a great job, over several visits, to find a perfect 1.15 CT stone that had such fire and brilliance even my fiancées ritzy established clients with all the bread in the world were in awe of the rings clarity and quality!! We reset the stone in a different setting so if you are creative and know what you are after these people can help. Howard really knows his stuff and I had the ring appraised by an independent 3rd party jeweler (in business for 25 years) to make sure I was getting the quality and 4C's that was estimated...it came out rating even higher! That jeweler said he would have bought it if I didn't and would have sold it for twice the cost at his own family run shop that is local as well.
Great staff and really good quality products and always honest very clean store. If they don't have what your looking for they can get it for you and always keep you up to date on new inventory
Very knowledgeable and friendly staff. I was looking to purchase and was very pleased with the selection. I will be back for sure.
This store sucks!!! I brought my Indian Head pennies in to be looked at and see what they were worth. The whole entire time Howard an employee treated me like a moron. This place SUCKS!!!!

After our first meeting with Dan, I was able to breath a sigh of relief knowing that our bookkeeping will now be handled by someone so detail oriented and knowledgeable. We had been doing bookkeeping ourselves, and despite how inconsistently we had been maintaining our books, Dan was confident he could provide us with exactly what we needed: Stress free management of our books and Monthly/quarterly reports so we can keep a close eye on the numbers without having to do the heavy lifting. We are so thankful to Dan  and his team and highly recommend Every Single Bean to Real Estate Teams, and business owners of all kinds who want to have effective and stress free management of their books.

Someone who lives by his motto, "caring for the business."  Dan has a huge heart and truly wants to seek his clients be successful.  While he is great at book keeping, and knowledgeable in the dark arts of CFO-level business analysis, he is also just a great guy willing to help you with anything you need in any way he can.  He truly goes above and beyond and is worth having as a bookkeeper and a resource.
Jeremy, jamie, and Pauline are awesome!  Knowledgeable and informative!  They have over exceeded my expectations and I always tell my friends, family, and colleagues about how happy I am with them.

Jeremy has been my ins agent for several years now. He is an Excellent agent. He really takes his time and really cares about you and your family. He takes the time to explain the different coverages so your really understand them.  Anytime I call they are always friendly.

If I could give this agency ZERO stars I would do so.   They are only too eager to accept your recurring premium dollars, but when it comes to service and advocacy for you as the customer, you can forget it.    The agent himself just has his office people do all the contact work while he sits back and enjoys those premium dollars just rolling in.   Don't expect him or anyone in his office to advocate for you, though.    I would tell anyone to not work with this agent, and not with State Farm.   There are a lot of other insurance companies and agents that are far easier to work with and treat customers with concern and honest interest in working for the customer.

Excellent customer service at this location. Oscar helped me out and was very helpful and friendly. I have been to this location a few times and always receive fast and great service. I would recommend this cash 1 location to anyone looking for mvd services, title loans, or just cashing a check. Thank you for your help cash 1 you were there for me when I was in a tight spot. 
- James.
Come in there every week. They greet me by name and always help in a timely manner. Girls always say Hi and always greet everyone who walks in door.

I am writing this note as a humble appreciation for the outstanding customer service provided by Kayla. Her ability to provide the resolution quickly exceeded my expectations. She has a caring approach and she is a true professional. Amazing customer service! Amazing place!

Wanted to give a shout out to, Ashley!
Great customer service, and thank you for being very patient with me. 

She has assisted me in refinancing my auto loan with AZFCU after USAA messed it up initially, and finishing up my Line of Credit application. 

Best customer service, ever! 

Only thing is, AZFCU - Update your add to support iPhone 6 :) 

Thank you again, Arizona Federal!

I usually have top notch service with AZFCU.  Not today :( I went through the drive thru. Needing to withdraw some cash & grab a check book register (yes I am that girl who still balances a check book) & I like to get $2 bills when I can for my toddlers piggy bank. (She says they are "soooo prid mom" :) 
The teller dude seemed annoyed I was wanting some. (Every other time/location it has never been an issue) & finally said he had a single one. I did take it. I don't know maybe he was Man-pms'n or didn't get his morning red bull. I hope it is a rare bad experience.  I have banked with them since I was a kid.

I opened an account with Arizona Federal just to keep my savings in there. I went in on the day after they had updated their computers. So naturally everything was glitchy and taking longer which I totally get and understand. Anyways I put a substantial amount of money in my savings. I had the account for about 4 months and need to take out $100 dollars. It was 6pm on a Friday so I went threw the ATM. It says account 0.00 savings 0.00! I was so freaked out I mean this is my largest savings account! I called the number on the back of my card and NO one would help. Everyone's response was its after hours we can access your account on Monday. Are you kidding me?! I won't be able to sleep till Monday! So since it is after "business hours" you can't let me know if my money was stolen or what the heck is going on? I literally got transferred to 10 different people. Finally I didn't let this lady get off the phone till she helped me. It turned out the lady who set up my account put me under a "special savings" so it's not something you can access threw an ATM. Why couldn't anyone help me with this information? And they were so rude! Anyways I'm going to take all my money out because that is just ridiculous what if it was stolen!

I've been banking with AZ federal since I was maybe 16 because my parents had accounts here. I just recently opened up a checkings/savings account over at Discover Card (yes they are a bank too) and guess what!? 24 hour customer service, free checks, and the best part... No monthly FEES. No $3 a month BS, no waiting forever to speak with someone, no limited crappy customer service with small windows for time frames. Gonna close this dumb account & switch all my banking to Discover Bank. Adios!!

Worked with dozens of lenders over that last 9 years, Sean Uyehara at Prospect Mortgage is truly exceptional. He is the one I go to for my loans and the person I recommend all my family to see. He doesn't play games and isn't in the mortgage business to make a quick buck, his rates are lower than others because he wants long term customer loyalty and referrals. In addition, his customer service is the absolute best I have ever had. He follows up weekly, and I've never been disappointed with his communication. Situations arise when applying for a loan, that is expected. What separates Sean is his ability to anticipate problems before they occur and be proactive. He is a terrific professional. Can't recommend him enough.

Spoke with Manager named Robin and she was rude, lied to me, and basically told me to go somewhere else. I asked her if I could speak with her boss and she said she reports to no one.

Beware! Avoid this bank to avoid unnecessary headaches!

THE WORST banking center ever. My husband was there yesterday and was told that they no longer have merchant line and he should plan to come in the mornings when they are less busy. So I went this morning. ONE teller, only one. I was there when they opened and was the second customer. I needed change and the teller told me she didn't have it, did I want other denominations? I said no, I wanted what I asked for.  It took "4 managers" 20 minutes to give me my change while I waited.  23 minutes going early in the morning.  There were 20 people in line behind me and no one of their "managers" offered to help anyone.  Really crummy customer service, in a neighborhood of many small businesses.

By far the worst Bank of America the line is always 15 people deep and they only have 3 tellers working which one of them apparently talks with the banker associate while working waited 30 minutes just to deposit some money and use merchant services absolutely ridiculous.

This agency has lived up to my expectations and more, my agent Korin Woods couldn't be more helpful, answered all my questions in a timely manner and made the adjustment from Louisiana to Las Vegas 
Very easy.I would tell everyone to give this agency a call when you need insurance of any kind.

The worst branch. In exchange for speaking your language the employees have zero talent or ability to perform the most ba is banking services. 

This was my 4th visit to get both my bank card and online banking working. 

The worst.

I like this location, they are very helpful. It's considered to be one of Canada's busiest TD Canada Trust branches. As such, you have to expect to wait for services. If you are going to see a Financial Service Representative I would advise that you make an appointment in advance to guarantee your spot, because sometimes it's so busy that they can't see everyone. For teller service, they are usually fully staffed, I think I counted twelve tellers at one point, but it still takes about twenty to thirty minutes to see a teller. Bottom line, waiting in line should be expected at this location. Come prepared with all your identification too, because they will ask you. Besides the long lines and wait times, the service is top notch and delivered with care.

Horrible customer Service.

I called the Chandler Cigna to make an appointment with my doctor Veravali. They had nothing available with her until 4-5 weeks from my call. I simply needed to get the biometrics form signed (for work benefits), did not want to wait that long. Lady on the phone suggested I go to the "Baseline" location. I said - great! The next appointment available was in 5 days. I was very pleased. Now the day of my appointment, I go to 1920 Baseline Rd, just like the lady on the phone told me to.  Well... I get there and there is no Cigna center; apparently, there is another address 1920 Baseline rd in Tempe... Now, I drive all the way to Tempe from Mesa. Still get there by my appointment time, but by the time I walk in and wait behind a guy who is arguing about his billing, it's now 6 minutes past.  Guess what - they tell me "you're late and the nurse will not see you"....... I actually giggled, I honestly thought the lady was joking (especially after I just told her what I went through and how the address given to me by the Cigna Center employee was in the wrong location). Nope, she wasn't kidding. She told me I had to reschedule, that they couldn't see me today. Here I am: drove from Chandler to Mesa, then Mesa to Tempe and back home to Chanlder.... And then, I thought, let me call The Chandler location, I know they will make this right. Nope, I called and they told me they don't have anything until late October.... So, I'm gonna enter this same review under all Cigna Centers, because they all suck pretty bad....

Don't go here unless you have to.  If you are on Cigna HMO then I think you have no choice but to go to one of these clinics but if you have the PPO then just find a general practitioner at a nice private practice somewhere.

The waiting room is always a total zoo and the place is so big with so many people you just don't know what you are being exposed to.  The office staff range from inept to competant but rude.  The doctors that I saw were OK but you get a different one every time so there is no chance of building a rapport.  The whole experience really makes you feel dehumanized, like you are being treated as a number not a person.  I know some of that is just the state of healthcare in this country but there are far better options out there.

The people, or more specifically a Mr. Tibbets, is extremely rude. This company is not worth paying for to work, because at the start, they seem to be very professional and answer all your questions. However, as time progresses and you pay the fee that they want, they start to ignore you for "bigger" customers and "more important projects." They, or more specifically again, Mr. Tibbets, get rude with you if you ask too many questions or want to clarify things about the taxes. They don't care for you, and they only want your money because they ask for more money if you don't understand and want more answers. That is a terrible thing to do, and I would definitely NOT EVER recommend this company to anymore. This company is probably decent, however Mr. Tibbets is definitely not someone you want to work with. Terrible. Waste of money, time and effort. Better try your luck elsewhere if you must deal with this man.

KeatsConnelly did my taxes last year and at first they seemed very helpful and very responsive to emails, etc.  Then they said the taxes would be done at a certain date, then the date comes and goes, I email and am told next Friday they would be done.  This goes on for two months.  I finally talk to the CEO and is very nice and assures me the taxes will get mailed to me.  Another two weeks, eventually I receive my taxes and I want an explanation for the charges that I will billed.  It seemed excessive and I wanted a break down of the hours that it took to do my taxes.  The CEO then tells me that they have been nice to me, but now they will have to start charging me for the time on the phone and the emails!  I was never given a breakdown of the time it took to do my taxes.  

I now had my taxes reviewed by another tax preparation service and they said none of my itemized deductions were taken off on my taxes.  Oh, and last year was the first time I ever had to pay taxes.  So I was not surprised that my taxes were done incorrectly so now I will pay another tax service to re-do my taxes for last year so that I can get the refund that I should have originally received.  

Would not recommend KeatsConnelly!!!!!  Horrible customer service!
Its a bank, it holds your money, makes millions off the interest, gets a bail out, then nickels and dimes you for every little service.  What's there to hate?

My boyfriend and I went in today because we wanted to see if they would remove a couple of overdraft fees for us. My boyfriend got in a car accident so we weren't able to work for 2 weeks and we really needed the money. Anthony helped us and he was so nice! He went above and beyond what we were expecting. He gave us what we were looking for and also gave us a bunch of tips to improve my credit ratings and to get my boyfriend his first credit card to help him build credit after we told him we wanted to buy a house soon. Ask for Anthony when you go in! He was the BEST!

I'm a little reluctant to write a great review about this bank because I don't want anybody else knowing about it and finding out about my little gym that is this Wells Fargo on Green Valley Ranch. The tellers are always very kind and the lines are quick and if there is one it's one of my favorite things about it you get in and out quick easy effectively. Parking in the Smiths parking lot I can be a little hectic at times but if you need to do some shopping it's a great one-two punch
Truely fantastic service I've had with them.  I came to their office with problems in a wire transfer and don Earle jumped in and saved the day.  Thanks Wells Fargo and don!!!!

I went to get a paper notarized and was told they would not do it since the person with me didn't have an account. Then was told by THE MANAGER Gilberto Villalba that I "...didn't have the mental capacity to understand what he was saying and should take my business down the street to Bank of America!!" I guess this is acceptable behavior for this company because I've left several messages with his superiors about the situation and have yet to hear a response.
One of the banks im with. its a bank. they have an ATM, and tellers. Nothing special. but not horrible. Friendly good service.

Used the atm on a Monday night.

No problem.

Kathy is a sweetheart. She always welcomes people walking in and takes her time in dealing with any issues customers may have. I was worried coming to a new branch because I had built a relationship with the employees in Los Angeles, but Kathy and Tara have made to switch worth it.
Monday at 11:30am this branch had only 1 non-teller employee to assist patrons. We waited 35 minutes and left.
Hola recomiendo este lugar, muy amigables todos en especial Diego el agente que nos ayudo nos mejoro el precio de lo que pagaba en otra compania los recomiendo.
Excelent service , great rates, you will not be disappointed. Ask for Diego, he will make sure you get exactly what you want.
